title: Dead by Daylight

review: Product received for free. Overall if Steam still had the star system I would probably give this game 4/5 stars as the only major let down is the lobby set up.Personally I can't stand horror games and survival games BUT Dead by Daylight is an exception. It gets the heart racing which makes you slightly paranoid for a few moments after you close the game which I think is great for horror games like this cause it means it isn't just a jump scare but it's a lingering fear.As a survivor teamwork is necessary but so is a good reaction speed. Once you're down to one or two survivors its pretty much game over cause it makes the killers job so much easier.I have yet to try playing as a killer but it looks pretty fun!The graphics is alright but the style sets up the atmosphere perfectly!The music builds up the tension and puts you on edge the closer the killer is to you which to me sets this apart from jump scares and other horror games as it has that heart racing spine tingling build up before some maniac slashes you. As an Australian player I don't seem to have any connection issues with the servers and the game flows pretty well theres no lag!One issue however is trying to play with friends if you don't have 5 or 4 people. As far as I can tell you can't play as the killer with your friends unless you have 5 people set up together searching for matches involves researching multiple times until the game finally puts you and your friends into a lobby and if someone dc's it boots everyone out and then you have to send all the invites again and then restart the constant clicking of ready until the game decides to place you into a lobby.A minor thing as currently the servers seem relatively stable Needs more servers preferably in other countries! Not just America!So if you're interested get this game! It's easy enough to search by yourself and find a match and it's pretty fun with friends too!
title: Dead by Daylight

well doneMathieu Cote is a great guy but his skill at directing the game is comparable to the blind making a graph on the office's success using markers and no help at all with anything but his writing handDead by Daylight devs remove a bug but the bug turns out to be an egg for several other bugs (they somehow claim they didn't plan this and i'm starting to doubt it)bug fixes are less like "we fixed this" and more like "hey get ready for more bugs but we removed some tiny ones along the way here's a list"praying to god that the next DLC will be a non licensed killer (no survivor) and praying it will be the last onerealizing that i'm an atheist as the devs announce 4 new killersposting criticism on the board and ending up unsubscribing from the thread because the fanbase is that toxic10/10 would loathe an addictive game againEDIT Welcome to the 2.0 update we have...we have...1 an irritating menu screen soundtrack that carries across both killers and survivors2 paying money for a currency that spends far more than the customization's worth3 a killer that can slow you down with a simple right click and is not balanced at all whatsoever4 a survivor with perks only one of which i've ever actually used and enjoyed using5 an actually really good trailer6 a PTB that suggests the update will be free but turns out to also be a paid DLC7 no rewards at all whatsoever for purchasing DLC with real money8 the 80 dollars i've spent have been culminated into this and i can get more customization than ever before WITHOUT money. leaving the money i've spent prior a complete waste.EDIT 2 Microtransactions. Not sure if it has to do with servers or purly issues connection to lobbies or players just plainly disconnecting if they dont get their way. So sometimes I can sit here for 5 to 10 minutes just trying to get on a stable connection to play as a survivor. And once I do it would figure that that connection would get lost once i have entered the playing fields. That alone can make the game very irritating. But other than that it really is a fun and heart throbbing game.

review: 8/10 rating Behavior Digital Inc. really gives an extraordianary design of games where players tend to interact with the environment that they adapted to. Furthermore for the killer part is more like an instinct behavior of surviving in harsh choices. Players will tend to give emotions towards the game even towards others because of this interactive multiplayer game.Players already seen the behavior of others well there is skill in this matter. I'm not saying that this will help you from certain chase of a psychopath or a serial killer no. It tests our instinct of choices and adaptivity. The game content is well not to shabby i guess balancing in this type of gameplay is quite hard but acceptable. Between an unexperienced survivors they sometime tend not know what to do but the killer only has one purpose just plan course of action stab the hell out of them and sacrifice the survivors. If players uses survivor and test it all the time they get some points to redeem it for talents. Well this is quite a downer to me. Talents earned are so fast that the graphics on reaching the point where the killer needs to do the hard work from now onLast its about the mechanics and system. First of all the mechanics the mechanics of the game is quite acceptable from TPS view for the survivors and the FPS view for the killer I think its quite fair. Controls are definitely good to me but for the "falling down the wooden part to escape" is lack in responds. For this game system you guys really need A GOOD INTERNET CONNECTION. This is the part what I hate about at first I don't want to buy this game because of waiting for players part or disconnecting and so but the least to prevent that is to having good internet connection. In conclusion this game has been adapted quite well a 8/10 spot for me. Pros Creative gameplay Acceptable controls Interactive graphics Marvelous sound effects and BGMCons Game balancing harsh Unfriendly internet connection properties ADVICE Try making a server for each region if can but it really costs a lot. For connections support

title: Dead by Daylight

review: People really need to relax here when it comes to the game and do your research.Dead by Daylight is a asymetrical multiplayer horror stealth game where one person is a killer and the other 4 players are survivors. There is a progression system that allows you to improve your character(s) over time with flat consumable upgrades or situational upgrades called perks.Now onto the stuff that i see all over the place in the reviews section.Matchmaking Matchmaking is probably the weakest point in the game running off of a MMR system. Currently there are alot of lobby hoppers due to the inability to queue up with your friends.This will be amended as the development team has been very good about listening to the community and are working on a survivor group mode to come out soon.Options menu The development team has also explicitely stated that the options menu is to be completed POST release. which is now. They plan on creating a fully fleshed out options menu for us along the way.Balance Simply to say if the game starts with a lower amount of players than the max then there will be less nessissary generators. Going down to only 2 being required to be turned on. The devs have said they are looking at the ranking system at the moment. But i am hoping they will make a ranked queue myself so that people can be punished for disconnecting early.Honestly this game is alot of fun. But it is incomplete at the moment. If you want a fun experience that will only grow over time (If the devs are being honest) Then get the game while it is on sale. It's a fairly inexpensive game for how much fun you can have killing your friends as the killer or enjoying a bit of running away like a scared child.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: I really like the concept of the game it reminds me of "Friday the 13th" quite a lot actually. I bought this game not only because it's literally the only thing I've been seeing when I'm on YouTube but also because it looked not only stunning but just a good game. My thoughts changed rather quickly actually. Here's why It's really boring if you don't have friends to play with I mean matchmaking is good but there's no interaction between the survivors. It felt like one of those "this game will be boring after 50 hours" games which is the reason I refunded it. I'm no expert at the game hence my 1 hours of playtime. There's also a rank system I would understand why but they really need to fix it.Although it did scare the sh*t out of me the graphics are good and the gameplay is okay. You should get this game if you have friends to play with. If you don't spend your money on something else.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: AS of june 21 i cannot recommend this game.ProsConcept has potential. And is a very nice idea.When everything is working as its supposed to both survivors and the killers can have fun.Cons The execution of the concept is laking and unbalanced.The game is riddled with bugs both for the survivors and the killers.The game seams to still be in the beta testing and we are the ones testing it for the devs.As the killer you are not playing against survivors of your lvl. As a rank 20 (witch is the base rank you start od as on both sides) You are often stuck playing against players that are not only higher lvl then you but are ranked way higher then you. 1 being the highest rank possible. The same can be said about the killers. as a lvl 1 rank 20 i played against killers way to high lvl and rank then me.The lvl is how you get perks with blood points and the ranks are how good you are considered by the game.You are given more blood points the more you play with the victims but they tend to escape if they know how to play.And help each other. If you tend to play efficiantly your are penlized by receiving less points. The fact that the killer whipes his blade after every successful hit is frustrating at best and the destabilizing effect of a wooden pallet barely falling on you is infuryating considering you are a beefy brute that can swipe those said pallets with one foot.All in all id wait for the bugs to get fixed and the balance to be worked out by the devs. I personally wanted this game to be good but i consider it ok at best. This is the kind of game i always wanted to play and i love horror movies. But as a survivor the only thing you get to do is fix generators to be able to escape. I wish both the killers and the survivor had other things to do to be able to win. Running around killing is fun for a while but gets boring after a day or two of play. Witch for a 20 dollard game is very disapointing.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: I've played this game on PS4 and most recently PC. After a long love/hate relationship I finally gave this game up and I hope I can convince you to try this game out even though I'm giving this game a bad review. Let me explain DBD isn't a pick up and play game. Deceptively so. There are tons of things to learn before you'll even get close to winning a game as a survivor or killer. I found this super refreshing! I love horror and having a deep evolving game to play online is such a refreshing change of pace from early access horror games that last one or two hours long. The strategy behind surviving and killing requires so many mind games that make this game really fun at times. If you're looking for a casual game to pick up and feel good about think twice. I easily put in 10 or so hours before I was even at a 25% winrate.But when you stick with it there is so much to learn and try out. Perks killers and survivors add a lot to this game and if the dev's keep up their development schedule we could be seeing many more in the next year. You always feel like you're building your characters and becoming tangiably better. Even when all you get is crap for levelving up you feel like the next breakthrough is just around the corner. It's a good feeling. One that horror games don't usually provide. However the worst part of this game isn't the game itself. It's the devs. They're a prime example of what not to do with a evolving community. Game is still running on client side servers. Meaning the killers lag is now your problem including lag switches (which inspired me to write this review). Skills like juking fake outs 360s and feints are mostly useless when your actions don't make it to the killers client side server and get you killed. Constantly I'd see a killer teleport to me and land a hit even though I was behind a window across a pallet or a good six feet away. It's a HUGE issue with this game and it will leave you yelling in some matches with frustration. Another is toxicity and too many mechanics in game that allow a survivor or killer to throw the game. Camping is a legit strategy that is straight up reccommended by the devs and that can either confuse newcomers or just straight up scare them off. Real talk I've bought this game for four different people and three of them got frustrated and don't play this game anymore because of the campers and lag. The community is still very uneven about camping (In all honesty.... it's basically required if you're a killer but I can understand both sides). Eventually you'll work around it but it's still frustrating to have teammates run into a camping killer or fall into his obvious camping trap and throw the game. The devs having a position on this would reduce a LOT of toxicity in this game and possibly up retention with new players. But their main concern is mostly cosmetics and paid dlc. Sure reworks come and tiny fixes go live but most are riddled with bugs that are recinded with a week or two or just 'kinda' change the meta. I felt often that I was losing or winning matches due to dumb luck lag or rng and less like I earned a neck and neck victory. Don't get me wrong it's a really fun game. But these bugs and issues will most likely have you rage quiting most of the nights you play DBD. A lot of my friends through this game (about ten or so in total) will get audibly upset disconnect or start raging. This is probably the biggest reason I won't play this game any more. It's straight up unhealthy. I'm yelling at bugs the devs have no intention of fixing bad players who exploit the game or toxicity. All in all this game is worth a try. Sure it's hard and sure it doesn't seem to be improving as much as it needs to be. But it's fun for what it is. A good asymmetrical horror game you can sink your teeth into every blood moon. Would I reccommend this game to a horror fan? Absolutely. To anyone looking for a fun game? Absolutely not. This is a game you grow to love through blood sweat and frustration. If that doesn't sound like your sugar and spice. Look somewhere else. Please add servers devs.... You need to stopbeing apathetic to bug reports and release a major update. Hopefully this is a game I come back to in the future.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Fun concept but the game is flawed. What other game has you thinking about ranking when you play rather than winning? This game is designed so doing 4 generators is a waste of time (just do 3). This game is designed so kiting the killer all game is a waste of time even if your team wins because you're doing it because you don't get all the right categories. This is equivalent to say in Overwatch getting 20 eliminations and being "maxed out" on points to rank. Then you have to get max assists and objective time etc. rather than actually just winning. That isn't a well made game. The reason for this is simple everyone can win. In a game so heavily focused on ranking and competition having a system where everyone can win is simply not good enough. Unfortunately this is such an integral part of the game I don't see how the devs could fix it without actually trying instead of just releasing new DLC.

Lack of variety. Only 3 maps currently.4. Graphics could be better.5. Insanely difficult to lvl up. Lvl 15 is the first time you get 2 perks. review: Ultimate Horror Movie SimulatorWhen I was first looking into Dead by Daylight I was hesitant after reading reviews that talked about the lack of balance in the game as well as the toxic players but I went ahead with it anyways. After spending over 200 hours in the game I can say that my experiences have been mostly positive. The game is relatively well balanced (especially considering the a symmetrical format) and players have been relatively friendly (especially considering it's a game where people brutally kill each other).No game is perfect but DbD offers a unique survival horror experience that still gets my adrenaline pumping every time I play it. The recently added store and cosmetic options do not bother me either I actually think this was a long time coming. I've got 100x more out of this game than my initial $20 investment warranted so I don't mind dropping a few bucks for some well designed skins. So if you're looking for a game that drops you into a different horror movie experience every time you play it remember death is not an escape.

My final statement Its a good game whilst being flawed but if you would not like to be incredibly salty try playing with friends or just watch other's play it take a break.

review: I've been playing DbD ever since Beta days and seen lots and lots of nerfs and some buffs along the way.... some of them have been good some of them.... debatable. All in all I've gone through most of the ups and downs of DbD and I'd personally say that if you plan to play this game by yourself you better have quite a bit of patience as well as tolerance for some of the bs that the game has.... And no matter what anyone says that bs exists on the both sides of the coin SWF (Survive with Friends) is something that in a way could be called the bane of killers as trying to kill a group of people with proper comms is a pain in the fu***ng a** SB and SC (Sprint Burst (makes you pretty damn fast for a few seconds (is about to nerfed in a way soon) and Self Care (Allows you to heal yourself from injured to healthy (below injured is downed where you can most of the time either recover and wait for someone to raise you up or try to crawl to the other end of the universe) another.... Hex Ruin (makes the game go quite a bit slower and is really annoying especially when you're new to the game) NOED (No One Escapes Death which allows you to put a person to the downed state with a regular hit (usually needs two hits) (which is a hex nowadays for those old players in the crowd that haven't been playing this game for "a while") could be said to be annoyances for the survivors.... and according to some people a friend of mine for example just the fact that the killer's base movement speed is much faster in comparison.I personally mainly play the game with at least one friend if not a full group of friends as I quite simply think that the game is much more fun to play with friends when you can laugh at each other and to be quite frank be a huge to your friend every now and then (READ Often) also hearing your friends get jumpscared is pretty damn funny (as this game ain't actually all that scary after like 10+ hours of gameplay or something....)I've personally enjoyed the game both as a killer and a survivor ever since the launch to this day and unless Behavior makes Emblem System 2.0 in the sense that it starts worse than the Emblem System did not too long ago I don't think I'll be quitting this game any time soon and would recommend anyone out there who hasn't already to give the game a try as well.... even more so if you can convince (or manipulate) some of your friends to join with you like I did all the way back when I started (and I'm quite happy to say that my friend ended up liking the game as well so I haven't exactly lacked someone to play with.

review: Remember in Friday the 13th where everyone just threw boards at Jason and casually outran him after rubbing dirt on their injuries?UPDATE I've updated this from recommened to not recommended. The devs clearly don't know how to balance anything nor how to get patches out in a reasonable amount of time.Dead by Daylight is an asymmetrical multiplayer game where 4 survivors attempt to escape the killer. The survivors have to repair 5 generators and then open one of several exit gates before they can leave or if all but 1 survivor are dead escape through a hidden hatch in the nick of time. The killer has the job of finding people and placing them on meathooks in order to sacrifice them to his entity. There are currently 4 killers and 5 survivors. The survivors have different unique perks ranging from self healing to destroying meathooks which are what the killers use to kill people. The Wraith can cloak (Albeit with a loud signalling of their bell) and decloak (with their bell again) in order to surprise survivors. The Trapper sets up beartraps around the map which can catch unwary survivors and make them easy pickings. The Hillbilly gets a chainsaw straight out of the Texas Chainsaw Massacre which can instantly knock down a survivor if he manages to land his charge meaning no he can't always instantly take you down. The Nurse has a teleportation ability which lets her jump past obstacles that survivors place in her way but if she misses her teleport then she gets stunned and almost blinded assuming she doesn't use her remaining two very short range blinks to correct her mistake.There's a "levelling up" and "ranking" system in play both separate. Levelling up involves collecting XP (Bloodpoints) during matches from naturally doing what your role entails (escaping/killing) and doing it well. You then spend your bloodpoints on the bloodweb where different perks(Equippable permanent buffs that have several ranks) offerings (one time use randomly activating powerups) and add ons (Things that improve your tools as a survivor or improve your special ability as a killer) are available for purchase. Note that add ons will always disappear if used as a killer but if you use one as a survivor and don't die OR expend your items "charges " then the add on should stay with you. The ranking system grades you on a scale of 20 to 1 20 being the lowest. If you do very well as a survivor or killer and rack up a lot of bloodpoints in matches you will gradually climb ranks towards 1. It seems to influence matchmaking but don't be surprised if you're a rank 20 something and the game feels like throwing you against rank 1's. Because matchmaking is hard.GameplayThe gameplay can be considered "tense" when you first start playing as a survivor. You don't know where the killer could come from only that he's looking for you. You don't know where your friends are you just know you need to fix these generators and leave ASAP. This goes out the window entirely when you level/rank high enough then the game becomes stupidly easy and you can abuse your broken perks to handily evade the killer for 3 minutes while your friends fix every generator.Playing killer is like playing a time attack game. You're constantly under pressure to kill survivors and you can't stop for a second. If you hesitate the generators are already fixed and the survivors are teabagging you at the exit gate and then complaining about how laggy you were. For some reason the survivors dominate the flow of the game. If you play killer expects lots of frustrating matches against high ranking VOIP teams determined to make your life completely unfun.The game is definitely survivor sided and the devs refuse to admit this while regularly nerfing killers. Don't get this game to play killer. Or if you do get 4 friends play regular gameplay for a while to unlock levels and items and then only ever play Kill Your Friends mode with them so everyone can actually have fun.Visuals/AudioThe game looks fine. I'm not much of a graphics person. It ran on my six year old laptop if that says anything. Sound design is very important so it really is a good idea to play with a headset plugged in. The killer FOV is always extremely limited (Unless you find a certain perk for the Wraith) so that killers are forced into tunnel vision survivors get a third person camera to use. Apparently the game runs in Unreal 4 and this game looks pretty bad if that's the case.Major Pros and ConsYou can rebind some keys now which is better than what it was at the start.There is now a party up system which has understandably frustrated a lot of killers since people abuse this system to VOIP with their friends guaranteeing very easy games for survivors.The game can also be frustrating as a survivor should your teammates prove useless as with all team games. At least in this game you don't HAVE to rely on them all the time but they're your only ray of hope should the killer catch you and place you on his meathook.A gigantic con is the insane grind of this game. You will spend hours working to level up your characters and you have no choice but to focus on one character to level up. Playing low level killer against high level survivor is a nightmare where the survivors bully the killer. A survivor without any perks can still win but it's just not the cakewalk it could be. Survivors are massively overpowered (Don't let the survivor mains hear that though) and have game breaking perks letting them remove hooks AKA the only way they can die run faster than the killer (The cooldown COOLS DOWN WHILE THEY'RE STILL RUNNING) and heal themselves in the occasional event the killer catches up to them. There are loops the survivors can run in the game where the killer literally cannot catch them. A dev with functioning brain cells could fix this in a map editor in 5 minutes. These devs took 3 months to unveil a "fix" that does absolutely nothing.The only major pro is that if you manage to get a high levelled survivor you can mercilessly bully all the killers in your path and enjoy the devs pandering to you with every new patch and stream.Except all future support aside from bugfixes that create more bugs to cost money. Enjoy paying for this early access game.OverallThe game devs clearly favor the survivors. In their latest patch (In fairness a public "beta" to test the upcoming patch) they debuted a slew of killer nerfs while leaving all the unfair survivor tactics in the game. Their proposed infinite loop fix does nothing at all. Playing killer past rank 10 becomes a chore and is unfun. Avoid this game at all costs and go buy The Last Year or Friday the 13th instead.

review: This is all just my opinion interlaced with facts. 1. LOTS of cheaters in this game. 2. Survive with friends DOES NOT WORK. Tonight we sat in a lobby for over a half hour until we quit with four survivors... All we needed was a killer. Seems to take a long time no matter how many players you have. I have a video of this actually on youtube and its more like 50 minutes of sitting in a lobby waiting for games to start.3. Developers seem focused on pushing out new paid content instead of fixing the bugs and exploit issues in game?4. The game is a cool concept could use more objectives or something though. As a survivor you fix 5 generators and exit the map to win there are also "skill checks" where you have to stop a needle within a certain area or you will stop reparing the generator and make a loud distracting noise and the killer can see where it happened on the map. These skill checks really involve no skill and they are random (love it when you get like seven of them back to back...) this also applies to healing sabotaging hooks/traps etc. As a killer you hunt down and kill the 4 survivors and hang them on hooks AND YOU DONT CAMP THEM (sadly most of them do). It has replay but gets boring.5. Save your money for Friday the 13th. Theres a reason this game is cheap you get what you pay for.6. Matchmaking is non existant. Beginning I started with some top level players and killers... JUST starting the game mind you.7. This game is really buggy and often freezes up during matchmaking and has extremely long load times causing people to CTL+ALT+DELETE and then you get to start with 3 survivors. If people leave the match early there is no penalty at all. You just dont get the points.8. I would say roughly 50% of the time I have into this game has been been spent trying to connect to a game or lobby. No joke... My biggest problem with this game is not being able to play it when I want to due to connection errors.https //steamcommunity.com/app/381210/discussions/0/366298942103813048/I cant recommend this game but I have to keep playing it because my friend bought it for me. Which is really sad because I LOVE this game I just get so frustrated with all the bugs and glitches. At least I can say I didnt waste my money on this. Greedy developers are ruining this game. When the game is fixed I'll change my review. Don't get me wrong I dont hate the game I just can't recommend it until they fix it. I wouldnt wish all these bugs and exploits on anyone.4/10 would smash but not in a good way.https //youtu.be/XTrPP3oKlD0https //youtu.be/af3l1lm1yAUEdit It took them awhile but they fixed most of the problems additionally dont buy Friday the thirteenth its garbage. 7/10 would smash

review: The game is still in Beta but the devs are listening. Mistakes are being made but changes are constantly being applied.Pros 1.) The controls are smooth and work well. This is important when reacting to jump scares.2.) Objectives are simple to understand and intuitive. There's a proper learning curve for the minor mechanics such as personal items.3.) Nothing will ever make you lose unless you make mistakes. It's so easy to learn from your mistakes which is so nice.Cons 1.) Players with low levels/ranks (like myself) tend to stick with a very predictable meta/style. This causes an awkward balance/scale The survivors either win super easy at the cost of a single player or everyone dies. This tilt happens constantly and will continue until new fixes occur or a new meta exists. (Will be fixed with time)2.) The levelling system is currently broken. Survivors who escape without scoring enough points can still be demoted there's no method to determine your current score and players who synergize well win fast meaning there aren't enough points for everyone to rank up together. You pretty much have to make mistakes just to earn more points. (Will be fixed with future updates hopefully)3.) The Bloodweb/items currently are either super easy to understand &amp use or is completely vague on how it works. The tutorials as normal with beta releases leaves a lot of information missing.Go watch Twitch players to understand the mechanics of this game. It's a classic game of hide and seek with an adult theme. It's a blast to play and feels ridiculously satisfying to escape the murderer but the odds are blatantly stacked against you. That is what makes it fun.
title: Dead by Daylight

The more you hook a victim the more blood points you get. What is the fun of being a Wraith and just cloaking/uncloaking infront of your hanged victim? God damn it! Stop it! Are you going to charge us for new killers or survivors?
title: Dead by Daylight

review: I would like to start this review off by giving my overall experience then i will go into further detail. So that this review can be as helpful as possible.Overall Score 8/10 Fun experience as both survivor and killer but does have some flaws.Looks of game 8/10 It doesn't have the best graphics but it really doesnt need to (will go into this more later)Playing as Survivor 9/10 easy to learn how to control easy objectives overall fun.Playing as Killer 9/10 this is my favorite it is a little harder to figure out but once you do so much funOther Players currently anywhere from a 5/10 10/10 this one is hard because you can have 5 matches in a row with people that don't disconnect don't hop windows etc. or it can happen every match you play in one day.I will now try to break this down the best I can Also this review is the game state of patch 1.0.1 any changes in the game will not be reflected in my review.Starting with my least high score Other PlayersAs of patch 1.0.1 there sadly is a large amount of players that are taking advantage of some design flaws in the infrastructure of the game. Here is a list so you know what to expect 1 If you are playing a game and don't like what is happening you can alt f4 out or disconnect your internet this causes you to leave the game and not lose any addons perks and your rank. (Rank is number one reason people leave a match)2 because of problem #1 it ruins the game for not just killers but survivors a like If you are playing killers your chances of ranking up has diminished and same with survivors so to fix this players have been quiting lobbies as soon as a low rank is seen causing grief for the players that actually earned their rank.3 window hopping I personally have no problem with this but it is discussed in the forums as a problem area for some.4 one problem that players have also caused is the killers camping once again it does not bother me but others see it as a problem.That is all of the problems that I have read about or encountered on my own. Sadly it is not the game's fault but because of people being people the Devs will have to work on this and it sounds like they are.Playing as the Killer Fun exciting. Imagine that your playing hide and seek and your the seeker that is what I think the killer feels like I have no complaints I like all three killers some more than others but thats me. My favorite is the Hillbilly. Playing as survivor I like it i'm not good at it. I always get caught but that is part of the game. It still has its rewarding moments when you escape with the killer right behind you.looks of the game It is not the most beautiful game to look at but it is a horror game that is suppose to be creepy I think that its dull looks make it more creepy so it works out plus it gives gamers with smaller PCs the chance to play.So overall I like the game I feel anybody that likes to get scared or be the scarer will like this game. It has a few bugs but what games doesn't if you want a bug free game then wait. Hopefully issues will be fixed and players will become genuine gamers that want to make the game better too.So I hope this review helped you out and cut right to the point.Jimmy Nerdtron
title: Dead by Daylight

review: I rarely give reviews for games.This game deserves one.I have been following the game development for quite some time and I found that the concept was interesting and bought the game 1 2 weeks after launch.The idea of being a psychotic killer hunting 4 survivors is a gore fest / horror movie fan dream of a good time. Gameplay is solid with most of the stuff done in a manner that is fitting for the concept a lone killer versus 4 victims or a survivor trying to escape the brutal stalker.Playing on either side is a challenge on its own right. Ignore the whining on the discussion boards. Some people think that the only way the game is fun for them is to keep on stacking wins in their favor. No doubt some game mechanics are being abused by the community (looking at infinite window cheesers) but steps are being made into making them more risky to keep on prolonging the time spent in a session.Pros choose to be either a killer or survivor (80% survivor 20% killer here) random generator spawns atmospheric music and environmental triggers ( ravens flying away if you get close / heart thumping when killer is nearby) risk/reward management ( do i save this guy or do i get out and leave him behind? )Cons yet to be implemented ranked game with friends (coming soon) infinite window cheesing by some high ranked players penalties for DCing too low no latency meter for survivors to assess connection to killers (game session host)Verdict in the current state the core game is very much solid but will require more updates from the devs. however there's nothing to prevent anyone from getting the game now and figuring out the quirks and enjoying it as it is.tl dr wear diapers you will your pants trying to get away from the killers.10/10 will play in the dark with headphones and scare myself silly. REVIEW UPDATE 05/18/2017 I have long left this game after finding that more and more killer skills and perks being tweaked according to the devs to the point where the killers are disadvantaged and disincentivised in trying to capture all the survivors.playing the killer is now very frustrating.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: So after long time i came back to DbD and realized that my game doesn't reset to zero(because of the special characters in my name the game kept reseting my game everytime back in the days).I liked the game when it launched but had no fun restarting over and over but now i can say that this game is worth its money.So what is Dead By Daylight?Well in Dead by Daylight you get to choose playing as a Survivor or the Killer. Survivor Part Play in a Group with 3 other persons Restart Generators while doing Quicktime Events (press Space in the marked area and get a boost or if you fail you make a lot of noise) Help your Teammates (Repairs Heal Pick up Rescue off Hook...) Search for Crates which contain Items like a Toolbox or Map Each Survivor has his own Unique Perks and Skills Killer Part You play alone You have a first Person camera while Survivors are in 3rd Person You are faster as survivors (I think the nurse walks same Speed like Survivors but she can teleport) Each Killer has his Own Unique Skill and Perks Hunt people torture them by not killing them instantly (Play with your prey)and then hook em' upAlso you can Unlock Perks from one Survivor/Killer also for another one so you are not forced to play only as one survivor/killer (the unlocking Part takes long tho).After jumping into the Game i really had fun playing as Killer and Survivor. So yeah i give this one a Thumbs up and i recommend it. If you don't like this one you might go check out Friday the 13thstore.steampowered.com/app/438740/Friday_the_13th_The_Game/
title: Dead by Daylight

review: The game is great to play especially with frineds however some things need to be changed. Firstly the speed of the killer is way too fast. To fix this you could make it so that the survivor is as fast as the killer on full health (or near the same speed) then when the survivor is hit he is slower just as is now. The next change i feel is necessary is the red scratch marks all over the floor and walls as the survivor runs from the killer. Me and my group that play the game together also feel as though this ruins the game as there is basically no way to hide from the killer as he can just see your path. We would like this to be removed to endulge us in a more thrilling game environment.

review: First of i see a lot of mixed reviews about this game but i believe it is a great game that has the potential to be loads better. a lot of people i believe write there reviews without giving the game a chance or reading the development twitter. here are some points i have en counted and my taught on the matter1) play ranked with friends so many people rate this game badly because its not implemented yet they are working on it once this is added it will be a lot more fun to play as strategy can be talked over online chat with other friends in the same game. they are vocal about developing it people need to chill with the hate about not having this feature im sure people want a good implementation that take longer to develop than a buggy quick one2) no new content just bug fixes I have seen this a few times guys the game is like 2 week old some games do not even get bug fixes after like 6 weeks I my self would rather see a stable game before adding in content to something that is broken. The creates seem active in the development I like that my suggestion to make it better1) few balancing issues or even make escaping more skilled like a generator spinner for the super quick but for getting off hooks obviously this would have to be hard and balanced once off the hooks I believe it would be good it it stunned the killer if he was in a close proximity this would make escapes to be skilled to get them off the hook but camping is not an issue2) proximity voice chat so if you are close to a ally you can chat to them maybe if you spoke to long the killer could see it like befor if its balenced it would be nice to seethings I like1) level tree perks and items I love seeing progression in a game and this makes you feel like you are getting somewhere while being benefiting at the same time how the map can be influenced by offerings brings you closer into the game2) the maps these are well engineered and flow nicely making both player and killer have to play smart to kill / not be killed. Overall its a game that I would recommend and the bigger the player base the more the players voice can be heard to make changes hope you find this helpful don t blame me if you don t like it its not every ones cup of tea but I like it give it a solid 9.4 / 10
title: Dead by Daylight

review: A very creepy asymetrical horror game it has a great atmosphere and you can choose between the killer or be a survivor. Feel your heart racing as you escape from the farm with the killer right behind you or curse others for revealing your hiding spot! The price is great considering how much fun you will get out of this. I've had a ton of laughs playing with my friends doing our "Drunken Dead by Daylight" parties where everyone keeps failing skill checks and the killer can barely catch anyone. Some cons Still farily buggy after recent release some bad ones are ones where you cannot pick the survivor up or people getting stuck etc. they're patching quite a few things it's good to see a very active dev team Some annoying issues such as too much window vaulting people disconnecting if they think they are going to lose No queuing with friends you can only host a private lobby with them. This is going to be addressed at some point but no idea when. I highly recommend this game you'll have tons of fun D

review: EDIT Review revised for balance issues.Okay let's get this straight. The game's buggy as hell. Progression and matchmaking is unbalanced new players can be stuck up against vets. The Killer player is the host and can easily lag switch for free kills. The maps aren't all balanced properly. XP progression's disabled when you're playing a custom game (to prevent farming).However this game is a hell of a lot of fun regardless. It's got such potential for badass moments like saving 3 of your friends from a creepy basement while being stalked by an invisible ghost. Or hunting and downing a player then using them as bait to draw in their friends.If this goes on sale and you've got a little patience grab it. You'll certainly have some stories to tell at least.

review: Product received for free. Played sufficiently enough and I love the game. Adrenaline junkies out there this is the game for you. It's got all kinds of things to offer for both competitive and casual players. Now for the dirt though Personally I think this game should still be labeled as BETA. There are way too many bugs to consider this a full release. I'd list the bugs but then we'd be here all day. The Devs are wonderful and working hard but it was too soon to release this game as a full. I'd say this game is 3/5 currently but if they can fix the bugs this game will be easy 6/5 play it 24/7 status. Overall get the game still the bugs are numerous but the game itself is just too fun despite the bugs. Once the bugs are fixed and playing with friends are added then this game is hugely fun.EDIT1 With the survive with friends now available to rank players this game has become infinitely more fun. Despite the matchmaking it has made surviving easier now that you have that communication with your friends be it in steam chat or off client server chats. that communication gives survivors a hidden advantage despite survivors being nerfed not only in terms of perks but in terms of juking the killer. There are still bugs and yes as i said you may still have unfair matches of all rank 20 survivors versus a rank 10 killer but the game changer is the play with friends. It used to be I get on and die so quick thanks to strangers leadin the killer to me while i am sabotaging but with friends they lead the killer NOT in my direction and we all typically win. This game is definitely worth grabbing and when more players join this game I am sure they will make a more solid rank matchmaking system where the matches will be more fair. Get this game even if you don't have friends you may make a friend or two from this game.EDIT2 With the new Last breath chapter the survivors are seeing a collection of nerfs and killers are getting buffed. It has come to a point basically where hiding from the killer will be near impossible without some high coordination and high end perks. It is really frustrating as well that the game still has not done anything to punish killers for camping hooks. It is impossible to save a friend if a killer does not move after hooking you. the killer can just afk there and know that you cannot be saved. Also the trapper in the game has an addon that instantly downs survivors that step in it which is a problem should he put it under you if you are hooked. no one can save you unless they sacrifice themselves but then technically that means someone is still being sacrificed. The new perks for the nurse on top of the general perks makes it impossible to dodge the vision of the killer and it practically demands that you have to be faster than the killer to avoid him. The new update even brought in more bugs as well and survive with friends might as well be thrown out the window. You can queue with your friends for 30 minutes and when a match is found you DON'T actually get in with your friends as someone gets thrown out and replaced with a random. This is even more frustrating since they removed the icons on top of the survivors that shows their names and rank. I am ok with rank being hidden but the names is something that needs to come back cuz we want to know if we are playing with our friends or with a random. EDIT 3 with the fixes to campers and queuing this game is now worth it. Ranking system is a bit flawed but with the game design it will not matter. this game is still great for those who crave the adrenaline and this game is fun with friends (obviously). not to mention cosmetics are now available to the killer finally (if limited).
title: Dead by Daylight

review: I originally heard about Dead By Daylight through a streamer I watch on youtube. Watching her play I was immediately intrigued by the gameplay. I finally bought it and I have never been happier with a game especially for the price. I could literally play this game for hours if my hands could handle it. It is so addicting and scary and fun all at the same time! I really love that the makers of the game are always trying to work on the game to make it better. It has come a long way from when I first started playing and I cant wait to see where it goes next. I would highly recommend this to anyone who loves 1st person /horror/ survival games. The best part of the game is that you can play with friends! It makes it a ton of fun especially when youre playing as the killer against them. Each month the ranks reset that way you have an incentive to keep playing. You never get tired of this game! The only bad thing about this game that they havent fixed yet is if someone decides to leave the lobby/match you have no way to report it at least that I know of currently. Other than that one thing this is one of the best games out there for PC!!
title: Dead by Daylight

review: I think it's safe to say we've found a game I'm just as addicted as Left 4 Dead. ) Can't get enough of it I actually get excited when I think about future killers for the game. I hope they add a meta morph someday. Someone who can change shape to look like a teammate or a generator. It's totally my new favorite game! . That being said there are a few things that could be balanced a little better. I play for fun usually but for those who enjoy making rank the system is overly complicated and it's gotten even more difficult to make rank after recent changes were put in. It would be great for both killers and people if they simplified it a bit. Some of the killers are also a little over powered. While I don't usual play killer I do love playing Freddy and having the ability to constantly know where everyone is it does make me feel like a little kid on a power trip though. This ability is a little over the top but not as annoying as the Pig Lady the killer from the "Saw" chapter. While it is a really cool idea to have to get the reverse bear trap off your head it changes the game completely making it basically impossible for whoever has been trapped to continue playing. If anyone finishes a generator it starts the timer on the trap and if the person playing the killer chooses to they can go against her character and just kill you. They don't even have to give you the chance to try to get the trap off. Really the only way to get around it would be to get all the gens close to done make sure no one has a trap on their head and then set off all the gens at once. But that's pretty difficult even if you have a well coordinated team. Her character would have been amazing with her stealth ability and the skill to see the last generators being worked on but the traps push her into the realm of irritating and frustrating to play against. There isn't even a real counter against it aside from everyone working together which without mics is pretty hard to do. With everything that goes into this game it's pretty amazing that I only have those two complaints for it. Everything else is pretty awesome. I hear there's a lot of toxicity from some people but I've only seen it once or twice myself and in all honesty that's not something the game makers can control. This game is amazing and as a horror movie fanatic I totally approve. .
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Dead by Daylight is a great game! Great gameplay can be really stressful sometimes. Lot of different maps different killers and surivors. review: Ich spiele dieses Spiel nun seit dem Release und muss sagen was aus der Community geworden ist ist erschreckend.Die Entwickler liefern Content und Bug Fixes am laufenden Band und es gibt für mich persönlich momentan kein vergleichbar fesselndes Spiel.Leider kann aber nicht immer jeder glücklich sein mit dem was ihm geboten wird. So entstanden aus Salz solche Dinge wie "Pallet Looping". Palletten sind da um benutzt zu werden. Wenn ein Survivor gut im Juken ist dann lass ich ihn halt in Ruhe und patrouillier weiter Gens. Fertig aus. Man muss Killern nicht die Arbeit abnehmen und mit Bloodlust ist ihnen schon ordentlich entgegen gekommen worden.Aber auf der anderen Seite gibt es auch sehr viel Salz auf der Seite der Survivor. Teabagging Provokationen und Beleidigungen gehören zum alltäglichen Erlebnis. Dinge die zu Release gar nicht denkbar waren und höchstwahrscheinlich zum Ochido Syndrom gehören denn Überlebende spielen jetzt alle gleich provokant und immer weniger verschiedene Spielstile sind anzutreffen.Ich freue mich nichtsdestotrotz auf das Anniversary Event und bin gespannt ob sich die Dinge so schnell wieder legen wie sie gekommen sind.

review: This game...Where do I even begin?As a survivor this game is nerve wracking. You're constanly looking over your shoulder listening wondering... But you've gotta stay cool. One wrong move and you're done. Especially if you've got an attentive persistent killer on your tail. Which segways into my favorite aspect of the game being the killer.Literally everyone is your . If you want them dead they die. While you can bully one survivor while he's hung on a hook your attention to only him/her will cost you dearly as another survivor may activate a generator. You have to be brutal but very aware of what's happening around you.Sound is crucial to this game from both sides. If you don't have a headset I recommend you get one before playing this.10/10Would slash again.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: I don't usually write reviews but I felt I needed to for this game. I basically want to communicate to everyone thinking of getting this game that it is a really fun time. It has some trilling gameplay and offered a fresh new experience to me and my group of friends. I think this really is a diamond in the rough but there is so much potential. The developers are asking a fair price for what is offered and with a few quality of life improvements (letting people play in groups in online match making) and some new survivors/killers this could be a great game for a long time.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: I dont write a lot of reviews but with this game i just had to go out and talk about it. I bought this game and started playing it about 5 days ago and I have been playing it hours and hours a day since then. This game is very intense and a ton of fun to play alone with random people or with friends. I love the stealth aspect of the game when being a survivor and hearing the music and heartbeating makes it so much more intense and scary. There are still a lot of bugs with the game i notice it mostly when your dying and being rescued from the hook at the same time your body can be floating above the ground on your screen but on other screens everything is normal. But this is still a fairly new game and I'm sure that will get sorted out soon. Still a fun game none the less. One thing i would recommend is more character customizations and maps (im sure more will be added in the future anyways). One cool map idea would be inside an asylum or some big building with plenty of rooms floors and a front/back door to escape. Being chased in corridors would be insanely intense and scary/fun!

review: This game. What can I say. I love it but there are many issues. So the genral basis of the game is a 4v1 survival horror in which 4 survivors have to turn on generators to open this escape door to win while the killer has to find and down all suirvivors and then play hooky with them by hoisting them up on a hook. I love the 90s slasher flick theme to the game and think the gameplay is very fun but there are some issues. 1st the matchmaking sucks. It takes multiple clicks to actually join a lobby whilst playing as a survivor. Sometimes it's so bad you may have to furiously spam the button for it to work. This gets quite annoying. 2nd the hitboxes are really bad sometimes. You could be playing as a killer and be pretty hot on a survivors and swing but not hit them even if they were right in front of you. The same happens to a survivor but in the opposite way. You could be running and be looking back and see that the killer is at least 7 feet away yet he will swing and hit you. The same can happen when jumping through windows amd sliding over barracades then even while you're off of it you'll get grabbed and then screwed. It becomes annoying and I don't know if it's a poor connection to the killer (since the killer hosts the matches) or just super glitchy hitboxes. 3rd the community can be pretty annoying. No one likes to play against a but this game unfortunatly has many. I don't think I'm the only one who get's aggrivated when I get hooked and the killer stands in front of you not moving. It's called killer camping and it gets fustrating for it makes it nearly impossible to escape. I wish that there was some sort of like penalty for staying within a certin range of the survivor on the hook like maybe you only get half the points for the kill instead of full? It just is an annoying way to have a game end when you were doing so good them maybe a teammate needed help so you did then you pay the price. Also survivors that taunt the killer in the escape doors at the end is not cool too. Just leave so then a new game can start. 4th there are tons of little glitches like animation glitches heartbeat glitches(it might not go off when the killer is directly behind you)((and I don't mean for the Wraith))) things that may not be gamebreaking persay but do need to be fixed sometime soon. Well I've ranted on enough about the bad so time for a bit on the good. 1st the game is great for making you feel suspensful. The feeling you get in your own heart when your heartbeat in game goes off is awesome. It feels like you are in that situation and that you do have to survive. 2nd the music is great. While it may not be a huge soundtrack to the game the way they use the music they do have is cool. The closer the killer is to you the louder and more suspenful the music gets. It's like that to make you panic and try to run when that's usually what you shouldn't do. It's mind games really forcing you to go against your flight insinct. The music for whe you are chasing a survivor is this cool chase music with a very powerful drumming and I enjoy it. 3rd the leveling up system feels unique. You have this Bloodweb for either side of the coin(killer or survivor) and you have to aquire the in game currency called Bloodpoints. You get these for doing various things in a match. You see a list of things layed before you and have to spend your Bloodpoints to fill the web up to collect them all to move to the next character level. Eventually you will have to spend these point wisely to get what you want quickly. 4th I love the maps. Right now there are only three loactions in game of places where the action takes place but they all are directly from horror movies. A creepy abandoned mineing site an old slaughter house farm and an old car wrecker shop in the middle of the woods. They all are great for setting the atmosphere of the game. Middle point The rank system can be considered good or bad It's a system where you either have to win a lot of matches in a row to level up or survive a lot of matches to keep it up. It's challenging but alos can casue people to play cheaply and in a douchey way i.e survivors completly forsaking teammates in need and camping killers. All in all I love this game. I love the slasher movie theme the survival aspect and the gameplay. It reqiures you to play smart and work hard. At the end of the day teamwork works the best. The developers are still hard at work to make the game better fix bugs and add new content. I love it a lot even though I do get fustrated with killers who camp slow matchmaking wonky hitboxes and animation bugs that cause a charcters hair to stretch across the world(yes iv'e seen this often). I think the game has poterntial to be huge if the developers fix glithces and change a few things to make the game funner. I love it and if you like slasher movies survival games game where you can hunt people suspense inducing games and a good ol demon sacrifice then you'll enjoy this game a lot.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Cancer. They couldn't even get the right optimization on unreal engine. Also it uses player host networking meaning that if the host has a terrible connection everyone else will also lag. This also means that you can build a lag switch and if you are host then you can make everyone lag and then unlag. They promised 6 month ago to change host to every player in the game but as of now the only player that can get host is the killer. I am not going to talk about the bugs this game has and how unbalanced it is. Also 90% of the perks are useless comparing to other ones and devs consider that nerfing that 10% of the perks will actually help. Hillarious.

review: The game is really intresting one of the best co op horror games Ive seen yet. Even if you dont have any friends to play with it still can be really fun. Killers are unique in their own way and the offerings can really have a nice turn on the game such as a no/dim moonlight heaver/lighter fog more luck or bloodpoints to gain and you could be lucky for a map change as well! (..But for the love of god let us use offerings for the dlc maps to be burned why have them if we cant ACTUALLY use them?) The bloodweb is really nice too the more you play the more you earn to help you have a better chance to survive or kill easier. However you may get some killer campers but rarely ever now I only see them around once every 20 games.I highly recommend this game to anyone even if they are trying horror games for the first time. This was my first horror game and I love it. There is more to this game but its better to experince it for yourself.

review: I incidentally logged in to Dead by Daylight offline. I had a level 9 Jake Park. He was level 1 when I logged in offline so I assumed that all of the stuff was saved online and I simply didn't have access to it. I logged in again in online mode and nope it's still gone.This is honestly the last straw this game has matchmaking three hour plus killer queue times incentives for survivors to disconnect mid game instead of just ing playing the game and now it deletes all of my hard earned perks. this I'm out. Developers shouldn't have let this out of alpha. The Forest is in alpha and it has better multiplayer than this garbage. It also doesn't delete my stuff for no ing reason. It also doesn't reward you for ragequitting. How the hell this was allowed to be a full release is beyond me. Seems like the devs all used to work at Ubisoft.I wanted this game to be fun and it's a great premise but it's littered with bugs and poor gameplay decisions. I had hope for this game and was excited when a friend gifted it to me. It's been nothing but a disappointment since then. I will not be recommending this to anybody and I'll probably actually warn them off of buying it.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Pretty fun game with a horrendous lobby system and some glaring balance issues. Heavily sided towards the killer especially with a party that isn't full.I recommend it if you have a full party of survivors and a monster who's more focused on providing a good scare than "winning". If you do that it's incredible.That said if you have enough friends for a full or near full party then it generally goes pretty well. But if you don't have 3 or 4 friends to play with then I'd say maybe pass on this one for now and look into Damned.Side note the lobby system really is just inexcusable. Seriously what is this 2004? We've had the ability to invite friends to games since freakin' Counter Strike. What the hell.

review: This game is amazingly fun. It has loads of content and frequent updates for both the killer and the survivor. It might appear repetitive but every match always plays out differently. I stopped playing this game for a while since the killer side was terribly unbalanced. Killers used to be a joke and would get bullied hard by survivors. Currently though if you are a skilled enough killer you can almost always guarantee at least 1 kill regardless of the circumstance. Don't get me wrong though this game still needs a lot of work. Survivors simply get too many chances (Decisive strike). The most broken feature by far is Survive With Friends which can give survivors critical information about the killer (location perks etc.). Killers should get bonuses or buffs when facing a group of SWF since they are obviously at a tremendous disadvantage even with top tier killers. Obviously not every SWF group is impossible to deal with but a lot of them are. Still the game seems to be in a good state and appears to be headed in a promising direction. Buy it if you are looking for an intense heart pumping experience that is addicting as hell but can be frustrating at times.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: After originally giving a positive review on this game I actually had to make a point to go back and change my opinion. The lack of stability with this game is extremely infuriating. I find myself struggling to get into servers sometimes spending 15 20 minutes waiting only to find that some of the team has left upon starting the match because it took so long. This stands true even when playing with friends and already having 3 out o the 4 required survivors... Joining servers is often nearly impossible!
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Dead by Daylight or better Dead my loading Screen?The idea of the game is brilliant and when it comes to the point where you play a game with or without friends its really fun and thrilling beside some camper noobs and some bugs.The real Problem is the queue. Most of the time you cant join a game and if you were able to its mostly the killer lagging out and lose connection so the game crashes. With the new update it worked for a short time but now i tried 50 times to join a game as a single player which wasnt a problem before the big patch with nurse killer came out. Now i werent able to play for the whole evening and guess what i payed 20 for a not working software. Seems not right yes ?So here is my tip for all of you who want to buy the game. Wait and follow the rewiews. When you see reviews that tell that the queue system is fixed then buy it. If thats not the case buy some game that works and wait. Update 22.08.16 The queue was fixed and the game is now playable. The Dev Team messed the queue again up in a previous update but then there was the last update where they fixed bugs and now you can find games easily. The game is now definetly playable. There are some grafic bugs left and there is still no punishment for leaving players but in general its now a really good game in the early phase with a lot of potential. Update 25.08.16 Because of unknown reasons the queue is again not working for groups of 2 or more. The Solo queue is still buggy and also works worse. This might be the result of an bad algorithm or to few people playing the game to make the existing algorithm work. Update 28.08.16 It seems like the queue is in general fixed. Maybe there is a problem with grouping players when there are a bit few people to match but im positive that the developers can do it and improve the game to a level where it is fun to play Update 31.08.16 a New Patch Update Message was implemented very nice ! the queue is totally messed up again. I really dont understand what those dev's do with it but was only possible to play 1 freaking game in 2 hours with a 4 man premade group. Really poor. Update 18.09.16 Lets talk about the last 2 weeks of this game. As you can see i reduced the gametime by quiet a few hours but still there are some i played. An lets be honest. I played 3 games. 3 GAMES !I mean wtf xD I sit there and wait several hours just to play one hour in total. That seems quiet unfair. I guess i will stop playing for now until a patch is released that fixed the queue.And i will report the game to be removed from buying until this is fixed. Update 05.11.16After a 2 month break i gave the game a new try and FINALLY the queue is working. I cant tell when within the last 2 months it was fixed but now the game is a playable game. New DLC isnt free I was a bit upset but well nearly every game has DLC's that arent free so im not really suprised it has come to that point here too. But the game is still good without dlc ) Update 23.12.16Today i was the first time happy a game was canceled haha. The Anti Cheat System works pretty well as i experienced a lot less cheating the last days playing ) Update 13.01.17The first Friday 13th in year 2017 and im very sad that the queue system is now a it more optimized but its still unable to match a group of 4 survivors with a single killer within less than 20 minutes. Very confusing. The Dev's argue around that problem by telling us something like Ohh the single players are priorized but i guess thats t. Whats so complicated to implement something like this if(groupsize 4 &amp &amp waitingtime &gt 10minutes) set priority high ??? Update 16.04.17Queue is working fine today so i guess its fixed. Good Job keep up the good work!.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: I feel like I treated this game a bit unfairly when F13 came out.Yes this game is a bit unbalanced 2 years after release.Yes DLC characters have OP abilities (but the free characters are arguably the best in the game).Yes This game is crazy amounts of fun with friends.As you start to climb the tiers this game becomes less of a survival horror and more of a cat and mouse type strategy game.Granted there are some desync ish issues. Killers hitting you from many feet away be it through a pallet window etc. It's an issue and has yet to be addressed.Another issue that has yet to be addressed is playing with your friends. If you are trying to play "survive with friends" after every game you have to back out of the lobby and reinvite your friends which is kind of a pain but not an absolute dealbreaker. It is kinda unfortunate that the game has been out for 2 years without a fix tho.All in all this is a very fun asymmetrical strategy game. Highly recommended with friends but just as fun solo.Be warned the community is insanely toxic and you WILL be ripped to shreds for using certain perks or items.Solid 7/10.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: This game is not balanced for ranking purposes I would suggest that you rank up to rank 1 for the achivements if you'd like and then just play the game how you want to. Survivor gameplay is too easy and killer is a bit of a challenge but I would not say that it's hard because it's not once you learn the mind games and such. I do believe that the devs are making good changes so far and I do hope they'll eventually forget about balancing it around rank 20's and such (AKA Low Ranks) and base the game on higher ranks because that is what will make the game more fun and obvisouly some gimmicky perks as well. It's still fun to play and it's EXTREMELY easy if you're playing with your friends or at least 2 people that know what they're doing. I would recommened at least trying this game to see if it's for you and if it's not you can just refund it within 2 hours of game time but don't expect playing a killer to go so well the first few days you play.

review: I bought this game after the recent free weekend ended. I gotta say it's an addiction to me.The option "Survive with Friends" simply mean premade team for Survivor up to 4 survivors. While in "Kill Your Friends" you can invite your friends as survivor and you kill em. You can see reviews from other I ain't gonna say much but do search for gameplay video(not beta version)This game is great what's making it imperfect is the glitches while you're in queue for a match(applied on killer or survivor) you'll be automatically quit to main menu or worst blop into a screen where your background wallpaper is the DBD icon pulsing animation while the main menu interface is still there but not functioning although clickable. This forces you to restart the whole game just to start a new queue again.Another turn down for this game is the server though if theres' enough amount of player I personally believe dev team will start their dedicated server for this game.The reason I don't complain about gameplay is because we doesn't even have enough player and having problem getting in a god damn game. I'm just protizing core problems before go deeper. Now I have met some friends whose facing data save lost problems (Was shown to me through screenshot they have full bloodweb system at lv0 character.) ??? What?! Oh also I played with him for around two hours and when I played with him again after that his character is lv0 again(He was lv6 something.)23 December 2016Overall rating 7.5 out of 10I think I'll give 8.5/8.9 atleast when 2 of these core problem are solved.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: This game was one a true gem. One of the most funnest and awesome games i ever played. Playing killer was challenging but very doable. Playing survivor was a little bit easier than being a killer but still a challenge. Now the game is a pile of disgusting boring rubbish. If you plan to buy this game to play killer. Dont. The new system has made it virtually impossible to enjoy. Even if you get a 3 4 kill its the most toxic vile crap i have ever played. You have over 10 killers to choose from and yet only 2 are any good at the moment. And if you cant aim with them (hillbilly and nurse) then your f****d. Every other killer is weak as hell. If youre playing survivor make sure you play with 2 or 3 friends. If you play alone and get caught you will be camped. and camped hard. Before the emblem system came in you would get the odd camper now though because its so hard for killers 9/10 games if you get hooked you will be face camped. Plenty of people will moan about this but even as a survivor i cant moan as its infuriating.If youre looking for a game that is easy with a few friends then play this. if you play survive with friends in a group of 4 49 games out of 50 all 4 of you will survive.The game is boring now. Its infuriating to play as a killer because pallet loops are way too easy and theres way too many pallets on maps. And its just a bore as a survivor because once the killer finds 1 person itll take him 2 3 minutes to hit them once an by that time 2 3 gens are done. By the time the killer catches your team mate all gens are done you get so few bloodpoints that playing survivor just isnt worth it. All in all this game was once 10/10. But with the changes they made this is now a must avoid at all costs. Its just turned too Pathetic. Theres zero challenge anymore.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: The game itself is pretty good but the problem that should be solved in addition to the animations that are bugged from time to time is the multiplayer system. I do not understand why I can not win blood with friends or not being able to play online with a friend being one a murderer and another survivor. In the Hearthstone the gold gain system with friends is pretty good and I do not understand why you can not replicate with this game. You should also be able to buy the murderers and survivors with blood as has the Rainbows Six Siege system that your players' cup has increased for that reason. I give the game a 6/10 because it has many things to solve being that they have been with the game for 2 years. I hope the developers someday listen to the community or finally listen to my message to have a better game.

title: Dead by Daylight

review: Anyways I don't usually write reviews but I just had to share a story in this game.I was a survivor. Our team tried our best to win but the killer had been outplaying us the entire game and eventually it led to a hook fiesta where eventually everyone on the team was downed in the same area. The killer seemingly satisfied starts to pick up the survivors.Suddenly.One by one the survivors DC. The killer helpless watches as the fruits of his hard work slip away as the survivors in a fit of salt and rage all disconnect. Meanwhile I'm still on the ground watching this happen. I'm considering disconnecting when he picks me up. Instead of hooking me on the hook right infront of him he rapidly shakes his head cloaking and uncloaking. He takes me to a generator. He starts furiously beating the generator with his club. He lets me wiggle free and repair the generator. When I finish he swings and downs me. Perhaps he wanted to give me a little more points before my defeat. However instead of hooking me he takes me to another generator and beats that one with a club too. We repeat the process.Once I'm finished repairing the generator the killer downs me once more. I'm sure he just wanted to give me a couple more points so I don't lose my rank. He carries me in the direction of a hook. Just as I thought the journey had ended he walks right past the hook and plops me down on the trapdoor. I spin circles in the ground trying to indicate that he deserves a victory. He just looks at me solemnly and slowly nods looking as I'm still spinning on the ground. He turns away cloaking and leaves me alone. I escape. Bless you Gaz.The game is great with a few bug fixes and a few balance reworks I can feel that the game will be much better in the future. Devs also seem to listen to the players and party queue and window cheesing reworks seems to be coming soon. Few issues like disconnecting problems but overall game is fun and very enjoyable.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Product received for free. A very fun game with edge of the seat excitement and absolutely a must for anyone who enjoys playing group co op games... but only when it works properly.Don't know if it is just the free weekend but the wait times are immense and sometimes even trying to queue up into a quickplay creates a game breaking glitch where it never loads you into LOADING a lobby. The download rate for new maps is extremely intensive as well so if you are playing with new players sometimes the maps can take up to 10 minutes to load and by then most of your team has left.Another thing is that when there are less than four survivors things are grotesquely not in your favor. The game does try to give you a break and requires one less generator per survivor that left BEFORE the game started (youre SOL if they disconnect mid game. They might as well have died on you) but this is no where near balanced enough as losing a survivor is much more of a loss than one generator is a gain. I have yet to win one of the many 3v1 (or 2v1) games that i was stuck in because of this problem. Sure you can leave as well but you basically over the person left behind and lose any items you might have tried to take with you.They desperately need to increase their servers to take on the load they are getting for the free weekend and they desperately need to correct their game breaking bugs.That being said if they correct it this game would be outstanding and a must for any horror lover.
title: Dead by Daylight

title: Dead by Daylight

review: I really wanted to like this game. The concept genre and setting were right in my wheel house I LOVE horror based games. I decided to give this game a try during the 'Free" weekend with the strong intention of buying it. I'm really glad I decided to try before buy.I played the game less than a couple of hours but during that short time I ran into numerous game breaking problems. I had to CTRL ALT DEL and kill the tasks several times when I was caught in a "waiting for the match to start" cycle. At one point I waited 15 minutes...just to be sure. It's really frustrating to "think" that you are about to start a match and then you just sit and wait...and wait...and wait... until you have to kill the program.The game also seems to host on the Killer's system. So whoever is the killer is the host. This can really cause a wide variety of network based performance issues based on player's proximity to one another and bandwidth etc. I had some games that seeem to run smoothly while in several others all of the characters were skipping frames and rubber banding all over the place. Really a poor experience considering this game is primarily a multi player focused game.There are other issues...but those two issues were enought to tell me that I would really be wasting my time if I purchased and tried to get into this game. Again great game...and great concept just problematic execution.
title: Dead by Daylight
