But the ability to invisible at all times increased speed and take a short time to come out while still chasing...Biggest issue is really the queuing with friends thing. I will change my review immediately upon the implementation of this. Aside from the above this is an amazing game and concept. You truly feel fear at times and for survivors it takes a lot of skill and patience to win. Because of this when you do win it is a very accomplishing feeling.Edit Finally got 2 extra friends to buy the game so we could actually all play together in a private match without joining 1000 lobbies and without fail everymatch someone gets dissconnected..... Ruining a good game!!!

review: 1908 hours in (25 July 2018) The best sign of the game FINALLY starting to go back towards a balanced state is the Survivor mains review bombing Patch 2.1.0 (even though they only got minor nerfs I don't want to imagine how petty they'll be once their beloved crutch Perk Decisive Strike is nerfed). Killer mains and Players who play both sides could finally rechoice with 2.1.0. The devs seem to have gotten the message and I'm thankful for that. As an impartial player of both sides from day one I'm so happy to be able to recommend the game again. 1727 hours in (15 April 2018) The game seems to be taking the first few cautious steps in the direction of some balance again but it's still way too soon to really tell what the devs will break next (yes a running gag that's all too true). The new Emblem System took some pressure off of Killers and punishes Survivors playing the game for and giggles trying to bully the Killer. However none of that addresses the broken core mechanics of the game that hugely favour Survivor if they simply focus on doing their objective instead of clowning about so I'm still not going to recommend it until further changes take place. 1430 hours in (7 November 2017) It's been a long time since my last update to this review. Sadly once again I cannot recommend to buy Dead by Daylight and thus support the Developers anymore. The game is riddled with problems the devs ignore or are blatantly not willing to address and fix. The game becomes a clown fiesta for the Killer from mid ranks upwards. Survivors disconnect to save their crutch items and generally the game is more toxic than ever. People have lost all sense of manners and sportsmanlike conduct. IF there's anything to be abused it will be.Also the developers have just recently acknowledged that they will from now on balance the game for the lowest ranks meaning newcomer and low skilled casual players steamfacepalm None literally no competitive game even if it still tries to be that balances around the end of spectrum especially not the low end. Small changes there have immense balance impacts on high ranks with experienced players.They should fire their statistics guy in all honesty as I have rarily seen such incompetence in creating and interpreting statistics. Most high schoolers would do a better job at that. 906 hours in I think I can finally recommend it again and I'm happy to do so. Patch 1.5. has brought some much needed changes and after adapting a bit to the new mechanics the game finally again feels like it has originally been envisioned by the developers. Killer feels like a powerful killing machine again and playing Survivor is now challenging again across the board something I missed. Unlike many crybabies on the forums (people who exploited and didn't learn how to properly play the game) I know that the game is going in the right direction now and I couldn't be happier. I would have felt really sad to give up a game I've now played for so so long because it was no longer the game I fell in love with almost a year ago. I'm so glad that things changed. Now 757 hours in. Haven't played nearly as much as I used to because the game is going in the wrong direction I can't recommend it anymore and I'm so sad about that. At least not in the current state it is in. Killers get treated as the personal toy of mid to higher ranked Survivors the game is heavily unbalanced and the devs seem to do everything in their might to make it even more so. With the newest update they added 2 perks that once they become the new meta they will make Survivors more or less invincible. Killer mains are leaving the game in heaps now. I don't want to see this game die but the developers are completely clueless about the problems they have and have no idea of their own game in mid/high ranks as they are all low ranked players catering to the need of low ranked Survivors not realising that they give experienced players more and more tools to with Killers. 735 hours by now can't believe that I haven't gotten tired of the game yet although I'm feeling a bit burnt out as Killer you need to be a masochist to play the high ranked games as one but thankfully that is about to change. Still going strong after 566 hours. I can't get enough of this game it's almost like a drug. Absolutely love it. Sure there are bugs and annoying things but most of the time they are minor and the devs are (contrary to popular belief) constantly working on fixing them and keeping the game alive. Alright 373 hours in I'm going to back up my own review. Still love this game "ORIGINAL REVIEW from 19 August 2016 Absolutely love this game I'm now over 200 hours in and it still doesn't get boring as no two games are the same also there is a big diversity of areas and maps and there will be even more in the future. I recommend it to anyone that likes the horror genre and the Survivors get chased by a Killer theme.P.S. Don't get discouraged by all the negative reviews. 85% of them are by people with very low gameplay time. This game takes several hours to "git gud" as you need to learn how to play against each of the four Killers and counter each of their specific abilities and unique play styles. Practice really makes perfect in this game. Same thing applies when you play as Killer you need to learn how all the game mechanics work."

review: This is the first review I have ever written but I thought important enough to do so... I absolutely love this game. The graphics are very good using the unreal engine 4 and gameplay is top notch. I have over 800 hours in this game and very few games have held my attention as long as this one. What keeps you coming back is the intense rush of trying to escape the killer if playing as survivor or the edge of your seat anticipation when hunting down survivors if you are playing as killer. This game lends itself to different play styles in that some survivors will play stealthy and try and hide from the killer others may play bolder and try and distract and harrass the killer by provoking chases. There is a very high learning curve at the beginning. Learning how to play with camera angles gaining experience and earning better "perks" will make for a much more pleasurable gaming experience if you can endure past the "noob" stage. Some in the community will complain about balance issues the devs are constantly updating the game game with fixes and new content. While the game itself is excellent if I have one complaint there is an associated toxic community pitting "survivor main" vs "killer main" which can become discouraging to read all the negative comments on the forums over time. I highly recommend this game you won't regret playing it!10/10
title: Dead by Daylight

review: I really enjoy this game and now that I'm approaching 200 hours I think it's time for a review. The devs still have some things they need to work out but just like most games that are constantly evolving the tactics change with them. They've already fixed some issues that were present in the past but I just played a couple of games today that I could definitely see some issues with.1. Killers and survivors being able to blody block. Sure it's nice when you're trying to take a hit for a teammate but honestly you'd be surprised at how many people do that. However when a hillbilly or myers can just camp at the top of the stairs of the basement and charge a chainsaw or just stalk until Evil Within 3 it's kind of broken.2. Pallets are a continous work in progress in my book but earlier I saw a killer glitch through the pallet onto the side the survivor was on the survivor didn't get hit and got a killer stun but I think if someone was to pull a pallet down the killer should be on the side that they approached it from not the opposite side. Needless to say that survivor couldn't escape nor juke the killer because he was too close.3. I think the doctor needs a complete re work. Sure the survivors can't hide from him but he's not that great in a chase and his symprtoms to his madness don't do much especially against high ranking survivors. The doctor is so easy to counter at his current state just do everything as fast as possible and forget about juking and hiding it's almost impossible to lose him and if he get's too close just hide in a locker to avoid your madness going up.Again DBD is a great game that stills needs some tweaking. There's no doubt some killers are a lot stronger than others and some of them don't require the same amount of skill to be good as some of their counterparts. Some survivors perks are pretty game changing too. I'm interested in what the devs are going to do with this game to keep it balanced and make it a bloody deadly good time for both survivors and killers.
title: Dead by Daylight

title: Dead by Daylight

review: I really love this game. It's an excellent blend of action and horror that becomes more and more addicting each hour you sink into it. But no game is without flaws and this game is a prime example of this. First off the community is absolute trash. There's so much toxicity being passed around the community and there's seemingly no end to it. Second off the balance is verrry off. With a concept like this there's no true way to completely balance the game. You will either destroy or be destroyed. There's camping tunneling pallet looping flashlights infinites and all kinds of other scary words that can make players tremble in complete fear. And if you're not familiar with these terms you are likely new which means you WILL get destroyed. It also doesn't help that it's too easy to stay at lower ranks facing really new players or really skilled players. But like I said there is no true way to balance the game perfectly and let's just all be thankfull that it's not F13. And my final issue with the game has to do with the bugs. The devs seem to try really hard to fix various bugs and do it successfully for the most part but there are a few bugs that can potentially be game breaking and could give either side an unfair advantage. And some of these bugs have been present for MONTHS without being fixed! But like I said earlier no matter how much the flaws irritate me the game is just too addicting to leave. I can recommend this to anyone who plays ANY online games because the constant feeling of adrenaline and progression that shows up in games like CS GO or Civilization is really present in this game and on top of that they add new content every few months that always changes up the game whether you buy the DLC or not. For lack of a better conclusion thiz gaem iz priti neet! C
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Don't buy this game until the developers fix pallet looping. If you play in high ranks everyone does the exact same strategy and just runs in circles to waste the killer's time instead of trying to get away. It's unfun and the developers still haven't fixed it or really even acknowledge it as much of an issue.8/12/2018 They still haven't fixed it. These devs are bad. They lack direction for which way they want their game to go buffing and nerfing each side of the game arbitrarily and based on player outrage instead of having a clearly defined vision of what they want this game to be. They heavily favor survivors as well refusing to remove another game breaking feature called "survive with friends" that allows survivors to choose who they play with giving them a huge advantage by talking over microphones. This was also added to the game by player demand again going against the original vision of the game they had as being a completely solo experience.If you plan on playing this game as a hard core killer your only option is the Nurse.. If you just want to play casually or with friends I'm sure you'll have fun. But if you stick around long enough to reach the high ranks you'll see the flaws as well.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: I loved this game It was scary kept you on your toes and everytime that heartbeat would blare in your ears yours would start too. The consept is exactly what horror lovers will adore.Now the bad part. ALL OF THE BUGS! It's truly ridiculous. Most time when I take an item into the game it shows I have it on my character BUT IT WILL NOT LET ME USE IT or set it down I have to find a chest and grab that item to grab my original otherwise after the match I lose it either way.Daily rituals... I just completed my first daily ritual in a while said I would get so much for doing it completed with no prize tried reseting still nothing.Most times I can not start a match it'll glitch and I will have to shut it down with task manager.Other players are of two sorts. One is very helpful and fun to play with. Others are extremely rude not a teamworker volgur in chat or they enter a match just to leave so you are pretty much screwed that match. The host is the killer and if they have terrible internet they will lag extremely bad and you can not do anything without making mistakes that will get you killed.Perks are a hit and miss. Some work some sometimes work others will not work. Premonition is a perk to alert you if the killer is looking in your direction from so far... Ive got murdered a couple times because it did not alert me. I have been chased and with them directly behind me and it still would not go off and its suppose to work regardless of the killer's perks.Overall parring the bugs it is a great game. But they need to stop doing so many updates for expansions and whatnot and just fix all of these problems.Oh this game will frustrate you to no end.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Product received for free. &gt goes to cornfield&gt hillbilly is monster&gt hillbilly finds me i escape&gt I hide in grass near gate&gt hear him come close reving chainsaw&gt get spooked &gt try to run across to window&gt run straight in front of killer&gt killer hits me&gt I fall in front of hook&gt killer hooks me &gt out of surprise and fear i turn around and yell "weeshiiifflegaaoooo!"&gt siblings look at me like i am idiot10/10 would run like deer again&gt have friend over to play game&gt friend notices the kill your friends option&gt off the bat i respond "thats only if we had friends&gt he looks at me&gt i respond a couple minutes later with&gt I used to have friends but as you saw...10/10 would kill friends againthis game is great yes it is slightly unballenced for the survivors but that is what keeps me playing the challenge captivates me and keeps me in for more. I can't wait to try the new characters.Edit FInally into the new year we have multiple dlc's out now however I would love to see the developers take a pause on dlc's begin to focus on the game mechanics and start to tweak them. I have been in two bugs where I was never able to move and it showed the map name and the location of the paticular area while small it will eventiually make the survivor's game harder with a player that cannot play. Along with this there are multiple occations where when a round starts a player is unable to join and there is a space between the survior game tags. I would also like to see more of an improvement of map selection and server choosings because too many times I have gone to the same place with the same killer round after round.Maybe input something that will track what places you have been to and what killers you have been put against to help change things up for survivors. Don't get me wrong the game is great but I would love to see a change from pumping out dlc's to working on game mechanics to make the expierience better from giving new content to give a slight change in expierience. It would also be great to have a matchmaking system as well becasue many times you get these killers who you find out are very ranked put players against people with thier own ranks and not putting rank twenites up against rank ones.

review: An unexpectingly addicting experience. You are able to choose from being a survivor or a killer. The game styles are very different between the two and honestly feels like a whole other game. As a survivor you mainly have one objective turn on power generators situated around the map to open the doors of escape. However many things will happen during the game that will challenge you in trying to accomplish this goal. Other survivors can be taken by the killer and placed on meat hooks to die or may be injured by the killer before escaping his gaze. In both scenarios you have to decide if it's worth trying to help your team or continuing on with the objective.Balance wise there are definitely still some issues. One killer called the Nurse is able to teleport. This basically allows her to bypass every obstacle other killers face and she is very strong because of it. Killers who camp the hook are also a problem but mostly for new players. Once you gain experience you realize they are actually giving you time to repiar generators when the killer chooses to camp one player.Overall a fun game that isn't near as repetitive as I thought it would be.

review: Exciting Unique ThrillerThis game attracted me because of the unique gameplay. Being a survivor of a horror movie esq killer instantly captured my attention. Then I found out you can become the killer himself. You'll get a thrill of the chase as the killer chases you with the classic movie music playing faster and faster as the killer nears. Great little skill checks during completing objects and teamwork to survive adds more excitement. Even though I found it easier to throw the other survivors to killer I found it more challenging to help.I find that it gets rather repeatitive the more you play the game. The maps aren't too different from eachother and the tasks to escape the killer is the same. Hopefully their will be new objectives in the future.

review: With a bit of experience under my belt as both killer and survivor I can say that this game is pretty fun and balanced surprisingly well. Works well both as a competitive game and as a game to play with friends.Playing both killer and survivor offer rewarding but very differing styles of play. Surviving is tense and butt clenching throughout thanks to long action times and high risk high reward situations where killing makes you truly feel like an 80''s B movie horror villain. The game is balanced fairly well in my opinion. I have had a fair amount of matches where most survivors escape and a fair amount where none escape. Almost every game though someone dies. My only real balance complaint is how powerful the survivor perk Borrowed Time is and how survivors are allowed to think because of it.If I were to have any complaints about the game itself outside of balance there are a few obnoxious but uncommon bugs and matchmaking can be a bit wonky at times. I have had games against both rank 1's and rank 20's as a middling survivor/killer. Also the community can be incredibly salty at times. Survivor mains and killer mains are always at odds.I would have to give Dead by Daylight a 8/10. Tense on the edge of your seat survivor play matches the raw power and cleverness of killer gameplay. The game's got a pretty good future too thanks to developers that are constantly working on updates and keeping their community up to date on future plans and changes. Definitely worth the price tag. Get some friends together for maximum YouTube fodder.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: This game is a fun concept and reasonably well executed. Sure it has it flaws but for its price it's well worth every cent if you are into horror/survival type games. You play 4v1 or 1v4 depending on what mode you select.If you play the killer you're in a 1v4 and the 4 survivors need to do 5 generators to open the exit gates and escape. You as the killer need to prevent that. You chase survivors down them with your killer powers and hang them on a hook to die. The game ends when all survivors are killed or survivors are escaped.If you play survivor you're in a 4v1 and need to work together to finish all 5 generators to open the exit gates. You as a survivor need to fix generators rescue people off hooks and distract the killer when your team needs it.It's multi player so every match will be different and it'll stay fresh. The community isn't the best at times there are very toxic people but if you ignore the post chat and just move on you won't notice it that much.After 20 30 hours the 'horror' and 'scare' effect will dissapear but that won't make it less fun.It's my 2nd/3rd most played Steam game. And that for a low price of 20.Please note there are DLCs however you are not forced to buy them. The maps are free to everyone only a new killer/survivor is locked behind money. However they've recently started a new in game way to earn stuff like DLC and Skins in game totally for free. It'll take some grinding but atleast this game uses a healthy MTX system.

review: Not gonna lie i've had some issues with this game. At one point my entire game decided to randomly erase itself and all my hardwork in it and the devs after being messaged several times refused to do anything about it which i am still displeased about. But the game itself is fun i enjoy playing it with friends most of all. I do feel that the player community can be a bit difficult at times players often troll or camp in games which can ruin the fun but all games suffer that stuff. I love the variety on the killers each feel unique (except for Leatherface he feels pretty similar to the Hillbilly imo) but i do wish the survivors felt more varied. Each comes with their own unqiue abilities but on survivors they general don't fell unique until ur a higher lvl and u've unlocked their personal perks but by that point u've generally probably unlocked those unique perks for the other survivors anyways (a concept i do enjoy though btw). All in all though i greatly enjoy playing it and look forward to each new killer that comes out and hope that a survivor that brings someone truly unique to the game arrives as well.On another note there are several issues with the game itself. A big one that ppl mention is the community is toxic but honestly who really cares. u have very limited interaction with others so u can ignore players in chat but on the other hand u will often find urself being left to die by selfish teammates who jsut want to survive on their own and let the killer be distracted by their teammates. Camping is bloody heavy in this game. Seriously 2 out of like 3 killers seem to be campers its a really annoying experience that ruins a fun match. Not sure what its called really but the match making system is rather Starting out the game as a tier 20 (lowest tier) lvl like 3 killer and i go against a full team of prestige 3 (u can tell because their entire body is bloody) survs is bs. its no fun. Its easy for good players to cheat the system by letting their tier fall down to 20 while farming bloodpoints then just going against lower tier killers/survs and just wrecking them. It can also be annoying to be a lvl 20 or so tiered surv/killer and see urself put against players who are lvl 10 tiered. a game where u dont even get to play bc ur against a killer with hundreds of hours or survs with the same is pretty irratating. Compared to when the game first launched back when i originally played it the net connection is much better i rarely see survivors dc any more. On the other hand since i started playing again ive had killers dc on me more games than not which sucks. but still much better than before.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: This game has a lot of potential. Its got a great atmosphere and it can be very scary at times. Im not a fan of the Rank/perk system at all though. Instead it should have been more RNG in game where you find items laying around and start with a random perk to mix this up. Right now people with more time can easily farm up perks and items and stomp players who can only do 1 ot 2 games a day but thats ok i guess. There should have been 2 different ways to queue up. a Ranked mode that is basically the current Quick join and a Play with friends mode where you grp up with your friends against a random killer. and balance it by only rewarded 50% xp To the grouped team but 100% to the killer since he is alone.The survivors need more things to do. Like causing distractions or laying a trap to slow the killer. Also Private games need settings. If im playing with 2 friends and im the killer i want to make it easier for them with game settings by reducing the time it takes to start a generator Stuff like that. Pros Great Atmosphere Scary Fun with 4 other friends Has potential for alot more.Cons Only 1 game mode. Perk system is confusing Not enough character customization Badly optimized (for me anyway) No way to play in Quick game lobby with friends. Private games dont have game settings I have hope for this game and i will recommend it only if you have friends to play with. Otherwise in its current state its too easy to cheat and exploit bad game mechanics to win.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Product received for free. Tested the game for free while weekend event.The game idea is pretty good and the way that it's made CAN be fun. (Saw some Let's Plays of DBD before).But the game as it is now (for me) had some really heavy issues. It worked for me to actually join and play a game for only 2 times of 10 tries. Sometimes it just says "waiting" when trying to find a lobby and nothing else happens for minutes. In this state you can't even go back to main menu to maybe retry or something. You can just hit "Alt+F4". One time when it actually worked for me to find a lobby but I had an infinite loading screen before getting in the game (After 15 min I gave up).This is just not acceptable! If DBD was a free early access game it would be kind of OK but this thing is considered as "final"and even has some DLCs!!! If I compare this to "Evolve Stage 2" which "finished" in Beta Status and is freetoplay now this is absolutely ridicolous. And in Evolve reviews people are complaining about long waiting ques while they are pretty normal and OK I think...If you think my PC might be the problem here my specs Win7 x64 ProIntel i7 6700KGTX 1080 OC16GiB DDR4 RAM

review: Product received for free. THIS GAME IS SO ING AWESOME GUYS! Nothing else to say aside from the fact that it looks like its develeped by brain deficit mosquitos. Enjoy the most interesting 2016 game ever made when you are not overwhelmed by its multiple bugs Experience all your data being erased every time a killer leave the lobby... The thrill of starting anew! Experience infinite loading time now and then 'cause yes this game is so heavy that you have to wait literally Forever while the match probably goes on! title: Dead by Daylight

review: Fun game I love the concept of the killers there are some very creepy and well executed designs. Overall game play can be fun when the killer knows what he's doing and doesn't camp survivors. However the game is played with a match making bug that makes it a nightmare to play with your friends. Lobbies kicking everyone or only kicking one of your group members out. You'd think fixing that would be their biggest priority but it isn't. I also feel like some of the newer killers are a little unbalanced like the hag and michael myers. The hag is frustrating because she gets 10 traps unlike the trapper where you have to walk around the map and pick up the traps she spawns with all of them. It's also very annoying not being able to disarm her traps. It is impossible to take the last couple generators with her as the killer because of her stupid traps. Michael myers is also a bit overpowered my only gripe with him right now is how fast he is at his first level. He can get to a max of 3 levels by stalking people its creepy as when you catch him at level 3 he's so god damn fast its insane. All in all its a good game if they fixed the match making bug and balanced the game a little better I would be happy. In my oppinion the only reason they haven't balanced the killers is because they want people to purchase them.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Playing as the killer is more fun for one reason above all others The killer is the host. If you're going to try to play as survivor you'll be spending time connecting to the host. How much time? Infinity time in some cases. Anyone who's played PayDay 2 will know about how in the planning phase if everyone readies up the game sometimes just won't start. At least in PayDay 2 you can quit out of that host. Not so in Dead by Daylight as once the game readies up a person can be stuck on that loading screen for forever forcing a task manager closing of it.Furthermore as survivor a person can't tell what their ping is to the host. One would think if there's no apparent grouping by locale at least let me know if my connection to the host is garbage so I can find another host. There's no reason to hide such relevant information from me.The lack of information and hours lost to the P2P system being a turd means that half the game (survivor) is going to be locked to anyone without the patience of Job. Being able to play the game is pretty important to me and it should be important to anyone. Pass on it until these issues are fixed.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: I have over 200 games on Steam and literally have never written a review.I love the concept of this game. The one time out of six I got to play this game during the free weekend it seemed like it would be a lot of fun. Pretty exciting stuff especially for a horror fan junkie like me.Now for the other five times the game simply hard froze on "Waiting" or "Loading" screens. I would let it sit for minutes frozen. It should be known the one time it worked it started fast and loaded fast. These issues appear to have nothing to do with my computer (I5 SSD Nvidia 970). I wonder if maybe to many people are trying it on the free weekend and it isn't ready. In any event it such a let down. If I had purchased this game it would have certainly been returned based upon having to use Ctrl Alt Delete more times than I use it typically in months of computing. I would understand more if this was an early access release however I hate buggy problems and do not buy those games for that reason.Maybe this can be perfected in the future. Great concept dreadful execution.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Product received for free. amazing is all i can say but to bad it ends up like crap on lower end pcs.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: My computer Windows 10FX 6300 at 3.5 Ghz8GB RAMGTX 750 Ti 2 GBCaveat I only tried it during the free weekend but based on that I'm not a fan of this game. The game balance is skewed heavily in favor of the Monster. Furthermore if a survivor player dies in a match there is no way to respawn so the player is forced to sit out the rest of the match. It's especailly furstrating because Level One survivors have no way to actually attack or fight back against he monsters aside from a few environmental context actions that are very unreliable. The game also fails to disable the Windows Key which means if it's accidentally pressed in one of the game's many frantic quick time events survivors are almost sure to lose. There's a fun core idea in here but it needs a lot of refinement and that's before the technical issues come into play.Credit where it's due the game runs very on my computer even in Ultra settings when it initially launches. But on subsequent attempts the game fails to launch getting stuck and never fully starting up. This would only be a minor annoyance but when the games fails to launch in this way it also prevents Task Manager from starting so I can't kill the process and it it even prevents the computer from fully shutting down or restarting meaning turning the power off and back on is the only way to launch the game again. I don't know if the game has a specific hang up on my machine or if there's just some broken code but at the bare minimum that needs to be ironed out before I'd say the game is worth a purchase.
title: Dead by Daylight

title: Dead by Daylight

review: Literally unplayable.Would have liked to give it a try during the free play weekend and I may give it a few more shots.Every single time I try quickplay or choosing a side and try to join a game it says 'Failed to join game' and then the next time I try it just locks on a black screen or pauses on 'Waiting' forever.You're free to defend the game however you please IE it's my network it's my hardware etc but I play a vast number of other games without issues or that have documented fixes. This game does not appear to have any documented fixes searching for the case of possible network ports only reveals the Steam standard ports which have been fixed on my network for quite some time.It might be the load on the servers from the free weekend. Don't really know. Just know I did not get a chance to experience the actual game and that the issues were enough for me to be frustrated and leave a review that the game has a chance of not working. I'd mark this as a cautious purchase for anyone as it'd really suck to have spent 20$ or more on this only to have it not work. Only saving grace is to remember for those that are purchasing (and not playing on free weekend like me) to remember that as long as you don't about for 2 hours trying to get it working you can refund the game.Immediately after writing this I tried again and was able to play once before the same symptoms showed up again. Any time it fails to join a game the entire UI itself and doesn't allow you to go further. It appears as if there's inconsistent state of some sort in the game int hat when you fail it doesn't re establish things properly to attempt again and you're left in an eternal wait screen where most things don't function proeprly.

title: Dead by Daylight

review: First of all I'd like to say that I really love this game. It's something I'd been hoping would be created for a while and after it's release I fell in love with the game.As a fan of the horror genre since the early days of Resident Evil 1 Silent Hill and Amnesia I think it's a fun twist to put another human being as the killer as a player with actual thoughts and ideas is much more terrifying than an AI.For people who have been throwing bad reviews to this game sure it has some downsides but every game does. Rather than tossing down a gauntlet and challenging people to internet flame wars as most 'hate posts' do Ignore them. I've yet to see a constructive negative review most people either have a grudge against the publisher or just dislike the game.This game is a must have especially if you enjoy horror and if you have friends who'd like to join in as well.There are a few issues I've been having lately and I know some of them have been addressed in the 'Developers Addressing Major Issues' post but there are somethings that I think may be sort of overlooked.Matchmaking Time to Full Lobby Perhaps it's just my location or maybe just bad luck but often times I find myself waiting anywhere from 5 10 minutes to get a game sometimes up to 10 15 if I feel like playing the killer. I know part of the problem is the current issue of 'Lobby Hopping' since there is no implemented ranked party system at the moment but it seems like a bit more of an issue than that. As a survivor I often am brought to the loading screen and kicked right back to the lobby failing to find a match which tends to increase the time to wait.Lack of Survivor Communication in GameMaybe gestures or maybe proximity voice chat that can be heard by both the hunter and the hunted. I feel like the game ends up being 1v 1 1 1 1 instead of 1v4 because there is a lack of communication and cooperation between players. Simply spinning in circles and crouching down/standing up isn't quite enough to communicate your plans and ideas to your fellow survivors.'Puppy Guards'Ever jumped into a game got hunted down or watched someone else get caught and then watch as the killer stands by them and hits them repeatedly until they're sacrificed? It's a problem currently. Sure you can go grab the generators while he's doing this but it ruins the game for that one person who has to sit there on the hook. Perhaps lower the rate at which the sacrifice ticks down while the killer is nearby or give a lower score to killers who sit within a few meters of the hook. It's not a serious problem per se as there can be ways to deal with it or you can just escape while he's doing this to another survivor but it does ruin the game for the one guy unless they just struggle and let themselves get killed to leave for another game but doing that gives the killer exactly what they want easy points with no downside and allows them to go after another survivor to hang up and sit by for more points. Wash Rinse Repeat.Pick Me Up with Med KitI think there should be a (SLOW) way to pick yourself up if you have access to a medkit. As much as this should be a team game with cooperation without a party matchmaking system currently no one every seems to care about the other players or the coop aspect of the game. You typically have to fend for yourself but once you're downed like that there's nothing to really do except exit the game. Perhaps offer a 'Quick Way Out' to downed survivors so they don't have to DC and lose what points they gathered through the game if a pick yourself up function won't be added.DING DONG DING DONG DING DONGThere are certain spots in the maps where the wraith(And other killers can but it's much harder) can press themselves up against you to trap you there with no way out sort of like corner trapping in older FPS games. Sort of the same issue with Puppy Guarding. The wraith goes invisible sneaks up on you and instead of killing you traps you in a corner in a building and stands there while doing nothing. It's a problem when said player ends up being the only one left and just has to sit there until they get bored and DC or the killer DCs because there's no way around and no way out.These are just a couple issues I found through playing. Great game great concept and great design and I know things are getting fixed up properly. For those of you still questioning whether or not you would like to purchase this game you can always wait to see if some of the issues are fixed in a future patch but I strongly suggest you start playing now as you're missing out on some quality content.Thanks for providing such a captivating and entertaining game.

review: I am not sure if the devs of this game even read this but this game is great and all until you meet someone who just sits at a window and jump back and forth it as a survivor because there is no possible way the killer can catch them. What the devs need to impliment for survivors is some sort of energy I would love to see someone try to jump through a window 50 times and not get tired. The energy could be used to where if they use it all up they become slower than the killer at performing such things such as the window. The window speed difference was set as an advantage to get out of range of the killer and get away not sit there and watch the killer walk back and forth helplessly trying to get somebody while the rest get objectives. If the killer leaves that survivor then they will just grab the closest generator since the windows are usually next to them. This would give a better balance between killer and survivor. I do recommend this game because when people actually play the game how it is meant to be played it is one of the most enjoyable games out there though.

title: Dead by Daylight

review: Dead by daylight is a strange game to review. It has so many problems but is ultimately still an extremely fun game.DBD is an assymetrical competitve experience it involves 4 survivors stuck in a map with 7 generators in order to escape they must completely repair 5 of them which takes around 80 seconds and then open 1 of 2 escape doors to survive. The killer on the other hand needs to hit survivors twice to put them into the dying state basically incapacitated like on left 4 dead. He/she must then pick up the survivor and put them on a meat hook hooking the same survivor 3 times or until the timer runs out will result in a kill. On first glance the basis of the game is simple which is one of the great things it's very easy to pick up and play regardless of previous game experience. However there over time and at higher ranks the game becomes alot more involved for both killer and survivor. This unfortunately is a double edged sword. While it keeps the game interesting and makes for intense chases stand offs and mind games it brings with it some of the greatest issues. It is generally accepted by the majority of the community that the game is suprisingly very survivor biased although I don't believe this becomes particularly noticable until higher ranks. Personally I don't belive the game itself is too unbalanced in its own right. The major inbalances come from the perks and the different killers. Currently there are 12 killers in the game the issue is that many are simply not viable against adept survivors. What makes a killer good? generally speaking is two things the ability to end a chase early i.e a very powerful killing orientated killer or a very mobile killer that has large map control. An example of this would be the nurse now nurse actually moves more slowly than survivors but has a double blink ability after which she can take a swing and become exhausted for a few seconds unable to act. Her ability is not great at finding hiding survivors but is extremely powerful in a chase being able to phase through walls and pallets (survivors drop pallets in the map to stun/block the killer if the killer breaks these they are permanently unusable) this makes it difficult for survivors to lose the nurse once she's found them. Doctor on the other hand is abit of an opposite he makes survivors descend into maddness over time causing them to hallucinate and scream revealing their location he is great and tracking survivors and keeping up constant pressure.Now for the bad part wraith is an example of a "useless" killer to many. He has the ability to ring a bell and become kind of invivisble? but you can still pretty much see him he takes 3 seconds to ring his bell and uncloak before he can attack this gives survivors ample time to run away to safety and his ability gives him no way to help in the chase itself so the survivor wastes your time while their team mates rush the generators.And ultimately that is what dbd is a game of time management as a killer for example you have to ask yourself the question do I follow this survivor into a pallet heavy area and risk their team mates completing gens or do I let them go and backtrack to the generators.The other issue is simply the perks most killers/survivors can choose from I think it's over 50 perks. But for some reason only the same lets be generouse and say 8 perks keep coming up that's because they are simply so much better than the others. lets compare 2 on killer for example ( a highly used perk) BBQ &amp chilli vs (a never used perk) monstrous shrine.BBQ and chilli basically does this when the killer hooks a survivor if their team mates are more than 40 or so meters away he can see them through the wall allowing him to easily begin another chase or if no one appears it means that the team mates are close by trying to save their team mate great perk. Then we have monstrous shrine this pretty much decreases the time it takes for survivors to die on basement hooks ONLY by 4%... seriously look at the difference between these 2 perks it's insane and there are so many perks that are like this for survivor as well not just killer.We need more balancing not necessarily nerfs right now more buffs for extremely underused perks for both survivor and killer to make things viable. Monstrous shrine for example why not decrease the time it takes for them to die by idk maybe 15%? something actually noticable.Another small issue I have is that on the 13th of every month ranks roll back. Basically the lowest rank is 20 and the highest is 1 on the 13th these ranks roll back more or less 8 ranks I think so a rank 12 killer is now playing at rank 20 against many new rank 20 players and kicking their vica versa for survivors skilled survivors are destroying new killers this rank reset is just so uneeded I don't understand why it's even there honestly it just discourages new players because the devs seem to forget challenge is fun getting steam rolled is not.One final poke at this game is simply the offering/addons. Addons affect killers abilities i.e increasing the charging speed of the chainsaw or survivor equipment i.e making tool boxes repair faster. Offerings are 1 time use before the game begins some of which are just stupid. A competitive game in my eyes can't have such game alterating things like this. I will talk about 2 things specifically. First for survivor is the brand new part. This is a 1 time use addon that pretty much allows the survivor to repair a generator in as low as 20 seconds compared to 80 seconds and for a game that's based on playing against the clock this is simply insane. Killer has ebony moris this mean that if the killer hooks a survivor once then catches them again he can insta kill them. That's it instead of 3 hooks you need 1 hook and 1 more down that's it. Things like this should not exist simply because they alter the game far too much imo and are apparently far too common at the top ranks.Despite all the issues with the game I would still recommend it simply because although it isn't perfect now it's heading in the right direction with every update. Just recently this removed this thing called the pallet vaccum remember how I said survivors can drop pallets to block off the killer well before the survivor could start the drop on one side and teleport to the other side basically teleporting them to safety away from the killer when they you should have taken a hit. This was removed last update a brilliant fix abit slow granted people were asking for this for ages but still.

review: I can't recommend this game anymore. It's just not fair for the killer. Playing killer which is the only reason I cared about this game at all you are on the backfoot the entire game. There is nothing you can do. Let me lay out how a game will go.You will spend probably around 30 seconds looking for survivors.You'll find someone.They'll run sprint burst when you get close then loop you 3 times then drop a pallet.From there they'll immediately go from the first loop to the second one.They'll loop you 3 times again drop another pallet.If you're lucky there won't be another pallet in time and you'll get a hit in.As you get one hit on the survivor 3 generators (out of 5) will immediately finish.They'll get a speed burst and you'll have to choose to chase them down or try to stop more gens.You'll patrol gens another gen will pop by the time you find someone.You'll hit them last gen will pop doors are now active.You'll down them hook them door will be open.Now you can facecamp to get one kill or you can try to get other people to no avail.They'll get him off the hook teabag you at the exit then leave comments on your steam profile about what a killer you are.The ONLY way around this is to run top tier perks. That means either A. Suffering through hundreds of games and waiting months for Hex Ruin or something to be teachable then grind a ton of bloodpoints level up your killer of choice until it pops up get that perk to level 3 then finally stand some kind of chance. or B. Buy The Hag play through massive amounts of t for hundreds of games getting no bloodpoints and grinding for hours on end to level up a killer you're never going to play because she's godawful then get her perk teachable in order to level another killer in order to get the perk on your killer of choice. Or C. Play as survivor and become as much of a as everyone else.A ton of things that absolutely need to change with this game A. Make pallet locations random. Everyone has memorized where each pallet is and can easily run from loop spot to loop spot. Without something like Huntress Billy or Nurse you're never going to catch them and you're just going to waste all of your time. They need to make pallets random so the survivors have to at least FIND the loop spots not go from loop to loop.B. Buff the underpowered killers. The only 3 killers who are even considered good are Huntress Nurse and Billy. Meanwhile there's killers like Wraith Trapper Hag Pig and Nightmare that are basically godawful.C. Add in a casual mode. Nothing is more annoying than the fact that people who are just trying to farm bloodpoints and level up their killers are matched with people who are genuinely trying to rank up. These two people are different and play differently. And it's not fair that you'll get a daily to play Wraith and go "Oh well guess I'll lose a rank for bloodpoints" or when someone who plays mostly killer gets a survivor daily and ruins a game for other survivors trying to rank up. Why isn't there a casual mode? And I don't mean Kill With Friends. That's not the same thing.D. Remove Survive With Friends from Ranked when you add Casual. A killer going against 4 people on coms is impossible. Between body blocking calling out locations of the killer and working together on gens it's literally impossible for the killer to get a single kill without running absolutely t builds like Instakill Myers with infinite level 3 or Nurse or something. Ranked should be about your individual skill.E. Lessen the grind. Make easier to share between your characters. If you make a perk teachable don't make someone level another character up to 30 35 in order to get the perk to level 3. If you have offerings like extra bloodpoints let me use them on other characters. The way the game is now you have to focus on individually leveling each person up whether survivor or killer. And that generally means in order to level other people up you're forced to play just one person the entire time. It takes 100s of hours in the game to level all the killers and the survivors are even worst.D. Slow down gens. With how long killers have to chase people it should take longer for people to do gens. Killers shouldn't have to rely on a perk in order to have a fair game. It should be a level playing field with perks altering the gameplay not an unlevel playing field with perks being the only thing that makes it level.E. Let killers place their own totems. Nothing is worse than a survivor happening to spawn in front of the only thing keeping the playing field level and destroying it in the first 30 seconds of the game. That's before you even see one survivor most of the time. And there's nothing you can do about it now it's just an empty perk slot. While you should probably restrict the basement from having totems placed in it you should let killers place their totems and hide them. That way they have a chance to have some use before they're even destroyed.F. Change flashlight animation blinding. In this game if you're in an animation you can't turn your camera. That means every time you kick a gen kick a pallet pick up a survivor vault through a window place a trap or hook a survivor someone with a flashlight can get a free blind on you. And there is literally nothing you can do about it. Not to mention flashlights have a limited amount of use which can be extended by add ons but literally 0 cooldown. So if they miss a flashlight hell they can just try again. Why not? They can make you constantly have to turn your camera every single time you go around a corner. It's painfully unfair.I bought most of the DLC for this game and bought the game at full price. I don't recommend anyone else does the same until the devs fix some of the t in the game. I haven't mentioned Decisive Strike because that's in bound to get nerfed but the rest of this crap needs to be fixed. Unless you're playing top tier killers you feel completely powerless. And no one has any honor at all. You will be teabagged insulted called every name in the book and ridiculed because the only reason is because "you're bad". But it's not all your fault. Not when a "competitive" game is as unbalanced as this currently is.

review: Product received for free. Edit after some research I've found out that they have no dedicated servers and the killer is the host. The match making is trying to set people up with who ever is closer to them and it means I end up with mostly the same people from my country over and over again. This also explains why are disconnects so frequent since it depends on players hosting it themselves and I don't know many people around here with a good enough connection.Over all the game is great but it feels under budged almost like an Early Access title.When I do manage to play a round of this game it's really fun it's a good concept and it is rewarding but..Too many times I see a player disconnect either a killer or a survivor and I really doubt it's the players fault. Too frequent.I get this bug where it is just stuck on waiting and has the loading screen logo flashing but you cannot exit it. I tried for 5 mins to see if it'll either pass or get me into a match in vain. I had to close the game via task manager since the back botton was not responding and alt+f4 did nothing. I'm playing on a free weekend and there is bearly any players. I can't imagine how will it look after the free weekend.It seems fun but so far I have not been able to finish a round due to players dissconecting.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Not a big fan of horror gore and so on. So I'm not sure why I decided to give this game a try. As soon as I had it installed I jumped in and played the monster without a lick of understanding of how the game worked. I didn't catch or kill a single victim. But I was hooked (yeah) anyway. I watched the tutorials after my first game and tried again as the monster. I got two victims. The psychosis was sinking in. Played again. Whack! Whack! Whack! Three down so fast and easy. Almost had the last victim but he slipped through my hands just before I could sacrifice him and found the exit. So much more for me to figure out and savor. I plan to play my own version of the game at the family Christmas party. I'll give 'em a few minutes head start. Maybe. Awesome game.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Product received for free. I played Dead by Daylight durring this free event. It is a very fun game this is comming from a horror junkie. Played survivor and was pretty bad at it. Played killer and no one could escape from The Wraith and his sexy legs! Playing a killer definitely helped me play a survivor. Leveling up seemed wonky though. You GAIN killer/survivor points to get a LOWER level (backwards from 20 to 1 which I think is weird but okay ). When I wanted to play survivor joining a lobby was a pain. I couldn't load in all the time and had to exit the game. Didn't see this problem when I made the lobby as a killer. Had a fun time playing it and enjoyed being the only survivor left and looking for that hatch and making it. Heart was pounding as well. 9.5/10

review: Ever thought about going outside and playing hide and seek again but can't because everyone in this digital age is too cool for that?Well then Dead By Daylight is for you! It's basically like hide and seek but hiders aren't subjugated they're tortured to death instead!!! WOWWWW!!!Relive your moments as a child when you were seeking those idiots that kept getting angry at you for finding them so easily. But this time torture them by placing them on sacrificial hooks for the Entity the god of this game's world. Ha try bullying me now suckers!ORBe the idiot trying to hide because there is no actual point in hiding when the Entity gives the seeker optional abilities(Whispers) to sense your presence within a certain radius.Instead play like the free runner you've always wanted to be in a game of freeze tag. Vault over waist high objects jump off balconies break ankles and disrespect the seeker for not doing his/her objective. Find joy in their failure and make a meme out of it. Then regret as there are no more unique players being the seeker and you always match up with the one that actually knows how to get you.Okay jokes aside this game is $20 unoftenly on sale for 25 50% and highly replayable.The game had a pretty rough start with frustrating bugs but it's definitely getting more and more endurable for long durations of gaming.The community is actually fairly decent for an competitive online game everyone who is nice will reveal it only if you're nice.7/10 grab it on sale tbh
title: Dead by Daylight

review: I was worried about this game when I saw it was being published by Starbreeze aka the people who completely ruined Payday 2 but after having played it for a little bit it's actually quite an enjoyable game. The mechanics feel very fleshed out and to me at least playing as a helpless survivor was fun too. I'll just get to the "TL DR Buy" recommendation now because the biggest issue with this game is a lack of players.I was curious how well the "start generator exit level" mechanic would work. The catch with the generators is that at random intervals you will need to time a button press or else the generator will make a loud noise and alert the hunter to your position. So while you're basically just sitting there listening for the hunter indicator to go off you're also paranoid about when the prompt will pop up and be able to react to it. I'm not too big a fan of the quick time events but they work well enough.I was also worried that it would be a bad balance between hunter and the hunted but I think it works fairly well. Checking closets for victims takes a good 5 or so seconds so if you're chasing someone and you stop to check a closet they may end up losing you (which is easy to do) or if you decide to follow the way you think they went they can slip out of the closet you decided not to check ... or from behind some rocks you didn't even notice. As a "victim" with the maps being randomized to a extent (of course it's so dark that you couldn't really tell anyway) it's all about thinking on your feet. Even though you can't fightThere's still a couple of things that need to be worked on for this to be a solid recommendation. One thing would be steamworks integration so I can invite people to a public match. Another would DEFINITELY be a re evaluation of the item system you apparently lose items you unlock through the skill tree if you die (which as a victim is likely) and without a more outlined way to get them back again it just seems like a waste of skill points and ultimately a waste of a skill system. The biggest problem the game has right now is a lack of playerbase and waiting for a full server can be a serious waiting game (and disappointment when you FINALLY have a full match and then someone leaves)Overall though there is a lot to like here. The mechanics are simple enough though some of the more specific nuances of the mechanics (like the above mentioned generator QTE or how your skill tree items can be simply gone because you died) are not explained. Still for $20 ($17.99 right now) it's a pretty good game. There's already room for expansions like more characters and hunters different clothing options and so on which I think could be cool but again being a Starbreeze published game I'm scared they may push it down the same path to DLC Hell. However as long as they can control themselves I think the devs have made something really nice here and proof that multiplayer CAN actually be a scary experience.TL DR Buy the game so we can have more players
title: Dead by Daylight

review: I usually don't write reviews for games except for the one I made for summer event but here I am. This game its not balanced at all not even by a long shot the community is poor and toxic. Its not a fun game at all. The game developers don't give a crap about the balancing and as a killer main its horrendous. Perks are terrible you have to grind them out to get anywhere and even then you're relying on RNG and praying you get something good every time you level a character. I don't have one bit of fun at all with this game. I only have 33 hours and this games matchmaking is making me go against people with 2000+ hours that have everything unlocked. I just cant play it anymore and enjoy it.I tried to give the game another chance and it just keeps getting worst every day it seems. The matchmaking is terrible and will even pit a newish killer against teams of four survivors which they dub "Survive with Friends " which adds to the difficulty a killer has to deal with. I would not recommend this game to anyone because of how unbalanced it and its community is towards new players. And if anyone wants to say "git gud " I made it to rank 10 as killer with 26 hours into the game and perks while doing killer rotation against players with a lot more hours then me and everything unlocked.

review: I did have my review as Negative but I wanted to change it up because I do play this game a lot. And I have over 216 hours on it so I should just say I enjoyed it. I'm not going to give any pros or cons cause that just takes up too much time to do.If you hate toxic survivors or toxic killers don't get this game. I have ran into killers who will camp you just so they can get an easy win. Survivors can be as much toxic as that but they like to run the killer around for as long as they can before time runs out and the killer has competed NONE of the tasks.Some people from YouTube videos I've seen they have seen glitches in the game which aren't game breaking they're just really weird. If you are new to this game and you're just starting out it will take a while for you to get into a match because of your rank. Level 1 survivor or killer may take you a while to find a lobby. This game does have custom clothing you can buy but you have to purchas it by paying real money to get the in game cash to buy such clothing. Really isn't much else to say other than if you wanna try this game out go for it. If you aren't a fan of games like this don't get it. Or if you've seen other reviews that have told you how BAD this game is wait for a steam sale and then buy it. I rate this game 10/10 for ME cause I personally find it fun if you're bored or have nothing to do or whatever your reason IS. Game does have mixed reviews and Mostly positive but those mixed reviews just tell you what the other players have experienced that isn't good to them. Most are complaining of issues or campers or Pallet loopers etc. Put this game on your wish list if you aren't sure if you should buy it or NOT! ...Think on it cause some of the reviews are literally half and half. Idk if I somehow kept repeating myself through out this review but if I did whatever.
title: Dead by Daylight

The devs are fixing the issues as they come up and for a $20 game its working exactly as i expected it to. I don't understand the negative reviews from new players. Its almost frustrating when you've seen the game improve and new players are still giving it hell. They don't know what it WAS like. They don't understand how far its come. The game was released pretty buggy yes but as it stands right now i think its worth it.I'm happy with my purchase and I'm 100% faithful that the devs will keep up with the game and improvements.

review: I give this game a down vote for the time being. Allow me to explain why. This game is fantastic. It is unique and engaging but the pros outweigh the cons in my opinion. And yes I "liked" the game but I still say it's a negative buy until they fix the core issues.PROS Again totally unique. Great idea and the game has had a lot of good going for it. The rounds are quick and fun. You stay entertained thw whole time. The developers also include a lot of content which is good for a game like this. Which sadly leads to the cons. Wait times for matches are decent although killer's control when you play which is BS.CONS A game should focus on its core before it focuses on content. The fact that you rely on the killer's "hosting" ability is very archaic. That should never be a thing for a PvP game. In some instances it ruins the game as the killer's internet causes you to lag like a MoFo. As well people should suffer greater penalties from leaving a game mid game. It hurts the killer's score and affects the teammates of the survivors. For the amount of time this has been out these simple core mistakes that make the game aggravating should have been dealt with.All in all this game is beautiful and I have had it since a few weeks after release. Yet they have prioritizes pumping out content over stabilizing the game. Some killers are rarely even used. So what the is the point of releasing them? Anyway I'm hoping the devs see this and maybe look back into the core of the game. The cons should not be an issue.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Honestly one of the most addictive games I have ever played. The thrill of trying to survive in a world where the killer has the advantage of speed. It's easy to play but hard to be great at. Different killers using different strategies or different survivors using different strategies depending on which side you are on makes it a very unpredictable game. The fact the killer is stuck in a first person view helps the survivors hide while their speed advantage makes it easier for them to catch. Only advice I can give for a survivor is1. Never panic. Ever.2. Think about what the killer will do next and with that knowledge try to stay away from him.3. Cry softly as you get hooked.4. Spider is love Spider is life

I really liked how the Devs diaries was so accurate towards the game it showed that they really care about their creation that is Dead by daylight.The feeling when you escape or when you caught the last survivor and hook him...it feels amazing (personally when i caught someone i start the music "Hooked on a feeling" cuz a badass killer need badass music)Pros You can hunt 4 victims you have to think before you act as a survivor gameplay is sweet and the heartbeat is epic!Helping fellow survivors gives you more points and bigger chance to survive but also a penalty if you get caught by the killer! can be 4 different survivors and 3 different killers. EPIC chases and escapes.Have no DLC wich i hope they never get!Cons Can only play with friends in private if not you are lucky to find them in a solo queue.Killers tend to camp after they hooked 1 survivor some bugs that break the game so that if not you or the killer leave the game goes on forever and the one who leaves loses points.I really do hope that the devs fixes so you can play with friends in a public game and that they give us some different customisations for blood points or something overall the game is awesome and i recomend it 100% but i would not buy it for 19 99 Euro it's worth 15 99 thats for sure but not higher.

Like falling out of the map by jumping through a window or People getting hit while they step out of one and can't recover can't be picked up by killer nor by allies. Or Graphic issues in which i can see the Killer in high distance while the area around him is not rendered. Well... all that is pretty annoying. If other people have a higher ping also thier arms grow... and thier godly powers. Beware.Edit Time has gone by and Things have changed a bit. review: Bought the game almost 2 years ago had a ton of fun the longest time besides the unbalance and boring playstyle you are forced to in mid/high ranks and hoped it would get better in time. But still the game is in huuuge favour of the survivors (and i am a survivor main just keep that in mind before thinking im just an upset killer) every 5 6 month the killerpalyer get a tiny buff to hold them by the game. Best example this ptb whats going on right now the survivors now have to stand on the side of the pallet where they want to be after they dropped it after 2 years should have been in the game from the start. The next good buff killer got this ptb (and that is actually a huge one) is to close the hatch an escapedoor on the ground that will open (under specific terms) after everyone but 1 survivor in the game died so survivors dont have to do their objectives anymore. If they found it they won. On the ptb killers could close it so survivors had to do their job and fixing generator. After 1 fixed it opens again. Cool idea but survivors dont want to do that so killers wont get that as soon as the patch hits live. Killer complaining for YEARS and get ONE buff survivors complain IN THE FIRST WEEK of the ptb over a killer buff and the buff wont go live untill changed (and that probably again) in favour of survivors. And the playstyle i was talking about is like playing catch with your little 3 year old brother/sister/cousin/whatever. Find survivor &gt survivor runs to a pallet &gt circles it 3 4 times &gt kilelr gets close &gt survivor dropps it so killer had to waste time breaking it &gt meanwhile survivor runs to another pallet &gt repeat. It is so booring to do as survivor to watch people do and to receive as killer. And if you dont bring one specific perk to slow down the gen progression of the survivor as killer you have lost anyway if your enemys arent total morons. So final verdictIf you like games like that or have a unhuman like resistence to frustration buy it and have fun. But i would wait a few month to see if the game will change and get proper balancing if not this game is doomed to die in his next year.

review: this game can be some of the most fun you'll ever have and with all of the playable characters and perks to unlock for both survivors and killers there's hundreds of hours of gametime here. however I can't recommend this game in its current state.if you were to get this game right now you probably wouldn't realize the issue even in your first 75 100 hours of playtime. the games would be balanced some games you'll win and some you'll lose. but once you start to really learn the ins and the outs of the game unlock the 'meta' perks learn strategies etc. it will become painfully obvious that this game is completely unbalanced. as it stands the survivors are the force to be reckoned with. not the killer that has a special power a weapon is more physically imposing etc. No the 4 little survivors are the OP ones and they will relentlessly bully the killers. There are so many crutches that the survivors have that the killer simply does not have. The killer doesn't rely on their skill rather the mistakes that the survivors make. So it doesn't matter how good you are as a killer if the survivor somewhat knows what they're doing and manages to not make any mistakes you're ed. from the absurd amounts of pallets and vaults that create brutal loops to the perks that make survivors actual gods to the harrassment the survivors dish out to the killers this game creates more of a stressful environment than anything for anyone who wants to play killer. If you want to play survivor then you're set it's all a breeze. but if you want to enjoy the other half of the game be ready to be pounded by 4 survivors for 5 10 minutes at a time.the devs are supposedly working on balancing the game out but survivor mains always find a way to whine about every good killer or killer perk/feature so the killer will be nerfed again and we'll be back to square one. it's already happened too many times. if the game does actually get balanced I will gladly change my review. but until then my review will be negative and I'll still waste my time playing the game and allowing myself to get way too stressed and frustrated for way too long

The good is the varity of perks and possible builds for both sides (both have there meta set ups but it) the amount of time you can sink in and the fun of the game why i havent spent as much time here ive had more fun here then i ever did in dota2 (my most played game) and for that it outways the negatives of the disbalnce of most the killers

review: I typed a huge review on this just for it all to be deleted and I really don't feel like typing it again so i'll sum it up.Killers get the short end of the stick at any level past killer rank 15 really.The game becomes frustrating unfair rage inducing even. So many people have spoken about how unbalanced the game is between killer and survivor yet DEV's do not seem to care about it the slightest? In fact one of the DEV's taunted the fact we were upset with how it was at one point in time?It's sad.I really enjoy playing killer it's always fun don't get me wrong but being endlessly pallet looped to the point 2/3 generators have been completed by the time I finally can kill the person really frustrates me and EVERY other decent killer in the game. There is literally nothing we can do about it. At all.Overall my review for this game is now negative despite the roughly 500 hours i've played (and don't get me wrong I have had LOADS of fun in this game.) but at this point with all the ridiculous perks the survivors have and how easy pallet looping is it's just not fun to play killer.Survivor is still fun especially with friends yes. But that doesn't change the fact there's a HUGE balance issue between the 2 that really needs to be sorted out before I even think about laying a finger on killer again.To those who can take that level of frustration daily I salute you it's sad how little the DEV's care about killers.Uninstalled hopefully to never return.Edit I'd like to direct everyone's attention to this video for a more in depth look at just how frustrating playing killer really can be.https //youtu.be/qnwdPlx9yR4I DO NOT OWN OR HAVE ANY RIGHTS TO THAT VIDEO.

review: Meh edited I've preordered this game and when I could install it and play it felt like a regression to 2003. Graphics are too basic most of the scenary is repeated (for example a scenario featuring a corn plantation all corn plants look almost the same this is a common resource re using items instead of designing variations. There is no option to turn down the music there's only one volume setting... Points system is hard if you are a low level items are expensive and you may need to play qute a few times in order to use/purchase any item. Beware because if you get caught during the game those items you have been carrying get lost. If you get caught you wont live even if you keep clicking your mouse button as instructed when it reaches 99% wont allow you to get up and scape so dont follow instructions. There is another annoying visual aspect to the game there are 5 players one being the hunter and the rest being "victims" and there are only 4 characters so you will mostly play with clones of your character because the game doesnt avoid that.Finishing my review I would like to state that since this morning multiplayer is down (comes and goes erraticly) its now saying that my steam app is offline the same app I'm using to post this review. So for now this game is unplayable.The game is very basic if a demo was available I wouldn't have bought this game.

The Devs fixed a lotHere is why still cannot fully recomment it without a but 1) Finding matching lobbies toghether with your friends is a pain in the You spend too much time waiting while you only wait for a few seconds while searching on your own either as survivor or killer.2) There are no custom servers!!! Really that already ruined most of current Call of Duty.3) Killers who are always host that are constantly quitting when they are about to lose are something that I encountert 4/10 times while playing which is unacceptable and needs to be punnished more drastically. Instead of punnishing the survivors for keep going until the end making them lose everything including the score and items.It's a damn fun game. It really deserves to be played and extended. Starbreeze has brought some memorable entries with the Riddick series and really should consider investing into this one to reward loayal players who are really keeping that thing up. It defenetly relies on teamplay and skill likewise and having a horrorgame within a league would really add some fresh wind to the same old.If you're a fan of classic slasher movies and of survival game concepts you should defenetly buy it without a doubt. The rest of us that already owns it should continue to heavy petition towards the devs to keep up changes and not just leaving us alone with the current additional content.See you dead by daylight!
