review: Dead By Daylight is a 4vs1 multiplayer horror game where you play as either a survivor or a killer.Now I say "horror game" but in reality I doubt you'll find the game that scary except for a few jumpscares now and then.In this game your goal is to win by either fixing 5 generators in the map and escaping through the exit gate as survivors or killing all 4 survivors as killer. Let's go through the game.As a survivor you're able to choose from 5 different survivors (7 if you own both dlcs). These 5 survivors are not very different except for personalities and perks which are the game's way of progression. You see as a survivor you get points by fixing generators escaping helping your teammates and etc. These points are known as bloodpoints which you use in something called the Bloodweb to get items addons and perks. When you finish a Bloodweb you level up. Items These are items you get through the bloodweb or through hidden chests in the map (Note that you can only use that item from the chest if you escape with it.) these items include medkits to heal yourself or your team toolboxes to repair generators quicker or sabotage the killer's hooks so he can't use them and more. These can be good or bad as they have tiers like common and such.Addons These are things you can put in items or killer powers to empower them or make them better.Perks These are upgrades you can put on your survivor or killer every survivor and killer have different perks that do different things.Now let's talk about the killer. There are 4 killers (6 with dlcs). The killer's goal is to down every survivor by hitting them twice and carrying them to a hook in the map where the survivor will stay until a creature called "The Entity" comes down and kills them. Basically the survivors are a sacrifice from the killers to the Entity. Every killer has a "power" which helps them accomplish this things like putting down bear traps or becoming invisible. They can also attach addons to their powers to make them stronger.Now I know I'm missing a lot of stuff but I'll stop right there and talk about the actual game.Dead By Daylight is a fun game that can give you hours of entertainment but only if you can endure it's problems.Yes the game has many. For example finding a game as a killer can take a giant amount of time to some people (I once waited 25 minutes) the game requires you to get perks to do good in high levels but you're only allowed 1 perk until you get to level 15 where you unlock a second perk slot a third on level 20 and a fourth on level 25 but until you get there you'll only have one perk.There are things like hook camping perk exploits infinites and more that can destroy the fun of the game completely to some.In short Dead By Daylight is a great game with many problems that the developers are taking a while to fix.If you can get past them you'll find a fun multiplayer game to play alone or with friends if you don't you will not last long before you stop playing completely.Before I end the review I should mention that The sound design is alright not bad but not great The graphics are fine for what they are trying to accomplish Matches can last around 5 10 20 30 minutes or even longer it all depends on the killer and the survivors. Yes teamwork is a thing but without communication (The game doesn't have voice communication or a chat system so you'll need to talk to friends with a program) it can be very tough to make it work.Do I reccomend this game? Yes because I believe you'll enjoy it if you can get past the problems I've mentioned. If not do not bother with Dead By Daylight but if you do have an itch for a game like this look into Friday The 13th The Game.

review: Now when people ask "What is your favorite hobby?" I can reply that I enjoy being a mass murdering serial killer who's only goal is to sacrifice young adults/teens to the evil entity above.I don't have friends so i don't have to get my jimmys all rustled over "No co op que (" keep in mind i did buy a copy for myself and someone else still a great game i missed out on ONE experience this doesn't make the entire game bad. I mean the other person im sure is more appreciative to have a free game in their library and WHEN there IS co op que then HEY it's a good thing i bought the game afterall and waited patiently not throw the game into a fire and i'm the one that actually spent the money not the other person.Be warned 1) The Wraith is by far the hardest of the killers to win against its not impossible just extrodinary unfair. His bell's cloak/invisibility abillity is really distinguished amongst the 3 secondary weapons but it allows him to capture survivors easily yes yes he can't do anything while cloaked but considering the Killers are naturally faster than survivors he doesnt have to stay un cloaked long to wack you cloak and run to you un cloak and do it again and hang you out to dry from how soaked you are from your nervous sweat salty tears and the 20 pints of blood you have spewing out of you (thats a lot of blood FYI). But when you successfully survive against him it's the greatest feeling in the world. (ProTip Use Teamwork to GTFO &lt not from a real pro).2) There are mass amounts of people just joining the lobby and leaving because they want to play with friends but 15 minute for one game just to que? that's extreme and kinda exaggerated. Theres tons of people playing this game right now and it take 3 10 seconds for someone new to join and not everyone (like myself) is gonna let "No co op que (" ruin a perfectly good game (also i spent $15.99 each for this GOD DAMN IT! IM GONNA PLAY IT AND SCREAM LIKE A LITTLE GIRL IN THE COMFORT AND CONFINEMENT OF MY HOME!)3) Actual gameplay related stuff not just the lobby section and perks/abilities there are a few glitches and they arent the kind you can brush off. They don't happen everytime but you're bound to run into them. I'm actually gonna "go out there and make a difference" and summarize the ones I (me myself and I alone!) have encountered feel free to add on. A) Falling through the world your character will yell and fall through the gound repeatively. along with the glitch in (C). Edit http //steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id 703987045 B) You gain the ability to hover above the ground It's not a T pose its like a contorted Y pose used for the falling animation. You can still take damage run and die but your screen will be distorted as hell and crouching isn't a thing neither is interacting with the world. Edit http //steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id 703986336http //steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id 703987070 C) Unable to interact with the enviroment self explanitory this means EVERYTHING. People items objectives. This particular glitch pairs with the first glitch above. Vise Versa people can interact with you though. D) i don't really think this is a glitch just a game mechanic but there is a delay in the little mini game (skill tester) that pops up when you heal someone or repair an engine/motor. You get use to it real fast you have no choice but to with all the adrenaline flowing through your veins it becomes the last of your worries. (Escpecially &lt good job stupid spelled it wrong when the heartbeat is going just as crazy as your own)Conclusion Sorry it's long i don't write reviews often I would recommend this **** i bought it for someone else regardless if i can play with them or not because it's just that fun of a game and i knew they would enjoy it. It's intense thrilling challenging and sorta cliche but the good kind the kind you reminisce about. Try it yourself and expect more to come this game clearly has potential and good fortune coming it's way. Let's all support the Dev's and pray to the gods of video game heaven that this doesn't become a Pay to Win cause i notice it is possible unlikely but possible. Second prayer for the Dev's to listen to the community's feedback not saying they don't fingers cross that they do. Unlike some devs (those who shall not be named) because there is always room for improvement and i would hate for this game to fall before reaching glory or fall at all it has good momentum. Edit After reviewing my post i notice i didn't mention anything over the top in the "Good" department mostly the bad. One when you buy a game you want to know the catches first what random t to expect i'm saying it how it is the game isnt perfect (none are) but it's enjoyable. Second if i can tell you all the bad AND STILL say this game is glorious then theres some kind of element i cannot spoil for you that overrides everything else it's an experience you must have on your own terms. Besides what do you want? The Game description? it's a freaking survival horror man! The dev's spelled it out for us already.

review: Before I get into anything to big let me get this out of the way if you want to understand this games flaws look at the comment by The Sacred Voice. That being said I love this game even with the flaws it has maybe that isnt because I havent logged enough time into it yet but the flaws and the marginally toxic community cannot really get to you if you play with a 4 stack of friends and go at it but one thing that I can complain about a little is the match making system. Nothing sucks more than just starting dead by daylight and going up against a killer who is running some of the best perks in the game while you a lowly level 5 Claudette only have the perk slippery meat. However if you can see past all of the flaws you can see a game that the dev's actually put time and effort into crafting for a fun long running gaming experience. So if you find this comment even remotely persuasive I say give the game a shot and if you dont enjoy the game then refund it and buy somthing else. At the end of the day I know its your money so just do what you want.

review: Enormously fun. A bit bare bones to be honest so don't expect a huge amount in terms of variety but it has very solid core gameplay that more can be built onto. There are a few issues As other reviews have said there is no way to play a match with friends unless you can fill the full five men. You can't choose your host and so it's up to the will of the gods as to whether or not you'll get one with decent ping. There are a few bugs and exploits that are running crazy right now including things like disconnections not being counted by the ranked system and therefore high level players are disconnecting at the slightest hint of losing. Finally the survivors are a bit broken. Though the maps are randomly generated anyone who plays them a few times will come to know the sections where a survivor can abuse their wall jumping speed to constantly hop back and forth over the same wall. A pursuing killer would then either have to run back and forth hoping that they mess up or give up and hunt other prey. Luckily this is going to be patched but hasn't yet. So yeah it is not perfect but it's fun. Ludicrous terrifying exhilirating fun. 8/10 would buy again.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Used to be a good game. New Emblem system is s**t though. Reward survivors for altruism "evading" escaping and repairs generators basically. So nowadays survivors are essentially forced to to be altruistic and save people from the hook that's not to say it's a bad thing to do and people didn't do it anyway. However killers now play on this knowing that in order for a survivor to pip/double pip they HAVE to be altruistic. ALAS MY FRIENDS this is no issue for killers cause now they can facecamp/soft camp ALL they want and NOW (get ready for the best part) SURVIVORS COME STRAIGHT TO THEM. So they can camp AND get even newer kills. God almighty isn't that wonderful? And I mean who doesn't love a game in which the moment emblems are released killers finally realise that "OH F**K I CAN CAMP THE WEAKEST/FIRST SURVIVOR I FIND AND THEN THE REST WILL COME TO ME!". All in all though would recommend cause this game makes me scream more than any man ever has and will continue to do so whether they are screams of terror or screams of anger. Please ing fix the emblem system though. Finally after all this time of the game being out please for the love of god penalise killers for camping.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Love playing this game by myself. I had loads of fun climbing the ranks by myself and learning new tricks. Then I decided I would get some friends to buy the game so that i could finally chat with fellow survivors. No party are allowed. Matchmaking drops out here and there. Some killer wait times are so long that you lose interest before you find a game. Some people find games as killer within minutes me on the other hand I waited for 56 minutes (i timed it) before the first person joined my game as the killer. He left shortly after and I closed the game out of anger. My suggestion is wait until the game has haad more patches and more updates. It is not ready yet in my opinion. So TL DR fun in game terribble and time consuming to find a game.

title: Dead by Daylight

review: Dead by Daylight is a great idea but this game is poorly balanced as of writing this review. The matchmaking is poor. People can leave when ever they want with no consequences. You can not be a lobby with friends unless you the friend are lucky enough to get into a lobby with them the only way to be in a match with them is to create a private match. Because of this people lobby hop a lot and its very annoying. How the servers are set up. They are Peer to Peer servers which means that a player is hosting the server and that can cause poor connections. My main issue is balancing between the survivors and killer. The survivors can get really overpowered perks and the killer does not but that really does not matter when it is literately impossible to get away from the killer unless you have a flashlight a board to block him or if you are lucky a window to jump through but that is extremely slow but other then that you can not out run him at all no matter what you do. A killer you can choose from is called the wraith and he can become invisable and he can barely be seen with only a bell toll to tell if hes cloaking or uncloaking which is very broken because if he put someone on a hook and cloak and uncloak repeatedly and that makes it impossible for anyone to unhook the person. The killer has a attack range much larger then he should and can hit you much farther then he should and he can hit you through a window when you are not even close to the window. This game is a mess of bugs as well for the survivors and killer. The developers have not updated the game to fix issues like these for sometime which is a disappointment. Unless the developers fix these bugs and issues and it is well known that they are fixed. I would not recommend this game.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: For a game that came out to the light recently and suddenly it is... Awesome! Of course there are several bugs but just look at version of the game. Dead by Daylight IS going to be developed in the future but for now it perfoms itself great. The concept is interesting and simple at the same time 4 survivors try to escape when 1 tough buddy whistles around to get a chance to kill them all. Actually there are 3 types of the maniac that makes the game even more interesting. Every single character has its own features. Along with that creators did not get lazy and created a pre history to each of them. Gameplay is convenient and quite balanced for now. There are not so much buttons to push that is pretty nice so that you are not going to learn all the controls for long. Also there are tutorials that makes learning easy.I recommend just to try this game. If you do not like it what I doubt about anyway you can refund it. BUT This Game IS MustToTry.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Really good game I must say. One of the best ones I have played actually so I am not going to start listing every single reason why this game is good instead I am going to list all the flaws. Becomes not so much fun after 1 2 hours of gameplay (without friends). Has very limited game types. You can not actually play with your friend in a public match where you are the killer and your friend survivor. Needs some offerings add ons perks and characters to be stabilize. Lack of options in Graphics setting. Inability to obtain skins for all the characters.And I must say that ranking system is straight up copied from hearthstone's. And recently I got this error occuring ''DX 11.0 level required to run the engine''. I have fully compitable graphics card and I had played the game even before the error. I have been waiting for updates to kill the issue but no luck so far.

review: Product received for free. From what I played on the free weekend. The game is immensly fun but as with any asymetric (4v1) game it can feel totally unfair when your opponent(s) just seem to be way more skilled than you. As a Killer you'll get survivors who know every loop trick and stunt in the game and will lead you in circles the entire match. As a Survivor you'll pull your hair out in frustration as The Pig traps all your allies and nobody can find the Hex Ruin totem(a special perk for the killer that makes it nearly impossible for survivors to complete their generators until they destroy the totem) .However the game isn't so much skill based as it is luck based. The maps are semi randomly generated so you could turn a corner at the start of the match while running from the killer and find yourself at a dead end. Flipside the map can generate tons of loops pallets and windows for survivors to lead you around with.Still if you just want to play for the thrill of hiding from a Killer or murdering helpless survivors you can 100% get that experiance in your first 10 hours before any kind of "meta" sinks into your head.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Hey community personally I'd recommend this great lan game online multiplayer. Decent community better on the killer side of things because they don't teabag quit dc even if they don't get what they want. Survivor community however is 50/50. Survive with friends by far most toxic community. I'm a killer main and I've gone against a 4 man group who did nothing but play like Climb the rank and I'm sure you'll find out what I mean. TLDR game is great aside my two concerns. I'd recommend picking it up really cheap too on sale! But this review is to at least help the community see what it has become since the DLC release.Anyway my main two issues with the game is the unbalanced DLC and the somewhat garbage customer service First off I can attest to the DLC being completely unbalanced. I'm a killer main but I play with a friend and boy those Freddy matches were horrible. Yes Freddy might be the best Killer for SWF groups but it's not fun for duo or solo players. The dude's got xray vision on you if you're out of his terror range and this is without having to use a perk. He speeds up as more generators get finished with a perk. He also blocks the exit gates with another. Like man did they think about counter play when they made this guy? Flashlights are rendered ineffective because most likely you can't see his face. He's outdoing the Wraith's invisibility and Michael Myers jumpscare capability. In the dream world there is no way to wake up other than have another player with you or fail skill checks which by the way still reveals your position. Even after that he can still put you back to sleep. Some balancing ideas let the survivors have a wake up mechanic similar to the snap out of it with the doctor.Or incorporate levels of sleep ie drowsy sleep deep sleep (unable to wake).Or survivors wake up when they get tagged. Or sleep has a timer.Or sleep has a short cooldown before being able to put someone back to sleep immediately after waking up.Or remove the aura reading from Freddy if he pulls someone into the dreamworld but hearing is amplified (this can separate great Freddys to decent ones).Or increase the number of skill checks when you're asleep. Or remove being able to see survivors outside terror radius I feel like this one broke it the most. Or as my friend suggested make Freddy an event Killer (availability only during certain events).Second line of issue everybody knows this and I'm not the only one. They have garbage customer services. Bots answering for them and telling you they're working on it. But days weeks months later nothing. I lost my progress twice now. Once on a level 15 Nurse and level 15 Jake. I actually didn't mind when this happened because I thought that's how rank resets worked. But then it happened again Level 30 something David and Level 45+ Huntress all down the drain. This is where I almost quit the game. It is super frustrating I was on a crappy connection but I didn't think that was supposed to be an issue though. I know people have had it worse and have not had their things returned for months. Mine's ongoing for nearly a month now but yeah 60+ hours just disappears that easily.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: This used to be a negative review then it became positive and now it is negative again.Dead By Daylight where to start?Plenty of game breaking bugs lack of anti cheat system or cheater reporting mechanics and then banning people for giving liks to cheater profiles really?New game features are all very nice and such except in some cases they push the players to certain boring tactics. Left alone against the killer with Ruin and a bunch of traps around the generators? Just hide and play for time even if he catches you in 15 minutes or so you get Iridiscent Evader and a pip.And now instead of fixing their old stuff and streamlining gameplay they add microtransactions and even MORE content? (which is in fact a new map new killer and survivor) New cash only currency also happens to be non tradeable between players. Bravo! Greed wins common sense loses.The drive to make things unlockable via gameplay is commendable but it turns out you can only do so for very few characters which kinda ruins whole idea. Why did I buy the Doctor DLC back then so that other people may unlock it without spending cash now?I used to be happy to play this game and even more so when they fixed bugs but I got nothing for this game or devs now but contempt.If it weren't for my friend who's a huge fan of the franchise I'd remove the game from my hard drive right now. And I regret spending money on this game too I would rather give them to DE in Warframe they at least fix game breaking bugs overnight instead of taking months to do it.The game is dying it needs love not money. Sure you can buy it but get far enough in it and you should understand what I'm talking about.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: I won't give this a bad review because this game is extremely fun when you get in a balanced match with no lag. Some matches can get really intense and it's an all around exhilarating experience. Othertimes you get matches that are too lop sided and you either get killed right away escape without any trouble kill everyone with no struggle or kill no one.And that's just when the game's working correctly. There are other much more severe problems. You have disconnects that happen at least 60% of the time in my experience. You have lag that will completely ruin the game. You have infinite loading screens that require task manager to exit you have loading screens that take minutes to load likely because the game is waiting for a response from someone who disconnected. You have random game crashes (This is rare) or random disconnects and instant victories or defeats. Even if that all works there are clipping glitches and other issues in the game itself that has nothing to do with latency.All in all they really really really need to fix this game. Fix the networking issues and fix the matchmaking and this is a 9/10 game. In its current state though I'd give it a 6/10 because of how inconsistent the matches are.

review: Salted eggs are normally brined duck eggs. Chinese people use them to make moon cakes 月餅 glutinous rice dumplings (粽子) and many other dishes. Some families I know like to steam salted eggs that go with congee for breakfast.In my good old days salted duck eggs are often sold covered in a thick layer of salted charcoal paste. Nowadays the producers might know how to do marketing and give the humble salted eggs a nicer presentation. The salted duck eggs I come across here recently almost have the salted paste removed wrapped in plastic or vacuum packed. The best salted eggs should have a briny aroma translucent egg white with the yolk bright orange red in colour. The yolk that releases oil after being cooked is considered as a high quality product.Sadly here in Australia it s quite hard to find fresh duck eggs yet it s much easier to get some cooked ones. Weird isn t it? If any fresh duck eggs put on rack for sale in any Asian grocery stores they would be gone very quickly.As I have been missing and craving this homey food very much I brined a dozen and then cooked several traditional Chinese dishes with the salted eggs. Would you like to know what dishes I cooked? I'll post them in a series later on.I was glad to hear that Penny of Addictive and Consuming and Trix of Tasty Trix would host an International Egg Incident Party. Lucky enough I can manage myself to participate this time. Here in this post I share an easy way to make salted eggs at home. This time I used chicken eggs. If you can find fresh duck eggs that s even better. But I found the end result of using chicken eggs was very satisfied. This recipe was tested for many times. Not long before I shared this recipe with my Chinese readers all salted egg lovers were fascinated and many of them tried it on the next day they read my recipe with satisfied outcomes. Here s a picture of my fan's salted egg. She shared her joy with me when she successfully made some delicious salted eggs.Homemade Salted Eggs Ingredients 12 duck eggs (or chicken eggs)1 cup sea salt (or rock salt)4 cups water1 tbsp Shaoxing wine1 star anise2 tsp Sichuan peppercornsMethod Rinse the eggs and drain well. Set aside.Put water and salt in a saucepan. Add star anise and Szechwan peppercorns. Bring it to a boil. Once the salt completely dissolves turn off the heat. Let cool completely.Pour in the wine and stir well.Use a clean glass container carefully arrange the eggs in the container. (Note check every egg to make sure there are no cracks on it.) Pour salted water into the container and cover the eggs. You ll notice some eggs above would float to the surface so place something like a little sauce plate on top of the eggs. The basic idea is to get all eggs submerse completely in the brine. Tightly cover the container and place at room temperature. The brining process normally takes 30 to 40 days. Label the start and finish dates on the container to remind yourself. (I used google calendar to set an email alert to myself.) After 30 days take one egg out to cook and see if its taste is salty enough. If not let the rest to brine for a few days more. If you re satisfied drain all eggs out and wipe dry. Keep them in an egg carton and place in fridge. The salted eggs can be kept for a few weeks in fridge.Notes Before placing the eggs in the container do make sure all the eggs are not broken or have any cracks.If you don t have star anise and Sichuan peppercorns you can replace with any tea leaves you like when cooking the salted water. The egg shells would look darker infused by the fragrance of the tea you used.The egg yolks would turn orange red beautifully because of the effect of adding Shaoxing wine.

review: My feelings on this game are love/hate and I've installed and uninstalled it several times. It's great at reeling you in with it's unique premise but ends up being an overly frustrating and often toxic experience.The core idea of this game is so solid which is what always ends up drawing me back. Asymmetrical pvp is always a interesting concept and expanding on that by having a singular killer and several survivors makes for a really fun mix.The problems arise as the initial excitement ends and you get into the meat of the game First the grinding in this game is unbelievable for a game that isn't somehow F2P/P2W. It's achingly slow and doesn't carry over between characters in any meaningful way. However your rank (used for matchmaking purposes) remains between characters so good luck trying to play a new killer with no items and no perks matched up against four top tier survivors. To be clear I appreciate a good progression system. But this is so needlessly grindy that it's not fun. Every game has cheesy mechanics. Things that work in a way that seemingly go against the way the game was designed but work (albeit generally not that well). They're generally good for a laugh often catching the other players by surprise but not much more than that. This game is built on cheese. It's an underground base in a moon made of cheese. The most effective mechanics are completely contrary to the theme of the game. I realize that this approaches dangerous territory in regards to how the game "should" be played. But when the best tactics for survivors involve standing in front of the survivor so he can't move around (body blocking) running in circles where the killer can't follow effectively (pallet loops) and other similar tactics you have to wonder if that was really the intention when this game was conceived. Survivors can't even hide effectively with one of the newer killers he literally just creates an AOE as he walks around that pings everyone. It's not completely without fun but it's definitely not anything like what I expected.The nail in the coffin is always the toxicity for me. Everyone thinks you should play the game in a certain way and you will get flamed post match at least 1/3 of the time if not more often. Should you just shrug this off and enjoy the game? Yes. But does it make you want to come back and continue playing? Not particularly.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: It's hard to recommend this game to friends...Especially when I can't join a lobby with them. At the moment the game seems unfinished and grasping on the hopes of people's expectations for them to add a working party system. The problem with this is I can't review parts of a game that have not been released so...As for now I will do the pro's and con's list of the released portions of the game PRO'S Fun multiplayer Expansive perk/loot system Rewarded for working with teammates Challanging and refreshing gameplay experience. Instant matches as a SurvivorCONS Lack of a party system Lack of a matchmaking balancing system Problematic for new players to be anywhere close to the same level as experienced players. What I mean by this is that of course you will have an advantage by playing the game more but in this game the disadvantage is far too great to make it fun for a new player. Toxic Community. Again during my 3 4 hours played I experienced some of the most hateful and mean people I've ever played with. Be prepared to be called 'baddie' or 'scrub' for simply not being a level 5+ character or above. Leveling individual characters. I can understand leveling Killers and leveling survivors but each character in each category? This is simply to add more of a grind feeling to the game and it actually distances me from the game. Wait times as a Killer. I've tried the killer 3 times and it took me 10+ minutes for each time I played. This is unacceptable in a game released in 2016.THE VERDICT While this game exemplifies some amazing and refreshing new gameplay the problems with it's matchmaking and balancing simply make the game unenjoyable past the first hour of the game.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: This game is . But it's a so delicious and addictive that soon you will be browsing the scat categories in adult websites just by influence of this game.The game is broken in so many ways. Both for the killer and for the survivors. Experienced players will make fun of you. Teabaging you infiniting you camping you. Bugs will make you so angry. Some matches will disconnect and you'll be wondering why the hell you spent your money in a game with no polish at all. But then you'll remember that in a long time you haven't had this amount of fun in any other game. You'll remember the matches you and your friends laugh the hell out your chests making the killer hella salty in the lobby after the game. Remember that time you found a famous streamer playing as killer and you and your friends put 4 brand new parts and made the streamer curse the game and almost cry LIVE in front of 2000 viewers laughing at him. You'll remember that awesome match when you and your buddies played the perfect game running saving unhooking banging the killer all the way. You'll remember his cry and that will made you love this game. You'll love this game besides those horrible things i said in the beginning of this review because this game is SO MUCH FUN. These things i've said in the beginning are what make this game so good. Please devs. Don't fix this game. We love this game as it is. We want infinities! We want sprint burst and overpowered strikes! We want Overpowered grasp and NOED! Please don't let us down just to please loud pretenders with 10 played hours of DBD. They are not the audience of your game WE ARE! 10/10 this is good!

That hurts the survivor more than the killer as the lag will killed you as you won't know where you will be and it will seems as if you're teleporting. This often results in you running into a wall waiting for the killer to hit you. It seems that the bugs and glitches that are "fixed" keep popping back up. They don't get fixed well as the devs only make sure that you can't reach that bug or glitch. However with every patch or update they appear again.

review: Product received for free. (i tried the game during the free trail and haven't spent a dime on it)to sum my review in a nutshell this is a game of hide and seek mixed with cat n mouse escapes you fix things in order to escape the big scary killer. most of these killers have thier abilites some seem balanced while others are just unfair. here are the good things about the game teamwork is useful and is needed (although few players help eachother out and decide to solo it) it can be fun at times when being chased or hiding from the killer the menu music has a nice jingle doesn't require alot of horse power to run on ultrabut the bad things oh my camping killers who stay near the hook when you are hanged (including targeting killers who go after one person) game crashing or freezing on the loading screen. killer's abilities (invisibility) repetative gameplay unhelpful teammates (happens a lot) faulty installation of filesnow i may have only played the game for 2 3 hours in total but that is because this game crashed on me so many times on attempted playthroughs its a big joykiller. i was thinking about purchasing the game before the free trial but this isn't worth my money. its a decent horror/slasher game but the constant crashing has to be fixed.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Pros +General idea of the game and atmosphere is really cool+Good impelementation of 4v1 asymetric multiplayer (1 killer vs 4 survivors)+Killer plays in 1st person whereas survivors in 3rd person which contributes to the immersion+Price of the base game and dlcs is cheap+Devs somewhat listen to the players and interact with them even though sometimes they don't make any senseNeaturals *Simple gameplay easy to learn but really hard to master especially if you're a brand new survivor you'll have a really hard time in the beginning until you get your strong perks. Killer is a lot easier to start with.*Every single multiplayer game community has both toxic and nice players this game is pretty much the same. You'll play vs/with both types. Nothing too special here.Cons Balance of the game significantly changes with each major patch (Especially after the nurse dlc The Last Breath Chapter balance took a really big hit imo) Fairly common game breaking day 1 bugs that still in the game and every patch breaks something while fixing another issue Persisting FPS issues since day 1 haven't been fixed yet. Killer FPS is generally lower than survivor and some maps are really problematic Game doesn't have satisfying amount of customization options for both sides(killer and survivor) but every now and then streamers and special events get exclusive items which you have to beg from streamers or pay 300 400 USD on ebay if you want them which is infruatingDo I recommend the game?Currently Not.Edit Spelling and grammar errors.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: My girlfriend loves this game and I liked the look of it also. I gave it a try and enjoyed the gameplay with the thrill of chasing down your intended victims. I immediately lost heart when i began to encounter the vast swathes of cheaters. They seem to possess abilities that enable them to unhook themselves as soon as placed take 3 hits from a weapon with no signs of damage or even slowing down. They have to address this issue and perhaps I will play the game again in the future.Perhaps a way to report cheaters would help this game. The anti cheat system that installed recently doesn't seem to have stopped them. Pros Game graphics improved optimisation interesting game mechanics big online populationCons easy for people to cheat slow load times but they are improving UI is overly simple (opinion not fact)I will change my review when the devs fixed my main issue.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Is the game fun solo? Certainly.Is the game 2spooky4me? Probably not it loses its 'horror' after about 20 hours.Playing with friends? Hilarious fun and shenanigans.Is it worth $20? A low killer ...... ahhhh..... as my 700 hrs experience says camping win whatever.The game is so toxic for me and yeah I didn't even mention bugs in it.Pls developer firx your game work on it new killers and maps aren't so important if your game is broken. review: I recommend this game to people who are looking for a somewhat new idea to play while keeping a competitive mindset while playing or even just normal play. Dead by Daylight definitely has its flaws but its still not finished and the developers actually listen to the community. It may seem like updates are coming out a bit slow but its hard work making a game. The game is very fun to play especially when playing with friends however sometimes playing with friends can be frustrating due to the matchmaking system being a flawed. It can be very hard playing as a survivor at first but thats what makes it fun trying to get better at the game and the same can be said about the killer however I find playing as the killer easier. Of course everyone has different opinions and such so if you actually are interested in the game watch gameplay and make sure this is a game youre willing to put $20 on before getting it and being disappointed. When I first played this game I was instantly addicted but again not everyone has the same experience.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Overall it's a pretty fun game but here is the break down.Graphics 8/10 Looks pretty damn good not the most amazing in the world but overall better than a lot from other indie companies.Gameplay 9/10 and 2/10 9/10) This requires some explaining. Most matches are fun mostly fair and pretty intense but you usually do not feel cheated. Sometimes you're team fails you and just leaves you to die sometimes you do the same...which is all fine and good. 2/10) The matches that aren't good are...really really bad. You either end up with the wraith as the killer and it plays some intense levels of t and is extremely OP wouldn't be so bad if they either nerfed the Wraith's invisibility power made it take longer to attack after appearing or turned off collision with the Wraith (there have been times where I have been squeezed between a generator and the Wraith when it decides to appear right next to me and I cannot flee). The Other thing that makes some matches absolute horrible is...killers that puppy guard when you're on the hook. I get that it is a tactic but it should be a tactic they are punished for. Losing points etc etc because puppy guarding definitely does not please the "Entity" if hiding survivors annoy it (An update made it that if you hide too long the "Entity" does things to reveal your location). Basically this poor portion of the review would be negated if they punished killers for Guarding people on the hooks thus negating a large portion of the Alturism tree of points for survivors. And if the Wraith recieved a major nerf on it's invisibility options. The Hillbilly can run into walls and miss entirely with the chainsaw the Trapper's traps can be sabotaged but nothing can with the Wraith.Overall 9/10 IF they fix some of the problems in the future.Suggestions Nerf the Wraith Punish Puppy Guarding Killers with point loss or something. Or best idea of all implement a ban system like similar games have done where the other players can disallow specific Killers/Monsters that way newer players are not being absolutely destroyed by the Wraith. Also please for the love of all that is right make it easier to get off the hooks...in my whole time playing in the beta and the official I never once managed to get off the hook with my own power.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: If you enjoy having lag issues due to the killers ping this game is for you. Be it if they are a million miles across the world or simply due to their bad internet connection. From the makers calling camping a tactic and giving no real penalty toward the killers for doing so to spending a little too much time just to find a lobby with a decent ping. If by chance you manage to find one most of the killers bail out due to SWF. Game updates almost every two weeks just for another issue to arise.And to top it all off basement blocking. This game has been out for how long? When you make it so a killer can completely block you off on the stairs to the basement with no way of being able to get through....well then why even attempt at saving anyone down there. Good luck to those that can put up with all of this. I sure hope someone finds this helpful in the least.

review: Essentially Dead by Daylight is a 4v1 game in which survivors try to escape and the killer well of course tries to kill them. I saw gameplay of Dead by Daylight and was instantly interested as I'm sure most would be. However I thought it was a Halloween game based around Michael Myers. But it's not which is absolutely fine because I can still play as Michael Myers. There are several great things about this game and it seems to be updated often making me think that the developers intend to keep their game alive and well.I recommend this game to anybody looking for a smart thrilling game that provides urgency. I especially suggest horror film fans mostly of slashers purchase this game and its Halloween Chapter DLC. Of the time I've played I've had a blast and intend to play much more. I'm sure many people will thoroughly enjoy Dead By Daylight.

review: With BHVR purchasing the rights to the game and the most recent iniative to balance the game I do have to say that they've done a very good job at fixing many of the issues for both sides. There is still a long way to go but right now the future is looking far brighter. For that I have to change my score.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Its been over 2 years since this games first release... Tons of DLC being brought out Tons of new content and tons of reworked content.To be quite quick in this review yes this game is incredibly fun in fact I play it all the time. I don't see any reason to not have this. If you're wondering about the mixed reviews this game has now there was recently a patch that brought more power to the killer's side and took a lot of it away from the survivor. Being able to use really powerful perks twice in a row during a chase is not fun which is what the patch fixes.Also a very famous youtuber/streamer OchiDO got hardware banned because of his incredibly high amounts of toxicity and use of exploits. A good move on the Devs parts we were all pretty much waiting for it.Again this game is not abandoned. It's stil very much alive. Although theres some toxicity in it I still very rarely see it. Reddit is hilarious with the memes and the devs do try hard in order to make the game a fun and welcoming environment.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: update I love the mid chapter update. The negative reviews are from survivor mains who most likely ran around teabagging the killer and thinking they were actually good at video games. Now instead of running across the map using flashlights 24/7 and instantly repairing generators survivors will actually have to put on their thinking caps and perhaps hide from a killer much like if you were in a horror movie. I play survivor as well and most of the time the players are toxic while the devs have been working on combatting their behavior with a new emblem system and now making some of the perks more strategic. This game is constantly updated and always getting better. The Devs have a vlog where they address features and are very transparent when it comes to the game. It's been a while since there has been a multiplayer game I can simply lose hours in and this is that game. You can play as either the killer or the survivors. Survivors play in 3rd person and the killer plays in 1st person. Survivors and killers each get 3 unique perks and eventually you can teach the perks to other survivors. Each killer has a unique ability such as throwing hatchets or charging with your chainsaw. Prestiging cosmetics and events keep the game engaging and rewarding. Survivors run around the map activating generators to power the exit gate and escape while the killer has to hunt survivors down and hook them to win. It's hard to describe how much fun this is so go and do yourself a favor and buy this game.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: I have been following the game for a little time. I have watched streams about it so I finally picked it up. It was kinda balance and fun to play. Not all things felt balanced but I learned to deal with the small issues.The game has four survivors which objective is to repair the generators open the exit door to escape. The killer's objective is to kill the survivors and make sure they don't get out. Killers of cause have some tools to make sure the survivors doesn't escape with ez mode.The recent patch made alot of survivors rage and go riot. I don't understand that behavior since it's so small change. Exhaustion perks got a nerf hit which it is not a big deal. Just use it with caution. To survive is SUPPOST to be a challenge.Two killers got a buff to which is needed because now you got a chance to face other than Hillbilly and Nurse all the time. Is it so bad? In my opinion this is the right step the devs has taken and I look forward to see what else they have planned.Beware the community can be really toxic my suggestion is just ignore the toxic players. Pay them no mind.It will remain recommend it for now since devs finally are trying to balance the game. Have fun the fog.Sorry for my English. It's not my first language.

review: just don'tnow when i got it it seemed like a FANTASTIC game that i could play oh it was such a interesting change from what i normally did! a 4v1 to help me get over evolve actually getting that whole feel of adrenaline or whatever else came with the game that had the word "horror" stamped on itgodi was a complete jackass now the problem is with all this is simply that there's one core element to this game that drives the whole reason why we play it and of course why its failing horribly the killers. or lack thereof. now as a killer your gonna spend more time screaming "WHAT THE " and wondering why in gods name you spent your money on this sinking ship that looked seaworthy but ran into an iceberg rather than having this maniacal look as you chop down survivors and sacrifice them to your hardly explained god now fair warning this is a opinion fueled by the bad times with this game and the fact that the steam refund system sucksstarting with the fact that no one wants to play killer"but why don't people wan't to play as the killers! they're powerful or whatever can't they whack those peons where they show??" yeaaaah but here's the thing you can have more fun playing as a monster in evolve (fun fact game that is no longer being updated is much more fun than this) than you do playing killer now you have 5 killers to pick from but since i have spent so little time with this i only played 3. the only thing really setting these people apart are movement speed and abilities and by god you need to be about as inescapable as the Blair witch to even stand a chance of WINNING as a killer to begin with which further supports why the que times suck. no one wants to play as a killer if its absolute hell to do so now when you do get to play it's honestly the most fun you'll oh did i say fun well fun if your a SURVIVORas a killer it makes learning how to play as one hell since the survivors are either A invisible or hidden far too well to be seenB turning engines on and disappearing into oh so magical mists as soon as you investigateC waiting at the exit to taunt you one last time as you hit them because apparently there's auto revive at the exit. joyous.its so mind numbing and aggravating to even start playing as a killer to even get the idea of playing it more after that. not to mention how most of the abilities don't seem to work for you hell a BLINK can fail you more times than once because the nurse apparently gets seizures from doing so and staggers as soon as she gets out of teleportation causing you to flail around like a moron yelling "where is he! he was right there!!". not to mention all those goddamned PALLETS. this is such a filthy and disgusting part of this poor excuse of a game that i cringe whenever i actually see one of these as a survivor. its a get out of jam free card and it is ALWAYS beneficial to use a pallet killer on your tail? PALLETkiller seen? RUN AROUND THE PALLET killer just doing anything in general? PALLETi'm amazed they dint make a function to chuck the damn things at the killers yet now as a SURVIVOR on the other hand this game is somewhat enjoyable that is of course your a troll who loves nothing more than ing about with the many issues of this game rather than actually playing the game the way its oh whats that?that's how all survivors play?well damn to be honest as a survivor at a high enough rank its not very challenging. the killer is normally almost always on tilt flailing about as you slink away without a problem pallets always have your back the killer is always further on tilt since you freed a survivor from the clutches of a hook 4 times already you have a back up hatch for when the time calls and you of course always look forward to waiting at the exit to say "MISSED ME JACKASS" as the killer lets a rage fueled charge for you as you run into the mist as the killer is given a disgraceful defeat this is the gamethis is ALL you ever do and nothing morethat's my basic honest to god opinion on the game anyway. waiting sucks no one wants to play the class that people bought the game for anyway and your gonna end up being a survivor main now go ahead and spend your 20 bucks if you have any faith left in this or the developers which i have lost long agoorrrrrrrrrr spend it on this instead http //store.steampowered.com/app/481510/now i know what your thinking "is this a link to night in the woods?"yes it isdo i expect you to get the game?of course not just offering a better use of 20 dollarsanyways have fun.

review: Matchmaking system has to be improved killers and survivors have to be matched according to a short range between ranks. How is a ranked 1 killer matched against a bunch of ranked 20s survivors or vice versa fair? Survivors getting caught and intentional disconnecting resulting in a loss of points for the killers and killers disconnecting if he or she felt that the game is on a losing end for him eg. Better skilled survivors getting generators online faster than the killer could find them.When survivors searches for games in the lobby it always bugs out and players have to keep retrying to search for games and when we do we encounter killers that lags. No doubt it's a fairly new game bugs and glitches are understandable.After ranting so much I still recommend this game.Although the negative trumps over the positive but give the game a go it is still enjoyable to a extend. I will still continue playing Dead by Daylight I still see potential in this game becoming way better than it is in it's current state.Dead by Daylight is one of those games that you really hate and rant because of problems it has now but you just can't stop playing because in some sense it's really fun.Devs really has to address this common issues that majority players are having problems with.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: I was sceptical at first but it proved better than I thought. It combines both singleplayer elements and multiplayer without making it unbalanced in gameplay. I prefer singleplayer games which naturally makes me suitable to play as the killer where you only rely on yourself. If you are into co op you should consider playing as the survivors although I haven t yet played survivor I d imagine it is very similar to the left 4 dead . Which mean you sometimes partner up with people of different experience and that will be your downfall for your chances of surviving are considerably reduced if you lose one of your people. However a skilful team against a noob killer will make it very hard for the killer to capture them. Still calling on my experience as a GM it is enjoyable to be able to apply pressure to the players and make them work together. It is one of those games that enable you to meet people and add them to your friend list.

review: While there will be matches that frusterate the matches that go really well will make up for them. When you can't quite decide to get into a long/deep game and are looking for something to tide you over this is a great game to fill that niche. Generally speaking the game features short (10 30) minute matches. You'll try to quietly find generators to repair whilst continuously looking over your shoulder for the proverbial (and litteral) axe to drop. This game is definitely dark as far as games go but the simplicity behind the game makes the mechanics that much more enjoyable. You can play for a long time and never fully learn the depths of this game's deceptive mechanics.

review: Play both sides of the Classic Slasher genre! Sacrifice peons to the great Entity! Let your friends hang on a hook while you fix generators so you can escape!A very fun and unique game marred by several issues on launch. They did a great job patching all the issues from Beta and I'm sure they'll fix these new issues.Currently the major problem and the thing everyone is complaining about in reviews is that you can't join as groups. I think this was intended because the ability to coordinate outside of the game is extremely powerful. Therefore you can only play in a full private game or not at all. This has resulted in people joining lobbies checking for their friends and then leaving. Over. And over. And over. The side effect of this is that basically games take forever to start.I still recommend this game just don't get it yet if all you want to do is play with friends. Because you can't. And please stop trying you're ruining it everyone.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Dead by Daylight is certainly a lot of fun with friends. However when I play the game on my own I dont get even near the amount of enjoyment as I would playing the game with a friend. You can either pick to play as a survivor or a killer. When you are the survivor your job is to find and activate FIVE generators (depending on how many survivors there is the number of generators that you have to activate will decrease.) which will then alow you to open a giant gate so you can escape. Therefore winning the game. However if one survivor makes it out that does not mean the rest of the survivors make it out with you. The remaining survivors will have to find the gate that you have opened so they can escape also. However you dont necessary have to activate all FIVE generators. There is a trap door which is hidden in every map and if you find the trap door then you can escape immediately without having to activate any generators. However the downside is that the game developers have updated the game so every time you spawn into the map the trap door will never be in the same place. Making it of course very hard to find. The killers job is of course to try and stop the survivors from escaping by killing them. At the moment there are only 3 killers you can play as. Each killer has a diffrent ability that they can use to hunt the survivors. The first killer you can play as is called "Trapper" and his ability is to lay down bear traps. The killer himself can also get trapped in his own bear traps however he can escape in 3 seconds. The second killer is called "Wraith" and his special ability is to go invisable. Which of course makes it very hard for the survivors to see him until it is too late. The invisabilty also makes him also very quite and what I mean by that is this.....When you play as the survivor if a killer gets near you your heart beat increases and gets louder. Telling the player playing as the survivor to hide or otherwise your going to get ed by the killer and lose the game. But when you play as Wraith you can not attack survivors whilst invisable which means you have to decloak to kill. The last killer you can play as is the least popular one where his special ability is a chainsaw but it is very hard to control and use effectively to kill. Moving on now. Playing with 4 or less friends will mean its going to take forever for the bloody game to find a match. Most of the time when you are playing with 4 or less friends you just keep pressing the ready button because each time it cant find a match it resets everyone to "not ready". Its like the game doesnt even really try to find a match. The game says "searching for match" then less than 2 seconds later is says "failed to find match". Its like "Come game put some ing effort into finding a match will ya!?" This is the biggest flaw at the moment and hopefully in the next patch or two this will have been fixed. Because like I have said at the start of me writing this review. The game is most fun when playing with friends. So my verdict for this game at the moment is........6/10. This game does show real potential and is really good fun when it finds a bloody match. So the sooner they fix that issue the better.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Personally I love this game. It's one of my favourite games. (Yes I'm Canadian). Dead by Daylight is a horror game. It's a multiplayer versus game. How it works is that there is 4 survivors trying to escape from a killer. The killers objective is to sacrafice all 4 survivors. The survivors objective is to work together to escape the place you are stuck in. The objective is that you have to repair and fix 5 generators. Those generators will power the main gates which you will then half to open to actually escape. While you are doing this there is a killer that witnesses every mistake you do. Don't screw up. Work together. Stay alert Stay alive. I rate this game a solid 10/10 for it's huge creativity and caring updates.

review: Honestly With the nerf to a certain set of perks (Exhaustion) The game is much more balanced then its ever been in my opnion and this comes from a survivor main. Ive played a decent ammount of killer and survivor and let me tell you that if someone tries to tell you that its heavily against one side then thats either old information or they are very biased. The gameplay itself is addictive as all hell and most definitly worth your money if youve ever played and enjoyed a game like it before. This game is what Friday the 13th should be but it doesnt just focus on the single killer like that game does. Each killer is fun maybe not on par with one another but still fun to play as all the same. The Devs do a Q&amp A on reddit every week and the reddit also has a "No Stupid Questions" day where theyll answer anything you could want to ask. All and all this game is making good progress and i hope to see it get even better than what it is now. Buy it and Welcome to the Fog!

review: I have a couple of hours logged on this game now so I thought I would leave a first impressions review.This game is great. The concept is great and the delivery is great. It brings me to mind of all those 70s 80s and 90s horrors which are so copied today but never bettered. Friday the 13th is the most obvious example. In this game you play as either a survivor or a psycho killer. The job of the survivors is to activate generators which power an exit. Once enough of the generators are powered it becomes a mad rush to the exit before the killer picks you off. As the killer your job is simple. Incapacitate the survivors and sacrifice them to the sky portal on various hooks dotted around the world. I believe that the locations of the generators and the hooks are random each time but of that I am unsure. There are a few problems with this game which I noticed straight away and are mostly to do with balance. It is simply too easy as the Killer. You move faster than the survivors are able to hear them when they work on the generators (this is visually represented by an icon) and there are too many hooks around the world. These things overpower the Killer and not in a fun way. Yes the killer should be difficult but not to the point where it is unfun to play as the killer because it is simply a walk in the park. You want players to relish both otherwise there will come a point when being a survivors outnumber killers and finding a lobby will be even harder than it already is. My advice would be to remove some of the hooks maybe only leave the basement hooks so that the killer must return to his lair and protect it from survivors who make rescue attempts. At the moment it is far to easy for the killer to be mobile all over the place. He can down a survivor hang them on a hook and still have time to reach a generator before a survivor activates it. If hooks were not so close at hand it would also make the whole escape mechanic whereby you must wiggle LS in order to struggle free a worthwhile addition. At the moment it is impossible to escape unless the killer takes his sweet time on purpose. Another addition that is much needed is for there to be many more different types of hiding place. At present there are only out of place looking cupboards but trash cans dumpsters and whatnot would add some variety and force the killer into looking more. Those are just some suggestions. Other than that the game is great and I am sure more tweaks are coming.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Dead by Daylight ReviewOverviewDead by Daylight is a 4v1 Horror game. 4 survivors 1 killer. There are now 4 choosable killers from the 'last breath' free update. There are also 5 selectable survivors. Survivors are launched into the map in thirdperson while the killer is in first person. Each killer has a special skill. The Trapper has a bear trap that can be placed. The Wraith may turn invisible but has a bell sound turning it on and off. The Hillbilly has a deathly chainsaw charge. Finally the Nurse has a 'blink' ability allowing her to teleport in a straight line. Each survivor and killer has a unique upgrade system but I will not go too much into detail in this review. GameplayThe gameplay in Dead by Daylight is truely unique. When you spawn in as a survivor your objective is to escape the map. To do this you must find generators and turn them on. You must hold left click while having short timed moments where you must press space in the white. If you do this incorrectly a loud explosion occurs and it attracts other survivors and of course the killer. When all 4/5 generators are completed the 2 gate openings will open. This takes a while but opens a gate to escape. If you are the last survivor alive a trap door will open randomly on the map. You can quickly jump into this and escape. The killer as I said before is in first person giving him a slight disadvanage. To know if the killer is near a heartbeat soud effect will occur. The louder it is the closer the killer is to you. The only way the heartbeat sound does not take place is when The Wraith is invisible but you can see him and it takes around 4 seconds for him to become uninvisible. There are now 4 different maps in the game. Each map is different and takes time to learn. The killer needs 2 hits on you for you to go down. They will then pick you up and take you to a hook (You can wiggle out of his grasp if you are fast enough). A bar will then appear in your name which is your meter to live. Before the meter gets half drained you can attempt to escape. There is only a 10% chance of you escaping though. When the bar goes half down you must spam space to stay alive. Other survivors can save you from this hook. Items in the game can be found in crates or you can get them from upgrades in your survivor upgrade tree. The torch lasts 5 seconds by default and can immobolize the killer if they are holding another survivor (which will drop the survivor). The medkit can be used to heal teammates. The toolkit is used to sabotage hooks. There are other items but I don't know the full extent to them. Also around the map there are closets which you can hide in but they make a sound when you enter them so I wouldn't reccommend getting in them. There is also no communication between survivors so if your playing by yourself prepared to be frustrated worried and scared as hell.ConclusionDead by Daylight is a fun game for anyone out there. If your worried that the game is too scary it really isn't. If you have $20 to spare I would definetly reccomend this game.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: EDIT Community is great. Thou some may disagree.It's a truly fun game and one of the few I am actually good at.It's hilarious trying to outsmart your opponent.Some problems with the game is the overpowered survivor perks and overpowered killer perks. Not gonna go into details. Just know that starting new you are at a huge disadvantage but the effort pays off with time. DO NOT SWITCH CHARACTERS OFTEN!!!!!! Just learn to play one character at a time and level them up before you switch. It is 100 times easier to level up one character than have 10 low level characters in the same amount of time. A leveled up character wins more often.It is the only game I can say that the more you play the better it gets.One frustrating thing remains in that a killer that camps a survivor on a hook severly ruins game play. But that has become a rare occurance. And you'll see this is one of the few games ppl say "GG" and then wish you good luck in your next game. I love the community.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Not a perfect game but a whole hell of a lot of fun. I tend to play as the moster more often than the survivors but both sides have a good balance with a few exceptions. Some of the maps have "safe zones" areas with only one or two hooks and plenty of obstacles which are made increasingly difficult if one of the survivors has the sabotage perk. I understand that can happen with the randomization of the maps but it can ruin a game real quick. However the devs keep updating and fixing things and overall this game is fun and exciting. Will definitely keep playing and am looking forward to new content.

review: I've really enjoyed playing Dead By Daylight. Its really fun. There are problems with balance and the Meta perks are ridiculous for both survivor and killer. But every game feels different and plays different. I just choose not to use Meta perks and use just random perks to see what I can come up with. Its a really fun game. Give it a try when its on sale for sure.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: I may come back to write more later but thought I'd just quickly put down a very strong recommendation for this game. There's a bunch of frustrating stuff in there to do with other players but there's also a lot of really great things and the game itself is brilliant.4 survivors vs 1 killer and they have to repair generators open the exit gates and escape while trying to be stealthy escaping the killer and helping each other out. The killer roams around kicking generators and cutting up survivors before sticking them on hooks to sacrifice them. Works pretty well! Loads of perks and items lots of maps and characters. The game is updated and gets new content lots and it has my favourite take on a skill tree.If you don't own it it's well worth a go even if you don't normally like horror games. I never thought I'd like this sort of game and mainly picked it up to play it with someone. I'm very glad I did as it's turned into one of my favourite games. You're missing out on a really great time if you don't try it.To youto!
title: Dead by Daylight

I will recommend this game because it is fun but make sure you have a full group to play it with.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Product received for free. This game is tons of fun! Im assuming a large sum of the people writing negative reviews have never even leveled their killer or survivor past level 25. I say this because that is when you unlock the fourth and last perk slot and perks help a ton in this game. The first two days of playing this game was very hard as a survivor with only one perk iron will 1 I found myself dying a lot as other survivors had premonition 3 speed burst 3 and other very helpfull/NEEDED perks kept escaping and winning the match. Starting this game as a survivor is very hard but if youre able to persevere through and past rank 25 you will find yourself escaping more often and youll also learn a lot on how to juke and hide from the killer. As for the killer its a whole different story as the first two days of playing this game I was able to become a rank 10 killer with only one perk Iron Grasp 1. I kept finding and killing all four survivors every match. However do not hook camp as youll easily lose the game and hopefully even a pip. Im glad the developers encouage you to keep looking for survivors and not just kill one after another however many rank 20 killers dont know this and proceed to hook camp and ruin the game for the survivors by not even giving them a chance. This is another reason why it is so hard to start as a survivor because youre likely to have a match with a hook camper with a 1/3 chance.Overall 9/10 game for me it was just a really rough start all bugs aside I would recommend this game only to people that are willing to play a game that requires you to play ALOT before you actually get good skill and perk wise.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Product received for free. Ew.After your first game of winning as the survivor you've experienced basically everything you can as a survivior.Insanely long loading times sometimes.Trying to play in a lobby with 1 2 friends takes a long time.Overall not worth the buy.

review: I tell you...this game is just a masterpiece in my eyes. The concept of it just never gets old and there are various maps perks killers and survivors to unlock and level AND prestige (which comes with cool rewards). What makes this game so good is that every chase pallet stun 360 juke blind save close calls and everything possible can get your adrenaline pumping. Sure this game is hard to just buy and be good at it but I've had quite a bit of experience on my hands. What also makes it so great is if you hate surviving against an annoying killer then you can play that annoying killer and learn so much about ways to avoid that specific character. Or if you hate inifinites then play survivor. There are a variety of ways to play and win when it comes to this game (cough cough* unlike F13 The Game) it makes any match interesting.P.S I am still giving this game a good review even though my progress was resetP.P.S I got my progress back because of how great Behaviour is and was awarded 20 000 000 bps back
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Before you buy this game answer this?Are you sure you are going to be playing with your friends majority of the time in swf? Or are you going to fly solo. This game with friends is indeed the better choice as you can have laugh rage all together about the killer camping majority of the time. If you decide to play survivor majority of the time get ready for salty killers? And if you intend to fly solo as a killer its the same thing. There is salt everywhere in this game. But with the power of teamwork you can overcome with even greater salt. However this game is all about grinding at the moment. You would see YouTubers who have tier 3 perks in all 4 slots. But when you play you're gonna be starting. (unless you do kyf but im talking about grinding). It should maybe take two or three days tops to get your suitable perks but damn it takes forever. I'm still trying to get two more characters to level 50 and i havent even gotten to any killer (except trapper yeah i know survivor main here). If you play salty games like League of Legends (this is just an example) then be prepared for the worst because it ain't very different. If you fly solo everyone is more or less is fending for themselves. "oh but wait shiro what about flashlight saves and op medkits plays (ex syringe or stypic which is not op)."They are farming you. Getting points so they can "help" you out when in reality they are just trying to rank up. In conclusion if you start you better grind...hard. Because this game can be horrible when it comes to grinding and it becomes scary at first but just remember when you play over the course of the game your not gonna be scared like "OH ITS A WRAITH!!!! RUN!!!!!" Instead you are going to be like "uh oh guys its the wraith easy match" or "ugh im getting tunneled again stupid baby killer". You will hate this game at some point because devs are still fixing these issues but goodness it can be one sided these days.Anyways thats all i wanted to say thank you for reading and have a wonderful day or night )
title: Dead by Daylight

title: Dead by Daylight

review: This game is the ultimate fantasy of every horror fan out there. I just can't wait for the Dead by Daylight film and hope they don't muck it up that's how good this game is. It 100% deserves a movie.Traditional run of the mill games (random example Skyrim) will have me gritting my teeth because some areas are just creepy (What a wuss right?) but Dead by Daylight has me eagerly putting my best 'offering' forward running for the next generator anxiously wondering who the killer is and whether he's gonna GIT me or not. It's all a rollercoaster of excitement even for someone who's as chicken as I always was before this game conditioned me into thoroughly enjoying the thrill of horror.Well fleshed out characters with just the right amount of information you'd like for each survivor. Each killer unique to DbD has their own well written story as well with the right amount of depth provided.Aesthetically everything in this game looks beautiful actually it's not all grit and gore. The Entity can actually be beautfiul and poetic looking (as angsty as that sounds) and the writing isn't cheesy or over the top. The characters look like everyday normal people and are given options that enforce their own personal style.The gameplay is fun and filled with heart pounding anticipation. It does have bugs and a rare glitch or two getting stuck between trees on Lampkin Lane is never fun but you may have a killer or teammates that may recognize and help or hinder. It's all in the sport of it and it's fun either way. There are times where campers can be cringey (hey it's a strategy...I guess) or that skip lag is working in someone's favor...but as far as mp/co games are concerned you'll definitely spend more time having fun than being tilted.The DLC they release is always innovative I always find myself surprised with each release and it entices users to play. Their updates are usually filled with bug fixes or improvements/new features/aesthetic additions which is great for the gameplay and visuals alike.The community is mostly good. I've run into some poor sports some jerks but that's unavoidable nowadays. Nothing you can't report and nothing the next great match with potentially fun players can't fix. )I could go on and on about this game. Get it! Totally worth it.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Product received for free. After getting this on the free weekend I can say with certainty i did enjoy myself sure there are bugs and a lot of them but the onlly ones i ran into were around the main menu (couldn't join friends matches freezing etc which were all fixed by closing and reopening the game) ton of fun if you can grab three or four friends and pllay private matches or survive online together. Other than bugs the most annoying thing about this game was having to remake your friend lobbies after every match or leaving and creating a new lobby to switch who the killer is in your group.All in all a good game i could see myself paying the $15 dollar (Canadian) price for it.EDIT After coming back to the game from a long hiatus I remembered why i stopped playing in the first place the ridiculously over powered new killers. I don't want the game to be easy for survivors but it shouldnt be impossible. How is it fair as a survivor to have apparently infinite axes thrown across vast distances? Whats the point in pulling pallets down when they can just axe you from a distance. And why is it an option the kill the players with your weapon in the first place? That doesnt make the game fun for anyone it makes it one sided and ruins the rank of the survivors when they end the game with 2000 points.

review: Product received for free. Since this game was free at the time I had the opportunity to play the game as a ''trail.'' I started the game and played 2 games 1 as survivor and 1 as a killer. Both were intense and fun even for me who can't even sit on my own couch and watch a horror movie and hate jumpscares. I later found out my friend got home from work. I told him to download Dead by Daylight so he did. Once we both started the game up we had issues. We could not find a game and it was impossible to find one. After 10 minutes he just gave up. I tried right after he left it worked again. I played 3 games after that. 2 of the 3 I escaped successfully. To be honest this game has its ups and downs but for $20 I think it is totally worth it. If you are not into the horror scene this is a great starter introduction. For the gameplay it is VERY good. It is very well enjoyable if you are alone or if you have a full party of 5. The idea is unique and fun. Both sides survivor and killer are relatively equal. I would give this game a 8/10 for a great starting horror game. )
title: Dead by Daylight
