review: Amazing game! This is truly an amazing experience and packed with hours of fun! This is a 1v4 horror survival game where the killer must hunt down the 4 survivors as they repair generators to escape the killer's hunting ground. Pros Multiple killers/survivors to suit your killing/surviving play style Interesting Level Progression Web (The Blood Web) that's infinate Music and sounds are amazing and give the game a great vibe to it Gives off a really creepy atmosphear on every map Plenty of maps to play Kill your friends mode! (sorry if you don't have enough friends they are adding a fix for this!) Skill checks are easy but keep players alert and actually doing something besides clicking and waiting. Haven't seen a single hacker since launch (day 12 now? Will update later if needed)Cons Buggy as hell I excpected a lot less bugs since this just went through alpha and beta just ended but that's okay... every game has bugs they just need to get fixed... Must have a group of 5 to play with if you're inviting friends for it to be any fun ( this is being added in the next major patch ) Window jumpers... ONLY annoying when they are the last alive. Laggy characters/servers at times Alt+F4 to save your rank. Why? Are you that bad you can't get it back?Over all rating 8.5/10Overall If this game continues to get patched and updated with more killers maps survivors etc. it has the potential to stay an amazing game!
title: Dead by Daylight

review: M1 holding simulator. "The objective requires another M1 holding seesion. Lord Index finger will not be pleased!" In all seriousness this game is AMAZING!!!. You either play as one of four victims trying to escape the PSYCOPATHIC killer.... or as the killer himself. Each and everytime I enter a game as Dwight (on of the charecters) I always get this "victim" aura about me hiding behind walls trees and in bushes to make SURE I dont end up like the level 1 just did. Weither It be The Hillbilly's chainsaw Revving in the background stepping into one of the Trapper's bear traps or hearing The Wraith's (my least favorite to play against/ most favorite to play as!) cow bell as he turns INVISIBLE all these will send a chill down your spine as you hear them come from within heart beat racing distance as you try desperatly to finish that last generator so you can get the h*ll outta there!

review: What can I say about Dead by Daylight? I don't usually like horror games but this isn't your typical "just jumpscare escape the AI" type of horror game. The stories for each character really get you into their thoughts and feelings and you can customize each character you play based on your playstyle. Leveling up your survivor or killer is incredibly simple and can be rewarding. The game runs incredibly smoothly at least on my computer and has very eerie audio which makes you constantly on the edge of your seat. Usually you can find a lobby rather quickly to play with other people which is really nice and the community seems really friendly at least to me! Overall great purchase!Edit After a long time of playing the game it takes an incredibly long time at least for me to find a lobby when playing the Killer which turns me off from playing that side. There are also A LOT of connection issues to different lobbies when trying to find a game. However when you do find a game it is insanely fun! D

review: Its really complicated to review this gameOkay let's start with a good thingDead by Daylight has a great and unique concept of a game where 4v1 survival game with objective to survive alive or to kill 4 people if you played as killer. This game have a good graphics and really interesting to play because every killer or item and perks you used have different skill and function and really helps your objective in some situation with a rarity too just like a rpg game. This game also require some teamplay and really interesting to play with friend. The feeling of horror will be felt when you first play the game and the feeling of become a slayer just like in the serial killer movie is very thrilling and felt so intense. Really recommended. But This game have a huge balance issue this issue caused by many things perks game mechanics map design and many more have a big problem. And sometimes you will feel stressed and have no fun to play because killer got bullied by 4 player or cant have your second chance alive as survivor because the killer really wants you to die so bad. This game also have a really really toxic community this endless debate from surv main and killer main caused by balance issue really stressful.

review: Dead by Daylight is a great 4V1 game that is both challenging and strategic. It acts as a cat and mouse game on both the suvivours and killers sides with you trying to outwit and predict what the other will do. It's not without it's flaws like all prominantly online games but it's definately one that is worth playing.PRO Games are pretty quick to find due to a good number of people playing Each game is different with opponents teammates and the randomly generated maps. Every suvivour and killer has their own unique perks and abilities. Plenty of killers and survivours to choose from and well timed and decently priced DLC (which include new maps) Graphics are pretty nice and it runs well. Lots of crossovers into different horror franchises that works great such as Michael Myers from Halloween the Pig from Saw Freddy Keruger from Nightmare on Elm Street. Each game lasts roughly between 5 to 20 minutes depending on how well the players are doing which is a good length so it's not over too fast or you're getting bored. Ranking system and levelling gives the grind a good feel. As you level up and spend points on the bloodweb you gain new perks abilities and items that you can use in the games. The music and atmospheric sounds really add to the tense aura of the game and that's not even mentioning the heartbeat that plays when the killers are near. Events are held every so often which give special bonus' for in game events which are fun to go for. There is no forcing players to work together which is great if you prefer to play solo. It actualyl tells you that you can do either and it will have pros and cons it's about whichever works best for you. Survivours play in third person to give an advantage of a heightened sense of "awareness" while the killers play in first person which is a great design choice.CON No single player tutorial it's all just text. It's alright but there's a lot to cover. Players can sometimes be obnixious and quit before you're able to kill them. You get points but I don't think it's as much as it would be if you killed them nor is there much in the way of a punishment for that. At first there were special DLC outfits that you could buy for cheap but it seems that they have implemented an "in game currency" for that which you can only use real money to get (that I know of). It wouldn't be as bad but there is a very limited selection as of now eg plenty for survivours not as much for killers. Some players do enjoy running around the same thing over and over again so be prepared for a little frustration when vying to kill them.Dead by Daylight is a great game if you can get past the 1 in 10 games that's pretty bad due to some annoying or frustrating players. But from my experience most of the games ar ereally fun and tense with everyone taking part and playing their role. If you enjoy a game of strategic teamwork or a game of brutal bloody murder then give it a try.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Overall 8/10This game is pretty good. It's definately the most fun when you play with friends though. Going into a match solo can be hard since you can't communicate with the other survivors on your team but i suppose that's the point. It's got good atmosphere and looks nice. It retains a spooky vibe that always lingers but it's not overbearing. I enjoy the gameplay as well simple but it can be challenging at times. The character designs are pretty cool and the system of ability building works out nicely. Addicting and not too hard to get the hang of.But actually getting into a game is the hard part. Their match system has some problems it can take like 30 minutes to get into a lobby. Another thing is that if the killer lives in a different country or something you're laggy af as a survivor and it makes the gameplay kind of irritating. There were also some problems where it'll glitch on the loading screen and you have to force quit. The glitches make it kind of annoying at times but the game itself is really fun and I would recommend getting it. The developers are working on solving some of the issues and whatnot so I have faith in it.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: EDIT 2 Fair is fair I said I would change the review when the lobby was fixed since that was my bigest problem with the game. After adding a reserved spot getting into matches is no longer a real pain anymore. At least for the solo que it seems fixed haven't tried the play with with friends recentlyFirst of I want to say that I really like the concepts of the game. Either being the killer hunting the survivors or trying to escape the killer are very fullfilling. The atmosphere is moody and dark which only is a big plus in the game. So far I only have encountered a single bug and with the recent patch this bug is already resolved.After the que fix I've been able to spend a lot of time playing as survivor sneaking around to get some precious generators. Only to find myself in situations where I suddenly encounter the killer getting mad for using his precious generators and using up all the gas in them. Apperently he wanted to use it for his chainsaw and his car. But no of course I had to start them making it impossible for him to go to the town next door to finally get his groceries.I have had great fun so far playing as a pesky survivor or playing as an angry killer who doesn't want his power being tapped. There are still some balancing issues/trolls/hackers out there but you will encounter them in every game.I would rate this game 8/10

review: Is this game fun yes for me. If you enjoy playing games solo then the killer is the way you want to go. It is very fun and when you get good enough to make people rage quit you get this warm tingly feeling in certain places. If you enjoy playing with friends and work well with your friends then the survivor is for you. Once you got the survivor playstyle down you will make killers hate there lives and want to just quit so they can get on to the next game. There are a few balanceing issues but they only become apparent when someone skilled is useing them. The nurse for instance has the ability to teleport and is extremely hard to dodge/juke if they are really good at reading what you are going to do. She can tele through walls and past barricades which are the survivors main survival tool. Getting rid of the usefulness of that means that you have to rely on stealth and when they have the right perks it's very hard. Personally I am not a big fan of the survivor mostly because I suck at quicktime events and that basically the one thing you have to be really good at to win. But the killer is great if you enjoy working as a team and don't mind quicktimes events you will like this game. If you like hunting people down and outsmarting them you will also like this game. If you cry whenever you play a game that requires the slightest bit of skill probably best you move on.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: So you've decided to consider Dead By Daylight for your steam library?Well pull up a chair grab your hot chocolate and let me give you the beatdown Whether you enjoy murdering and butchering people around you or love being chased by that kinda mob of people. You've chosen the right game to play. Dead by Daylight provides a player with the capability of becoming one of many survivors in a map with 3 other players against a single killer ranging with various skills and tricks. The aim of the survivor is to fix generators and escape the cold grasps of the killers before they're snatched and sacrificed!It's easy to hop in and play but after playing with more experienced players climbing down the ladder it becomes more clear that players really grow some common sense and awareness and begin to counter your attacks and make less errors whilst fixing or looting.Each Survivor and Killer have their own special skills which after leveling enough with bloodpoints scored after each round those skills can be adapted to other classes to make the perfect Hunter or Runner.It's easy to become very attached to saying one more round to either finish off on a good one or perhaps acquire the skill you've been hunting since. The game has an active community and still the developers provide content worth the wait.It's a game that i fully recommend and after not playing it for a while i thought this game deserves a review and a darn positive one at that. It has let me pour timeless hours into murdering my friends or Outwitting random players. It has become a treasure of mine and has earned a place on my shelf. I hope to return to this game soon enough.Anyways i hope this helps you understand and convinces you about this game. I recommend it along with god knows how many others. Its not a professional review but it's here to show you that Dead By Daylight is darn worth the money.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Where is "EARLY ACCESS" sign? Ohh.. this is a complete real deal ?! Really?!!! Like it's done???Sorry but the game is such incomplete piece of crap I still can't believe how disappointed I am. Because I loved the idea. OK here is why CONS Repetitive (as hell) game design and everything in it every map has the same feeling goal and atmosphere (it's fun for 2 rounds) I was looking forward to run through beautifly designed levels like some cabins / cottage with forests around and LAKE omg the typical horror scenery... no I got repetitive piles of walls and crap and few trees like I wanna play Paintball or what?!!... Customization option is useless you cannot change anything on your Hunter character at all (NOT EVEN weapon or overall look). With survivors you can change 2 (!!!) damn kind of jeans and 1(!!!!!!) mustache (really in 2016?!) WOW! Overall graphics is not bad but animations and physics looks like 2000's feels awfuly skeletal the whole movement system Leveling system is not enough motivating Matchmaking is useless (you get 20 30 lvl oponent while you're 4) and it's even not functional most of the time. I got so much disconnections from lobby I can't even count it.PROS One of a kind game (for now that's big advantage for developers) Unique idea for a gameOVERALL I hope developers won't fall asleep and bring better features and gaming experience in the future. Or please somebody else make perfect horror hunting game like this but better way )

review: Great and fun game! But oh my god so many issues and bugs it's mind blowing. Pros New and innovative playstyle a competitive multiplayer horror game. Very addictive and replayable. Alot of diffirent characters and perks.Cons Horrible peer2peer system. Disconnections empty lobby spots and are sadly all to regular. Camping and/or griefing killers. Griefing survivors i just got blocked by 2 players who were camping in the basement. OP DLC characters *cough* pay to win *cough* Only competetive playmode not any casual mode without the ranking system. The ranking system seems flawed as well not matching people with similar skill/experience/character level. It feels more like it's just throwing 5 people together without considering any of their merits. In game communication in form of using microphones or a chat is not available. Graphical and other general bugs which are STILL in the game. For example where some you can get literally stuck inside a pallet and can't get out except if the killer hits you.Have to give this game a negative score since these cons sadly outway the pros.

review: Dead by Daylight is a fun competitive and intense game where you can play as either a Survivor and complete generators to escape the killer's grasp or as the Killer chasing down survivors and impeding their progress. Matches tend to last around 10 15 minutes and gameplay is vastly different between each 'trial' you play. Decent variety of characters to play as for each survivor and killer roles though physically every survivor is the same while killer's movement speed differs between each. Plenty of unique and shared perks for survivor and killer altering gameplay depending on the perks used. This game features alot of bugs but the dedicated developer squad releases patches and updates regularly enough. My advice to new players would have to be Dont get discouraged by your first 50 or so trials this game takes alot of skill building and practice in order to become a good player. Chances are you have no idea what your doing your first times playing and thats okay the more you play the better you'll understand. And also pay attention to your surroundings. Seeing the killer coming towards you beforehand vs waiting until you hear the heartbeat ( terror radius) can cost you alot seconds matter in this game!
title: Dead by Daylight

review: It takes about 2 good games to level up your survivor in this game. I am currently at 12 hours and my survivor rank is 7...now before you think I'm a bad player (which I assure you I am not) I'll tell you a little about what you're getting into buying this game...If you don't have any steam friends that have this game and you will more often then not being playing by yourself then this game is absolutly fantastic and you're going to have a lot of fun.If you have 1 or more buddies you will be playing this game with well...I hope you guys have a lot to talk about because it goes from being a survival horror game in which you try to outrun a killer to a campfire simulator."Oh Storm what do you mean a campfire simulator?"Well sexy one let me tell you...while you are trying to ready up multiple times for a lobby for it to say searching for a game for about 3 8 minutes only to cancel out and have to reready up (god forbid one of your heathen friends goes for a drink or a pee pee time because then you have to wait longer for him to come ready up as well) all of the survivors are just standing around this campfire waiting for a lobby to get into so they can take a knife to the face and run around boo hoo'ing and leaving a blood trail all the way up to a closet you think you're safe in.You want to play a killer! Well all be dang gum you just broke the game you'll get into gameplay instantly and frequently. Me personally I like playing as a survivor as I have more fun that way but it's come down to me and my buddy just playing as survivors in different games now. He has to listen to me talk about my game and all the fun and good times I am having and vice versa. It's ruining our friendship our bonding time and who we are as men. We will never be the same after this! I left him on a hook one time because I was so used to playing with random people ya imagine having to deal with that in teamspeak he didn't talk to me for like 15 minutes!But for real when myself kurk and tyler was all playing trying to play as three...in 2 and a half hours we got into 2 games...not kidding or being over dramatic at all...literally 2 games in close to 3 hours. On the brightside we got to know each other very well kurk is a real life friend and tyler is a buddy I've been gaming with for almost 7 years now. I found out tonight he is 6'6" (holy sh!! I know!) we talked about beer woman politics the universe who would have what superpower if we got struck by lightening who's dad could beat up who's dad what kind of food we ate in the last 3 months...10/10 would play campfire simulator again and again
title: Dead by Daylight

review: This is a very challenging game and not for the faint hearted either. I first played it today as a survivor on quick play and my hand was forced to cast lots with a useless not teamworking group. Got killed by the hillbilly very quickly! I then ventured into the boots of the evil wraith and jumpscared many with my predator style invisibility tricks. The only downside was the weak damage of my sharpened bone club and the pallettes the survivors kept dropping on me. I eventualy got better and avoided those and went around the path to get survivors eventually somehow injuring one gravely survivor to sacrifice her without doing it myself. Got another runner on a meathook cloaked and then watched as some girl helped him off and they waltzed into the sunset. This game is intense has a great progression system and also is a game where you can improve your skill at it just by playing it. On a side note however this game has issues with GTX 970 cards (you probably know about the 500MB running slower) I get about 24 30 FPS in game but its smooth so I don't care. I did actually do what someone suggested and use DDU to uninstall the nvidia drivers and do a clean install but that did not work. If you have a GTX 970 don't worry make sure the game is set to high for a bit more FPS but you will get a smooth experience out of it. Unfortunately I won't get to be on my pc for a week so I can't progress further but I will not give up on this game. It is ground breaking in the gameplay department and also choc full of horror and horros movie vibes. If you play this you probably will get scared and feel the atmosphere and claustrophobic enviroment working against you. Know your strengths and work as a team.If any of you want to play this game with me just add me.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: I'm not usually one for horror games (I get scared really easily) and this was actually the first horror game I bought (don't judge lol). Because this game allows me to play as the killer too I could try out both sides and that was kind of a key in helping me get over some of that fear. Plus. remembering that every character is really another person helps. So for people who are kinda nervous about horror games I recommend this way of trying out the genre.The maps do switch around a little and this increases replay value. Think of it as hide and seek with some twists xDPlaying as a survivor Because the killer is not an AI it is fun and challenging to find new ways to clear the game. It's also cool to try out new perks and see how they affect gameplay. The killers seem scary when they're in sight because of the constant is he gonna get me feeling. Not to mention the music that comes with them. For people who aren't used to horror games just remember that it's another player and enjoy the thrill!Playing as a killer Survivors have all sorts of tricks to avoid being detected and for the first time I'm frustrated with a first person camera view (compared to the survivors which have a 3rd person view it feels handicapped!) because a glance in the wrong direction even for a moment would mean that the survivors can slip right under your nose. I've ever had an experience of walking right beside a killer who didn't detect me because I wasn't in the range of his red triangle vision of doom. Upon catching the survivors the primary attack has a very satisfying effect if it hits.I won't spoil the game with lots of details but it really is worth the time. Plus a new map killer and survivor have just been released in the DLC (free) so that adds even more to explore!

review: This game is a "Jack of all Trades." The game is easy to run especially on low but you don't really need a great grahpics card to run it max either. Of course there are some other games that have alot more detail than this game but this game offers graphic settings that are very playable and enjoyable. If you like the thrill of being chased or playing as this maniac with a cleaver / chainsaw or a maniac that has special abilities to go invisible / teleport than this game is right for you. After a few hours playing this game you may realise how to actually out play this maniac and your mentality and focus becomes how can I survive this game with the consideration of my teammates. Overall I rate 8/10 just because of matchmaking is still garbage and I recommend everyone to try this game out for just a few hours even if that be watching it on YouTube or Twitch.

review: Let me start by saying that I am a Survivor main. All of the recent negative reviews are just pure garbage let me tell you why... A few days ago a recent patch came out that nerfed some meta perks for survivor. This has the lower/mid tier survivors extremely butthurt. Do not let the recent negative reviews deter you from picking the game up and giving it a try. The killers had good quality of life changes to some of their perks as well as The Trapper and Hag buff were both pretty necessary in order to make them more viable in higher ranks. The balance of this game is in a better state than it has ever been in my opinion. Killers SHOULD feel powerful and survivors SHOULD have to work every second in order to make it out of the trial alive. At the end of the day the Devs are doing everything they can to bring more balance into the game and they are listening to their players thoughts and opinions. The game is easy to learn and hard to master and just like all things the more you play/practice the better you'll become. Now this is not me saying that you won't run into some toxicity but for the most part I love the game as well as the community.

review: I have had this game pretty much since it came out and have seen the game grow exponentially in that time.First of all I want to deal with the fact that the majority of the bad reviews relate to the "toxic community". Yeah there are some horrible people out there and yeah some of them will call you names but my friends is the internet. To blame that on the game is unreasonable. Personally I am to old to be getting into arguments with 11 year olds beyond a "gg" or "wp" after a game I don't get drawn into post game chat.The biggest problem for me is the number of people who d/c from the game because they are not doing as well as they would have liked. It leaves everyone else at an unfair disadvantage and I notice it is often the same players doing it. Anyone who has played a board game like Monopoly with a younger sibling who upended the board because they were losing knows how frustrating that can be.That said I concede that the SWF (Survive With Friends) alters the game's balance considerably against the killer and does make being "toxic" that bit easier for those who wish to be so. But hey... again that's the internet for you.Anyhow the game. The game is great fun. People clock up hundreds and thousands of hours on it because it is a great game with a long term learning curve lots of different characters with different skills and different play styles too.The game runs well 99% of the time (rare glitches are often hilarious) the graphics look very smart and the sound is atmospheric and (although you eventually do get used to it) pretty terrifying.The level of updates has been generally very good with rebalances (and all the inevitable applause/anger that they can bring) and new content appearing regularly. The events such as Haloween Chinese New Year and Summer BBQ add another flavour to the game from time to time and Double Bloodpoints Events get everyone excited.The ranking system is not perfect but it does work by and large. A new player should in theory be matched with other lower rank players so you won't spend your first few games matched against a hardcore streamer who has matered the game over 18 hour streams for the last 2 years. The new tutorial is a nice addition too however I imagine most people will pick up the basic by watching YouTubers such as Hybrid Panda Noob3 Monto and whoever else.I do recommend this game to people but like any game if you're not prepared to lose don't play! Be nice to eachother and have fun because that's what we play games for ...right?
title: Dead by Daylight

review: A good mix of competitive gameplay co operative gameplay and freaking jummpscares.Dead by Daylight is an asymmetric multiplayer game meaning the teams aren't split up equally. One player controls a horrible looking killer and on the other team 4 players control survivors. The goal is pretty obvious Killer has to kill Survivors have to escape.In order to escape the survivors have to start 5 generators to power up the exit. While doing so they have to try to avoid the killer.This isn't always easy as the killer has some special abilities like invisibility traps and teleports. Anyways you get the gist of it.The game is really fun addicting and surprisingly well polished for an early access title. New content is periodically being added for free. You can level up survivors and killers rank up to show you're the best and all that. Basically your typical competitive gameplay stuff.The game is definitely worth the prize. Every round is tense and I still get jumpy sometimes when the killer surprises me.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: This is not a bad game. The concept is original and when the stars align fun. What irritates me is the whole character progression system un fun options being the best options and the infrequency of bug fixes.Personally I think this game would have been better without the "growing characters". Every survivor is the same starting out you have to spend hours upon hours in game to get anything that makes them unique. New players have no tools outside of fundamental gameplay that lets them contribute meaningfully.Killers on the other hand can either be a joke or a terror based entirely on how much time the player has invested.As far as I have been able to tell camping a survivor as the killer is your best strategy especially as the game's best killer Trapper. Survivors have no way of offensively threatening the Killer or communicating with random players so incoming help usually does little but change who's dying. Conversely the best strategy for a survivor is to leave the dying player alone due to the above. There is no being a hero unless your killer also wants to have fun.The dev team doesn't seem particularly interested in fixing the multitude of bugs plaguing DbD many of which have no reason to exist. One example springs to mind where a killer's facial model will clip into first person view interfering with vision based on which killer is dealing with it. This has been an issue for months.If you must get this find it on sale. Otherwise look elsewhere until this gets cleaned up.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: This game is incredibly glitchy. I had to leave a match as a killer because a survivor manage to glitch into a meathook post and refused to quit the game. In another instance I played as a survivor and got stuck in a magic mime box at the bottom of a hill. Later the killer got stuck in that same box and we won the game with no deaths and no worries. The dev's really need to go through and fix issues with the game BEFORE they release it. So until they do what they should have done MONTHS AGO don't buy their product.Edit All if not most of the bugs that existed when this game was released has been patched and the developers are incredibly customer focused and frequently release patches and tweak the game. Recently they released a patch that fixed severe mathcmaking issues making the game hundreds of times more playable. They listened to the concerns of the public and addressed them. While I stand by my statement that these bugs should have been fixed before the release of the game they are fixed now. While it took time for the game to be user friendly and playable it now is. If you're interested go for it. Add to cart.Second Edit Wow. After the release of the HALLOWEEN dlc this game went from playable to frustrating in about ten seconds. The community has just become incredibly more hostile and the game mechanics are all shot to hell. I/ll be back IF it's fixed.

review: This is a game for those who like suspense and thrills. With the new Halloween chapter it's made it even more fun with Micheal's Evil Within Weapon. Especially when I'm just sitting there minding my own business then BAM! He's right there behind me. However with the recent updates it seems to have gotten harder for survivors to win. I'm not sure if it's just me but it seems as if the generators take longer to repair. Also there are the killers in the game who like to camp the hook making it nearly inpossible to help your teammate off the hook. On the other side it makes it so you have to coordinate with another player to distract the killer while you/someone else rescue the hooked player. Then there are the killers who watch you while you crawl around dying and waste your time. This makes it incredibly frustrating. If you manage to get into a gmae with friends this changes everything. The game becomes incredibly easier as the people you are playing with can be in a chat program such as discord with you and coordinating what to do and what's going on with the killer. Or you can kill your friends and have a good laugh. Overall the game is still a working progress and I think it needs to add some form of talk system for the survivors. The perks make it so the killer/player can be unstoppable (if they know what they're doing with them). I reccomend this game for those who like coordinating and like to get their adrenaline pumping.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Great game Great concept Great atmosphere very enjoyable. Obviously a game like this (asymetrical Horror) is going to have its issues with glitches bugs lag etc. as do all this game is no different. THis game though strives past its issues. It creates a sense of dread and excitement (if you are a survivor) and power and it feeling of imposing your will (as a Killer). All in all this game gives you exactly what you pay for and then some and with its updates and dlc's it comes as no surprise I would recommend this game to any horror fan!

title: Dead by Daylight

review: All the bugs in this game make it extremely frustrating. It would be tons of fun if everything worked but every patch introduces new issues. It's hard to get into a game to begin with and then you get laggy killers disconnecting teammates killers with auto aim broken mechanics. Right now there is a bug that results in getting no points after you finish the match. Bah.It's also not beginner friendly at all since there is a complete lack of match making. 4 rank 20 survivors against a rank 1 killer. You pretty much have no chance. Wish I hadn't bought it tbh. It's too much money for so little fun. I played it a couple of times but almost always left frustrated.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Do not think this review is bashing the game because it is not i loved the game up until the recent updates this august. I do have 100+ hours played in the game &amp i am by no means a noob my highest rank on survivor writing this review is level 4 with 1 pip. Also do not go ahead thinking the only reason i got to this rank was infinite glitches because i have never used one nor do i know about them but i do watch people stream on twitch and hear a lot of talk in chat about them.This game was fun until the recent game update in august the killers are way too overpowered now. Perks that are overpowered &amp all killers use "Spies from the shadows iron grasp deer stalker no one escapes from death" are too overpowered and need a nerf or the killers perks need to start having a cooldown like survivors do. On top of it most of them carry the four perks i mentioned above which just makes them overpowered.Problems with killers They hit you with their weapon after you have already jumped through a window there weapon goes through the window and hits you puts you down on the ground after hitting you for the second time of course. The killer walks way to fast &amp catches up to you in very little time. This gives you no time to escape at all. The killers speed should be nerfed i am not saying all killers but certain classes should walk slower in this game which i will list in each killers review. Every killer in the game has auto aim which is terrible according to dead by daybreak "it s a bug". I would say 75% of the time when i hit a killer with the pallet i end up getting hit by them. Then they end up on the same side of the pallet as me as well. Their attack range also needs a nerf all too many times i get hit when i am so far away from the killer which is crap.Problems with killer s items The Trapper His traps are to overpowered now since you can no longer sabotage them unless you disarm them first &amp by the time you do that he already notices that you have disarmed the trap and heads towards your direction giving you no time to sabotage the trap meaning the only traps you will be able to get rid of are the ones he has not picked up and set on the ground. They need to reduce the speed that the trapper runs to give you more of a chance in the game or reduce the time it takes to disarm a trap &amp sabotage it. Also they need to take the auto aim off the killers. The trapper should not be able to place traps underneth people on the hook it is to overpowered and does not give you team member enough time to disarm and take the person off the hook.Hill Billy His chainsaw lets him run halfway across the map or more it is also a one hit kill once he hit you you are instantly down on the ground waiting to be hooked. Because not only can he run really fast plus far with his chainsaw he can walk fast and catch up to you quick even if he misses. This would not be such a big issue if his walking speed was nerfed to something more reasonable.Also they need to take the auto aim off the killers.Nurse Her teleport is to accurate mixed with the auto aim attack for the killers she is way overpowered i would have to say she is the worst person to play against you do not want to play in a match against her at all let's just say your team is like an insta kill. She is broken &amp needs a nerf. They need to take the auto aim off and reduce the range of her attack also make her slower she walks to fast. Also they need to take the auto aim off the killers.Wraith He is not really overpowered a pain to play against but he is most likely the easiest to play against this patch. He deserves the extra speed since he does not have any killer items like traps teleport or a chainsaw that lets you run super far at a fast pace. i do not have much to say about the wraith except for his attack range is pretty out there and might need some small tweaking. Also they need to take the auto aim off the killers. Problems with surviving in the game The only escape from the killer that you have in the game is hitting them directly with a pallet to stun them which is pretty close to impossible since this game is player to player based and the connection is always the killers so he has the advantage in every single game. Example "lag is a survivor killer &amp the killer never has that problem". The flash light is useless if anything in the game deserves an auto aim this because it never works when you shine it in their eyes to begin with they just walk right up to you and hit you. Besides the pallets being risky and the flash light being useless this game needs to come up with more ways to get away from the killer.About Survivor perks I do not find the survivor perks to be overpowered although there is a lot of discussion about them not being teachable to other classes because people would rather them be unique to each class.Bugs in the game for survivor When a survivor on your team is on the floor bleeding out in the game there highlighted body will disappear &amp you will no longer be able to see where they are which is annoying when you are trying to help your team member this bug will also happen when your team member is on the hook. i am not sure if this is a bug but its annoying when you think your team member is hit once only to find out he is thrown on top of a killers shoulder being carried to a hook. Killers still glitches through pallets and hitting you. Dead by daylight needs to fix healing when you are bleeding out on the floor if your whole team is on the floor and the killer is leaving you there to heal up all the way you should be able to heal up the rest of the way so you can contunie playing the game it is pointless to heal up all the way if no one is left to help you. To many times have i laid on the ground as the last person to bleed out and die with no help no way to get up this needs to be fixed. I think this wraps up my review on Dead by Daylight. if you can put up with all the bugs &amp glitches and the unbalanced gameplay Dead By Daylight is still a good game but it needs a lot of work before it is completely finished. I hope this helps before you decide to purchase the game.

title: Dead by Daylight

review: First off...The game has its quirks and clearly not perfect. Although addicting it seems to be attracting more negative feedback rather than positive. I for one approve of this game and would recommed or buy it for a friend. The Killer?I'm not a good killer and I've ran into a few games (where not all games are like this mind you) where survivors boast 'surviving' when they successfully escape. I know the point of the game is to kill all the survivors but I also enjoy the entertainment and thrill the game brings. Reaching 10k for a pip is a win to me regardless if all 4 survivors escape. I'm also not one to "patrol" or "camp" unless it's blatantly obvious that survivors are around me (i.e. seeing scratch marks or just finding one behind a tree). I enjoy the rush of preventing the generators being popped and if I see someone using infinites I just move on to the next guy or ultimately let them escape. No point in boosting someones ego for using a spot a killer can't counter (unless you're the trapper).The survivor?I'm a rank one survivor and although I've put in 200+ hours into this game I have to say that the thrill of hiding from killers is amazing especially if they don't see you in plain sight. I admit that camping killers are a massive downside to this game however I also firmly believe that the developers are working to counter any patrol or camping that is done to prevent altruism. I hate infinites although necessary to avoid getting captured by the killer I also understand why they're put into the game (i.e. random map spawns with blimp window blocked but now tractor has pile of hay which could ultimately be used as an infinite (although I have seen killers counter this fairly easily)). ...surviving?It boils down to how well you know to keep yourself hidden from a first person camera. The killer has a lot of advantages when it comes to spotting a survivor such as scratch marks or even breathing. However the survivor has great advantages as well to counter that such as premonition spine chill and iron will which are amazing indicators and techniques to quiet your character. Is this fair to a Level 50 killer who somehow stays Rank 20 and plays with new Rank 20 survivors? Of course not because the killer would have unfair advantages and perks at his grasp but it is also likewise. I know survive with friends is an amazing feature but does bring some disadvantages but again boils down to how good you are at finding a survivor or hiding from a killer (I would know as I have had rank 20 killers fresh with no perks take me down).Tl drI approve of the game and what the developers are accomplishing. It seems equally balanced unless you get players who play 24x7 and know how to operate a killer such as the Nurse. Other tid bits...The matchmaking seems fixed to an extent. I have had to press 'Ready' several times just to be returned to the lobby which is really annoying 08/29/2016 . I've seen more than 4 survivors join an already started game a lot more recently now than I have in the past. The anti cheat system needs to develop and learn quicker (my personal rant). And finally the lag problem needs to be fixed. There's too many Koreans playing on U.S. download regions (or that's what it feels like). I do agree that they need to get a beefy server and host it that way (my opinion have survivors join and would wait for a killer or vice versa so the matchmaking process isn't so borked).
title: Dead by Daylight

review: I can't stop playing this game but in no right can I recommend it to other players. This is by far one of the buggiest games I've ever touched. Maybe if the Developers focused more on fixing their mathcmaking and other bugs in the game instead of creating new content it would be a different story. Constantly I pull pallets down on killers to have them appear on the other side. Trying to dodge through a window you better be 50 feet on the other side or else they can still hit you. Last but definitely not least. How are we still playing on a host system? With the amount of sales this game has had they should have dedicated servers. Instead your entire game experience is dependent on whether the killer has a good network connection.

review: Horror in games (and films) is too often characterised by jump scares shocking startling events designed to trigger a fight or flight response. Dead by Daylight to its credit eschews these in favour of real horror a gradual increase in tension resulting from the unshakeable sense of impending doom. That it manages to do this in an asymmetrical competitive action game is what is truly impressive about it.Dead by Daylight features two teams four survivors and one killer and pits them against one another in a battle for all the marbles The four survivors need to repair five generators to power the gates which will allow them to escape. The killer needs to find the survivors knock them down put them on hooks and then sacrifice them to their otherworldly gods. The odds are skewed heavily in favour of the invincible killer and as a result playing Dead by Daylight as a survivor can be a nerve rattling sweat inducing terrifying experience.After queuing into a game with three other survivors Dead by Daylight puts you in one of several eerie horror environments a dilapidated farm a run down manor a rickety junkyard and tells you very simply to fix the generators to escape. When you find the generators you then need to repair them a painstakingly slow process where you hold the left mouse button down while crouching in front of it. If you're alone repairing the generator can take more than a minute. As you crouch next to the very noisy generator the game will throw skill tests at you by way of a rotating bar if you fail the QTE the generator will backfire. This creates a noisy explosion and the killer is visually alerted to the location of the backfire turning you into a target.If the killer does find you (and he probably will) your options are limited. If you have a flashlight you can blind him temporarily but your best bet is to run away. The killer moves faster than you can run maintaining the traditional horror movie 'ominous walk' but you can slow him down by leaping through windows or pushing down pallets to block his path. You want to put as many of these obstacles in between the two of you as possible as you flee for your life.Fortunately for the survivors a sixth sense mechanic alerts them to the presence of a nearby killer the closer the killer is the faster your survivor's heart beats. Unfortunately the sound is obscured by generator revving as you repair it. When 90% repaired the generator nearly drowns out the heartbeat entirely forcing you to rely solely on your eyes to see the killer.When you play as the killer you're able to see all the map's generators at all times allowing you to patrol them. If any of them are making noise you know at least one survivor has been working on it and you can hunt for signs that the others are nearby. Panicked survivors will sprint away leaving scratches on nearby walls and breaks in the grass and you can follow these markings to find your prey. Once you find your prey you chop them down pick them up and put them on a hook sacrificing them to your god after 60 seconds.The scoring system initially encourages players to create exciting gameplay opportunities by rewarding risky play. Survivors who engage in lengthy drawn out chases escaping the killer will earn more points for their boldness and you can rack up the points by rescuing other survivors who have been captured but not yet sacrificed. As a killer you're rewarded for killing more of the survivors although a single sacrifice is counted as a victory. Inevitably though this scoring system leads to immersion breaking actions like exploiting the killer's slow movement past obstacles as survivors earn huge points by taunting their hunter. Another problem for Dead by Daylight is its matchmaking system. The game is entirely peer to peer hosted with the killer hosting the survivors at all times. Unfortunately there's no way to tell where in the world the killer is or whether they're capable of hosting five people in a game until you're playing. There's no ping indicator and no regional matchmaking so you have to roll the dice each time you join a new server and if you crap out you'll warp around the game world barely able to work out what's going on. Further there's no group based matchmaking so you can't queue with friends. This results in players lobby hopping until they are grouped with friends which is a terrible experience for all involved.Dead by Daylight executes the concept of a competitive horror game well but only to a point. As players become more familiar with both roles the horror dissipates and they begin to play for the competitive element alone. The poor matchmaking and the highly exploitable scoring system make Dead by Daylight less competitive than it should be resulting in gameplay which doesn't resemble the horror experience it sets out to be.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: I want to weight in on the recent changes. I bought this game at the end of October 2017 and quickly put almost 300 hours from that point until February 12th where I decided that the game was to broken unbalanced and horribly in favor of a bunch of toxic survivors. I decided I would wait 6 months to see where the game itself was at and judge it. I came back after the recent patch and it's been wonderful I have more fun playing survivor I can play my killer the Trapper again without having ruining my day from 1 game. It's perfect. The game has a lot less bugs now they implemented a proper crash report system and things are really moving a positive direction for the entire experience. Dead By Daylight is finally leaving a state of junk towards something greater and part of this path is nerfing the survivors BMing tools in the game. The result of these negative reviews are 100% survivors complaining that they are no longer able to spend an entire game taunting and bullying the killer they are upset that the game requires them to actually play optimally. The review bombing is being used as a threat to the devs if they don't get what they want not to actually inform buyers of what the game is like. Right now the game is just okay it's improving the devs seem to be managing this game a lot better after they split from their publisher earlier this year and they have a lot of healthy changes planned in the future in regards to reworking the maps some killers and changing around a lot of perks. Their are a couple things survivors have a geniune reason to be upset about currently only 1 of them is gamebreaking. A perk is currently broken that sometimes removes a killers terror radius (a way to track them through sound) this is already been fixed and being pushed to the next hotfix that should come out within a week. The other complaints are in regards to pallets and the hitbox on a killer called the Huntress and her thrown hatchets. Pallets for the longest time worked differently they made another healthier changed that made it so survivors don't get sucked through the pallets when they push it down avoiding a hit from a killer that should have landed. This resulted in a lot of weirdness with timing it still feels slightly off but it's not a huge issue and pallet stuns still consistently work. The hatchet hitboxes are just slightly larger than they should be they aren't that small and precise as the ingame model suggests. This means dodging them is a bit more difficult if you go purely by visuals it isn't gamebreaking just keep it in mind. Take the negatives regarding killers being overpowered with a grain of salt if you're hesistant to purchase the game you rightfully should be look into what they have planned for the future updates and poke around a bit the game is a lot of fun currently and it's only going to get better.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: I sit there in the dark. Footsteps to my left to the right.It must be near by. I slowly move a direction.Is that breathing I hear?I look to the right the bush moves.As I get closer a figure comes out.Look to the item in my right hand and back to it.Human skum!I chase it down it drops items in my way to slow me down.I grunt from the pain. And look back up.GoneW Where could it have gone.As I look behind me is see a figure dash through obsticles.I cut around and he sees a surprise infrount of him as I hack at him with my muchete.blood flies to the trees his adreneline kicks in as he far again.He moves into ruined buildings. I cannot see anyone...I look to the locker There is a moan. I march my way over to the locker and watch.one of the doors fly open.I reach into the locker and grab his face throwing it to my shoulder."They will be pleased with this one" I say to myself.The human screams and struggles.But it is too late.The game is absolutely amazing although there is lots of bugs there is nothing better than hunting down you friends with a chainsaw and trapping them with a bear trap XD or even running around getting the objectives distracting the killer to save your friends or having your friend try to hunt you down. This game can really get your heart pumping in a good way. 10/10
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Asymmetrical multiplayer games are becoming much more popular lately and this is probaly my favorite. Whether playing as killer or survivor the game doesn't feel one sided. While the survivors have the advantage early due to numbers as the match goes on surviving becomes much more difficult as you become a target. The only problems I found with the game are perks and skill based match making. Perks are either obtained by leveling your charecter or drops starting the game with none a new player is possibly at a disadvantage based on luck though I feel perks don't usually determine a match. As with skill based match making there is none. A new player can be easily intimidated by a level 20 hunter as players are thrown in a first come first served basis. Other than that the game feels very balanced and makes a great time either playing with randoms or friends.

review: It can be very fun I enjoy having the killer run right past me as I hide in the grass. Or actually surviving (Which sadly doesn't happen that much). Joining a match can sometimes take awhile but recently its gotten a lot better. I love that the survivors are in third person and the killer is in first person. It helps survivors a lot but when I'm the killer I tend to get a headache after three or four rounds because I'm squinting since it's very blurry. I can still see the hiding survivors though and that's the point. Not to make it too easy to see them.I extremely dislike being the last survivor because the killer ends up toying with you. Then I'm forced to leave and I don't get all those points I tried getting. Or if you get caught and get hung on a hook you kinda shrug and give up because the killer will camp you. So why bother trying to survive? We all know the killer camps because if they can get at least one kill they win even if a few survivors still escape.Now when I win instead of "Yay I finally did it!" I feel "Finally. After ten losses we won."
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Dead By Daylight is an assymetrical Survival/Horror game Where 4 survivors face off against the killer who will try to down them with two hits (one with hillbilly's chainsaw) then sacrifice them on a meat hook to The Entity.The Survivors are by far more agile than the killer but in a straight grund race they will lose So survivors must throw down barriers and hop windows to escape the killer. the Survivors must also power 5/7 generators throughout the map Team work is almost always essential to your survival so be a team palyer. After 5/7 generators are powered the survivors must power any number of two doors to escape or if you're the last survivor you may escape through a secret hatch hidden somewhere in the level after at least 2/7 generators are powered.The killer is faster as previously stated and they have map contol abilities such as traps and speed boosts but they must stay on their toes as their view is limited by first person while the survivors have the added power of third person view.Pros Great Gameplay Scary at times Makes your heart race all the time Easy To learn Hard To master Fun to Play Decent price made better by summer sale and even more so if you own PayDay 2 Gorgeous Graphics Can have some really intense moments Hard but not punishing Level up system is fun and makes you Think about your choicesCons Has some game breaking glitches(falling out of map etc..) No Party system for quick play Trying to get yourself a hook is usually in vain and will just waste your time no voice chat for survivors Window Looping Alt+f4 Glitch(losses don't count against you) Killers have to host (crap killer internet Crappy round) No Cd on wraiths bell Hatches are to easy to findOther than that i enjoy this game alot and highly recommend it to any one who enjoys survival horror games.Overall i give Dead By Daylight (DbD) an 8.5/10 score in my opinion.

review: First off let me say that I never review games. But this game... hot damn I'm throwing in my 'thumbs down' for this one!Started off buying this game during the recent sale. I thought "Wtf why not? For $16 this game looks hella fun!" At first it was... I could live with the glaring bugs (my killer got stuck in a plank once and couldn't move... AT ALL... imagine how fun that was!) the occasional &amp incredibly one sided matchmaking and the gery of the general populace that plays games like these. Surprisingly despite all of those things the game was still actually a blast to play!But then two days later a patch hits. And it literally changes everything.Let's get something straight the game was enjoyable but it's like... meeting someone with a seductive voice wearing a paper bag over their face. Eventually the mystery bores you and you rip off the bag only to let out an ear piercing shriek that would make even Jamie Lee Curtis proud.If you buy this game here is what you can expect You will start off totally new at Rank 20 and every character at Level 1 (derp). You will waste hours upon hours in a Korean like MMO MF'ing grind fest to get perks (all of your perks are RANDOMIZED!!! You can go MANY levels and get nothing but tastic perks over and over again)! You WILL DEFINITELY be paired up against Rank 1 10 players whose characters are Level 60+ with 4 Very Rare Perks that will either gut and skin you like a one eyed GDMF'ing doe or they will run 3x faster than GDMF'ing Usain Bolt YOU WILL NEVER CATCH THEM. There are glaring balance issues on both sides of the coin but none of that matters when you're facing people who have sunk 300+ hours into this game and have abilities that will DESTROY you. Failing all this BS if you want to play a Killer the ONLY way you'll level up is by being a lame camper. This will lead to a few things 1) You being bored out of your GDMF'ing mind 2) People will whine and worse than fat pigs strung up by their puny corkscrew tails in post game chat about how you have no skill insulting your mother your heritage and just about everything else you can imagine (AKA entire community must play this game when they're not busy playing League of Legends or DOTA) 3) You will get jack for Bloodpoints (EXP) and it will take you hundreds of hours to level up before you can try ANY other kind of strategy. This game is obviously skewed towards players who want to sink 600+ hours into a game. Unless you're that ing dedicated towards a $20 game don't bother.Did I mention that EACH character/killer has their own level? Want to try someone new? Cool! You get to start that whole damn cycle all over again and suck for another hundred hours!!! BUUUUUGS! You find out quickly that the developers cannot seem to even remotely catch the majestical &amp mythical unicorn named 'Princess Balance.' Everything is skewed to high hell. After the excitement of buying a new game wears off you'll realize very quickly that this game is actually an Early Steam Release game disguised as a Full Release game and the quality is nowhere near what you expect from a fully developed/play tested game.Now is this game fun? It can be. But 70 80% of the time it really isn't whatsoever. Because of glaring bugs heavy back handed game changes and mind blowing matchmaking issues (the likes of which I have NEVER seen in ANY other game that even claims to have one) it's just not even worth the investment IMO.But hey why not just waste $20 and decide for yourself? Then you too can leave a review for this bug ridden game that has no semblance of actual matchmaking!Hey... I'm only pointing out that now you can't say that your wingman didn't warn you 3x over about taking the well endowed girl with a paper bag over her face home.Honestly... what did you really expect was under that bag anyway?(edit 8/24/16 NO matchmaking is NOT fixed. Blatant LIES!)

review: To the uninitiated this is a multiplayer only horror/slasher game where 4 survivors are put up to the task to evade a single killer while trying to repair 5 generators so they can escape. If you're a horror junkie like me then this game is simply a must buy. It may not be the scariest game on the market but it is filled with tense moments that will without a doubt have you right on the edge of your seat. Whether you're working on a generator when you hear the killer right behind you or you're hiding in a closet and you see him walk by hoping your helpless whimpers don't give you away. Even playing the killer the game is packed with moments that get your heart pumping. There is nothing quite as satisfying as nabbing the last survivor as he tries to make a break for the exit or being that survivor and actually making it out. For the price this game is a STEAL! I put 17 hours in it so far and do not see myself stopping any time soon. The suspence satisfaction and perk and item progression will without a doubt leave you hooked for hours on end.With all the praise I give this game it isn't without it's flaws however. I've never had problems in the lobby I get into games in seconds most of the time but some people seem to be having problems with it from time to time taking too long to find a game. Most of it's balancing issues talked about in other reviews have been fixed from what I can see sure some perks are a little strong but you can develop strats around them and really it only makes you a better player. So that leaves us with the most glaring issue. The community. The Dead by Daylight community is a mixed bag I've played with people who have become my friends but I have also played with people who try their damnest to suck the fun out of the game. Be it by exploiting and infinite window loop as a survivor camping either the hooks or the trap door as a killer. Or disconnecting be it the killer ending the game causing people to lose their rank or a fellow survivor quitting creating a pretty big disadvantage. In order for anyone to have fun in the game the survivors have to work together otherwise it can get pretty aggravating at times for both killers and survivors. But do not let this deter you from getting the game it is still a blast to play and is getting better with every update.If you want to enjoy this game to it's max potential I'd suggest playing with headphones so you can hear cues telling you where people/the killer are. In a dimly lit or dark room and in a lobby with 4 of your friends. But it's definitely possible to have a really great time in a light room with speakers and playing with strangers which is how I normally play.I give this game an 8/10! A must buy for horror fans especially with the 20 dollar price tag.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: * NEW EDIT FINALLY the game is taking the right direction. Survivors are not massively overpowerd anymore and the devs take a close look at the mechanics and killers to buff and rework them to finally give you another choice than nurse in high ranks. If they keep going in this direction I can fully recommend this game since it's a lot of fun (despite some idiots with massive egos in the community). *OLD REVIEW I wrote a positive review beforehands but at the moment I can't recommend the game anymore. There isn't any fun in high ranks anymore if you play killer. You feel more like a class clown than a scray killer slaughtering people. As well as the survivors being kind of in favor (perks buffs.) there are still some bugs around which still aren't fixed. I hope DBD will be better soon and the devs take a look at some core mechanics of the game.Edit It got better but is still very unbalanced in high ranks. It's really easy as a survivor at the moment and it's not even close to scary anymore which is really unfun as a survivors as well as a killer. The DLCs are good and the way the devs fix things got better but the problems still remain.Edit #2 The devs fixed some stuff and tried to balance things. DBD kinda turned into a scooby doo chasing game than a scary game. You won't be as rewarded for playing with stealth and brain but for running around like a headless chicken. Some perks and even killers are designed around the time wasting chase mechanics which is really sad. You're considered a good survivor if you waste a lot of the killers time by running around obstacles. It's still fun but the direction it went is not mine tbh and has nothing to do with a scary horror game anymore.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: And yet again the DBD devs show that they don't have a clue what balance is and that they want the game to be as killer sided as possible since most of the player base are killer mains.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Edit As of patch 2.1 they've introduced a whole host of game breaking issues along with radical balance changes that make this game very dangerous to new players. Good luck if you decide to buy...Pros Great game to play with your friends. Competitive af. Solid progression system. Game is still receiving significant updates and DLC.Cons Balance is really bad on both sides devs remain clueless about the majority of balance issues and instead fiddle constantly with things that aren't broken. As a survivor it's not uncommon to get camped by the killer which basically ruins the match for you. As a killer it's quite common to get pallet looped which is utterly frustrating. Disconnects mid game happen too often as the game can very often be far more frustrating than rewarding. There are a number of people who play solely to troll the killer and waste their time. Most killers don't have good counters to trolling techniques in this game. Overly frustrating matches are guaranteed on both sides. Community can be quite toxic.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: I played this game a lot both as survivor and killer and I plan to keep playing it. Why? The artstyle is very unique and personal the sountrack is literally perfect the core gameplay is solid and has many layers and more depth than what it might seem the fight between survivors and killers is not only physical but even psicological and mindgames are a key to success. There is a deep layer of customization not only aesthetic but in gamestyles. You can play as a sneaky Myers jumpscaring survivors emerging from behind corners or as an oppressive mad Doctor that envelops the map in his madness you can play as a "medic" survivor always there to help others or as a sneaky one never seen by the killer and growing stronger as the others die. The high amount of perks contribute to the diversity in gamestyles allowing for a huge variety of builds.Most of the content (all the perks and 80% of the skins) is obtainable without spending additional money aside unluckily from licensed characters (because of licensing problems). Currently it is quite a bit grindy but I think in the future the grind will be eased.For a long time the game suffered from imbalances with survivors widely considered paradoxically the strongest role and some bad mechanics (I'm looking at you pallet vacuum) but since Behaviour bought the license from their publisher Starbreeze and are now independent the game is getting better and better at a good steady pace. Customization increased a lot with the introduction of the store and the constant addition of skins and the guaranteed big patches every 6 weeks bring amazing content and changes not counting the way more frequent PTBs (Public Test Build) where we're given the chance to try in advance new changes and give feedback about them.The devs seem more likely than ever to listen to players feedback and are more clear and transparent in their communication and I hope they won't stop because of the review bombing that's happening lately. Because that's what's happening this days. The last patch (2.1.0) brought a lot of good changes and is part of the process to make killers the power role as they are supposed to be but whiny survivors mains (because only someone that plays exclusively as survivor can't see how amazing the new changes are) can't adapt at all and rather review bomb in an attempt to spoil the game as they did to make devs nerf Freddy Krueger right after release and to stop them from delivering needed changes. But that was the Starbreeze era and hopefully that behaviour won't bring nothing to them now.In conclusion the game is amazing under many aspects but more importantly it's still growing and getting better. The community is quite rough (in some cases plain toxic) but if you want a thrilling experience and can accept loosing as part of the game (and ignore or laugh about salty players when they loose and try to flame you because unfortunately this happens) this might be the game for you and hopefully we'll meet in the fog.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: So how can I start? I love this game so much it's so fun especially with friends however if you ever decide to buy this game think about what you're getting yourself into this game is a roller coaster and a half.Pros This game is absolutely to die for this game will take over your Horror gaming for sure there's so many things to come from this game it is so fun playing alone playing with friends playing for yourself or playing as a team to escape or die you can choose every game you get yourself into you don't know what map it is who you're playing against every game you can be safe working around the killer fixing generators and escaping others you can just hide for a lot of the time and others you will have to run for your life all game as the killer can choose to either go for you only or spread the killing field you can choose from many characters perks add on things and offerings as a killer or a survivor you can change the game style by using specific offerings as it can change from how many things are in the level to how much mist is in the level to changing the map completely The game concept of a 4v1 Horror game is a very interesting for future online Horror games as this is a factor the execution is fabulous for a Horror game however it is very complicated to pull off with the balancing of the game play.Cons This game is a mixture of good and bad things this game runs flawlessly very fluid and very visualized and sound coded however many issues break these as there are a lot of lag spikes fps drops and glitched visuals until you get close to objects that have been glitched many of these can be fixed however can come back for a few examples cabinets will be black until you get closer and sometimes if you get picked up by the killer your character sometimes gets put on his shoulder other times the character will fly around the map/ screen.Negs This game has many many many bugs and loading times are ridiculous loading screens take for ever to load to not even load game can crash for no reason whatsoever the devs announced that they were going to fix the bugs when the game released they have not as each update comes along the bugs keep coming and ruining the game experience in which the game is practically rendered useless I don't know what else to say but this game is a range of thoughts and opinions I won't be able to choose which I want to pick if I do want to recommend this product or not you can decide what you want to choose for this game but my recommendation is going to be recommended but in fact I can't choose.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: I'd recommend this game for friends to play together but not so much for playing with random players. Love the game very addictive and fun to play only when you get a fair killer and fair survivers. Best for actual friends to play with/against is the better choice as to not get harassed by rude players looking for reasons to bad mouth someone for whatever reason they can think of.The infinate loading screen is a real problem though mainly happens for me when trying to join as survivor so I don't get much of a chance to play that role. You will come across people/killers who will camp survivors who continuously jump over baracades windows run around obsticles non stop. Being able to take down the hooks should be limited to a few and not all that aren't in the basement because players will continuously run to the far end of the map and create an endless game of back and forth until someone decides to disconnect or the killer gives up their rightful win. Some will camp the hook when they catch players taking down hooks and I was harrased by another player for that reason alone for their past experiences and accused me of playing unfair/cheating even though I had barely played as a survivor because of previously explained loading issues. Players lose tempers when singled out as survivor for any given reasons. Going for a player knowing they can be killed is not unfair survival of the fittest the weak are reasonable to go after. When on the virge of escape going after a player again because you know you can kill them instead of the others is not unfair either.Will come across players who will accuse you of camping if you don't go to the other side of the map when hooking a survivor. Checking the immediate area for players is exceptable. Some players will disconnect when caught and ruin the games point of playing as a killer and survivors but there are points given to the killer because of quitters.Being harrassed by players/survivors for playing as you are supposed to as a killer and "camping" in their unfair perspective of not leaving the area even though you know players around and attemping a save kills any enjoyment of the game. Being harrassed by the player/killer for playing as a survivor fighting to survive is absolutely ridiculous and also kills any enjoyment of the game.There are a number of types of people named that will ruin the game for others and probably a number more that weren't named also.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: A truly great game. Fantastic to play with friends and gets you on the edge of your seat even if you're watching it.The community is amazing you can have a good laugh with the pointing and other gestures (it's the only form of communication makes it so much funnier).Unfortunatly it can take a few minuites to get into a game but that really shouldn't be off putting.EDIT A week later After hours of waiting my paitence was worn thin.Also after a week it's noticable that menu's are glitchy game is glitchy and half the time you get a game where if not the players disconnect the host(killer) does.You level down(down is better in this case) but then the killer ends or your team quit and you loose your levels. The only way to get the levels is to not play the game and wait for everyone to die and save yourself.Do I recommend this game yes when the bugs are fixed. Until then no.Also just a point to note joining games with your friends is severely difficult. Especially if there's more than 3 people.

title: Dead by Daylight

review: You wake up in a dark and scary place knowing that you are have one job. Survive. Wondering what killer it is you attempt to start up a generator in hope of escaping only to cause a small explosion. From here you are given a choice to either run or cotinue working on the same generator you just blew up. Either choice dooms you if not executed properly. You decide to stay and work on the generator and eventually complete it further dooming yourself. You run and hide making sure that you weren't spotted and start work on the next gen. A chill goes down your spine as you attempt to balance your concentration on looking out for the killer and hitting skill checks. They appear and you run as fast as your legs can carry you. Miraculously the killer loses you and your only choice is to continue what you started. The game in general is not as scary as one takes it to be but if you become too immersed it becomes so. It is more intense rather than scary but it all depends on the perks and addons that the killer brings. Scenarios are based on skill but luck is a great part of the game as well. A great game for those adrenaline rushes if you play as a survivor.
title: Dead by Daylight
