title: Dead by Daylight

review: It's Really Fun. My First Game as a Survivor i managed to survive Long enough for survivors and Monster to disconnect or ragequit. What happened was We unfortunetly let one of our people die and the 4th person disconnect at the start of the game putting us as a disadvantage. This mode was honestly horrifying to me yet thrilling at the same time. I decided to give the Killers a Go and i definetly Learned alot from the High Lvl Survivors. Even though Monsters can pick survivors up another survivor if brave enough can flash the light to temporary stun the Monster. Since the Monster is 1st person viewpoint he won't get to really see where they went except to corner of his/her eye perhaps and following the scratch marks survivors make from running. Also Even If the Monster Hangs one of the survivors the more bold and veteran players WILL risk their lives to save their comrades. I had the weird experience of having one taken off and i swing at the savior and hang him instead while the one that escaped got away. Another time i managed to attack the savior b4 he/she got to get the one I hanged off. At this point there was 1 survivor left and she was a high lvl that had some sprint perk and managed to escape. normally when you have 1 person hanging and about to hang the other one there is a chance the other survivors will save that hanged person. Even though i sometimes lose to high lvl players I at least sacrifice 1 person which earns me blood points. I also learn from these other survivors how to be Very good cooperative survivors. I wish i could say the Wraith is OP because of the ability to cloak but that bell ringing when he needs to phase in and out of invisibility just to hit a survivor is a dead give away and they end up running when they hear it. This is gonna be a fun year for me. 10/10 7/9/18In my most recent match as the killer the survivors happened to be a 4 man survive with friends. maybe even a 3 man. I knew this because during the game the 3 players were messing around with me and were hiding poorly. They thought I was some casual killer (I actually am too perhaps even a baby killer) But I've watched enough videos and use my ears to hear my surroundings too. They were too altriustic so they kept saving each other and were always close by. Once one of them did the tea bag while I was breaking the pallet out of being over confident I started to tunnel. Managed to sacrifice all 3 of them and then I Freeze. so I take this moment to take a break and come back to find it was a Crash. I know Dead by Daylight doesn't do this it was more likely the player might have ddos or intentionally crashed the game so I wouldn't get anything out of it and because they were salty. I log back in to try to find their profiles via Shift+Tab and find their names don't show up as if they didn't exist. It might be time to bring in some A.I. Killers and A.I. Survivors because apparently people get salty when they lose to other players and go so far as to greif/hack and sabotage gameplay for killers and probably survivors alike. I like this game alot too but then I find I lost my offering which wasn't a big loss but it was still an item I earned with my time and effort and apparently that match still counted enough for me to lose it while the crybabies got a free pass to keep being toxic. PRETTYGOODJOBSOFAR! 7/25/18RecommendedI was mad before but with patience and just playing the game as it is I realized I just gotta enjoy it whenever I can and brush off the negatives. but all in all this is still a fun game to play. Just gotta be a sportsman and take defeat like a real player and also figure out ways to beat the killer when he camps or just try to escape. in killer perspective if they gen rush to 3 or less quickly they figure it's time to camp and start killing people ASAP. depends really though. most of us just play killer ofr the rituals yet continue to play as survivors or we're killers and play survivors casually.

review: CRAPPY GAME WITH BRAINLESS PLANNER
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Product received for free. If you don't know what dead by daylight is it is an asymmetrical horror game where four survivors have to repair five generators and open a door to escape. All the while evading a killer which tries to kill all four survivors before they can escape. Seems thrilling doesn't it? Well you're only half right.This game has it's own perk system in addition to an item addon and offering system to spice up the gameplay. But instead of being supplements to the gameplay some are complete crutches that take no skill to use leading to feeling cheated out of a kill not because the survivor good at surviving but because he just equipped something pre game. Granted there are killer crutch perks but one can be countered before it is able to be used and only is able to be used when the exit gates are open and one is only usable when an exit gate is open and you hook a survivor. Not to mention that 90% of games survivors will only use the same few crutch perks as the perk balance is completely skewed. Some of their bonuses as both killer and survivor are completely negligible or are very situational. However recently the developers have been tackling these imbalances and are going to be reworking one of them I believe in the next patch.Let me touch on the characters. The survivors have no special ability or anything that makes them unique from eachother other than teachable perks and skins. On the killer side the killers do have special abilities that change their playstyle yet only a few killers are viable at high ranks. The huntress nurse hillbilly hag and maybe the doctor.Let me discuss the maps for a little bit every map is practically the same but with a different layout except for a few landmarks (though haddonfield and lerys will feel completely different than the other maps) and the shape of the map. Just to clarify there is no side objectives or different main objectives at any point in time. Leading to a very repetitive experience of repairing five generators a game. Granted I had no issues with boredom playing for 900 hours but I don't think everyone will feel the same.Other than these gripes I really enjoy the game. If you can get past these issues you will get an enjoyable experience worth many hours (or even days) of fun.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Edit 7/25/18So over the last few months we have seen a massive increase in balance work from the devs &amp while the community is still toxic at times their ability to troll was reduced significantly in the last few patches. The devs are trying to strike a balance for sure at this point &amp its noticeable even if its slowly &amp gradually. Playing with friends this is still a great game so I can say that the changes have made me start playing this regularly again. Edit 5/22/18Playerbase is getting worse I'll come back to play for a bit then quit again as they get more toxic over &amp over. No matter how many times I try to give this game a chance the devs dont seem to want to fix the bugs glitches &amp imbalances that ruin the expierence. After playing a very frustrating match to try &amp get a Kill a Survivor as Huntress daily today having 2 people quit only having one mori to do so with on her &amp then finally getting it.......only for this piece of trash game to just crash on me due to some half server error because the Devs wont make dedicated servers for the game (yet they make us put our saves there no because they couldnt fix the damned loss of progress glitch)......I'm just done for a long time with this game. I want to love it but its just nothing but frustration game after game. Edit 11/8/17While I did enjoy this game theres a large amount of problems that dont seem to be addressed by the game developers. All 4 survivors running 3 perks like decisive strike(skill check to escape killers grasp) borrowed time(get hit but have a timer to keep running instead of falling to ground) &amp self heal make games repeatitive &amp not enjoyable as killer. Also pallet looping(running in circles around pallets which can be used to stun the killer &amp moving onto the next pallet) hasnt been addressed &amp with some killers is impossible to counter(myers freddy). Survivors are also constantly getting new perks &amp while there is some new stuff for killers(faster generator damage animation) its not enough.Being a killer in this game is a chore &amp leaves alot to be desired with the theme. If they dont fix these problems then in the long term you will have a player base that moves onto other games. I'm already starting to spend my time doing so. I will alter this review if changes occur. I want changes to occur. I want to enjoy killer. But in its current incarnation its not that fun. Previous ReviewSo first the concept behind DBD is really awesome. I love horror movies. I have multiple signed prints by actors directors &amp writers of horror. I got it specifically because of this concept of playing the killer in a slasher 80s film. But there are defintely some hits &amp misses.Pros Atmosphere is very on target very strong horror vibe Lots of killers to choose from even without DLCs 3 Licensed movie killers(leatherface michael myers &amp freddy krueger as of this writing) Lots of replay value from the killer side since each one has uniquely different strategies Scares the living crap out of you when you switch to survivor for the first timeCons Extremely toxic community. This is true of most online games but I find many players to act like immature children &amp keyboard warriors. This is largely ignorable if you want to play with friends or turn off chat. Paid killer DLCs are nerfed within weeks of being released. Obvious bias towards survivor meta from developers. Survive with friends is the biggest culprit of this as it matches random killers up with groups of 2 4 survivors who are likly using team speak voice chatting and thats a huge advantage over killers Match making system is broken &amp doesnt work Some of the daily tasks are near impossible to get like the hag killer teleport dailyOverall I'm still giving this game a shot but theres defintely work that needs to be done on the development teams part to fix the issues. If they continue to push a survivor focused meta then killers which is what I bought the game to do will become impossible to enjoy. Grab it on sale for $10 dont buy DLC &amp enjoy it with some friends. You will scare the crap out of each other.
title: Dead by Daylight

title: Dead by Daylight

review: Alright at long last I'm revisiting my review of Dead By Daylight which was originally written back in Nov 2017.Quite a lot of things have changed that have evened out a lot of the balance. However most of the things I hated in the original review are still present game changing perks on both sides severely unbalanced killers and overwhelmingly oppressive mechanics. It's still incredibly hard to recommend this game to a NEW player and half of that reason is because of the ridiculous rank reset every single month.As a new killer you'll get absolutely made fun of and talked by survivors that have hundreds to even a couple thousand hours. The rank reset constantly throws these people back down to destroy people still learning.As a survivor you'll get bodied over and over without a chance by a Prestige 3 killer with hundreds to a couple thousand hours.The problem is that while you struggle without good perks/addons you won't really understand the balance as players with all of these things and experience can run circles around you on both sides. This doesn't even scratch the surface of actual problems for veterans.For starters killer balance hasn't actually changed at all. As of this review Hag and Trapper are getting buffs. The former barely needed any and the latter's buffs are actually pretty nice. Also upcoming are the nerfs to Brand New Parts which are pretty game breaking against the killer when more than one is used and even then it's pretty overwhelming for even a top end killer to deal with if the survivors are good.Since my last review the pallet vacuum has been removed and so have instant blinds. These are huge nerfs to survivors especially at the top end which is good. However...None of the BS mechanics or perks of killers have been nerfed. While it's true the Doctor is technically only a "good" killer he easily demolishes people with his ludicrously oppressive and difficult (sometimes impossible) to counter mechanics. New and veteran players frequently disconnect/leave the match against him and I can't blame them. He's awful to play against and so are a couple other killers. From his stupidly high range on his power to the disgusting synergy he gets with some perks it's almost not even worth playing against him if you aren't with good friends.Nurse and Hillbilly remain the two "best" killers since one ignores collision and the other ignores distance (and also the need to hit people twice to down them). I'm still basically waiting for nerfs on them. Hillbilly is still completely busted with the Barbeque &amp Chili perk which every single one has and runs. Almost every killer runs that damn perk but he's the only one that uses it to game breaking effect so have fun with that.Sadly Decisive Strike still hasn't received any nerfs yet as of this re review and Ruin is still mandatory for most serious killers.Camping is still awful but it's hard to say it's any different than before. I see a lot less Leatherface campers these days during the middle of the match and less Insidious in general. I would say I see more killer variety now than before whereas I took a 3+ month break because it was Hillbilly almost every single game intermixed with Doctor and a rare Nurse.If you end up invested in the game especially on the killer side you'll probably wind up dropping some money here or there to get a killer or faster access to their perks. The Shrine of Secrets rotates 2 survivor and killer perks every week so it's also only a matter of time to earn them otherwise. However you cannot purchase licensed survivors or killers with in game currency they're buy only.Given that this game is $20 ($10 on sale) it's pretty high value. Ever since Behaviour Interactive bought back the rights to the game updates seem to be more frequent and larger. While the dev streams themselves might not always hype you it's good to see what they're working on or looking at in the future if you have some minutes to throw at them.I still can't recommend this game to most. The barrier for new players can be very high especially when certain killers are just so ludicrously oppressive (such as the Doctor). As a killer it's really hard to deal with survivors that are stuffed with full perk and item loadouts with hundreds of hours of experience while you're just learning maps and how to kill people.I highly recommend watching some video guides for both sides and then eventually playing both sides. You cannot be a good survivor without playing and understanding the killer and how their first person view is and vice versa with how survivors operate.

review: One of the best survival games out there Dead by Daylight lets you play as a killer to hunt down and kill all four players in the map or as a survivor to work with other survivors to escape from the killer alive. The game is like hide and seek its repetitive at times but is also really a fun adrenaline rushing experience that will make you want to play again. The only negative issue about the game in my opinion is the match finding system. Most of the time it cancels finding a match that you'll have to start looking for it again so it may take awhile getting into a game. But once your in the game the fun begins. Dead by Daylight is an intense horror game that will keep your heart racing trying to survive or kill them all. 8/10

review: Excellent concept spot on gameplay that's easy to learn nice graphics and fun maps... all ruined by horrible matchmaking (you can't play with one or two friends you need five whole people or you're forced to play with an entire team of randoms) and a complete lack of in game communication (a co op game without in game commuinication... great idea!). If they fix the matchmaking and add in game communication between survivors I will change my review.Edit to add weeks later and my negative recommendation still stands. The matchmaking is horrible (it takes several minutes just to find a game) it does not match you with people like your rank (nothing quite like being a low level survivor matched with a top ranked killer and vice versa) you cannot play with your friends (the game simply does not allow it to work) there are several game breaking issues (such as ring around the rosies created by chokepoints) and the latency on servers is caused by the poor P2P choice. To cherry on top is that anyone who voices these legitimate complaints to the community are met with verbal abuse about how they should just "git gud."Final edit they fixed the matchmatching ended the problem of people leaving all the time by hiding levels and ranks from other players and solved a lot of the match dropping. Not to mention that you are able to play with friends now it finally works. I'm a happy camper now.

review: TL DR I recommend I get hooked on 5 10 games then don't play in a whileAfter playing 60hrs in game I've decided to write a review based on how the game is as of now. I played it around it's release time and much has changed which I wont go in to.I play this as a break between tactical shooters as one of the best survival games out their right now with L4D and hopefully GTFO coming soonThis is more to give my opinion as I see it as it seems for every forum saying the survivors are OP there is also a forum for killers being OP.In my time playing I would say this is quite a well balanced game. No killer is too tough (though I would like them to be a bit tougher this is a survival game after all) and neither are they too weak.I've sacrafised all 4 survivors with a 'plain unperked level 1' killer and also survived as the same with a survivor. Whilst all the perks do make it easier it's not nessasary to live/killEach game is a fresh start (think L4d/R6) so newer players are not at a noticable disadvantage again as i see the perks as nice but non essential.Plenty of survivors/killers to choose from so read the bias and find the right one for youThe comments on the toxic community are sadly true I've died in games put my GG WP only to see the insults go towards the killer equally if you survive and another died he'll be on you with the insults. It's a shame but this only effects the post game screen as their is no chat in game.Too many people put their views on how to play when their is no right/wrong if a killer wishes to stay at the hook to ensure death (I personally dont) then it's their choice they shouldn't be insulted after as their giving others more free time to escape. Equally if a survivor opens the gates and doesnt come back for you that's their choice.I personally am a team player up untill the gate opens then only come back for people who have helped me

review: I haven't played much of this yet at this point only 2.1 hours. With that being said I can tell that this game and I will be great friends. I no longer have real friends as I murdered them all over and over again. I really only play killer at this moment but I have played as a survivor as well. They're two completely different ends of the playability spectrum as they vary in difficulty. I will definitely play more of each "class" when I can. Until then I feel like it's a good buy. The only thing I have an issue with right now is the server load time when you try to join a game as a survivor. You don't really get that issue though as a killer because you actually create the lobby and people join in on you. When you're a survior though it can be a bit tedious to find a game and all I can suggest is that if you're adamant on playing as a survivor just keep trying. Eventually you're going to find a game and hopefully the killer is a good guy in regards to not camping.

review: I wasn't sure about this game in the beggining. It's sort of out of my norm RTS play. That said I have become totally addicted to it. There were problems in the beginning with lobby and small stuff but now that more people are playing it takes less time to wait for a game. It's a very well balanced game from the killer and survivor perspective. I would seriously recommend using headphones to play well as a lot of the queus are audible and need paying attention to in order to be good at this and up your rank. I also suggest playing a killer and survivor at different times so you can learn more about how to be good at both. All in all I think it is an ecxellent game with even greater potential for future DLC.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Well I was sceptical when I first saw this game. Running around as either survivor or a somewhat supernatural killer? Being a survivor was okay for me but playing as a serial killer? So I watched video after video about this game and thought that maybe I should try it. I heard that the community was dying out and that there weren't enough people playing it. I think it is because this game is pretty intense and you can have a really tough time......Playing as a survivor isn't easy at all. You have to outsmart the killer run away hide help your mates use tools be careful about every step you take. If you are good at playing as a team you can do it until the end and escape. But if you're not a good teamplayer or don't like others then play as a killer. Being a survivor is tough many people just care about themselves and do their own thing which in fact doesn't work. And then there are the people who just can't lose. Calling the killer and his teammates things you don't want to hear. What do you think? That a killer wouldn't camp around his prey? Tactical waiting isn't a crime and you would do it yourself and you know it.Playing as a killer isn't easy either. Your abilities and the fact that you can't die are your only plus. Most of the time you're slow and you take your time for every action you take. The fact that you are alone isn't much of a help either. If you are playing against people that are smart work as a team and know what they're doing you can get into real trouble. Protect generators follow your prey protect a trap door that you can't see protect the escape points find the survivors..... It can be a hell of a nerve wrecking game. And if you actually win by killing everyone you are the biggest as***** on the planet. Being a killer and wait for others to save their friends and jumping out to attack them is often seen as unfair. But let me ask you Would a killer care? Guess what? Guess not!All in all after letting out my frustration about teenagers and ragers it is still a good game. And people like that are part of the community. Even you and I lose our temper at a certain point. It is all tactics and strategy in this game nothing else. And you can see it as a somewhat bloody game of cat and mouse.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: this game is a great game. really addicting annd really fun. that is when it finally loads. this is the first review i ever write about ANY game because usually I just dont care. I do my reserch before i get any game and if its bad I kind of already expected it so i dont get too mad it was a risk i took. But this game sounded so good and exicting I had to give it a try even with all the reports about being a buggy game. Sure it couldnt be that bad right? Well... it was. of the 12hrs i have on this game i must had spent playing it about 6hr. 6 great and fun hour true but i just didnt had it in me to batlle the loading screen anymore. everytime you go to a macth making its a drawn. it could go well or you could be facing a loading screnn that if you let it will go on for hours (literelly I've tried) and every time that happens the only way to get past it is either wait it out (sometimes takes ONLY 10 15min) or force quit and restart the game completly (wich takes less than 10 min but its a hasle)I ended up requesting a refund. dont buy this game if you dont have 1hr to waste for a 10 min gameplay.

review: When I first watched this game on twitch I wasn't a fan at all.. I thought what's the point if all you do is run from the killer and not be able to kill him.. After playing a few hours during the free weekend you realize there is a huge amount of teamwork that goes into it.. Playing with friends is an insane blast and if you are solo playing as the killer is fun as hell as well.. There is MUCH more to the progression than I ever realized and you get quite a bit of bloodcoins (used for progression) acquired every match.. All in all I think the game is great and I'm glad the free to play weekend got me into it otherwise I would have never given it a chance.. THERE was an issue with the matchmaking but they fixed most of the issues and I'm sure will furthermore improve on it.. I'll be purchasing it and with the price tag at $17 til tomorrow it's a steal in my opinion..
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Played the free weekend trial and heres my initial impression of the game after one matchI played as the killer well because im to much of a to want to be hunted down. Anywho the games premise is great and i think its well executed especially for a game thats under 20 bucks. Thats not to say there arent any issues with the game because im sure theres plenty of bugs and servers issues i just didnt run into any in my first match. Now as for the gameplay itself it feels intuitive and relatively smooth. My only complaint is that the killer just seems to be way over powered while i was playing him i just felt unstoppable and not once to i feel these survivors were a threat in any way shape or form. Now i know in horror movies Jason isnt going to feel threated by the teens or freddy is going to his pants because the survivors are fighting back but i just kinda wish the killer was toned down or the survivors were given more options to fight back. My first match i won decisively and that was my very first game i just didnt feel challenged at all which for me in particular is a problem. It was fun chopping these survivors to pieces but just wish while theres more than 2 people alive still the odds are a little more evened out. Overall the game is fun and with a few tweeks this game could really take off. I give this game 7/10 Decapitated heads

review: I've had this game since the Halloween DLC chapter released a couple years ago I loved it then and I still love it now. This game is one of the first of it's kind and one of the best as well and it only improves as time goes on. There's still a lot to really be done in the name of performance and game balance Survive with Friends crippled this game's balance forever and having 2 console versions definitely stretches them thin on optimizing the game but the devs continue to make great strides towards good gameplay balance despite what the community will say (performance may vary but i've had no problems running it on my mid tier computer so it shouldn't take much to run it).If the idea of 1 vs 4 horror themed death hide and seek sounds fun to you and if you're a big slasher movie film fan (this game has Micheal Myers Leatherface Freddy Krueger and a SAW themed character) then this game is the game for you. I guarantee you won't regret it.Just...maybe bring some friends too cause the community is relentlessly toxic.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: I have changed my opinion on this game as the Developer has listened to the players and given us survive with friends and fixed many bugs. The game is now very enjoyable and most complaints I had in my review below have been dealt with. Pretty sweet game now. EDITED OLD REVIEW NOT LONGER CURRENT OPINION.Great concept of a game but it's nothing new nor has it been QA'ed properly. Game crashed frequently for me ruining some fun games I actually did have while learning. Some random small bugs but nothing game breaking bigger problem was connection problems making game pretty laggy at times. Damned a game with a very very similar concept and gameplay also suffered connection issues but never crashed for me and was much more spoopy. This game is definitely horror themed but is more frantic/thriller rather than horror. To compare in movies Damned is The Ring and Dead by Daylight is Texas Chainsaw Massacre. Final Verdict Fun game during the times it did not crash for me but barely got to finish most games because of those crashes. Sure i could look up solutions but i shouldn't need to do that for something i'm purchasing. Not worth the money so I refunded it. Purchase Damned instead for this sort of game which has little bugs no crashes custom lobbies to play with your friends without a need to dodge queues constantly and much more spoopy gameplay with the same concept get objectives and escape the area.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: A solid asymmetric multiplayer game. It's refreshing for a game to feature NO way to fight back as the survivors which makes for a much tenser game than Friday the 13th. The game play out as a polished and more elaborate version of the schoolyard cops and robbers.Pros Lots of unique killers. Movement is pretty smooth. Teamwork is highly encouraged. Visuals and themeing is excellent (and haunting).Cons Can sometimes feel frustrating as escaping once a killer sees you is incredibly difficult (killers have high movement speed). Some killers feel much stronger than others (slow ones just plain suck). Some arenas feel fairly samey.Overall I agree with metacritic and give it a solid 7/10
title: Dead by Daylight

review: My Experience Playing Dead By Daylight... Progress is constantly lost. Killers facecamp/hover over Hooked Survivors. Sabotaging is Useless. After leaving a match your Friends Lobby is disbanded forcing you to Re invite everyone again. Hooks are too close together for perks like 'Boil Over' and 'Decisive Strike' to be used efficiently. Multitude of Survivor Perks are useless i.e No Mither This Is Not Happening Ace In the Hole Unbreakable Bad internet connection in lobbies makes the game virtually unplayable. Effectively avoiding the killer as the survivor in a match results in less bloodpoints earned.Dispite these issues I've had a blast playing this game and leveling my Survivors. Earning teachable perks and progressing other survivors for their superior perks has kept me hooked in this game for a long time. Playing as both survivors and killers can be extremely fun but there are issues in the game currently that really rip my urge to play to shreds. In its current state I can't recommend that many people go and purchase Dead By Daylight. I hope that some of these issues get resolved or at least balanced efficiently soon.5/10 FeelsEhMan
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Dead by Daylight is Dead by Daylight Starting to shine Pros + Survival team based gameplay + Relive the slasher flicks as a killer+ Unlocks and progression system (with additional skill based ranking)+ variation for survivors and killers (4 different survivors and 3 different killers with their own customization albeit limited for now)+ Audio is well doneCons "Team based" gameplay has no in game voice chat (can't strategize with fellow survivors) mic is now longer disabled but no in game chat Cannot lobby with friends without repeatedly entering and exiting lobbys Can now group lobby with friends No counter to killer that camps "hooked" survivors Using yourself as bait and working as a team "can" resolve this killers are rewarded for survivors leaving the match early and survivors are penalized if the killer leaves early Fixed buggy game overall long loading screens and wait times for matches Not alot of options for configuring the game to your liking. This is pc after all... (controls audio graphics etc) Can now configure controls (M&amp K and controller) and some basic settings skill based ranking system is heavily stacked against survivors even more so with the 1.0.2 patch skill based ranking system is challenging but the fairest it's ever been as per the 1.1 patch What needs to be done group pre lobbying (for friends) in game and lobby voice chat (lobby can be exclusive to survivors while in game can be proximity for fairness) If anyone leaves (before they are killed) they should be penalized even killers make it so the survivors can counter (2 sec stun from behind or something) for killers camping "hooked" survivors regular updates for bug fixing balancing between survivors and killers and lobby system (adjusting the skill based ranking system would be one thing) they are working on this and doing a better job to bootupdate 1 I want this game to succeed but more care needs to be taken into account if this game is going to survive the night. This may include re examining the initial goal of what this game is supposed to accomplish. Focus on gameplay that heavily rewards those who assist their team rather than selfish gameplay would increase the player base and make this game more rewarding for all parties.update 2 Would reccomend this for players who game in groups. If you prefer to lone wolf this game (without chatting) it will seem cruel for newcomers. Most players will not be able to take on or avoid the killer single handedly unless the killer is atrocious. Personally even with all the downsides the game is quite fun. If your not ready to suffer for enjoyment you might want to holdout until the game is fixed.update 3 As per 1.1 1.1.1 the game is quite balanced and I can notice alot more survivors ranking up. Players are rewarded for playing intelligently such as distracting the killer and assisting team mates. This actually gets you more points than rushing the objective 100% of the time. I'm looking forward to more updates to see if they can keep this happy medium or advance it further.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Opening with bad stuffI really like this game and feel like it does not deserve all the hate but it does deserve some of the hate. Let's talk about the hate it deserves. One of the few things that some people have complained about that I actually think is legit is the settings like for a modern game 2k16 you would think that the devs would give you the option to change your settings for quality a little more than low medium high etc. I mean it does not really bother me but I think that it is an option that is needed. Another thing that needs to be addressed is the connection to steam a lot of people have been dcd from the game because it says that steam is offline (myself included) but most of the time steam is still up. There is a lot more things that are legit to complain about but let's talk about the things that I really hate that people are complaining about. And that is the "You can't que with your friends" the thing is if you can que with your friends it will put the killer at a disadvantage but the devs have already said that they are working on it. And the whole que with friends if you only want to que with friends and don't really care for other players then go play "Kill your friends" if you are only playing the game to be able to play with your friends does your rank/lvl really matter?Good stuffNow let's talk about the good things about the game. I've always liked the horror genre and was really excited when I saw this game. I just love the feeling as you run for your life hoping you will get away or that someone will distract the killer so you could survive. The game has a *v1 concept and the survivors need to turn on generators in order to escape while the killer will try to hinder them at any costs. I really love this concept it both builds on teamwork and betrayal. I've had my fair deal of teammates trying to save me and my fair deal of teammates luring the killer to me or just blocking my path with wooden objects _ . Game stuffThe lobby layout is fairly simple you click join lobby(sometimes a lot because you can't connect or something) then you wait for the whole lobby to fill out in the meantime you change your loadout to make it easier for you to survive(med kits flashlights add ons sacrifices and perks) and check out the other teammates lvl/rank it's a shame that you can't see the killers rank or level anywhere(well you can see his rank after the game is done but that isn't enough) and I think that is a shame because you would not know if you are meeting an experienced player or a completely beginner so you can't really adapt your playstyle(You can kinda it puts you with kind of the same rank but still). Then in game you start of fairly close to your teammates while the killer is pretty close himself so you could easily get caught within the first 10 20 seconds if you aren't careful. If you are caught the killer will most likely guard you while you are sitting on a hook and that will give your team two choices. Either 1 save you (Which will be the more risky choice and someone will most likely be killed instead of you or with you) or 2. Turn on the generators while you are struggling (This is the more obviously choice since you barely get any rewards saving your teammates which is a shame) after all the generators have been turned on you try to open the exit and escape or if you are alone left you can find the escape hatch and ditch the others.EndI really love the concept of being in an old horror movie and trying to survive but I think it would make the game better if they added some sort of VON/VOIP 3D broadcast to the game it would benefit the survivors but the killer would be able to hear them as well.Currently I would rate the game 7/10 just because of the missing things and some balancing issues.UPDATENow that I have more hours into the game I feel like I can point out some more things.The devs have added a mode called Survive with friends which is basically a mode that lets you play with your friends online and that is great if it wasn't for the fact that you need to spend on average 30 40 minutes in the fricking lobby pressing "READY" over and over again. This is a way of treating your "Customers" by letting them wait for hours only to have the host (aka the killer) leave and you will feel robbed of your time. They have also added a feature which gives killers points in case a survivor leaves but not vice versa????? I mean like if the killer gets something if someone rage quits shouldn't the survivors get something if the killer rage quits?? I just want to say one thing after this ed up development and that is the Developers are bloody stupid like common why do they keep buffing killers all the time when it's not even needed....I just feel like they don't even care about the fans but only about the money they have already gotten. Until they fix a lot of bugs (Did not mention the bugs) and still balancing issues then I can't recommend this game to people.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: This game is fantastic. A lot of votes for it are for problems that have been fixed already in recent patches. Hours of fun for only $20. review: When I got this game I was pretty excited. One of the coolest concepts I have ever seen sorta like a mature L4D promising actual adrenaline and the thrill of an invincible murderer. This was also like Amnesia where survivors' hopes in escaping is poisoned with how powerful the killer is.Reality was actually how I thought it would be. There were many chases and scenes period of times where my (real life) heart beat as fast avatar's in the game.I recommend this game because despite the bugs and the current unbalanced state it's still damn fun. Now my warning. It IS buggy. The game is like a really handsome/sexy individual you wanna date. Only thing is he or she has like an IQ of 80. Perhaps you are just gunning for the looks department here so I guess you might want to date him or her anyway.Dead by Daylight is like that. There are going to be some of you looking for a fully optimised game like Overwatch. Even if the game has a cool concept maybe you ain't gonna have fun as long as the game is still buggy. That's totally fine. For people who haven't yet BOUGHT the game I am just gonna list the current MAJOR bugs/annoyance. I hope it will help in making your decision. PROS It's sorta like a multiplayer Amnesia. You can't fight off the killer so you escape you hide. This concept of being in a hopeless horror game IS ING FUN. The thrill is amazing. All the dopamine and adrenaline like a drug that gets me high. And you live and die then right to the next game where you can do it again. The perks you can get(passive abilities) also really changes the game so it gets really fun when you get them. You feel the significance of it helping you really aiding and changing YOUR STYLE of escaping the killer.You wanna be a team helping aura survivor? Sure. Someone that can sabotaged the killer's stuff? Why not? How about someone more individualistic. You ain't gonna help anyone so your perks are just for you to move faster and quieter? Hell yeah. There are many styles and perks. It's fun to actually experiment with them. Have the killer caught someone? You have to make a choice now do you want to risk your live saving the nimcompoop or just try selfishly by yourself to make an escape? It's your life your choice. And you will be scared while making that choice. CONS It's damn buggy. Some minor some major. You know how you click a button ONCE in other games to queue? Then you sit back relax and wait till you enter a game? Ain't like that here. You gotta click it a couple of times. It will still only take you a couple of clicks but there might be time periods where you gotta click more. So yeah you click to queue. And then after awhile you might have to CLICK again. And again. There are exploits to be used I guess this is a subset of buggyness but I am just gonna explain as another point. You can still win as survivors and killers but there ARE exploits. To me I feel they ain't being abused that much so it's still alright. Mods are also trying to fix them every patch and since the game came out it's WAAAY better. Still if you hate the very concept and don't have much tolerance for them then yeah okay maaaaaybe not your thing. Might feel the game is a tad unbalanced. As every patch nerfs and buffs the killers and survivors there is a meta. Where a certain killer/survivor is OP and everyone uses them. Yeah this exist. But honestly most games have this "meta complain".In conclusion I still advise you guys to get it. The raw fun I get is too damn great. And I am sure the game will improve into a more optimised state(give the mods some time they are a pretty small studio).
title: Dead by Daylight

review: I tried this game a few months ago and refunded but then I played it again for a free weekend and I got hooked. The game took a turn for the better definetely. Being a survivor is atmospheric intense and in every way thrilling. You have to outsmart the killer knocking down boards hiding vaulting over things and even escaping his grasp. But don't get me wrong survivors are pretty weak and its easy to get caught by the killer(SKILL CHECKS!) Or you can play as the big scary Wraith Nurse Trapper and others. Even though it may seem "easy" to be a killer you can be slowed easily and its hard to focus on getting all 4 people while they are trying their guts out (literally and figuratively) to LIVE! However the killers are very strong and can easily overcome all 4 survivors if skilled enough. Either role killer or survivor the game is great and should be played. I can't say much about flaws yet because I haven't played the game enough. Anyway RECOMMENDED! However there is a glaring flaw I have noticed with more time played which is queueing for a match. It can be a bit annoying at times when it takes 10 or so minutes to find a match(only on occasion) but when that happens it sometimes just kicks you out of the lobby because of an impatient host or something. Which is fine its just somedays ill be trying for like 20 to 30 minutes to find a match and I simply won't find a match! Other days it goes smoothly and I find a match pretty quickly. But in the end its a minor flaw and it doesnt hinder my enjoyment of the game. Only one time I have waited for a match for 10 or so minutes I was in the middle of loading screen with the tally marks before the game actually started and boom the game crashed. But that was the only time that ever happened and I would still definetely recommend this great game.Edit I have only played 2 games with this new ranking system however I do NOT like it. I preferred the old ranking system and honestly do not understand why they changed it.Edit 2 They have changed the ranking system but to a modified form of what it originally was but I like it. Please keep it that way developers!
title: Dead by Daylight

review: The game is pretty fun MOST of the time. The objective is simple enough for whoever you decide to play. If you are a survivor you try to fix the generators and survive until the doors open which you then proceed to escape. As a killer you try to hunt down the killers and sacrifice them on hooks to the ALMIGHTY SPIDER GOD (AKA The Entity).I can recommend this game if there is someone who wants to have a horror themed kind of game with a cooperative and competitive mix of gameplay its pretty simple and fun. Different survivors killers and perks relating to each one can give you different kinds of builds and strategies depending on what you build.The downsides are...pretty bad at least right now. The major problem is that there are only a few INCREDIBLY GOOD MUST HAVE perks that you will see majority of players running while other perks are okay situational or outright useless. Another problem which is pretty much the fault of the players who do this killers who will camp hooks and ruin another player's game. This problem is countered with "Yeah but the other survivors can just work on generators and get an easy win " BUT this doesn't excuse the fact one survivor is still having his game ruined by someone who wants to be garbage to someone. Finally this is a personal complaint (And some people will disagree which is fine) but I feel using the Mori killer offerings (Or anyway to instantly kill survivors without hook) are just too easy of a way to get an edge on the survivors.Despite my complaints I still have fun with the game most of the time and would recommend checking it out.
title: Dead by Daylight

The question you should ask your self ones you start is " Are you willing to risk your self for the sake of another surviver?" You will feel the pain of every decision you make...

review: Product received for free. At first look it is a fine and entertaining horror multiplayer game but when you start playing it it does not make any sense gets boring too early and there are some major bugs and gameplay glitches which makes the game painful. The small deficiencies give the feeling that the game is still in the development or early access stage. It is good for a free weekend fun but it gets repetitive and boring after a few hours so I do not recommend it for a long run.Purpose background charactersThe game has a pretty simple concept a monster is hunting down 4 survivors who have to start 5 generators to escape from the area. But the game has a lack of proper back story and a has a fair concept. I know a mulitplayer game does not need a decent background but it depends on the genre and the content which in this case a must have. Who are these survivors? Who should I pick? Why are they separated? Why can't they communicate each other? Why can't they fight back? Why they have to start N generators? Does everyone have a master degree in engineering? What is the purpose of destroying totems on the level besides gathering "blood points"? Why should I play this game for hours? I didn't find any motivation at all.MonstersThe only good part of this game is the concept of the killer. Each monster has a unique skill and play style which is quite entertaining. The look of the monster is terrifying the survivors really get the creep when it appears out of nowhere. But the killing machine has only one flaw killing the humans. The monster just cannot kill the survivors with its bare hands (or weapons). No matter how hard it strikes with a giant axe or with a sharp scythe or a massive chaisaw they just getting hurt a bit but remains alive. So the monster has to wound them first then it has to bring them to a magical hook where an unholy spider appears and gathers them? What is the back story of this nonsense? Was it really necessary to mix a typical B movie monster with a deeper supernatural setting? The answer is no.Loading ScreenThe worst part of all. The players have absolutely no idea what's happening in the loading screen. After a few minutes waiting the player has a feeling that something went off and the game stopped or something so closes the game. The fact is the game starts only when all players are connected and loaded the map but there is no indication for that. If a player has connection issues the waiting time gets longer and the loser who waits the end of the loading screen gets only a game over screen because everyone left. Totally worth it.Sounds CommunicationThe music in the main menu is absolutely fantastic. It gives the players a pretty good atmosphere for the game they getting the horror feeling already. The in game heartbeat effect is a good concept for the survivors to indicate the presence of the killer. But the environmental sound effects don't tell the players what's happening around them. They cannot hear any footsteps or cracking twigs. The monster can't make frightening sound effects to scare the survivors to death. The players can't communicate each other via text or speech or any special messages emotes or signs. Considering it is a public game with 4 strangers players it's not a good design. Game SettingsOnly one option for changing graphics quality Graphics quality LOW MEDIUM HIGH ULTRA. Can't even change the resolution. A true horroristic game.

review: EDIT Everything below is from months ago. I have since grown completely frustrated from the lack of communication and support from the dev team to the playerbase. If the dev team ever fixes the game and listens to their paying playerbase this review will be readjusted.I do recommend this game but read before you assume it is all positive. I have put a lot of hours into this game and I am speaking from a high rank perspective.TL DR A very fun game where you might lose the next several months of your life. Just don't expect the most balanced competitive game ever created.This game has a lot of ups and downs and almost all of it is from the nature of the game itself. The game was designed to be asymetrical and that makes it very hard to balance. At high ranks the game is extremely survivor favored and at low ranks the game is extremely killer favored. This will always be the case for as long as chases are mostly based on the skill of the survivor. The devs saw this and tried to make an extreme change they made a killer where the length of the chase was mostly based on the skill of the killer (The Nurse). There was an extreme backlash from the community because the survivors had a much smaller influence in the outcome of the chase. This means we will probably never see the parabolic curve of advantage change because the devs do not seem to understand how to implement incremental change.This does not mean the game is bad by any means. The game is extremely enjoyable and you will have to sink over a hundred hours to get a full build. You probably won't even notice the time you lose as you sink hours and hours of your life into this game.

review: I was holding my axe and not knowing what to expect. I was hyped time to hunt down some corn thieves. Blood was pumping through my veins and my heart was racing as I buried my axe into my first victim. I put him over my shoulder as the victim tried to wiggle away and drop down from my shoulders to run away. Just before he managed to succeed at it I lifted him and thrust his left shoulder through a massive meat hook on the edge of my corn field. "Nobody ain't stealin' me corn" I said to myself. On the edge of my eye I saw another person running with corns in their pockets. I proceeded towards the thief with my giant axe leaned over my shoulder. The person was going to run away so I took one of my trusty hatchets and threw it at the person. It buried itself into her back knocking her down and the corn she was holding. I walked over to her and grabbed her. She moaned as I put her on my shoulder and started walking towards my other meat hook in middle of the cornfield. "These are me foking corns m8 and nobody steals my foking corn m8" I kept telling myself as I thrust her shoulder through the meat hook.As time passed by I tracked down 2 more thieves stealing my corn. I buried my axe and hatches into them and hooked them onto my meat hooks and offered them as sacrafices to the Great Entity of beyond knowing that it would watch over my cornfield as a thanks.It was done. All thieves were hooked and dead and my cornfield was free at least. No thief would ever try to steal my corn. I walked back to my farmshed washed my hands and my trusty axe. Tired and exhausted I sat down turned on Steam and started to play Dead by Daylight.10/10 would kill more corn thieves.11/10 best cornfield thief run down simulator.

review: When I first looked at footage for this game I was very skeptical on if I would enjoy it or not. The gameplay animations and even general concept looked very plastic and stale no matter how far deep I looked into it. I eventually bought this game on sale since Friday the 13th The Game (a game I love dearly) is bound to close down in the near future due to the halt of new income due to the F13 rights lawsuit. I didn't wanna stop playing these slasher titles so I decided to give it a try. "If I don't like it I just won't play it. Plain and simple." I told myself.After clocking about 16 hours into the game now not too much but enough for me to get a good idea of the game I purchased I honestly really enjoy it! The gameplay isn't as boring when you're actually involved in the experience and one with the atmosphere. I've already purchased a good handful of DLC for the game now (all of the iconic horror characters for the sake of it) and I've enjoyed playing Freddy Krueger despite him being the most underpowered killer in the game. I intend on putting a lot of hours into Amanda Young and Michael Myers too. I can safely say that overall the game is a blast and I definitely see myself continuing to play it for a while now.A fair warning to all new people who intend to play this game on a free weekend or buy the game yourself straightaway the community is very toxic. This is likely because of the direction they took in terms of online play only supporting ranked matches aside from friend only lobbies. If you've been involved in any competitive gaming before or you've been involved with any tryhards on CS GO you know how people love to stroke their egos by getting super high ranks and t bagging their opponents any chance they get. That being said I have met quite a few nice people on this game! Good sports who don't do everything in their power to taunt you but individuals who just play to play. You'll likely see more toxicity the higher you get in ranked so enjoy the nice people while you can. I'm writing this review right out of a match where people in chat were yelling stuff like "GET GUD" like they're a hardcore competitive gamer from 2013.Overall I personally give the game itself an 8/10 as it has really nice and addicting gameplay that's sure to get any horror fanatic thrill seeker and even action enthusiast rooting for more. However the toxicity of the community brings the online experiences down to about a 6/10 and since this game is 100% online with no offline AI...well buckle up.Behaviour Interactive and Starbreeze Studios you have made a wonderful game that houses an incredibly toxic community but your work is still very much appreciated and I hope you continue to pour the same passion you did here into future updates and also future games.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: This game is a fantastic game in itself regardless of 'horror' or 'survival' genre. With a multitude of colourful survivors and many unique killers hours of gameplay are guaranteed. Even now my palms still sweat even thou hours played are into the hundreds!

review: This game is alright I've been playing it for a long time and when it first came out goddamn did I love it.TL DR the community is a spread of really annoying trolls buzzkills and normal players. Be prepared to have a game out of your few that isn't fun at ALL. Updates consistently break and fix things then fix those things they broke and subsequently break something else. DLC is fun but sometimes pay to win faster. Gameplay can get repetitive strategy wise its in this rut where you need a certain kit to win. The game is fun overall but buy it only if you're certain you can handle these things. Otherwise you'll regret your purchase.Obviously as per every game there's an interesting community. There's a lot of irritating survivors and killers out there the real pissy or real trolling kind but there's also a handful of pretty good ones out there too. Within your first few games you'll probably get the latter since rank 20 (the base rank) is kinda a mixed group of newbies who are genuinely trying their best and people who know what they're doing and just got their rank reset. Killer wise you'll most likely get people who either kinda know how to play the game or campers/tunnelers who don't know better. Basically there's people occasionally ruining your fun for a game and others who are either newbies or decent. the community is kinda like CS GO in that aspect i guess.Oh yeah there's farm bots too and I'm not sure they've ever been banned.Update wise it's not awful. There have been a few features updates and bugs that have ruined the game for a while. Freddy's first kit the Killer's pickup stun interaction rework the Nurse bugging out on a certain map making her literally unplayable hook blocking if you've played the game you'd know what I'm talking about. But they've all been fixed within a few months and the devs are actually not that bad when it comes to dealing with this stuff. Sure their patches aren't perfect when they come out (even when it comes to bug fixes) but things get resolved. Plus they're still adding DLC which is pretty neat. I don't know about their ban system however since I've seen people say that they were banned despite never having hacked and I've seen people cheating/hacking/botting and I don't think they were ever banned. There's no real way of knowing as far as I can tell.The most important thing is the gameplay though. First and foremost servers. There are NO DEDICATED SERVERS. This means that every killer hosts their own game making it susceptible to lag and lagswitching. Plus depending on your wifi and where you live finding or hosting a decent game will be really friggin hard. The gameplay itself isn't too bad and things can get pretty repetitive especially if you're unlucky like me and get the same goddamn map for three games. When you first start it's pretty fun and even scary when the killer is after you. After a while though the game stops being "hide and seek" and more "run for as long as possible." If you know how to run fast and evade damage you win. Anything else you lose. This kinda forces survivors to use a specific kind of kit that their opponent can't beat unless they're a certain killer and even then it depends on the map setup and luck. Your best chance of living is to have a certain kit and knowing how to run off of youtube and your best chance of killing is to be on a certain map be a certain killer and/or a certain kit.

review: QUICK REVIEW The game looses it's "horror" aspect after a few hours of gameplay and by then becomes a crappy game of Hide and Seek Killer Edition. Matchmaking times are long and laoding game times are even longer (a majority of my hours was probably spent waiting). VERY BUGGY AND UNSTABLE! There are constant crashes and laggy moments that not only ruin the immersion and what horror is left in the game but also makes it nearly impossible to play. FULL DETAILED REVIEW Every * means how poor is that given section. ***GAMEPLAY If you manage to play in a unbuggy/laggy server than you will find yourself playing a watered down game of basically hide &amp seek with some changes. The killer will go around hunting the players with some perks that allow him/her to detect the players easier (this feature allows the killer have easy tabs on all the players) and the survivors have perks as well that range from healing yourself or breaking the killer's hooks. The "Horror" aspect of the game fades away after a day or two of gameplay and by then you will be able to avoid the killer even under pressure. Some of the perks of course are unbalanced and the horror tag of the game quickly poofs away after you play a lot and become a true pro.****IMMERSION The graphics are rather fine and actually some what acceptable yet it becomes rather tiresome after a few hours of game play as you constantly are forced to look at the same trees with the same buildings with the same brick walls and so on. Audio of the game gets extremely annoying as you are constantly chased by the killer to hear this loud pounding music that just becomes a great annoyance after you play for a day or so.*****BUG &amp GLITCHES Some glitches have still remained from the close beta and are still ruining the gameplay. You will find yourself as the survior teleporting around as the killer confusingly watches you walk past him while your screen sends you to some sort of break in time (then you die). The crashes occur in fair amounts and will simply ruin your game as you are tossed out of the match to give the killer a "Rage Quitter Bonus". The Immersion of the game is then also ruined due to the constant teleportation and glitches of player models.***FUTURE PLANS The devs right now have been releasing patches but for the wrong things and issues. They recently came out with dlc to add more clothes for glitchy player models + had added another killer to the large stew of bugs and crashes. This halloween they plan to possibly add another killer from a movie film along with it's given surviors which in turn will only make the game have even more glitches. The devs road map is going all over the places and lightly counters the on going issues that many players are facing. OVERALL I would only reccomend this game to anyone who is okay playing a water down version of hide and seek with the powers of laggy teleportation. Otherwise wait for the game to come out with more patches that will hopefully fix this game. I give Dead by Daylight 3/10 Teleporting Megans

review: Pros * Very simple and fun game design. It's pretty easy to learn but very hard to master.* Addictive. There is a strange feeling where you'll want to play more even when things are not going to well. * Bloodpoints/Bloodweb. The rewarding system is very good. You get rewarded based on your actions not matter the game result. You can lose and still be nicely rewarded so you are not so dependent on your team to have a good result. Of course winning is always better.* It will take you some time until you have played through all content so the value for the price of the game is pretty good.* This game is even better with friends. If you have no friends you can always go killer and slaughter everyone.Cons * No dedicated servers. The hosting is done by the killer. This creates lag and a lot of problems joinnig a game. This also creates a feeling of distrust since killer can abuse the fact that he is the server.* Bad matchmaking. Matchmaking is kinda random. Be ready to learn how to play the game against seasonal players in your first matches the game makes a very bad job trying to pair players of equal level of experience/skill which can be very frustrating in the beginning.It's really up to you to decide if the pros overcome the cons. I guess it will depend on each person.

review: A very fun game you can work together with your randomly assigned buddies to hopfully escape and claim a victory or you can get facecamped before a single generator is up both are completly dependant on who you get matched with and against and playing the objective is manditory if you want to win however that puts you in the crosshairs of the killer and that is never where you want to be. Lesson for new survivors here constantly play the objective you may be the first to die but this is what you need to do sure there may be games where you repair 5 gens and your team has done literally nothing but hiding constantly will not help you it help your survivability in the short term but you need the generators to win. I personly ave not spent much time on this game and this is just what I learned in the first 5 6 hours there are much better qualified people than me and I would highly reccomend watching a tutorial before you hop into the game your new teamates will thank you not in chat of course that would never happen.for all the new killers out there good luck. From your first match you'll be in games with people that have max level characters people in premade teams (thanks to the survive with friends feature) but I hope you'll stick with it and finally crimb the ranks rising like a star before your rank is reset next month. as much as I hate saying this play to win and never play fair and use whatever perk work for you as long as you're having fun of course. that's something I don't see enough killers playing to have fun I don't know maybe they are tired of losing maybe they just happen to enjoy those perks I shouldn't judge.look even with all of this negativity I'm spewing out dead by daylight is certainly with the money and I hope I'll see you one day in the evening fog a hook through your chest.....

On a more happy note i have encountered a few nice folks after matches most people dont bother but one match where it was a 2 kill 2 escape the last 2 guys said they had fun i said i had fun and we all danced about with balloons was nice )

review: As much as i love this game the matchmaing system is ed. it puts me up against those who have all ultra rare perks and offerings while i have no perks. Also devs have yet to fix the tractor spot in Coldwind Farm that people use to infinitely outrun the killer (i emailed the issue to them no response).On the other hand the thrill of being either survivor or killer is great atmosphere really comes through as well. Skill checks add to that stress to put you on edge adds to the thrill. Overall a great game its just the players that often times end up being s ruining some of the fun. Additionally devs wont respond to emails about bugs..... dissapointing that communication is lacking. With the devs and community working together we could end all the glitches and exploits as well as add remove or alter existing features for the better (ex nurse should be able to cancel her teleport should be able to attack while charging up)

review: finally find a lobby by daylightThis is a fantastic game for anyone. There are lots of high risk high reward points in the game that make it very tense and give the game a livelyness that other games dont have. The game is very balanced with the killer moving slightly faster than the victims while still giving them a chance to escape with corners vault spots pallets closets and tall grass. The game has a different style to most of the games that have been coming out lately which gives it an edge when you are running away from an 8 foot tall beast and being screamed at by drums and orchestra.Although the game does have a few faults such as A poor matchmaking system where instead of searching on its own when everyone is ready the search runs in pulses and wastes a lot of time and attention Occasionally getting stuck in a meat hook pole after being saved No team communication at all.I would still definitely recommend this game though

review: Okay here's the deal. 4v1 games like this are always a risk but I feel like this game is a good investment. I started playing during the free weekend in August and I've been hooked (ahaha ow) ever since. For me the game never goes stale. I've had amazing games where I escape by the skin of my teeth. I've had games that have left me screaming with frustration. The matches have been mostly positive though there are always going to be issues with other people. Camping killers are an issue but what can you do? That's just people being people. Yelling at them just encourages them so don't waste your time. Cheaters are around too but I've only encountered one or two in the months I've been playing. I may just be lucky on that part. The controls can be a little weird especially the quick time stuff but it just takes a few rounds to get used to. I've had issues with parts of the map not quite loading but those are usually fixed with the updates.I don't mean to rattle on but this is one of the most addicting games I've played in a long time. If you're looking for a spooky game that keeps you on your toes and you don't mind playing with people (who may or may not be jerks) then this is the game for you. But if you don't like losing matches or getting mad when altruism isn't at its highest you might be better off looking somewhere else. Good luck!
title: Dead by Daylight

Meyers is a really really cool update to the game. The only thing they "could" do is that maybe he could jump back to evil within 1 or maybe shorten the evil within 3 time from 60 to 30/40 sec. . I witnessed a few people that havent figured him out yet because they camp at palats which is a huge mistake against meyers but in a couple of weeks i think most of the players will work it out and then all the hate will be probably gone at least lets hope so.have fun and happy slaughtering

review: I Strongly reccommend this game. About an 8/10Pros Has lots of replayability regularly comes our with patches has an active commuinity Developers are the kind that play that game so they know how to balance everything pretty well (for the most part) I haven't seen any hackers (yet) Very addicting DLC isnt required to have a good time as almost all content in DLC can be experienced w/o buying the DLC (only the actual survivors are locked) Lots of variability between playstyles Players can choose HOW they level up as in choosing what perks they can get and what items Good game to play with friends Environment is dark dirty rundown and dreary overall perfect for this gameCons Killer can be a total and camp almost everything Not many cosmetics You can lose very quickly and in rapid sucession The Huntress existsOverall I would reccommend buying this game the pros strongly outweigh the cons. P.S. I wonder if there will ever be excessive customization such as being able to make your characters unique like the ones in the 6th trailer video from the left.

Can be very difficult to escape. Still buggy and some players can be ***holes for a lack of a better word. title: Dead by Daylight

review: Product received for free. This game is pretty fun imo especially with friends. PROS Nice graphics little glitch. Atmosphere is nice Gameplay runs smooth Nice daily challenges/Things to help levelingCONS Random chase music when the killer isn't near Awful lag in some games NO CHAT during gameplay no voice chat. (If theres an issue on how to mute others then make a damn muting button) Can be frustrating for NEW players at firstThe game is incredibly fun as it is with few balancing issues and minor glitching issues. However in my opinion the devs should bring back voicechat WITH a muting button or put in a in game chat. It helps to tell the other survivors "hey hes camping me don't bother." or "hey the killer is gone!". It would make being a survivor worth while. I've seen some statements about how it "breaks the immersion". It's a game theres only so much you can immerse yourself in. Games like Deceit do very well with voice chat and in game chat and I'm sure this one will fare better if it had one. Another thing would be the killers while I am a new player I've gotten the hang of it and have won quite a bit. Although that said I've also lost my share of games as well. But my honest opinion on them? The killers are way too fast. I play as Meg and still they somehow catch up to me. Killers like the doctor Michael and Jason can be incredibly frustrating to go against so I feel as though there should be a "Ban" button. Something every survivor can vote on before a match. Kind of like how League of Legends has bans. I don't ever expect this in the game but it would be nice to get rid of the same two killers that everyone plays. That being said I do enjoy this game but it needs to have some type of chatting system for teamwork. Also! It helps making friends and having more people to play with which obviously in turn means more fun.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: I have played the game now for over a year and here's what i think. At first the game is awesome. However the more you play and the more involved you get the more you see the problems this game has. The Devs really make very little attempt at making this game good. Their is soooooo much wrong with this game and it seems to only get worse. I'm sure you can find the laundry list of problems if you look for it.The community has become VERY TOXIC! If you try to explain your point of view about the game you will be trolled and blasted. I have never seen a community so toxic. Several times i have tried to point out what's wrong with the game thinking the devs will listen and make some sort of attempt at fixing it. But they don't! Bugs connection issues random problems and soooooo much more.The balance between killer and survivor is just plain stupid. It isn't fair and the devs and community don't care. The killers get the short end while almost every asttempt at making the survivors better is addressed. I'm sure the game will be just as fun for the survivors when all the killers are gone )Making the killer host the game is probably the most thing i have ever seen. What if the killer has a bad connection? Well now it's worse because you are hosting 4 other players. The devs spend their time releasing more content for you to purchase and 0 time trying to repair the game.In short i just want to say that fater spending the amount of time and money on the game that i did...i wish i could take it all back. This company will never get another dime from me.If you don't believe me...purchase the game and see for yourself. Be sure to check the community out to...no toxic people there...noooooo
title: Dead by Daylight

review: This game is a lot of fun with friends. If you don't particularly care for progression grab 4 of your friends and play a custom game with each of you rotating through the killer role. If you have voice comms it can be a lot of fun bragging about how you escaped/sacrificed one of your friends.The minor downside that I've come across is people disconnecting as survivors. I had 3 games just today where I ended up being the only survivor to not disconnect. In those games I must say that the killer was friendly and didn't kill me off. They let me get the 2 generators active in order to open the escaped hatch and each time they led me to the hatch. They were understanding in the post game chat and overall friendly. It turns an otherwise fun game into a chore for both the lone survivor and the killer.There needs to be some sort of penalty (apart from downranking) for people who disconnect.

review: Pretty great better than I thought it would be. Games with objectives like this are usually a disadvantage for the players being hunted *cough cough Aliens vs predator cough* But this game actually has really great balance to it if you play a survivor and you're smart and plan ahead you'll get very far this game has a progression system that lets you get new skills and perks for both survivors and the killers. Regardless of what few people say about how the killers might always win that's actually not always the case you just have to use stealth correctly and always plan ahead. I would rate this game a 8/10 only an 8 because I wish there with more maps or a vote map ability and I wish there were more bug fixes I notice a lot of people seem to be having issues with however. People claiming "This game is terrible don't buy it." Because of the "campers" is a silly childish fit for people who don't strategize correctly this is a PvP game. Players will use any tactic they can to win even if it seems somewhat cheap you can still counter that always. I've played both survivor and killer multiple times and to be truly real with anyone reading this.. They are both balanced sometimes I run into a really good killer other times I run into very intelligent survivors this game is strictly PvP but I like that about this game.. Sometimes I run into children who whine because they didn't get an easy win but a lot of times I'm running into friendly players who often tell me gg (good game) and it's an interesting community to have not a lot of games have fair sportsmanship players I do like to see that in this game it's really quite the opposite of league of legends' toxic community or World of Warcraft or Call of Duty's whine and cry so and so is too strong fest. All aside from my community experience if there was a vote map option and a lot of bug fixes.. this game would be crazy popular. Most likely a 10/10 for most veteran PvP gamers.
title: Dead by Daylight
