review: Dead by Daylight that depressing and addictive game at the same time ...You can play whether with friends or not it really doesn't matter at all because I asure you will have a nice time as long as you know the basics of the game and how to act in certain situations instead of your pants ). At the beginning is a pain in the learning how to play (99% of the time you will be crouching behind a tree each time you hear the heartbeat of the killer) because for example If you play killer you will have to pay attention to everything arround you to catch those filthy survivors so you just have to get used to it and watch the tutorial vids inside the game menu that will clear you some things up.I have to say that sometimes you MUST have a lot of patience with people who play this game especially if you play killer because this game is one of the most toxic games I've ever seen and played. Eventually survivors will blame at you just for stupid things Well If you camped the whole ing game then it's normal hehe also If you are new to the game you will probably get bullied by them so that's why I highly recommend to play first Survivor a bit and then Killer because you will see more or less how things works for both sides.Pros There are a lot of differents perks to play with which makes the game different everytime whether for the killer or the survivors 200 hours of playtime guaranteed Constant tension atmosphere Maps are generated randomly that means that you don't really know where you will play until you just get in the match DLC characters are soooo fun to play with Really addictive gameCons There are some kind of playstyles which literally ruins the game P2P game Sometimes the game feels monotonousThis game used to have A LOT of bugs even though It wasn't in beta status anymore Which at the beginning made me think about refunding it. However nowadays most of those bugs are already fixed so I think they did a pretty good JOB so far.Do I recommend buying it?Yes

review: Alright its a good nearly 400 hours later and I'm still playing this game so I thought I'd revisit all the points I originally made in this review as well as share my overall opinion of the game since now vs then.Cons 1.Community is toxic as f**k anytime you complain about hook camping body blocking or cheap vault spots or any other cheap game tactic nearly everyone will insult you or tell you to "Git gud" or stop whining. This game is VERY unwelcoming to new players who most likely will find the game hard as hell until they get the hang of it.*This point is one the few points that is still very true. This game's community will rival league of legends and dota 2 for most toxic community. But if you like me and play a decent amount of killer just bath in their salt or close end game chat. You'll be doing yourself a favor.I'd also like to mention how gamers who even play the slightest amount of killer on xbox one are having their reps destroyed by salty gamers which punishes them in alot of online games. There's ways to up your rep to circumvent this but its still a testament to this game's toxic community.2. Killer for alot of people is a very frustrating experience I've checked alot of the negative reviews for this game and nearly all of them complained about how people don't fear the killer and will often teabag and taunt the killer. So many players have the same overpowered perks of Saboteur 3 Self care 3 and Sprint Burst 3. WIth the 4th one being the only one that's differnent for alot of people. For example when you realize they disabled ALL of your hooks and just have to rely on downing people cause you can't reach the basement without them wiggling out is a prime example of some of the bs you will deal with as killer. Killers need a major buff to make survivors fear the killer again and counter the cheap perks of the survivors.*This point is half true. Self care 3 and sprint burst 3 are still very meta perks hundreds of hours later. Although saboteur 3 is no longer meta and getting all your hooks disabled is no longer an issue as hardly anyone sabos anymore. That said killer can still be a very frustrating experience but its alot easier than it was back then. Even though the survivors now have even more crutch perks such as decisive strike dead hard and borrowed time. The killers (excluding nurse) are heavily underpowered compared to the survivors and their many crutch perks. Especially if you're playing against swf which massively shifts the balance in their favor. Not to mention in my opinion the introduction of pallet looping since this review has made winning as killer significantly harder. Like sure we had some infinite back in the day. But pallet has down right made enjoying killer alot harder as the devs refuse to do anything about it. Even though it would be an easy fix.3. The ranking system is total horse crap. Some of the more no life players who reach rank 1 like its nothing will just tell you its easy and for you to get better. And that may not be too hard for someone who has the damn time to do so. But if you're like me and have a job and can only play this game a few times a week at most you'll find reaching rank 1 a pipe dream. Hell even when I REALLY commited to getting my rank up I only got to rank 13 before they reset the rank season and I was back to rank 17. They honestly reset the seasons WAY too quick. Plus they don't tell you at all the length of the season such as September 1st 15th or something like that. If they did that at least I'd know how much time I'd have left to reach those high ranks and get the achievements for them.*This point also rings half true. I actually managed to get up to survivor rank 3 before the rank reset. They should say resets happen in game instead of just on their website. Its still a little frustatrating. But the length is always a month with the reset happening every 13th of a month I believe. Its also alot harder to rank up as killer now since the victory cube which doesn't help the situation.4. This is sorta of an add on to previous points but you have to have a level head if you play this game. There's 2 situations in this game that have made me rage to the point that my blood was practically boiling. First situation which I've had just a few today where the killer either spawns nears you or finds you instantly and practically insta downs you and then when you're on the hook he either camps you or no one even attempts to save you. The other big one is as a killer to have survivors teabag and taunt you at the same cheap spots over and over with the same overpowered perks basically aquates to trying your hardest to win only for EVERYONE to get away. Either of these situations you will be very tempted to rage quit which I have at times. Do NOT play this game if you have anger problems like I do.*I don't even remember why I made this point. I think its cause I was and frustrated when I made this review. Is it still anger inducing sometimes? Sure what game isn't but this issue relates more with killer I find than playing survivor5. This one is a small one but this game isn't exactly Crysis levels of good looking graphics yet it is one the most poorly optimized games ever. Do NOT buy if you have a crappy PC.*This point is still true its very poorly optimized. I still play the pc verson despite running it on low graphics. Which is why I ended up buying it on xbox aswell for a smoother experience. If you suffer from a crap pc on this game I recommened buying the console version instead.Now onto pros 1. This game is amazing to play with friends if you got 1 or 2 buddies its great to work together. You can have some truly memorable experiences when playing this with a bud. But good luck finding a game with 4 people. If you have more than 4 people then kill your friends is a great and at times hilarious mode to play to scare the absolute S**t outta your "Friends"*The load times since the original review have VASTLY improved. It used take 30 60 minutes to game into a game as swf but now it only takes 5 minutes thankfully. At the same time this is almost a con as the survive with friends mode provides too many advantages to survivors against killers that it upsets the balance of this game.2. Perk system is great gives you something to work towards and you get really cool abilities that will overall make the game easier for you as you progress.*Still a great point. The perks are why this game is such a time sink as you'll level so many people or killers just to get that perfect build that let's you surive way more or absolutely destroy survivors.3. Gameplay is very fun engaging has alot of replayablity no 2 matches are ever the same. Will definately get your adrenaline pumping at times.*The core gameplay loop has only improved over time with 10 different killers (soon to be 11) giving the game massive variety in matches. This along with all the different maps perk loadouts items and add ons. No 2 matches are alike.As you can see Con list is nearly twice as big as the pro list. That said I got my money's worth when it comes to hours I bought their dlc and I'm still gonna play it. If you got a couple friends to play this with and can stomach the toxic community and what at times will be a very frustrating experience as killer or survivor ESPECIALLY if you manage to reach rank 10 or higher. Then by all means buy it and you will love it just like I do as it's definately worth the $20 price tag for the 50 100+ hours of playtime you're probably gonna get outta this.*In this game I main survivor 60% verus killer 40%. Yet I still find myself siding with the killers in this game. I'm still playing 400 hours later. I'm still buying their dlc (although freddy was a big regret). But this game unless they seriously buff killers fix swf balance issues and fix pallet looping. There will be no killers soon and this game WILL die.

review: Dead by Daylight is a lot of fun to play with friends. Playing it by yourself is a lot of fun too although I prefer playing with friends. The graphics are nice and although there are still quite a few bugs reappearing now and then they make this game somehow a lot more funnier. The developers invest a lot of time and energy to create new things and fix bugs. I don't quite like the community though. A lot of people seem to be spoiled by Triple A games and don't see the work that's behind the game. There's a lot of hate and misbehaving trolling people who can sometimes destroy your game experience. Nevertheless I really like playing it every now and then because every game is different and even players with less experience can turn out to be real talents and make your game quite hard.I would recommend it if you don't expect everything to be fixed in a few minutes. I remember times where you waited for an hour to join a game with friends. Now it's much better. So there is progress and that's all that matters.

review: I have a love/hate relationship with this game. When it works it's probably one of the top multiplayer experiences I've ever encountered. When it doesn't it makes you want to kick your cat across the room.ProsAtmosphere Top notch horror feel. The maps are well designed and for the first 10 20 hours as a survivor you will feel that gut jump when you turn a corner and the killer is right there. Very well done with the graphics and music integrating into a tense and enjoyable experience.Variety of Builds the developers go to great lengths to keep things balanced as best they can (always a chore in competative multiplayer). Overall I think they've done a stellar job and a multitude of play styles can be achieved by switching up builds. There is of course always the meta but it doesn't mean other builds arent just as effective or viable.Killers The insane amount of killers available is fantastic. Each has a unique style and for the most part can be effective. Certain ones don't do well in the higher ranks (Freddy damn you) but the unique list and the ability to capture the iconic killers abilities is something that shows how much the developers care about their product.The Grind and Events the grind is real in this game. When you talk about unlocking abilities or even pushing toward prestige ranks for certain survivors/killers you will put in the time. Luckily BEhavior isnt overly stingy with double blood point events and such so it helps take away the pain a little.ConsMulitplayer this is a competative multiplayer game. If you've ever played one before you know the crowd it attracts. While for the most part the community has been fairly polite there are groups of mouthbreathing cesspool salt bodies who will take any loss/hook/kill/escape like you just dropped a huge dump on their bed and rubbed their moms face in it. From the rage quits stupid teabaggin because they happened to complete a simple evasion or the ultimate rage of a killer because he got flashlighted (which can be annoying...lol) the preschool like behavior will be on full display. Nothing pisses you off more as a killer then burning high quality add ons to have 2 people rage quit on their first downs. Balancing I just praised their balancing but sometimes its not all fanatastic. As in all multi games meta rules. Which means that some people will never deviate from it because their enjoyment is tied solely to their K/D ratio. Which means some cool and interesting build can be forgotten about to collect dust. It also means that there is almost zero variety once you get into the higher ranks. Everyone knows what they need to run by then and due to the cutthroat nature of the genre if they didn't they'd be hamstringing themselves. Alot of DLC Now I'm not gonna harp on the DLC so much in this game. For this genre I feel it fits really well and I have yet to see a crappy one from BEhavior. But it can be expensive for first time buyers. I paid $80 for the game and DLC (the clown had just released) when I got it and that was on sale. It can hit you in the pocketbook abit.Matchmaking System When I say mathcmaking I'm not talking about higher level players versus lower. The largest gap I've seen has been 3 4 rank levels. Which isnt alot. But the matchmaking system trying to balance survive with friends groups and lone players is kind of wonky. You could spend 10 minutes waiting for a match then 5 minutes later get an instant que. It's weird and hard to predict which can make those random 'I have half an hour to play' moments not even worth attempting.Survive with Friends This only really pertains to when you're the killer but dammit is it a pain in the The game is designed around the idea that the survivors can't talk to each other. Hence no in game voice chat. The addition of a 3rd party VOIP can at times really break the game. This is just one more thing that the developers try to account for in balancing but when you get a four man group of survivors all on discord together it's gonna be an uphill battle. Doesn't mean you can't win but the greatly increased tracking ability due to every survivor being able to relay your position to the others means you better be on your toes. It is hugely satisfying to smash these groups into the ground though. So I guess that can be a positive as well.Overall this is a great game if you like the whole 1v4 (Evolve) genre of game. I've had a good time with it and recommend it to anyone who enjoys competative multiplayer or LF4D and Dying Light's PvP modes.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Personally I've had a ton of fun playing this game. As of right now I have 200+ hours playing this game and I don't see myself stopping anytime soon. There are a lot of problems with this game but there are also a lot of really interesting aspects to it as well. I think for the base price of $20 the game is well worth the money. I'll go ahead and list some pros and cons to the game as a whole. Pros Interesting characters and plot (excluding The Shape of course).Procedurally generated environment.Decent Atmosphere.Devoted Developers. Addicting if you get into it at all. Relatively balanced gameplay.Overall draws a lot of good aspects from horror movies/games. Cons Lots of bugs.Horrible community for the most part.Exploits and Survivor Infinites.Facecamping Killers. Bad matchmaking system (host based).Survive With Friends.Isn t really that scary after a few hours (but it can get your heart racing at times).Not Immersive. I know I ve listed more cons to this game than I have pros but frankly for the price of the game it s still worth playing especially if you are a horror fan. Keep in mind that this is just my objective opinion and shouldn t really be taken too seriously. I ll most likely update and elaborate on this review as the game develops (this is based off the 1.2.2a patch).
title: Dead by Daylight

So lets get to things.Pros Fun with a groupKiller is easy to learn takes moderate skill to masterSurvivor is funMOST of the survivors are good and have nice unique perks.Cons Now this is the reason this game is not recommended by me.Killer is NOT hard to masterKillers can Hit players THROUGH a pallet stun.Devs refuse to give an actual unique survivor (Laury is trash nea is useless)Devs constantly buff killer and nerf survivors.N.O.E.D is a thing that last for 2 minutes.Survivors get little to no support from the devs.Killers can quit and make survivors lose a rank.Survivors quit a lot if not with friends.ALL the killers can face camp and exploit the hit boxes and reg for the actions on hooks making it actually impossible to take someone off the hook.Game constantly lags (Not FPS. The connection is always AND FOR THE FINALE *Drum roll*MATCH MAKING IS COMPLETELY EDRank 1 killers can go against rank 20 survivors AND on top of all that Killers get the majority of points even if they dont do anything. As for survivors you'll be lucky to get 20k a match if you max everything.Overall Game is good just broken. Once they polish this turd then I'll change my review. review: Edit Seeing that they patch this game pretty frequently I'm going to change my review to a recommended. Though i stand by much of what I said in my previous review. We'll see if they fix the problemsThis game has an AMAZING concept and really needs to be better. I love the gameplay. When it works. WAY too many bugs. I will change my review and sing the games praises if the creators put more energy into fixing bugs. This game was NOT worth the price I paid for it considering how often it simply doesn't work. Buttons sometimes don't register. I've healed people who have already exited and survived. I've fallen through the floor of the map and died. COUNTLESS times I have been sitting waiting at the loading screen until I realize I need to force close the program. You have to make a new party when you want to change who the killer is. Only killer can be host. Garbage. Your core gameplay is really good and the game deserves to not be soffocated by having broken bells and whistles. Fix the game and I'll fix the review.

review: Well. This game has provided me with the most fun I've had in recent years. The gameplay was unique and it was a fresh look for a video game at the time and it pretty much is still the only game of this type that isn't a garbage chinese remake.Other than that ever since the clowns release up until now the game has gone to complete for survivors. don't get me wrong they were ruining things before the clown was released but it was a more subtle destruction as opposed to just throwing malotovs piles of c4 like they're doing now. As of right now survivors are getting nerfed into the ground with every patch. I'm not getting into specifics about the patches. you can google "dead by daylight patch notes" and find them easily. typing out specific patch note changes will just upset me further.Basically the developers don't know how to balance the game even when the people who've played this game for 1k 5k hours tell them how to do it they think differently always. It was literally within the last month the DEVS of this game stated on a live stream that they were "going to start taking player feedback more seriously and start considering it for implementations in game." i don't remember the exact quote but that's insane. you should be listening to the community the entire time. there has also been a situation on live stream where the head honcho of the whole shabang (Matthieu Cote') told all of the live viewers if they weren't happy with the game that we should go play something else. He said that on live stream. He mentioned to go play civilation 6 specifically. another team member looked at him as if he were insane. THEN you can hear HIS BOSS tell him HE CANT say that on live stream. This man still runs the game to this day. He has not been fired. HOW?!The dev's also don't play their own game very often and when they do they are pure garbage at it honestly. Another reason they don't know how to balance this game properly. With that in mind let's go back to balancing. They balance this game for new players. They release things and people complain they're op (in all actuality they're not but these noobs think they are because they don't know to play) then they nerf it into oblivion. Now that newly introduced "whatever it was" that just came into the game be it a new killer perk etc is now no longer fun at all to use or play against because babies got it nerfed into the ground.They also keep buffing killers because they all cry because they cant kill survivors fast enough. they're mad ethe generators get done before they can kill everyone. Now instead of the devs reworking generator timings mechanics etc they instead release perks that give aura reading abilities to killers insta downs buffing low tier perks to make them insta down like their top tier version they create perks that destroy the ability to heal yourself. they nerf the time it takes to heal in general by 12 16 seconds. they introduce perks to block off windows they introducs perks to make healing slower they buff a perk that now gives an effect that makes your healing speed reduced by half. etcThe problem with the game balance is this and many veterans have said it. it's the time it takes to do generators. did the devs listen and try to balance it? ONE TIME! they added like 10 seconds in total to how long it takes to complete a generator. well that didnt work of course it didnt. its 4 survivors vs 1 killer. 10 seconds isnt alot if you spread it out to 4 people especially if they work on a generator together. Did the devs try tweaking/reworking the MAIN OBJECTIVE of the game after that? no. they gave up and said adding time to the gens didnt work. basically they said they suck and theyre too dumb to fix the issue. you know all those perks etc i mentioned in the paragraph above? thats what they started doing after their generator fix failed. and oh my god that paragraph up there is nowhere near all of the bandaids theyve attempted to put on. Bugs/Glitches galoreNo dedicated server and the killer is the host. automatic advantage to the killer whenever he wants.The dev's wont FIX anything and keep applying fake bandaids to problems that aren't even the problem instead of fixing the main one which is generator completion timing.On top of not fixing things nerfing into the ground and overall ruining everyones fun do you know what they're doing?They're releasing new cosmetics multiple times a month. guess how much a whole outfit USUALLY costs unless its a recolor. it costs 10usd for 1 outfit. a head piece shirt and pants. or head pants and weapon if you're a killer.Keep that last one in mind the most before you buy this game. These trash developers would rather release cosmetics than provide dedicated servers and fix bugs that've been complained about for years. They don't listen to the experienced players and they cater to the noobs. I'm pretty sure the veterans were the ones who stuck around from the beginning and gave you that money you earned in order to continue your development of the game.....but ok.I haven't just uninstalled this game I've completely removed it from my account. this game and it's developers.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Thanks to this game 4v1 survival genre has been on the rise. It is a very fun addictive tense and fast paced. Some of the Pros are 1. THE PRICE I would say with the scale of variety of this game is worth even more than the asking price compared to other games of this genre.2. The game is unique This is the first game that is survival 4v1 and would proabably be the "grandfather" of 4v1 survival horror game in the future.3. The Diversity The game offers many killer with unique powers to kill survivors with (more are coming). There are 9 survivors to level up as well. There are so many "perks" that both Killers and Survivors has access to so you can build your own set of perks to customise your play style.4. The Devs are backing up the game There are bugs than what game doesnt? The game has evolved positively thanks to Devs commitment.Now the cons 1. Salty players (mainly survivors) are everywhere.2. Killer camping (Its a strat yes a crappy one which result in salt)All in all a massive recommendation.

review: I have been playing this game since before the Micheal Myers DLC and its heartbreaking to see this game turn to so fast by the dev team. The devs have no idea how to run this game because none of them even play it on the daily! They're too busy adding dlcs and banning random people for little to no reason that all these new exploits are being used. I have atleast 5 exploits to get me into a place the killer can't hit me in. I can't believe this game is still alive and I wish it died because nothing new is being added like the devs said a year ago! It sucks being apart of this game for so long and having so much fun to see it become so bad. The community is so much worse because of how many things are being added that are just disgusting. I can bully most of the killers I play against and who cares. I'm extremely toxic and no ban for me but with the big streamers they get banned for nothing. This game is terrible now. PS I would not buy the game at this point it's complete hell for newbies.

review: This game is like whack a mole except you use only the power of your mind. It's simple but only a true master of the mystic arts can win. You choose a Killer make a lobby and then humans (the moles) appear around a camp fire. The aim of the game is to make them disappear by whacking them back into the floor. You have no buttons to press and no mallet but if you concentrate really hard you can make the humans vanish back into the ground with nothing but pure focused willpower. If you can make all the humans vanish you win. I'm not sure what you win yet but I guess it's awesome. On the other hand if you get fed up of whacking the same moles over and over you can leave the lobby but if you do that means you suck and are a loser. 10/10 Best mind controlled game ever.

review: Great game so far. Overall the concept is great. The feeling of being in a Friday the 13th esque game will make this a must for when anyone busts out their horror movie and game binge in October. The tutorials covered very basic subjects about the game and seemed to have missed an opportunity to explain the strategy required for higher levels in the bloodweb. Although it has a manual that links you to a more informative webpage it seems a more thorough coverage of all the mechanics in the game with well flushed vids.The lobby still needs tweaking due to all the players that drop and cause the lobby to break. It has been known to just sit in a lobby and have people pop in and out over a 10 15min wait. Not sure if this is due to very impatient people or unstable server connections.Not sure how I feel about the bloodpoint mechanics yet. Some games there is a real challenge between teams and you can score a good chunk of change sometimes roughly evenly for everyone. In some other games I would be able to catch 2 3 players and hook them within 2 5 mins of the game play cat and mouse with the 3rd or last man just to have them camp the hatch and end up with a lemons worth of points while the last survivor leaves loaded.I really like the character progression and ranking system so much so that it was rough to continue playing in the beta due to the lvl 6 cap. Which tells me that even if i were to reach an amazing rank i would not see the benefit so much if this resets every month. At that point you would really need other friends to play this to continue on. I feel that this is the problem with the 4v1 game genre as no one dev team that i know of really apply a solo campaign. Its nice that they left some lore on their webpage and in bits and pieces throughout the bloodweb but where is the emersion in that? Seems to be the games greatest strength &amp weakness.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Please see edits below the video(s) for my latest opinion on the direction of the game. The following is my opinions Just after update 2.0 (Clown killer) was released.Killer rank 20 10 Easy and fun games except for the occasional survive with friend toxic group.Killer rank 10 1 Incredibly stressful and nervewracking games *when played against competent survivors. If i grinded enough i could make it to rank 1 but that would be very unfun and would be very stressful.(Ended up doing that stockpiled lots of good addons to make my games a lil easier) that I play video games to have fun this one is fun for the first 10 ranks but as you keep playing and playing (until the monthly rank reset) you'll move past 10 and be very sweaty after every game.If someone plays games competitively This game is still not fun for you. Horribly favors survivors in 97% of any possible scenario when survivors know what they are doing and that's not even with Survive with friends Playing with your friends over discord gives you a massive advantage. Even with no perks.Marth88 a godlike player at this game has done 300 matches under 3 different scenarios and guess what in every single one Killer's are ing dominated. Go on watch these games and tell me killer is balanced.https //www.youtube.com/watch?v CEB9Rh6AtbI&amp list PLoJokCjX7gozpIVDM1qjmXSC7M1SXSP3C (No perks but voice chat. Killers won 12 out of 100 matches.)https //www.youtube.com/watch?v QeWJcSWe _0&amp list PLoJokCjX7goxDLKGgKtbSAz81yIpy9Vr4 (Best perks but no voice chat. Killers won 5 out of 100 matches.)https //www.youtube.com/watch?v F6Nb66nPbMY&amp list PLoJokCjX7goy1osh2j5jW2bepe1iZAxBU (Best perks and voice chat. Killers won 2 out of 100 matches.)Just find another competitive game to dump your spare time into.EDIT 07/24/18 New mid chapter patch is bringing better balance nerfing survivors and buffing some of the killers but survivor mains are review bombing this game with negative reviews because they dont want to learn to play differently from their established meta unlike killers when they constantly get nerfed or reworked. Entitled little want a free escape every game unlike me when i play as killer i dont mind if all 4 people escape i just want the game to be fun and there to not be any toxicity.EDIT 10/05/18 The latest patch and soon to be new mid balance patch are finally giving killers the breathing space they needed. Fast vaults nerfed small reduction in hook time survivors take more time to heal balanced out by having their recovery bar cap at 95% instead of 85% to make slugging harder. The game is going in a great direction now. This game will be actually perfect once they nerf Decisive strike as well as give killers bonus rewards for facing Survive with friends IMO playing against SWF should not consume your killer addons if you are facing 3 or more survivors grouped up in Survive with friends. After all they get to bring their best items and competent survive with friends players like marth and his depip squad shown above and by surviving get to keep their items. Killers never keep theirs so with this idea killers can actually stack their own addons against the survivors items without having to grind another bloodweb to get more addons for their killer.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Dead by Daylight is a 4 v 1 game in which a Killer has to hunt down and kill 4 Survivors roaming the randomly picked Map. The Survivors have to activate 5 Generators to open the Exit Gates and escape while the Killer has to kill them all by hitting them picking them up and hanging them on meat hooks where they slowly get consumed by an Entity. They can be saved from this state will however die automatically if hooked 3 times. Dead by Daylight focuses on teamwork on the Survivor side and individual skill on the Killer side. It is alot more fun played together. Can however make you rage more than Super Meat Boy and Flappy Bird combined.Pros Horror Multiplayer Game Steep but satisfying learning curve skill based rarely Luck better together or play alone as the Killer Very Satisfying wins Winning is based on Points earned in 4 Categories you don't have to do everything and can specialize in some Both sides can win in the same match if both earn enough points Close to no Hackers Variety in Character Play Not Pay2Win the DLCs are not necessary to play well or have fun "meta" leans towards Free CharactersCons Incredibly Toxic Community that cries 24/7 Slow development Sometimes Buggy Sometimes laggy Incredibly Punishing if bad team or badly played7 Killers (3 DLC) 9 Survivors (3 DLC) (DLCs include 1 Killer and 1 Survivor so there are only 3 Character DLCs) 18 Maps. Each Survivor has 4 specific Perks that can at some point be unlocked by the others as well. Each Killer has different Abilities. Each Character is played differently.8/10 Incredibly Fun but can drive into Madness
title: Dead by Daylight

review: I do recommend this game I enjoy playing it. The goal of the game depends on the role you take killer or survivor. I have chosen to dedicate most of my time into the survivors because to level them up you must put bloodpoints into their bloodweb. So yes this game does not save the same data on all the charaters . This makes even more time to put countless hours into playing the game. The objective of the game if you are survivor is to escape as for killer it is to make sure the four survivors don't make it out alive. You will turn on generators search chests help each other and unlock many perks and items. Now it is up to you to figure out how to play well how to gather new items and most importantly not get hooked. No matter how many people complain about bugs I know the developers are trying to fix them and we just have to be patient. So many reviews say this game has too many bugs and it may have quite a few but it is not like the devs aren't trying to fix them while trying to do at least five other things. The devs are only getting better at patching it and making DLC and what not. Sure they don't get it right every time with each update but I've seen progess beyond belief.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: One of the best game i ve been playing.It is a great game where you choose to play as a survivor or a killer. As a survivor you need to team up with the other three survivors and fix five generators and then escape and even be careful so the killer doesn t attack you and hang you on the hook.As a killer you basically just obstruct the survivors from fixing the generators and escape.The graphics is good and even well optimized.

review: This game is so much fun. I mean who doesnt love running around after people with a chainsaw who are basically helpless agasint you? Who doesn't love running away from the killer to then jump into a trap which leads you getting hooked and then watching as all your friends try to save you and end up dying? Who doesn't love taunting the guy who just spent the last 10 minutes trying to kill you and failing? Yes there are bugs however the devs are working on them and are fixing them and they are doing a great job.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: I've been waiting for a game like this for a long time. A horror game that you can play with friends. The killers are cool the survivors are well designed. The sounds cues and sountrack is great. The game has (right now anyway) kind of hidden lore but the stuff shown is quite interesting. The gameplay as a survivour is fun and intense as hell (If you don't get camped or cheese.) And playing as the killer really makes you bring out your hunter side. (Unless someone just cheeses infinites.) But personally I love this game then again I'm a sucker for horror. The game right now is very early on and the developers have talked about much more content being released including killers survivours and maps. Also the perks really surprised me. The survivours and killers all have their own unique perks you can use in game and you get xp (bloodpoints) to spend on perks and items. I enjoy this game a lot a recommend it to people who love quick thrils in the horror genre.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: A fantastic breath of life in the asymmetrical PvP genre. Both sides of the fight are enjoyable in their own right be it hunting the survivors or hiding from the killer. The developers have shown to really care about the product and have been publishing multiple patches to fix glaring issues with gameplay with greater changes on the horizon. Higher rank play gets a little dicey with players using unsportsman like strategies to win. All things considered it's best to go in with the mindset to have fun and not care about your match making rank.

review: Product received for free. This game is supposed to be "hide and seek with killers" But the problem is that they don't have any proper game mechanics to make the game that way. If you want meta perk builds you have this game. The ranking in the game means nothing..It's just a number as of now. The devs cater towards the killers rather than the survivors. The survivors feel more like a useless paper weight than anything else. The kids over at Friday the 13th's the game Crystal Lake feel more like actual people than these emotionless piles of rendered garbage they call "survivors". Even Bill from left 4 Dead looks worse now than what he did back in the original left 4 dead game. How do you mess that up? You are using the unreal engine one of the greatest enegines to make visually stunning games on But I digress. I don't like rating a game based on visuals alone but however... For this game I will have to rate it on visuals. They said (the devs) that they wanted to make the enviroments as "spooky/ scary" as possible. The visuals do not help with that at all.. If the game looked better and had better textures that would definitly help sell that even more. A good comparison to look at is the trailers for this game. The actual trailers look better than the actual product itself. Some of the trailers are actually scarier than the actual game! But that's not the only reason to not "like" this game. On another note let's talk about the developers They have changed a lot since when I first started playing which was the day of release. It appears the devs at this current point in time only care about filling up their pockets with cash and the once buring passion they once had is now gone. They only seem to care about adding movie killers that already have their own lore and everything I can understand where they are coming from about this Dead By Daylight + getting a movie killer profit/ new customers. I can understand that. But devs.. There are starting to litter up the game. The killers and survivors you guys put out are very unique in their own different ways. And that's what makes them special. When I want to think about Dead By Daylight I would want people to think about The Trapper. Not "that Michael Myers game" and so on. I once gave this game a very positive review I really did. But in the current state of the game you wil get frustrated at a lot of things. And if you don't take my word on it Buy the game for youself and try it. I'm currently in a love hate relationship with this game and I really hope it really does improve for the better. But as of now I can not recommend this game as much as I hate to say it.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: For this game I recommend drinking a 2016 Trader Joe's Charles Shaw Chardonnay. The Charles Shaw boasts organically grown grapes or something. To be honest I wasn't really paying attention to the back of the label while I was using that McDonald's toilet. This "organically grown" stuff tastes as about as complex as a wet dish clothe and as natural as synethic motor oil. As such it will contrast and compliment the complexity of this game.It's weird. Such a simple premise. People being hunted by killers in a closed map. The victims need to repair generators or invest in bitcoin in order to escape. The killers have to capture and hook the victims. But then you have all these witchcraft offerings and whatnot being given to some guy or god or whoever possibly Santa. These offerings will hopefully help the offerer. I know that if i was a guy or a god or a Santa I'd want cookies and/or cake for my offerings.What was more painful than being skewered on a hook was having all of my favourite perks nerfed. It's like they want the killers to win or something. It won't seem so bad but its a real seesaw of opponents. You'll face the same pro three times in a row and then meet some noob who will tank harder than the bitcoin the victims invested in.Lastly I must say that I've never liked a game which will bring out a hundred different DLCs. DLC prices should have a cap of something like $2 across all games.In conclusion I'd like to say that its important to stay hydrated.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: The idea of this game is awesome but god damn does is this game garbage. The ONLY way you can have fun playing this game is to either play a custom game with friends or play as a killer. Playing as a survivor is basically the worst unless the killer is terrible. Most of the time you are grouped with a high ranked killer with OP perks. Making you usless. I tried playing it for multiple hours but after having to wait about 10 20 minutes waiting for a game to start which has been a problem from the beggining then starting a game right next to the killer then having him camp until I die it makes this game frustrating and unplayable. I dont want to have to wait so long for a game for it to finish in 5 minutes! I understand people may say "Get gud" but if you're playing againt Micheal Myers who is COMPLETELY broken then you're basically screwed. I just wish they did something about the camping wait times survivor weakness and just overall gameplay. I reccomend you play this game for 2 hours then getting a refund
title: Dead by Daylight

review: All in all the game concept is pretty fun. Deliver a good hunt as a killer or (don't) risk your life for your friends or strangers as a survivor. A skilled killer combined with good teamwork among the survivors can create a very tense game that makes you smash that spectate button immediately after dying cheering for your mates.Unfortunately the game experience can be ruined e.g. by camping killers which take away the challenge of getting out alive as a survivor if you or a team mate get camped hard there is not much you can do except for rushing through the game. This spoils the tension of sneaky hiding (that moment when the killer walks right past you...) as well as escaping the killer or rescuing your hooked / downed teammates.The devs are more and more adressing greater issues like matchmaking. Unlike in the past waiting times in order to find a game are not much of a problem by now as well as imbalances in the matched players' ranks. On the other hand some bugs are merely replaced by new ones. I'm loving the new content but in some cases I would also like previously released content to be extended before delivering new one. For example further DLC map variations There is only one asylum and Haddonfield map whereas other locations offer more variations.Overall the DBD team is working on giving us a better game experience so I recommend getting the game.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Dead by Daylight is a fun game. However it runs TERRIBLY. The graphics themselves are pretty decent but definently not something my computer shouldn't be able to run on the lowest setting. I know it says 8gb ram and a whole bunch of other specs my computer doesn't have but I can still play the game (as a survivor) with a small amount of lag setting my resolution to render to 0% my resolution to 800x600 and playing on low (obviously.) If they do ever fix the lag and make it playable without having to do a bunch of extra things I will change over. However since this basically stops people from playing it deserves a no. It's also worth noting people with higher specs also have issues playing so that's something devs really need to work on.

review: I still highly recommend this game but when devs are banning killers from camping hooks and the entire matchmaking mechanic of the game is a little screwy It makes me want to...not recommend this game. I get it that killers literally sitting at a hook watching a player as he dies is a little annoying but that should most definately not be a bannable offense. It makes no sense at all. I'm currently studying to be a game designer and I have played this game since there were glitches with players floating around the map and I have loved the entire concept of this game. The machanics work smoothly and it's a fun and sometimes scary game to play with your friends. But forcing players to play your game the way you want them to is breaking almost every "rule" (I use this term lightly) about making a game. You should allow the players to play a game however they want. If they camp a hook then the rest of the survivors can easily get the rest of the generators back on before the first person even dies. If a player wants to camp a hook let them they're just hurting themselves but they are still playing how they want to play. The next problem I have with the game is the matchmaking mechanic. I've notice a lot after playing time and time again that even when I am ranked 20 I still get matched up with rank 1 killers. That doesn't make sense to me. Yes it would be hard to differentiate between players who are skilled that just want to stay at low ranks to get blood points but there must be other ways to fix this other than allowing rank 1 killers to demolish rank 20 survivors. Once again I really love this game and want it to succeed to the point of reffering everyone I know to get the game and let me kill them! But it's getting hard with some of the aspects of the game that could be deal breakers for some of my friends.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Amazing game if you have the patience to learn how it works and improve your gameplay. Constantly updated and the devs have come a long way in communication and game balancing new characters are being added fairly regularly and each one brings new life to the game even if you've played for hundreds of hours. Each killer is unique and original whose abilities are creative and force different tactics for the survivers. The survivors are one of my major problems with the game as each survivor is nothing but a reskin and a set of teachables. Their gameplay however is just as fun as the killers. It captures the essense of survival most of the time however there are occasionally higher level players who will understand the game enough to run you around for about 5 hours. As the game progresses though it continually becomes more and more balanced and fun to play.

review: I played this game when it was free around half a year ago. It had potential and was a lot of fun but there were many issues I had with it that I couldn't ignore. I kept it on my list of games to keep an eye on and I'm quite thankful I did.The game is super fun to play and it creates that fast ending yet strong bond between the other survivors and yourself. The framerate has improved quite a bit since last time I played and overall the movement feels smoother.I wish they could make a different way to explain the inventory system instead of the current "tutorial".I will definitely play this game a lot more in the future as a quick refresher since playing the same type of game can get quite exhausting.I do have some minor complaints though. The character models feel very strange I guess it's because they're all supposed teens? Some pants and head features look kinda gross Bills beard has a weird see through effect there's not as much character customization as I'd hope and overall these characters look off.This doesn't affect gameplay at all though so no worries. Everybody just feels a bit skeleton esque.I hope to see further improvements in the future this game still has a lot of untapped potential.
title: Dead by Daylight

title: Dead by Daylight

review: LAST UPDATE I ing love to hate this game. It is beyong aggravating however victory is soooo sweet! It takes about 10 15 levels before you start performing better due to perks items and addons. The game is not very intuitive so it takes a lot of failure to become successful. After 14 hours I am now winning more than losing but I still have some rough runs. The community in this game is dope and if you have friends who play I would highly recommend utilizing discord. My only gripe now is that the Doctor is OP as . Doesn't change how awesome this game is!1st Update After another 4 hours of game play I'm still extremely frustrated with this game. The art is amazing the controls are okay but there is no balance whatsoever. In a coop game like this that has to be the most important thing. Right now the survivors seem to have a major edge. To name just a few major issues 1) NO ING CHAT IN A COOPERATIVE GAME. You will play against people who are on discord and can coordinate better. This is giving a major boost to those who have friends who play this. I have a couple folks who play and we demolish everytime because of this.2) As a monster when you hit a survior they get boosted away from you AND you have about a 3 second delay where you savor the attack. It needs to be one or the other not both. This gives the survivors way too much of a chance to get away.3) Excape attempts from hooks only provide a 4% success rate. This should be around 10 15% considering it speeds up the process of the entity hooking you.***If you are going to play I would suggest going to the help/tutorial section. The game should start with the tutorial but they just throw you into it making it a bit frustrating at first.***1st POST Meh... there is no balance. My first run I started up 3 generators and escaped with little trouble. The next 2 rounds I died within 2 minutes of start. I was hoping for a horror game like this but with more of a challenge on both ends and no stacking against one or the other. As it stands now I'm not liking the game. Visually it is dope. The mechanics are not to my liking. You get out run by the monsters it isn't hard for them to search for you like the hints say and the meter to struggle out of their grasps is insanely long. Needs more work. I might revisit. As of now I paid $20 and feel like I wasted $15 of it.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Dead by Daylight embodies what it truly means to 'survive the nightmare'. A highly addictive multiplayer game makes this a great entry to any horror gamer's library. But please be aware that is all this game is multiplayer. Characters are fleshed out a little in their backstories you can read however there is no single player plot.Instead the aim of the game is to simply a) escape the killing ground as a survivor by powering up generators to open the gates or b) as the killer put the survivors in the dying state and then 'hook' them onto sacrificial meat hooks for the entity. Every character has their own perks that you can choose along with individual items which will enhance your character. While the objectives sound simple every game changes based on the random teammates you have player experience level as that killer items attached/perks active etc. etc. While I recommend this game this game is not for the faint of heart or anyone squeamish towards blood. It will leave you chilled at times after seeing fellow survivors sacrificed or the killer hunting relentlessly for you. Both being the killer and survivor offer their own unique expereince that encourages high replay value of this title to perfect your approach with each character. The variety of characters environments and varying conditions for each game are simply amazing. Hunt on my friends and watch out the entity knows you're here.

review: Fun game. But I've suddenly and inexplicably lost all my progress... Kind of the ultimate buzz kill...Update I lost everything and emailed them on Oct. 11. They got back to me on the 13th stating that they were currently looking into it.I have yet to hear anything else but I'll update again once I have.Update 2 Its December 7 and still nothing. I inquired a week ago just to check on the status. Nothing. Not even a "we're looking into it."Does that sound right to you?...Update 3 On December 8 they got back to me and restored my progress.That took way too long but they were polite and ulitmately resolved my problem. I'm changing to a thumbs up to reflect my current view of the game.Important Note Included in their response back to me was a recommendation to regularly back up my save files. I'd like to pass on that reccomendation below. It would be nice to see an in game PSA about it until this issue can be resolved. For future convenience please ensure you back up your save files regularly. This can be done by creating regular backups of the folder "381210" located in " Steam userdata YOURUSERID ".

review: Ok I now have almost 100 hours in this game and feel like this is a good time to give my review. Firstly this game is great fun with friends. If you have 4 friends or less then you can play Kill with your friends and take it in turn being killer which is very fun. The survive with friends option is also great fun but only when it works! Half the time it takes over 5 min to find a game or when you do find a game the game might kick you out of the lobby anyway. It is also bad that if the killer disconnects straight away and you escape then you never get enough blood points and will actually derank from escaping which makes no sense and should not be possible. Overall it is definitely worth the money for this game and improvements are steadily being made.

review: Horror in games (and films) is too often characterised by jump scares shocking startling events designed to trigger a fight or flight response. Dead by Daylight to its credit eschews these in favour of real horror a gradual increase in tension resulting from the unshakeable sense of impending doom. That it manages to do this in an asymmetrical competitive action game is what is truly impressive about it.Dead by Daylight features two teams four survivors and one killer and pits them against one another in a battle for all the marbles The four survivors need to repair five generators to power the gates which will allow them to escape. The killer needs to find the survivors knock them down put them on hooks and then sacrifice them to their otherworldly gods. The odds are skewed heavily in favour of the invincible killer and as a result playing Dead by Daylight as a survivor can be a nerve rattling sweat inducing terrifying experience.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: This game is pretty fun and has a really cool premise. However there are multiple things that make it unoptimized. For starters if you're brand new you may still go up against either a Killer or Survivors that should be &lt 10 in level. The 'season refreshes' make this even worse a lot of the times. Once things are done to make sense like changing unhook/disarm from the same button this game could be great. Until then it's fun to play in a group so you can all be frustrated together.

Anyone crying about balance issues and only caring about leveling up miss the entire point of the experience in this game I feel.When you are the killer sure it's about killing the survivors and ranking up but is it entirely? review: I recommend this game for anyone who is even tempered and can refrain from disconnecting or playing in a toxic fashion in order to secure a win. This game can be fun for all and is even more fun playing with friends. The only downside is that you'll need to search for a communication app like discord to chat.The game has its issues. It's definitely not perfect but it's doing okay for the size of the developer's company. This game has gotten more popular than it can handle I believe. People want fixes and it's just not going to happen as quickly as we'd like. Some patches make the game worse some improve it. We all want the game to better and even but it's just not there yet.I recommend you buy this game when it is on sale and give it a try. I guarantee you'll become addicted whether you leave a game salty or not. Don't be toxic. Have fun. It's just a game. Give eachother a break.

review: This is an amazing game concept that I would love to see more co op horror games incorporate. Even though right now there are a lot of bugs (yes there are more than a handful) this game is honestly one of the most addictive games I've run across in a long while. There's a decent amount of content that gets added onto every few months so the devs haven't completely abandoned their players (though they could use a boot to get them to fix the Survive with Friends queue).Now as someone who's put a decent number of hours into this game I will say that the community is very hit or miss. People get super salty over the little things and that leads to poor gameplay for everyone. If you cannot handle other people making mistakes then this game is not for you. If you have the tendency to rage quit or will turn on your team (if you're a survivor) this game is not for you. This game is filled to the brim with trolls and derps alike so either you suck it up buttercup or you should go find a game where you can release your anger elsewhere. I've noticed that most people in this community go with the general rule of "don't be a d*ck" and it works really well. )For survivors it is your goal to work together (&lt that's the magic word here) to get the f*ck out of the match. Each survivor has their own set of unique perks that make each one worth leveling them to make the ultimate perk build. Many builds can be created to benefit yourself or others (or a mix of both). Communication before the match is key to good team work but most people simply go into the match planning to do their own thing. All in all try to do your best and help your team as best you can because that's all anyone really asks for.For killers you gotta be on your toes. I've just recently started playing killer and now I understand why killers do some of the things they do (except camping and slugging 'cause it's pointless and no fun at all). Killer gameplay is fastpaced and because of each of the different killers' abilities each one plays completely different than the next. Each killer also has their own set of perks that are beneficial to other killers so try to max them out and figure out what works best for you.TLDR The game is great even with its bugs and glitches but that's to be expected of a game that's still moderately a work in progress. Each survivor and killer are unique and there's plenty of fun to be had either way.May the Entity favor you in the Fog !
title: Dead by Daylight

review: This game needs to be fixed. From the moment I bought this game everytime you want to play with a friend you have to open steam and invite them to your game through steam AND NOT THE GAME.Everytime me and my friend try to find a lobby we get seperated from our team and thrown back into a lobby or a game without each other!PLEASE FIX THESE ISSUES OR MY REVIEW STAYS NEGATIVE!

review: Game is amazing but I've encountered way too many bugs so far.1. Lost a rank from a killer disconnecting from the match.2. Tried jumping over a window but got stuck and stood still after pressing space.3. Same problem like the window but this time I got stuck while trying to sabotage a hook and couldn't move after.4. After finishing the current game I would see previous game results.Also there needs to be some balancing for both killers and survivorsWraith is fine.Hillbilly I feel like he should have a limited distance when traveling with his chainsaw because his mobility is way better than Wraith which is why I probably encounter Billy more than Wraith.Nurse is fine. Extremely hard to deal with especially if it's a good killer.Michael Idk but he's just pretty damn strong atmTrapper he shouldn't be allowed to cancel his traps and fake out.Game does have some pros and consPros Survive with friends fast leveling (recently added) fun grinding game variety of killers and survivors.Cons Camping glitches killer hosting internet a good amount of useless perks.Honestly I'm very neutral on this game but I recommend it because it's a unique game that everyone should give a try and if they don't like refund it.

review: Failed to Join Lobby...Failed to Join Lobby..."Oh hey a new loading screen maybe it's finally working! Oh never mind it just reloaded the same screen I was just on."Add the fact that the DLC won't show up and it's not worth anyone's time. Don't even bother downloading it for free.That was my review during the free weekend. Horrible stuff. But it did get better. It has potential. Updates are consistent if small. The balance complaints are mosty overblown and overall you probably won't regret the purchase if you can actually play the game and recently that last part hasn't been so much of a problem.New Patch and once again the game is a glitchy laggy unplayable mess. Stay far away.Edit Months later most of those old problems are gone. The people who complain today often have no idea how far we've come. It's a good game. I try never to buy anything new if I can't get upwards of 100 hours in it and I've already sunk over 300 into this. Worth it.

You play a few more games and slowly start to sympathise with the killers. And then you get gud and start winning. Ah the satisfaction of smacking a teabagging scumbag and putting him on a hook. The glory of getting a third sacrifice thanks to "No one escapes death" when they thought they already won and were taunting you. This is the greatest feeling I've ever had in a game. Mind me the killers are the good guys cleaning this world of filthy trolls and making them suffer while at it. Playing survivors makes me feel so dirty I want to shower afterwards.Well if you're a trolling scumbag yourself you'll like this game too. review: Product received for free. I have hard time writing this because I really wanted to like this game / I wasn't hyped or anything just liked the idea.I have played during the free weekned and couldn't join any lobby for about 30 minutes. After some reading i found out that you have to use "survive with friends" option to join... good to know.The game itself has potential and has something that makes me watch gameplays of it but it seems that it's only fun with frinds. Playing alone as a surviver is an excercise in frustration. No in game communication (is proximity chat so hard to implement?) most of the time you feel like playing alone and it is hard to find someone who actually wants to team play and not only care about his score...Graphics are nice to look but could use some work to help set the atmosphere. Sound also is a bit wanky. On my 7.1 speakers I had hard time to tell where the sound is coming from.Gliches bugs quiting killer hosts aside I think this game has a long road ahead of her to be worth buying for current price almost 30 with all available DLCs. It feels like it was rushed and still not complete experience.

review: When playing with friends this game is cool challenging and awarding.As a surviver I'm always on edge. When escaped or saved I can get a good feeling of acomplishment.However.The match making system was less than random. It's functional but thats it. You are counting on your luck even before the game can start.The killers are nearly breaking the game except the nurse. Especially the traper he's too OP and can use two trap to nearly glitch a surviver to an infinte trap marathon in order to gain a huge amount of blood points. When you are the one getting marathon ed it's beyond annoying and agonizing.Overall 6 out of 10. Slightly above average it's fun it's kinda new thrilling with too many problems at current state. Patching speed is not satisfying to say at least.I do not recommend it now. When it's patched properly I will update this review and gladly recommend it.I'm updating this review.Sadly the match making is still barely functional. I got matched to 3 rank 1 survivor when rank 20 and level 1 as the killer May I ask how I'm going to deal with them?There's something else that I found in this game...CheatersThey are smart actually they just twitch the speed to slightly faster than the killer that you almost got them but can't. Even when I catch them(with luck) I put them down they still make the boom sound and they can move instantly.Please do something about it.Update agian.Ok guys Michael Myers. Halloween trademark killer. I'm stunned he looks and plays nearly just like the movie. I lost words here I've been waiting for him to be in a game for an eternity. Well done indeed.Well...He's...really really OP. Seriously too powerful.Why nerf the already most balanced killer the nurse? Weird decision.Survivors are having more hard times its getting really difficult to escape.Haddonfield map was welcomed but a little small and too crowded.BUT I think they patched the damn match making system FINALLY.This game is still unbalanced but now I can recommend it. At least on sale and with Michael Myers. I mean c'mon play as Michael Myers and Laurei Strode. C'mon.Have to make another update.My killer rank is 11 now.Wow the cheaters. Every two or three matches I can encounter two to three speed hacks each match. Some of them were actually pretty high ranked. I've played against high rank survivors thery are good and I can feel it. It's the strategy they use and they can hide under your nose pretty quickly.Speed hackers are mostly trolls. They diliberately stop to wait for you to catch on and start running with the speed of burst instantly. They mostly run in a straight line but trust me you can't get them. Not with play with your food. This is aggravating. I believe every killer will have this kind of problems sooner or later.So keep this in mind.Update.No good enough bug fix and I'm getting punished by decent strategy. This game is encouraging douchey play and dirty tactics now you'll need a mind set that don't care about win or lose to play a competetive game.

review: Product received for free. This is a survival horror game. You can play as survivors or as the killer (4 vs. 1).Survivors Find generators and fix them (there will be a "skill check" mini game where you have to press the space bar in the allowed section) Failing skill checks will alert the killer of which generator is being tampered Hide in lockers behind objects in tall grass pull down pallets (can vault over pallets that are already pulled down) Have perks (like in Call of Duty) to help you run away or give you skills to alert you of the killer Save your pals if they are being carried to or on a hook already Find and open exits after required number of generators are powered up (usually 1 more than the number of survivors. Example 3 survivors v 1 killer 4 Generator's required) Hear music when killer is near (unless killer is the invisible Wraith in that case you will hear bells) Third person view (which makes it considerably easier) Save your buddies if they are hooked Very small chance of unhooking yourself if your buddies can't save you (you'll bleed out faster each failed attempt to escape the hook) Find tools/items to help your escape Escape the killer's grasp if he has not hooked you before you can wiggle out Can heal their injured friends so they stop moaning in pain and leaving a blood trailKiller Find survivors carry them and hang them on hooks to sacrifice them to kill them Has the locations of all generators Has perks aswell Will be alerted if survivor fails skill checks Can see a "trail of scratches" of recent survivors who were running (can still be difficult to follow mind you) Ghost dude who can turn invisible trap dude who can set traps in certain locations and chainsaw dude who gets a speed and attack boost when he uses the chainsaw Can destory or go around pulled down pallets First person view (you could walk past a survivor who's hiding behind a tree and not notice it) Attacks have a long cooldown and heavily slows the killer Survivors makes noise and bleed if they are injured Will out run survivors if they don't use their surroundings Can hit hooked survivors to hear their cries if killer is a sadist (doesn't really do anything ingame but it's kinda funny) Can be blinded and drop a survivor if another survivor shines a flashlight to his faceThis game is fun but there seems to be some balancing issues if you read other reviews. There's some obvious choppy ness in game wheather you're climbing over a window or fixing a generator. The devs should fix these. There may also be some balancing issues if you're playing as the killer. It's actually quite hard to play as the killer. You're in first person view so your vision is limited. You have to find the survivors in a sandbox map which is somewhat big all while patrolling and keeping track of the generators. My experience as the killer is actually limited though so take this with a grain of salt. The bigges downfall of the game is that you cannot party up with friends. YOU CANNOT PARTY UP WITH FRIENDS (WTF WERE THE DEVS THINKING). You can play a private game with them yes but not a public game. You do not get experience when you play a private match. So if you and a friend or 2 friends perhaps bought this game to play it together good luck trying to enter the same lobby.There are obviously flaws to the game but it doesn't mean this game isn't fun at all. I only recommend the game on a discount. For $20 dollars I should be able to play with friends. If I could it would be worth that $20. But since we all cannot play with our friends wait for a sale.EDIT I have been playing as the killer a little bit more. I do not feel that it is completely imbalanced. However there are times where the game will frustrate you. Some areas of the map are exploitable by survivors making them impossible to catch just by simply vaulting the same areas over and over again or repeatidly going over the same path because the killer maneuvers over these areas slowly (I have abused this myself as a survivor).They did impliment a party system that allows you to survive with friends but they shortly took it out because of bugs. The devs say they are on this issue according to the news. Be aware that I did not get the chance to use this feature. This game will get my recommendation as soon as they impliment the party system again.Edit 2 They have added a party system now. But let me tell you it sucks. Queing up with 2 people is barely operational takes dozens of tries/reque's and most of the time you won't find a game. Now queing up with 3 people is and close to impossible as pigs flying. Me and my friends got tired of waiting and requeing for a game every 5 seconds so we just decided to play another game DEdit 3 (1/10/2018) Game has been fixed a lot since my last edit. Playing with friends is now possible. Many of the windows that were previously there have been blocked if there is another window nearby so makes it so survivors cannot abuse the same 2 windows forever. Even then if a survivor abuses even just 1 window "The Entity" (idk how to explain it other than the killers work for it/them) will block the windows. New killers and survivors and map help make the experience better. Michael Meyers and Freddy Kruger are in there aswell. The game has had some good changes and with that I can recommend this game if you're looking to play with friends.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: A great game. The learning curve is a bit steep for new survivors but it's a fun experience that keeps me coming back for more. Playing survive with friends is lots of fun. However the game is balanced around total lack of communication between survivors so groups of friends have a much easier time than random groups do.While the game itself is fairly simple there are a lot of little naunces to learn and master. At low ranks the game tends to be very killer sided but as survivors begin to unlock perks and learn how to properly drag out chases that changes rapidly. There is a ridiculous amount grind involved to get all of the perks unlocked (at 86 hours I'm just getting started) but the next patch promises to reduce that significantly.Don't listen to the people with hundreds of hours complaining like the sky is falling. The game has its share of problems and bugs but its still fun to play regardless. The devs are listening to feedback and actively trying to make the game better.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: I bought DbD on a friend's recommendation and had only seen a bit of gameplay on a stream. I was hoping the game would work seamlessly and thought I'd have fun playing this with friends however I was horribly wrong. This game barely has any options and while I understand that grass and fog have to be the same for everyone to avoid an unfair advantage I'm about not being able to tune the antialiasing method or motion blur as this game appears to use either TAA which I hate or a terrible FXAA that makes everything slightly blurry even on the highest graphical settings. Not only that but I found out that keybinding options are lackluster to say the least and in a game that requires stealth there's no option for crouch toggle meaning I have to hold down a key for minutes on end without any other option around it. Worse devs had promised they would address the terrible control options on June DURING 2016. It's been more than one year and after several paid dlc they haven't fixed any of the issues I've mentioned. I'm awfully disappointed with both the game and the developers and will be sharing my experience with my peers.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: I certainly got my $10 worth out of this game but the initial appeal has been entirely lost at this point. At its core Dead by Daylight is a really fun sometimes scary game. Survivors scramble to repair generators hide from the killer and to escape with their lives and as many friends as possible. Killers brutally hunt for and chase down helpless survivors as they try to prevent any of the widely spread out generators from being repaired while hopefully continuing to hook survivors to sacrifice them.Unfortunately you do not have to play for long for this game to stop being fun. Survivors easily obtain a plethora of tools through the game's perk system that allows them to evade escape and sometimes troll the killer. The party system allows survivors of higher ranks to work together and abuse the killer. Killers are given tools as well but they are largely focused on finding the survivors not on helping chase and kill them. What DbD eventually becomes is a game that is very easy for survivors and often unfair for killers.The way that you play this game (within the rules and with the tools given to you) completely guts the spirit of Dead by Daylight. It no longer becomes a game about being hunted. It is a game where survivors actively sprint around and beckon to the killer begging to be chased so that they can begin an endless series of pallet looping and flashlight stunning. Survivors want to use their sprint bursts to waste more of the killer's time. They want to use their dead hard perk so that the killer's hit does no damage. They want to use decisive strike so that they can stun the killer and run away after he downs them. They want to use Borrowed Time so that when the survivors is unhooked the killer's attacks do no damage.This game has technical flaws and glitches but at least in the beginning it outweighs those negatives with sheer fun factor. However in a way that no other game that I had enjoyed so much ever has Dead by Daylight so quickly sucked all of that fun away and just left me feeling disappointed.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: This is a must have for any horror fan who grew up with Michael Myers Jason &amp Leatherface. Hearing a chainsaw rev up right behind you is jarring every time. Pros it is just fun...it's a sadistic spin on hide and go seek and both roles are a blast to play. Addictive "Ok just one more match" feeling on both the killer's side &amp the victims' side Leveling system that rewards perks even after only a few matches. Great atmosphere Most online games when you get killed there is a reaction of "Dang...he got me". With this game it is more like (while running from chainsaw wielding hillbilly) "crap crap crap crap crap crap crap crap crap....AAAAAAARRGGGHHHH!!!!" Then you get hung on a hook.Cons I could see it getting a bit repetitious after dozens of hours in the same environments. The game could definitely benefit from more than just the single "Fix generator hang on hook...wait for rescue" formula...even if that variation is only a variety of new animations. The environments are good looking...but feel very similar to one another.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Asymmetrical games have been popping up more frequently ever since Evolve tanked it and Dead by Daylight is one of those games that does the genre proud. It's not perfect but nothing is. The sooner you learn to accept that fact the easier your life will be. This game does a really good job of balancing risk and reward as well as critical thinking and understanding. It's not just about survival it's about weighing your options. Is it worth it to risk your life to save your teammate? Is it worth his to save yours? What do you value more your dignity or your skin? The killer plays the game in first person perspective while the survivors are given a third person perspective and this spearpoint of a mechanic sets the tone for the entire game. As the killer your greatest weapon(besides a jagged machete and rusty beartrap) is thinking like your prey. Knowing where they'll run where they'll hide how they'll react to the actions you take. As a survivor there are two things that will get you killed faster than anything else. 1) Panic. 2) Movement. By abusing blind spots vision cones and the most basic forms of camoflouge and deception survivors can evade or escape the killer to live another day. The question remains... Will you be dead by doorknobs?*cough I mean daylight. Seriously though it's a very fun game.
title: Dead by Daylight
