review: TL DR Good game but needs a lot improvementsGameplay + The gameplay is quite good+ You can do a lot of things to hunt or escape. + The target is clear and a "competition" to get there. + With the Perk system you can get new options and possibilities. Some Perks need some balancing / Medium grind to move forward in level system.7/10Graphics + The graphics are not overwhelming but they fit to the setting and game so you wont be disappointed.7/10Sound + The sound is quite good maybe they should add some more options.7/10Atmosphere + The atmorsphere in the game is intense. You will feel hunted and in danger at the most time.+ You hear the heartbeat and will feel how your heart beats faster too.10/10Content + Content is quite okay for the Basic game.+ / Cosmetic sometimes for free and sometimes for $ New Content only by DLC just maps for free. New Killers and Survivors just for $.6/10Others + Developer still working on game and trying to improve the game. One big problem is the Peer to Peer Connection. Killer hosts the game and this is something that cause or may cause some problems. Dedicated Severs would be way better. Laggy Killers and Survivors because Peer to Peer (Matches are made by download region and lot of people abuse this by playing somewhere where they don't really are) Matchmaking not very good AutoAim for Killers. Really? If you cant aim you shouldn't get help by system Hackers/Cheater/Botter5/10Overall Rating 7/10Can recommend the game now. They improved a lot and made the game enjoyable. Still some issues but the main part is alright now. Grind is way better than to start but still takes some time. Updated because of patches

review: Dead by Daylight is an engaging asymmetrical survival horror game that pits four survivors against one killer. I purchased this title in mid 2017 and quickly accumulated several hundred hours in it. The gameplay is always fresh and exciting albeit quite tense and stressful at times which is the perfect storm for competitive junkies like me.Unfortunately I do have a major issue with this game that can't go unmentioned. There is a very persistent and apparently unfixable glitch in this game where sometimes it will fail to sync with the Steam Cloud and you'll lose all of your in game progress. I lost all of my progress at around 306 hours and had to start from scratch re leveling up all my characters. I contacted the game's customer support team via email for assistance however after literally months of no response I finally gave up. Unfortunately in order to preserve your progress in this game you must regularly backup your profile save in the game's files. It is an inconvenience but there's no end in sight for this irreconcilable glitch and that's just the way it is.The game IS still playable even if you lose your progress. You don't need any of the perks items or offerings you earn from leveling up to play well but they certainly help and it is frustrating to lose everything.Overall while I definitely enjoy this game and highly recommend it it is not without its faults. The threat of losing all your in game progress is always looming over you and the customer support team is useless. Please take these factors into consideration before spending money on this title.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Awesome Game. Addictive Fun Replayable Everything a game like this needs. The community can be a bit rough sometimes and the game has bugs here and there but content is constantly being added and there is enough there already to keep anyone busy for many many hours. The killers and survivors are unique they are able to be customized have their own perks and items. Perks are unique too there are many of them and this allows people to play in many ways resulting in a new experience each time you play.Being a Killer is very difficult at the start unless you've seen many videos on how to play them. However after 2 or 3 matches playing as a single killer you will start to get the hang of it. As a survivor some killers can be terrifying. They will patrol areas often and make the game incredibly tense and suspenseful. To wrap up this review The game is 100% worth your money as a survivor you feel that rush in almost every game. That rush could happen while you are hiding while the killer walks incredibly close to you but doesn't see you or during a chase. As a killer getting kills is very satisfying and rewarding. The game is buggy sometimes but far less buggy then Friday The 13th The Game at the moment. The only downside to some people is that after 10 or 15 matches games get far less scary however they do still remain suspensful in my opinion that feeling will never go away when playing this game. The procedual generation also helps putting you in random and unknown environments each time you play.100% recommended you will not regret it. Take a chance if you're unsure remember if you do dislike it you can always refund it.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: As a disclaimer I came to this game a little late (June of 2017) and therefore did not have to contend with all of the early major bugs. I also adore horror so I am totally biased in that department HOWEVER this game has sucked me in. I'm addicted. I'm primarily a solo RPG gamer so this was a huge shift from my comfort zone. Here's what impressed me *The maps are procedually generated to a certain degree so that every game feels slightly foreign. *The tension of the game is fantastic from both the Killer and Survivor perspectives and keeps the horror element alive throughout each match.*It doesn't shy away from the gore.*Great game to play with random people but it really shines if you play "Survive with Friends" mode as it adds an extra layer of comaraderie.*When playing as the killer if another player is greifing you you just murder them. It's fun you should try it. What annoyed me *While the bugs do not break the game it does make certian matches grueling when pallets and such don't respond as they should. *The matchmaking system is a little flawed. Don't be surprised if you end up facing an OP expereinced opponent while you're still new. *Finally you have to patient in the lobby sometimes while waiting on a game. I keep my sociology textbook at my desk so I can study while waiting. Seriously read a book knit a scarf learn another language in the downtime. You'll be impressed by what you accomplish. I would recommend this game 100%. The free DLC that are released on a semi regular basis is nice and the paid DLC are not that over priced either.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Ok... so I can not say this enough!! TRY THIS GAME OUT!!!I played 1 to 2 rounds when I fisrt bought this game and thought "What a waste of money..." The controls were difficult there were no weapons and well of course I kept getting captured. I gave it about a month and I decided that I would get it for my husband and we could learn and play together. I mean seriously... The game LOOKS awesome just in watching the videos!! I am soooooo glad that I came back to it. The game is truly fun and once you get past learning the controls its actually an amazing time. Sure... I wish that the rounds would last longer but I love everything about the game. The Graphics are amazing. The adreniline that you get when you hear your heartbeat speed up... The Chase... Let me just say this.. I went from a Level 1... to a Level 7 in ONE night... can we say ADDICTED?!!?Give it a chance and you too will love it!

This held onto those hopes and dragged them higher i love this game to pieces but the community is getting extremely pissy. They are always yelling at the developers for more content and the devs are trying hard to make everything that they need to happen happen.Pros Good if you like horrorProcedurally generatedCo optional gameplayActual feeling of power when you're the killer (Except when they window cheese)Cons Peer to peer server (Survivors connect to the killer)Window cheesingSome people have tactics like camping hooks as a killer or maybe never cooperating with the team.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: EDIT Gameplay wise it's still fun but can be improved. Wraith is still broken but it can be worked around.What really gets frustrating is when the huge amount of bugs gets in the way.When starting a match there's a 50 50% chance you wont get to look around your surroundings before you start playing. If you dont you get 50 50 of either having the camera annoyingly misplaced on your weapons viewmodel (as a killer) or not being able to control your character at all thus losing your rank offerings and addons which will cost you a huge amount of luck to get back.I've had some matches where I collide with something on the map and my character just phases right though the ground breaking the game."Survive with friends" mode doesnt leave you on a queue until it finds a suitable lobby It searches for 5 10 seconds and then requires you to search for a game again and again. But when none of that happens its a really fun game to play with friends.Once you get the hang of being the killer and learn how survivors try to avoid you having the power over the other players and catching them feels really rewarding especially when you get all 4 survivors.Making teams as survivors and being capable to best the killer's plans is really rewarding as well.At some point the game stops being scary but the suspense lingers a lot more then.I feel like this game should have stayed a bit more under beta. Some bugs make the game frustrating and even unplayable. But when things work it proves to be a really awesome game.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: The large majority of issues this game faced have been fixed and the game is now much more enjoyable. My only complaint at the moment would be having to ready up constantly in the survive with friends lobby other than that the game is highly enjoyable and highly recommended.

review: Two words for this game "Survival horror" this game have a lot going on and every run is a fun experience.Pros Fells like real life man hunt. Here you really find teamwork not like "solofortress2" (TF2) Here you can do a standalone run if any victim is likely to help (some time is everyone in they own) Good designs for the maps and characters Camping hunters is like real live killers. (They watch the prey die a slow dead)cons Sadly no campaign to understand the background story unless the bios for every character and some tapes? (Dint get that). Camping hunters. (Why me and not that dude that pass in front of you HELP HELP *DEAD*) The BUG that everyone is talking about. I don t mind starting again but is a bad programing thing ( The dam jump scar that nurse killer do as she blinks in front of you gives a heart attack.Mostly this game have all the potential to be a great game the thing is the community hate frustration like everyone in this world how don t have a freaking killer standing in front of you only to secure that no one ells save you (I happened to come across to this situation but the other 3 victims lured him out of sight and one of them save me so stop putting Camping killer . You can easily scape if you do teamwork) surviving is pretty easy if you know what to do and the things you come across in the way the best part Is gaining points for doing extra things. Well finally is that I have a lot of fun in only 4 hours and it worth all the money I spent in this game + dlc.Pls do more stories or background story that activates is you do something in game or buy a combination of items maybe a crafting option is you find peaces of scrap and broken story items for more story .

review: I played many hours of the beta and after a couple hours play there are a couple glaring problems I'd wait to be addressed.The MAJOR cons Can't party with friends(as a result people contsantly leave lobbies) If Monster disconnects/rage quits the match ends and you can lose rank because of it Settings/Options are extremely limtedThere are other issues as well I'm sure other reviewers will go into much greater detail of the bugs and balancing issues. But these are the main ones I think people would want to maybe wait to be included before purchasing. All in all it's a fantastically fun game with a lot of promise. Intesnse gameplay at its best. If the partying issue doesn't bother you playing solo is still a lot of fun but having 4 other friends is an absolute blast. Some of the most fun I've had goofing around in a game in a long time.Will also review positive as soon as a friend and I can party together they're not very clear on that in the description and I'm sure a lot of people (myself included) would be a bit miffed only to realize this after purchasing.

review: I want to thumbs up this game. Its fun solo it is. If your looking for a solo multiplayer game thats spooky buy this game.BUT if your like me and my friends looking for a good 2 3 multiplayer spook fest avoid this at least for now. Im writing this at the time the Play with Friends ladder has been RE RELEASED. It takes roughly 20 minutes of re quing over and over and over to get into a lobby. And I do mean Re quing every 3 seconds so its not like you can even do anything while you wait. It occasionaly does the "Cant find game" thing in solo player also (why?) but its to a forgivable extent. TL DR wait until you see the "Play With Friends" function working at 100% to buy this with que times under 20 mins (for JUST 2 people 3 is unplayable) or buy it on a sale with low expecations. Edit Review The Game now deserves a thumbs up for working at its base level. Some killers are much more obnoxious than others (looking at you Doctor) but overall its a fun game.

review: Very spooky and fun to play with friends.Though... there are some problems.Most of the time the game works fine but I have to have it on the lowest quality graphics and resolution to be able to play it and even then sometimes the lag is unbearable. I really would like to be able to see the full quality of the maps while still being able to play the game.On the topic of maps there are not very many but I can tell that more are slowly being added!Hopefully there are more maps that are just as fun to play as Haddonfield. (It's my favorite the other ones seem too similar tbh.) Also more room for character customization would be nice. _ My biggest problem though is that after i've finished playing the game and have closed it Steam says that it is still running. This causes me to not be able to play any other games or close Steam so I eventually have to go into Task Manager and end it manually. Another problem with bugs is that when I try to use the Survive With Friends mode the party moves to the main lobby but all players wind up being kicked out. It's very weird and has happened frequently.There has also been problems where the killer is stuck in place throughout the entire round causing survivors to take advantage of it. It really takes me out of the horror mood when this happens. Over all I truly love this game and would reccomend it ... but these things DO NEED FIXED!!! I've seen other reviews talk about this as well as countless discussion posts so I hope this helps get the point across.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Great Game But the server is terrible sometimes especially when you play with your friends (.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: I'm really happy to revisit this game and see how it's progressed. It had a rocky start but the developers believed in what they made and stuck to it and it's paid off in dividends. My initial review was a thumbs down but it hurt me to do it because the potential was so high. I'm happy to say this game has worked out many (if not all) of the bugs that plagued it at the onset.No matter the role you play you will have fun with this game. The only time you might not is if as the survivor you get caught early or as the killer you just really struggle with catching a survivor/get outplayed. That's really all I currently find to be a con of the game in it's current state. The fact that it's just one game mode can and will be a turn off to some but I think the game shines here because even if it only does one thing it does it extremely well. It's the kind of game you pick up and play and if you get tired of it you play something else for a while but you know you'll come back for more.A big shout out to Behaviour Interactive for sticking to their product that you could tell by watching any videos on them and this game that they cared deeply for. They live and breathe this game and it shows and I think that's awesome.

review: Fun in theory. In reality boring as hell. I don't know why really. Seems like a great set up for a game but its basically sitting with a mouse clicked to start a generator and looking around hoping to not get killed. Over and over. That's the whole game. The elements are cool many interesting pieces are there but the gameplay itself is just nothing. Survivors play in third person the killer in first so you don't really get into the world of the game to actually feel terror. You just think "Hmm... can the guy playing the killer see me in 1st person right now?" and if they do you run away for a bit maybe hide then go hold your mouse down again on a generator until you either A) start all the generators and leave or B) get impaled on a spike and fed to a spider demon. That's the game. I just saved you $10 20.

review: I love the game. It is a ton of fun to play the Wraith. Saying that I also have to mention that I have lost rank three times now for getting stuck while trying to pick someone up. The other survivors even try shining a flashlight at me after noticing that I am stuck and I continue to sit there until I just leave the game.EDIT I figured I would give it a second try. I have had to leave a game twice today due to getting stuck while trying to pick someone off the ground. I also just had to leave the game because I had hung two people and the "entity" did not take them into the sky. I am getting very disheartened with how this game is performing currently. Simple parts of the game that should have been solved before it even got released are becoming a common issue with my playing of this game. I have the feeling of buyer's remorse due to the lack of faith I have in this game going further.It is now 02 16 2017. A new patch has come out that will make killer more fun to play. I try to log on to the game and it says launch error. I try to re open it through steam and I get the same response. After opening and closing the game multiple times I have almost given up. The game is fun. It also ruins my nights. If I am in a surviving mood I have to wait until I hopefully get someone that isn't lagging and not a bot. If I want to kill I have to hope that all 4 survivors get in the game so that I don't have to "be a good sport" and let everyone pip. Steadily losing faith. The game is a great concept. I cannot recommend a friend buy it with everything that I have experienced with it.07/08/2017 update I have tried updating drivers installing the new windows update went through the command prompt on my computer to fix corrupted files and again to try to fix the easyanticheat error I was receiving. this game. the developers. I have tried e mailing for help and received none. New update? DLC. Bug fixes? Next time. It has been nearly a year since I have played this game and I still cannot. Fun game and I am trying to remain patient with the hopes that a fix will eventually come. I now consider my library on steam one less because of this game. I've put 30$ into this game put +300$ into updating my graphics card and power supply JUST TO PLAY THIS GAME and now I cannot. If anyone asks me about this game I will give severe harshness towards it. Last and without regret this game.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: i can't join if i be survivor and how to change the server
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Edit This game added a ping indicator as a survivor before entering a game. That's all that we ever needed. This is a great game that was plagued by a faulty infrastructure. We've gotten some updates and fixes as well as some additions to help cope with it. It's playable now.This is a really fun game. Great concept great replayability. I can't in good conscience recommend it to people in general though. The peer to peer hosting is just atrocious. Game constantly hangs at loading screens requiring a force end task people disconnect from 45% of your games game immediately kicks you to the survivor menu as soon as you enter a lobby or you rubber band everywhere if you even manage to get into a game. They want to make this game competitive they need to front the money for some good dedicated servers for match hosting. One quick solution to avoid these issues is to just play as a killer. I get wonderful games when I do nobody dcs everyone is having a good old time. Unfortunately the sole determination as to who you are matched against is rank not your character's level. So once you start winning some games as a killer it will begin to match you with people with maxed out survivor levels making it nigh impossible to ever catch and find them. I'm not sure why this game needs a ranked matchmaking system it is certainly not a very competitive game insofar as being considered an esport. So many lame mechanics that people can abuse. Just another way esport/twitch are fundamentally ruining potentially wonderful games by making developers feel like they need to make their games "esport MLG competitive."Fix the hosting problems and this game is great regardless of the matchmaking issues.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: *The original review is lower down*13 09 2017 The game is now much more stable in terms of grind and playthrough and with the shrine system it makes it easier for players to get an upper hand if they get the needed gems it's once again worth a buy.AS OF 1.1.0 The developers keep pushing onward in polishing their game and giving it a proper shine and even granted us a FREE DLC for The Nurse and Nea characters there's a lot I like about how the game is right now from playing and customizing your own characters with a good assortment of perks and now includingly one that shows the entire team if someone is being a Lazy susan and isn't trying to help unhook someone.HOWEVER I will now touch PERSISTING PROBLEMS 1 The matchmaking is still just "Press Join" and await for an open room and hoping you get one without lag.2 The GRINDING. Oh boy bittersweet word that may be grinding is now harder in the game and even more so it feels very slow the higher levels you reach it'll take you nearly a month if not a "cave dweller" to get 3 characters all to level 30 wich is in the game truly starts taking a new shape so far I feel there should be timed boosters during the weekends or during certain weeks and these could be announced therefore dragging more players back into playing 'cause "Oh I get TRIPLE the points!?" or at the very least let us risk BUYING Blood Point boosters as DLC there isn't much wrong to it the game is still played and whoever levels faster will eventually land with players of either equal skill or levels offer a mask or something with it just as an excuse Payday 2 did it for a good while and people ended up enjoying a good handful of the DLC's even when they just added more cosmetics and minor accessory tweaks.For short the game continues to deliver good times but it does go from a nicely paced jog to a slog and crawl through the later parts of it. I think something like the timed "à la MGS V" BP boosts or "Shark Card" DLC's could be beneficial! ( Original Review written in version 1.0.1)The survivors are granted more chances of succeeding than a killer over the fact you can vault windowsills without these being on a cooldown like for example if the window came down and prevented that hole to be used or the fact since the killer cant climb over chest high obstacles a survivor can theoretically run around a tank tread in the farmstead per say indefinitely thus turning what could be an interesting chase into a joke this isn't me being salty it's seeing a proof of read actually being applied in the game itself.The game is good so far it's VERY cathartic to be able to overcome odds in this game but as it stands the survivors are of 1.0.1 have the upper hand but am looking forward to further balances in the next updates.ONE. STRONG. POINT I WILL TOUCH. The game has people abusing already of things such as speed hacks (this luckily so far being rare you'll mostly find foreign eastern players doing this) they're not unkillable just they jitter around constantly so play it smart and there WILL BE a good time to get them. Death first and foremost to these sacks of S.h.i.t. but what can you do really?If you find any of these people report them at your leisure.

review: This game has the potential to be the single best game that anyone in their right mind has ever played. Unfortunately it has been ruined by a man who by his own admission sniffs underwear both used and unused all day. His partner in crime for this gruesome debacle of which a likeness has never before been seen is another man who gets second dibs on said underwear. While engaging in perverse debauchery they dream up ideas that a Pre School Nursery class tutored by dogs and graded by the UK Office for Standards in Education Children's Services and Skills as "Excessively Deficient" would take one look at and produce the large red "Denied" stamp before applying said stamp to the skull of these clowns.Their idea for creating "a Killer who will be so OP" could not have been further from the intended had it been designed by Ben Brode himself with the exception of an extremely overpowered bugged farming tool which was patched out a week later thus making said OP pick only slightly less and current bottom tiered Wraith. Meanwhile they allow other killers to go with balance akin to that of a fully armed Trident Nuclear Missile versus a Shepherd armed only with a handful of leaves and a bent twig.You'd assume that with a rival around the corner that you would be doing everything in your power to ensure that your product was top of the line the highest grade the best around. Instead they seem to have heavily banked on the idea that because their game is so it will have scared away not only the competitors of such games but also the playerbase thus creating a self depricating monopoly whereby the only userbase they have left are those who have not yet perfected the art of pepperoni nipples for their Deviantart pornography page.All in all the approach to bugfixing in this game appears to be "HAHA WHAT BUGS?!". There is no real Anti Cheat making it a simple case of turning off the Steam Cloud to avoid Easy Anti Cheat bans and due to the lack of dedicated servers you can only be matched with someone on the surface of the moon. Therefore making it easily the best game I have ever played. My last stream of this game broke the all time viewer record with a peak of 2 when I checked the quality of the stream with my phone and it gave me another viewer.My Rating for this game? 10/10 would catch the turd with my mouth again.

review: *edit 3* June 2017They unlocked everything for kill your friends mode (a mode that lets you have private matches with people on your friends list).With this you dont have to worry about grinding for the right perks and equiptment to do well against your friends.In my oppinion this feature solidifys this game into the category of timeless classic.because of its peer to peer connection and this feature it is future proof.Ill enjoy playing this for many years with my friends.*edit 2* December 2016If there is one thing any game played online with random people have in common its that the games themselves are great its people that are the real buzzkills.I still say this game is better enjoyed with friends only because friends generally wont attack you because they lost. friends generally treat eachother with at least some level of respect.If you dont mind or even enjoy the bitter comments from random people then online play is perfect for you. Im pretty sure only league of legends and the great salt lake rivals the amount of salt generated from this game's players.A lot of the infinites have been fixed and they even added a mechanic to stop it completely by giving windows a cooldown if used often closing them temporarily by the spider god.As of right now the devs are working on camping.Despite the unpleasable fanbase the devs have been working quite persistently to fix the problems introduced and discovered by players themselves.A large enough sample size will always make the flaws stand out more.Overall its still a fantastic game. There really are only 3 other games like it and they wont even come out until next october (2017)*edit*The salt content in this game is deliciously high.It doesnt matter which side you are on someone is going to be salty about something.Its a fantastic game.It reminds me a lot of a party game people would play on early fps games called "Jason"Besides a couple of issues that will be fixed next patch I find this game to be really well balanced.The worst part is people though because people are generally terrible and selfish they dont like working together.As killer my only complaint is the window hoping (which will be fixed next patch).My main complaint as survivor is people and you cant change people.Next patch is also going to bring in the "survive with friends" feature which the lack of is the cause of most of the negative reviews. Every rare while you run into an honorable opponent and this game really shines through its flaws.Its a fantastic game and I recommend it to everyone who enjoys this type of game.

review: 2017 REVIEW The game is now MUCH more playable than when I first reviewed the game and the developers have fixed most of the issues I ever had especially the stupid ready up problem that everyone used to have only problem I stil have is the incredible unbalanced matchmaking in the game. This is the only remaining issue I think that still exists but apart from this small hiccup the game is now really enjoyable. The constantly readying up is not much of an issue anymore. I can finally recommend this game to my friends and be able to sleep at night.OLD REVIEW TL DR Ready up simulator 2016Great game but the amount of glitches and bugs ruin it. Needs some reworking with the characters and perks. Dwhite needs a huge buff because lets face it he's absolutely worthless. Also matchmaking in this game is T TOTALLY TERRIBLE. Yesterday (July 25 2016) I literally spent 3 hours total trying to find games yesterday. And when I did find a game against a killer it would be a killer of much higher rank or lower. It is VERY rare to find a game against an even opponent. I cannot recommend a game that I spent more time hitting the ready up button than playing the actual game. (No there is no queue to finding a game so you have to press ready up after every 5 seconds because there's never any matches found when playing with friends) so basically you need to macro an auto clicker to click ready up for you if you want to try to play with 4 friends.

But I really like the "mechanics" of the game simple and thrilling and not something you've seen a million times. Also I do think it is decently balanced (again maybe moreso now than before).UPDATE New bug showed up making the game unplayable. Tons and tons of people are getting kicked for cheating. Supposedly it's EasyAntiCheat but the game makers are ultimately responsible if they use a service that makes it unplayable for normal players. It's a disaster.Other bugs continued to be frustrating and still happen as much as they ever do despite patches and tons of "new features" without fixes to the very problematic bugs. It's a real shame.

review: Dead by Daylight is an extremely fun multiplayer horror survival game. The mechanics of the game are well thought out and puts an interesting twist on survival games. That being said many of this games beautiful features are demolished by it's crippling bugs and exploits. Many times if you are queueing up with more than yourself you are going to have to wait for over 5 minutes to find a match. Once you do find a match there is a fifty fifty chance the host which is the killer has very bad internet speed or lives too far away from you to make the match enjoyable. Also some of the very mechanics that I applauded the creators on end up being broken. An example being jumping over a window many times results in the killer getting a free hit or sometimes two on your character. I conclude that this game has great potential and exciting gameplay for both killer and survivor and I am willing to to look past many of the flaws it contains. I will continue to play this game as a murderous hunter or as the terrified survivor. 7/10
title: Dead by Daylight

Old Review Not recommendedIt's a great concept but the devs seem more interested in adding content than making the game run well or even at all.Last patch I couldn't get into a session with any number of friends. Now the game doesn't launch a second time (some file keeps getting deleted and I have to verify cache everytime for it to fix it).Until the devs show they are serious about making it run WELL I can't recommend this as it will be just another dead title by the end of 2017.

review: It only took me two hours to see that at present this game is simply not fun. It appears that much of what I hated comes from recent changes so this may (hopefully) change in the future.The core issue is that Killers aren't scary and they aren't fun to play. They've been de fanged to the point where seasoned players dance around them in the game and there's little that the Killer can do. I only played 3 games as the Killer the whole reason I bought this game was to play the Killer and in every game there were players taking advantage of cheap tactics over powered Survivor bonus items and the Killer's absolutely tiny hitbox.For me at least the fact that the Killers aren't scary means that playing as a Survivor isn't any fun either. I play to win but the challenge is what I want and there simply isn't much challenge unless you the player restrict yourself to 'fairness' when you play as a Survivor. I thought my games as a Survivor went well because everyone was new to the game so the Killers I faced didn't know what was going on. Then I switched to Killer and I realized that it was because playing the Killer is lame and any half decent Survivor can spit in your face dance around your body and then skip away after you swing and miss.Until Dead by Daylight puts the "kill' back in Killer I suggest you avoid this. I'll update my review if they fix what they apparently broke not so long ago.

review: I only have a few hours logged into the game so far but I can honestly say this has become my current favorite game and is usually what I load up to both begin and end my day with (hopefully not dead). With that said there's a few things I'd like to see fixed myself.1. Matchmaking can be horrendous at times. When queing for a game constantly get the no network found error and it closes the game completely. If you do connect you get kicked from your party and sent back to the home lobby about 10% of the time.2. Keep consistent groupings. One thing I dislike is having to send invites after every game to friends I play with on the regular. If I play 20 games in a day I have to make 60+ or so groups (due to the above as its not just me these problems affect but my group mates also)3. Latest patch penalizes Disconnects heavily. Usually that would be a good thing but I had a game as a survivor earlier today where the killer disconnected almost instantly and we got the escape status screen. We got points for escaping but I lost a rank pip due to not reaching a certain score. So if Salty Killers really wanted to just troll a group of survivors they could just exit the game at the start and possibly cause them to lose rank. Maybe they dont like some of the offerings or survivor choices who knows the mind of a killer?And just as a preference maybe a few emotes to communicate with your team. Currently the community has adapted a crouch spam as a way of getting attention and such. Maybe even a proximity voice ... and to balance it out a bit you could make it so that proximity voice / emotes can be heard by proximity killers.I'd also like the ability to be able to have a group que as survivors and killers in the matchmaking. Randomize the killer if multiple people choose the role. Sometimes I want to be able to kill my friends (im such a good buddy) but dislike the idea of having to 1v1.

review: Short Review Pros Fun scary gameplay! The devs know how to make good first and third person contolls and animations. The most terrifying experience ever! (For the first 2 3 hours you play it.) Fun to play as both humans and killers/monsters!Cons Issues connecting to lobbys with players in them LOTS OF THEM! (But when you finaly get into a game the game plays fine.) After the first 2 4 hours of gameplay the scares slowly start to ware off. (Though with all games the scares will ware off sometime.)Final Score 7.5Long detailed review Ok I dont know what I should do give it a recommended score for amazing fun pvp gameplay or not recommended for alot of the time being unable to get into a game. When I get into a game it gives me as many cant connect to server messages as possible or it works but no one ever joins even though I know there are alot of other people playing and some one should connect. And then I go to play as monster and people join in 5 seconds. Its always either no one joins when you play as monster or no one joins when you play is human. And they never both work. Its one or the other. This games lobby is your enemy!Buy my god it is fun to play the days when it works! The third person (when you play as human) and first person (when you play as monster) cameras work great. The controlls are easy too. And playing as humans and monsters/killers is really fun.The only other thing is that I wish being in first person or third person should be a server setting that the lobby creator sets so that depending on what the lobby creator wants the humans and monsters can be in first or third person. And then players and search for what the players want being in third or first person. But all in all I think that they should just make all of that kind of stuff server options.Final score 7.5/10If and when they fix networking issues I think you should get this game for around maybe 15 dollars but if you have an itch for a game like this then get it on sale for now 10 bucks. Untill they fix the networking issues its not worth more than ten bucks again even still it should only be something like 15 bucks.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: As far as a competitive asymmetric game goes this by far is one of the best games I've played in that regard. It uses enough mechanics to allow a deadly game of cat and mouse between a killer and 4 victims who have no means to fight back directly other then distract juke blind or stun the killer.The killer starts the game with the hardest or easiest task chasing down each survivor which gets easier up until the last person alive provided some generators have been completed. The killer uses their abilities to hunt the survivors down and knock them to the ground so they can be picked up and offered as a sacrfice to the entity on a hook. What often is hard for the survivors is to remain hidden and elude the killer which becomes harder to do as the match progresses on. Each generator completed makes one less generator to work on and activate to escape which involves less patrolling for the killer themselves to maintain. The game goes into a deeper gameplay when one of the survivors is caught because then it becomes a struggle of rescuing the person or leaving them to die which gives you one less person to depend on for your escape.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: I think the killer "Hag" is supposed to be weakened because of its trap.I mean you can touch off a clip trap only with hand and can easily see it when focused. But we almost cant discover or distroy a trap of Hag without a torch.Obviously its impossible for player to bring torch in each game just because of a low possibility that they meet a Hag. This results in the invincibility of an invisible trap.And Hag can even move to its trap when necessary which makes saving and repairing more difficult . Both of hag and nurse can move in distance but nurse still need to find survivor herself but hag's trap will tell it the location of survivors and move suddenly.Although the the distance of trap is limited hag can still know the location and go there thats too easy for killlerplayers.Its tooooo unfair for other killer or players.Compared to other killers i think hag is much more powerful and agressive . when most players find the ability of hag so strong and the ability can bring them victory easily the balance of dead by daylight will be broken soon.I write so much because i like this game and want it to be better. When i play a survivor who was killed by killer i will say the killer plays well. But when the killer is hag I only feel that the game was destroyed totally. Maybe the player is good too but the killer itself is so disguisting.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Pros Fun gameplay. Spooky atmosphere. Great character design. Best multiplayer horror game yet. Lots of giggles. Interesting perk system. Ranking system so you play with/against people with relatively the same skill level as you. Can get VERY intense. Jukes. Terrifyingly hilarious glitches.Cons Killer is host (P2P connection) so if he has crap internet it's GG. Lose items if Killer leaves as a match starts. Lots of disconnects. Killers camp a lot. Game gets glitchy from time to time. TERRIBLY OPTIMIZED. Sometimes takes forever to find a match. Matchmaking sucks a** most of the time. Rage quitters. If one survivor leaves early game it can ruin the whole game.OverallI really enjoy this game despite the bugs connection issues and unoptimized graphics. It's fun from the core if you can get past all the issues surrounding it.Go ahead buy it. Give it a shot and see if you like it.

review: A really fun game both alone and with friends. But though I haven't been playing all that much yet there seems to be one flaw that might damage it in the long run the lack of killers. When I play survivor alone I get a queue time sometimes over 10 mins if I get to a lobby at all. As killer I get a match within ten seconds.There are probably many reasons for this problem but the biggest one imo is the community. Firstly when you get into a match as a new(b) killer the first thing you notice in the after game lobby screen is that all the survivors are 15+ most of them lvl 25. This gives the survivors an unfair experience advantage both in perks and knowledge about the game.Secondly the survivors can be toxic as . Just today after one match I've heard words like "autistic" "retard" "not bad. really ing bad" and so on. And these are the 25+ players. Sure when you lose you can write stuff like " ing camper" and so on but at least you are kicking up. Kicking down on a player that has lost is just untasteful and ruins any potential for new killers. I've also noticed that the killers are a lot nicer than the survivors. Writing stuff like "gg" and "thx for the game" and "well played" and doing things like helping you if you're new by letting new players finish generators and escape or guide/carry the newb to the hatch.All in all good game. Too bad the community is killing it. *ehm* Left for dead 2 *ehm*
title: Dead by Daylight

review: I really felt the need to review this game as I see so many people commenting about how they think it's unbalanced and all for the killer... Dead by Daylight is a horror movie simulation essencially you have a killer and 4 survivors who have to make a choice to work together or save themselves. The scenarios are so endless in this game and while you may have a few games as a survivor where you lose because of whatever reason it's never the same. If you're new to the game I recommend playing with as many friends as possible especially when playing a survivor. You have no way to communicate in the game with survivors other than emotes and even then it's only 3 that you can do so voice chat with friends will really help you become a better survivor. The killer is the real land slide on which the game can go in either direction.Survivors and Killers have very different points of view in the game survivors have a third person camera that can move around freely while Killers have a first person camera which limits their FOV. In my opinion neither roll is easy or overly hard but there are aspects of the game that make each side hard and easy at the same time. The killer moves faster than the survivors that's a fact. The survivor has to use stealth to their advantage and quick wits. Think what the killer will do before he does it and use it to your advantage. Survivors fix generators to trigger doors to escape you spend about a minute on each one which in itself can be difficult but to keep you on your toes they have added skill checks. People find these really hard at first because they don't listen to the queue before the skill check happens. Before every skill check there is a clonk echo sound which means get ready put your thumb on that spacebar and stare into the middle of your screen and wait for it. It's meant to wake you up! I don't play much of the killer but I know how hard it is starting out as a survivor and it could be very frustrating at first but it's the visual and sound queues you need to listen for that make all the difference. I really recommend everyone give this game a chance at least 10 hours it's worth it when you learn how to play better. I promise. Its hard at first but it gets better.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Pros Fun multiplayer if you like survival horror Survivor is easily playable solo without voice chat or text chat (since there is none lmao) Randomly generated hook pallet and generator locations based on presets so they're usually balanced Good selection of survivors and killers to experiment with Gameplay is balanced for the most part Leveling your characters gives you a plethora of perks to mix and match up to a max of 4 equippedCons Killer is the lobby host so if the killer has a bad connection you won't have fun Randomly generated hook pallet and generator locations can end up on a map with all hooks on one side of the map or end up on a map with only six hooks on the top portion of the map. Can also end up on a map with pallets nowhere to be found. Bloodwebs are random which can lead to you not getting that one perk you want for a pretty long time. Fairly toxic community. Almost every lobby I play killer in has scrubs disconnecting after getting hooked before they die or even before the game even starts. I've been told to kill myself a good amount too. Also you'll get killers who will camp hooks making it near impossible to save a survivor. Almost every update is the developer forcing new DLC down our throats. DLC killers don't seem as balanced as base game killers Michael being a prime example with his almost non existant terror radius in stage 1.Fun game all in all great with friends make sure you use something like Discord to talk because there's no in game chat. A well co ordinated team can destroy a killer easily so work together.

review: Product received for free. This is a good game but it has some issues to it like most games. I would suggest to play this however only with your friends if you want to be a survivor but if you want to play this solo then the killer is the role for you. Despite that this game tells you to play as a suvivor as either a team player or a solo player. I can tell you now with my experience of playing this 3 days now its not going to be fun. I have had soo many games now where I have played as a survivor solo and by doing so I have had the following things happen to me which might happen to you Team mates leading the monster into you Leaving you for dead despite being easily able to be saved You will encounter players much higher than yourself You will find losing ranks soo much quicker (Not telling anyone to get a friend to farm stuff as thats cheating just saying without a friend to more than likely help bail you out you will have a greater percentage at dieing early which will definietly lower your rank).Now this is my experience so its not exactly gonna be the same with you... I hope. So what other issues are there with this game other than solo play that you have encountered. Well sit your arses down because I'm gonna tell you. Despite the penalising of playing solo as a suvivor I have found which is my biggest gripe there are some technical issues with this game. Some of which feel fairly beta esque problems and need sorting. When you finish a game with a friend you want to go back into a lobby with them right? I mean its only natural... So heres the deal with this game. Once you enjoyed a fairly nice match of this with a friend you then join a "after game" lobby which is where you can see all the rewards you reaped in (Pun D ). But from this lobby you can only either go back to the main menu... Or... go into a solo lobby where you can upgrade and search for a game solo.... which is a bit of a pain in the Because from there you have to back out to then go to the main menu to then select a lobby to invite your friend into then once they are in and you have readied up and they have.... guess what?.... YOUR THEN ENTERED INTO ANOTHER LOBBY o . O B but there must surely be a reason to why they need a seperate lobby for the solo and the multiplayer one from the main menu right....??? NO THERE ISN'T! I DON'T UNDERSTAND IT D SEND HULP!? D Okay sorry moment aside there is two differences and two alone which does not warrant the need for a seperate lobby you can switch to play as a killer in solo and the invite button has disappeared..... Thats it? Yup.... thats it... There will be points where you join a lobby and if the host quits (Which is always the monster... We shall get onto this point soon....) Then it can bug out your game you then have to close it down and then reload it back up and deal with the lobbies again... yaaaaay... Earlier mentioned Killers being the hosts... yup they are... they always are.... But why? Well when you go to play as a killer you actually create a lobby and wait for people to join you... B but... what if they have bad connection?? ( AHAHAHA your in for a ride... Because heres the two likely situations Ever played the early GoW on the xbox?? Well your gonna have a whole lot of Deja'vu cause that killer is gonna shred through you as they won't really experience much of what your suffering as its their connection. Okay other situation?? Well if that delightful character disconnects before lets say 10 15mins into a game prepare to lose a rank. Cause the system is not fair and you will get penalised for it unless you so happen to get enough points in that time. Rage quiters... You will hate them even more.... I have lost ranks because a Killer has lost sight of the person they were chasing or because someone escaped from a hook early on... Which guess what.... penalises you again because they left because they were so tilted that you have a team that works together.... bad times. HIT BOXES... So you see some cover and you want to slide over it to get away? Sure... but you might die....wha?... Well if a killer strikes say when your at quarter of the cover... your hit... just like that. Oooor they grab you and your instantly down. I have done this by accident a few times as the Hill Billy and you feel like the worst human being in existance because you and the other player both know that you shouldn't have hit them. But downed players can't get up by themselves fully unless a perk lets them or if they have a med kit so you mayas well just hook them. NO TUTORIAL! Okay you can argue saying that there is lots of notes inside the game telling you objectives and how to play etc. But if your a gamer/learner like me you do best at doing. Not reading. So when you stick your little head into a lobby with experienced players... you mayas well be a headless chicken. I'm not saying this is the most needed thing but it would really do wonders for new players to go against some bots or to be put into lobbies full of new players too. Campers!?... You will hate this with a burning passion... Forget CoD forget any other game you know where you hate them... because this game will give you a new definition into hating them. Why? Lets put it this way... you have just started the game maybe about 5 10 mins into the match you get hooked and the killer is standing right next to you while your on the hook. Which is compltely unfair because if you stuggle on the hook you get a 3% chance of success... 3%... thats it... If by some miracle you get off it... guess what your going straight back on it... And if someone comes to try and rescue you... guess what... they are more than likely going to die too.... But if you fail to struggle your way off... guess what... You have just signed for your own death congrats because if you fail to do it 3 times or if the meter gets half way and you will die if you don't mash "space bar". Oh and the best part if someone by some miracle does get past the person camping you and un hooks you... if you then get caught again... you die!! This is made 10x worse if the killer is the worst camper of them all "The Trapper" as yes he places traps... he can make any attempt of rescue 100000% more difficult because he can trap all around you making for death to be certain. Mate... you okay?... Yes I like this game its a great game don't get me wrong. But there are some issues that need to be resolved instead of bringing out DLC which is what these developers keep on doing but only at these points do they fix errors. OR atleast thats how it feels. I love how the atmosphere is in this game its perfect for horror lovers espcially that of the old classic horrors. You will notice how some of the killers resemble that of old killers and monsters. For instanceone of the killers is based on Michael Myers with a very chilling music vibe to whenever he approaches. There also seems to be one that looks similar to Jason in some ways. Either way this game is keeping those memories of such iconic characters alive and it brings me so much joy. Just waiting on the developers to re create the beloved image of the classic horror "Swamp Thing". They have a perfect map for it and if they are reading this I hope you approve of that idea. D I love how the game makes you feel like a "suvivor" you feel like your hopeless against the odds but yet you have to fight on to escape. There is no way a suvivor can damage these creatures but they can for if the situation arrives hinder their assault on you. Or find a place of safety in a wardrobe should they need to duck into cover as a killer approaches. And when you get to play this with friends its just perfect as they also get to share in the same experience as you both fearing for when the killer approaches. This game while it strikes alot of boxes negatively it also does so positively. I can't recommend it yet but all In all 5/10 until fixed. )

Against good survivors it can be a pain at times but learning to catch them and deliver their slippery souls to the entity is rather satisfying! review: This is a tough game to recommend but since I'm still playing it I will. Honestly I think the game itself is a lot of fun if a little unbalanced. Mechanically playing as a victim doesn't inspire a lot of fear in me. Because it takes so long to actually die it doesn't feel like the stakes are very high. Once you get into the groove of the gameplay loop it can still be fun but requires a bit of suspension of disbelief (like most horror movies I guess). I mean having to impale survivors on hooks 3 times to get a kill seems a bit much. I think like the game would feel scarier if the consequences for getting caught out were more severe and maybe the victim count was higher to balance this.Playing as the killer feels better but comes with it's own share of problems. Due to the lack of a threat the victims feel from the killer I've had a lot of victims body blocking me while carrying victims to the hook. I don't mind victims being brave and trying to lure me into drawn out chases I think that's great. But exploiting pathing mechanics due to the lack of gravity a killer possesses really takes you out of the experience.The worst thing about this game by far though is the toxic community. Every second game I get somebody complaining about how I play killer. Apparently I'm a camper because I don't leave when I know there's a victim nearby trying to rescue their friend from the hook. Apparently I'm supposed to play in a way that's more entertaining to the survivors instead of trying to secure kills. Despite the fact that I'm securing 3 4 kills most matches I consistently get abused and berated by body blocking victims for my playstyle as a killer. I won't rant about why I think it's ok to camp but I will say that the way you treat somebody shouldn't be contingent on their playstyle. If someone isn't exploting a glitch or bug and you're raging over the gameplay then maybe you're just playing the wrong game. Is there something innately infatilising that draws emotionally stunted individuals to the horror genre? Is the desire to render oneself vulnerable and childlike that brings out the child in the playerbase?Yes. Yes it is.I realise I've focused on a lot of the negatives here but as I said at the start I'm still playing it. It has some fun game mechanics but I can see myself moving on to something else in a few weeks. If you can get it on sale go for it. I'm sure it will entertain you for a few hours if you can look past it's short comings. Just be aware that it may not be what you want it to be... o.o
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Bought this on Xbox One when it launched. Loved it that much I bought it on PC with all the DLC in the Steam Sale (though I wouldn't call it much of a sale they both ended up costing the same overall). Not much difference between the two other than a some extra content on PC (which is going to console soon too) and slightly better graphics (not much in the way of graphics settings on this for a game that came out on PC first) but well worth the purchase to at least be able to play it when the missus steals the Xbox. Plays nicely with a controller too as super precise aim just isn't required so good for those of you that want a break from keyboard and mouse after a day in the office.Better gameplay than Friday the 13th. Worth a purchase!

title: Dead by Daylight

review: Incredibly Fun Gameplay Poor Preformance and Terrible Glitches.This game is absolutely incredible it's very fun has great sound and music unique mechanics FASCINATING killers and one hell of a back story for everything going on! I feel terrible saying anything bad about this game but dear god it needs to be said.If you like horror please keep on eye on this one and BUY IT when the reviews talk about the developers fix up the glitches.I actually really do love this game however the developers need to stop adding in all this extra content and work more on improving the quality of the game. I have a monster PC with 64 GB of RAM and a high end processor (can't remember which one exactly) and the loading screens can sometimes take up to over 10 minutes before putting me into a match and by then all the other players have left and I'm left with a "Merciless Victory" I usually play as the killer and when I do I've noticed I get slightly shifted from side to side a lot (and no I'm NOT carrying a survivor in the cases I'm talking about) One time while playing as Bill I had this very strange continious glitch that caused me to constantly be shifting about a foot to the left or right multiple times a second. Absolutely unplayable. But I also didn't want to go through another loading screen so I hoped it'd go away. I didn't last long as I glitched into the corner of a brick wall while running away from the killer. Everytime I launch the game it comes up behind all of my other windows in full screen mode with the bottom bar for my applications still showing. I can see and hear a cutscene playing but clicking on the game via the tab at the bottom or on the game screen itself does not only do nothing in terms of coming to the front of the other windows but the screen goes black and the cutscene disappears. There is no sound and the screen is black (but I can still see the in game curser) for a long time before the main window shows I assume this lasts for the amount of time the cutscene had left. Textures for characters take several seconds to render properly but the survivors seem to be much worse and sometimes their clothes never actually look quite right. Min's hair is the worst though has a terrible tendancy to glitch out especially her bun. I've also noticed Laurie's clothes have a tendancy not to render properly more then anyone else as well. For some reason the killers don't have the same issue as much. Although the killers have super interesting back stories some are definately more weak the Nurse and maybe even the Hag aren't as interesting as Carter or the Trapper. Also all the survivors are incredibly uninteresting and the expressions that are indefinately on a couple of them make them come across completely unlikable. The only 2 survivors I found myself liking were Bill and Laurie THE ONLY TWO SURVIVORS FROM OTHER FRANCHISES. This game has an awsome story surrounding it but the only reason I know ANY of it is because I read it on the Wikia I assume the developers made. I'm surprised there isn't a story mode and in the (distant) future thatwould be a total must for an update. Along with offline matches if you can't connect to the interenet. DLC does NOT have enough content for the $$$. Why can't I put Rochelle's shirt on anybody but the botanist? Why does the bloody sack (or whatever it's called) have so few items and only for less then half of the killers? The killers have unique gameplay mechanics so why can't the survivors have unique abilities as well that I don't HAVE to buy with in game currency?DEVELOPERS!!! If you read this review I'm going to advise you that you should STOP putting in all this DLC and extra content with more killers and focus on making the game preform better. Fix the bugs. Fix the long loading screens. This game would be sooooo much more popular if it weren't for the issues with the preformance.Also putting certain mechanics that belong to a certain killer in DLC is a BAD idea. I honestly regret buying Spark of Madness before properly looking at it.

review: This game is awesome I have been very impressed so far with the game mechanics. It seems like any time there are any bugs they are fixed relatively quickly. I would say however I would love for there to be some kind of story mode like in Left for Dead. The game does at time feel repetitive but it s especially fun to enjoy with friends. At times some of the killers seem to be way over powered and the Haddonfield map is way too small especially when playing with an overpowered player. I would say the enjoyment of this game all depends on the players you are matched with. Some of the killers like to camp which make it impossible to save your allies so if you do start playing don't do that it just makes the game boring. I d also like to see a few other changes like a better chance to escape hooks.

review: I really want to like this game. It's such a fantastic idea and on the border of being great but it has just too many problems to recommend. If you're a low level killer you'll be paired up with undoubtedly several high level survivors and chances are they will win with little to no effort. If you're a survivor it'll take forever to find a match (if you even do) and then it's hit or miss on how well the game will perform which depends on the host's internet and the host seems to be the killer. Pretty massively unbalanced gameplay latency issues due to the lack of dedicated servers clunky mechanics (which I can overlook on their own but in combination with latency problems they become pretty unbearable) poor optimization and the few exploits in the game such as window spams make this game not worth my time. Maybe it'll be patched in the future and polished out to be fantastic but it just didn't there yet. Save your money for now and wait for improvement or another asymmetrical serial killer game. Update So it's been a full year or so since I wrote this recommendation and I have to say the game has improved a ton. You can still be paired against a person with significantly better perks than you which sucks but the lag issue has been somewhat handled glitches and other problems have been worked on substantially and there is a ton more content now in new killers maps and survivors. I recommend it whole heartedly now but just keep in mind that it isn't a perfect experience.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Hi people of the fog (or whatever) since my last review (that i had to delete because you can only have one of the same game on your acc at a time) a lot has changed... many bugs have been fixed and some t has stopped but that does NOT mean that there isnt anything new i can complain about. my nerves are limited too so i figured its time for a little break for me. NEGATIVE THINGS camping oh boy where do i start. well dear killers you can call it patrolling or try to justify your t but we all know you arent leaving the hook because youre too incompetent to secure a kill otherwise. i dont say its easy to be the killer but its harder being a survivor most of the time because there are rarely any killers who dont camp and seriously online game developers shouldnt tollerate camping because it simply ruins all the fun. pallet looping survivors do it a lot but ive got to say its not as common as camping. its annoying when theres trolls who just run from pallet to pallet because it completely ruins the fun for the killer and that leads me to the next point facecamping due to bad behaviour when you use a game mechanic like sabotage you can bet that youll be facecamped (killer stands in front of the hook and waits for you to die) and that is completely ridiculous. you shouldnt be given a punishment for using a game mechanic. thats absolutely unacceptable and im sick and tired of this t. traps under hooks (1.4) of course it makes more sense that youre trapped when you step on them but when camping is such a big thing you cant just buff traps that hard. killer variety all i get in nearly every second match is the trapper. im seriously tired of this. unbalanced gameplay the perks completely ruin the game because some are way too overpowered. dear devs when you dont have any ideas what to implement think more instead of adding a horrible idea just to have more content (deerstalker whispers self care iron grasp) killer speed most killers are faster than driving cars and then they have this walking animation and are faster than running survivors (dafuq) matchmaking jesus i almost missed this point. when youre playing alone you can find a lobby relatively fast as a survivor but most killers just dodge the lobbies because you either have a certain item character etc. but you as a survivor cant see who the killer is. quitterbonus survivors have this sometimes when the killer disconnects BUT by far not everytime and when your allies leave you get NOTHING. survivors dont get enough points already so why the pls. this could be fixed easy as but i dont even know what the devs are doing the points killers get way more obviously because they cant die so theyre there the whole match and survivors cant really fill the survival category which makes no sense because you do anything to survive as a survivor so this is t. if you dont survive youre not going to pip that easily because its not rare that you die at the start of the match because as mentioned killers camp A LOT and btw the bloodweb is so big that after a match you can hardly buy 4 items and then theres like 15 more to buy until you reach the next level perks most of them are very strong and a must have like sprint burst and then theres some like the hex perks or hope that are straight up pointless. dlcs too expensive for the amount of content they bring with them (for example 80s dlc only cheap reskins with 8 pieces for three bucks (srsly what the devs i can do a better job with photoshop)GOOD THINGS the devs seem to care a little more than they did but of course they should make the main decisions bloodpoint weekends the time you get double points every match is needed because you dont get enough in a match free dlcs they might will happen more often which is great some community members most of them are absolutely cancerous and just insult everyone but from time to time you find really nice and flashy people but to be fair everyones a lot because this game can really make you upset so yeah. concept great but the way they did this... it was better when it came out characters mostly creative and unique fan service some animations and easter eggs you can see which horror movie theyve been picked out of fixes they come frequently and solve some problems but you see that the devs can care a lot if they want to i cant think of much more things that are either good or bad. as things are now you should definitely not buy the game. and btw if you are offended reading the complain points then so sorry but that just underlines that youre doing things that ruin the game and obviously i play more survivor and im not saying that only one side can be hard but some points are just that annoying that this game is slowly dying and need to stop. im sure that some people can relate to this so if you have any updates to the points or want to bring anything to my attention i have a lot of time on my hands at the moment.

review: Product received for free. It's okay for what it is at best but certainly not worth dropping $20 on. Hell I wouldn't even spend half that on it simpy because I don't think it's that great.The concept is okay of course but the game is repetitive the perk and item system seem clunky at best and serve to artifically keep people interested in the game. Think about it how fun is it when the only excuse for playing a game is to grind out something new? Some may see this as a positive of course but certainly not for me. The game also feels lackluster with the supposed horror atmosphere. Sure it's dark but there's nothing that really keeps you on edge unless you perhaps are facing someone who really knows how to screw with you. That's not to say that I hate everything about the game though some of the killers look spot on and have a great backstory. However it just feels like a bit of a letdown to have good monsters (at least lore wise) in a meh game. The lore behind what brought said killers there is also interesting for sure. I'll not spoil it here look into it elsewhere.Overall I'd give the game a 4/10. It could certainly be improved though I doubt the devs have the same thing in mind that I do.

review: Firstly i have to start with saying that i do realy enjoy this game it is quite possibly the best think outside the box multiplayer game on steam and now also on the xbox one and the ps4........now hold that thought.I have been playing dead by daylight since almost its initial release on steam in fact it was the first game that i installed on my at the time newly built gaming rig the game game immedietly surprised me with just how different it was to anything else that had been on the market to date seeing the struggle from 2 real purspectives 1 being as the almost helpless survivor desperetly trying to survive and escape and then theres the killer hunting and scaring the living daylights out of the unsuspecting survivors.Now back to the differences that i have noticed between the pc version and console versions of the game and there are many !alot more time and care has been put into the console versions of the game and that is evident from just the graphics compared to the pc im running the game on ultra settings and on a 4k widscreen monitor so the game is pushed to as high as the pc can take it and it looks nowhere near as good as the ps4 version!!! with the amount of updates that this game gets you would think there would be a massive amount of content but i am yet to play any map other than the cornfield and the damaged building map im aware there are alot of other maps but they never cycle through i have sunk over 20 hours into this game and tried all possible setups to no prevail.since release there have been less than a handfull of new characters added and next to no new customization options whatsoever even though there are alot of empty slots that are clearly visible in the customization menu.In retrospect i am not slandering this game and telling you to avoid it like the black death however what i will say is there is still much that needs to be addressed with this game esspescially not that there are real alternatives in the market that come from a major motion picture franchise which from personal experience improves on every short coming of dead by daylight.This is well worth the money when on sale but at its present state i can only happily give Dead by daylight a 7/10

review: This game is mad fun when you can play. Many times I have been stuck at the lobby and had to end the program because of bugs/freezing/etc. It is extremely frustrating. On top of that many times you will find your allies have been disconnected and you end up being ed. On the alternate side you get a victory after only playing 5 minutes. Bugs need to be fixed before they continue to add more killers/survivors. I cant recommend this game until something has been done to make it run more efficiently. 5/29/17 update Survive with friends (SWF) has gotten better. There are still some issues but not as many as there was orginally. I'd reccomend getting this if it was on sale. At the current state I would not buy at full price. The mechanics of the game has been changed recently I am like 50/50 on the new updates. Not super happy but not super upset. Overall its a fun game but que. times are still pretty long (except during bloodhunts).

review: Product received for free. I did get to play this for free and am writing this review during the FREE to Play weekend 2017 Sept 14 so I only have a couple of hours invested the game so far. Its not one I'll be buying though! Its basically just a game of 'TAG' for adults. Mostly I spent MOST of my gameplay time sitting in the lobby waiting for enough players to join and then stop messing about going 'unready' and then changing their character etc. It might not seem like a lot but even just 3 minuts sat waiting for a game to start is a very long time when your leisure time is as valuable as mine is. (re having to work for a living)..!I am not good at playing it yet... But my first thoughts are... I don't think that the game is very well balanced as I played both as a killer and a survivor maybe its just not my kind of game but when I was running away from killers I could never move fast enough to escape yet playing as the same killer I could not catch the survivors at all. So how does that work? If all the other players are at about the same level as me then why can I not succeed with any aspect of the game?Its a little like those cop cars in GTA5 where on the whole 'when' you are driving them they are not super fast cars yet when you are being chased by them they can ram you up the A**** even though you are driving a lambo at 150mph.Out of balance...They should have a score board where everytime you evade a killer you earn 10 points after the killer has seen you but then loses you (they did this to some extent and I did score 250 I think for evasion of a killer)... But from the killers perspective you should gain poins for finding the target but then have them reduce by half if they evade and hide.If that is what is supposed to happen that was not what I experienced. People literally in front of me who I'd even managed to hack once then vanished from view.... What's that about.. Yet when I was hit by a killer I was always down for the count everytime... As the killer I stood over a target who was crouched and unaware I was even there. I struck him from behind and yet he was able to limp away even faster than I could go. Not any fun nor realistic.. (Not that I've chased and killed anyone for real (recently)! Not as far as I remember anyway...

review: I can't recommend this game in its current state at all. It's been out for over a year now and they still haven't fixed issus that have been present since day one. The game is a 4v1 experience with an incredible bias towards the "1" that being the killer.The core issue to the whole game is the fact that it's a pvp game that gives the killer full control to either be nice and let everyone have a fun match (I don't mean not killing just not camping/trolling) or they can absolutely ruin the whole experience for all 4 other players. Got some rare items? The killer can not only see them ahead of time by design but he can also disconnect at the start of the match or tamper with his connection to force you to disconnect (no dedicated servers) and force you to lose your stuff. They can literally single out one player and effectively remove them from the game the first time they catch them by face camping them on the hook STILL after over a year. You wanna let some random nobody online choose if you get to have fun with the game you purchased? I know that I don't.I haven't really played the game in a while but I had to write this review when I remembered how bad the devs keep crapping on it with every update. I strongly do not recommend anyone to this experience and I can't see it getting any better unless a lot starts to change in the devellopment.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: This is hands down a fantastic game. It can be scary at some points but that's not what it's all about. It's about surviving against a killer and helping out your teammates. Escaping and leaving no one behind is the main objective of this game. I love the leveling up mechanics. It was such a clever way to gain more levels. The balance between the killer and survivors is fantastic. Killers aren't to OP to the point where survivors have no chance. It all depends on how you go about your strategy. In general this game is fantastic well scripted and needs to be given a lot of credit. I definetely reccomend this game if you love a good challenge.
