review: This game is hella fun WHEN IT WORKS! Most of the time you get stuck on the lobby loading screen and the only way to get out of it is shutting it down from Task Manager. It's no longer Early Access and they've YET to work on the bug that causes equipped items to be rendered useless which has been around since conception. Every time they update this game the old bugs are still there and new bugs are found yet they continue to add new monsters and survivors. GUYS! STOP! If you don't fix these bugs you are really going to lose your following. I know many who have given up on this game because of the bugs. Love this game but the issues make me give up when I can only successfully get into one match out of five or six attempts! Really gets annoying.Okay so since the time of the post they have made a lot of improvements on the mechanics of the game HOWEVER they have severely broken the survivor/killer balance. If you play games to be competitive or if you are a competitive player by nature DO NOT PLAY THIS GAME! They have built it so that you WILL die. If you're killer is leveled you are going to die. If you have a team that doesn't work together you are going to die. If your team is not on voice together you are going to die. They continually make it easier and easier for killers to kill you. They are encouraging killers to camp you (much like corpse camping so you can't rez/respawn). If you have friends who own the game though and you queue with them it is worth getting. Fun to hear your noob friends get salty (please be sure to be nice to them because you were there at one point too tell them to stop caring and shake it off). Play it like you're in a horror movie expect that you're going to die but have fun doing it.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: I was a little skeptical when it came to this game and what it was. However my opinion had a complete change after delving deep into the violent escapades of this great game. Playing as the killer makes you feel like a badass once you get the hang of how each of the unique killer plays. Each gratifying hit sacrifice and kill has you coming back for more. Using any of the survivors that are available have great perks that help you and your teammates thwart the killers attempts to sacrifice you all. Playing by yourself can be a bit frustrating in my opinion but if you bring along a couple of friends to play around with you'll have a lot more fun. I totally recommend giving this game a try if you haven't already. Bloody good time.

review: I really like the idea of this co op game four survivors trying to escape from the killer cool maps great music I also like the perks offerings and bloodweb system even tho it gets a while to understad how it works I enjoyed it so much at the start..BUT after some time i get sooo anoyed by this ing matchmaking system its the worst thing on this game.. sometimes you can play 5games in a row without huge problem but sometimes it takes so much ing time to get into a game so meanwhile i could complete whole Witcher 3 story. Last time i was waiting for 50mins to get into game it joined me into the lobby like 15 times but after few seconds i got kicked out every ing time I even tried to restart the game twice didnt help.. AND then when you get lucky and get through this ing matchmaking system into a game you can play for few minutes until you get caught by the killer and then he stands right next to you so other survivors cant get you out of the hook and after that you can wait another half hour.. so yeah camping killers are the second worst thing on the game + few more bugs but it dont bothers me so much.Still i would recommend this game sometimes you get really good matches with helpful cooperative teammates and non camping killer so it can be very enjoyable.. and i hope the matchmaking system will get fixed one day. 7/10 EDIT Okay so one day after i wrote this review i have to add one more thing that happpened to me just now and as i read the forum im not only one who had this problem..Today I just strated the game as casual and wanted to play some more of this loading simulator but suddenly all my progress is gone all character levels perks bloody clothes everything is lost... tried to restart steam and recover my save files but naah everything is gone....(got some bloodpoints as an apology from devs for loosing my characters after i wrote them email)I dont want to say this but i have to.. this game is ing trash it could by awesome game i like the idea so much as i said at the beginning but the devs ruined it so much i feel like they dont give a about this game anymore they adding more characters and killers but cant fix the main problems which been here for more then year as i have seen in the forum.. FeelsBadMan (UPDATE After half a year i started to play this game again and yay! matchmaking got fixed! + they added some more new stuff like new killers maps and few more thing so i guess i'll again fall into this game ) Keep it this way and you'll get awesome game! There are still face camping killers but i guess it's hard to do something with that.. 8/10

review: Dead by Daylight is one of those games where you pick up and cry the first ten hours (this applies for both playing as survivor or killer). But then you get a hang of the game and start to enjoy actualy accomplishing tasks during a game. There is a bit of a grind due to the bloodpoints system but by the time you get a hang of the game you should have acquired enough bloodpoints to have decent perks to play with. In regards to balancing the devs do a subpar job. The updates come a bit later than they should but the devs do listen (sometimes a bit too much). The community obviously has the toxic bunch but there are also a lot of fun and humorous players that make it enjoyable in my opinion.Overall I rate Dead by Daylight 8/10 . I would suggest to look up a video or two to see how it actually plays out. If it interests you definitely give it a try. However if it doesn't then save the $20 or $10(if on sale). However personally I would say give it a try.Update (May 13th 2018) I changed my vote from a recommendation to a non recommendation. The devs are not doing enough to fix the game it's sad really such a pioneer of a game tossed into the dumpster because of the lack of effort and commitment from the devs. They just turned money hungry now and will only do what benefits them not the players and the community both survivor and killer mains. Don't buy the game it's not worth it anymore simple as that.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: The concept of the game looked very good the gameplay was simple but still very good. Pros + The experience of horror was executed well.+ Working together with friends was fun.+ The bonus items and perks were well developed.+ Price isn't that bad.Cons You couldn't play with friends in the start Trying to find a game could last hours (with friends you had to wait years to find a lobby) Too many bugs. (You could glitch in rocks 50% of the time you joined nothing ... ) Some things werent very balanced there were a lot of spots that could be easily abused. Camping a hook as killer isn't fun. Even though the killer has a disadvantage with doing that. Especially when you are playing with friends and they are being camped so you cant save them. Not fun for a killer and not fun for the survivor.Some of the big bugs have been fixed by now. The waiting time for joining games is shorter but it could still last hours...6 8/10 (If you have the patience to wait).
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Dead by Daylight. Ah. A very nice friendly creature. You open it and you are welcomed to a very nice intro aswell as background music with original characters such as the Trapper Wraith Hillbilly Doctor Nurse &amp the Hag. Along with famous horror film characters such as Freddy Krueger &amp Micheal Myers. 4 against 1 in a place no one has seen. In a very haunting Situation very scary game. Expect that all of the things I have described only occurs when you get the game and only have 0 10 hours maybe even shorter. The game is as repitivitve as it gets. Unfortunately the developers keep tricking players into buying killers that are used to make the game as unrepitivite as possible with maps survivors and new killers as well as perks and offerings to change the odds. However people only focus on the best for the survivor which is usually the most toxic. When I played as a noob I loved the game to my heart now having it uninstalled and out of my list of games. I had 998 hours or something due to being sucked into the DLCs. The game gets boring after finishing a lot of generators. Opening a lot of gates Camping a lot of survivors. The usual. The game reminds me of my uncle friendly nice and overall rich fun dad I wish I had. To having sexual intercourses under the bed in the tell it turns purple. Overwall rating 4.8 Gentlemens outta 10. "Less DLCs more Gamemodes" BottledRemote
title: Dead by Daylight

review: After a few hours of gameplay what i can say is that this game has a lot to offer but could use a bit of work here and there. I can say that it was one of the best experiences of my gaming life (also because i love this type of game like Friday the 13th The game) for my first 5 hours untill i noticed somethings that could be worked on. First thing's first the survivors i believe that the balance in between the task we have to acomplish as a survivor is quite at the level of what was expected it's challanging and it's fun at the same time exept when we are a unballanced level of players the matchmaking on this game is not the best. I at the time have 15 hours of gameplay and i already got to be in a game with people that played for 700 hours and i ended up by ruining their experience of the game i believe that we could use some ballance not only for the survivors but for the players in general what i mean is that the survivors and the killers should be at the same level of gameplay to ballance the games. Now killers there are a few killers they are not the best but we could say that they are decent but they are not scary enough the challange is allways the same and it's not scary after a while me on my personal opinion believe that the game could have something more scary a new scarier character or some jumpscares during the game for as much as i enjoy it during a game (but after i think that it could use a bit more of that) to be calm to focus on my task i would like to know allways that i am being hunted ant the killer is allways present during the game maybe you guys should consider putting an ingame enviroment music to keep the pressure. Now there's one specific killer that i would like to give a opinion that has bugging me from the begining the nurse is way too op.. i mean.. cmon.. she can tp eveywhere and it doesn't affect her.. whe allways get fuc*ed when a nurse is in the game.. Please consider lowering ther abilities and add a debuff or something to give us a shot to escape. One more thing.. if it's possible.. consider optimizing the game for people with lower pc builds are able to play..Concluding it's a great game and i love to play it but this things kinda trip me. I hope this game goes far and keeps on getting content (and also a new gamemode plz).
title: Dead by Daylight

review: I've owned Dead by Daylight for about a year or so as of writing this review. Originally when I bought Dead by Daylight I wasn't so much into the game. There were plenty of bugs and it just wasn't appealing to me. I told myself I would just wait for a "quality game" ( i.e. Friday the 13th) to be released. Fast forward to that "quality game" being released and all the drama exploits/glitches and etc that followed it drove me away and I came back to Dead by Daylight to give it another chance. I'm glad I did. The game has really improved since I last had played it and it's really enjoyable playing with friends. On the topic of playing with friends as much fun as it is matchmaking with SWF (survive with friends) can take FOREVER. It's a shame when you're in a SWF wtih three in a party and the matchmaking takes anywhere from 20 40 minutes. It could take longer but I refused to wait and we ended up just playing a private match. I hope in time the developers do fix this issue perhaps making groups a priority in matchmaking but I don't know the answer to fix this issue. Besides that matter Dead by Daylight is super fun and enjoyable.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: First Impressions Basically this game is all about surviving from the killer in which you need to activate generators to unlock the door to escape but there's a catch the killer is there to prevent your escape by killing all of you. Points are given for each objective met. You can play either as a killer or a survivor. Killer would have to host. If you do not like the concept or the game where you find it to be quite redundant then it is not the right one for you I suggest for you to search it up on youtube for its gameplay.I've never played the beta hence I do not know what are the problems then. Despite a few glitches here and there I can say that I'm satisfied with the game thus far. Those glitches do not hinder the gameplay too much but if they are fixed then it is much appreciated. Playing online is a gamble sometimes its silky smooth and sometimes its just plain laggy. The lobby matchmaking needs some revamp in terms of getting to play with your friends online in the same lobby and not always reshuffling to get into the same lobby with your friends (I see that a lot online). I really like how they cut off the communication in game online as to avoid cheating and also stripping away the fun from it. Honestly the ranking system is broke and it needs to be fixed but I'm a casual player so I don't really mind about it. From the games I've played so far there are two types of killer. One the killer would camp after hooking you up 2nd the killer would hunt for other survivors giving them chance to save those that are hooked. I definitely prefer the latter to spice up the gameplay. Sadly the mass majority camps at the hooked survivor and awaits for him/her to die which is kinda a kill joy. A way to counter this is to slowly die by the hands of the killer so that you can stall time for other survivors to fix the generators. Since this game is new I am more than happy to give the devs a chance to improve the game and also adding more content to it.If you're willing to look beyond the ugly side of this game then you're going to have heaps of fun playing it.I can easily recommend this game to anyone if you have the extra buck to go for it. Otherwise if you think that this game is not suitable for you you can do your wallet a favour by keeping it fat. Cheers D
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Dead by Daylight also known as "Murdered by Morning " "Slaughtered by Sunrise " "Annihilated by AM " "Culled by Cockedoodle " and "I'm Having Too Much Fun With This The Game " is an asymmetrical player versus player murder simulator in which one player controls a friendly masked killer and four other players control superhuman mutes with the ability to sprint at supersonic speeds. Activate five generators to power the exit gates of a magical murder realm and skedaddle your way out to safety but beware for the killer is angry.Just angry.If you're looking to play with friends (even though the game was NEVER designed and is absolutely not balanced for people able to communicate over an outside VOIP client) and gleefully repair generators to the merry tune of people screaming on meathooks this game is for you a highly lethal and entertaining game of hide and seek.If you want to BE the masked psycho killer do NOT buy this game. The community hates you. The devs hate you. The balance of power is hideously skewed in the survivors' favor and it's NEVER going to change. You won't have very much fun after you rack up a level or two and the matchmaking system makes doing anything with your lower level killers nigh impossible as you'll be constantly matched against better skilled better coordinated players with a full set of overpowered standard perks. Any attempt at securing a kill will get you screamed at. Even if you're new expect to be teabagged infinitely looped and mocked in the after game chat.If you want to play as a survivor this is the game for you. If you want to play as a survivor with your friends you're cancer but this is still the game for you. If you want to play as a killer buckle up buttercup you're in for a wild ride of disappointment and frustration.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: I played this game when it first came out like around a year ago haven't really touched it ever since because I got other games on hand to finish. Generally speaking I would recommend this game.The gameplay is challenging on both sides perhaps more challenging if you're playing as the killer. The atmosphere is creepy the graphics the sound and the general feeling that you're being watched/you are the evil. The gameplay is fun on both sides. As a killer you have the evil fun of hunting people down you have to be smart set traps ambush or simply chase em down. As the survivor you have to be smart as well using surrounding enviornment to hide yourself fixing generators strategically and cooperate or not cooperate with your teammate.I can only think of two downsides of this game. First is the connection issue. The game is P2P based. I can see the reasoning behind the P2P mode since each gameplay requires only 5 people at most. However P2P can be really laggy and annoying sometimes. Also you can only host a game by being the killer and there are way more people who wanna be survivors than killers at least this was the situation when I played this game. As a result a lot of times when I wanted to be a survivor I ended up not finding a game in 3 4 mins (and around 1/3 of the times I joined a game there were connection issues thanks to P2P). The second downside is the upgrade mechanics the upgrade is something I was not really comfortable with even after around 8 hrs into the game. I don't think any intelligently designed leveling system should make a player feel this way. Many of the items are one time only use which is kind of upsetting consider you put so many bloodpoints to get the upgrade.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: I did initially write a bad review for this game but they have fixed a lot of issues that plagued the game when it was released.The game is much better now the concept is good the atmosphere is creepy (initially obviously with all games that you play for a while the atmosphere of it wears off). The killers seem relatively balanced. The one thing they could change is that when you're against a rank 1 killer but you're a rank 20 survivor it'd be nice if they could somehow scale the perks so that it's more of a level playing field. If a killer has all the best perks and is against 4 level 20s with one bad perk it's going to be fairly easy for the killer to win.The DLCs add some freshness to the game and are worth picking up if you have some spare change just to keep the game feeling new.

review: This game is a blast. I've been playing since the beginning and I have to say this game has come quite a long way. First of all the diversity of the gameplay is incredible and because of that the replayability of this game is high. You can choose to gain expertise as a survivor role or a killing role as a myriad of survivors and killers all with their own unique detailed backstories. They are constantly adding update DLC's to the game and have incorporated killers from Halloween Texas Chainsaw Massacre and Nightmare on Elm Street among their own original killers. The game is extremely competitive and way more active than Friday the 13th The Game at a lower pricetag. Downsides are that competitive ranking does not result in any rewards and that servers are not dedicated so that killer hosts the server every time.8.5/10

review: I bought this game because my friends are playing it. I've done a few survivor matches and a few killer matches. I've got to say it is fun. Sometimes. It makes your heart beat and if you're playing with friends it can be even more fun. Pros 1. It's fun to hear your friends scream as they get startled. 2. As the killer if you main him you can let off some steam. 3. It forces you to get REALLY good at map awareness. Cons 1. If you're like me and super late to the gaming scene THIS GAME IS NOT FOR YOU YET. It's got a VERY steep learning curve as is evidenced by the fact that I'm usually the first person murdered in every game. I'm mostly unlucky but I understand that I lack practice with basic controls. I've yet to get the hang of straffing and my ability to remember my surroundings for kiting purposes sucks. 2. The comunity is a mixed bag. As a brand new rank 20 killer I'm still trying to get the hang of what I'm supposed to be doing (Where are the tutorials?) and as a result you get people who taunt you a lot in game and then after game the sheer amount of toxicity is huge. Also being held hostage in a game is VERY real as players trying to get those last few blood points will sit around in the game hiding while you're struggling to look for them just so you can move on with your life. Then they tell you you're bad and should do other things. Or they call you a camper if you're just trying to get one person for some blood points. 3. There is no tutorial. Not really. It's a LOT of writing with interactable stuff but it doesn't REALLY teach you about game play. This is why the learning curve is kind of HUGE. 4. THE RANKING SYSTEMS SUCKS. Every month the 'ranks' reset. This means you have people who are a high rank mingling with the lower ranks. This isn't the worst. It means that you as a BRAND NEW PLAYER will now be pitted against people who have THOUSANDS of hours in this game. But wait there is more! They can STILL be rank 20 with maxed out perks and STILL PURPOSEFULLY be in the low ranks so that they can have an easy slaughterfest and then tell you to kill yourself or worse. There is no way for you to really improve if you're constantly first dead with NO IDEA what you did wrong. This game is NOT for people who are looking for a group of friendly fun. The community is against friedship the developers don't care about my very last most important con. If you don't believe me please try playing League of Legends as a new player and pitting your might against the Diamond ranks. It's not fun. It's not REMOTELY fun. Neither is this game.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Fun game but terrible matchmaking where people with 5 hours in game can be matched up against people with 1000 hours in game. Progression in the game isn't just rank and skill. It's based off unlockable items mechanics which the longer you play the more you're able to hop into games on *your* terms rather than someone else's. So if you queue up as a killer not only do you have to account for the skill gap between you and the survivors but whatever items and perks they have packing. With a full set of four very rare perks and a matching very rare item a single survivor can get a generator up and running in 30 seconds easy. Nevermind the sabotaging of every hook except the four in the basement which you won't be able to carry them that far so they get dropped and you have to chase them down again to down them to drop them again. Same goes for survivor it's a steep learning curve on how to deal with each individual killer and what to and what not to do. You are pitted against people that are decked out 100% with perks they've spent hundreds of hours acquiring in a specific combination to f*** you over and it's up to you to figure out just how they're going to do that. Don't get me wrong it's a fun game but it has terrible balance via the shoddy matchmaking system.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Initial impression after first couple of matches At first I really didn't think this game was anything special given that there is no story or single player campaign. So I continued playing and I realized how interesting and addicting it truly is. I think given what appears to be a "low budget" in nature and the reliance on solely a multiplayer platform the the graphics gameplay skills and abilities that the survivors and killer can use is what makes this game a success. I'm willing to bet if you're a serious gamer you could think otherwise however as a casual gamer This has to rank somewhere between an 8 and a 9 solely because of the lacking campaign/story function.Impression after a few hours However after playing this for a little longer now I am beginning to see why this is receiving negative reviews. It is terribly unbalanced. Survivors are overly exploiting perks and abilities (or cheating) in such a way that as one person playing the killer makes it impossible to keep up. Honestly at this point I really wish I could get a refund for this game. Game rating 3/10
title: Dead by Daylight

review: This is one very unique game. I never thought I'd find myself playing something like this. It's not part of a normal "genre". It's 4 survivors versus a bloodthirsty killer (there are multiple types with each their own ability) and you have to survive and escape. You've got to power generators whilst also hiding or running from a killer that is faster than you. There are perks to unlock items to get through a unique system of spending "bloodpoints" in a "bloodweb". It's all really well done and keeps you wanting to play. But the main draw is the game is just fun especially when you play with 3 other friends. You get an amazing feeling when you juke a killer or slam a pallet on their head and you do genuinely feel your heart racing when you find yourself crouched in a corner and the killer steams passed you and doesn't see you.I'd recommend anyone to at least try this game (you can always refund within 2 hours on steam). Even if you think it won't be your thing it just might be!
title: Dead by Daylight

review: If you're looking for a deeply immersive horror game that will constantly keep you in a state of panicked awareness this is not the game for you. The scare factor of the different killers begins to wear off after only a few hours of gameplay and once you understand the game enough you'll likely begin to toy with the killer often leading to your death. However if youre looking for a fun party game to play with a few friends casually or another game to grind out points to upgrade your survivors and killers this is definetely worth the 20$ asking fee.As for the DLC you don't need any of the dlc to have fun or build your characters properly. However if you have a few dollars now and then you could probably pick up some of the DLC. But AGAIN you do NOT have to buy the DLC to play the game to it's fullest extent. In fact all of the teachable perks from the survivors and killers included in the DLCs can be aquired simply by playing the game to aquire shards and buying them off of the weekly shrine for 550 (sometimes 750) respectively.So for $20 yes this game is worth it to buy. I advise that you come into this game ready for toxicity and saltiness because no matter what you do or how you play whether it be survivor or killer someone will always complain about how you play.Only real downside to this game is it's lack of a casual mode without rankings. The only gamemode that doesn't include a ranking system is Kill Your Friends which is a private lobby mode. However if you dont care for rankings and don't mind toxicity you should have an issue.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: This game is great. A great premise and a great format. There are a few issues but some of them are just inherent to the game itself.1. You're first couple rounds of survivor are actually pretty scary. After about match 10 it just becomes a game a great game but no longer heart pounding scary. So if you have a family member you want to scare the crap out of the investment is well worth it.2. Balance will always be tricky to get just right. The Devs have consistently listened to the community and added great things to the game and adjusted the worst parts. People will complain about Decisive strike and dead hard all day but I still remember when you didn't have any hooks on the map! Good luck killing anyone like that!3. Hook camping is a fun sapper. Since the games inception camping hooks is the biggest complaint I ever had. There really isn't anything the survivors can do about it except keep doing objectives but that makes the gameplay completely boring for the person who got hooked and the killer is actually missing out on tons of BP but they never listen.So I highly recommend this game for everyone except those who are squimish about blood and gore.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: If you are like me and you suffer from various mental illness which can range from Anxiety to Schizophrenia then you might think this game is impossible for you. Let me tell you why you are wrong.I suffer from very bad paranoia along with anxiety and schizophrenia so I have a hard time with anything horror related and when I received this game as a gift to play with my 3 other online friends I thought it would just go waste. After letting it sit in my library for about 5 months I finally decided to try it with them and now i'm hooke (Pun intended.)If you suffer from mental illnesses that might hinder your ability to play this then just play custom matches with friends only. It's very fun and it's helped me battle my own mind. I love the different killers you can play as and all the various maps. I'm almost 30 and I used to be terrified of slasher films and horror games until now. I love this game so much because it's just opened more doors for me to battle my own inner demons! Buy this game!
title: Dead by Daylight

The upgrade system is very well designed and the fact that it's hard to win as survivor makes the game challenging but not impossible. Even as the killer it's completely based on skill whether or not you find all the survivors chase them down and manage to get them on the hooks without anybody saving them or shining a flashlight in your eyes. The game is replayable and it takes many many hours to master this game. It's far more than worth the 20 dollars since the graphics are amazing the gameplay is fun and every match is different.

review: After watching weeks of streams and videos I finally bought it and tried for myself. Here's what I think. The game is fun and easy as a survivor. You can pretty much on any killers with the right set of tools (perks/addons) and simply by having a little bit of experience. As a killer well at rank 20 it's really easy. Matching against survivors about your rank and non op perks you can have a good time chasing them down hanging them etc. But once you reach rank 17 18 (keep in mind its just 3 ranks up) you get completely destroyed. Being a new player I don't have access to high level perks for survivors/killers. I was just trying to earn blood points every game. But it is really really hard against most survivors. If you're lucky you get to kill 2 in a game. But most of the time its just a wild goose chase as even when they won with the gates wide open they will simply refuse to leave and taunt(teabagging is really popular in this game) the killer knowing they have nothing to stop them.And yes. Killers have some decent tracking/chasing perks. But the survivor's perks are really too much. Dead hard sprint burst borrowed time decisive strike with a trusty flashlight in hand. Let's just say you don't want to play a killer. I think the devs have a good concept and it's a beautiful game with nice music. But the game is in a really dark place now and it's going to take a lot of time to fine tune and balance the game. Some of the survivors understand they have really unfair tools in their arsenal and chooses to not use them to make the game more fair to the killers. But sadly most of them are really toxic even to each other. I do not blame the players for this because it is the way the game was designed to encourage and condone this kinda 'killer bullying' behaviours. To conclude I will continue to enjoy the game as a survivor but I cannot reccomend the game until some sort of balance is in place as at it's current state no amount of DLCs will keep the players for much longer.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: By all means a great fun game....If your playing with friends the amount of BM and rudeness in this game is some of the highest ive ever seen even playing games like league of legends for years. Anything from constant 4man SWF all 2k+ hours dragging games out for 20minutes or just doing rude stuff like tbagging behind pallets ect. Or a 4man team all blinding you constantly so you literally cant do anything. This game is great when you have perks and when you are playing with people your own skill rating unfortunately there is no *ranked* or *casual* in this game so you will often run into groups or solo people with 2k+ hours that will just run you around and be rude while doing it. Get the game when its on sale Its not worth buying just to be disrespected every game your in. For some reason this is the way the community on this game is and its a shame

review: If you like a game where sitting at a searching for lobby screen for 15mins to get into a 5min game is fun then this game is for you. The killers are a bit too easy to play while the survivors have almost nothing going for them. That I can put up with. It can have bad latency issues with drops in framerate every so often. That I can put up with. The most intolerable part is that if you want to play with a friend or two the game basically says "Go f*** yourself and your friends". I timed myself multiple times waiting for games using the party system and it averages from 12 15mins to get into a lobby. Then have the time when you enter a lobby you get kicked back to the title screen anyway to start over. Until the developers actually fix the party system to oh I don't know actually put players into a game I cannot recommend this game to anybody who likes to play games with friends like I do. Upon release it had issues that can easily be put aside because I like the idea for the game. The game having a matchmaking system that does not work cannot be acceptable if they (the developers) are not willing to fix it. All in all decent game with horrible multiplayer systems.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: What can I say this game has treated me nothing but good so far in my journey of surviving against agressive killers with Meta Based perk builds that everyone already knows about and laughing while killing survivors who also run Meta Based perk builds that everyone uses. This game has also taught me how people will get try to argue against anything at hand to keep their ego so large that they can not swallow it for a fair fun game of Survivor vs. Killer. One thing that I do find odd is that people base their opinions of others on character choices in this game. "Good golly this guy is such a David." "This Claudette is ruining my game even though they have completed more gens than I have.". Come to think of it this is making me look like the bad guy it seems but at the end of the day I'm the kind of guy who has no idea what perks he's running and plays for the fun of it not the win. Buy this game. Also buy the Halloween DLC and nothing else.

review: I can honestly say this game is one of if not the BEST games I have bought on steam. There are a few small things you should know before purchase and consider.Pros Survival Horror is done well. As a survivor (when you are new) every killer is in many ways terrifying. A fun game to play with your friends. Literally a game my group of friends and I (we have different tastes in games) all enjoy. diverse set of killers and survivors. The DLC perks which you do not have to buy occasionally are available without spending more than the baseline if you do not want to buy the killers. This game has no loot boxes though so even though I may not play every DLC i spend the 7 dollars to support them NOT having loot boxes. A game you can wrap up in 30 minutes tops ( normally) matches are normally pretty fast.Cons The community can be at times very angry towards each other. I really should not look at post game chats the killer and survivors. (myself included at times) can lash out at each other and really all we want to do is enjoy the game. If you hit the &gt &gt it disables your chat and you should leave it that way. Some bugs can persist a while and terrain has some dead spots. At times you will think your character will be able to run through trees or rocks ect. Then the game lies to you. Vaulting over pallets and windows can be buggy. Sometimes it feels you should not have got hit or hit the survivor. (could be lag related)All in all these are some of the issues good and bad that I have with the game. Buy the game and give it a try outside the somewhat toxic community (at times not as often as others seem to say). This game is allot of fun. ESPECIALLY if you want to play with a group of friends. Kill your friends mode allows 5 of you to make your own matches. Those are a blast.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Now that I have gotten some time in on this game I feel I can review it properly. Pros Intense game play for those looking for a fun hide and seek esque game with objectives. Replayability to an extent. Good Killer design that does justice to movie villains we all know and love. Especially like the Leatherface model and how they made it so close to the 1970s version of the killer. Can level up one survivor to max and then keep using to put points into another survivor or killer. Pretty balanced gameplay. Some tough perks and killer combos to deal with but not everything should be insta winnable. If your team bails on you you still usually have an option to cary yourself to a victory. Cons Graphics are nothing special but can run on a budget PC well at least. I hope the game is updated with better or mmore interesting textures as time goes on. Sometimes glitchy mechanics or gfx like on Megs hair. The hitboxes are a bit wonky sometimes and is reminiscent of a CS S game. Ping makes for a lackluster experience and find myself dodging queue until I get someone hosting on my side of the country and that can take some time. Bloodpoint grinding can be annoying if you don't get lucky with 100k point dailies have 7+ 30k or less quests in a row. Steep learning curve makes you feel useless until you start to understand what all the perks do. So far with about 100 hours of actual playtune I have only managed to get to rank 10 and my progress is slowing. I have taken 2 survivors to 50 so far and two more to 20 and 30.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Consider this to be a neutral review Dead by Daylight is a multiplayer survival horror game. In it you'll be able to play as one of 4 survivors or as one of three killers each killer having different abilities. Your main objective as survivor is to fix generators to open the escape gates. As killer your objective is to (duh) kill the 4 survivors by wounding them or sacrificing them over a timespan of 1 minute by hanging them on hooks.Upon completing a match either by dying escaping or killing survivors each player is rewarded with leveling points for certain objectives those should encourage players to play in different styles depending on their character and situation. And this is where (in my opinion) the games problems kick in... Due to the point/leveling system players on both sides killers and survivors will resort to cheap tactics to win the game. Killers will often spend their time camping in front of a hooked survivor clinging to the few extra points they get by successfully sacrificing a survivor instead of venturing across the map to catch other survivors making the game incredibly boring for the hooked survivor the killer and probably also the other survivors (since they wont be able to enjoy one of the best aspects of the game the thrill of being hunted by a killer and the possiblity to outchase him). If a survivor tries to rescue the hooked person he'll just get picked off by the killer putting him in danger and probably making him the next person to be camped on.The game feels kind of unbalanced due to these uneven odds (mind tho survivors can resort to simular cheap tactics I just feel like mentoning spawncamping as the worst of 'em since it ruins the game for at least one survivor and probably also for the killer)Another thing which bugged me is the matchmaking as said there are levels but aside of those there are killer and survivor ranks (You'll raise your rank by getting a ceratin amount of leveling points during a match). As killer I was on a fairly low level and got matched (multiple times) with high ranked and leveled survivors (same as survivor with the killer being fairly overleveled). This harms the balance of the game even more since you can potentially get a fairly strong leveled party with many helpful perks against a weak killer with no perks or the other way around... and this really needs to be fixed to make playing ranked&amp online a fairer experience for both sides!Aside of these balancing flaws the gameplay is fairly solid and if you don't run into a camping killer you'll presumably have a great and adrenalin filled match. I can absolutely recommend playing this game in a lobby with 5 friends without camping and gathered in a skype session it's incredibly fun. Beware though Playing in a lobby will not give you leveling points or archievements out of fear of abuse. If you have at least 4 friends to play with you should check it out and if you can overlook it's design/balancing flaws you'll probably have fun playing online/alone as well. Just don't buy this game if you can't handle unfairness or unbalanced mechanics or even repetition in quite some matches 'cause as of now there's alot of exploiting going on. EDIT September 2017 They made quite some changes to the game and now quequeing is faaaaar faster &amp fairer game improved much in general
title: Dead by Daylight

review: I like this game. But I will only give it a good review after some issues are addressed * map glitches. Basically I was stuck in the map and couldn't do any action killer couldn't hit me. The only thing to do is leave. Or just stick around until the killer gets bored and leaves.* last survivor camping. For those who don't know some as***** killers just chase / hit / drop the last remaining survivor until they quit. The killer gets points survivor gets 0 points at the end.* leaving the game gives you 0 points. Generally you will do that because you either glitched out or getting camped and it is just not your fault so why should the game punish you ???* server issues. Christ partying with friends is just almost impossible sometimes. You have to create the lobby 3 4 times until you manage to get into a game.* playing entirely only with friends does not give you points. People will abuse this sure but let's face it how much ? This game is not going to become an e sport so why take blood points so serious ? I still want to advance when playing with a killer friend and I promise you they will not go easy on me.

review: List of pros/cons and a quick personnal review.Pros Many playable characters with their own unique playstyle/skills. Great maps that are generated randomly. Pretty smooth to run. Some DLC are free ( they include survivors killers and maps ). Others DLCs are not too expensive. The bloodweb is an awesome idea ( You can buy skills items addons ... from the points you earn in game ) and it's randomly generated too.Cons Your ping relies on the killer's internet ( host ). There are campers and this ruin your game besides the report system seems not to work since they always do it. I had a data loss ( which happened to many people as I see ) ok each game has issues but the support takes way to long to answer your mails and that's a lowering the image of Behaviour Interactive. If you play with friends it can take a long time until you find a game. Usually it happens when you play with 2 3 friends duo is ok.I think that's pretty much it. The gameplay is really awesome. When you play by yourself it's pretty intense. But my opinion would be that Behaviour could really do much better about this game ( talking about bugs and support ). I'd recommend it though because it's a cheap game which is really addictive.

review: Dead by Daylight is a fun game at the core. The gameplay is admittedly fairly simplistic but that doesn't stop it from shining in the asymmetric survival genre. With only one gamemode and one primary objective it might seem at first glance that it can get quite repetitive and boring but I think that the bloodweb system of acquiring items perks addons and offerings keeps the game feeling fresh.Don't get me wrong this game has its issues with a fair variety of bugs and some pretty OP items or abilities but since the games are pretty short it's easy to get out of a boring game and get right back into the action. One of the biggest problems I have with the game is the fact that there aren't any dedicated servers. Servers are instead hosted by the Killer which makes for some very annoying situations in which you think that you weren't seen or that you shouldn't have been hit but they somehow find or hit you. This could probably be solved by creating dedicated servers and giving players a ping indicator in the HUD in the lobby so that they know if they need to leave the lobby and find a new one.The strengths of the game are the high skill cap and the procedural generation of maps. Skill is a large part of playing this game since repairing healing sabotaging wiggling and struggling all involve a quicktime event of some sort. In addition to the QTEs evading the killer is quite skill intensive as well since you have to know when to juke hop in a closet drop a pallet etc. The procedural generation of maps is a strength in my eyes because it keeps those who play a lot from knowing the best spots all the time and keeps the playing field relatively level. The randomness provided by this feature also contributes to the overally feeling of the game that you never know what's going to come next and the torment that the characters are supposed to experience.Overall I highly recommend the game if you like asymmetric survival/horror games or just want to try something a bit different.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Short version Killer is always in favor with cheap bs Surv are always nerfed when they have a slight leg up Not the best community Killers can hit through walls You need to leave ppl to die if you want to win problem is no one knows when is the best time Not for causal play Your team will kill u for points. (I personally hate learning that stuff since it breaks the game a little and just want to not invest that much time.) No balance. Even a rank 1 surv can get absolutely destroyed by a rank 15 killer. Sure you'll waste 3 minutes but thats about it. Depending on team not very much. Cheaters on crackLong Okay so palets get glitched (on top of several more game breaking ones killers are always way more in favor then survivors. They give you one map in the game thats good for a survivor and it gets nerfed. Your team mates usually get you killed. If your a killer main then the only choice is trapper there is only one killer TRAPPER he moves so fast with the chase buff that he sprints past you. Only thing that could counter him was sprint burst/lethe you can't use them together now cause of nerf. If you want a game you could casually enjoy this is NOT it. You shouldn't even play surv cause you barely ever are enjoying urself with all the bs. A killer can flick the mouse and 360 around buildings cars and trees big obsticals as well that shouldn't be able to reach. I get this is a skill thing but to be honest whats the point in trees and cars and T walls? You can take em out. I think flicking should be out. It makes more sense in the game that way. Also you should take out being able to hit through windows. I get hit through walls when that happens. I will be around a coner and his hand will hit me through a wall. How can the trapper even hit someone (Same for nurse wraith and every other killer but myers) with a weapon that big. You can't ever juke a billy hit cause range is so long and u can 360 hit the WHOLE area around you.

review: Ok so i've played to the point where i have a level 50 Meg Thomas &amp due to my profile picture you can most likely already tell what im gonna say about this game. Hear me out the community seems to have gone sour but if you're willing to put up with some trolls &amp campers here &amp there then i fully recomend this game to people who consider themselves good at stealth games. On the other side of the dile there's the killer Let's put it this way I've never had a more twistedly fun experience in a video game then playing the killer on a good day it's a really good anger outlet in my opinion. Finally theres's the overall feel of the game the grungy music &amp visuals gave off a really great vibe the aesthetics of the game are most likely my favorite part it really gives off a classic slasher film/occult feel like there's always the overlooming presence of the paranormal breathing down your neck this is helped along by the constant refrences to offerings sacrifices &amp rituals including the real life practice of burning tea leaves &amp flowers &amp the keeping of totems to ward off spirits &amp other things of the sort. Give DBD a try &amp see how ya feel.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Not a good choice if you want a fair multiplayer which requires skill. The fact that there are still mechanics like bloodlust (making the killer faster after a certain time in a chase) autoaim (helping killers to hit stuff) perks which let survivors tank way too many hits or get free escapes actually just giving the survivors way too strong placements of tiles (walls with pallets and windows)makes the game a complete mess if you get into it.The design of killer and survivor is used to only have one side really having fun. Killers are from the game design used to camp (stay near you so you die for sure after getting caught) because survivors seem too hard to catch that a killer would actually go after another one instead of securing the kill. Survivors are used to gen rush (do generators extremly fast) which makes the game completly survivor sided. The maps are way too big that the killer could have enough pressure to stop that. Also a couple of items and killer abilities are just braindead broken or just unfun. If you wanted to be a part of a non toxic DbD community and have fun you should have started playing this game summer 2016. Now its just sad looking at it its dying.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Edit I believe in being fair. While I stand by my feelings regarding many aspects of the game I did finally hear from BEhavior. They were effusive in their apologies for the long reply and awarded my wife 830 600 000 bloodpointys to restore her characters. With that said I have to say that my main gripe has been addressed. However many of the other issues really need to be worked out and improved. If you submit a ticket to BEhavior expect to wait a few weeks to a month for resolution of your issue via bloodpoint reward. I can cautiously recommend this game again...with the caveat that you backup your save and in my case disable Steam cloud saves.So here are the facts about this game Pros Incredibly addictive fun to play Great maps Great killersCons Developers do not respond when you need assistance. My wife lost her save data due to a well known issue with this game and the Steam cloud. She lost over 1 100 hours of bloodpoints and prestiges over multiple characters. We went on the forums found the method to ask the dev for help. They replied that they would get back to us and that they appreciated our patience. That was a month ago. Since then we have requested help two more times sending them all the information they asked for...no response. Survivors are lacking in true ethnic diversity. Mostly white. No Latinos Hispanics Middle Eastern people and no Black men. It has a distinctly Eurocentric myopic feel to it. Not super welcoming to people of color to have super limited options for them to play as people who represent them. Leatherface is a reskin and rehash of the Hillbilly with slightly different perks. Even his weapons are not realy different. The game is supremely glitchy and it gets to be really hard to play if the host has poor internet Plenty of hackers on here who make the experience less than fun far too often Survivors have a bunch of mediocre outfits that offer no bonuses in and of themselves...just looksWith that said I still play this game as does my wife because we have supported it from the beta stage and sunk so much money and time into all of the add on content Which was mostly not really worth it. We stuck by this game because we thought the devs were really trying to do things differently. I bought multiple copies of it for friends and family. But in the end they behave no better than EA or 2K games. They are only about the bottom line and could care less about the people who were loyal to them and helped to stuff their pockets and promoted their game at the grass roots. I am extremely disappointed. I can't in good conscience recommend this game to someone else knowing how BEhavior treated us as customers and gamers.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: since the great patch (1.02) i played 3 matches as the killer killed each time 3 of the survivors pretty quickly and the last one ran to an endless window juke spot where he jumps through the same window without any chance for me at all to catch him (while teabagging me) for like 5 10 minutes. rly fun as killer... then they run to the trapdoor and win with like 25k points as a reward for wasting your time. game itself is fun but i'm not willing to watch someone teabag me for 5 minutes at the end of everygame just wasting my time that just simply ruins the fun for meEdit about a year later. They fixed the faults i pointed out and added a lot of new stuff ( most of it free too). I think it's a really enjoyable game now so go ahead and give it a try )Edit2 Fall 2017 now. They added some new survivor perks which just let them straightup escape or give them a third life. Playing killer is now either being bullied by survivors who you can barely kill one of with some of the killers after being looped around safe pallets for 20 minutes. Also instant blind flashlights.Now the other thing happening is that you actually kill 2 survivors and now the last 2 just hide waiting for the other guy to die so they can take the hatch. Sometimes 5 10 minutes pass without you seeing a survivor or a survivor touching a generator (rank 5 10 btw). Then you finally kill on of them. Now you have to search the whole map for the last survivor who is hiding next to the hatch just so he can tbag you before getting his free 7k bloodpoints for sandbagging his team. This game has been out for 1 5 years and still needs a lot of work..

review: One of the few games that really hooked me in.I've been obsessed with this game for about a month I played 30 hours without a graphics card at 15 25 fps because it was so thrilling and fun. I recently switched to playing the killer which is a whole other type of fun as well. In the beginning you experience the thrill of being hunted. You run when you shouldn't you stay put when you shouldn't all out of fear of the hook. You try to fix generators but keep screwing it up and making noise which gets your heart racing. After this stage of personal progression you begin to learn better when to run and hide. You might even watch the killer roam around a bit nearby waiting for them to leave so you can continue working on your generator.Then you experience a new killer one you haven't played before. They can sneak up on you like the others can't or you don't realize they're coming until you see their red glow on your back. You'll eventually play in the insane asylum which sucks but has it's own reason for adding to your level of fear.Moral of the story is get this game. It's fun and thrilling as all hell.

review: This game transformed my wife into an official gamer! When first starting to play this game be sure to turn out the light and be prepared to have your heart beat out of your chest. This is an exceptionally exciting game (especially for new players). The basic mechanics are about as simple as it gets so it makes for an easy learning curve. At the same time there is a nice complexity to the game that builds with your experience so what appears simple on the surface actually can be quite intricate. The DLC is pretty nice in terms of nostalgic value and the most recent patch introduced some new mechanics as well that help keep the game from getting stale. The only downside I have experienced this far is that the adrenaline rush doesn't come so much any more when the killer comes near after many hours of gameplay. Absolutely love the assymetry too many games are cookie cutter and this actually presents a real challenge when playing as a survivor. Backstories for the characters are interesting and I wish they were fleshed out a bit more so that you could connect with them more as favorites. If the devs could figure out a way to deal with "face camping killers" this would be a 10/10 for me. Excellent game have gifted it to several friends pick it up if you haven't already!
title: Dead by Daylight

review: After many updates the game has improved and is very fun for survivor mains. Killers have a rough time because its survivor oriented now. Also not been able to play on my own account for over 3 months now because of an error the devs haven't gotten back to me on. Negative review because a small percentage of the player base (myself an avid loving player included) can't play a game they paid 20$ (or more in my case for the cosemetic DLC) for.OLD REVIEW BELOW Ok. I've played the game long enough now to update my review. Solo queing survivor 5/8 times unless you play selflessly you won't get help from the other survivors. Survive with friends you can party up to 4 and have a much more organized game with the help of VOIP servers such as discord (free) or teamspeak. I've had great games when I've been able to talk with at least one of my fellow survivors. Killer. Needs work. The debuffed a lot of the killers recently but they are about to drop a new map and new killer. Trapper was my favorite until they removed putting the trap down infront of the hooked victim. Now everyone just camps / patrols again. I try not to because I know I'll get more points chasing around other people then having a staring contest with a guy stuck hitting spacebar that isn't going anywhere because your dumb is just trying to sit there and smack him with your weapon even though it won't do anything to make him die any faster.TL DR If you wanna play with friends and survive game is 8/10 if you wanna kill people and up their day 6/10 until killer buff to compete with BS survivors or the new killer will be better. Idk I'll probably update this review in another 200 300 hours of gameplay.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: I love this game I think it is great the designers of this game to come up with a game completely different than most main stream games it offers something completely different to the table and gives the option to play either killer my favorite and or survivor. I love the different take of this game and this game is like no other this game for me stands alone. I would love to see the intensity of this game evolve and continue. Excellent concept for a game. Also granted a lot of people I've noticed rage quite on the survivor side which is unsportsman like I understand but rage quitting..I would like to see that once survivors are then selected for the match then to be locked down till the end (If thats even possible to do why beacuse if you've selected a bunch of totems hexe's and or offerings rage quitting then will render the killers perks and or offerings to be completely useless. Just because they get salty and dip out half way through a match.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: I LOVE this game! Variety of killers survivers and maps to play and the developers are constantly working on improving and adding content. I really enjoy playing both killer and survivor. I usually play killer if I'm solo but really enjoy playing survivor with at least one friend although I know idealy I should play solo I appreciate that it is an option. The only thing unfortunate about this game (and any multi player game i'm sure) is that I've found the survivor community to be quite toxic in after game chat but it's always something you can ignore. There really are a lot of fun random people out there to play with but it seems the toxic ones are always the ones that stand out since the scram the loudest. Thankfully there are bans for that D. I definity recommend this game to anyone! I still consider myself a newie but find it enjoyable and look forward to learning more and getting better!
title: Dead by Daylight

review: EDIT New Review They have since fixed my technical issues with the game for transparency I will leave my previous review.They have fixed the matchmaking and server issues. It no longer takes forever to que for a game. People still BM but I guess this is 2017 and the interner so what do I expect. Otherwise this game is a lot of fun and if you have some friends to play with you will definately have the optimal expirence. Previous Review I'd love to write a review but I'd have to connect to the internet first.Anyone who voted this game up either played a way earlier more stable build of the game which I doubt or is fanboi'd themselves up and made a stand. This game is a hot mess constant lobby issues constant reports of being not connected to the internet contstant BM from killers and survivors alike.For what it is worth when actually playing the game and not recieving BM from a toxic community it's a really solid game that I enjoyed a lot. But it's not worth fighting through 15 minutes of trying to connect to a lobby for a game to only be trolled by a killer who knocks the last two players down and walks around.

review: I had my first taste of DBD on the XOne. At first i was just watching and thinking to myself "This game is stupid". Then I was given a try. As soon as I put on the headphones it was a whole different ballgame.i felt my heart start to pick up in speed. Its alright... its just sound. So i picked my first character. They didnt tell me how to do anything so i tested out how to play. This did this and that did that ect. Then i started to hear a creepy hum. Oh that hum scared me the most. I started to run and i got louder and louder. I looked back for a second and was like "NOPE"!!! This game is a good scary game and is a challange. But warning you need Direct X 11 to play it. Direct X 12 should work but it wont start up the game unless you have 11. Figure out how to get Direct X 11 and your set for a good scare
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Review changed to positive.Play with friends has been patched in allowing you to progress while you play together.Old Review I was going to refund this game because the features I was told will be in game never came when the game released. Even with the devs knowing full well weeks before the release of the game the ability to invite your friend to a game other then private was never added.I love to progress in games it means that you get better at it with tools you can use. When you play private sure you can play with your friend(s) but you do not level or gain anything in return.The problem with playing a private game means that if you only have one other friend to play the game with one of you will be the monster and the other a surviver you cannot open the game to public or invite others not in your friends list. This means that out of the 4 survivers that could be on the map you play by yourself.If you want to play with friend and progress you have to play the loby game you enter and exit depending if your friend is in there or not.I cannot speak for everyone others who play this game think that the game would be easy or unfair if friends talked over the internet allowing them to communicate where the monster is... I've played the game with 2 other friends 1 other surviver and the monster from this experience I can say that we ether won with most of us dead or all dead rarely we all survived comunication did us little good except when we had to run which still eneded up with one of us dead we never took advantage of hopping windows like crayze.Its been a few weeks now since the game has released and the survivers life has gotten even harder. You still cant play with friends and progress however.
title: Dead by Daylight

The wait is affected by a number of factors including being dropped by the matchmaking service problems with authentication for some reason and just good ol' fashioned being locked in some kind of cue limbo. It's a truly dissapointing fail on the developers end because the rest of the game is wonderfully addictive and great fun.

review: I've played this game for about twelve hours and already see a glaring problem. This game is complete garbage in some aspects. Here are some pros and cons. Pros Playing survivors actually conveys a sense of fear and dread at times not actual fear but fear of losing them sick rank progression points and potential blood points. (essentially XP.) Killers are unique and interesting to play as despite some clearly being better than others. (The nurse being clearly amazingly good if you can understand her.) The game is oddly... hard to find stale despite spamming game after game the consumable add ons and offerings add a layer of replayability and lack of staleness. Cons Killers. Listen survivors once they get easy access to flashlights and batteries... are ing insane. I've played five games so far level 20 into trapper rank eighteen. Trapper is a solid pick but is weaker than the high tier killers this would be fine if skill mattered into whether i get to have fun in all of my games. When i actually am able to have fun due to my skill it's because none of the survivors brought flashlights and batteries. Survivors can group easily pick up gens move to the next and stomp you. I downed two survivors they didn't even worry just waited for me to pick one up flashlighted me due to the fact there was no nearby wall... and i dropped the survivor who instantly healed due to a poor game mechanic and then immediately lost him and had to chase him again. Therefore giving more time for them to do gens. It took me a solid Five MINUTES. of just hitting and picking up survivors to finally get one dead. There isn't any intrinsic lack of skill to me they literally face camped me as the killer and i felt more scared to play than i ever did as a survivor. This really makes killers feel unfun and non scary to play as. Now this is due to the fact i don't have the perk and offering to reduce flashlight stun and build up but that shouldn't be required to have fun even at my low level... survivors Survivors... just feel unfun to play as unless you completely stomp the killer honestly it feels unfun for the game to hinge on three other people unless you have the godly perks. Teamwork and altruism will crush any killer. Borrowed time decisive strike and sprint burst? Dang well i guess we're just gonna completely stomp the killer as our Dwight runs leadership so we can speed through our 5 gens in less time than it takes for one hooked teammate to die. If you like challenge play without items or item add ons allowing RNG and chests to actually give you that edge with a sense of risk. otherwise it feels like it's too easy to hardstomp. TL DR Killers are horrendously perk and item locked in the early game compared to survivors. Early survivors with no perk and no item are harshly under relevent unless they know how to play well. Killers are horrendously irrelevant to late game survivors... even with some decent perks.Survivors are fun but eventually become dull to the fact they can hardstomp easily. Final Thoughts This game is worth it to buy on sale for every time i get flashlight s i will get two or three games of people who are normal and one or two games of altruistic good players. then about four or three games of people who play hyper altruistic without any sense of safety and easily let me decimate them. In total the game is good as a whole but the small bits and pieces make either the survivor late game... or the killer early game... horrendous.

review: As much of a buggy piece of this game is it's surprisingly fun and addicting albeit repetitive. When you get used to everything the ball starts rolling.Starting off the game legitimately had me scared. Not cowering under the covers kind of scared but legitimately nervous and afraid of dying and losing the match because the killer is very intimidating. Especially during moments of pressure when you're being chased down or have to force yourself to not panic in order to sneak and not give up your position because stealth is very much so rewarded.This game is not easy especially when starting off as a survivor. If you're coming into the game ignorant you're going to be making a LOT of mistakes. That's why it's good to be with friends or "survive with friends" so that someone's there to show you the ropes. I feel a lot of newcomers jump into this clueless and get salty which is honestly understandable. This game isn't so casual as it requires some commitment especially with how grindy it can be with the bloodpoints system. On the contrary the killer's part is a lot easier. Don't get me wrong it's not baby mode you have to at least know what you're doing or you're going to get trolled by teabagging survivors who constantly juke stealth and farm bloodpoints from your lack of knowledge. But with some commitment you'll do just fine as a killer as well.Survivor and Killer are completely different worlds and which being more fun is all up to preference Survivor is more difficult and focuses more on keeping you on edge where you have to keep a level head and not give away your position. In the end you have to be as stealthy as possible and not give yourself away unless you absolutely must have to such as saving a friend from an impending doom. But you gotta be clever too and wary about the kind of noise you make when performing certain actions.Killer on the other hand is easier and is all about hooking them up. You assert your dominance and gain pleasure from their panic and despair. While Killer is a walk in the park in comparison you still have to be clever about what you do because survivors can be just as clever. With the first person perspective it is surprisingly easy to lose track of your prey or have mind games be played on you. When you overcome this barrier you'll soon learn that you get the most satisfaction from not only sacrificing survivors but playing with your food (which coincidentally is a perk too). Camping and securing your kill isn't usually a good thing to do as hooking survivors repeatedly can net you more bloodpoints (and fun too). When you hook someone and walk away they will stop doing generators to help each other which can clue you in on where they are about to go next. Even if they successfully save someone they only have a certain amount of times they can be hooked before an instant death. It's very much possible to get lots of bloodpoints without sacrificing a single survivor because you are moreso rewarded on the amount of actions you perform. But in the end you would want to get multiple hooks and if possible kill absolutely everyone after you've grinded them out.Now I'm not here to tell people how to play the game but the intention here is that you're suppose to be scared as a survivor. If you're teabagging all over the place can you honestly call yourself scared? No. If you're discouraged from messing around and instinctively try to get out ASAP can you call yourself at least a little bit worried? Yes. What confuses me the most is when people talk about balance and use that as their entire argument for downvoting the game. I understand that balance is very often important but in this case Dead by Daylight is a unique case. Yes the killer will kill you once they find you. Yes Michael Myers will one shot you if he keeps staring at you for long enough. But is he impossible to beat? The answer is no. Michael Myers is very strong one of the strongest infact but he is not OP like the Nurse once was. Once you figure him out you'll once again learn that stealth is still very much so rewarded because being one shotted isn't a thing when he doesn't even know where you are right? And if he finds you you're SUPPOSE to be scared and concerned about living or not. There shouldn't be a definitive strategy to never getting caught such as infinitely juking or hiding. It's kind of dependent on luck. That's why the maps are randomized and never consistently the same. In a way this games runs off of RNG or situations that are not very easy to control. If you know what to expect that gives you a sense of security. But no Dead by Daylight is a game where you should never feel safe and the devs try to make it so with every patch. The killers SHOULD have an advantage over the survivors otherwise it wouldn't be a "survivor horror" game now would it? Now don't get me wrong there were plenty of times where both sides had unfair advantages or just completely illogical things happening but the devs handle it as diligently as possible.And what's with all these people complaining about paid DLC? He's MICHAEL MYERS from Halloween. Do you honestly think the devs can profit off of a licensed franchise and legally get away with it? I feel like there's a bunch of kids these days with mob mentalities who just look at Capcom's DLC practices then just use that as reference to start hating on all forms of DLC as if they know that the system is corrupt and that they're here to preach the truth and fight the power. Why don't you actually take a little bit of a time out of your day and learn about how corporation works?In closing this game is fairly new a couple months old. It's got a long way to go and I'm hoping that it goes somewhere within the next year or so. It'll either be dead or still kicking. I'm hoping it's kicking. Despite my hours I felt I made this review very early. And besides some argue that this feels like an early access game. And trust me it sure does feel like one. I'm just hoping there's much more to come in the future. Not just new survivors killers and maps but more objectives and content. I understand it might be kind of difficult to come up with new ideas since honestly this game is a one of a kind and requires a different approach. Why is this game with as many bugs as it has is still frequently played? Because literally no one else has made a game like it. But an exception might be Friday the 13th coming soon.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: This game has very amazing content and the way it was set up is clever. However there are serious downfalls to the game. Major one that is ruining the game and litteraly making matchmaking take insanely longer is the SWF feature which allows you to team up with your friends before joining a match. Most killers will leave the lobby when seeing everyone join as a team and if your the killer why wouldnt you? It is to unfair mainly because high rank 5+ will have one rank 15 or lower in there team and be matched up with a new killer who is also rank 15. And going against player who have all 4 perks while you do not and in teamspeak is not fun. This is ruining the game for both parties and the forums show this. I would avoid this game untill a solution is found.

review: There are pros and cons like all games. But its not good when the cons out weigh the pros. The items should not disappear it is complete bull that they do. A shop should be implemented as well to where you can buy clothes hair masks weapons etc. Or let us get the items there something needs to give or the game wont last long for many. There needs to be a party system. People get this game yes to play with their friends but online as well. You want us to wait in the lobby screen forever waiting to see if our friend may possibly appear at a 0.00000001% of them actually getting into your lobby? There are definitely some bugs that need to be fixed with the game the crashing the mouse disappearing even the glitches of you being the killer and have someone one hit away from being downed they go over a barricade you hit them and they are still standing up but it was a registered hit. Fixes need to be made or the game will just fall off after a while because of all the problems people are having or how unbalanced the game can be on both sides of the spectrum. Like not being able to control the hillbilly chainsaw sprint Not enough hiding spaces for the survivor to get away. A majority of the time if you even get spotted your done for. Or another aspect when your the killer there being to many knockover barricades on the map it just becomes an aggravation nuisanc and overall makes it less fun and more hard to be the killing role. There a problems all over and thats alternately what happens when you release a game earlier than it should have been. Gaming companies are more for releasing them early then making sure the game is perfect and entertaining and fun for the players. People should NOT release games early. Bugs are no fun for anyone yes there will be bugs but when there are this many its just straight carelessness and greed. Please fix the bugs. I love this game and id recommend it because i wish to see it become better and be more fun and less aggravating for the players.
title: Dead by Daylight
