review: UPDATE 7/13/2017 The devs pushed an update that absolutely obliterated matchmaking. It's now almost impossible to find a match and often trying will crash your whole game. The crash can happen when you're queuing by yourself trying to join a Survive with Friends or Kill Your Friends lobby or when your SWF lobby tries to connect to a killer. If your game doesn't crash outright you might get the infinite loading screen bug which requires a restart to fix. It's now also super easy to get disconnected in the middle of a match.Until Behavior fixes matchmaking don't buy this game. You'll spend more time waiting for a match than actually playing. Overall the game is a lot of fun! I generally really enjoy when I play and the game provides the kind of stress based fear that horror games should strive for. However I DO have some issue I feel like people should know about.1. The matchmaking is absolutely horrendous. If it can't immediately find a game to put you in it often quits looking and you have to click the button again. (my record is 12 tries before it actually started searching like it's supposed to) If the hunter leaves the game everyone is booted and you have to search all over again. Further there seems to be no experience basis to who gets put in what game leaving me in my first match as hunter to try and chase down two top rank survivors.2. The game is often laggy. In the worst cases I experience nasty rubberbanding. When I'm in the middle of a chase and try vaulting or throwing down a board to escape the game hasn't quite caught up with me and while I'm waiting for it to register my frantic spacebar spamming I get shanked.3. The ranking system is incredibly frustrating. As a survivor one can play a perfectly good game with all or most escaping and derank solely because you didn't heal your buddy or escape a chase often enough. As a hunter it feels too easy to rank up even hooking only one survivor I gained a mark because I chased around the other three long enough to make up the lost points.4. Trying to use items is also incredibly frustrating. They occur rarely as is and even when I do find one I'm reluctant to use it since if I die it and any add ons I attached to it are gone for good. Their benefits weren't even enough to keep me from deranking when I DID get to use them.5. Nothing is intuitive. The tutorials are just videos with vague imperatives like "maim survivors" superimposed over some staged gameplay. I didn't even know which buttons to press until I got into my first game. The items and perks aren't any better I keep seeing mentions of "dark mist" but I have yet to find out what that actually is.6. There's no way to communicate once the games starts. Of course I wouldn't ask for team voice chat a la Overwatch but even a couple of range based interaction hotkeys would do wonders.This doesn't even begin to touch on the lack of a party system the completely average graphics and the fact that the game has so few mechanics that it's outdone by most game jam products but those are of less concern to me personally. Again I really do enjoy playing the game it's just so full of issues that I can't help but be frustrated after a couple of minutes of playing. Definitely buy it if you like horror just wait until it goes on sale.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: My first game ever was with a Killer because it was taking forever to que as a survivor. I tried to que as Killer and it was instant that led me to playing the Killer over and over. I started out getting board/window looped by some people and never being able to track any of the 4 survivors down as they got generators on and escaped. Then I got good with the hooks and realized that nearly everyone tries to save their friends. Some folks call it camping I call it a sure way to win if you are playing with scrub survivors or altruistic high ranks. This game is awesome and I also have a great time as a survivor escaped for the first time yesterday (got 2 gens on myself too). You can hate on the Killer for camping or you can not get caught in the first place don't be stupid and try to save your friends and if you are still butt hurt take it up with the DEVS. I think it's well balanced depends how smart you are on both sides. 10/10!

review: I tried this product on the free weekend it was on sale for 9$ I played it for about 2 hours thought it was really cool but wasn't for me. I then spent the next day looking on Steam for something LIKE this with the same online gameplay feel that this brought me and I could not find it. The sale had ended and it was already 19.99$ again at which I bought it and am enjoying it and do not regret it buying it for the higher price.It can be repetitive if you only play as survivor but you can always switch between killers &amp survivors and each killer has a different play style so it isn't repetitive for me. Also you can get unique items that "slightly" help you but only experience and some reading of the in game tips will truly help you win.I have not played that other horror game you all know which one but I'm waiting for a sale to try that one as well but back to this game I recommend it the thrill and fear I felt the first time playing was very interesting and although its not scary anymore I find it actually funny when you are hands reach from either a killer or a survivor and you miss or they miss you with that fatal blow.. always makes me laugh... If you are the killer stay patient and stay focused on your goals eventually they are going to slip up in a rush to finish the objectives...

review: Ever so frustrating yet sheepishly satisyfing. Nothing better than barely wiggling out of Michael Myers's grasp and running to your friends for help only to be met by his creepy face peering at your through the window. Now your friends hate you for leading him to them but you are happy that he has chosen to pursue them and give yourself a much needed break to let your heartbeat return to normal.LOTS of tweaks and changes. Developers try to keep things as balanced as possible. What really matters is that the game is fun and spooky.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Never expected this game to be a big deal as I got it as part of a random humble bundle where I was angling for another game. This game however was a total diamond in the rough and has been a lot of multiplayer fun!Not much to say that hasn't been said by other reviewers The core game mechanic is essentially hide and seek with the additional nerve wracking "break your friend out of jail" mechanic. Super fun. Even though its irritating to be camped by a killer there is game balance here from the fact that a team of good survivors should see whats going down and exploit this to make progress on their objective. I think its a fun trade off and makes for some interesting moments!The thing that has been sort of a disappointment and this is something I've given some thought to because its weird the toxic attitude in the lobby both before/after games really gets old after a while. After about 40+ hours of game play being subjected to the abusive language over and over again is just tedious... I know I'm here to play a 'murder' simulator but its always a little sad seeing the % of the population that feels OK with subjecting everybody else to the chat room equivalent of a truck stop bath room wall. Clean it up folks!
title: Dead by Daylight

review: I do not recommend this game to potential buyers. It has a very high skill cap for new players to learn the game to the point of many people not wanting to try it again because they get absolutely demolished by people abusing exploits to lower their ranks and somehow not getting banned for it.... Meaning people playing killer with 2200+ hr gameplay are getting put in the same match with 0 30 hour survivors. This is terrible design. It's also terrible that survivors are getting nerfed more and more. Less pallets bloodlust slower vault speeds games being extended longer by several minutes because of perk combinations like Ruin and BBQ Chili.... BBQ Chili even on Billy is the most anti fun game you can play. This game has gone from jump scare Michael games to annoying grind fests where you're held hostage in a round with a killer... e.g. a Doctor that you have to attempt to sneak around which is nearly impossible and also impossible to get away from Doctors or do any actions once they've chased you for a while. Ultimately the devs are making bad decisions by killing off interest for most of the player base the survivors. They're taking away bright/dark moonlight nerfing flashlights again reducing pallets more..... it's just way too much. The mechanic of simply "running away" is boring. Little strategy involved there. With devs talking about taking away moonlight already having nerfed mist to it not being worth playing etc... it sounds like they're trying to address the issue of people hacking items on their accounts in a less than productive way. I think there's a huge problem now that you have to rely more and more on terrible teammates to unhook you. This isn't scary it's annoying. Many of these changes just lead to frustrating game play. I'd say a reason many people still play is to unlock everything but even then it's not really great because devs are making games longer without actually giving us much more points.On the weekend that Freddy was released I got 3 5k tops most games. Normally with my full build I would get maybe 12 20k+. Doesn't matter if it's bonus points weekend if you still end up getting average points because you don't properly play test a killer and balance it.... you guys should seriously read the review bombs that happened around Halloween when Freddy came out. It was all deserved because little testing clearly went in to Freddy and it was nearly impossible to get away from him or do anything. Rare skillchecks to be found item add ons that were supposed to give you more skillchecks actually REDUCED your chance sabotage didn't cause you to wake up from his dream perma deerstalker on you etc.... just led to a very anti fun weekend. I should say it can be fun... especially if you group up with friends on voice chat but if new killers continue to end up being as unbalanced as Freddy and if devs continue to ruin their own game by keeping survivors hostage in garbage killer rounds then I cannot recommend this game anymore. Again the skill cap is already really high and these killer perks are punishing new players even more than previously... if you get demolished every time you play you might not want to play again. This has been the case for a number of my friends.****** TIPS FOR DEVS TO IMPROVE * Stop nerfing survivors. Removing items completely from the game (as well as pallets) is not a fix for balancing gameplay. It just makes the game more two dimensional and bland.* Survivors absolutely need ways to counter BBQ Chili more. Hiding in lockers should counter BBQ Chili. If a killer is BAD he should not be babysat by saying "here are the survivors"... it takes away skill from the game.* Doctor is way too strong still. There should be a much longer window between screams when in stage 3 it's already way too easy for a doctor to hunt someone down even after they escape. If you ESCAPE from a killer by juking you should be able to get away for good. You shouldn't be punished for it. This is very bad design. You should not have to rely on selfish randoms to save you.* Consider adding a tutorial video or training mode for killers / survivors. The tips in the pre loading screen is a good start though
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Ladys and Gentlemen I welcome you to the saltiest game the world has ever seen. https //youtu.be/3KquFZYi6L0 This is a short description of how the game community functions /url I'm happy to announce the most toxic community since League of Legends. Here you are morally somewhat below a pedophile terrorist who sells drugs to kittens if you play killer. Threats to have your family yourself and your pets killed sexually violated or tortured is something you should get used to.The game is an asymetrical horror competitive coop game. Where one side plays the killer as a single person and has to kill four survivors. The survivors need to repair 5 generators on a randomly generated map of which each has a specific theme but the maps are always very slightly different.For the horror aspekt of the game is to say that it is not exactly clear who scares who more. If the killer is more scared of the survivors or the other way around. For the survivors to win they have to repair the generators which enables them to unlock the two exit gates and leave through said gate the last remaining survivor can also leave through the exit hatch which opens even if not five generators are yet done.For the killer to win he has obviously to kill the survivors. To kill a survivor the killer has to hit him twice where the first hit damages said survivor and the second hit puts the survivor down. After the survivor is downed he needs to be put onto a hook. Hooks can be everywhere on the map.The survivor is then for a specific time on said hook until finally dying. The other ways to kill a survivor is by hooking them once and if they were rescued and you used a so called Mori offerring before the start of the game you can kill the survivor https //www.youtube.com/watch?v Rw7gTUzPDbc which looks ultra cool btw /url directly after downing him.The survivor can be hooked for up to 3 times before dying completly but he can also die in a single hook as long as noone comes or manages to rescue said survivor.The sides have completly different playstyles. A survivor can shift between crouching walking and sprinting. He can also jump through windows and above dropped pallets as well as he is able to drop pallets. The survivor plays from a third person perspective.The Killer plays from a first person perspective walks generally faster than the survivor can sprint but has a set speed. He can be stunned by pallets can't drop them but can destroy dropped pallets and walk slowly through windows. Each killer also has a special ability like setting traps for the trapper a chainsaw sprint for hillibilly a blink for the nurse etc.The killer also gets indicators about noise that the survivors do. When they for example jump through a window or finish a generator. The killer also sees every unfinished generator with a red indicator which enables him to go directly to them without searching for it. And the killer can see the tracks of injured or running survivors to enable him to chase said survivors better.Each side can unlock various perks tools and addons they can equip before each round.Lets talk about the specific jobs of each side. Your main job as a survivor is to make the killer angry. Teabag him have him follow you through a bunch of pallets and loops and basically just him up. https //www.youtube.com/watch?v tahJmMkEEXA basically like that /url The killer runs around and tries to down a survivor. He then proceeds to place him on a hook and then has the big moral questions. Because the general psychology of the survivors there is always someone near to save him. Thus he has the decision between three things.1. Leave the hook and search for survivors2. Softcamp3. HardcampThe first decision is the one survivors try to force at the killer this is also the decision that appoints you with the lowest killrate and lowest amount of Blood Points. This decision normally leads to survivors calling you a noob and laughting at you because of your low killrate in the endgame chat.The second decision grants you the highest Blood Point and a normally you have about as many kills as when you'd hardcamp. Sometimes more sometimes less. This decision also grants you a decent amount of salt.The last decision would grant you an o.k. amount of blood points a decently high killrate and an insane amount of salt. Don't forget if you play killer your main goal should be the salt. The more death threats reports insults and flame in general you get the better you were in reaching your goal.In turn as a survivor it is your task to flame the killer in the endgame chat. Don't worry in this game the only bannable offense is to cheat nothing else ever got banned.I don't know if the game is something for you. But if you want to get the salt. Live for it. Breath it and strife in it. And all the insults you fired in League of Legends and that were fired at you throughout all your time playing is not enough for you. Here you can get the same amount in a week. (Only if you played League of Legends for at least 3 years and played ranked in low elo).This was my review. Have fun. And remember No Salt no Life.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: This game has been incredibly good to me so far. After playing around 100 hours of so I've gotten used to the mechanics of DBD. Honestly this has been a pretty unique experience in terms of asymmetrical multiplayer. You've got your standard four survivors (playing in third person mode) who try to fix generators to open a gate and leave (and maybe save a couple of hooked friends) and you've got your killer (playing in first person mode) who just wants to hook and kill everybody for fun D.I'm sure people will say that it'll get stale blah blah blah but that's only for the first few hours of the game. During this time killers will feel incredibly overpowered and you WILL feel like giving up. However if you level up your survivors enough using the in game currency of "Blood Points" you'll eventually get cool neat perks and items that you can use to your advantage against the killer. Conversely the killer can also do this against you.Now this sounds pretty good until you get to the toxicity of some of the players in this game. Survivors often use pallet looping which is basically just running around this object that can stun the killer when you drop it in order to save time for other survivors. This is incredibly frustrating for killers. On the other hand some killers also just camp you sometimes to the point of literally just staring you in the face so that you can't be saved by your fellow team mates. The devs have tried to alleviate some of these problems (in the form of new perks or added features in the game) but some of the solutions just kind of fall flat. Not to mention that strategies against certain killers really have to involve pallet looping to some extent but that's just based on my experience and what I've read.Furthermore another jarring negative in this game is the lack of dedicated servers. Normally it would be fine since the game just directs you to a killer who has a good connection with you most of the time. But if you're playing with friends who are geographically miles apart it's frustrating to get a good compromise between the two and it usually takes several tries to just get it right. It would be amazing to have servers choices instead of this constant trial and error. We have a ton of DLCs but no god damn dedicated servers.Another thing that irks me incredibly is the redundant separation of the menu for "Survive with Friends" and "Play as Survivor". The only difference between these two menus is that Survive with Friends has this little button on the lower right portion of the screen where you can invite your friends to a lobby. Why can't the devs just put these two together in one place? Not to mention that if your party fails to find a match it DOES NOT bring you back to the Survive with Friends menu instead you go back to the Play as Survivor where there is NO OPTION TO INVITE YOUR FRIENDS. This is probably the most annoying thing in this game.There are also a plethora of bugs like when my party and I queue up for a match we all get kicked out for no reason. My friend's game also literally crashes and we have to try MULTIPLE TIMES just to get into a lobby where there is no guarantee that the game will even start. There are also many in game bugs that I hope the devs are trying to solve.When we do get into a game as a party it really is fun to try and survive together. Coordinating with your friends on which generators to finish or telling them to proceed to a gate or trying to save your friend via flashlight are all satisfying to do. This in my opinion is what makes Dead by Daylight a very fun experience.To conclude although I sound incredibly angry and negative in this review I still have to recommend this to people who wanna pick this up. Though the huge number of menu related bugs are annoying the game is fun enough with its perks items and different strategies for each killer that I can look past it and give this game a thumbs up.EDIT NOT RECOMMENDED BECAUSE OF LOBBY ISSUES. LITERALLY WE HAVE TO TRY LIKE 10 TIMES JUST TO GET INTO A LOBBY WITH A KILLER (IN SWF) AND MOST OF THE TIME THE KILLER IS A SCAREDY CAT AND WILL LEAVE SO WE HAVE TO TRY 20 TIMES AGAIN JUST TO GET INTO A GAME.DEVS FIX THIS PIECE OF
title: Dead by Daylight

review: The game is fun for the most part however there are a great deal of bugs and issues that need fixing. First being their ranking system. New players are often tossed into the mix with other killers/survivors that have had a chance to gather and earn more than the new players. It really isn't a new player friendly game. Second would be to fix the issues with killers who lag. The killers are the ones hosting the game and therefore if they are lagging all the players are lagging. I've been in games before where one moment you are completely fine and the next you're on a hook with no clue how you even got there. Unless the killer dc's you are the one punished for it without any help from the company to make up for it. It really puts a damper on the enjoyment of the game. Other things that need fixing are small bugs such as characters and objects floating in the air. At times the game will crash for no reason usually when in the menu. There are times when a lobby will get stuck in the infinite loop of never finding a game. All of these problems and more are not just things I've noticed with my games. I have a large group of discord friends I often play the game with who all seem to have the exact same issues. Not a bug but something I find absolutely no one enjoys in the game is campers. That is when the killer will hook someone and simply stand under or so close that no one can go save them without having help from other skilled players. Even then it's hard to actually get out still. It really runes the fun. I would rather make the killers stronger and remove the ability to allow a killer to camp over allowing them to camp. Survivors have a penalty for camping killers should get one too. (And no I don t just play survivor. I play killer just as often. They are easy enough to play that the only people who actually need to camp are those who can t do well unless they do.)Despite all of its problems it is still a game I would recommend playing simply because when it isn't broken it can be a lot of fun and I hold on to the hope that someday the company will fix the issues listed above. If you are someone who can't handle the chance of losing everything you've worked for due to a bug I would not recommend this game. It will frustrate you beyond reason.
title: Dead by Daylight

title: Dead by Daylight

review: Had a lot of potential but 15 spent and a combined playtime of two hours doesn't seem like a good deal to me.Gameplay is redundant and survivor objectives are boring and mundane. Many would disagree with me but the implementation of a proximity based social component could have enhanced the gameplay but the devs don't want to add it as it would break the terrifying immersion.What's truly terrifying is you have to haphazardously activate all five generators which is about as exciting as painting a wooden panel.Graphically the game is relatively pretty and the character models are nice and expressive. The procedural generated maps are conceptually good but since the base assets are copied and pasted into mildly different locations you'll hardly be able to tell that procedural generation was even a part of the game.Overall if you like spooky things and that gets your wet then give it a try. It's not necessarily fun or deep in any way but some people might like it more than I did. I just wish I'd bought DS III when it was on sale.

title: Dead by Daylight

review: This game is on a good path.Before I start reviewing lets talk about what Dead by Daylight is.Dead by Daylight is a 1 vs 4 online/private match based game where the goal for the killer is to kill the survivors or sacrifice them to an "entity"with your ability.The survivors goal is self explanatory you try to survive and power all of the generators spread across the map with perks and items.Now lets reviewPros This game has many and I mean MANY pros so i'll just do the 3 biggest pros so lets get started.First off the character customization is amazing you can give your character a bloody skin at lvl 50 or even the amazing DLC skins and there are skins that are already there with the download. Another pro is how many characters there are.For survivors you have Meg Dwight Jake Claudette and many more! for killers you have Trapper Hillbilly and The Nurse just to name a few.And they are all unique!lastly Are how many items and perks you can give your survivor or killer.You can give your survivor so many perks that makes playing as your survivor a lot easier and fair. Your killer can not have a main perk but have perks that help the main ability. because they have abilities such as cloaking invisable trapping chainsawing and a small range teleporting feature for the nurse.Survivors get items too like med kits mainly for Claudette or flashlights for Meg tool boxes for jake and maps for dwight.Those are the biggest pros for Dead by Daylight now on to the cons.One con is how much content there is that needs to be bought.If you added up the prices for the game content it would be more than the entire game itself which is very sad because most people dont want pay up to 6.99 just to play as an extra killer or survivor with a map.Another con is the games bugs and glitches I know this one is just something that devs are working on but there are so many bugs and glitches. like options not showing or getting flung out of the map sometimes not being able to even move. The good thing about this con is that I like to think that its getting fixed by devs and should hopefully not be a big problem in the near future.Further more is how Dead By Daylight makes some of the most horrible maps for killers. Maps can suck for two reasons pallets being everywhere or the map being HUGE. Backwater swamp is the biggest and foggiest map ever so catching survivors is so hard and frustrating.Autohaven wreckers is an example of how pallets can be so annoying you cant go 2 seconds without finding a pallet being slammed in your face.Those are some of the biggest cons that i could think of.My overall thought on Dead By Daylight is this. If the develepors keep doing the pros and less of the cons this game will be so much more fun!If they keep doing the cons the game is going to spiral into trash.Thank you so much for reading this it took me about 20 minutes.Tell me if i missed anything and Critical out!

review: Dead by Daylight is a great game with plently of maps and a plentiful variety of survivors and killers to choose from. From my experience I've ran into almost zero issues and couldn't be happier with the performance of the game. I could honestly play this for hours and bringing friends only adds to the fun. To be honest I've played plenty of rounds and I've come to appreciate the multiple tactics that is surviving every killers different game styles. However and here it comes Freddy is undoubtably a very powerful foe. I'm not going to make the argument that he needs to be nerfed. I just believe that he needs to be ... tweaked slightly. I've had my fair share of wins and losses but not once having came across Freddy have I nor my randomly matchmaked party been able to successfully escape him. I invite challenges in games besides that's what makes them way more fun but Freddy is most definetly an overwhelming enemy. I in my good faith hope they find a fair way to balance the character for both stressed survivors and blood thirsty killers. If no compromise can be made or even the developers don't want to make changes I can accept that. So long as they add a feature where survivors can choose which Killers they DO and DO NOT want to encounter in matchmaking. It's a longshot but if that's what it takes I'll bite. Lastly before anyone proclaims I'm a sore loser I'd like to contest that because I've played enough to have many Wins / Losses and I'm fine with that. However when players start disconnecting in game or bite the dust once Freddy is the killer that's when there is an issue. Freddy has pretty much manifested himself into the in game meme equivalent of certain death / failure itself. Anyone trying to voice their concerns can reach the developers at deadbydaylight bhvr.com

review: My Dead By Daylight review has flip flopped a couple times between liking and not liking it. As you can see I've got a fair bit of time in the game but it bounces between good updates and bad updates.pros great concept play as victims or killers lots of customization fun to survive with a group of your friendscons the community is flaming GARBAGE. What the game does is it makes the killers do everything they possibly can to hunt down survivors and it makes survivors do everything they possibly can to get away. This leads to bug abuses infinite loop tactics and a whole bunch of other awful stuff. the devs have literally admitted in their own words they try to "break the game" whenever they unveil a new DLC. You have been warned. If you aren't prepared to accept defeat the moment you find out who you're playing against this game isn't for you. There are some strategies that are just completely broken. On the plus side you don't run into these incredibly often.In the end it's an okay game it was great for a while but then it got worse. It will make you rage and not like rage games do. It will make you hate every human you come into contact with but sometimes it can be fun.

review: The game suffers from a series of bad design decisions which lead to a terrible in game balance bugs that should of never shipped and a very clueless design staff who are more interested in crafting lore and a world than creating a mechanically fun game. The game has nuggets of fun especially at the lower ranks of the game but the problems with the design become crystal clear as your reach the upper ranks of players. Feedback from the community is generally met with a deaf ear feeling or hand waved away creating a bad feeling in the player base and an unwillingness to support development further. Stay away until things change as it could be a really good game if the Devs put forth the effort but nothing has shown me over the last year they have any interest in doing so.Edit Stay away the game is rife with hacks and bugs. Do not play if you care about a fair experience. The Devs haven't made much of an effort to combat it either.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Really fun game. Play killer solo or queue up with 3 other friends or randoms as survivors. The only problem is that the game is bugged to Getting stuck on random terrain falling through the floor and floating are some of the bugs you may encounter. There are also exploits where killers can use survivor perks to reveal other survivors and harmless glitches like having a killer weapon (unusable) on a survivor. The matches are also killer hosted so survivors are at the mercy of their internet connection. For some reason when playing survivor the more people you are in queue with the longer it takes to find a match even though a 4 man queue who only needs a killer SHOULD be quick. There is also a bug where offerings aren't used up and can be endlessly spammed game after game. Once they fix all of the bugs I will change my review.****EDIT Most of the bugs have been fixed so heres that thumbs up
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Awsome game
title: Dead by Daylight

review: So I see a lot of people being semi misleading and thought I would clear some things up a bit first this game is not p2w you don't have to spend a single penny on dlc if you don't want to currently all the survivors have nothing unique because of teachables every survivor/killer has 3 perks that (until the teachables are learned) are unique to the these teachables are gotten at levels 30 35 40 for everyone since survivors have no powers or anything only killers really provide a unique play experiance (at least at tie of posting it has been hinted passives may be a thing for survivors one day) killers all have a unique power so you can play the killer you want now Dead by Daylight does get free killers currently only 2 recent ones but each killer plays differently some powers allow the killer to really shorten a chase (Nurse Myers Hillbilly Wraith(post rework) Leatherface and Trapper) now Killers also can fall into multiple catagories so have a list1. Trapper Utilizes placement of bear traps to slow or prevent going through certain areas (his traps can be disabled as can hag) these can shorten a chase or even catch an unaware survivor off guard2.Wraith(going to use knowledge of his rework as currently he isn't very good) He is able to find survivors easier when bleeding and he is also good at chasing going in and out of invisiblity to keep up with survivors during a chase (weak to flashlights while invis causing a longer stun)3.Hillbilly A high map pressure killer using a chainsaw to dash around the map from gen to gen that allows him to instant down survivors (his turning can be weak without addons or knowledge)4.Nurse Another strong map pressure killer that requires lots of skill and practice to do well as she can blink (short range but longer with charge up) the weakness is a mini stun after a blink with longer range equaling longer stun also can be easily juked by a smart survivor or due to poor nurse knowledge5.Huntress A killer who can hurt survivors at range with a throwing axe (can be hard to aim as there is no crosshair also hums that reveals location while roaming) Another killer that requires practice but can do well in a lot of casesPaid killers 1.Hag A killer who places traps that pop a illusionary version of her which she can teleport to (can be crouch walked over without activating or burned away with a flashlight) this killer requires knowledge of the game to do well with as proper trap placement is very important as she is slower then other killers2.Myers A very strong killer if you are new and want a dlc buy him first easy to play killer that requires little game knoweldge to do well with (He stalks survivors after a certains amount of stalking you gain a tier. 1st tier smal lunge slower speed but non existant terror range. 2nd tier normal lunge range normal speed with a normal terror radius. 3rd tier heavily increased lunge faster window vault insta down atks) mind you he can only stalk a survivor for so much till they turn red and give no more towards his power3.Doctor(my fav) A killer with two stances 1st allows for a ranged lighting attack that increases a survivors madness and prevents them from doing any action for 2.5 seconds (this is a charge up attack) along with your terror radius increasing madness (this does no damage mind you) (madness 1 30% chance of a skill check going to a random spot on screen First time reaching this makes a survivor scream revealing where they are. madness 2 60% chance of a skill check moving to a random spot on screen first time reaching this makes a survivor scream revealing where they are. Madness 3 survivors can not longer repair gens or heal themselves or others they also periodically scream revelaing themselves they then have to "snap out of it" which causes skill checks to pop that have to be succeded in order to go back to madness 2) his second form is just a form allowing him to hit people4.Leatherface Utilizes a chainsaw like hillbilly but instead of a dash he gains a small speed up that then allows him to swing his chainsaw in front of him multiple times (this is an instant down) he is more of a defensive killer that is meant to patrol gens hard to find his prey and then down them(sometimes multiple survivors) 5.The Sandman (not yet released so I have no clue)I hope this helps people better understand killers the only current glaring issues I would like to note is there are instant blind flashlights (thus wraith being terrible rn) and killers can face camp which involves blocking a survivor from being unhooked from meat hooks (this is being fixed and shouldn't be an issue within the next week or two) also the dbd reddit is the best place for info and people to ask questions D so have fun out there in the fog!

review: Bought it to play with my brother. Purchased and downloaded the game. Queued for 20 minutes to get into a game. Game force closed on my brothers computer. I quit out and now I'm heading for a refund. GG. WP. Wait times and game stability scared me at least.********************************EDIT*******************************************Okay! I have rebought this game after several months.. Well that's a lie. The bitter taste left from my previous experience kind of made me want shred my SSD as I installed this game but I waited. I was told the game was better and that every issue with the game had been solved.Well. I have to say the game (FINALLY GOD DAMN FUNCTIONAL) actually works pretty well. You can use several different approached to the game and enjoy gameplay by yourself or with friends. I personally have no tendency towards either as it's now really fun to play both.THE WORST CURRENT THING ABOUT THIS GAME IS THE CAMPERS. THESE ARE THE GAMES WORST ATTROCITY. However it happens less recently so maybe they're addressing the issue. TL DR NOW ACTUALLY PLAYABLE AND REALLY GOOD GAME. EXCITING. YOU'LL PROBABLY S!!T YOURSELF AGAINST MYERS.*************************************************************************************************************** NEW REVIEW 02/10/2017Okay so leaving my third review for this game so far a lot of mechanics have been changed and there's be a whole lot of improvements made. In my opinion the game now has become unplayable again. I would understand if it was down to my computer but I'm fairly sure it's not. I'm using a I7 7700k with watercooling 1070 overclocked and have a tested build that can download a stream of data at 50 75 mbps. This isn't an issue of my computer can't handle it. Now that I've gotten that out of the way let's look at what's wrong *CURRENTLY*. There is an imbalance towards the killers favour now however that's nothing to complain about I get the logic the devs are going for. They want there to be two survivers and two killed survivers in each game. That's cool it adds to the game make it more competitive maybe it's been taken a bit too far in some cases (leatherface is frankly too OP and they need nerfing) but hey ever game has an OP character.Now that isn't what has made the game unplayable now in my opinion.What made the game unplayable in my opinion is the fact that the game couples you with people from all over the world nothing inherently wrong with this but after a few days of playing the game I literally cannot play the game because I'm rubber banding (pinging on the screen all over the place) because I have a 500 ping average for each game that I'm being put into. 90% of the killers I'm facing are from Russia / some other far away country again nothing wrong with that I truly do not mind it at all. But if I'm dying from jumping half way across the map when I'm fixing a generator or opening an exit gate and still having heavy heart beat despite the fact the killer just hooked someone from the other side of the map something is seriously seriously wrong with the game. If you need to make it so that UK players face UK players and American players face American players do it. People would rather wait 5 minutes longer in a queue than play with 500 700 ping...I will still recommend this game but if this isn't fixed soon I'm changing to negative. **************************************************************************************************************
title: Dead by Daylight

review: TLDR An addicting but buggy and unbalanced game. Fun for a limited time. Can't recommend as is.Let's start with the fact that there's no tutorial. Only pictures and text. Try to learn skill check sound from that. Or the fact that the red stripes on ground mean someone ran there.Some people like to learn things through mistakes but some people don't.If you try to play a little more seriously you'll see how many problems are nested in this game. I don't play mind playing casually but the games ranking makes the games a little bit tryhardy.When you hit single digit ranks the games gets really toxic and joining a lobby takes forever. And players DC or give up early all the time no matter what rank they are.And when the game eventually connects to a killer lobby it connects to lobbies with 250 1000ms ping like 2/3 of the time and you'll have to DC and wait again. And lobbies get disconnected all the time from killers side. They're screening survivors I guess or maybe some survivors don't understand to DC with &gt 300ms ping.Playing lone survivor there's little strategy. If you happened to take a flashlight against the hag or wraith you win the lottery. Of couse if you play with 3 friends with voice chat the game changes totally and becomes unfair for the killer.Playing killer you can choose the killer perks and offerings based on survivors and their items so there's some strategy.Some more problemsYou can stun the nurse mid blink but she can still hit you after the stunned blink which seems super fair.Hit boxes are a mess so playing huntress or against her is lottery. This affects hillbilly somewhat as well no matter which side you're on.There's no real counterplay against leatherface other than try to run away and slow him down. If the player is good you're f'd. His chainsaw doesn't seem to hit terrain much at all so you can't pull any anti hillbilly moves on him. Also crouching has helped me like 1 time I think and lockers have saved me 0 times.Lithe doesn't activate reliably when the killer starts chasing you. Even with chase music.Pallets seem to hit kinda randomly too. My record is when I hit a hag from like 1m away with a pallet but sometimes they don't seem to hit when on point. Desync?The last big update ruined the games balance big time. Leatherface itself isn't the (biggest) problem but the perks that came with him.Nurse or hillbilly with barbecue &amp chili + nurses calling is such a pain. Or losing your item with 100% chance when getting hit.I bought a bunch of extra content right before they released him and would've 100% refunded them if Steam would allow it.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Dead by daylight consists of a 4v1 players game where survivors need to repair gens to escape and killers need to kill them. These dlc's are changed regularly by the developers but lots of times they ruin the perfect dlc that you spent your money with and it kinda make it look garbage. But there are always changes to be done. I really enjoy playing this game!!10/10

review: Previous review can be found below I'll just update my thoughts on the game for a bit.Much has changed. Much hasn't. If they release a patch that breaks the game they don't revert it they wait until they find a fix. I don't like this behavior it feels unprofessional but that's how the entire game feels to me.That being said I can tell they are at least trying to improve the game. The grinding was made somewhat easier they're still putting new content out some of which you don't even need to pay for. And even with all the bugs and whatnot the game is fun. You can play a good couple of hours without getting bored. From what I said below much still holds true but if you can gather a few friends you can lighten up the game's issues.I'd guess the worse part of playing the game is trying to find people who want to put up a fair game which takes both skill and a good mindset by everyone involved. Both sides can decide to ruin each other's fun and unfortunately that sums up more than half of your matches.Should you buy it? If you have the money to spare sure go for it. Chances are the positives will outweight the negatives. Old review I never thought I'd regret paying for a game the way I did with this one.Let me state this before anything else the game's idea is great. I didn't play over 10 hours of it because I found it boring.But I wanted to know what is going on inside those devs' heads. I've seen a few dozen free games that make this game look like a joke programmed by a teenager who just found out about Unity. I've probably had more crashes than matches in this game and I'm not exaggerating at all. I've known from people here and there that this game had issues but I couldn't possibly imagine they were so bad.I'm not even getting into things like toxic community or the ridiculous grinding system it has. But I probably should because unless you've played over 10 hours on a single character you'll just get frustrated at how everyone has better setups than you do. Also did I mention that like 60% of the matches someone disconnects before it even starts? You can guess how balanced things get when it happens.I have no idea what made me go through with the purchase when everything else pointed to this. I guess I wasn't expecting the game to be this broken. Maybe if the game was free I would understand the lack of quality or interest on improving the game but given they are constantly releasing new content and charging almost half of the game's price for a pack of two characters... yeah I can't really understand why this game is so poorly finished.Honestly what I want to say is if you're planning on buying this you better know what you're getting yourself into. The game is fun yeah but sometimes it feels like you're stressing yourself trying to make it work more than you're actually playing it.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: As I write this I have 1156 hours played. I have bought every DLC up to this point(besides the soundtrack) however some were on sale. If you bought everything at full price the game+all DLC would add to $64. 1156/64 18.06. That means if I payed full price for everything I would have gotten 18 hours per dollar. However I bought many DLC on sale and none of them are necessary to heavily enjoy the game due to all DLC maps and perks being available in the base game. If I simply bought the base game at $20 I would have gotten 58ish hours per dollar. Extreme price to entertainment ratio. Cannot recommend enough.

Instead of reaching out to the big names that continue the play this game they should be reaching out particularly to those anonimous players who have been playing this game from the start or even other twitch streamers without a lot of followers or views to show that even their support is realised and appreciated rather than asking for more money for extremely basic articles of clothing. review: The game is like a 4v1 strategic game. You choose a survivor/killer depending on their special trait. some survivors are sneaky others have leadership skills depends on what you prefer. Some killers can be sneaky (mike myers dlc) others very loud but fast. Your main objective as a survivor is always to escape wether through a hatch or through the main exit. You escape through the main exit by teaming up and fixing all the generators going through skill checks (some perks make it easier for you). Your main goal as a killer is to catch the survivors and hang them on a hook giving other survivors the chance to unhook them. As I said every killer has their own special trait like the trapper which can place bear traps and notify the killer where they were trapped. The game can get very intense making it interesting.Bottom line this game is worth it especially with this price. I would rate it 6/6 generators!

review: Game is amazing and suprisingly deep. It gives you all kind of options. You would think that the game would bore you within 2 hours of playing it but since you actually have so much freedom on what way you choose to play the game you can spend hundreds of hours playing it.I recommend to buy it. It is well worth the price.And btw the reviews complaining about bugs are honestly over exagerrated. If any of you knew anything about programming you would actually understand why a game with so much choices has to have some bugs in it. Personally I have only encountered 1 in my 100 hours of playing this game that was kinda game breaking but funny (I was hooked 1 and died inmediately) the rest of the bugs are just funny. If you don't have a terrible PC you will run this game with no problems.Its a unique and very special game that deserves more popularity.The developers definitely took a risk in producing it but in doing so they have created an almost new type of game. It is truly a master piece of programming so I forgive the little mistakes it has.I also want to talk about the balancing of the game. So as a rank 5 survivor I can honestly say that all you people complaining about killers not being balanced (freddy) they really are. If you keep dying as a survivor it is only your fault. If your team isn't helping you then change your tactics become a sole survivor. If you keep losing well maybe you actually need to help out your team specially in the beginning when there is 5 gens. Once there is 3 then you can start being a little selfish.The game is balanced developers did a pretty damn good job and they don't deserve to be blamed for you losing and losing over again. This game requires a lot of thinking and strategy sometimes to win against good killers. If you are still not sure if the game is worth it buy it while on sale or try it out on free weekends. Even though it is worth 20 bucks for sure.

review: 2 modes of play Survivor or killer. Survivor NEED TO WORK AS A TEAM you have to "POP" generators by completing skill checks your reaction times here matter and help other survivors when they are caught and "hooked" by the killer. You are rewarded "blood points" for your endeavours. The more you do the better your teamwork the bigger your contribution the greater the reward There are a selection of survivors you can choose from very little separates them at the lower levels but once you get to about level 25 35 the differences really begin to show. It s a good idea to level up 2 or 3 survivors as they can share abilities at the higher levels between them. KILLERS Need to "hunt" the survivors and kill them hit them to take them down then hang them on hooks there are a selection of killers each have different weapons and abilities and require different play abilities. Advantages A co operative group of survivors that work together will have a better chance than people that run of doing their own thing. this game promotes teamwork not just about yourself. a good killer will add suspense to the game the better the killer the more skilled the more active the more they hunt move about strategise the better the game.Disadvantage CAMPERS! and FACE CAMPERS CAMPER KILLER Will walk around you in a medium sized circle so that they can see you at all times on the hook and make it imposable for the other survivors to rescue you! Their (the camper killer) justification for this is they are using you as BAIT to draw the other players in! REALISTICLY If you camp then the other survivors will see this and not come to rescue you from the hook! And you (the camper killer) have just made everyone else hate you! FACE CAMPERS the most unskilled of all the killers. Their lack of skill shows in the fact that they only know how to stand in your face and watch you die if you are unlucky enough to get hooked by a face camper forget getting rescued..... no one likes camper killers please do the game a favour don t become one.IMPROVEMENT TO THE GAME Personally I would like to see the killer buffed the longer they stand around camping once they have the survivor on the hook they should be buffed for being in range. Movement buff or aura buff. Slow the killer down or better SHOW THE KILLER UP for the lack of skill and ability they really don t have! Reward the killers that don t camp.... by not buffing them. Think about it. If the killer stand by you for 10 seconds and have lost 100% of their movement (that s 10% of the killers movement reduced for every second they stay within maybe 24 meters of the active hook) then the person being camped can be rescued in front of the very face of the camper and nothing they can do about it because they are to TRANSFIXED to react they will be either TO SLOW to chase or totally stuck transfixed maybe if the developers were to do this properly they could even make it that the penalty is heaver applied the closer to the hook they are so face campers get transfixed in 6 to 8 seconds while an area camper gets maybe 10 to 12. It would soon push killers into playing a better game and add a little new difficulty to the killers roll and balance back the game a little given how hard it is to survive with all the skill checks and other buffs already placed on the survivors.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Product received for free. If I could only play one game It would most likely be this game. They way the developers made this the texture and detail are beautiful. The game play gives you a rush where you have to be stealth and sneaky as a survivor or scary and sneaky as a hunter. Where the more you play the more you are strengthened like its not a P2W. They way you can even customize your characters and hunters and get achievements for reaching level 50 each time and that there is a character for everyone to pick from a nervous pizza nerd to a solider and all the dlc's in between. The hunters each give their own experience to the survivors each one is different. Now there is some bad stuff you can get a bad match where you have a camping hunter or a way to over powered group of survivors that are all friends using discord or other communication device but it just makes it more intersting having to use the best of your ability to beat them and have brag power in the end. This game is worth every peny and I have to thank my friend so much for introducing this game to me and buying it for me cause I love this game so much it is just a piece of art. Even if you think your going to lag there is a little bar that tells you your ping with the hunter so you dont have to waste your time if it isnt going down the game runs so smoothly well besides when you glitch and land on the oppisite of the pallet you know the side with the hunter on it...I highly recomend getting this game.

review: Got this on sale awhile back just recenetly got into playing it. It's pretty fun although most of the early ranked survivors/killers are pretty toxic and most of them are more focused on saving you instead of getting generators but it's still fun to play.Playing as a killer is always fun but be prepared to be called a camper by everyone even if you don't camp. There are quite a few killers and survivors to play and level up with an optional prestige mode that gives you cosmetics so you aren't pressured into doing it. The maps are really nice but a few of them really suck as a killer. The perks for survivors are set up so that most of the high ranked people use the same 4 perks which can be really annoying Hopefully there is an update that gives other perks a chance and gives them more benefits. The only real issues i've had with the game is the lobby breaking(to which you just leave then requeue up) and on rare occassion when i do a survive with friends it puts me into a different lobby.It's a really cool game fun with friends fun as a killer and fun as a survivor. 10/10

review: As of January 7 2017 the gameplay itself is great but its matchmaking system is a complete failure. I'm not talking about who gets paired with who (which is also an issue). I'm talking about whether or not it will even pair you up with ANYONE. It bugs out more than half of the time and kicks you back into the player menu.Another issue is that you're lucky to find a decent match where all four survivors load into the map where you can finally play. It takes ages to load into a match sometimes after you've been paired up with everyone too.If you go to join a public lobby through matchmaking (your only option) sometimes the game glitches and sits on the loading screen forever. You have to kill the game's .exe process and reboot it if you want to try and play again.If you're playing with friends you need to manually invite them again after each match. It kicks everyone back to their player menu after each match.It's truly a shame to see such a great game go to waste if the developers don't pick up on these obvious flaws. Otherwise the gameplay is great and the game itself is fine once you load into a map. Currently I do not recommend this to friends until the developers fix these issues.***EDIT*** Septemeber 27 2017 ***EDIT***Wow! A developer actually listened to their community and fixed their game for the most part! I mean it too. The game is much better now and it's much more playable now! I recommend this game now.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: In all honesty I reckon this game is amazing regardress of the major bug that went around. Granted it wasn't one of their finest moment's and I personally didn't experience the bug. However one of my friends did and for those who actually read the comments I hope that the bug didn't put you off.The game is great if you want to play something for ages and not get bored the fact they were able to create a game that can do that is amazing! The bug was just one of those hug bugs that comes every once and a while the game is constantly being developed and if anyone has done coding you will understand why it's hard to find the one little thing that wrong. I am 98% sure that the developers have fixed the bug. So it shouldn't be a problem now. Yeah I understand that to all the people who have played this game for so long that it kills you that all your progress has gone but if you message the developers they will get back to you. It might take a while but if you think about how many people play this game I would give them a little slack.Personally I love this game and it just keeps getting better if the bug does happen don't let it put you off the game. Things like that happen and they can be fixed it just takes time.

review: When looking at the game thinking about buying it don't take the negative reviews seriously. They complain how hard it is but in reality they just dont know how to play properly. Unlike me i was a naturaly good killer and normally get a 4 kill even with no perks. People just don't understand how to play and instead trying to get better they try to complain so the game can become uneven and unfair. But TBH I would take time to watch Dead by Daylight channels as they can easily teach you some cool tricks and help you be a better survivor or killer. The only problem I have with the game is that when I moved I learned that comcast or really any good internet service so if you have horrible internet like me I get around 400 ping in most games and in this one if the killer has bad internet too then I have about 900 1000+ ping. I have learnded to deal with this but sometimes the game is just unplayable and if you too have horrid internet then dont get the game untill you do have better internet. And the last thing i have a problem with is how much DLCs there are and how much they cost for maybe 2 characters and thats it. But over all I would 100% recommend this game as it can provide limitless fun and can be so addicting especially if theres is like a double bloodpoints weekend or something. And i also love how much they listen and colaberate with the players.

review: It's a fun game for the price tag and it will get you plenty of quality gameplay. Here's a list of what I think the pros and cons are.Pros Fun core gameplay The game's fundamentals revolve around a Hide and Seek like gameplay that has a killer pitted against 4 survivors who try to run and hide from an unkillable killer. It's intense at times and it's great to pair up with your friends for a good time. Interesting Lore The game has an interesting and mysterious backstory that is obviously Lovecraftian based. It centers around a dark force known as "The Entity" that is the puppet master behind the events taking place. It feeds off the hope of the survivors whom it has taken into its own realm. It's an interesting read if you ever get the time to sift through it all. Licensed Content The devs of this game use their money wisely as they've selected slasher films' most notable icons such as Michael Myers and Leatherface so far. They plan to do more licensed characters in the future of course.Cons Higher level gameplay has dubious balance There is a learning curve to be had as survivor once you get into the game and killer is easier to pick up off the bat but when the game gets into higher level play the dichotomy reverses. The killer ends up having a tougher time outplaying the survivors due to large margin for human error designs that are easily exploited in higher level play. These designs include but are not limited to Pallet looping exploitation of poor pallet design by circling an object near the pallet resulting in a maximum waste of the killers time. Just type in pallet looping on youtube and you'll see what I mean. Infinites There exists areas on the maps that can force a killer to run in a large circle several times before being able to catch up. They usually involve a window in the center of a long wall this is a problem because the killer vaults through these windows slower resulting in the survivor constantly gaining ground while the killer inches through. Perks There are "crutch perks" at the survivor's disposal that can be used in a way that punishes the killer. Most notably of these perks are "Decisive Strike" which allows you to break free from the killers grasp once per game and "Borrowed Time" which allows you a limited frame of invincibility after unhooking a survivor.Overall I'd recommend the game if you intend to play it casually but if you are going into higher ranks patience is definitely a virtue.
title: Dead by Daylight

It's because as is my experience in any other Multiplayer game the matchmaking is You either destroy or get destroyed. No middle ground. Doesn't matter if you're a survivor or a killer. You either steamroll or you get steamrolled. Which is no fun for anyone. Guess I'm gonna go with a thumbs down.EDIT Oh and by the way I meet the minimum system requirements but I still rarely get to 30fps even on the lowest graphical settings which is really frustrating. It would help if you specify the necessary processor speed cause everywhere I look it just says that I need at least a Intel Core i3 4170 or AMD FX 8300 + "CPU SPEED Info." What the f does that mean?

review: I want to start by saying that this game has had its ups and downs and that I believe it is currently at the best state it's ever been at. The gameplay is super fun and although it honestly isn't that scary once you get used to it it's still thrilling. I still get the occasional scare when The Shape creeps up on me or when I turn a corner to run right into the killer. PositivesThrilling if not Scary gameplaySupport for multiple playstyles Teamwork being highly encouraged and enabledFun and Unique survivors and killers (None of them are the same thematically)Cool perks and Killer abilitiesLOTS of customization optionsIncludes survivors maps and killers from well know Horror properties such as Bill from L4D and Micheal Myers (The Shape)Regular DLCOcasional Free DLCNegativesSome characters lack customization optionsMost of the DLC is paid No clear stance on things like FacecampingI highly recommend Dead by Daylight. It is very fun and any fan of horror would love it. The gameplay is easy to pick up but is very deep if you choice to put time into the game. The pros easily outweigh the cons. A lot of the problems the game had a few months ago have been fixed and the Devs have become a lot more communicative with the community. They even hired a community manager a few months ago which has made communcation between us and them a whole lot better. Rating 8.7/10
title: Dead by Daylight

review: There is no longer a meta in this game. The latest update buried survivors into the ground and left no balance. The biggest issue I have with this game is as a survivor when hooked chances of escape are very very slim. I don't mean attempting escape what I mean is that when another survivor unhooks a hooked survivor the hooked survivor now has to evade the killer while injured which is nearly impossible if the killer is half decent. The main reason this is true is that every single decent or above average killer will camp hooked survivors they won't facecamp but they will stay within the vicinity. As soon as someone gets unhooked the killer will dart straight back to the crime scene and down the originally hooked survivor. Killers have no penalty whatsoever for camping according to this new meta once a survivor is hooked they're dead for sure. Borrowed time was the only counter to this sickining meta but the developers obviously had to bury that perk into the ground because why make a balanced game? I understand survivors would pallet loop and troll killers for a crazy amount of time before this latest update which needed fixing. But something needs to change for sure hooked survivors don't have an actual chance of escape which wasn't the intent of the developers in the first place. Getting hooked once and dying because of it is just not fair for survivors. Please review and fix this update.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Product received for free. Might as well just put a final edit here the game is good and fun. The developers have shown time and time again that they are really trying to make a great game. It's a learning experience for everyone involved and I think that's really fun. The developers have no reference material to work with so everything comes down to experementing and figuring out what works and what doesn't. At the very least this leads to interesting patches and fun new mechanics to toy around with. All in all this is a good game and I can only see it getting better. It's also a plus that the two paid for DLC's don't include anything OP so props to you devs for understanding balance and always striving to reach it.

review: Dead by Daylight is one of those games you either love or hate for the majority of gamers there's no middle ground when it comes to DBD. Game mechanics are fairly simple and the objective play as well killers try and down/hook all the survivors to sacrifice to the Entity survivors try and activate enough generators to power the gates to exit the trial before being sacrificed. Gameplay sounds easy enough but the game itself has a fairly steep learning curve. Killers and survivors have various perks to unlock to give additional abilities as well as items (for survivors) and addons for items/killer abilities and offerings to affect gameplay for each trial. Developers are active in trying to balance gameplay but there are still balancing issues (nothing game breaking but sometimes frustrating). Devs toss out tons of DLC (and a suprising amount of free DLC too which is amazing) and for the most part have done well to get some licensing rights for some really cool killers (Michael Myers Leatherface Freddy Kruger). Love all the extra content they've released so far and have purchased it except for Freddy (they absolutely botched his mechanics completely). The community is really 50/50 in my opinion I've run into some really toxic people but I've also had the pleasure of playing with some really cool folks as well. In any event I'd say watch some Youtube videos to see if you're interested in the game and give it a shot if you see it's on sale. I'd definitely recommend this game but sometimes you have to accept you're going to get frustrated playing it (like getting face camped/tunnelled as a survivor or constantly getting insta blinded by a group of survivor friends as killer).

review: Dead by Daylight (DBD) is a fun game with lots of potential. Some of the play styles of players as survivors and killers can make or break the game. Biggest issues * The 'camping' killer that moves only a few meters away from a hooked survivor and claims they weren't camping just 'patrolling'. While camping can be considered a strategy and right by a killer (hey they are there to kill you not play nice) it does lead some survivors to rage quit since they have no chance of being rescued and if they are pulled down the camping killer typically 'tunnels' the injured survivor quickly. (Nothing like just taking out the easiest target). * The 'slamming' of pallets breaks occasionally either causing you to rush through the pallet to same side as killer instead of stunning the killer OR *major bug* the killer or survivor is stuck in/on the pallet. If the survivor is stuck the killer can break the pallet and hit the survivor (or place in dying state if survivor was already hurt). If the killer is stuck the survivors cannot do anything to free the killer so they either finish the round (and get 'free' bloodpoints) or the Killer disconnects and ruins the game for themselves (their score goes to 0 and survivors get bonus "5000" survival points. * Endless pallet looping survivors just irritate the killers and can make them rage quit. While looping is consider by many a valid strategy it can and does lead to killer's rage quitting. They may want to implement a change to pallets like they did to windows and block survivors from abusing the same pallet over and over. This would change the dynamic somewhat and lead to additional strategies.These are just my opinions of things that should be looked at for improvements. There are other issues in the game that are addressed slowly. Sometimes changes are made to killers that are unneeded unwarranted etc because people (survivor mains) want to always cake walk troll etc the killer and if a killer can prevent them easy bloodpoints its a whine fest (aka Changes to Freddy when he first came out to his neutered down self).Feel free to agree or disagree with the above. I am not complaining or asking for things to be banned just looking for ways to improve and reduce the amounts of raging quitting due to some of the items mentioned above.As I said other things really need improvement (not even going to touch on the "matchmaking" system that can takes extremely long times to find a match to even play) but these are some of biggest issues i've seen over my 600+ hours of playtime.

review: After many hours of gamplay I can honestly say what began as an awesome game for me quickly rolled down hill faster and faster spiraling out of control. First is the pros.+Great graphics and sounds.+Plenty of characters and killers to choose from each with their own sets of unique perks.+Cool to see executions.+Haven't seen many bugs. Some occasionally maybe once in 20 or 30 games. (May just be lucky?)+Weird cult people running around doing... Strange things... Example provided in my steam screenshots. Pretty cool though.And now the many cons... But i'll keep it as brief as i can This game is INCREDIBLY survivor biased. Killer perks get nerfed very frequently and survivor perks are just plain ridiculous. (Trying going against people with 2+ borrowed times. The community is absolutely horrendous. When the game ends whether you catch all but one or no one when you see the exit there is always that guy. (I like to call him Uncle Skeeter because why not.) Who stands at the exit repeatedly tea bagging you. Although sometimes it's amusing to bait the little troll out and one hit down him with no one escapes death which almost always makes them rage quit disconect which is priceless. Always run that perk on every killer just to at least get some laugh for the trolls.) The great camping epidemic. The entitled category of survivors are incredibly salty of even the smallest thing that looks like camping. (Patrol in a very large radius around hook your camping. You see someone staring at you from behind a corner less then 3 feet away from hook obviously visible your camping. Standing beside the hook with all exits open and hatch all within visual distance and easy to walk to no sprint needed with zero incentive to leave. Your camping. Standing on the oppiosite end of the map facing the wall still camping. It is ridiculous. The fun "survive with friends" an absolute kill joy to nearly every game of high rank. Vs a 4 man premade team with maxed flashlights AND voice chat blinding you continously as they tea bag up and down everytime you look in their direction. You are going to have a very bad time. Not only do they all have flashlights but if they all run 4 borrowed times 4 decisive strikes 4 dead hards/sprints and 4 self cares. Your chance of winning is zero don't waste your time and give them the satisfaction. That being said not all sfw teams are bad it can be a good time for all if they aren't all running the same exact thing and items. or 4 new parts. There are some places in nearly every map where survivors can lead you in circles litteraly forever even with bloodlust which was supposed to fix it. There is still no way to catch up in an infinite loop. However there are some spots which are very long to run around but you can catch up but it takes precious minutes to do so and if you miss god help you. Or if you hit you get to do it again for second hit! If the previous con doesn't get you this one will. Tons and tons of pallets. If 5+ pallets all spawn in one spot. your chances of getting whoever is hiding in there instantly becomes zero and your only choice is to go through it all and waste at least 3 generators or more and still not touch him. Or leave only to chase him again a few minutes later or one of his bodies who repeats the cycle wasting more of your time. one of these 2 cons always happen every game pallet loops or inifinite loops.I can continue to rattle off much more but to save everyones time this will have to suffice for now. Can't keep my review positive anymore so i'm changing it. Will check the game frequently to see what changes it has good potential if some of these issues become addressed.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: I honestly want to give this game a good review becuase it is entertaining but the mechanics are so flawed it becomes more of a rage inducer than a legitimate fun game. As the survivor some maps are fine and others are too wide open to be able to avoid the killer so you will unavoidably be hooked. This is fine except for the fact that the other survivors will come unhook you because they dont give two ****s if you live or die they just get 1500 blood points (exp) and can basically rank up after just 3 unhooks and a bit of other stuff. You on the other hand have no chance to escape and will just be hooked again and three in a row means you're automatically dead usually resulting in a derank. If the killer leaves after the game begins you get a derank. If survivors leave mid game you will most likely be slaughtered and again end up deranked. These are just some of the more apparent flaws.As the killer the survivors can constantly pallet stun you run then vault through a window numerous amounts of times because of how the map is layed out. They will sit in between a pallet and wait for you to walk in so they can stun you and you honestly can't do anything about it. Then at the end of the game you will most likely be called a camper for playing the game the way the mechanics allow you to play. Again these are just some of the more apparent flaws.And gameplay wise every play session is just more of the same repairing generators by holding mouse 1 and pushing space every so often. Not much variety besides the strategies used against the different killers.Is dead by daylight a good balanced game? NoIs dead by daylight entertaining? Too an extent if you can look past the flaws.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: I haven't played this game that much but I'd say it's absolutely worth the 20 . In this game there are four survivors who need to start up five generators around the map and after this open the escape doors while one killer tries to stop them. Sometimes you get adrenaline rushes while escaping the killer and sometimes you feel afraid cause you don't know where the killer is (expecially the Shape aka. Michael Myers in early game). Surviving a match feels good. I can't say much about playing a killer cause I haven't played as one due to my bad modem. There are some bad things like laggy hosts bugs and of course camping killers. Campers can ruin your game experience expecially when they literally stand one meter away from the hook and stare at you untill you die and I think this kind of behaviour should be punishable. Bad hosts can ruin the experience too if the lag is at its worst and you just teleport around the place. I don't recommend this game for people who throw stuff if they rage because of these campers and bad hosts.Good adrenaline rushes pleasure after surviving a match losing the killer while he/she/apache is chasing you variety concept friendly killers team work surviving with friendsBad laggy hosts campers bugs ranking system Rank 20 survivors in the same match with rank 1 killer (this is ed up) finding all survivors for one match can take up to 30 minutes.PS. Sorry for my bad english.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: I have left the original review below as the good points still stand.It seems they have now resolved the progress loss issue which was my main gripe with the game. If this is the case (touch wood) I cant recommend this game enough. So this game is a tale of two reviews...Firstly the game itself is decent and works really well... played both survior and killer and the two different approaches really feel different and allow a large amount of customisation.Everything clicks together from the perks to the maps to really make the mechanics worth coming back for unfortunately thats where we get into the second part of the review.I have 7 hours of playtime at the point of this review and have had 3 full progress resets. This is where any points or items you have earnt just dissapear and you have to start the game from pretty much day 0 again.If you dont mind this and just want to jump in every now and again then its a decent game however if you cant this I would steer clear of this game until the issue is resolved.Its a shame its a decent game but not good enough to have to start from scratch every couple of days.
