review: I have become completely addicted to this game. I picked this up during the Halloween sale so I have been playing it for about a month. I have about 70 hours on it so far. I mostly play survivor as I have been trying to level a good main and unlock some teachable perks. I have played some killer as well. This game is a ton of fun and it also definitely brings out the salt in players. There is salt from both survivor mains and killer mains. I see both sides of the coin. Survivors can be annoying at times when playing killer and killers can be annoying at times when playing survivor. Like most games there are those that would seek to exploit features and those who just want to have fun.I plan on running this game for quite a bit of time still. I sincerely hope that the devs continue to love nurture and grow it with future updates.

review: At first I recommended this game..but after a bit more time I have to say I can't anymore. DBD loses a lot of the tension and horror after a while and the matchmaking system makes it worse. Early players will often be put into groups of extremely skilled ones with abilities that pretty much neutralize your play no matter what you do. The game has no communication system so although survivors have to work together they can never talk or communicate. Killers can secure kills easily simply by camping which survivors hate and will call you out or report you for even though this is a tactic the game fully supports and promotes. This game goes from fun to dull and boring fast.This is a game better suited to watching on a stream than playing it. Even though Friday the 13th is a buggier game it is still a lot more fun to play than this.

review: This game is pretty fun I didn't think I'd like it too much when I first started to play and it seemed really hard to get used to at the beginning. Once you learn what you're doing and when you can start reading other survivor types and survivor builds w/ perks and items you can work together without talking. A lot of people are complaining that survivors leave you to die but that is not really the case. This game is hard if you're not with a group of friends there is no way to talk to one another so of course it's going to feel like you're being left behind. I have met plenty of killers and survivors who are not trollish. The only people I have found to be toxic is killers who facecamp but that's because they're ienexperienced and don't want to learn to play the game like they should. Over all I would at least suggest to buy the game while it is on sale and give it a go. Take the time to learn your role and don't try to face camp if you're a killer. This game was made to have fun and that's what we should try to do. You won't win every match and sometimes you'll be the first to die. It happens. It doesn't mean you're team is crap or the killer is a troll every game. Like i said buy the game when it's on sale if you doubt the game's community. Try to play during the day in Central Time Zone that's when I find the most people online. Don't forget to make friends and practice in the Kill Your Friends!

The leveling system suits this game great and I it keeps you wanting to fight for a rank each new season. Comparing this to F13 is bull FYI because both are different games that have unique things about them although I do suggest both. Overall it's definitely worth the buy even more so on sale.

review: Dead by Daylight is a great game that I would recommend to any of my friends who enjoy spooks. Admitedly yes as other negative reviews say there are bugs the game is not perfect and some of the killers are pretty damn strong. But the core aspect of the game "Horror" rings true despite these shortcomings.There is a very attentive design approach to Dead by Daylights horror theme and that horror is derived from adversity a point that is missed on a lot of players. If the game were easy or balanced you would not feel even a semblence of horror because you'd always have a way out. The cold truth of the matter is that sometimes you will queue into a game and you will die. Sometimes you might even be the first to die. And thats part of the experience. It creates that tone and atmosphere that can only be established in the time you spend at whatever map you're on. Adapting is a key part of the survivor experience. Learning what does and doesn't work through trial and error. Research and study and grinding points to get addons that will increase your odds. I want to place special attention to the level up system in the game because its probably the best format for a horror type game like this. As you level you'll find that the 'entity' the being that controls all these games will try and eat your level ups and perks. This means you have to carefully strategize how to get in and out of the bloodweb to get the most out of each level. This ideology of optimization and adaptability is what the survivor experience is all about.And when all is said and done if you're having a hard time as a survivor that means its time to truly embrace the entity and play a killer.Killer is the most fun aspect of the game to me. its like playing as an endgame boss and exerting power and fear unto your enemies. I would say to still play survivor to get a hang of the game and get map knowledge before trying killer but once you do you'll find a very fun gory game of hide and seek.Endless strategies endless possibilities. The games can range from very fun to very frustrating and all the feelings in between. Its about learning and applying what you learn to make yourself a better player all the marks of a good video game.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Product received for free. If you like horror slasher films this game is a good homage. To survive as a survivor sometimes you got to think like a killer. To secure a few kills as a killer sometimes you got to think like a survivor.You start at level 1 with a character of your choice and gradually you make your way unlocking perks based on your character until you can unlock teachable perks at level 30 35 and 40 respectively. Teachable perks lets you "teach" your character perks to the other characters in a sense letting you transfer your perks to other characters and allowing you to make your own builds with your own combinations. Max level is at level 50 and then you can choose to remain or prestige.Obviously you can only teach killer perks to killers and survivor perks to survivors of course. The game encourages teamwork and lone wolf gameplay at the same time but given the atmosphere of the game you have to make a choice at some point in time. Can you kill them all on your own without the survivors completing objectives and rescuing each other and taking hits for one another? Can you survive together and avoid killers and leave your fellow survivors to die when the time comes?However the negatives of this game is that the perks are incredibly grindly and even after you get the teachable skills on a character obtaining the perks is another question as it's subject to the RNGesus. Oh did i mention your perks have levels and those upgraded perks are ALSO subjected to the RNGesus? Oh you can grind your way up and I find that playing as the killer lets you farm faster and more especially if you know what you're doing. You can sort of farm together WITH the survivors but most of the time the public survivors have no clue of your intentions as there's no chat system in game. There is one in the lobby but that's for the survivors. For survivors? Tough luck it's a lot harder to earn bloodpoints. Still doable. But that's if your killer is nice enough to let you survive. Farm with friends? Hahahahaha you can't do that unless you are able to matchmake with your friend as the killer. Developers and some players say what you want about farming in this game bans and all but if you're going to introduce items that lets you earn more points and subject 85% of the game to the RNGesus then farming should be legitimate. Also the item system is very one sided allowing survivors to keep their items if they survive but killers lose their items regardless if they win or lose. Granted 2 of the perks can substitute as the 2 items and the items are reacquirable but again all the items and their add ons subject to the RNGesus. Given that the community is also toxic whether you play as killers or survivors be prepared to be trolled when playing in pubs. For killers that's 4 players working together. For survivors if you're up against the killer yourself.. Good luck. This game has a lot of potential and i'll admit there's a lot of fun whether I'm playing with my friends or on my own but seriously unless you got a party of friends to co op and go up against the killers or you're playing in private among yourselves or you like to play alone you can wait for sales or just outright skip this game if you're on the negative side. TL DR Pros +You can unleash your inner psycho on those people.+You can unleash your inner survivalist against supernatural killers. +Interesting perks with various killers and survivors with their own advantages and disadvantages+A good number of maps and content for its price.Cons When playing as the survivors you can't fight back against the killers. Survivors be prepared to die. Killers be prepared to be trolled. Hard. Very very grindy and subject to RNG. Which adds to the grind.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: No graphics options on a pc game. The excuse offered that being able to toggle for example vsync and AA would somehow be an advantage in multiplayer is laughable and is no doubt an excuse for laziness. The only tutorial offered is entirely a wall of text because laziness. No AI mode because laziness. But most damning of all is that the game uses peer to peer hosting where the killer is always the host. Lag and drops are omnipresent due to this but worse this enables cheating killers to induce lag and rubberbanding in survivors. I personally experienced this in one match where the lag was constant interfering with our ability to fix the generators but when the killer appeared near me suddenly the lag was suspiciously horrific and I was rubberbanding out of control. This occured every time the killer chased me in that match. Everything about this game is lazy and poorly thought out.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: My boyfriend let me borrow his copy of the game. At first I enjoyed the concept of it and liked it overall then I played a few more games and started to see the issues. The ranking system Unless you're constantly winning games you don't get anywhere with anything. The worst part is even when you're a fairly good player for some reason you still get camping killers and players. I think the ranking system needs to go and it needs to be fair. A rank shouldn't determine how good a person is at the game and whether they deserve to play with better catergories or not. It's the most annoying thing ever when you're trying to have a good game online and the killer camps or the players do absolutely nothing and like me not many of my friends play the game so I have no choice but to play online and I can honestly say most of the time it's just rage enducing and not fun at all. So no unless the ranking system disappears and there's better people playing as killers and more cooperation as a team I won't be recommended this game nor will I be looking for future updates and patches.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: One of the most amazing games I've played in a long time. I thought at first that it was too simple and repetetive but I've played it so much already and I am completely loving every minute. It's a simple game to understand and to play but it has surprising complexity. Totally recommend this to anyone who loves being scared survival games is a horror enthusiast or just wants a fun game to play that actually has a really fantastic community. Oh that's one more thing as someone who mostly plays survivor I have to say I've had some really fun interactions with the people who have played the killer in my games. I have not had a game that didn't end cordially and I just can't even say a negative thing. Oh well now that I said that I can think of one thing the servers are very laggy sometimes for me. Laggy enough that it sometimes makes a match unplayable. It's not super frequent or anything but the game could be greatly improved by addressing this though I'm sure it's a question of resources.

review: What on earth do I say about Dead by Daylight?I could say about it's active (though partly salty) community Its vivid and genuinely enjoyable gameplay Its absolute replayability Its rich soundtrack Or its constant expansion with new chapters and events.However rather than go into depth about this all I have one thing to say. Buy this game. Go on do it.You won't regret it (Unless you play as a Dwight main from the get go).If you want a game that you can constantly go back to a game that constantly changes based on feedback from the community and a downright fun game with replayability this game is for you.Oh and if you do decide to buy this game... please make it your duty to understand the F I N G E R G U N S meme. review: I am changing my review written in January of 2017! I've been playing Dead By Daylight on and off for a very long time. It's always been a fantastic game to fall back on when other games arent as fun. In the beggining there were alot of bugs. Alot of abusing of bad mechanics and alot of paid dlc being released despite glaring bugs that would ruin the game but lately this game has been fantastic! There are still things that need to be worked on but the devs over at Behaviour Studios showd that they do listen to us and they have always worked on making improvements in this game.There is so much that this game does right. Every killer feels unique and bring their own challenge to the game when you are against them and every game as a killer feels fast paced and exciting! I hope that you concider playing this game because it has brought me alot of fun (alot of headaches too but thats with any indie titlle that is constantly pushing to new limits) This is alot of fun and if you are a fan of multiplayer horror games then this is 100% the game to pick up because others can seldomly do it as well as this game as done See you in the fog

review: Current GPU is not good enough to have decent FPS but this game is still hella fun. Even with 13 15 fps i still find the game to be fun as the killer. The game provides enough clues to keep on a survivors trail provided you don't over think their escape. It is crazy how easy i can be to overlook people hiding in plain sight but it is equally rewarding to catch people doing it XD. I was a little bit thrown off but how long it takes to fully kill the survivors at first but then I got better at the game and realized it makes the game mo better nothing more rewarding than getting the final hook on someone that has Barry Sanders'd your all game DPlaying as a survivor for the first time was scary as hell until I learned how to hide myself correctly. Think outside the box and hide in plain sight! Oh wait! Sometimes it is luck the killer doesnt see you sometimes you hide in the areas your current killer hasnt been patrolling. Im god awful as the survivor I freak when the skill check happens thanks Devs &lt 3 i am always amazed when I land enough in a row to almost have the generator fully repaired and slip up right before it is fully repaired T.T. one day my FPS will be decent and my skill checks will be on point but until then ima keep on freaking!!P.S. some mother kluckers get a little too fresh with pallets or windows when you are the killer and it can suck but you have to remember there are other people repairing generators so stop wasting your time with mofos that are playing you and slay their less bold buddies the cocky bastids will always slip up sometime later DP.P.S. it can take a bit to load a game in solo que my tip for getting around that is clicking on survive with friends exiting out of the friends list that pops up readying up waiting for the game start timer to count down and have it throw you into a lobby within a minute. Otherwise have fun waiting 10 30 minutes for a the game to throw you into a lobby from the main menu survive alone option I like turtles

review: I truly love the game but cannot in good conscience recommend this game to anyone in its current state. I tried to give it a chance and I got a couple of my friends the game but I don't think I can deal with these bugs/exploits anymore. I might not have played as much as some people but when you lose literally everything it kind of makes you hate this game. I sent in information and never recieved an email about anything. I think fixing bugs and exploits would be their first priority for this game instead of pushing new content out. My Claudette is level 0 for godsake they are supposed to start at level 1. Level 0 doesn't even exist! It even has a level 30 bloodweb at level 0! I don't even know how that is supposed to work.Update 11 Jan 17 Still. Absolutely. Nothing. This happened on 19 Dec 16. Almost a month.Update 22 Dec 17 I never updated this after I got my points back (20 Jan 17) but it has actually turned around now. I can connect to my friends and we can actually find games without waiting an hour.

review: This game has a great feeling and two unique gameplay but there is so many cheap strategies you can do it just kills the fun.I'd really like to see an overhaul of the core gameplay mechanics to adress a couple of things like palet looping hatch stalling and others. The game is very cool but not that fun to me anymore.Below previous positive review. This game really feels like no other I've played.You know when you get into a new FPS or a new MOBA your prior knowledge can be usefull and allow you to perform somewhat well in the new game.This won't happen here. You'll spend your first few games confused runnung for your life as a disfigured man runs at you with his chainsaw. And that's great.The game also comes with two "games". A coop stealth/survival game and a solo hunting/slasher game. And I was surprised to find out that the playerbased is well shared berween the two roles.There is a few details I don't like about the game. Survivor ranked is based on their grind ingame. Rank is Pip based (like hearthstone) and not Skill Rating based which is very weird for a game that doesn't have a binary win/lose condition. The community can be very toxic at times. In game it's not that bad as there is no chat during game but the forums are a I feel like the survivors can abuse some killer mechanics a little too well.Beside that I love everything about the game. It's very fun to play both alone or with friends.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: This game isn't perfect. The balance needs to be worked on for some killers and the easiest way to win is to be a jerk. But man is it fun. My heart still pounds when I know a killer is close. I laugh maniacally when I grab a survier from a locker. This game is what I use to get me pumped for work and it's what I crave all day long. The premise is simple. You are a survivor trying to fix a bunch of generators to open the doors and escape a supernatural serial killer. Or you are said supernatural serial killer trying to decorate your home by putting survivors on hooks (feng shui). Play one play the other or go back and forth as you see fit. You can't talk to any of the other players in game thus removing the negative experience that haunts competitive games. So have fun kill some folks fix some gennies and spend some time in the basement. You'll get hooked.

review: Product received for free. Recently started getting back into this game with the mindset of playing to actually have fun instead of playing to win. It appears the game can be much more enjoyable playing with that kind of mindset.. especially when playing as a survivor. If you take a look at the forums and reddit and any other media outlet for this game you will WITHOUT A DOUBT see posts about how and why killer is hard to play and why and how survivor is hard to play. I can tell you from my experience of playing this game so far that killer is much easier to play. I don't know if thats because of the type of playstyle i have if I'm a good killer or if the killer truly is easier to play but I ALWAYS get 3 4 kills. I have never put points into my killer therefore I do not use any perks on them and still get 3 4 kills every match even at rank 10 and lower. As you can imagine I play survivor more now as I feel its more of a challenge and I have a lot more fun. So if you plan to buy this game don't expect to always win and don't expect to always play against/with people who play "fair" because of the toxic community this game has.Pros Lots of fun even more so with friends Much more in depth then you'd think with the perk system and items/offerings Cheap DLCsCons Peer2Peer servers that are based off of the KILLERS connection therefore you will run into killers with horrible internet and killers that abuse their host connection by lag switching. To combat this I recommend downloading Kindred/MLGA to see what your connection is with the killer before beginning the trial and you will also be able to block the killers IP after the game is over if they were lag switching or you did not have fun play against them due to face camping tunneling etc. either way it is nice to have the CHOICE of who you play against Can be a bit buggy at times and usually the dev's response to something that is deemed "unfair" is just to nerf it to oblivion so keep that in mind when choosing to run with "meta" perksOverall I would recommend this game! Just remember it's exactly that... a GAME so if you decide to purchase this don't join the ranks of the toxic community and become another complaining player.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Dead by Daylight is an asymmetric game that when everyone plays the way intended can be quite a fun experience. The game centers around the Killer who uses first person to track down and eliminate 4 Survivors before they can activate generators to survive. I won't get into the specifics of "who's more OP" because the game is an asymmetric game giving different strengths to both groups. I will say that I have had tremendous fun with this title(mostly with friends) and have been filled with the utmost of salt and I'll explain why. While the game does do a lot right there are several aspects it needs to have examined and fixed or outright reworked. I've played both Killer and Survivor and I feel like the Killer was the easier of the two to pick up and has the most responsibilty to make the game enjoyable(face camping is not enjoyable for anyone and does nothing but cause one person to be removed while the rest of the Survivors beat you merely by doing objectives.) That's not to say you have to outright abandon your prey but don't just stay there and stare at them because it removes the tension and fun for a stupid one off kill. Where the Killer shines is the ability to stalk and hunt down the Survivors and when done right can be a very fun time for all. Survivors as well have the responsibility to not use flawed design or mechanics to abuse the Killer(and yes it DOES happen lol).My biggest gripes with this game are actually design/animation/execution issues. To start off the game puts everyone into a hyper tense state of survival or hunting which is going to naturally lead to easier anger. The problem lies with the fact that the animations and coding for this game are absolutely awful. I don't know how many times myself and others have cleared a window/pallet and been hit in the back because the game uses and awful lobby system (where the Killer is the host) and causes major latency issues. Which leads me to my second biggest complaint. The Killer has a distinct advantage and can even abuse their high pings and that has led to games where I physically feel ill because of how much rubber banding is going on just because someone with awful internet(or intentions) decides to be the Killer. And that ruins the game for every Survivor and not so much the Killer. It really ruins every game I've been in and there's no reason for it(just pull from the every person in the game and assign a host at the best latency). There is also the rampant issue where Killers disconnect from a game as soon as offerings are on the table which costs loads of time and is seriously childish and causes no one to want to use anything for fear of losing it without cause. That's not to say that the Survivors are innocent of it as well. I've been in many games where a Survivor will insta rage quit the moment the Killer sights them or hits them and that ruins the game immediately.All in all the game has loads of potential and is lots of fun with friends. If the Devs would pay more attention and fix major issues(such as buggy animations glitchy items add ons and offerings) then the game would be excellent. But it seems the Devs only care about making some more money and less about fixing persistent issues so it's unlikely these will occur. In closing very worth the buy on sale if you enjoy asymmetric games especially if you buy with friends.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: This is an amazing game. A 4v1 horror game. I remember the first time I played I was so scared however the more I played I got more adept at it. You get to choose to be a fearsome killer or be a brave survivor. The survivors objective is to repair 5 generators on the map and exit through an exit gate. It's not so easy however as the killer his or her objective is to down and hook the survivors. The survivors have a certain ammount of times they can get hooked before they get sacrificed to the entity. However the game is way more complex which you will have to learn by playing the game and trial and error. It's also important to mention that public games you play are always ranked except if you play kill your friends a mode in which you and four other friends play as a killer and the survivors. During a match (not kill your friends) you gain bloodpoints which you can spend for the survivors or the killer to get perks items offerings and addons. I have said enough about the game. You should try it out. So will you be a brave survivor? Or a bloodthirsty killer?
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Currently only have played 300+ hours but you only really need around 80 100 hours to understand how the game is broken. Killers are extremely under tooled while the survivors are over tooled. The amount of comeback mechanics for survivors are unreal with the killer only having a handful of options from relying on his or her game ability NOED and over altruistic players all of which cannot come close to comparison to the toolkit of survivors. (All views are from playing survivor main)Will recommend once killers get a buff in the right direction as well as decisive strike being reworked. Overall great game and many enjoyable hours were put into it.

review: I really like this game and i enjoy playing it for the most part but I can appreciate the complaints people have there are a few things that might really help new players and devs with working out what is actually wrong with the gameplay its hard to sort out through all the salt and tears but here are a few things that will make a massive difference 1 work on the match making system currently it appears to only be taking rank into account take away the ability to switch characters after joining a que make them equip before hand and then use perks selected survivor/killer chosen and hours played as well as all previous ranks attained to sort out who is ACTUALLY rank 20 and who was rank 1 yesterday before the reset so they dont play against each other. I was in a match with 11 hours play against 440 800 625 and a killer with 1200+ all had 4 lvl 3 perks with purple items ...guess who died.2 make a radius around a spiked survivor in which the killers aura is revealed to all players let them know immediatly that he intends to camp so they dont waste any time go a step further and give them a repair boost while the killer is revealed this would be enough to keep the killer from camping or at least basically end the game if he does.OR create a radius around the spiked survivor in which the entity progress will not count while the killer is within radius removes camping completely3 reveal the map/killer and perks to the players during character select and reveal survivor items and perks to the killer

Hope you will consider this option to allow players to refine their play before going online. It would be greatly apprecaited! Maybe for some it will be the only way they play as they do not want to even deal with the abuse but at least people will be playing your game. Thanks for listening.

review: This game is pretty simple 4 survivors try to get generators going to escape the level before a killer sacrifices them on hooks. Rinse and repeat that for every level. That being said it's pretty fun to play. If you were to play it a lot it would probably get repetitive. I think this game could hang around for a while if the developers continue to push out updates and DLCs. Time will tell. I purchased it when it was on sale for $10 and at that price it's worth it.

title: Dead by Daylight

review: DISCLAIMER Buy on sale only with lowered expectations. Big potential deal breaking flaws listed below.It all boils down to there being a decent game in here dragged down by the perk system and the community.Perks They're there for incentive to play for points and to keep you playing with a sense of progress but they're insanely powerful to the point they screw up the game. Stuff that doubles baseline abilities or nearly eliminates 90% of a side's challenge (instantly repair a generator as survivors! Flat out know where the survivors are as the killer!). You will constatly run into higher level people than you who are running 4 very rare perks while you're only running 1 common one and the fairness between the difference is a joke. Skill can only mitigate this to a point. If you stuck a noob into a fully leveled/perked character he could probably beat a long time player using a level 1 perkless character.You don't even get to know what perks are being used until after the match so you can't plan around them. It's total guesswork until suddenly the survivors have half the generators repaired in the first 30 seconds or some such horse manure. Imagine trying to play Chess and in any given game you never knew if your opponent would suddenly be able to move bishops and knights in straight lines. It totally undermines any strategy and the idea of a level playing field. You shouldn't feel any satisfaction winning or losing with that. Yet that is roughly how half your Dead By Daylight matches will go. I honestly wish they'd ditch the perk system altogether and have it be decided entirely on in game skill rather than pre game loadout and grinding. If they HAD to include perks then let them be available to everyone sooner or at least limit everyone to 1 or 2 slots max.The community You would probably have to venture over to Counterstrike to find a more unfriendly online FPS user base. The winners will be just as nasty as the losers.If it was just bad attitude I could take it by simply ignoring lobby chat. But it goes beyond that with the reviled "Survive With Friends" system. Basically having a premade team of survivors on voice chat throws the balance out the window. A lot of SWF players claim it's part of the game. No it is not. It is also blatantly obvious to everyone who's played even one hour of this that the game was definitely balanced around the fact that the survivors cannot directly communicate. The game was not designed around the survivors being able to have a dedicated lookout warn the entire team where the killer is at all times or a captured survivor tell everyone that the coast is clear for a rescue. There are survivor perks with the explicit purpose of gaining information on the status and whereabouts of other survivors so you cannot argue that premade voice chat teams are totally legit and don't throw the game off.You might say "Well of course a cordinated team has an advantage!" If both sides were teams this would be a fair point. If it was 16 survivors against 4 killers sure. But the game is 4 against 1. Coordination and voice chat is not somethign the killer can use and only gives the survivor team a huge unintended advantage.In summary if they got rid of the perk system (or at least heavily toned them down) and gave the killer some kind of option or bonus against premade survivor parties (very hard to impossible to implement) then this would be a pretty decent low cost multiplayer game. I don't see either of those happening though so I'd say only get this on sale with expectations of half your games being screwed over by unfair perks and premades.P.S. Holy hell is Michael Myers a pay 2 win character. I suck as the killer and even I can regularly get 3 4 kills a match with him and that's with NO PERKS! I can't imagine how broken he is with 4.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: I have this game since it's release and boy was it a journey from then to now. I play Survive with friends aswell as killer (mostly Trapper Huntress and Hillbilly) So i know the game from both perspectives. The game has phases of beeing really annoying because of bugs (sometimes gamebreaking) and matchmaking connection problems aswell as phases of running almost flawlessly. The phases always change with each update.The game runs nice # UPDATE # the game runs and there are new bugs # UPDATE the game runs nice and and the bugs are fixed # UPDATE the game runs again and there are returning bugs that has been fixed 10 times alreadyI dont know what the main problem is together we joke about Behavior programming this game with MS Paint but i have never experienced a game with such conditions. For example a little update fixes a colission problem with a static prop on a specific map... suddenly all dropped pallets (dynamic props unrelated to that specific fixed prop) start to fly up in the air when destroyed by killer. Other example an update introduced a new killer to the game...suddenly the sounds for when a killer breaks a generator changes to the pallet drop sound.....HOW CAN THIS BE....really mysterious.Also the community mostly the killer main players is really whiny in the forums and the studio listens mostly to them since they pay for the Killer DLCs introducing new inbalanced perks and addons that for new players are really hard to counter. But if you got the skill and help of your friends you can still manage to MAKE DAT DAMN DOCTOR RAGEQUIT after he got hit by the 5th pallet and 10 flashlight beams in a row. And these moments are one of the best. The best moments in this game you can only have with your friends in my opinion. Or you have super friendly and skilled random teammates. Although the community is toxic the game has some flaws and bugs (although always different ones not the same bug for ever haha) and some decisions on balancing the Studio is making are really questionable ......I CAN RECOMMEND THIS GAME in it's current state (23rd November 2017).The Studio is constantly updating the game like every week so who knows what the future holds for it.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Good Concept Excellent should be build uponFeel Jeepers Creepers The Hills have Eyes Texas Chainsaw MassacreSetting Massive cornfield which randomly generates new layouts every matchChoice Survivor(4 ppl) or Serial Killer(Butcher with machette Wraith with holdable psyth Hillbilly with chainsaw)Grossness Slicing dicing hacking sawing and running people through with rusty metal hooks while they are alive before sacrificing them Scary 7 10 ( As a survivor you are running and hiding from the killer. Also you get to the point where you have to crawl away as blood drips from your wounds leaving a blood trail for the murder to follow)Realism Yes just yes... Blood splatters reactions from victims running away in fear and how they react from the different ways they are hurt and sliced. How they keel over after being cut for the first time and then try to crawl away leaving a blood trail to follow. As the killer you decide whether to finish them off there or pick them up and bring them to an old rusty hook used to slaughter animals and rip the hook into the victim's back or shoulder while they are still alive like one of the dripping carcasses they suspend from it after skinning their animals.Bad Still in BetaCan't change controls too wellGlitchy and low fpsSlow load timesGraphics arn't the greatestSummary Great concept and feel. Really puts you in Slasher film atmosphere. Awesome and gross ideas of how to kill people.However it is still in Beta so there are lots of glitches and things to fix. ***THIS SHOULD BE MARKED AS AN "EARLY ACCESS" GAME***Yes I would buy this but I would wait until the next sale and/or next patch or two so the devs could work out some of the kinks... ( I hope you enjoyed the description of the realism because that is how it actually is in game there are worse stuff but that's for you to find out)I am now going to watch a slasher film(Maybe Friday the 13th or something) because this review and game got me in the mood for it...
title: Dead by Daylight

title: Dead by Daylight

review: This game has a very cool unique concept that has been rarely approached before in horror games the classic slasher movie killer against survivors.As a fan of those classic slasher movies i love this game and it's idea.I USED to give this a negative review because of it's unplayable state with massive amount of glitches no key binding and overall unprofessional work for a full release.However these issues have all been fixed since then with balance issues and small (animation) glitches being the only minor problems.This game is very unique scary and fun you get to choose whether you're the survivor or the killer there are many survivors and killers what makes them different are their abilities. The survivors get their unique abilities much later on but killers have a different playstyle from the get go. It's up to you to make a choice about which you prefer. As a killer you have to hang every survivor (and get them killed) while as a survivor you have to activate all the generators in the map so you can escape. As a survivor you'll rely on teamwork while as a killer you'll have to rely on yourself only you'll need to make smart decisions. Either way if you fail (killer or survivor) you still get a good amount of bloodpoints (the game's points which allow you to get perks) so losing isn't really that big of a deal.When it comes to the soundtrack it's a fairly simple soundtrack with a nice (although repetitive) menu music ambient music related to how close the killer is related to you music when the killer is chasing you and snippets taken from the Halloween movie's famous Micheal Myers theme for Micheal Myers' abilities yes he's a killer in this game. Despite being simple the soundtrack fits the atmosphere perfectly.Overall the game's balance is prettygood with a couple of issues the devs are looking into (hopefully) both sides can be both fun to play and infuriating at times. I'd recommend this game when you can afford it (maybe on a sale?) it's very fun very spooky and actually really good.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: I enjoyed this game for a long time. I put hours and hours in this game and mained the hillbilly for a minimum of 300 hours. I decided to stop playing this game because it's way too competitive for what it wants to be. An "asymmetrical horror mutliplayer" should never focus on competitive things or "ranks". A Killer with power is easily outplayed with a little amount of skill. Even I a goddamn killer main can escape from the most rank 1 killers as a survivor. I dont want to be forced to use a nurse or the brand new 10$ DLC killer with every meta perk to get 1 pip in a match full of good survivors. The most killers are not even viable for higher rank matches. In my opinion the killers are too weak and too easy to gimp and juke for a "competitive" (which is btw ridiculous in horror multiplayers) gamplay. Better play F13

review: To me it's a waste of money. I hadn't played the game since it was over more than a year and today I decided to play. I was playing the killer and after my second or third match I was being targeted by the other four players. They claimed that I was cheating during the match because I was "camping". But in a situation where you feel like actually winning a match for once against players who swarm their companion(s) as soon as theyre hooked what else is there to do? After I made my case they preceded to harass me by stating in a similar manner "that isn't the way the game is meant to be played" and also threatened to report me. The first match I've played today was fine I lost they won and it was fine. "Let's move on to the next one" I thought. So I did just that and it was all fine and dandy. Match after that I actually won and immediately after was opposed by my issue with this. I think I preferred the silent players who respond with "gg" than what those few did. Maybe it was one bad egg of the bunch situation but either way I'm deterred from the game. If you've read this I'm not trying to influence you but more so to share my experience that will give you awareness. I wish games weren't like this but I guess nothing can truly be done when the people just looking for a reason to vent by verbally incinuating in the form of a negative criticism (or in other words "personal attack"). At any rate that's my dilema have a good day.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: It was a warm Thursday afternoon the dev stream had just ended and half of the Dead by Daylight community was at panic Operation Bloodlust was a success. Now Operation Bloodlust was an idea that most people mocked when it was first revealed. In reality who did think that having a killer running around at mach 5 was a good idea? In case you can't figure it out the Dbd devs. I digress the whole Dead by Daylight world would soon have to face the wrath of this implementation. And the ones who suffered the most from this was the new meanie faces. The new meanie faces have now grown accustomed to running around at the speed of sound and are stuck with permanent training wheels. Wait this is where I post reviews? In that case if you liked the old retro Sonic games from the 90s I think you will really enjoy this game. Even though there are some really weird fan made versions of Sonic in this game the player can still experience the same fast paced gameplay through the killer mode of this game! If you have friends that have poured a lot of time into this game don't listen to what they say. You must enter this game with the sheer purpose of becoming the ultimate speed machine through the killer mode. I digress once again my main point is why are you still reading this review? Get out there buy Dead by Daylight and play yourself one of the weirdest Sonic The Hedgehog mods I have ever seen!
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Really fun game excellent tool for mining vast amounts of salt.PROS Good killer/survivor designs. Good sountrack Games are often short and sweet Skill ceiling is fairly high Semi random map layout each timeCONS Semi toxic player base Clear survivor bias from the Devs Semi random map layout each time (can sometimes result in 1 sided maps.. not for killers though)CONCLUSION This game is fun and the only thing that detracts from the fun doesnt arise from the game itself but from the players in it. A good portion of the Survivor base is toxic and anything that results in them losing is "broken" or "cheap". Unfortunatly the developers compound on this attitude with the very obvious bias and refusal to listen to legitimate criticsm if it comes from a Killers point of view.The best example of this was Freddy Krueger a mediocre Killer at best yet because low to mid skill Survivors didnt know how to play against his unique abilities they screamed and cried and just 1 week later had a raft of incoming nerfs. Now only 1 of these has made it through so far because of the massive outburst of Killer mains but even then the 1 nerf is bugged and basically makes him unplayable. BUT DONT WORRY KIDS! He will be fixed next month )
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Dead by Daylight is one of those rare multiplayer games that makes it fun to both play by yourself or play with friends. Want a fun solo player experience? Play the Killer and single handedly hunt down four other players. (Or in some cases chase them around a tree until your speed boost kicks in.)Want a fun multiplayer experience? Get some friends to buy the game and make a four man scooby squad to evade/outsmart the killer.The game does have some slight balance issues when it comes to match making but the devs try really hard to make the game as fair as possible and so far every match has been a unique experience.
title: Dead by Daylight

If you're looking to scare the pants off of a few friends or strangers and have a blast doing it this is exactly what you are looking for. Despite the game's flaws so far and relatively shallow gameplay this game is the only multiplayer horror experience that actually captures the horror part. That makes it worth it for someone like me.

review: So I been playing this game quite alot recently and have lots of thoughts to share. It is you who should decide whether to buy this game or not but I would like to give you some thoughts about this game and gives you pros and cons (which I felt along the way).I knew about this game before buying it cause one of my favourite streamer used to play this game alot (recently he havent though because of viewers trying to troll with him ingame) but he havent played for last 2 3 months so most of information I had were outdated when I purchased it we had few more killers few more survivors. The fun aspect of this game I think is the intensity you feel initially. I think this is unique experience you have with Dead by Daylight. You may have some experience similar to this in other games but personally I find it pretty hard intensity heartbeating experience when I had to hide and killer was searching for me. The music the heart beating system the risk you can have by failing QTE and goes on. I think first few hours of this game is one of the most intensity gameplay you might ever have (As Survivor I mean.) You also can learn few perks ("skills") ingame that can help you along the way. You dont need these if you are really good at this game but still it is good to have them. Especially certain perks can really help you play as Stealth and be much more safe than playing without perks.You can also have different variations of perks. For example one character can have only 3 unique perks on its own but if you level up that character to level 45 the perks now become avaliable to other characters so you can have fun of mixing different perks of different characters and find your own style whether to play stealthy or play flashy type.What I dislike about this game mostly is about the bloodpoints. So in this game when you learn perks or levelup what you use is Bloodpoints. These points are made by winning through the game or doing some works in game such as doing some objectives helping other teammates running away from killer and so on. Problem with this system lies on the fact that in order for you to level up you need more bloodpoints. Therefore more bloodpoints better. Winning game? Surviving? well it doesnt matter if you have enough bloodpoints. At one point of time like me you will probably feel less and less intense about this game. For example few days ago I was so scared and my heart was beating so quickly when I was last one to live and I had to find hatch (escape route). I was literally fighting Killer 1v1. This moment was so unique and I enjoyed every last bit of it. However already I started to get used to this. I now dont feel as scared even in situation like that. I am more interested in bloodpoints since afterall surviving this game is not really main point you need more bloodpoints to level up.So from one point this game become not a killer vs survivor game but rather who makes more bloodpoints game. I seen some players who play this game just to make more bloodpoints. Killers wouldnt even kill survivor Survivor would help killers to get more bloodpoints. This should never happen in this kind of game more it happens less you feel intense about this game.I am no killer player but I did try killer twice just to do my Daily ritual and what happened on 2nd game was players in game realized I was new to game so even though they opened exit instead of leaving they tried to take more objectives hatch instead of leaving the game. Should we call this game survivor game at that point? Sure it isnt.So Conclusion do I recommend this game? for now YES sure thing. However I think if this game management fails hard we might even see less and less players in this game in near future. This game has done such an awesome job of creating heart beating music hide and seek system but it is failing to make it game serves its original characteristic of survivial not trying to "farm" more bloodpoints.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Old part I like the game but to anyone thinking about buying it Don't! At least not yet. The developers set their priorities on releasing new content instead of fixing important broken issues (they claim it by themselves see their interview streams). Most prominent example You basically cannot play the game as the mathmaking algorithm simply does not find any games for you meaning you sit there clicking 25 minutes (not exaggerating) every 2 seconds on "Join a Lobby" to play a single approximately 10 minute long game with random people who do not match your skill level (since there seems to be almost no rank matching whatsoever).This issue came up with release &gt 2 months ago and still resides in the game.I will update my review in a detailed manner once this is fixed.Update 1 Apparently the developers now changed their strategy They included more telemetry tools to find bugs faster and fixed some crucial game mechanics.Now this game after the implementation of the Halloween addon with Michael Myers brought back a feeling of terror and surprise which I really like.Still there is a competitive component to crack this 10k points mark so you will be able to improve your survivor/killer rank.Especially the survive with friends mode is a fun challenge when you are able to play certain strategies with a good killer.For people who want constant action I have to say there is a lot of "down time" when you just sit there and fix a generator wait for the killer to vanish or heal a person and you do nothing but watch out for the killer. This is part of the game and I like it but I can understand some people don't.Update 2 Even after one year the game is not fixed. Medium to severe bugs are still there the studio just cares for new features instead of bugfixing again. I do not think that this is the dev's fault but the fault of e.g. this economics guy who thinks he knows everything better (the arrogant guy who leads the stream) but seems to have no clue about anything (just my opinion). &gt Play if you own it but do not invest your money in this game.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: I think the game is great when it actually works. I've played the game for 5 hours now and it has crashed and breaks the game more times than a game is actually finished. That's unnacceptable and I can't recommend this until you can play the game. The worst part about the game is how buggy it is. You wait too long to find a match. It is the number 1 selling game on steam right now you shouldn't have to wait at all. When you finally get a match to start there is at least a 50% chance that the game will break before it can be finished. If that happens to you no matter how much XP you earned you lose it all. I just crashed a game where i was the killer and had just finished off the last survivor and was taking them to the hook. Crash. I lost 10 000 XP and lost 18 000 XP from the completion of the Trapper Divine Ritual goal. Talk about taking the wind out of your sails... 28 000 xp lost in a single match. It's already too difficult to level up as it is but you only complete a game half of the time. This game is early access at this point. Buy it if you want to be a beta tester.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: The game is good to play it creates a good suspense and also provides a spooky environment at the same time yes there is a few bugs as expected for a game that has only been released on the steam market.ProsGood music for chases lobby etc.Good perks to encourage assisting other players.Various different perks based on what character you chooseMultiple locations to keep you interested in the game3 different killers that you can choose based on your playstylebonus score for trying to save your companionsConsA lot of lobby hoppers due to people trying to find friends only still takes around 1 to 2 mins to find a gamePlaying as the killer can sometimes be difficult due to i never seem to find any survivors i don't know whyThe killer can just literally stand directly infront of a survivor and you can't get the action to grab them off the hookNo control rebindsDeluxe edition itemsThe artbook is currently in development which i am fine waiting forI recieved both of the payday 2 masks and the beta keys. The payday masks are sick )The only problem i have is that the OST is availble on the website and steam we are meant to have it but from comments i have seen nobody has access to the soundtrack.To summarize this i think that the game is worth paying the money for and also if you get a few of your friends you could play in a private match until they release a party mode which will most likely be available sooner rather than later due to high demand

review: Don t get me wrong this game is loads of fun However with that being said there are some major problems with this game that IMO is holding it back.1) The ranking system In order to rank up you have to achieve a certain level of blood points in each game (3 times for 1 rank) and if you don t make the requirement you lose one of your progression marks. This is a completely idiotic idea because it turns the game from a Survival style game into a Farm Simulator . It should be changed so that you get a progression mark if you survive not by how many blood point you acquire.2) Lobbies Instead of having set servers for the game the dev set it to be P2P This means that if the host has a bad connection you re in for a bad time. There is no auto reconnect so if you get dropped you have to find a new lobby. Since there is no set matchmaking you can be put into a lobby with people way beyond your own skill level which leads me to my next point The Host (Killer) is able to see everyone s names and ranks but not vice versa so if you and your group are rank 20 with 10+ character levels against a rank 10 character level 30+ you re going to get stream rolled.3) No matchmaking with friends a huge complaint that I have seen so far is that there s no way to play with friend online other than creating a private match. I m sure this will be added it (But who knows how long it will take)4) Mechanics Some of the mechanics in the game feel a bit off/unfair. No matter how much you wiggle you won t escape before being hooked (Unless everyone has a tool box and destroy all the hooks) The chances of getting off the hook on your own are extremely slim so even if the killer leaves you hanging there if your team doesn t come back for you you re SOL5) No team communication in the game How can there be no team based communication in a team survival!?! The only time you can talk to anyone is when you re in the lobby before the game starts after that silence. (Again I m sure they will add something in but who knows how long it will take)6) The Killer The Hillbilly and Trapper are fine as they are but The Wraith needs some serious tuning. He can turn invisible / move faster while invis you can barely see his outline while he is invis and the only way to tell if he s there (Since the heart beat is silenced) is to sound the hell out of the game and listen for his growling which is hard to do while fixing the generators) 7) Items I hold no issue with the Med kit or the Tool Box however the Map and Flashlight are completely useless. The Map allows you to see the outline of generators that you have already been to. This makes the map useless since you can easily remember the locations of all the generators (The game map is small / locations almost never change) The Flashlight has little to no accuracy and it burns through its durability extremely quickly which means if you miss the killer on the first try don t bother doing it again. 8) No penalties for deserters While I am guilty of leaving 2 3 games so far I do have an issue with having no penalty to it. If someone leaves early then it makes it easier for the Killer and it decreases the amount of blood points he gets which affects his rank.While I have listed quite of bit of negatives I do see hope for this games future if the developers take people s concerns and criticism seriously. From what I understand these issues were brought up during the beta yet nothing was done. This game makes you think on your feet and can be more intense than scary. I look forward to playing this game a lot more if these issues are resolved.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: I would have recommended this game very highly before the Huntress was introduced. An utterly broken character that is to over powered with the ability to have ranged attacks. Further the player base though mostly okay seem to gravitate to watching you when hooked. With normal killers it is easy enough to get someone down with a bit of distraction but the huntress makes that entierly moot. She camps from a distance so that people who are coming to get you don't know and get an axe to the back or the second you get pulled down you get downed again by the throwing axe. If the devs balance her it may be better but I doubt it. They won't even fix the constant bugs or put in place anything to prevent camping. Instead they keep making dlc to add an ever growing number of bugs and cheep exploits. review: Pros A lot of ways to play. If you want to run distraction grab a flashlight. Medic? Grab a medkit and use some healing perks. Sabotage? Get you a toolbox or the perk. Killers have the same goal to sacrifice survivors but different perk setups keep it interesting with Hex users or making the survivors progress harder. Doesn't get repetitive despite seeming like it should with the same goals each game. Chat in the before game lobby allows survivors to coordinate offerings and items to help each other which the killer cannot see in the normal lobbies. If you're playing the Kill your Friends mode then it's not a ranked match and the killer can chat with you. Survive with Friends allows for an easy game to play with friends that doesn't get boring quickly. You can only spectate your other survivors after death/escape so you can't cheat by watching what the killer is seeing. You don't need to purchase the DLC to get the full experience of the game. While you cannot choose DLC characters for yourself you can be pit against DLC killers and play with other people using DLC chracters. Skills are creative and you can make some very good builds to play with. Shows the ping for the lobby you are in to prevent laggy games.Neutral Ranking System that pits you against people of around the same rank. You have a survivor rank and a killer rank and it resets once a month. Neutral because of the reset and each rank is shared between all killers or survivors respectively. Killer hosts the game which can be good or bad depending on their connection. Worth mentioning for people with internet data limits. Certain things are very overpowered. The devs are usually pretty good about balancing as needed though.Cons Killers in lower ranks tend to stand right in your face after you've been hooked known as face camping. They will even ignore survivors obviously trying to get their attention nearby. This prevents anybody from saving you and kills any chance you have of getting any points or enjoyment out of that match. There's a glitch currently with people losing all their progress. You can conctact the devs to get it back but it's still frustrating and takes time. The glitch is known and being looked into. Keep screenshots or pictures of your progress at all times to prove your level etc. There's also a way to back it up but I don't know how. You can get kicked from the game due to connection which can be frustrating especially when playing with friends.Overall I highly recommend this game.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Payed 20 euros for this game 1 and a half years ago aproximately when it was released. At first you don't get anything of what's happening and you will either go out of your way and watch dozens of tutorials or you can learn everything by yourself assuming you are dedicated to spend lots of hours in leveling up your characters getting new perks which referesh the game's "repetitive" gameplay prestiging your beloved prey...i mean survivors and your favourite killers. If you want the full experience you will need to pay extra for the DLCs which as of now will cost you about 50 euros (with more to come in the future i am pretty sure). But these DLCs really make you want to jump straight back in the game if you were bored of it as i was. After taking a 4 5 months break from DBD i come back finding out that i missed 2 or 3 killer releases and some nice cosmetic items.I was forced to jump back in and give Dead by Daylight a second chance. That was an excellent decision. I hope you find this game as enjoyable as i find it 100 500 even 1000 hours later. Dead by Daylight is a MUST have horror game 9.5/10.

review: Extreme hide and seek mixed with tag basically.Survivors have to activate 5 generators an exit door and escape and the killer needs to knock the survivors down and hang them up on a meathook to sacrifice them to the spider queen. Because the killer sees in first person and has no visual aids the game boils down to hide and seek. For a simple concept it's pretty fun though the community can be (and often is) downright cancerous.Just to be perfectly clear as many see it as a point of confusion this isn't really comparable to Friday the 13th. Friday the 13th is more of a slasher simulator while this is a tightly focused competitive game that merely shares the killer versus survivors trappings.

review: This is not really a review its a suggestion for making matchmaking better and more enjoyable. Request to the devs. Please add a ''Ban a killer'' Option in the matchmaking. By that i mean having the option to block certain killers from being matched against you. E.g I would ban ''Nurse'' and the ''Nightmare'' so i wont have to deal with how unbalanced ''i think'' they are.The game would be more enjoyable for players like me as we would be matched only vs killers we are comfortable playing against. Its not fun being chaced by a decent nurse 90% of the time you will get caught and hook camped as even if nurse leaves your hook she can insta teleport to it from the other side of the map.... And the nightmare ? Where to begin with ? If he is close to you he is chasing you if you manage to escape he sees you and by the time you find a way to fail a skillcheck or a teammate in order to wake up you are already on a hook if your teammates are not in the dream they cant bodyblock neither flashlight that guy... Please either balance the killers or give us the option to not be matched against them. And im not saying give us the option to ban every other killer so we would always be matched with the same kind just 2 bans per game so there is a plenty of options for finding matches as there are a lot of killers to choose from.

review: Played 'til Daylight The Good Every game almost always guarantee suspense and sometime even fear. From hiding from the killer up to running for your life there is no shortage in emotions from winning or losing and surviving or dying. Dead by Daylight is constantly being refreshed and updated by its developer. New Killers Survivors Skins and even new maps have been thrown at this game since its release. Make no mistake there is a strategy to this game. I have to admit I haven't mastered or even aware of all of them. Thankfully there are communities in facebook youtube channels devoted to educating new players how to advance and succeed. Multiple Play Styles. You can be altruistic or heroic. You can also just look out for yourself as a survivor. Characters can carry different perks according to how you want to play. The Bad Don't get me wrong its current and only game mode and mechanics is fun. However given the potential of this game I expected it to have another game mode or different types of mechanics for the killers or survivors to catch their prey or survive the game respectively. Developers made a huge blunder. A lot of players lost their hard earned progress in the game. If you've slaved over this game to get all the perks and items you've wanted I can't blame them for down voting this game. The Recommendation BUY ITWith the comming halloween season now is the perfect time to get this game a long with your friends. So load up those perks hold on to your flashlights the night is long and danger is just around the corner.

review: With more experience I'm gonna have to change my review. The balance and quality of the game goes down every day as more and more survivors learn how to abuse the game's mechanics. When the game first came out it took 20+ minutes to get a game as Killer because nobody wanted to be survivor. By next week there'll be nobody left playing Killer because playing Killer in the current balance environment is an agonizing ordeal.As it stands right at this moment the game is broken. It's not horror it's not stealth and it's definitely not fun. It's Benny Hill whack a mole where survivors will actually start chasing you if you haven't given them enough points to rank up.Don't buy it right now. If a major balance patch fixes the game's egregious problems it'll be worth a buy but if it keeps its current trajectory it'll be dead as soon as the twitch hype dies down.

review: Dead by Daylight is an amazing game to save the least. I've just reached 13 hours and this game has done nothing but impress me. I love it so much. There are a few things that may bother some but the devs are working on it for sure. I know I've read a lot where people are complaing about not being able to communicate with their fellow survivors but in my opinion that makes it all the better. I mean sure it does hurt in some aspects but it truly challenges you as the player to think about morals. "Do I save my teammate and risk being caught or do I take this time to fix generators and escape with the others?"That is one of the questions that you'll have to answer in a split second because time is of the essence here. For $20 this game is a must buy for any of the horror game loving people out there.

review: So after a good amount of play time i can write a pretty good review which will be accurate from most perspectives.PROS This game is very fun and has constant updates this means there is always something new as well as new perks addons etc so no game is the same especially with the amount of killers currently available. The game is very unique and devs respond to problems somewhat well depending ( I will get onto this) Being able to party with friends and trying to survive personally it makes the game loads more fun to play and also allows you to work better as a team and will have higher success of winning The game has a relativly high skill cap depending on wheather you play killer or survivior and if killer which oneCONS Now this is where i start to dislike the game and therefore cannot reccomend this game to other people. The main reason is BALANCE now Im not saying oh this killers OP this killers not bla bla im talking balance in general. A lot of killers at high levels say rank 10 on arnt even considered a viable pick because of how bad they are wraith has always been bad and will always be bad the hag is okay freddy is god awful but WAS good and this brings me to my next point. The Devs takes surviviors complaints A LOT more seriously than killers when Freddy first came out he was good he was balanced he was viable then because surviviors started actually dying and no longer had control of games and could no longer bully this killer they had a tantrume saying hes OP and shouldnt have this or that and so the DEVs nerfed a perfe ctly fine character to the point NO ONE plays him now which also results in 5 pounds down the drain as you pay for freddy New Killers and surviors cost money now this is a topic I am in the middle on yes they have to pay for lisenced killers such as freddy and the new pig but then again its only a killer survivor and map with then perks for each its not that big of content to warrant 5 pounds every time theres a new killer and survivor if you main surviviors its pointless as you basically then buy the dlc for looks and to get their perks (if they have good ones). If that DLC killer then gets nerfed (like feddy) then the money (to me) is wasted Balancing issues so im going to explain WHY i think this and I share the same opinion as a lot of killers and big youtubers and this is based on the fact that the killer doesnt have enough time. Now im not going to put all statistics in here you can look online but the killer takes so long to chase hit chase hit/down then pickup potentially get Decisive Striked and if so chase and hit again and pick up then carry to the hook (hope they dont wriggle out or get blinded or get a pallet slamed on you and then hook them. This takes SO long by this time the other 3 survivors could have completed 3 gens. A survior can harass the killer and dependant on how many and the placement of pallets out run the killer in the time all gens are done. Surviviors control what happens they have pallets items windows perks like DS and sprint burst they can get back up after being downed from Bills perk they can duke you by literally if mastered turn around and spin right past you so so quicly their movement speed is now so much quicker its insane I was playing the Pig today and it takes about 10 15 seconds just to catch them if we are both running in a straight line without pallets now I know that doesnt sound long but in a game thats a lot of time wasted it feels like your just tagging along behind them and then the game becomes boring My final point is the new killer she has great potential but not right now her abilities are AMAZING and i was so excited to try her out but then I saw the downsides. Killers can see the Saw boxs from the start they are highlighted. 2 problems with this first they straight away know what killer you are and secondly it is stupidly and i mean stupidly easy to get the saw trap off they just run to a highlighted saw box and inte ra ct with it like a generator now the patch notes say that box may not be the right one for their saw trap I call bs every person ive seen run to one has got theirs off and thats with me using addons to create more skill checks and if they fail a bigger punishment. So the masks yeah they buy time have I ever killed anyone with 1 yet? NO Overall this game is very good and I do love it but I cannot play it reguarly or reccomend it to anyone because of the balance issues so many people are complaining to the devs but they just dont listen and if they do they attempt to buff a killer like the wraith in the most stupid way it doesnt even help. The game is mained up of mainly surviviors and so they are the ones who the devs will prioritise.But there you go i hope this review helped and let me know in the comments your opinions!
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Its a great game that deserves some credit for being the first fully fledged horror game that was multiplayer that appeared on steam it has done a great job I had gotten into the beta a while ago (I still havn't bought the game) and got into the free weekend recently this game deserves credit but it also needs to relise its own weaknesses in how the devs have communicated to the players. Pros This game is not Friday the Thirteenth at all Period Exclamation Mark! People try to compare the two games and you really can't and it does truly bother me that people try this game was never meant to be like Friday the Thirteenth it trys to establish a equal playing field for the surivor and killer while Friday likes to establish the killers dominance but gives numbers to compensate for the players own weakness. This game is competive in nature and you can't change that. This game is soul eating faced survivors against a killer that will cry this could easily be a con because the community can be rather meh at times but you can ignore them mostly. The graphics are nicely done and animations are fluid Bloodwebs + Perks are a nice way to level up and grow in strength. Ranks do reset and so does your progress at the start of a new season some could say this is a weakness but I say its great to have everyone start from the beginning but there is flaws to this as well which I will explain more in Cons section of this review Pricing now I may lose some people here because its a game how do you really say price is a good stand point its because of what you get for the 21 dollars you get 5 killers and alot of surivors around half the amount of survivors of friday and killers but the variance of what these characters can do you have a wraith (weakest character do not recomend but I did kill 4 people with him so yeh he used to be worse) he can go into a half baked invis and ring a bell to come out of it. you have teleporting nurse You have a huntress that throws axes you have a trapper that places traps and you have a hillbilly with a chainsaw all have different abilities and different strengths making this more divergent that Friday going back to the Friday the thirteen because I was just getting at the killers for this you get alot of diversity and alot of content to play with making it really worth if you enjoy the game if you don't you won't get your money's worth but thats normal but it feels like you will have alot of way to get enjoyment and time into the game Random Generation Kinda Its not really but its a nice fact that its somewhat random maps but not really which allows for some skill and memorization to come into play.Cons Here is the that happens yeh Communty is Reported You camped me I'm going to derank now because I lost ect... its not terrible like League of Legends and CS GO and DOTA and Overwatch. but it has its darkside but I'm just going to talk to these people now I don't care if you say I camp I don't care if you decide this I'm going to derank because its just for fun in the end and its a game meant for a killer to find the most effective way at killing you wether that is to stay around you because your a surive with friends or whatever people need to relise that killers will do whats best for them not whats best for survivors. Now you can get angry at me or you can accept this you won't change and I know it but for the love of god understand and look through the killers POV because at the end of the day its sad to go throught a game hard fought and manage to get 3 kills and then for someone to yell yah camped them for no reason but you saw some guy standing by a window and you knew as soon as you moved he would come and get you. I hope the community can learn not to ostrasize the killer (that sounds extremly ironic) but the community needs to understand the killer has to do whats best for them on their side of the field its their choice sure some killers camp you because its a pip but some do it because they have no other way to kill the people that will free you if they come a knocking at the hook. DLC Paywall this is very small and it doesn't matter in the long scheme of things if you play killer you will see all the survivors and if you play survivor you will see all the killers you just won't be able to play them which is nice in a way you get to see what its like but its just a slight missgiving the game has in the end. Rank Reset and Skill Purge You will meet people on reset day that are far above you inskill and in the following weeks new killers will be turned off and so will new survivors this needs a fix because it does feel unfair FOR BOTH sides of it. Someone kiting a bad killer for 2 years or a surivor being down one after another in a minute or less both feel terrible for the side unless they know they are the right skill level so in this side of things its terrible the skill purges are annoying on rank reset day because all that time you took to get those perks and now they are all gone but its a way to somewhat ofset the skill gap for surivors and killers that happen when a ranked reset happensFinal VerdictIts a good game its less buggy then Friday that for sure... But you can't take my word for it in the end I have only looked over footage so take everything I said about friday with a grain of salt ok you dihard fans of the friday franchise ok. but I know there are a ton of bugs and this game doesn't have as many the devs can be scatter brained at times but they balance stuff out eventually thankfully I have seen alot through streams and such to know where DBD has come from to now and its looking fine. I hope people hop on the game and take a mossey through some fields and get chainsawed by the Billy or New Leathered Faced Friend in haddonfields P I recommend this game because it is fun it is somewhat balanced in its current state I will probably eventually buy the game but I will also say if you are hesitant wait for a free weekend or when it goes on sale if you don't truly know this game I can't give a rating too because a game is hard to judge by numbers its just fun for me and its my own opinion those who have read this entire rant and all my points I thank you for all survivors who take what I have said to heart I hope you give a surivor a little less of a toxic chat experince and I also what to remind them I know not all surivors are toxic just a few get carried away at times and with that I'm off to some unkown game somewhere where I will have a good time see yah !

review: Product received for free. Disclaimer I got a key from the devs So about 24 hours in and overall I've had a great time. It's a unique concept (when it first hit Steam now there are other copycats) and can be a ton of fun with friends. It has a bit of a learning curve as survivor but it's well worth it. I've not played enough to encounter some of the major issues people have had other than the sometimes long matchmaking times. I'm sure at higher levels of play some of the biggest problems start sticking out (I mean hell even Overwatch suffers from this). But if you're looking for a fun asymetrical survival horror game that won't break the bank check this out.
