Instead of taking a long time it just sends you to main menu making you have to join your friends lobby again.I wouldn't be writeing this review if the developers weren't making other content while their game is still broken. review: The game itself is great the concept is decent the nurse just got a big nerf but since I don't tend to play the killer I'll let someone else do it.Matchmatching is by far the biggest problem with the game if you a solo player getting into a game isnt to hard for killers matches are instant for solo survivor the time varies it can get instant or it can take up to 10 minutes or soSurvive with friends is currently the most broken match making I have ever seen the way it works is you invite your friend(s) everyone readys up it searches for a game and then you get kicked marjority of the time which means you have to go reinvite all your friends all over again I've noticed that player population and pip has alot to do with this since a game cant start without a killer say one of your friends is like under rank 10 and you just got the game maybe 15 20 rank expect a huge wait time if your friend is closer to your rank its a little bit easier.The process of inviting friends and searching before a kick averages around 30 seconds if everyone is paying attentiona few stats listed below for 4 games (i have played more then 4 games with more or less same problem.07 04 (14 Lobby Remakes) SWF2/4 Match Found Sucessfully08 21 (12 Lobby Remakes) SWF2/4 Lobby found friend kicked04 30 (8 Lobby Remakes) SWF2/4 Looby found Sucessfully14 23 (26 Lobby Remakes) SWF2/4 Lobby Found Friend kicked (Survived with friend button bugged twice forcing friend to invite instead)Getting the game to play on your own is more recommended then with friends but there is a learning curb to get over and without having someone to teach it the game can be very hard and make you not want to play muchI highly recommend staying away from this game if you are getting it to play with other people until the match making is fixed

review: Campers really ruin the experience for me. When the killer grabs you and puts you on the hook it's practically impossible to be saved when they're standing there staring at you. And the length of time it takes to start the generator is much longer than the time you have on a hook so saying "camping lets your team start generators faster" isn't a valid argument. Besides if one person dies the team is at a serious disadvantage the next time the killer decides to be a camper. It's unfortunate because this game has an amazing concept. Killers just abuse the system.Other than that game is addicting and adrenaline pumping. Just needs better balance.

review: I'll be honest some folks are gonna play this game once or twice get infuriated beyond belief and stop. And I will see you off and salute as you leave. The devs' strategy of making every new killer unreasonably strong and buffing characters/mechanics by leaps and bounds leads to a lot of frustrating slogs where queuing as either killer or survivor against certain characters feels like an instant loss. The tendency for killers to be structured around depriving survivors of essential mechanics doesn't help with this The Nightmare making it impossible to hide The Hag's hexes forcing an extra step into the game before repairing generators.But now I gotta be honest with my honesty. None of that has stopped me playing. Sometimes I even circumvent mechanics or characters I thought were unreasonably powerful and there is a kind of joy in that. The core mechanics are solid straight through an asymmetrical multiplayer about surviving the assault of a slasher movie villain is a fantastic idea on paper and the reality isn't far off. It's tense it's panic inducing it's frantic...and sometimes when things don't go quite how you planned it's hilarious. In short it's emotional. It makes me want to puke but sometimes in a good way the game intended hence my "Mom's Spaghetti" award nominee.At the moment it's a solid buy for anyone with an itch for some fast paced eccentric multiplayer action with better balance practices it could be a safe bet for anyone full stop. (PLEASE NERF FREDDY AND LEATHERFACE GUYS. THIS ISN'T FUNNY ANYMORE.)
title: Dead by Daylight

review: The game is entertaining and definetly worth playing.My major complaint is In this game you have a ranking system which is based off of something called pips. You need roughly 13000 blood points to be able to pip or rank up. Lately its been rather aggrevating to attempt to pip. A killer starts a game and just leaves every time that occurs you lose a pip. Alone in the last hour I depipped 3 times from a killer leaving the game. Which for some reason this game penalizes the survivor. This problem has existed for the longest time and has not been fixed. Its annoying to see anywhere from an hour to an hour in a half of games just dissappear because a person decides to leave the game. It pretty much undid my progress and it begs to ask the question of why I am playing this game if Im going to be penalized because the host disconnects or leaves the game.

review: Epic game...perfect envisioning of a horror movie.Pros Even with one kill you still win the game as a Killer. Easy point and level up system. Exhilirating music and ambience brings the atmosphere to a complete head. Each killer character's design is well done and believable.Cons Non destructible environments cause survivors to run in loops making it impossible to catch literally. Few Abilities and skills to really change each match or how it plays out. Little Customization options No sprint ability unless you are the Hillbilly.What I'd like to see Destroyable walls/ledges to end the eternal looping from survivors. More Characters Weapons Costumes and Abilities. More traps that maybe the survivors could set to hinder the movement of the killers. The ability to shut off or damage generators for longer games.All in all I still enjoy it. I primarily play as a Killer and even if 3/4 get away ultra satisfying to hook that 1.7.5/10
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Dead by daylight is a popular assymetric multiplayer survival horror game. Each match is played with up to 5 people 4 survivors and 1 killer. Survivors go around the procedurally generated map searching for generators to fix (there are up to 7 generators spawning in each game at random locations 2 more generators than there are players in game). Killer patrols the map trying to prevent survivors from fixing enough generators to power up exit doors. Killer can hit survivors with his/her melee weapon to injure survivors or put them into dying state if already injured. Dying survivors can be picked up and carried to sacrificial meat hooks. Hooking up survivors is the primary goal of the killer in order to win the game. Fixing enough generators while evading the killer and then escaping through the powered up exit gate is the main goal of the survivor team. Both survivors and killers have a complex leveling system utilizing bloodpoints earned during the game to purchase perks items addons for said items and offerings which can be used to alter a single match in some way ranging from increasing chances of being sent to certain map to allowing the killer to kill survivors by his/her own hands. Game is very entertaining to play from both the killer and the survivor perspective. Killer gameplay provides a nice stress relief after a hard day's work as you get to hunt down some players running scared from you (unless they are much more experienced than you are). Survivor game play provides a more difficult but ultimately more rewarding experience where you can either cooperate with other players to complete mutual objective or play selfishly in order to secure your own escape.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: So this is an update to my previous review. I have about 30 hours on record. Have 1 Survivor sitting at Level 31 only made it to rank 19 as a survivor but have a more firm understanding of the ins and outs of the game (I'm just not amazing at it) So here is my breakdown of the Good Bad and Ugly Good Game is super easy to learn and play. No steep learning curve (Good for us old guys) Graphics and level of detail is on par with some of the top line games. Ability to play with friends has been added so you can enjoy surviving with or killing off your friends. Leveling up system is unique from most games where you use points you've earned from games to collect items on a "Blood Web". These items are perks or items that are used for your killer or suvivor in future games. Once all items from the Level 1 "Blood Web" are collected you become level 2 and a new "Blood Web" appears and so on and so forth. Each Survivor and Killer is leveled up individually. Killers are fairly balanced across the board. Although the person playing the Killer can make the game not fun through camping bodies on the hook or placing traps under the feet so the rescuing survivor has no chance at rescuing. Everyone knows the rule if the Killer is camping the bodies everyone run for the other engines to get them running. But for the person on the hook it makes for a very boring and frustrating game.Bad The player base tends to lean more on the unfriendly side giving it that League of Legends community feel to it (Name calling before the game foul language cursing at each other talking crap after a match etc.). (Some may consider this good or bad) The ranking up system is very difficult and tedious and im not sure the ranking system has any major effects aside from bragging rights. The ranking system works on bloodpoints earned in a match and you are ranked seperately as a Killer and Survivor. The way the system works is this Your earned bloodpoints are calculated at the end of a match which fills a meter with 3 "diamonds" along it (checkpoints in essence). The first "diamond" is black. If you get enough blood points to reach this point you don't gain or lose any rank marks. The 2nd and 3rd "diamonds" are white. If you earn enough points in a match to reach them you will fill 1 or 2 empty rank circles respectively. You have to fill all 3 circles to reach the next highest rank 20 &gt 19 &gt 18 &gt etc etc. Most match wins will get you high enough to reach the first lit "diamond" filling 1 rank circle and meaning you will have to win 3 times in a row to rank up 1 time (Sounds easier then it is). If you don't win (and you die pretty early in the match normally you won't even reach the first black "diamond" which means you lose 1 filled circle from your rank (if you had any). If you were rank 19 with no circles filled you move back to 20 with 2 filled circles. So as you can see you need to continuously win or at least score enough points in a match to not lose any rank. So to those guys who are rank 1 congrats because its extremely difficult to do. I can say personally my survivor was level 31 before i each reached rank 19.Ugly The queing system is incredibly unstable. You might be fine getting in a game for 5 games but then the next few games you'll keep getting "Failed to Join Server" messages. "Failed to Join Server" messages appear quite often and it means the game has frozen on you. The only fix is to close the game through your Task Manager and reload the game to try to requeue taking the chance that the same thing happens again. During Survive with Friends you occasionally find yourself having 3 5 Min queue wait times (For what reason I don't know). Once in a game if any player doesn't "Ready" you will be stuck on a long loading screen and you will either have to wait it out (Approx 2 3 min) or you have to close out the game again through the Task Manager. (This happens quite often). The reason for this is that a player has just dropped from the game and the game has to wait for him/her to timeout and you are now without 1 (or more) survivors in a match. With teamwork being an essential part of being able to win against a Killer losing anyone from a game can make it a lot more difficult. Losing 1 person is still doable but 2 or all 3 more makes it nearly impossible. Most just drop from the game and requeue for another match.Overall this is a fun game to play. As you can see there are very frustating things with the game that need to be tweaked to make the game perfect but if you are looking for something fun and simple to play with friends or even with random strangers this is the game for you.Rated 8/10.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Ok first thing is first i dont write reviews often but when i do its cause the game makes me my pants!xDI will tell you about my favorite match on here.I joined into a lobby all the guys all playing good characters and werent too low of levels so i stayed.Once we were in the match we were intantly getting slaughtered like pigs.The killer was playing as the hillbilly(chainsaw guy).He had goten one of my teamates down and onto a hook .Being the nice guy that i am i saved that asshat.I did not know he was an asshat at the time so i saved him.The killer decided to chase after me not him.The killer one shot me with his chainsaw and just left me on the ground to bleed out.At this point in time i was still up it was before i saved the kid He went and killed another kid leaving him to bleed out on the ground.When i got down it was maybe 45 seconds after the other nice gent.Ok lets go forward to where i was at in the story The asshat kept going for the generators even though we were down.This selfish kid escaped by himself and left us two to die.after that i realized oh im gonna loose my rank cause i just ranked up.Then the kid started to spin in circles signaling me to go to him so i started my way to him as soon as i got there he bled out.But that kid saved my Where he was was the hatch and i was the last player alive i had maybe 10 seconds of life left in me then i heard the killer's terrror signal growing.So i was dragging my bloody fat body towards the hatch slow as right as he came up behind me i jumped into the mother ing hatch!11/10 would crawl my fatass into a random hatch to excape a crazy chainsaw killer again.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: 90 % of all Killers camp next to the hook. With this "press space in the right moment" mini games it gets nearly impossible for the other survivers to get a generator running while the killer is camping. Thats extremly stupid and way op on the killer side. Maps are really small and you got almost 0 options to slow down the killer.Edit After playing some more I think its not that bad. You just have to give up the thought that everybody can survive. While the Killer gets one and camps at the meathook you and the others can go and repair generators. With decent team you get 3 before the first one is dead. Then you go and fix the others if he catches one and camps again go and fix 2 more. Thats often all you need and then one goes and opens the gate while the other tries to bait the Killer. So most games you get 2 people at least outand even if the last 2 ones open 2 diffenrent gates one will survive

review: Sadistic Simulator 2017. Although this game is quite unpolished you can see the developers are actually working quite hard to make this game better even today! With the recent patch 1.5 changes it's quite obvious they're working hard to balance/fix as much as they can for us. And for a 21.99$ game that offers what it does I do not regret my purchase! If you're into games such as White Noise Deceit the upcoming Friday the 13th game or hell even Depth I'd recommend adding this one to your collection! Pros Lots of Killers with various gameplay styles &amp lots of Survivors (with customizable clothing). Lots of perks items and offerings for your Survivor/Killer (that are being actively balanced). 4 or 5 maps + randomly generated chests hooks and generators. Matchmaking + Ranking System. Survive with Friends. Can gives you thrills playing both killer &amp survivor.Cons Finding a game can take a while. Players disconnecting to save their ranks Peer to Peer (killer always hosts which can lead to them disconnecting when they know they're going to lose). Slight balance issues for certain perks/items (being worked on actively by developers). Odd bugs here and there but not often. Facecamping Trappers (they removed traps under hooks). Trolls of any kind (both killers and survivors). I've had a survivor spam the rescue button when I was on a hook so no one else could rescue me... Then let me die.I always wondered why I kept coming back to this game but I think I nailed it... The thrill you get when you're running from the killer or when you fill every hook in the basement with a body... That feeling of pure sadism coursing through your body... It's nice.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: This is a very solid game. I used to play it when it came out and I stopped after awhile because it kept bugging out and caused me to have to restart over and over and trying to play with friends was horrid. I recently came back and all of those problems are fixed. I can't play anything other than this because I'm so addicted to it now. The dlc's are worth it if you like to play killer and dope survivor outfits. My only advice is to remember the point of the game and don't get upset because a killer decides to actually kill you rather than play around and point farm with you.ALSO some people complain about wait times in this game. If you play killer it's not a huge issue however I'm a survivor. Just for a quick tip I play on US Dallas during the day and then at about 12 30 1 00 a.m. I'll switch my steam download settings to Canada Toronto and get insta queues almost always. They have a lot of killers. Happy hunting! (Or escaping)
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Dead by Daylight is a multiplayer only 3rd person "horror" game where one player takes control of a killer and hunts the other four survivors.The game has great sound design and the devs are always updating it... and thats about it when it comes to positives. The devs (although they work hard) always seem to be heavly on the side of survivors with them getting crutches in the form of torches that can blind the killer in litrally 0.5 of a second and perks which absolutely blow almost everything the killer has out of the water.The survivors also do something known as looping. You can probably guess what it involves by the name the survivors run around objects with a pallet in the in the center and due to the diffrence in speed between the killer and survivor it can take up to three loops of the object for the killer to catch the survivor. But it doesn't matter anyway because the pallet in the center can be dropped onto the killer stunning him for about 2 seconds giving the survivor enough time to run away and locate another loop location. when I first saw this I felt like I gained a stress induces aneurysm and also thought that it must be an exploit. But apparantly this is "part of the game" which I would be fine with if it weren't for the fact that it can cause chases last up to 5 minutes sometimes more.For proof of the imbalance I recently purchased the Nightmare on Elm Street dlc which had the new killer Freddy Kruger (I got too tempted). Who I thought was a good unique and well balenced killer only to have him nerfed two weeks later because survivors complained about him being overpowered. Even though due to his ability survivors can do things like litrally run up to a hook and unhook someone right in front of him an he can't do so basically the devs took my money then gave me the finger. Unless you enjoy playing as a survivor and the killer off (or playing as killer and getting off) I can't recommend yet.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: UPDATE 12 May 2017Following on from my previous review (remains below) I am pleased that the developers have addressed many of the bugs with the process of the game. The majority of matches now launch without issue and for several weeks I haven't had to kill the game process in order to play.With that said the game itself is fantastic. It's entirely objective based. There is no way to avoid the objectives and this leads to teamwork in 9/10 matches. The changes being brought to the game sometimes don't sit well with me but they are balance fixes and so it is perfectly valid I may not agree with all of them. Many changes they make improve the gameplay and negate cheese tactics. Just recently they changed the game to prevent the Trapper (a killer) from placing his traps underneath hooks. They also made it so that hooks which have been sabotaged respawn.As someone who plays survivor almost exclusively I agree with one of them as it is beneficial for me but I completely respect their decision on both of them I can only imagine the frustration that killers must go through when they only have a small set of hooks left which could be located on the other side of the map.How would I compare this to other games on the market? It's become one of my most played. It's fun for the sake of being fun. There's progression but it isn't such that you NEED to be a high level to be able to compete. It's beneficial but even a completely new player could jump in and have a chance of winning.** ORIGINAL REVIEW BELOW **The massive bugs with failed match loading and being stuck unable to join a lobby or go back to the main screen let down what would otherwise be a fantastic game. I should not have to force close the game down 4/6 times I attempt to play a match.Get it fixed developers or I'll be blacklisting your future games when it comes to considering purchases.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: I recently played this while it was free on steam and here are some thoughts and issues. When you first begin to play as a survivor you can expect to get reckted the first few rounds. There is really nothing letting you know what to do. The killer will seem horribly overpowered at first. I found that they are not as overpowered as it seems. While they don't have to hit you many times and it seems that they are right on your tail if you can run randomly and get over obstacles than you have a chance to escape. This game does have some scares. I was playing with a friend and we were fixing the generator than all of a sudden the killer that turns invisible was right next to both of us. Scared the living out of us. It was very fun and winning is very doable once you get the hang of it and play with people that are not level 1. The game does have some issues though. playing with a friend can be a bad experience. Multiplayer is fine very badly. My friend and I would have to back out of every gane and reinvite to continue the party. This is something that with most AAA titles would be seen as unacceptable. Also the game will let you click ready when you are already searching for a game which leads to a bug that stops the game search and will not allow anyone in the party to do anything. This leads to having to relog the client to continue play. Items you get are notated as having uses. In actuality it is more like having a certain amount of usable seconds instead of uses. This could be explained more or reworded maybe. certain aspects of the game seem unexplained. Does startling crows alert that spot to the killer? It is entirely way to difficult to wiggle your way out of the attackers arms. With one execption. Of the survivors have diasbked hooks and the killer can only use the basement than it is easy to escape because the killer may have to walk for like 2 mins just to get to the basement. I would almost consider buying this if some things were fixed. It seems great. I enjoyed the few hours I got to play it. The blood web system was awesome but can be worked on. The overall concept is great. The experience can be generally scary. Everyone who has watched a scary movie and thought man I would hide in the closet what is that stupid idiot doing hiding under the table you kind of have the opportunity to do that somewhat here. It is scary and to run away from the killer and not even be able to see them. Really enjoyed the experience. I hope it has more free play time soon.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: TL DR the game is good and I'd be happy to recommend it.It's a great game fun to play and the concept is awesome although it has its issues.I do genuinely get scared and feel like my heart is pounding at times playing this game and the race to the door after the generators are done is thrilling to say the least. Generally speaking the DbD community is pretty nice to boot although there is a lot of killer survivor etiquette that needs to be learned before you stop getting spammed in the after match chat. In essence be nice and play fairly and you'll be met by a community who chats nicely and plays fairly.Conceptually it's a genius game One killer four survivors five generators and two doors mean that all in all there's a 50% chance for either party to win when paired up against people of equal skill level. Furthermore the map layout aids to chases and near misses that could be used as the inspiration for Hollywood horror movies. If a spectator could freecam it really would be cinematic at times.The balance of the game between killer and survivors is ridiculously out in some cases.The nurse is the most well balanced killer and possibly the most fun to play as her strong powers are well countered with the stun periods.Hillbilly is also pretty well balanced easier to play as and I don't hear anyone complaining in chat about going against him.It seems like a de facto part of the game that the Trapper will place a trap under any survivor on a hook. How this hasn't been axed yet is frustrating it just seems unfair and makes for a tediously linear game once you know you're playing the Trapper. The better trappers in the world hide traps in places a survivor might step a fair fete requiring forethought and skill.No comment on the Hag I think she's well balanced but I haven't played against her that much.Mike Myers is a different story. Completely overpowered and a pain in the to play against. Losing as Myers requires a complete and utter lack of skill in video games. If I were to list my frustrations against him I wouldn't be able to finish the review.The etiquette side of things boils pretty much down to these simple rules As a killer Sticking on a hooked survivor without even looking away (facecamping) is totally unacceptable unless that survivor got caught sabotaging a hook. Coincidentally this renders the hard earned perk Saboteur almost useless.Camping hooked survivors (running around the area of the hook and staying within hearing distance of anyone bold enough to unhook that survivor) is unacceptable and lacks skill.Relentlessly chasing a single survivor and actively ignoring the others is poor sport give them a break and chase the guy you just ran past instead.As a survivor Sabotaging the killer's hooks. Although this requires some skill daring and patience the DbD population looks down on you for this. The perk sabotage and toolboxes are useless because of this unless you can justify it against a camping killer.That's pretty much it.In all the game is an excellent survival thriller. Happy to reccommend )
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Dead by Daylight has so far been a point for so many arguments it's hard to count them. However despite everything people might say it's still a super fun game to play. If you're a chill person that mostly play games for fun you will enjoy it very much especially while you're being a low rank player cause that's where all the nice people at. The more you grow rank wise the more toxic people you meet on your way. Both killers and survivors abusing some game mechanics in their favor to make your lower point hurt with pain. But! That's not the game's fault but the community's! The whole idea of the game is so epic and fun that you wanna come back and play more and more. Game devs keep working on it releasing new DLC's patches fixing bugs and improving the quality of the game in general which is very admirable in my eyes. All in all get the game play it and enjoy!!
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Very Fun Amazing and Addictive Game. Worth a buy. Dead by Daylight executes the concept of a competitive horror game well but only to a point. As players become more familiar with both roles the horror dissipates and they begin to play for the competitive element alone. The poor matchmaking and the highly exploitable scoring system make Dead by Daylight less competitive than it should be resulting in gameplay which doesn't resemble the horror experience it sets out to be. Overall it is a great game though.

review: I end up playing Dead by Daylight often with my friends. It s a great game that you can either play alone or with friends. No voice communication but there is a messaging system when in lobbies. Matches are hosted by the killer and you face them with four survivors. There are a handful of free survivors and killers but like every game there is DLC. It s a great sorta jump scare/horror game to play cause killers can be crafty.Some advice Play as both survivor and killer. If you are playing solo start as a killer. You learn some basics on how people are spotted and learn how the camera angles are important. If you are still shy of playing there was a free weekend not too long ago from when I posted this. Put the game on your wishlist and wait for either the free weekend or for it to go on sale. FYI it never goes for more than about 40% off.

review: The TL DR Version This game is AMAZING worth far more than its price for its insane replayability but needs dedicated servers to prevent Killer tampering issues and some ****MINOR**** balancing issues.So personal overview I got this game because a really good friend of mine had raved about how much fun it was and how much he liked the concept. I did my research read reviews watched gameplay and although it was all mostly positive it did NO JUSTICE to how much fun this game is. Even when really stupid things happen and I have to take a break from it for a day I still get super excited to come back to it. PROS The Killer is a real player. So are your allies. Objective Diversity is great (I'll go into that later.) Character Diversity and Balance are relatively refreshing. Real Terror. A Horror Game where you can play as the terror. The Game gets better and more replayable with experience.CONS The Killer hosts the game so lag and lag switchs are a big problem (for now) Some unique character perks are pretty bad. (I'm looking at you Dwight.) Some perks are broken/do not work. (I'm looking at you Iron Will.) As the game is in its early stages some glitches are still pretty bad. (I'll go into that too.) Useless item Flashlight. (I'll mention why) Matchmaking system needs some work but is "aight." (Worth the wait tbh.) Killers are often pretty rude. (Not a proble mwith the product though! I'll mention this.)Ok so things about the game that are really important to know before getting into it in a little more depth The objective diversity can be different depending on the player killer and how you feel.The primary objective of the game is to get generators done and escape without dying but there's also the role of sabotage and plundering. Sometimes you'll have someone who will spend the game destroying hooks so that the killer can't actually kill you without a special item or getting you in the perfect situation (under perfect circumstances for the sabotaging player) and you may make your primary objective finding the chests around the map to leave with a new item and focus on finding the trap door instead of working as a team. This is a selfish victory but you get a lot of points for it. Every game you'll find a different mix of 4 players picking one of those three primary roles. You'll also find the altrusitic player who's entire role is getting ready to save people from hooks but that role can go with any of the previous 3.So onto the most annoying issue with the game. Killers host every game. There are no dedicated servers (yet?). So when a Killer wants to use a lag switch or anything like that it's REALLY easy. It'll always be super obvious and you can try to report them but they still ruin a match and lower your rank. Also cheating aside some killers are just SUPPER laggy. You can have the craziest most amazing connection but a killer's connection will get you stuck on a window for 30 seconds while they hit you twise really easily and put you on a hook while your frame is still on a window. Since timing is everything when escaping a Killer you need a reliable connection and the lag does not effect the killer nearly as dramatically as it effects the player so you'll find that the killer benefits from lagging while you crash and burn and lose rank. ( This problem however could be easily fixed by dedicated servers so we can cross our fingers this gets taken care of before too long and thus does not ruin the game.So onto glitches. There arent all that many but the few existing glitches are pretty rough. The worst of which is that some games you'll pop in without any of your perks and you'll be able to see your item going up your arm instead of in your hand and you can not use it. Thankfully if you put your item in a chest and pick it up again it will function and not just get deleted when you escape but you will still have to function without perks. That's the worst of the glitches the others are very minimal like Killers phasing through objects thrown down but that problem isnt too huge since they still get stunned and it doesnt completely screw you over(most times).As a whole items are actually really balanced and great. The most stupid ridiculously powerful item the Skeleton Key is incredibly rare and therefore not too much of an issue while the Toolbox Medkit and Map serve their purposes PERFECTLY in a balanced manor. However the flashlight is a completely useless item. You can stun the killer if you shine it in their eyes for at least 5 constant seconds. The only problem with that is that you have to be pretty close to the killer to do it and he can just down you in that time or look in another direction and down you without any problem. The purpose of the flashlight is for multiple people to use it at the same time but there is not enough of a communication system in the game for that to be in any way functional so it's just a useless item.All the nasty bits put out to dry for everyone to see the game is actually still absolutely incredible. Everything that's wrong with it right now will probably be fixed and the game will be crazy wonderful from that point on. A lot of issues like these in most games are problems with the premise or concept of the game and aren't nearly as fixable as the issues with this game.With the glitches I give the game a solid 8/10Without it s without a doubt a solid 10/10.I would with no doubt or hesitation reccomend this game to anyone who could remotely appreciate a good survival horror game.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Product received for free. Great game. It has such a simple systematic behind it still it's very complex.Every session is different depending on which people are playing. It gets you involved with other players to the degree you decide. It's not a decision of letting a character die or not but a decision of getting out alive or helping someone having a more rewarding session(to name one). This is boostet with a clever xp system. So it puts you right on the edge where it's a tough decision.Didn't have this much real fun in a game in a long time.I understand the negative reviews. It's frustrating if you buy a claimed finished game and it's broken all the time. A finished game that's full of bugs and stuff is a real pain in the a**. And it borders to a scam that its not "early access". And some bugs really destroy the experience but I think it s getting better. Wouldn't give a positive feedback if it wasn't.But for the moment it s at least a fun game to play with friends. I cought myself smiling while playing it. It's really really fun...when it works.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: As of 8 25 this game is great if you want to play solo or kill your friends. The game is incredibly fun and the bloodweb(skilltree) is diverse and keeps you wanting to play one more game.The Survive with Friends mode is broken though. The way it's set up now when a killer decides to look for a game a lobby is created for them and the any group of survivors that start looking for a killer *after* the killer's lobby was created has a chance of getting into that lobby. If they dont get into that lobby the survivors are booted back to their pre lobby and forced to ready up and start searching again.The more people in your survivor group the harder it is to get into a killer's lobby since someone playing survivor solo can be put into an empty killer's lobby thus removing them from the list of available killers for a 4 person group. Resulting in the survivors having to press "Ready" and search for matches many many many times before getting lucky enough to get into a killer's lobby as soon as it's created.Once the survivors ready up they should be put into a queue where other survivors are matched to them until there are 4. Then the 4 person group is placed into a queue where any killers that want to play are matched to the 4 person group at the top of the queue.That way no one has to constantly click "Ready" and players will be efficiently matched.Other than the Survive with Friends matchmaking everything is GREAT love this game and will continue to play it. It's incredibly funny to play and even spectate friends.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Product received for free. I understand that some people are disappointed by the community and the bugs the games has but take in consideration that the devs are doing their best to improve all the black dots in this game. Let me tell you that this game is not bad. The community makes it bad.1. When I first had Dead by daylight in my hands (Console back then) I fell in love with the game and I couldn't stop playing. There are a lot of survivors and killers. 4 survivors and 1 killer in a random map. You must complete all 5 generators to open the gate and escape from the killer. Of course it won't be easy. It's entertaining but people sometimes can be harsh for stupid reasons and we are gonna talk about that in the next paragraph.2. People. YES there are salty people like in ALL games out there. you will with no doubt encounter a salty premade or killer. The salty killer is not offensive but survivors are mostly. They bodyblock you just because ''They didn't have a good day'' or basically just because they are grumpy and want to bring misery to others. I don't understand the people that doesn't like to play for fun. One thing for sure is that you can't complain about the community to the developers. It's not on their hands. Why? because it's not that easy to wipe out these salty pimples. They are like mites stuck in a dogs furr. 3. The game itself is REALLY entertaining and VERY funny. The people are just idiots (if you excuse my language) I dont hate the game but I do dislike the specific ''I am so proud of myself'' kind of people. They blame you for every mistake they make and they get away with it. Ignore these pimples and enjoy playing with friends trust me. Now this ''TUNNELER YOU F**** S***'' and this ''CAMPER PIECE OF GARBAGE'' and this '' HACKER MOTHEF*****'' is everywhere D but ignore it.4. If you dislike repetitive games then this is not your game. People argue about it being the same over and over but the point is surviving from a killer and that's all. killers will be added every year survivors as well with different mechanics. The game will evolve. Just be patient. Bugs show up and then vanish it's normal for a game. All online games has it. Give the developers a moment to breath because they can't fix things that fast and easy. Find some cool friends in steam and play together if you think that other players are dumb easy. Buy the game It's very good and I recommend it. )
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Heya First This is a fully released game. No early access. Keep that in mind.I really like this game I do. The idea and the gameplay as intended is compelling.It is what evolve should've been. And a lot of the reviews that complain about long lobby waiting times are literally jack sh*t. They only wait so long because they absolutely want to play survivors. Since this is a p2p connection game the killer hosts the game. So if there are 20.000 survisors and only 100 killers in the queue the survivors will have to either wait or switch to killer. I play the kiler mostly and my games are full and running in under 3 minutes.BUT why I gave it a thumbs down has the following reasons Matchmaking sucks. No really. You cannot see the rank of your opponents (I guess due to the reason that the devs rather wanted to mask the bug than to fix it). I mostly run against survivors where I can exactly tell that they are a lot higher level than me (by the items they carry or the perks they have). That is a big no no in my book.Second big reason Spawn is a . You can easily spawn in the game with the killer's breath down your neck already.Another big no no No mouse settings. You will not be able to adjust your mouse acceleration/sensitivity in this game. Unless you have a mouse (like me) that has buttons for the dpi you are f*cked. Who the hell releases a PC game with no mouse settings?And on the long run playing as the killer is no fun since you have to deal with rank 1 survivors taunting you after a game as a rank 18 killer due to the sh*tty match making system. Problem here is There is no real reason to play the killer. You are already in a big disadvantage. There is no incentive. You p*ss off all the killers there will be no more games since they are the p2p hosts.EDIT Oh and as far as the free items (due to having left4dead2 etc) are concerned Don't bother. They are not usable in your steam inventory. Greyed out items with no options. No way to activate them.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: I really enjoy playing this Although the community has died down a bit but that isn't a bad thing it was mostly the super salty and exploitatious part of the community so it got better I love playing this and will continue to do so I have not run into any of these "bugs" as of yet so I have no opinion on the current "problems" with the game others seem to be having I have a feeling these people calling it buggy and glitchy may also be apart of the salt survivor/ killer crowd that has decided to leave the game because the developers decided to balance the survivors and killers to a point where it is fair for both sides where in realit they want one side better than the other. But I give this game an 8/10 I highly recommend it and at the time of this review it is on sale 40% off so super worth buying if you don't like it then utilize the steam refund before you play it for 2 hours see how you like it.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Is this worth $19.99? If you answer Eight/8 of the Twelve/12 statements with Y/Yes it is. )#1 I enjoy Hide and Seek. Y/N#2 I'm a team player. Y/N#3 I'm comfortable with playing against much higher experienced players. Y/N#4 I can calmly deal with unfair advantages that do not rule in my favor at times. Y/N#5 I'm okay with waiting for long spanses of time to find a game. Y/N#6 I can function efficiently under high stress. Y/N#7 I'm okay with having limited options. (customization items characters etc.) Y/N#8 It's difficult to frustrate me. Y/N#9 I'm not patient enough to wait for a sale. Y/N#10 I'm a good sport when it comes to losing. Y/N#11 I'm okay with getting kicked from games time to time unexpectedly. Y/N#12 I enjoy unique games. Y/NIf you answered 8 of the 12 with YES then you can be nearly certain this game will satisfy for $19.99.A quick side note Latency issues can sometimes take away from the game but not all too often. Typing 1 and pressing enter repeatedly while watching how quickly the text appears in the lobby chat will give you an idea of how delayed some elements of the game will be. DLastly disconnectors are a cancer in this game. Not too common but common enough to be an annoyance. Still it is an enjoyable game.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: This game for what it's worth is pretty fun at first but after a while it's just a bor cause you have to deal with network error's getting disconnected from matches with a bug that endlessly looks for a game then you have to alt+tab then quit the game that way. this game is really fun with friends if you decide to do a private or public match but other then that there is really not much holding this game together apart from people who enjoy camping someone on a hook friends playing together and of course DLC. The game needs to punish campers since no one likes to sit on a hook for the whole game or part of the game waiting for the killer to leave and give a fair escape and some of the killer do feel OP for example MM feels faster then any other killer (him and granny are fast hard to give a 1st or 2nd on there speed) anyway's there is no way to counter any killer it's pretty much hide and seek with an objective. But is this game woth buying i'd say save your money unless this is on sale for a great price it has weak gameplay to me at least

As for some of the killers I wish they would be nerfed. The doctor's most frustrating to combat and avoid as his ability can go through walls. There are many other problems that are in the game but that doesn't stop it from being fun. I'd say 7/10.

review: The Howling Grounds update proved to me that the developers shouldn't be trusted. So while I enjoy watching the people play this game I hate actually playing it myself. Here's what it's like playing this game go to lobby pray for good ping or back out of lobby and try to find one with decent ping next ready up and hope everyone else readies up as well or wait for a minute get to loading screen and there's a 1/3 chance (roughly out of 123 games 42 were with one DC) that someone DCs in the loading screen if it's you you win by losing any item or offering you put into the match. Fun right? After waiting for 20 minutes you get in game and play rinse and repeat with a mixture of campers s and idiots (most people playing between rank 20 10) who'll get you killed unless you're SWF scum. So for now I'm done. I might return but I doubt I'll edit this review. (The only reason I will change my recommendation is if the final two suggestions are taken and/ or enough key members of the development team are fired and updates thereafter show a new approach to balancing the game.)Two things before I'll make a serious return to DBD Servers I'm sick and tired of P2P and all the t it entails. Second remove teachables or at least making certain perks only usable with certain characters I have come back and playing has been a mixed bag in terms of teams it seems to have reliable chance of winning you have to play with friends but that only means it's more challenging to rank up. So all in all give it a go. See how far down the rabbit hole you can go. (This was written right after the Myer's update) This game has huge balancing issues the devs have decided to change the game to make it nearly impossible for new players to play with any success as a survivor. I no longer recommend this game until the devs can make the chasing mechanics a bit more fair giving the survivor a greater chance of surviving because as of now if you're spotted you're screwed unless you play this game religiously as survivor and grind out your ranks as Micaheal Myers. Here are my criteria for this to be a fun game again Killers should average about 2.3 kills a game the reason I think this is fair is because the average survivor will be able to get about the same number of points this way. While also giving the killer a more difficult game to play it would be relatively balanced when we see those numbers for the majority. They've screwed up windows and are consistently making camping more appealing despite saying that it's an unfun style of play. They've refused to give survivors anything in the last several patches and show no signs of truly wanting to make it more fun for the survivors. They took away "generator rushing" aka punishing campers they took away windows and aren't listening to the survivor mains at all. So... Until this changes I'm not playing Dead by Daylight and I refuse to recommend it. Instead I'll be waiting for "Last Year" hoping to see a more balanced game.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: EDIT 2 5/16/17 Because I think this game is great and I really enjoy it I want to update my review as the game changes. Currently I feel I can recommend the game again because of the new update. While I feel the new killer is a bit too strong I am also pretty low level and I dont have a lot of the good perks so he just feels pretty oppressive.DBD's developers seemed to have fixed the matchmaking at least a good bit. As before if you play solo you get a game instantly with no issues. But before this update with 2 people you may wait for a bit and with 3 4 people you usually cant get a game. Now with the new update games are pretty instant or fast with 2 people and with 3 people you will get games but sometimes you have to reset the matchmaker. With a full party of survivors however you still cannot get a game a lot of th e time. Which is really sad because I love to play this with a group of friends. I will be changing the recommendation however because they at least fixed a majority of issues. I hope they completely fix match making and some of the few bugs in the game. Currently 7/10EDIT After a lot of frustration with the current state of the game I have to say that I no longer recommend this game. Balancing with the killers can be annoying but the largest issue I have with this game is the broken party system. If you que for a game solo as a killer or survivor you get an instant game. But the moment I add even one friend in a lobby and que we sit there for at least 20 minutes if not more. And if you make a full 4 man lobby and just need a killer you will never find a game. I have searched for a game for an hour and a half and could not find a game. Everywhere I search people just tell me that the game just prioritizes the solo que and party que is lucky to find a match. This makes me very upset since my friends and I like to sit down after work and get some games in but never can and instead just waste our entire afternoon trying to find a single game. This combined with the bugs and balancing issues makes me unable to recommend this game. I like this game but it is trying its hardest to make me hate it.ORIGINAL REVIEW This game is a pretty awesome game but does have its flaws. Its basically a deadly hide and go seek where a team of survivors try and activate 5 generators and then a door to get out. If you are the last one left and your team powered 2 generators then you can escape via the trap door if you can find it. All the survivors do good stuff though if no one in the survivor party took a perk or item to destroy hooks it feels like there are far too many hooks in the game.The killers are fun but I do believe the two dlc killers are a little strong Myers is the obvious one. You can stalk to get a stack and once you have that you have great passive stats to go wreck and can slowly build up your next stack to unleash a moment of instant downing. The swamp woman is pretty good but she makes it where once she gets someone hooked that person is gone. With the ability she has she can just put her item down by the hook and just teleport back to the hook and get multiple hits in. At least with the trapper he has to stay near the area to try and get you if you stepped on his trap. Though you could cleanse the area but you need to be quick about it.My only major issue with this game is the matchmaking. This game is fantastic to play with friends and go as a party of survivors. The problem is when you search for a game you will wait literally an hour to find a game if that. But when I play on my own I can get games back to back and it just doesnt seem right. When I play solo I usually play as the killer and want to play survivors when I have friends around. Its kind of hard to convince your friends to sit there for an hour and wait for a match though. At least we can play custom games but you cant level up and so none of us progress.I give this game 4/5 because of its dlc killers being a little strong and because of the matchmaking issues. I would give it a 3.5 but I feel as long as the devs balance the killers the game will be in a great state.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Product received for free. I got this game for free and I started playing it because I was going to join the team as a designer.I've played it for about 15 hours (I left it on longer than that so Steam thinks it's more like 21) and I have to say I like it quite a lot. I really like asymmetric games and this is VERY asymmetric. The Killer is first person while the Survivors are third person. The rules and goals for the two sides are also very different.The presentation is consistently grim and oppressive as it should be. It feels like the team did their research on horror films and how to convey the proper atmosphere for the subject matter.I am very much looking forward to working on this game to make it even better than it already is.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Dead by Daylight is a 4v1 survival "horror" game. With many elements in the mix. If you want a terrifying game to play with friends you've come to the wrong place. After a while all the killers lose their scare and just become an obstical to overcome. The only killer that can geniunely startle me now is The Shape (aka Micheal Myers) due to him not having a terror radius.That being said Dead by Daylight is still a good game and an amazing time waster well worth its pricing. The devs have made a ton of progress since they started and the game has come a long ways.DLC Sadly if you wish to become the best of the best you're gonna need to buy the DLC. Killers like The Cannibal and The Hag have perks almost required to survive the upper tiers. If you are a casual player it's not that big of a deal as many of the survivors and killers you'll be facing are in a similar skill level as yourself.Rankings The ranking system has improved greatly since they changed it sadly if you are Tier 1 potential you wont find a lobby. The future With a massive update and balances on the horizon there is a lot to look forward to. There are public betas where anyone can try playing as new killers and survivors so we can all colectively yell at Behaviour for having something that doesn't work.

review: Product received for free. This game isn't mean scary all the time but instead of that it is very frustrating. Dead by Daylight has many issues like No servers Weird hitboxes/ glitches. Sometimes you will be around a corner and a killer will literally leap 6230 metres towards you. This many come at a disagreement but I as a survivor do not like this. My hours spent on this game feel like its been kinda worth it because I get to feel the rush of excitement and being squirmish while getting chased. On the other hand All killers of this game feel very overpowered for no reason. For example Michael Myers. Michael Myers when at lvl 3 (The Evil Within) is faster than a bloody rocket. I really do not like this when I'm doing a generator and this boi literally zooms from point A to B in milliseconds (Exaggeration). I Feel like every killer is op except for the hag. Sad little hag is literally E.T's cousin that's been under shreks for who knows how long.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: How WIN Dead By Daylight as Killer Step 1 Dying Light and proceed to tunnel your obsession.Step 2 If step 1 fails and all 5 generators are completed don't worry No One Escapes Death has got you covered! You can now instant down people. Hook 1 and all the survivors will run to the rescue. Don't forget to camp the survivor on the hook. It's justified because the exit is powered.Step 3 If both steps 1 and 2 aren't working out for you try Make Your Choice as well. This will allow you to camp just outside of the hook terror radius and instantly down what ever survivor unhooked your hard work.Step 4 If all of those steps fail throw on some aura reading like BBQ and Chili. That way when ever you do hook someone you can see everyone on the map. It compliments well with Make Your Choice as it allows you to know that people are near you as you can't see their auras.Pretty easy game you'll have plenty of fun!Survivor?You don't win you just do a little better each time. Goodluck out their soldier.There aren't any tips for you just try and be as toxic as possible. Tbag at every pallet and window you can and make sure you bring a flashlight and Decisive Strike every match.Also play Claudette she's hard to see on darker maps. No it's not racism it's the truth. Get over yourself.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: I enjoy a lot of the things DBD tries to do. It tries to make a very interesting 4 vs 1 game. The problems with it tho are many. Like the fact that the game is divided between survivors and killers. Both want the game to look a certain way and the developers try to make both happy which in turn makes nobody happy. I still play this game occasionally but unless it has some major reworking done I don't think it will have the same size community for much longer. And oh yeah a lot of the community are just the most toxic people.There are good people to tho and when you do have a fun match either as a survivor or a killer it is amazing! I play mainly killer but I can appreciate both sides of the coin and I hope that this game does stick around because even tho its been out for awhile now it still has lots of potential if fixed and handled correctly.

review: Amazing fun and addicting game. Games are fast and there's a good community behind it. An amazingly active 4v1 game something I craved ever since the sh*tshow that was Evolve &amp Evolve Stage Two.A few minor points There are perks in this game that give you a small advantage. The game has been updated mid june 2018 to make sure you at least can choose 1 of the character specific perks but from a certain level you can learn the perk to "teach" to other characters which makes some experienced players have the best perks and thus a huge advantage over a beginner. This is both on survivor and killerside. The time to 'catch up' is way less than it used to be pre june update but it's still a grind to do if you're just starting out. Sometimes automatch puts you in a lobby with a host (killer is always host) and gives you a bad ping clearly showing that this person is nowhere near you. You can leave lobby wait a few seconds and search again but it's a bit tedious to do. If you're not careful you're in a laggy game and that's just no fun for everyoneBut honestly my negative points are nitpicking. You'll get the perks eventually and you need to be careful for joining a server with a good ping just like any other multiplayer game basically. Great game great community!
title: Dead by Daylight

review: The Good Buggs getting cleaned out every month. Strange players that just want to help farm points more than they want to actually win. First DLC is free! Once you are in you are set for at least 10 minutes of play time. 4 diffrent themed maps all with multiple set ups pending on the Hunter. 4 hunters. 5 Survivors. All with there own chain of level ups on the "Blood Web". Very fun once you get into the thick of things.The Bad VERY HARD for new players lot of people are much bigger than you. No level up with your friends. It all has to be done in solo play. Good luck. Camping Hunters Bad team mates. Quiters. (Problem for teams takes points away from hunters and they get no penalty for it.) Dailys that you just can't finish. No in game chat for teams. No main Hosting server (Lag is bassed on the Hunter's connection to you.) Cheaters who use Map Bugs to kill you. New bug game keeps hanging on loading screen. VERY bad optimization. It's been years on the market now and even Friday the 13th runs better than this The characters my looks better the popular named horror heroes and villians look nothing like themselves so why put the names on them? And again if it's this ugly why does it take so much to run this game?In short. You are better off with any other popular horror based game. I even joined in again after years away only to find the lobbys are dead! Do not bother playing unless you have friends to fill in all positions!

review: "Sometimes when I play this bug we find a few games."While I completely recommend this game I will start off with the negatives. The biggest one is that the game is constantly full of bugs. Mostly minor ones like small graphics glitches (I can see inside my arm) or certain actions not going through (press the button and nothing happens). Occassionally they are more difficult ones people falling out of the game etc. It's not too bad learning to play around the bugs then relearning when they fix the old bugs and you get new ones. But certainly not recommended for anyone who gets easily frustrated by bugs and such.The community is a mix of wonderful and toxic on both ends. Salty survivors and killers who break the game (and often both are to their own detriment). The post game chat gets a lot of salt but I feel it can vary. There are some frustrating killers/survivors but also those who are genuinely good and really just want feedback. I've made a few friends this way and often find that it's overwhelmingly neutral or somewhat positive. But for those who are easily upset by toxic communities again this game may not be for you.Finally there's the difficulty in balancing the community. Nerf killers and they're upset. Nerf survivors and the survivors are upset. It's a dififcult balance to make both sides happy especially in the very low or very high tiered ranks.But there's still a lot of good. If you adjust to the bugs the game play is enjoyable and surprisingly not repetitive. Each map is procedurally generated and each game seems to vary greatly. Survive with friends is a fun mode as well. I find it more fun to play with friends in the matches which helps counter a lot of the frustrations mentioned earlier. Also it's interesting to have to balance what game play you want in each match. Some matches punish you for being altruistic while others tend to make it harder to play without saving the other survivors. With all the factors that go into each match it feels like a brand new game each time you play.Overall don't take it too seriously. I'm at best average at the game and really it's just that a game which is meant to be enjoyed. Nothing is truly going to change if you're rank 1 or rank 20. So yes I do recommmend it but again take the whole game with a grain of salt and don't play too seriously and you'll enjoy it a lot more.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: I love Dead by Daylight and I personally enjoy being a survivor. I would be lying if I stated that the game was perfect it's not. My main concern as a survivor is killers that camp. (camping meaning once a killer downs a player or hooks them they stay around the survivor until they die) How am I suppose to "survive" together with other players when some killers suck the joy out of being a survivor? I can't and I'm sure many other players who play as a survivor can't. I suggest fixing this pehaps a penalty for a killer that just stands in one spot for too long. Maybe the killer slows down or can't move at all for a few seconds? I just wish for some penalty for the killers that do this. There's a penalty for vaulting too much through the same window so why not a killer that doesn't give other players the chance to survive? Just a thought. I also suggest you all get rid of peer to peer. A lot of players use lag switching and it's so easy to tell. If the developers are making money I suggest hosting this on your own servers because then you wouldn't have to worry about people lag switching other users. You're going to end up losing the fans you do have becuase of these issues. I paid for this game. Did I get what I paid for? Yes. If you enjoy being a killer and PROPERLY hunting down your prey I suggest this game to you. If you like being on the edge of your seat and running from a killer I suggest this for you too. This game COULD be more ideal and I don't doubt that the developers care about the players so it's worth sticking around and seeing what new things they come up with.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: I love so much this game that hurts me to give it a negative review but I feel it's necessary. &gt Too many quiter hosts and they always quit in the beginning of the game or even in the loading screen. For every game that I play I spend two matches in vain trying to find a room that is going to actually start. And here comes the worst part which I don't even know why it still a thing the offering still being consumed in matches on which the host leaves it's just ridiculous. &gt Ridiculous loading times if someone has a bad PC or something or even if the host quits it can take from 3 to 5 minutes. It's not a problem if everyone have reasonable PCs though. &gt This one doesn't really bother me since I play a lot Age of Empires 2 HD Edition but since I am here throwing the shi* on the fan it might worth a point there's no dedicated servers. For the lay people games with dedicated servers on Multiplayer send the player's data packages to the closest dedicated server from the company itself and from there the server will send these packages to all the players which means your own connection will have any impact on your ping besides of course the geographic location of the server. P2P games however connect the players right in each others machines like a torrent. If someone delays the sending of the data package everyone will lag because everyone is receiving the packages slower. &gt Too many Russians.

review: This game is absolutely horrendous. I mean it's actually really fun. But it's horrendous. Let me explain why..Why's it really fun?The game is fun because the plot and idea of it is just intriguing. It's a small mini game style game that really makes you rethink your surroundings. Gameplay is mildly interesting when it comes to tasks a better way to put it would be 'clever' rather than fun (skill checks). The game so far seems relatively balanced. Of course it may come to the occasional 'wtf' moment but aside from that it's pretty evened out in what Killer's Perks are able to do what and how to counter them etc..The game surrounds the subject in an enclosed arena style map (procedurally generated) included with 3 other survivors and one killer. The Killer's objective to sacrifice all the humans to the 'Entity'. The player's objective escape with all other survivors or on your own by fixing 5 generators or escaping through 'the hatch'. It's a pretty simple idea but it's filled with so many little mini games within the mini games and tactics upon tactics it's frightening almost. Though that's one of the many things that I admire about it. Keeps it interesting! Why's it absolutely horrendous?Spaghetti. Code.I know the game was made with UE4 stating either the game was made with blueprints or hardcore C++ (or both). With that in mind ing hell. It's stringed together like grandma's 90 y/o hair still trying to impress guys. It's not feasible. It's not clean. It's just not ideal for a game that DEPENDS on not crashing. For a game that requires you to be in the 'trial' until you die or escape it sure as hell crashes more often than a blind man driving a car. Which results in what you may ask? Losing everything you've done that round you get rewarded no 'blood points' (the main currency in the game for leveling up your character) and of course lose all progress towards any 'daily rituals' (daily challenges for players/killers to complete for a hefty sum of blood points).Now of course every game has it's ups and downs. And sure this review could be depicted as some form of hate/anger directed towards the developers but I can assure you it's not. I love the game in fact it's a clever design for something so intricate and complicated. I applause the developers for that however something as simple as stability.. that should be a given in a game like this in all games in fact. It's just a frustrating downfall of such a great game.I recommend this game only if you're prepared to be disappointed every here and then. (Meaning almost 4/10 matches resulting in crashes) But aside from that it's definitely fun to play with friends or alone!
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Product received for free. REVIEW EDITED AT BOTTOMI only have a little more than 100 hours on this game but I've been consistently watching streams of it since it came out and have kept up with it since longgg before I finally picked up my own PC. It used to be pretty balanced with balance patches here and there mixing up the meta. Now this 1v4 intentionally imbalanced "survive against all odds" horror game has become a 1v4 "try and get a kill against all odds" surprisingly balanced for a 1v4 bully the killer game.Over the last few months patches keep coming out that directly address complaints of survivor mains then either ignore barely touch on or outright claim it's not a problem whenever killer mains have any complaints of things in game that had really ought to be changed. This has resulted in the survivors being able to negate things the killers do that take a lot of effort (outplaying a survivor to get two hits on him hooking someone etc.) by just standing in the right spot equipping one perk forever or doing one skill check.Despite the survivors becoming more and more unnecessarily powerful and the people who play mostly killer continuously and loudly voicing their concerns the developers release patch after patch after patch and have developer live streams where they announce that they will not be working on things the killers would like changed at any point in the near future but have many plans to tend to the wishes of the survivors. I used to be a killer main and this was my most played game. Now I sometimes get back on to play survivor but I've moved onto other games. It's a crying shame. Do not buy this until the devs make an effort to fix it which if the last handful of awful patches are any indication won't be any time soon.EDIT 1 I definitely purchased this game at full price I'm not sure why it says I got this for free...EDIT 2 I've more than doubled my hours since this review and I can say now that the game is in a better place than it was at the time of the above review. The developer (BHVR) has purchased the full rights of their game from their publisher (can't remember the name) and it has been only great stuff since then. There's been way more communication way more use of the play test server for big changes and way more ACTUALLY listening to the community. I'm far happier now with the game than I was before and I'm happy to change my review to positive.Obligated to say maybe this more positive experience is because I'm now a survivor main... _(ツ)_/
title: Dead by Daylight

review: This game can be incredibly fun especially with friends! I just started playing the game again after playing at launch (2 years lol) and noticed so many changes. I also encountered various people that insulted me after playing so take that however you want. It's fun to be both the killer and a survivor as each has their own fun playstyles. I will say though the killer will almost have no advantage to the game whatsoever. Winning as a killer takes strategic thinking and luck. Same with the survivors. As a killer It really only comes down to whether the survivors make mistakes. The best killer with the best perks going against the best survivors in the game with the best perks will almost always have the disadvantage. With all that said this game is really fun and I'll keep on playing with friends. If you do pick up this game 1. Don't insult anyone or teabag the killer. It's pretty childish and it's not fun to get teased and insulted and it deters new players from buying the game and bringing in more players.2. Try not to camp it prevents the survivor from actually playing the game and them from getting any points from the game. It's not fun to just watch someone die on a hook and honestly isn't viable since generators can be primed during that whole period3.Don't tunnel (targeting one person the whole game) if they are recently unhooked it is understandable to go after them but if there are others in the way attack them first. It makes the game a whole lot more fun that way and gives others a chance to play (this point can go both ways)4. Learning curve can be quite steep especially when seasons are reset since high level players will also be at the starting rank.5. If someone insults you try not to lash back at them. It honestly just feeds them and I just laugh and tell them to have a good day. Kill'em with kindness DTL DRFun game that can be even better with a full lobby of friends as both killer and survivors. Community can be quite harsh and if you play killer expect some games to be challenging and frustrating at times. Don't be toxic or feed the toxic community It deters new players from joining a great game. Let people play the game instead of being a hardcore camper or going after a single person for an entire period. Have fun )
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Playing as the killer in DBD is baisically impossible and is rarely fun unless you're with friends. You have to abuse techniques like camping a hooked survivor to generator patrolling and face the music of the suprisingly toxic survivor playerbase. Most of the fun killers are considered mid to low tier killers within the game. While these killers can be good when starting at the beginning of a ranked season they become less favorable over the higher tier killers as you progress. If you actually want to do well as a killer in higher rank matches you baisically need to use the Hillbilly or the Nurse.As an online Competitive game Dead by Daylight makes some dumb desicions on how people connect to each other. DBD and Call of Duty are some of the few games I remember that still use P2P connections. I want to give BeHavior the benefit of the doubt within this reguard but if you're able to afford four movie tie in DLC's (plus your own custom character DLC's) and be able to push microtransactions into your game it seems absurd that you can't afford dedicated servers.The overall bias towards survivors is extremely noticeable. The breaking point for most killer mains was Freddy Kreuger who was nerfed by the dev team within A WEEK OF HIM LAUNCHING (this is made more absurd due to the fact that he is a lower tier killer and is hard enough to use). On top of this most have noticed that the survivors barely get any nerfs whatsoever which only reinforces the obvious bias against killers. When they do get nerfed it's nothing noticeable either.While certain killers do have overpowered techniques to use these mostly come in the form of one time use items while most of the survivor techniques are the root of perks and bad game design. You can be chasing one survivor with a flashlight (if you shine this into the killers eyes they become blind and drop anyone they are carrying) self care (allows a survivor to heal themselves without a medkit) decisive strike (explained later) and sprint burst for 5 minutes while the rest of the survivors fix generatiors (which takes about 80 seconds to do for each generator). Normally by the time you catch them 2 3 of the generators are already fixed. Plus if you have my luck they use decisive strike immedietly (a perk where if a survivor completes a QTE while being carried they instantly escape and stun the killer). By this time the survivor has escaped and at least 3 4 generators have been fixed. By this stage you're sh!t out of luck of getting all 4 survivors and have to tunnel and camp just to get one.I would say go buy Friday the 13th when it's on sale instead but the game recently had to hault content production due to a lawsuit so you're baisically stuck with this game.If you want to have fun convince 3 4 of your friends to buy this game so that you can properly do KYF matches. It's baisically the only way to have fun.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: I guess it's about time that I finally get to reviewing this one.PROS It really isn't Pay2Win in any way. Although I can't personally confirm this from what I know you can unlock every character through farming. And honestly if you really like the game you're probably willing to do that. It is fun for a surprisingly long time especially if you have atleast one friend to play with. Content. New Characters and maps are released at a decent pace helping to keep the game fresh.CONS The Community. Seriously these people are on the same level as the League community when it comes to toxicity. Although I have to say that I don't think that this comes from the people actually being angry or anything but rather from the fact that they don't understand their opponents' way of thinking. This become really obvious after you play alot of both killer and survivor as you can somewhat put yourself in the shoes of any given person.An example of this kind of misunderstanding would be camping. I once hooked someone and when I turned around I saw three people standing there. Obviously I didn't go away. In the post game lobby everyone was ing about me camping. It's like the hell you want me to do? Just walk away when you're obviously RIGHT THERE and just ruin the result of some of my precious time? Yeeeeeeeeeeah no.Overall it's fun. Gather up a few friends and get to killin'. Or escaping. Whichever you prefer.7/10
title: Dead by Daylight

review: So this a game that is worth the money. It can be a bit frustrating initially and there are scum survivors and killers at the low ranks. However if you get past that then you'll find whatever you paid vs how much you play it gives you a great value.On the flip side of this the developers are more concerned at adding more content than fixing or balancing. They get things "working" and then release it without what feels like the proper test scenarios. They are more than capable of doing public beta tests but do so what feels like for hype.This most recent release with the clown they didn't "finish" before releasing. I've been grinding up points for purchasing perks when possible or redeeming them for bloodpoints. They took this feature away and haven't returned it yet. Even though the area for purchasing this is still there. In my past jobs I got yelled at for taking away tools or features like this. Maybe they should be too.But if you get beyond these gripes it's still a good game.
