review: in the beginning the devs buffed the crap out of the survivors which made any decent survivors able to always beat the killer i never got to be a decent survivor back then because whenever a killer would miss one swipe on me they would face camp me to death then they changed the killer up and the way certain things with surv worked and it was decent the survivors had to be a lot better to beat killer i improved because of less toxicity from killers camping me to death and had a decent time most games win or lose (mostly lose still) but then the devs started nerfing everything the killers complained about and believe me i had my complaints when i played as killer and survs did the same things to me. but i didnt want them to change it so that killers didnt Reallyyyyy get affected by it more or less just slowed down for 4 seconds at most and then they totally destroyed survivor in the last update the game that i loved i watch slowly get killed by the same people who had made a few tiny mistakes with survivor but have now decided to make it extirely unfun to pay survivor sometimes wining turned into rarely winning (id say probably 1 in every 30 game i would actually escape normally other times i would get lucky and find hatch) they made killers from something that required just as much work for survivors to win into a point and click winning game i know i dont have nearly as many hours as people who have spent many many MANY hours on here but honestly i dont want to have that many hours because the only way i will be able to win is as killer and i feel like using them is just cheap now its not fun to play killer or survivor and i truly believe im never gonna touch this game again because of this update as of 7/25/2018

review: Product received for free. I played this the free weekend and it was a great time with friends if it goes on sale at a decent price I will definitely purchase it. It plays more like an early access in many ways. Lack of diversity in the maps (they look a lot alike) very few maps and limited play options. You can't really join a server off of a friend or see where your friends are playing. Another limitation is in if say you have 3 friends 1 of you wants to be the killer this isn't easily done and you can't do public with a group unless you all are the ones being chased.More options for play better ways of searching for friends etc. along with more diversity in maps would make this game even better. I personally wouldn't pay a full $20 (USD) for it more like $10 15.

review: This game it's really fun! I really enjoy how it is difficult for survivors to get away from the killer as it allows for interesting jukes and dodging mechanics! The games I've played were all fun as I rev my chainsaw to down survivors or hide out in closets in the basements. I've never seen an asymmetric game done so well and balanced. This is 10/10 best fitness game because I lose so much weight forgetting to eat.As for my recommendations for different Survivor Perks and Killer Perks something to do with trapping the killer like 'Vine Knowledge' where you can set up a small slowing trap for the killer in a really small area (5/10/15% slowdown). Maybe for killers a perk that allows you to lock the Escape Hatch (temporarily permanently (unless 2 survivors open it together) and permanently).Again I really enjoy this game it's super fun and cool. I really wish I had more friends to survive with but good ol me has none.

review: Dead by Daylight has clear successes and failures in almost every aspect of the game the game developers fail to throw in proper fixes to abused gameplay mechanics this includes the OP flashlight and difficulty to fight against SWF (survive with friends) that can communicate although I m not a professional in the game I bought the game close to launch and loved its flare and gameplay mechanics. Now it has lowered from killers being feared by survivors to survivors making the killer fear flashlights and extremely long chases. Even though the killers have been crippled lots of people miss the difficulty for killers because of their simple mechanics compared to a survivors and continue to demand nerfs towards the killers and buffs to survivors. The game has improved a bit however there has to be proper balance as there is always 1 a meta in perks. And 2 a uneven success rate between survivors winning and killers winning. (Survivors win most of the time). However the game does have original design and can become great once the developers get their head out of the drain and balance arguments from the community

review: Long live the king...Jason Voorhees.This game istmosphereic and enjoyable but brutally one sided. This is a great game to play with your friends but the non killer characters are very too helpless. I know its supposed to be a horror movie esque set up but as far as game mechanics go it could use tweaking for the sake of balanced gameplay.Game designers if you can read this hear me out. How about you make it so the hooks never kill you and just hang there...then someone can save you any time they want. Or maybe allow your player to pull themselves up withotu the aid of another player (that is insanely frsutrating). Or give the players more health.Left 4 Dead is another multiple player horror game where you can play as the monster and it had far more balance. I'm just saying this game could use effective gameplay mechanics.But it still is a lot fun. I can't see myself playing it for hours and hours but I had a blast playing it with my buddies. Worth the on sale price but I wouldn't have bought ti for full price.

review: Introduction This game has alot of ups and downs sometimes more down then up. but personally i think this is the best attempted of creating 1vs4 game. However i recently play fewer and fewer dead by daylight and more and more of "No More Room In Hell" and i din't know why. But i think i had my reasons. So everyone this is going to be a detailed and in depth review as to why i start to play dead by daylight less.I will tell you this i think this is the most harsh review i wirtten so far. Too many dlc's To me this is a big evdience that Game developers are not the people who makes games to get attention and create playground to have players experience and have fun they never had before but rather as business game developer forcus on making money then actually making players happy. They more forcus adding microtranscation of the game Then balancing and fixing the game. While having a cosmetic store is okay but half of the killer roster are locked behind a paywall raised red flags for me. review: A really fun game with some downsidesI love playing this game. I'm really a sucker for these kind of games. I just love the concept of a group of players versus 1. And this game uses that concept pretty good.There are however a few downsides to this game. First of all it's quite buggy. Even after all this time it's been in developement many of the same bugs still persist. And some of them are quite annoying while playing such as being hit while you've already vaulted over a window. Some bugs that aren't major are model issues especially with Feng Min her model. I frequently have it that I can see insider her left shoulder. And her clothing often starts tripping.But regardless of these bugs I still enjoy the game greatly. Whenever I start playing Survivor with my friends I have a blast every time. A bug fix from time to time would be appreciated however.

review: My feelings about this game have been pretty inconsistent because of the toxic community however I love the game's unique gameplay as an asymmetrical horror. In the game's history the developers were very hesitant in balancing the game because of the process of approval required by their publisher Starbreeze. Ever since Behaviour bought the rights from Starbreeze there have been many balance changes that have given the killer side of the game the balance they deserved. Before the balance update survivors were very powerful in that they almost didn't even need to cooperate in order to survive. The point of a 1v4 asymmetrical gameis that the 4 survivors must work together in order to overcome the overpowered killer. The developers have recently been enforcing that type of gameplay which is why you can see many negative reviews and why there is so much toxicity in this game.

This is mainly from toxic and/or entitled survivors being mad about Killer Buffs and Survivor nerfs. Killer is meant to be strong. Survivor is supposed to win if you work together. Git gud. 7/10

title: Dead by Daylight

review: This game is quite good in my opinion. In this review I will sum up what it's about and what I think about it.The game is an Asymmetrical Horror Survival game.The game goes as follows There are 4 survivors and 1 killer. Both can equip up to 4 perks 2 add ons and one offering per match. Survivors can equip items while killers have a set power. There are licensed killers like Michael Myers and Freddy Krueger but also licensed survivors like Laurie Strode and Quentin Smith. There are in total right now 12 killers and 13 survivors. Survivors are played in 3rd person while killers are played in 1st person.Survivors have to repair 5 generators to power 2 gens which can then be opened and the survivors can then escape. Meanwhile there is a killer who is slightly faster than the survivors who has to hunt them down and kill them one by one. It takes a killer to hits per survivor to down him. 1 hit injure and 2 hits downed. When survivors are downed the killer can pick them up and hang them on meat hooks. There are 3 phases on the hook. The hooking phase the summoning phase and then the sacrifice. 1. You are given 3 chances during the hooking phase to escape on your own with every escape having a chance of 4% to be successful2. The summoning phase renders you unable to escape on your own and requires the help of another survivor to escape. You have to spam the set button (default spacebar) at a specific pace so you won't get killed instantly. You have to be hooked 3 times to die except if u get into the summoning phase during the first hook then u die at the next hook.3. The sacrifice phase is when you die. You get penetrated by pointy entity spikes and you get pulled up into the sky and die.Survivors have many means to escape the killers' grasp and hits. There are a lot of windows in the 20+ maps. Vaulting is quick for survivors when running and jumping through the windows. While vaulting is slow for killers. Pallets enable you to slow down the killers and even stun them when they get hit by the pallets. Killers can destroy these which will take some time and enables you to escape or just give you some time during the chase.If the killer finally gets you after the chase he can pick you up but during the walk towards a hook survivors are given the chance to wiggle out of the killers grasp by spamming A D A D A D A D etc. When released the killer is momentarily stunned giving the survivors a chance to run away and hide.There's a place called the basement. There's a meathook stand with 4 meat hooks attached to it. It's a dangerous place you as a survivor should try to avoid.There are 3 chests with items for survivors located throughout the maps. One is always placed within the basement.There are 8 generators (referred to as gens by the community and players) per match. There are also 5 totems located on random spots in the maps. Destroying these can give you points.A killer shack is in most maps. The killer shack is basically a run down shed which sometimes has the basement included and sometimes not.Killers have few items for disposal to chase down the survivors. They have a few more to find the survivors.When trying to find survivors killers can commonly patrol the gens. They're transparently outlined. When survivors are running the killer can see their ''scratch marks'' and follow them towards the survivor's location. However they end when the survivors start walking again so the killer has to look around a bit as well.Killers have a terror radius in which survivors can hear the killers heartbeat and start hiding.Killers are slightly faster than survivors but that won't really help them that much. During very long chases killers get a helping mechanism called ''Bloodlust''. This will make them slightly faster for a short time.Killers can simply hit to hurt a survivor or lunge forward to hit survivors. Killers have to think ahead of time to expect where survivors are going to go.I think this game still has high potential. Even after its release 3 years ago it reaches almost 30k players simultaneously every day. The game is not what it promises to be though. It's not very asymmetrical right now since the survivors are very strong since release. The developers are changing this slowly and because survivors are getting a bit weaker since the last patch they instantly made 440+ bad reviews of the game. As you can see from that the game has a pretty toxic community but what game (which was made in the last 2 years) doesn't have that? This community has 3 sides. Survivor mains killer mains and people that play both.I play both and have to say just like every other normal player that survivors are superior in strength to killers. Survivors can run around pallets for some time and then smack em on the killer in the last moment just to run to another pallet and repeat the step. During this one chase multiple gens can be finished leaving the killer with no chance or time. When killers get a buff or just a QoL change the survivor side gets really mad resulting in a new killer nerf.This is because survivor players are in a 4 1 ratio and thus are the cash cows for this game (buying outfits and auric cells for example) This means that the devs kinda have to obey to the survivors' will which they have done plenty and thus nerf killers. (which they have done plenty as well.I would give this game 5 5 or 6/10 stars basically. The community is and the dev team is pretty bad considering balance but the game is great and deserves more people to maybe one day fix the community. The game is quite hard in the beginning since there are a lot of killers and playstyles but you will get used to it and start dying less/killing more people. Thank you for reading this long review and I hope to see YOU in the fog.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: I can now recommend this game now since the developers are now actually listening to the community and buffing/nerfing things acordinglyI play killer and survivor about 50/50 so i do know what both sides are capable of experiencing in terms of toxicity and frustration and i can say with experience that the newest update is balacing the game toward the right directionRight now survivors are having a reeeeeeeeeeee because the update has changed how 'exhaustion' related perks work now they can't get their sweet sweet Sprint Burst or Dead Hards if they prolong the chase for long enough. Since i don't rely on those perks as much i havn't had much difficulty adapting to these new changesI can say that i don't think they should buff killers or nerf survivors/game mechanics anymore the balance right now is just right and they should focus on providing more content in the future(PS IMO i'd like if the new content to be 100% free no grind or paywall crap just content for content unless its a licenced killer then its completely understandable)

review: I play this game somewhat casually and it's a lot of fun. Especially with friends. Keep in mind this review is solely from the perspective of a survivor player I have not played any killers and am not interested in doing so. So I will not be talking about being a killer in this review.The concept of this game is simple to follow and there's no overtly complex mechanics unless you're aiming to reach the top 1% of players or something. As a survivor you and 3 other players have to activate 5 generators to escape the area (which counts as a win) while a killer looks for and attempts to murder everyone. This game is effectively a horror themed version of hide and seek and I don't know about you but I loved hide and seek as a kid and I love it now. Just with a few extra mechanics to work with like saving other players from hooks (what the killer places players on when they're caught) and various items to work with (toolbox for repairing or sabotaging hooks medkit for self healing or faster healing of other players flashlight to attempt to stun the killer and "keys" which I have yet to use).Additionally there are about a dozen or so survivors to work with. At first they are unique but as you level them up you allow their perks to be able to access other survivors' "bloodwebs" which are basically skill trees. So late game survivors can effectively become skins. I like this because if I don't like the look of one of the survivors I can use helpful perks from them to someone else.When you start the game it is a bit scary. You don't fully understand killers' mechanics so some of their abilities can genuinely scare you at first. The Doctor for instance has a jumpscare. The Nurse can teleport the Shape gains power by staring at you (imagine working on a generator and you turn around to see him just looking at you). After a while you understand these more and kind of get the gist of their playstyles but I still get adrenaline from running away from killers while the music hypes up and the heartbeat is thumping like crazy.All right with gameplay and out of the way graphics are okay. They look a little dated and some animations could use more polish. Sometimes the physics whack out like crazy and you can see someone's hair stretch a yard away from their head. Not amazing not bad but it's nice enough to look at.The maps aren't amazing but they aren't bad. They're small but this allows for quick games most of the time (there's no time limit). Environments feel sort of the same but this is also for the sake of gameplay and everything's dark because it's horror so that's to be expected.I got the game on sale and it feels worth it for $10. It's fun can be played casually and so far nothing feels like t mechanics. Everything feels fair.EDIT Doubling my playtime now and playing a lot of solo I've found the game to be less fun without friends. That's how I originally got into the game and without voice communication I find myself baffled by the choices my teammates make even if it makes sense for them. This can leave the experience frustrating for solo survivors. I'd say the game is best played with a 2 4 premade.Worth mentioning that yes there are a few "camping" killers in this game. They do ruin the entire game experience and there is not enough mechanics within the game to punish camping so that it's entirely pointless to do so which of course just encourages more camping.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Dead by Daylight is one of the latest games in the asymmetrical 4v1 horror genre similar to the upcoming Last Year and Friday the 13th. Consider Dead by Daylight a hybrid of Outlast and Dead Realm.I'd held off writing a review to see if the developers would fix the numerous bugs within the game such as waiting upwards of 30 minutes for a lobby collision detection issues and killers being allowed to cherry pick who they want to play against. As of the 23rd of August I can happily say that the vast majority of these issues have now been fixed matchmaking is now instantaneous (although still lacks dedicated servers) collision detection issues have been addressed and thankfully no longer cause problems and ranks are hidden from other players to avoid lobby dodging.Overall I now highly recommend this game to anyone looking for an atmospheric horror experience whether it be with friends or by themselves.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Can't recommend this game until they fix the matchmaking. If you queue solo it's fine most of the time however if you have a group of 2 or more then you can expect hitting the "Ready" button over and over. When you do finally connect you will have a dice rolled for you either taking you back to the survivor screen getting stuck in a load screen or the killer bails and you go back to hitting that "Ready" button. It's truly something that completely sours the experience of the game because the actual gameplay is phenomenal.If if wasn't for this insanely glaring issue I would pants down recommend this game to anyone who enjoys fun.UPDATE All of the above was true once but has been (for the most part) sorted out. This game gets my full recommendation for purchase.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: An enjoyable yet terrifying game thats gets the blood pumping as you sneak around trying fix 5 generators with 3 meat shields all the while trying to avoid a murderous psychopath who only goal is to throw you on hook like poor pig babe. If I had any grip about this game its about the match making and even then its minor complaint since matches come up at a decent pace. More often then not ill be a really low ranked killer and a couple of meat sacks will be really high ranked and all of a sudden it becomes a really really hard game of tag. As a survivor its the opposite effect where your just trying to run away from the overly attached girlfriend and she JUST WONT GO AWAY. But as I said matches come up pretty quick though and when you die you can just que for another one. In all honesty a very thrilling game that I have enjoyed.

review: The game is great. You have fun for a few hours play with some friends maybe solo to increase immersion. Each killer has unique abilities and gameplay and so does each survivor. The game is going great you load in find a generator and start working on it. Within the minute of the beginning of that certain match someone is down. You think "Hmm that was quick". Seconds later you are near the killer using the run around the tree to avoid being seen tactic and you notice "wait a minute is that Michael Myers? Or Leatherface? Don't you have to pay to use those? And all of a sudden you get one shot. By a killer that cost at least five dollars. And then after a few more games it happens again but this time with a different paid killer. And it hits you. Pay To Win. Three words that are so true for this game. Want good clothing that helps you camoflauge? You can buy it with auric cells and be pracitcly invisible against a dark corner or in a bush. Want a killer that will win you games? And get you blood points? Cough up five bucks and you got it. This game is ridiculous with making paid killers have one shot abilities that take mere seconds to charge with almost no setbacks on the killer who is faster than you and has great hit range. If you can prove to me that it isn't bull that the only way to get those characters is to pay then go ahead.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: When I first started playing this I was also playing F13. Both good fun games. Im a big F13 fan in general but I think DBD has the edge over it on the fear factor. The atmosphere is just right on it. Theres no attacking as a survivor you can only hide and do what you need to do to escape which really helps make you feel vulnerable.A few niggles I have with it are the graphics settings. They are very sparse and don t seem to do much when changing them. Also it says its in fullscreen but it s not really its borderless so the performance takes a bit of a hit. There are loads of guides online that tell you how to solve this which I used and now the game looks and plays great.Another little niggle is with the actual connection. I get a fair bit of rubberbanding more so over the last couple of plays Ive had. This is where my character seemingly warps forward or wherever making it difficult to judge your escape from the killer. I suppose it could be due to me playing over wifi but it wasn t doing it the other week. Something to keep an eye on I guess but I can see that others have the issue as well.Anyway I recommend the game if you fancy something a bit tense and dark. Give it a blast and maybe hit me up for a game!
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Love and hate relationship.Pretty good game quite addicting really. The overall idea of the survivor x killer is getting popular these days with some of these upcoming games for instance. I finally started playing this bloody thing this year but damn it's been 2 years and the game continues broken af. A 4v1 game was supposed to give the killer all the tools needed to be OP and impose terrorand pressure on them. There's a massive reliance on pallet looping in order to waste the killer's time extremely powerful perks such as decisive strike and borrowed time and the lack of stealth options given to survivors. Dbd's gameplay in a nutshell is basically like this If you are playing as a killer your ability to win is almost solely based on the ability for survivors to make mistakes. It's always wheter or not they screw up. If you remove most of the pallets from the map the killer would be really powerful. However the survivor doesn't receive points for being stealthy and so they must relie of pallet loops because it's a really strong option and they get points for being chased and stunning the killer with said pallets.Let's not even discuss about flashlight abuse and survivors removing your totens within 10 seconds and nullifying your powerful killer hex perks. That being said just think about the following idea four survivors with four powerful perks against one killer with four powerful perks the survivors will always win if they play correctly. For a killer to have a good time on this game the survivor MUST mess up for you to get rewarded. Unless the Devs decide to make any balance rework or something alike there will always be a Jake jerking off on your hooks and kage bushin Claudettes.Devs response after 2 years no uI recommend watching "Problems with the Dead By Daylight (DBD) Meta" by Bricky if you need more insight into thatBy far I love this game but I definetely do not enjoy playing for hours straight too stressful most of the times.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: They still have matchmaking/lobby creating issues and most of the thumbs down reviews are completely correct on the gameplay issues. That being said they fixed a lot of the initial problems the game had and it got me hooked on the recent free to play weekend.Update Review 12/23/2016 After about 2 weeks of playing on and off the main issue with the game seems to be the extremely salty community Dead By Day Light has acquired. Many surivors complaining about host advantage issues with the killer/monster (whom is always the host) plus complaints of constant camping.My issues with "camping" After having played both survivor and monster extensively I have to say that camping is a completely fair and viable tactic. Survivors seem to have some sort of superiority complex where they feel they can have their cake and eat it too. It completely ruins the entire experience in my opinion specially when you go against a group of survivors that's a steady group of players that are constantly partying up because they're friends and they all have all their four perks unlocked plus full ultra rare (red colored) perks.They run around the entire match causing complete mayhem they love to not only fix generators as quickly as possible with perks such as saboteur but they break hooks traps run to every single board on the map to drop it on the monster chasing them and are generally a group of smart asses that feel like they should all make it out alive.It ceases to be a "horror" or thriller and devolves into smart asses running around trolling the monster. Then in the aftermatch lobby they have the gall to and complain telling off the game's host for camping if he even manages to catch one. This is a game about a horrifying monster sacrificing ordinary people to a dark entity that exists and permeates in some unexplicable form from the area or "map" you happen to be on. Not everyone was meant to make it out alive. Part of the experience of this game is the fact that you're likely going to be executed. That's that. Stop being a ing
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Although outside pressure probably had something to do with its release date *cough* before it was done *cough* (why not closer to halloween?) I appreciate that this game was released when it was to allow the community to shape the balance and tweaks to gameplay and allow time to grind up points for advancement.I believe this game is a lot of fun for the following reason YOU ARE IN A HORROR MOVIEPrevious games have used the multiplayer aspect to pit monsters versus survivors but not quite on this level before.One can be a helpless survivor scrambling to escape a never ending nightmare with others they can choose to cooperate with or bait the monster with to save their own hide.You can be the killer fast powerful and driven with malice to hunt down the other players using cunning and prediction to catch other players off guard.You get the feeling from each game a new story is unfolding that you inevitably are a part of. Especially with items that change light levels and fog in the game.Couple that with a kind of misty backstory of a web of blood and you have a weird awesome near lovecraftian experience of confusion heart racing and momentary relief from danger that normally only comes from single player horror games like FNAF or Slenderman multiplayer.For those considering buying the game do it now as you will need to grind up points for additional perks that make the game more enjoyable. And hey its $20 not like other high graphic $40 games that are multiplayer only. You can't expect the quality to be the same for what you pay. Plus you help influence gameplay changes in its continuing development.ok enough preaching.You might want to hold off buying the game if you want a more finished bug free game as the devs are working still on game balancing new content bug fixing and the like. A recent patch helped to balance infinite escape spots for survivors so it is easier to play the killer now in a sense (less abuse of arena). Perks on certain characters are overpowered versus others meaning these perks almost never see play. The ranking system is different from other games and takes some adjustment as it is not enough to simply win the match while hiding in a corner watching everyone else work. Ya gotta be brave to get pips.Disconnects ruin the fun (when has it not in multiplayer gaming?). Perhaps some adjustment to disconnecting so that if a survivor disconnects at very start of match a generator gets taken off the count or something. The connections in games vary by match meaning some matches are laggier than others your connection is not going to be stable every game. Very frustrating when as a survivor you glitch into the view of the killer or as the killer you can't hit a lagging survivor.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: I really wanted to love this game and in some aspects I do. Every game if someone is hooked they'll just dc or let themselves die on purpose. If you're hooked then it's just killers camping you. (I don't have anything against that really) But if you're being camped and tunneled team mates should just get on with gens while the hooked person gets as much time as possible to help them out and buy them as much time as possible. This isn't the case though people just disconnect as soon as they're picked up never mind hooked which makes the rest of the game more difficult for everyone else. Occasionally you get team mates that know what to do how the system works and to use their brain when it comes to escaping. This however is a very rare occurance. Until something is done about people leaving once downed or dying intentionally it won't be a huge success. I'l continue to play the game casually from time to time though .

review: The mechanic seems simple (four survivors try to repair generators and escape one killer tries to kill them) but the game is surprisingly rich in possibility. Both killers and survivors have items and skills that can be equipped or leveled up for subtle changes in gameplay and encounters. Other good points interesting content (characters and skills maps etc.) is steadily released the art and design are excellent and the game is genuinely tense. The only issue I have with the game at the moment is that killers are a bit too powerful compared to survivors. Even in my first games as a killer opponents only survived if I "let" them (ran away after they were hooked let them get away if they put up a good fight so as not to "tunnel" them etc.). I have played very few games that were a true challenge as a killer (all because the teams were communicating outside of the game and had a few excellent strategies (and were good with their killer stunning flashlights). Apparently this is a recent change in balancing so I hope it will be adjusted in the future.

review: I've been playing this game for more than 2 years now. I bought it when it first came out in june 2016.I played consistantly to get better. Warning this game is not beginner friendly and it's easy to feel oppressed.Yet with that out of the way. I always come back to this game cause the way it makes me feel while playing it.A hide and seek plus the seeker is a killer. I love the mindgames the chases and the thrill. No game is perfect and the devs are trying to make the best of it.Pros The thrill that the game is creating All the maps Be able to play with friends or killing them P The strategy that you have use while under pressure The constant updates balance patchs and dlcs coming out.Cons A little tweaks to make the killer feel that he can do more that just waiting for survivors to make mistakes. I was scared for the longest time playing killer cause i was getting insulted whatever playstyle i was using. This is a community problem and it's not related to the game. Now i just do my thing and if they are mad...i just don't care.I had a pretty great experience playing this game and i still love it...to death hahaIf you don't like losing don't play this game. This is a simple warning. To get better at this game you will lose a lot of games.With that in mind i still recommend the game if you like assymetric horror game!Peace out!

review: First of all I Love this game!It's so much fun to play and the atmosphere is amazingyet I have 3 points that might need some rework The beartrap killer is able to place traps directly beneath the hook while a survivor is on the hook making it impossible to save him because one of the survivors always gets stuck in the bear trap if they try to rescue each other. Maybe just change it so the killer is able to place traps near the hooks but not underneath them. Playing with your friends is obviously the most fun but if you're just 2 or 3 people it's almost impossible to play together as survivors. So adding either a server browser or the option to create a lobby for your friends to join together as survivors would be GREAT! I sometimes have issues with my internet connection so from time to time it occurs that my connection breaks for just a second or two but that's enough time to throw me out of the lobby and there is no option to join back in which leaves not just me but my fellow survivors I really hope the developers read my review and maybe even think about adding one or two of my ideas because in my opinion those would make the game even more fun than it already is right now!Please keep up the great work. I love your game and hope it will get some more content as i wish to be able to play it for as long as possible without it getting boring. ButterFliege33

review: This game has been a fun ride since I first started playing it around a short amount of time after the Nurse came out. The game has given me mixed emotions since I started playing being bumpy once in awhile although maintaining what it has and will always be a headache. I'd like to section off the review into three or so sections starting with the overall community and then going deeper into the game itself. Community I want to get this out of the way. The community is filled to the brim with nothing but toxicity and reasonably so because of the 4v1 gameplay. I seriously doubt that the community will ever be any different. Survivors and killers alike both have the mindset no matter what that the other is directly going against them not only in game but in overall moral code and feelings shared with eachother. I have almost never seen anyone on the survivor side agree with the killer and vice versa. One key example that I have seen the community do to reflect this is mass reviewing the game if a side got mechanics changed against their favor only giving negative reviews because of a simple change. Ranks 20 16Ranks 20 16 consists of people who are new to the game. Conversation is usually pretty open consisting of sharing ideas to general talk. Essentially the community that you would want to see from a developers standpointRanks 15 6Ranks 15 6 generally have your standard gg's and maybe some back and forth communcation here and there although there is some people who stand out from the bunch here and there.Ranks 5 1Ranks 5 1 are where the true community shows out. There is usally little talk if any at all and most of the time only a few gg's if you play right in the opposing player(s) eyes. Developers The developers for this game are a mixed bunch. They have made some awkward decisions ranging from balancing to just gameplay mechanics. The best example would be in patch 2.2.0 with pallets having only stun if the killer is essentially inside of the pallet. There isn't too much to hate on here besides that you can tell the developers are scared to make changes because their community hates change. The GameGameplayThe base gameplay is balanced in favor of the lower ranks (Rank 20 16). This has made playing in higher ranks feel too hard for every killer except what is generally considered high tier killers with nurse being the best as of now. The gameplay after 1k hours feels repetitive and I find myself coming back during high ranks only for the new chapters which to be fair usually come with their own rank resets. I feel as the gameplay would be more fun if there was either something to boost the baseline killer to have a higher skill ceiling or to make gameplay slower and less competitive the higher the rank you are.BugsBugs have plagued this game since its start being nothing but even more stress on the player. The PC side of the game has PTB's or Public Test Builds every once in a while. Each build usually contains a few bugs and what feels like every PTB the developers let through a few bugs or bad changes and release the chapter even though they exist. This on top of the community have made me question if I should have spent time playing the game to begin with. Conclusion Overall I feel as if the game is incomplete. It deffinetly needs a massive change to feel fun again in my opinion whether by making a casual mode or by making bonuses for being in high ranks. There honestly isn't much to say about it other than it is what it is a simple 4v1 game that gets harder to play the more you play it.I'm giving this game a no simply because of the dedication and patience you have to put into it to keep your sanity and to keep your anger down while playing it.All edits so far have been for formatting.
title: Dead by Daylight

title: Dead by Daylight

review: I don't know I'm not good as it is but I dropped 3 ranks all because Freddy is almost impossible. I haven't found anything to counter any of his perks or even his dream state. I wouldn't recommend this game to someone just starting out. If you want the game and are going to buy it anyway I'd suggest just playing with friends and try to have one of your friends play as Freddy and practice against him. Even after the hype dies down I still think a majority of bad killers will stay as Freddy. Even then though I'm not sure the game will be fun.I'm not saying I need to win every time and obviously I don't seeing as I'm usually a Rank 16/15 but when you have bad killers that are all of a sudden getting up in rank you can't just chalk that up to someone getting better at the game when they can only win with one killer. If I'm out of line thats fine but just giving my opinion. Going into Dream State is instant getting out of dream state either gives up your position or you have to hope you have teammates that will help he is incredibly fast. Also once in dream state he can see your aura.I changed my review to recommending the game from not recommending because I think I was premature. I still believe everything I wrote but a good way to counter Freddy is having self heal and taking advantage the 7 or so seconds it takes to get into the dream state.

review: Good game.Pros Very grindy so if you like having something to do no matter how long you play this is good The killer and survivor are like completely different games depending on what side you choose Monthy patches and updates from devs Large community New characters and maps being added every season A rank reset every season Ways to unlock paid dlc characters with ingame currency Fun with friends Allows for custom matches to play around Seasonal events like Halloween and Xmas An option to prestige your character forever once you level them to 50 (OPTIONAL)Cons Graphics can be poop sometimes Killers are the host of the match (this can lead to some issues) Killers who lagswitch to win It takes ages to find matches at certain ranks like 20 and 1 Toxic community Survivors disconnect whenever you beat them Killer can be frustrating if survivors bully you like flashlight clicking and 360ing Some killers face camp to secure 1 kill which ruins the game for that 1 player and thier friends.Overall the issues with the game is community wise and this review was written on Oct 6th 2018 and yesterday the devs made a survey about toxicity because they are actively working on it 9.5/10
title: Dead by Daylight

review: I really like the concept of DBD. It's the coop version of Outlast (if you ever played Outlast you know what I mean). This is probably the only time I like a coop game where I have to lvl up. Everything is more or less well balanced just need to use the perks and environment to your advantage. And that's where the negative points come in the tutorial is crap. Took me a couple of hours (and youtube) to figure out the Skill Check and other game mechanics. Make a Tutorial where you can pick what you want to practice. And of cource it's a P2P game. Between disconnects lag switching and bad pings all online games need to be client/server based and not P2P... the game will be better for it... get servers... you reduce cheating and other disconnect issues.All and all I still recommend DBD.

review: This game is great every once in a while sort of. the first few hours are great and terrifying. you will lose alot from lack of map knowledge but the atmosphere is cool. then you learn the maps and the atmosphere is gone horrorwise and the new insentive is to win. kicks in by like 20+ hours tops. after that you hit a wall of needing perks to win as a new goal. perks are awarded randomly and good perks are unlocked via mastering a character which takes forever. after you master every character you still need to get every perk. now for the gameplay. the game is fun and even at first or for level 20 people (level 1 being the best 20 being new) once you get out of that area you hit the mid tier casual players where you win some and you lose some. this is where I usually sit because grinding isn't what i want from a game. I love playing killer but here is where my negative review comes in this game is very anti killer. the killers can be balanced but theres exploits to screw killers like "pallet looping". the being strung along in a 1v4 while the other 3 beat the game is fine and dandy but this game is toxic. if you kill one person you are a camping ****. if you kill all 4 you are still a noob camper etc. the players on survivers side (not all of them) are so toxic it makes this game not fun. then you add on survive with friends +so players can communicate with eachother (basically cheating it helps so much) and keep you from actually getting kills. this game is draining and if you like a grind go for it but a game where the community (and developers to a degree) make the game cator to survivers allways winning or else you get salted at isnt fun long term. Basically being a killer main this game is toxic af.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: When I first saw this game I though "It ain't anything special" but after watching a plethora of gameplay videos and streams I grew to be quite fond of the game which has lead me to purchase it. I've spent about 230 hours playing this game so far but when I look at it now and the state it is in.... It just makes me frown in disappointment becosue of the balance issues at higher ranks. Even though I am not pleased with how the devs are treating this game I still cannot bring myself to give it a negative review. Dead by Daylight has earned a special place in my heart and I still have hope for it to earn back it's glory and not becoming the next EVOLVE.

review: Good game idea and plays well I could imagine that this game would be fun to play with five friends but from a single player perspective it can get really annoying and frustrating because of the lack of people who actually help you when you are stuck on a hook or being hunted down by the killer. Another problem with the game is that you cannot search for a public game with friends (that I know of) meaning that unless you have five friends to play with then you are unable to play with friends at all. The game doesn't include any in game chat meaning that you are unable to communicate with your teammates. Overall I would recommend this game to people that have enough friends that own the game to play with.

review: not bad but it takes forever to get into a match if you are playing killer. Lots of ways to tailor your character and every level of your bloodweb has atleast 1 useful item. One major downside is the community. It is more toxic than a game of CoD filled with 7 year olds. If you have a laggy game as killer and win you are called a hacker and reported. If you have a quick victory as killer you are called a hacker and reported if the players even stay but most rage quit to keep from losing rank. If you are playing survivor and get generators repaired too fast the killer quits so he doesn't lose rank. In short its really rare that you find a good game full of people who don't cry about losing. I'd still suggest it to players looking for a better version of Friday the 13th that won't go into perma stasis mode any time soon.

review: Thoroughly enjoyable and strangely compelling to play as survivor. You'll die horribly and quit the game in disgust but be loading the game back up and joining another game within 10 minutes.Sure there are some bugs at the moment but nothing that stops the game being fun overall. Just don't take levelling up and ranking too seriously and the fun will remain. Coming back to the game after not playing for about a year it has been expanded greatly. I feel like there are a lack of places to hide in the indoor maps as there is no foliage to hide in and no option to hide in items like boxes etc.The game still feels overly complex with the myriad of new mechanics perks and items. especially with the DLC killers. I still wish for a "casual" mode with no perks items in map only and no levelling up.

review: If you're even tempted to buy this game do it! Been playing it for about 2 weeks now and I'm loving it. This game will seriously make you feel like you're trying to survive in a horror movie so if you're a horror fan check it out. It definitely requires a little bit of strategy but once you play a few rounds you'll get the hang of it. I was a little worried about it getting repetetive but after 32 hours it hasn't yet. They're also going to keep adding to it with new survivors killers perks and maps. Pros Fun intense gameplay Makes you feel like you're in a horror movie inexspensive Great matchmaking generally does a great job of pairing you with similar level players. Cons Can be frustrating especially when you have teamates that aren't helpful. There are two leveling systems Levels and ranks. Ranks matter more but can be frustrating as you have to win multiple games in a row to rank up and you lose part of a rank when you lose. Depending on how good you are it can take a while. Some of the player base can be "elitests" but not overwhelmingly so. No party system yet.I don't typically review games but this is one of those games that caught me way off guard and I feel deserves it. Thanks to the devs for this! Keep the content coming!
title: Dead by Daylight

review: This game manages to capture the suspense and thrills of a Hollywood slasher film in game form perfectly. The cat and mouse gameplay is amazing and is unlike anything I've ever experienced in a video game before. Throw in some tough choices on whether to help your fellow survivor in their moment of need or take advantage of the distraction their misfortune has created for the killer and the experience is exhilirating.

title: Dead by Daylight

review: I want to start by saying that I do have fun with this game and some times it's the same way that some people have fun by putting needles into their private parts.There is so much that is good about this game and in the same breath i have to also say that there is so much that is broken and needs to be fixed.1. THERE IS NO CONTROL REBINDING! that is right a full launch of a game that does not let you edit the controls. Really?2. The Infinate vault hopping thing. there are so many vids on youtube and times that i have spent waisting time with a survivor that will just hop through window after window after window. 3. Perk Ballance in relation to the lvl of others in the loby. how many times i have come across a high lvl Meg with Adrenaline seriously that perk is so OP it is not funny full heal and run speed +150% at it's best it will full heal from dying state... are you serious? AND after she gets to lvl 30 she can teach it to other survivors.On the flip side lets look at a few killer perks Insidious for example after standing still for a few seconds you have no terror effect or no heart beat to hear untill you move or act again.Dearstalker the ability to see aura of dying survivours from a distance awayAnd Iron Grasp which makes it tougher for a survivor to escape from you holding them.These are in my opinion the best 3 perks that the killers have.If you are going to buy this game be sure you have 4 friends to play with as this is currently the best way to get enjoyment out of this game. Ther is serious Potential in this game and i want to see it brought into being and that is why i bought it... Evolve did something similar before but this game has the ability to offer so much more.I just hope that the devs hear what the community is saying and make this something special.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Dead By Daylight is overall a fun game. However needs quite a lot of work and balancing to become a great game. No party system makes it hard for people with only 1 2 freinds. The ranking system is some what broken. In the sense that is very hard to rank up. Now the worst part is some of the exploits that the survivors can use to make it impossible for the killer to get them. From vaulting over 2 ledges that are right next to each other to running around a truck endlessly to avoid the killer. It can make the game infinitely more frustrating to play. In conlusion Dead By Daylight needs work. It's a fun game but it might've needed a little more time before it's release. Hopefully the devolpers can fix these issues within the game. 6/10. Worth a buy if you have a group of freinds to play with.

review: Don't bother even if it's on sale.The devs are ether too stupid to figure out haw to balance that game or just don't care. Everytime a new killer is released it's a broken mess and a poor attempt at fixing something instead of addressing the actual problem. The community itseft consists of ether griefers or morons with maybe a handful of decent teammates. There are no dedicated servers so you'll be playing with lag most of the time. The gameply itself isn't very good ether once you realize what a chore everything in the game is. Doing generators is nothing more than a boring quick time event. Chasing survivors amounts to being endlessly looping the same obsticle while every generator gets done and even if you do catch the survivor they ether get saved by a flashlight of use a perk to escape making the whole thing pointless.The only way I could recommend this game is if you like feeling like the other side is overpowered no matter which side you're on.

review: Great game so far. the gameplay whilst a bit repetitive at times (due to the lack of maps and game modes) always manages to feel tense. At one point i thought i had conquered my fears only to join a game and start screaming the second the killer came around a corner. The game seems fairly well balanced never seems like one side is at a massive advantage. The one glaringly obvious flaw this game has is its lobbying system there is no way to join with friends although the developers have said they intend to fix this. it's levelling system is also a bit odd no upgrades feel like they do much so progression is sort of pushed to the side. EDIT the fixes have come for the lobbying system this means playing with friends is easier.TLDR Good game would recommend if you're into scary adventures obviously better with friends.

review: This is a fantastic horror movie simulator. You and three other friends can run and try to escape the grasp of the killer. Or you can play as the killer and hunt down your prey!. The objective as the survivors is to repair a certain number of generators to open up the exit. The killers objective is to yes...kill everyone! The killer is in the first person veiw as the survivors put you in third person POV. This game is balanced really well and is a lot of fun to play. A couple bugs but im suire they will fix them over time. Though BE CAREFUL...there are hackers roaming around with wall hacks and speed hacks. If you catch one or are suspicious of one report them to the dev via community forums.

review: Previously I had complained that the various bugs made the game unplayable. As of 1.03 there are still bugs but they seem far less common or egregious than they were before. The game is now fun to play it's far from perfect but I can now feel comfortable giving it a good review.

review: Very atmospheric but not jump scary. It's easy to jump into a couple of quick rounds when you have some time free without having to commit hours to play. Killing your friends while you're all in voice chat is glorious fun. I'm looking forward to the Survive With Friends option so we can play together even if we don't have a full 5 people available (and still hopefully earn blood points). Connecting to games is a bit buggy and you'll find yourself clicking 'join lobby' several times before it actually hooks you up but hopefully they'll have that fixed soon.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Honestly I enjoy this game BUT (yes there is always a but) there are a lot of things that need to be improved on. The killers are kinda OP. I'm not saying that because WAH WAH WAH /insert tantrum I get killed. I'll accept my death like I should but there are times where it just seems impossible to even get away from the killer. The whole party system needs some help too. I shouldn't have to click ready constantly while trying to get into a lobby with a friend. The killers shouldn't be allowed to see the victims ranks. It gives them the chance to back out and then we are back to playing the ready simulator all over again. If we can't see the killers rank they shouldn't get to see ours. Why should they have a hand up on deciding if they want to play with us or not when we can't make the same judgment based off the killers rank/level?
title: Dead by Daylight

review: This game can be fun when your teammates actually decide to include themselves in teamwork. Horrible players will in turn make a game horrible.Pros Atmosphere Randomly generated maps Easy to understand the game (very easy to play this game without help (i.e. the tutorial)) Wood pallets + Killer stun Lootable chests (you keep the loot if you live) Generator Map item (very handy item) Perks (Self Heal is amazing) Trailing system to help track Survivors You don't lose your consumables during private matches Character leveling and progression system Item add ons Multiplayer QueuesCons The absolute lack of teamwork and help is this game is so bad that it has given me full blown terminal super AIDS. No in game communication (excluding pre game chat box) Lack of graphics control in the settings Can't adjust the music and sound effect levels separately Skill check can be slightly laggy Random game disconnects even on good internet Flashlight is horrible Ranking system isn't consistant Lobby hopping Hook CampersOther thoughs What is the point of the music getting real loud during a chase/escape? It only hinders the ability to hear footsteps groans vaults failed healing skill checks closet doors being shut Wraith snarling and basicly any other sound that's supposed to help give away the Killer/Survivors position. Need an incentive to continue playing after going from 4v1 to a 1v1 when 3 4 generators still need to be fixed. You get zero bonuses for solo fixing 3+ generators and living. Not really worth the time and effort to continue. The toolbox needs to last longer. It's virtually useless when 3 4 hooks are a stones throw away from each other. There are a few perks that don't seem very helpful or at least that I haven't noticed them be helpful. Someone explain to me when the Wraith unlocked the ability to attack you while retaining invisibility. Game glitches to the point were teammates can't be picked up and downed survivors can't be sensed*When the game recieves more updates down the road I might adjust my review depending on what the update does*
title: Dead by Daylight

review: This game is the perfect party game. If you have friends get this game. The gameplay is outstanding. The maps are fun. While the style can be offputting for example having the same texture for the closets you hide in for every map The game looks good. I wouldn't say its scary but you can be startled. If you don't have friends it'll still be fun but it's better when you have two or more friends playing with you.Pros Fantastic party game. Easily within my top ten favorite games to play with friendsAmazing gameplayAmazing mapsCreative perksVery good online playFun to play as both killer and survivorCons While the game is balanced for the most part it can be a nightmare to play with the killer being completley overpowered and unbalanced or a perk the surviors/killer has that makes everything impossible. For example there is a perk that makes every generator not work unless you cleanse an impossible to find token.There is no penalty or prevention of campingThree placements on the hook means your dead. So if youre getting camped and someone tries to save you you can immidiately be put back on the hook and killed.No explanation for how the killer you are facing works. Had no idea what the doctor could do so I lost based off of having no idea what was happening.8.6/10
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Product received for free. TL DR it's worth buying given the latest update and with the next update in line as long as earning characters isn't too dificult and hopefully they slow down gens a little bit.Since the time of my original review several much needed changes have been made and there are current y quite a few very important changes in the works for the next patch. Because of this I've changed my mind about the game.At the current point in time I would say that this game is worth the purchase. Vacuuming has been fixed a new quality killer has been added many of the survivor perks I previously took issue with are being reworked the lowest quality killers in the game are being reworked to make them more viable several killer perks are getting much needed reworks and all of the non licensed DLC has been made available through gameplay. Because of the combination of all these things I believe the game is worth buying now more than ever.I do still have some issues however. Generators are still completed far too quickly especially with a toolbox and even more so with the "brand new parts" add on and the cost of buying characters using iridescent shards is very high with a seemingly low rate of earning. With the update that made characters available via gameplay they modified iridescent shards and how they're earned. Now you earn shards by leveling up your profile which is done by simply playing the game. But int the beginning you earn very little with each level only ten per level up to level ten which is how much you used to earn from each match. From there it goes up to 195 at level 16 which sounds good in theory but I don't know how much more it'll increase later and I don't yet know if later levels require more exp. Level 15 and 16 both require 2 700. If they do have higher requirements the increase may be inadequate.Each killer in the game costs 9000 shards. That means it may take many hours to earn a single character but hopefully the shard gains will steadily increase and make it fair later on since gaining a new character will dramatically change the game experience for both parties adding to the variation and replayability of the game. Making it hard to get these characters without paying for them would mean that most people would play to the point of near boredom before they get a chance to do something new simply because they can't or don't want to spend extra money. But even so this is a step in the right direction for the consumer and I applaud them for making these changes.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: VVVVVVV EDIT 2 MONTHS AFTER RELEASE DOWN THE PAGE VVVVVVVGame is unfinished and unbalanced. On release and to this date wich is 3 weeks after release It is still impossible to play this game with your friends (other then private games wich don't give you any credits to upgrade your characters). Yet they were selling a 4 pack edition of a game that matches you with random people? After release people were complaining about the unability to queue up with friends and play but they said they were too busy going to E3 to patch it? I feel like the devs are laughing at my face releasing this game with such little content. Few maps no customization broken ranking system unable to play with friends and unbalanced. I might change my review when they patch the game but for now Would no recommend. 4/10EDIT We can now play with friends if you're willing to wait 15 minutes to find a game as 4 survivor! Tho is has been much better lately.New killer released the nurse obviously OP in anyone with a little experience with her. She can blink over walls this for great distance up to 3 4 blink almost impossible to juke unless the nurse jukes herself. this killer was made against the fundamentals of the game wich is hiding and running away to "safety" where there are pallets. Plus this patch they released a game breaking bug wich makes the killers attack with aimbot so they can never miss and have litteraly twice the attack range if not more. I still do no recommend this game RIGHT NOW oh and now they won't fix the game for a couple of days you know why? cause they are at some other gaming convention just like on release ) EDIT IT'S FINE NOW

review: Without a doubt when this game came out it was so fun but after all the updates and patches came out the killer is so overpowered and beyond effortless it is idiotic. I can play killer hook one person and still have over 10k. easy blood points. but on the reverse playing survivors is basically a beat down and punishment then if you want to survive with your friends its a 14 hr wait for a queue with more than 2 people. And each time I hear about a patch it just makes the killers so much more at an advantage. I really wish you could be challanged as a killer. Survivors are at such a disadvantage that if the killer can simply watch the victim its an effortless down and Iron grasp is basically a free hook. With tier 2 or better you can take a person to the basement from accross the map. And if the hooks regen then there is no effective counter to it. I hope that one day the developers pull their heads out of their asses and figure out this game is totally onesided.

review: Edit Wow blown away by the way the devs turned this game around. 2 years later I've picked the game back up after the whole F13 debacle and man this game is actually enjoyable now. My biggest gripe is not having perks compared to others and having to grind everything out but it's not that bad. Overall fun game for what it is.(original review from release)It's really a neat idea but sadly this game falls short of what it's aiming for. The game is about teamwork yet it has no way to matchmake with friends and no form of communication which really goes against the whole formula of 4v1. Even a pre set text wheel of things like "area clear" or "killer nearby" would mend this. Performance wise the game is subpar. Looks decent considering its UE4 but with no options other than "quality" (which is only low med high ultra) and a resolution slider. Going from a solid 60 fps at med then switching to high causes 20 35 fps is really annoying. Devs have no excuse for a lack of graphic settings in the year 2016.Most matches as survivor aren't very fun against a decent killer because its impossible to tell what is going on with your team if they arent in your line of sight. Levels are auto generated which I think is an issue because of the killer's much faster move speed which allows him to quickly get a layout of the map with nothing to deter him while survivors have to slowly pace around to avoid being spotted. In most of my matches I played I managed to get 2 3 generators up alone and would stop to help a team mate off a hook or heal them only to have them follow me and lead the killer to my hiding spot or get knocked right back down etc. Lack of communication is an awful idea.Playing as the killer is fun because it's fun to win multiplayer games. If you have a slight idea of the way the game plays you'll have a good time regardless. Balance wise I the whole 1 hit down mechanic of the Hillbilly is annoying when your team runs into you and stops you mid sprint or something. Wraith has the power to go invisible which imo in a game with 0 communication is too strong without it having a lot a negatives which it does not.The item/perk system is set up around whoever has played longer gets an advantage which isnt all a fun time for new players considering the killer is a one man team and has an advantage if one surivor is lacking items or perks. I played the beta a decent amount but still the game needs some major patches and after that I'll consider checking it out again. As someone who loved Evolve and was hoping to find a new home I'm sad to say this game is going to be my first refund.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: First time ever asking for a refund. The game looked like it was going to be awesome but what a let down. When you're a lvl 1 killer going up against a fully stacked lvled group of survivors with all super rare perks good luck. As the survivor its not so bad but I would like to kill people as well. As the killer you will spend most of your time playing ring around the rosey as they hop through the same 2 windows or fences. While you do this the others are turning on the generators and escaping. If you leave the game of ring around the rosey then they will just turn on the generator you left them by. Once you know the general lay out of the map its pretty hard to get killed as a survivor plus the added perks later on make you pretty untrackable or being able to be snuck up on. I get the survivors need to be quicker than the killer but to be able to just hop over the same things over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over... get my point. I can see how this game would be fun in a lan type setting or with a group of friends over vent or something but as of right now not so much. I guess I will get my serial killer fix when Friday the 13th game comes out this October. Really hope I get my very first refund.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: At first this game was fun. Getting found by a killer was horrifying and an adrenaline rush but now its just a nuisance. Killers seem to move must faster now than a few days ago. Ive read alot about hacked/cheating players....make sense now. Queue system is GARBAGE! It takes about 10 minutes for each round that my friend and I want to join a match together. Cant imagine trying to do it with 2 other friends as well. Playing as a killer can be just as frustrating. Players seem invisible and the scratch marks on the ground that are supposed to help do nothing to help. When you do catch someone they are able to wiggle away in less than 5 seconds. I wish i didnt have more than 4 hours into this game so I could get a refund. Also buying the deluxe edition makes this more irritating since it was almost double the cost and half the value.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: So I want to start off by saying that this recommendation is very hard to make at the game's current state. The game is a total blast I had tons of fun playing by myself. HOWEVER the biggest gripe I have with this game like everyone else is that there is no party system whatsoever. Do not go into this game expecting to play with your friends unless you have enough to play on your own private server. The monsters/bad guys/hunters are very creative and look creepy the game seems pretty damn well balanced and is a joy to play. I'm recommending this because of how fun it is and no doubt that there will soon be a party system implemented into the game. Even without friends though I still find this game addictive for both sides.

review: Entertaining gameplay however there are some major flaws.1) you can't play with your friends unless you have a full 5. This sucks because its rough to get 5 people together. It also means poeple are constantly leaving and joining lobbies to try and find their friends. Making the wait even longer.2) There is no ranking system. So the rank one players just ruin the experience for killers.3) It's plagued by a series of glitches. The somewhat clunky gameplay plus loading and joining glitches really just makes trying to get into a game an unpleasant experience.4) This one is more personal preference but I think having a random number generator in the core mechanics really ruins the game. It takes away a huge amount of skill. Sometimes players can get insanely good perk drops that can seriosuly make the game impossibgle for the opposition.All up its a really fun game but it needs some serious work before its worth $21.

review: I bought this game in its earlier days (December 2016). Originally Dead by Daylight is an asymmetrical killer game where a killer is chasing you until you'll die. The survivors have to repair at most 5 generators then they re able to escape. While repairing gens a killer is hunting you thought the entire map. When all gens have been repaired you can escape thought the exit doors. It s simple or?Yes it is but When I started playing as a survivor in December 2016 I thought this game is amazing but after a few months the game gets I don t know how I should say weirder crazier xD.When I was in the higher ranks the killers started camping and tunnelling. I recognized that the community is filled with s survivors AND killers. When you re playing Dead by Daylight it doesn t matter how you ll play well or badly. There might be a person who is playing as good as a pro and he lets you know how to play. The community is the first problem. Killers are crying because of decisive strike (a perk where you can escape from the killer s grasp) but you can counter this perk in 6 different ways Wtf and the whole killer community of this game is crying because of ONE ING PERK? The second problem are the developers. I understand that perks and the game have to be balanced but The game was balanced when the doctor was released. Then the development of the game decreased. The developers are just reinforcing the killers and the survivors gets weaker and weaker and weaker. It s possible to influence the survivors internet when lag switching as killer to get an advantage. Servers might be a solution! The third problem are the community managers and the balancing/performance of this game. The community managers do NOT think about your problems. If you have one hahahaha You ll still have it because no one will help you. (Dead by Daylight had a bug where you lost all your advance and WHEN but just WHEN they were helping you you had to wait at least 5 months.) The balancing IS a big problem. I said in a sentence before that killers are able to influence your internet and I think it s an absurdity in a game. While chasing it s not as impossible as you may think but sometimes you re sticking into a tree or in the grass. A new bug is that you can t move when the game begins so you have to disconnect and you get punished for it. Story of today I had a killer with 800+ hours in the game and he was hacking (speed hack) and a friend got banned because he left more than 20 times because of face camping killers Is just amazing how the developers are impressing me.You might heard about the new shop Just look in It s just unbelievable. I did the mistake and I bought outfits there for at least 35 (don t know the US/GB prices) and it was just a mistake. I spend 35 in 8 clothes and I can t put them on in real life (To sum up I can say Dead by Daylight is funny to play with friends and when you have aggressions it s a playground for you &gt I won t stop playing yet but when I ve found another game bb and gg Dead by Daylight.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Dead by Daylight is a competative online multiplayer game the unique scenario a slasher/horror type plot where you can play as either the survivors or the killer.The developers are very proactive with updates responding to both balancing issues and bug fixes. Games like this tend to lack re playability (as there are no variation in game modes) however the competative nature of this game creates and the large playerbase allows for plenty of variation for more than a few hours of entertainment. The real fun in this game is the suspense (as with a slasher/horror flick) which is largely reliant on how willing the killer is in indulging the survivors in a game of cat and mouse.Outside of the playing cometitively online there is also the option to play with your friends in closed matches (which can also be very fun).
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Dead By Daylight is a very very awesome game however it does have a lot of ups and downs.If you get frustrated VERY easily and are a really REALLY bad loser you'll hate this game very quick I'll list the reasons why.(Some things I will mention might spoil the way to play so BEWARE alright?)PROS AMAZING movement! The moving of camera is really good and you can easilly find your way around Amazingly different perks for each character you choose to play as You can be a full 'team and heal' player or the more 'I'll help but I'll leave quick too' player It's super intense when the killer is after you and when you stun them you feel downright AWESOME When you get a really good killer they are the ing best praise the outta them It's really nice to play with your soul mate(lover or whatever u like to call IT) hell ing yes it's the BEST team The graphics are AMAZING the characters are creative that being both killers and survivers Some glitches but they are pretty darn funny when you find them Every map is in 'the same area' depending on what map it is but is totally different so you can always end up surprisedCONS Toxic cummunity Killer's that wont play by the rules camp you so that other people can't get near you and then you DIE If a killer camps you and you call them out for it they'll be so rude you wish you stayed in your mom's womb More toxic community 'cause damn it is TOXIC Really the REAL 'killer' of this game(see what I did there?) is the community they will come and on you so seriously bewareThe game is cool though and with really good friends it can be a wonder to play. If you have never played it before I SERIOUSLY recommend playing with your friends through 'training' rounds it's an option where you 'can kill your friends'. It's sickly good for practice and better than just jumping right into the game and ending up getting a killer or two survivors who lost connection to the server.AT LAST A word of advice IF you are dealing with a camper killer signal the other's by waving your arms(attempt to escape but don't go through with it) to tell them to stay away or tell them before the game starts that if a killer camps you they should just work on the generators because the killer is losing a sick amount of precious time guarding your hanging dying body.Oh and lastly The Doctor sucks the Doctor.
