review: Dead by Daylight... A brilliantly designed game by Behaviour Digital Inc. The graphics are good a bit dark at some points but an overall beautiful game. The game itself has 4 players and many characters to choose from to play as. Their goal is to escape from the killer. The killer can choose from 4 different killers which all have a unique perk that will allow them to kill faster and/or easier. When you activate a generator it notifies the killer where you are making your adrenaline rush your heart beat faster until he gets in view. You cannot outrun the killer your only choice is to jump through windows knock over boards or to hide if he looses sight of you for a minute. If all the players but 1 die a secret hatch will unlock better find it before the killer if he does you cannot escape unless you open the doors while he guards the hatch and when he sees you trying to go for the door you can run around him and go to the hatch. A few minor glitches here and there also balancing levels is not the best but this game has true potential in the future. I am excited to see what they have in store for their next big update/DLC. The Last Breath Chapter captured an ayslum feel a nurse who can "blink" to kill you and a new survivor was added. A new map was also added even though I have never played on it due to random maps and usually getting the same two I have seen what it looks like and its a thrill!
title: Dead by Daylight

review: With the premise that I do not like leaving reviews of a game I've only played barely 10 hours I consider this a fantastic game when it comes to mechanics but it has so many flaws like everything after all.Of those barely 10 hours the vast majority has been spent pressing "JOIN A LOBBY" and shortly after having to press it again and again and once again. This game needs some serious attention to its lobby system and how players create/join lobbies because as of now it kind of ruins the player experience especially as a casual player who just wants to pop in for a couple of hours and actually play for at least one and half hour of those.Other than that I like the artistic concept... but boy are they heavy. I run the game at max resolution and high settings on a 4K screen and a solid frame rate. Yet the 3D graphics look quite poor.Moving onto the sound and music. Spot. On. Everything feels immersive and suspensful. I got used to the Wraith's jump scares ok little note just a second why on Earth would you even consider giving stealth to a killer in a game like Dead by Daylight is far beyond my comprehension.. like isn't the game scary enough? It sure is for me! and still everytime I hear that heartbeat or even that warning for skill checks while repairing a generator I swallow a little piece of my heart.I'm looking forward to seeing how the game development progresses especially with new characters killers and possibly game modes. As of now I'd recommend the game 110%.
title: Dead by Daylight

title: Dead by Daylight

review: A fun game that you will find wastes a few hours of your day. The gameplay is fun if not slightly repetitive from both killer/survivor. High replayability given it's competitive multiplayer. However both survivor and killer can be frustrating to play. This is *for the most part* because of a mix of bugs/exploits (see the pages of random reports on the community discussions page for specifics) that can ruin a game often enough to be annoying. The reason this does not make this review negative is because I find the game fun to play! The devs are hardworking and listen to their community and are actively fixing the game's problems. When the game works right it works extremely well. When it doesn't it's either very frustrating or very humorous. So if you enjoy 4v1 multiplayer within a horror environment and are willing to support the devs through a somewhat rocky launch by all means pick this game up and join the mass murdering fun! Many people are posting negative reveiws about this game because of numerous nitpicky complaints that really don't affect gameplay often enough to ruin the experience. As an example at the very beginning of the game's launch many people posted negatives because friend to friend multiplayer wasn't exsistent. This was a bad move by the devs but it was deliberate. It was deliberate because it would shift the balance of the game towards the well coordinated teams. Though the devs openly said this the community didn't care. So it was implemented early with barebones funcionality because of the community's impatience. Now what do the reviews say? That it's broken and makes it too hard for killers to play. See a problem there? Again I will repeat if you like this genre of game and are even slightly interested and don't mind the once in a while bug that are indeed being fixed as this review is being written don't be turned away by some of the whiny negatives this game is worth it!
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Dead by Daylight is a 1 v 4 game with 4 survivors trying to outlast one killer. The survivor's goals are to start up the generators and get the escape door open all while having to outrun the killer and save their teamates from death. The killer's goals are to catch as many survivors as they can and stop them from escaping the compound. It's essentially a cat and mouse game chasing each other and running from each other. What makes the game fun is the suspense built in. It's not like any other horror game that tries to fill the scary aspects with jumpscares. When you hear the heartbeats getting faster but you can't see where the killer is it really does turn into a scary game.I loved the beta and I love the full game even more. There's a decent amount of content from types of survivors killers items perks maps and the large amount of skill building built into the game. If you want a game that includes suspense and fear while also being a challenging game with lots of content to explore I would definitely reccomend Dead by Daylight.

Auto Aim for killers (I'll never understand why...)13. A low cost game your game files are in your computer so it's very easy to change them you can have items bloodpoints perks etc. (there's just a system that verify your integrity of files and you can get ban for this but it'll be much safer to store your game files in a database) the match is hosted by the killer (game doesn't have servers) so if he has a poor pc or a bad internet connection all the players will have lag.Pro FUN when u play with someone.So don't buy this game is too expensive for a low cost game.

review: I'm redoing my review for DbD considering that it has seen a lot of changes since I last reviewed the game. (My review was more of a first impressions after 20 hours of gameplay kind of deal) So overall I'm very happy to say that those changes have been positive for the game. While the game is still rough on newcomers it is significantly less so especially from the killer PoV. The devs even included tutorials on how to play survivor and kiiller which is a great touch. (It's free BP to do them even for veteran players)So my intial review touched on the hatch game and that was one of the only things from my list of complaints that hasn't changed. I have however grown lukewarm to the idea of the hatch. It doesn't really...bother me like it did when I first started and I think that has more to do with the fact that I don't care if I 4k or not as killer. This game does that to you with enough experience. At some point I just take victories as me pipping and even will farm with the survivors and let them get the hatch if I'm feeling nice.In regards to the matchmaker...that is also still bad in a way because of rank reset and I can see people complaining about rank 1 survivors/killers bullying new rank 20's. However I have heard that they are fixing this soon by limiting the rank you can be reset to so rank 20 players will never see rank 1's anymore unless they buy the game on a separate account.The pallet vacuum was also removed not too long ago which really increased the skill level required to play survivor and really helped out the killer side to not be a frustrating mess to play. I can't commend the devs enough for this change. I know I may be a little biased because I'm a killer main but I do like things hard on me as a survivor. You're probably noticing a pattern by now the devs seem to be really looking into this game's issues and listening to the community.Really the only broken things left in this game are honestly just DS and NOED which is incredible considering how many balance issues this game had a year ago when I intially made this review. The Nurse is also broken when played right let's be honest but she also demands a high skill and memory to play her to her max potential so I think it's alright she remains the way she is. It was one of the complaints I had with this game the killers *should* be scary...and the Nurse at least accomplishes that.So all in all I recommend this game to any survival horror fans or just anybody who loves slasher movies in general. It's a steal at the current price considering how fast you can be addicted to this game and pour tons of hours into it. This game thankfully has a high skill cap that is always rising but is also somewhat casual at the same time for beginners to intitially get into. There is some frustration to be had left in this game but from what I can tell the devs have been hard at work on fixing this games many problems so those last few frustrations may finally meet their end. To that I say cheers!
title: Dead by Daylight

review: To have 800 hours in this game the most I have ever spent on a single game and to say that this game isn't my favorite would be ludicrous. I've mained survivor for 500 hours for the past year and a half. And more recely have been maining killer for the latter 300 hours. I've been playing dbd for nearly two years now. And my relationship with the game has been an up and down roller coaster. The devs work hard to make new content and please everyone but the fact is that it's impossible. Bewarned the dbd community is pretty toxic which is one con I have with the game. People like to degrade others in post and pre game chat to boost their own egos from a loss or their current negative mood.There are a lot of bugs and balance (b/w killer and survivor) issues with the game. I even lost my save file because of the bug and lost my legacy skins and rare items. But despite this I keep coming back to this game. This game can be quite addicting while being very repetitive. The devs try to fix their problems by releasing killers that hot patch the problem but neglect the other killers that run into the same probelm as well. This has been a theme of the dbd devs. Can't hit 360s? Leatherface.Gens going too fast? Ruin.Gens still going too fast? Make bnp have skill checks instead.Gens STILL going too fast? The Pig. Don't get me wrong. The devs work extremely hard on their game but their solution to fixing the balance of the game is not well thought out and any fixes to the bugs or exploits can be slow at times. PROs Sense of skill and reward " the devs are doing a pretty good job so far" Fun to play with your friends (multiplayer) For andrenaline junkies New killers Occasional festive holiday events Sense of early progression The jukes and rewards Bullying the killer Tea bagging Double Blood point events CONs Ragequitters/DCers/Hackers/Farmers Lack of skill with crutch perks Toxicc community There's a game in this bug Updates can hurt the game even more (audio bugs) Lots of complaining on both sides Bullying the killer Tea bagging Very grindy and repetitive
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Incredible game if you don't mind the bugs. The bugs are the real killer though. I was matched up and the game was on the loading screen just to be kicked out one too many times this time. You might be in a group of 4 friends and one person might not load up forcing them to wait for the others to finish their game. Also for some reason you can't keep your same group. After every match you go back into single player mode and pressing "Join a Lobby"will have you join another group of 3 people. You have to exit the screen select "Survive with Friends" and reinvite your friends after every match. This game is just way too buggy. You'll have moments of fun and moments of utter dissapointment becasue of a bug. I never complain about bugs if it's an early release game but game has been out for well over a year. Devs should have kept this in Early Access until they've got rid of the major bugs that plague this game. Very frusterating.

review: To start off don't get me wrong with this bad recommendation. I write this review to prevent new players from buying it right now and getting disappointed by this great game.The game itself I really love the concept and how the game is made.Once in a while I start playing the game and after about 30 hours I leave it for a month or 2 and come back at it again. Well when the last DLC and big update 2.0.0 came out I really wanted to start playing. And here comes the part why I'm really not recommending the game in the state it's in now. Since the last update the game has a very annoying bug which causes major FPS drops and a very laggy experience. Which for me makes this game pretty much unplayable. And I'm sure alot of people who wants to start playing will refund the game after experiencing this.Will get back at this review then the bug is fixed!

review: Played this game since it first came out. Liked the game more when it first came out as it was mainly hide and seek with a killer. Now it's more like an objective rushing game.It's great fun for groups of friends playing together however playing with friends disadvantages the killer. If you play killer with a controller you will also be at a disadvantage because the mouse people can turn on a dime.The gameplay feels the same everygame. One of the best strats while playing survivor is to loop around pallets until you need them. The gameplay at that point for the killer and survivor is nothing more than looping. It should be called a circle running simulator and is as tiring as running circles in real life. The toxic people have lessened quite a bit but I wouldn't recommend this to children or sensitive people. It's worth buying on sale.

I recommend this game to everyone who likes a little bit of horror and some really thrilling survival even if you play solo this game is great.Something I really would like that they add isIn Game Voice chatDon't get me wrong here guys most of the players in this game are really team friendly they will help you for the cost of their lifes. review: The game itself is pretty wonderful . I love the asymmetric 4v1 game that they have created. If I were basing this review on the gameplay review I would definitely recommend this game. There is something that will stand in your way when you're trying to play it though and that is the matchmaking. As of right now there isn't really a group matchmaking feature when you want to play a survivor. Even if you aren't trying to group with friends this feature not existing will still affect you. People will be constantly joining and leaving your lobby in order to find the game that their friend or friends are in. This means if you queue as a killer you could spend maybe even 20 minutes like I currently am between games waiting for 4 survivors to ready up in your lobby. Conceptually I underdstand why they didn't add group queue. I believe they wanted to add this atmospheric horror element of being alone. The issue is it heavily affects gameplay because there is a good chance you won't even be able to play unless you have all the time in the world to just sit there and wait.Update I sat in a lobby as a killer waiting as I wrote this review and it's been over 30 minutes and have had hundreds of people join and leave my lobby. If they don't fix this feature this game will not last.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Great game that's ruined by indefensable bugs and balance issues. Apparently the devs couldn't wait and finish it before release. Even after a public "beta" and over a month of being "released" I would consider this game to have just barely graduated from alpha status. Some issues are so blantant that you can tell the devs are just straight up not testing their game. This game has put Behaviour and Starbreeze on my "watch out" list.That being said the game at its core is crazy good. But between the bugs and other players DC ing I just can't do it anymore. If only they didn't rush it out and fixed all the major bugs first this game would be a GotY contender. By my reckoning we'll be well into 2017 before they get through fixing most of the issues. Hopefully I'll be able to write a more positive review then and not a more disappointed one.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: This game is an awesome asymmetrical multiplayer take on survival horror. There is constant balancing but that is the nature of asymmetrical multiplayer. The game itself is a blast to play. There is some fantastic original content and every game can be different.Unfortunately the developers show a complete disregard for their community show biased behavior towards huge partnered streamers (because they don't have a marketing dept. so they rely on Twitch) and have had game breaking bugs since release (at this time of writing about 7 months) that have YET to be fixed. I haven't ever experienced a patch of this game that has completely working matchmaking and it's a multiplayer only game.In conclusion a great idea with some fantastic original content and ideas. Poorly executed. Developers focusing on DLC instead of solidifying the game. Don't recommend until they get it together and fix every aspect of the game (balancing not included).

title: Dead by Daylight

review: Dead by Daylight Four survivors try and activate 5 generators scattered across a level in order to restore the power to the exit gates. All the while they are being hunted by one of three killers who have to incapacitate and place survivors on sacrificial hooks scattered about the level. Survivors view in 3rd person and detect the killer based on vicinity. Killers view in 1st person and detect survivors based on direct line of sight within a certain distance straight ahead. Survivors running is slightly slower than the Killer's base speed. When a survivor is hit they get an initial adrenaline burst of speed. Survivors are typically running walking or crouching about bushes and trees. Killers dash around the map patrolling generators. Survivors being chased can use the environment to escape their hunter. Such options are knocking debris behind them forcing the killer to either go around get hit and stunned or break the obstacle jumping through windows (which can be done quietly if you aren't sprinting) and hiding inside closets (crows appear atop the closet if you stay too long). Certain actions are loud and alert the killer to where they occured. There are a few spots where the killer has no hope of getting you but it is balanced in that you aren't being productive while being a troll so it's fine. This game has ridiculous strategy involved. You need to change your playstyle depending on who is hunting you or who you are playing as. The Wraith has a bell that he rings to turn invisible though it takes time. The Hillbilly has a chainsaw that when charged allows him to dash at an incredible speed until he hits something. THe trapper uses bear traps around the map. There are a few items survivors can equip before games to change the way they play. Someone with a medkit may stop repairing a generator and prioritize healing themself or others. The flashlight may make you more likely to act heroically as if the killer is carrying someone and is blinded by light the killer will be stunned and drop his victim. The map sucks. The toolbox is amazing but rare. It lets you either repair generators faster or dismantle two or three hooks. The skeleton key allows you to escape a bit earlier through the hatch. The hatch is an alternative escape option made available once there are two or less generators and you're the last alive. It is difficult to find but once in vicinity you'll hear an obvious sound. Buy this game.
title: Dead by Daylight

And why dlc of your own design (and not under licenses like Halloween or Saw) are now purchasable and not free since the huntress ? We already bought a game and now we must pay to access its full content and you are making correction of the meta trough the dlc with the new perks counter meta ? Is that supposed to mean we have to pay to stop getting hammered against strong killers or survivors ? Well if its indeed what it is supposed to mean its really sad. I belive this game can't be perferct and have a perfect balanced gameplay because on side will always be better than the other but killers are not fun to play anymore its more frustating than anything. I just would like to understand the direction the game is aiming to but its pretty much obvious with the new shop system... Money is more important than the amusement of players nowadays only numbers really counts.By the way why ochido can still play this game after getting ban ? Don't get me wrong i still love the game and it's still really fun to play but some games can really test your nerves pretty bad

review: ORIGINAL POST FROM AUGUST 21 2016. UPDATED INFO BELOW.A really solid premise bogged down by horrible matchmaking and lack of basic features. First and foremost there's no real way to communicate with your teammates even when they're right next to you. I understand the idea of it being a horror scenario but seriously if I was in the woods with three others and there was a psychopath chasing us I'd sure as hell tell them "DON'T GO THAT WAY" if I'd just escaped from them. There's no real way that I've seen to play with your friends either against others the "Survive with Friends" button on the menu seems bugged either that or it simply wasn't setting up parties right because nobody could join any games I was in due to "failure to connect" issues. On top of that from what I understand even if you CAN get it to work playing with friends immediately negates your ability to earn any kind of experience. That part is not from experience but if its true that's just all the more disappointing. However you can always just join random public lobbies right?More than anything that can ruin any multiplayer game is poor sportsmanship. As a killer you should have the same courtesy as in any other multiplayer game and refrain from camping your target. In this game this manifests as if the killer catches you and puts you on a hook to be sacrificed they can and often do simply sit there and watch you die. The killer is invincible so there's nothing you or your team can do to stop them. Even if you manage to free yourself (good luck) one good smack before you fully recover your controls and you're on the floor and back on the hook now unable to free yourself as you're in struggle mode. Play as the killer and try to be a good sport by not camping? If you then fail to kill everyone prepare to be mocked mercilessly post game as trash and noobish for letting people get free from the hook. So either ruin the game for somebody potentially as soon as less than a minute into the round if they're extremely unlucky or deal with toxic hateful attitudes. Furthermore matchmaking on its own is literally only there to set up games (if you're willing to wait for the queues) there's certainly no "matching" going on. Four new players fresh off the bus at rank 20 getting matched against a rank 8 killer? No thanks.This is a fun enough game but I can only honestly suggest trying it on a free weekend on a good sale (50% off or more) or if you have four buddies to have a good time with. Its a shame cause it really is a fun concept and the couple rounds I had where folks were friendly pre and post game were awesomely tense and very enjoyable. It just has too many flaws with the general community and lack of matchmaking balance.UPDATE 9/24/18 So after convincing some of my friends to try it with me for the F2P week I got to see what two years difference made in development. I have to say I am very very pleased. I'm going to keep my original statements above as a contrast but I can very happily say I can now recommend this game. Here's why I've changed my mind.The number of killers has significantly increased adding a much more varied experience as a survivor and keeping you on your toes as to what you'll deal with next. My personal "favorite" is playing against the Pig as she is absolutely terrifying to encounter against a good player. We escaped on my first encounter with her but very narrowly and it was thrilling all the way through.I use "we" because this time I was able to play with friends and I'm pleased to say that whatever caused the bug two years ago has been completely resolved. We experienced absolutely no trouble joining up to survive together. Furthermore the ability to communicate and try to coordinate made the game as fun as I'd hoped it could be and then even more. What was originally intended as a quick few rounds to record for my Halloween videos turned into nearly three hours of terror laughter and good ol' spooky fun!Also I was in error originally or maybe it was due to a patch but experience is earned while playing with friends AS LONG as you're all survivors playing against a random killer. You don't earn experience in "Kill Your Friends" mode only.The last and most significant detail I've noticed is a remarkably improvement in player behavior and sportsmanship. We still ran into a couple players who were less than sportly but being able to communicate allowed us to punish their camping tactics effectively. Furthermore most post game chat was very friendly and in good spirits which is an incredible departure from my previous experience.Assuming this wasn't just a fluke caused by an influx of super friendly players on the F2P week (which lets be honest how often does that happen in F2P promotions?) then these changes for the better have convinced me this is absolutely a game worth your time. Triple that if you've got some buddies to survive together with. Dig in this October for some good tense spooks!

title: Dead by Daylight

review: I don't think I've ever asked for a refund for a game and I was really looking forward to this. Not only is it a nightmare to get into a game with a friend either play with friends only in a private match (which means you need at least 5 people that are friends the game for a full match) or the craziest way keep hitting join and hope that you end up in the same lobby (me and my friend tried for half an hour and it never happened. We ended up going on forums to find people to play with. The entire time the game chat doesnt work in the game and steam chat doesnt either because the game takes control of the mike. But all those technical issues aside the gameplay itself just isn't that good. The atmosphere is fantastic and for the most part I think the game looks pretty decent. However after playing two rounds I soon identified that there were dominant strategies when playing as the survivors which you could just pull off over and over again. I first noticed when I was being a spectator after dying (which btw is incredibly boring as you can barely see anything with the way the camera is tilted). I found as a survivor there were dominant strategies that gave them a huge advantage and made it almost impossible for the killer to catch them...which ruined the fun. The fact that you can't actually kill the survivors yourself is a disappointment too. You can't deliver the finishing blow. You knock the player down and drag them to a hook where they stay until their time depletes or another player saves them. The game mode gets quite repetitive very quickly and I only played a handful of rounds. It's a shame. It's a game I really want to like but you spend a frustrating amount of time trying to get the game going and once you finally get to play the buzz is already somewhat gone and the shortcomings of the gameplay just hit you that little harder. I love the Idea I hope they fix the technical issues and tweak some gameplay elements. They've clearly worked hard on this game but I don't think it's fair to have released it in its current state and if feels like far more play testing should have been done so for now I'm out.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: I'm going to start this off with this is my first review. I'm a horror fan movies novels games anyhow you get the jest. I stumbled upon this game while browsing the market place and read about it. Right away I was captivated with the premise of the game. So I did some research watched some gameplay videos online and decide to give it a shot. I came into this game with a open mind and after playing it for over 12 hours I gotta say it's fresh it's addicting and it's a good change of scenery from games I normally play (A lot of FPS) The concept of this game is simple yet fun. It seems to have a small following that continue to support it and I must say I will be one of them. The only thing that bothers me with this game some members of the community. My biggest pet peeve is the players who swarm the hooks right away and you can see them because they clearly suck at stealth. Then they expect you to leave the victim on the meat hook and run away so that they can help them down the second you turn your back. Wrong If I see them lurking and not even bothering to hide I'm going to stay around that area to ensure they don't F### with my sacrifice... then at the end of the game I get called a camper because I never ran away to let you get down your buddy. Just boils my blood when they expect a victory to be handed to them in a 4v1 match.All in all it's a fun game and it's blast to play in a group of friends. I'm interested in seeing where the developers go from here. Can't wait for some new killers.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: I'll start this review off by saying the game is incredibly fun with friends while also having a lot of intense moments. There are some issues with certain areas of the game but that is not what gives the game a thumbs down from me. The problem is the ridiculously long wait times. I'm not talking 3 minutes I'm not talking 10 minutes I'm talking 30 minute wait times. On a weekend on the east coast of the US at 9 p.m. on a saturday it took us 50 minutes to find a game and this was with 22 000 people currently playing. Granted the wait times only apply if you are playing as a survivor as killers have no problems finding matches most of the time. Only buy this game if you don't mind 30 minute wait times every other game.

review: 100% recommend this game to anyone looking for something like this.I started playing after I saw Jacksepticeye and Markiplier playing it so I downloaded it back before all the DLC after the huntress started coming out. It's a lot scarier than you think because things happen so unexpectedly and every game you play is different. Being the killer is a lot harder than you think it is when you're first starting out but it provides a good challenge which is always a really good characteristic to have in a game.My sister and I regularly play together. I only have 115 hours on record due to not playing in a long while after FNAF came out but my sister has nearly 1k hours and is incredibly good at it. We have a good giggle playing this game.The only negative thing I think is how OP some of the killers seem. I know a lot of stuff got nerfed after the initial release but some of the stuff does still make a couple of them seem pretty OP compared to the survivors or even other killers. But I digress.I would 110% recommend this to anyone who is wondering about it. Love this game a lot.

review: Updated since the developers have full control of the game it has gotten alot better and alot of balance issues have been addressed. This is a great cat and mouse game. But there is tons of things that this game could be but if they want it to continue they have to figure out what their roots are especially with survive with friends. Do they want the game to be fun for 4 suvivors and 1 killer? Or just the suvivors. Why because the game makes suvivors OP when they can talk to each other if its 4 friends vs one killer it takes on a form of bullying they don't need perks to be successful because they can just chat over voip system and coordinate gaining up on the killer. The game sometimes feels like wack a mole with you constantly having to bat away the survivors as they swarm you for finally getting one of their own. In the meantime they can heal up and go back in until their buddy gets away. The ranking system needs some work why because if you join a game with friends (were you have the advantage of talking and coordinating) you then get not even close to your average level. I can be rank 17 killer and face off against 4 friends were a couple will be 15+ with two over rank 10 or one as high as rank 5. It would make sense to have the friendgroups go against higher rank killers because they have the advantage of coordinating so instead of the killer rank 17 vs a average suvivor group of 13 have the killers rank be 1or 2 higher then the friend group rank. If you want to play a murder game cat and mouse just know that the cat gets soundly beaten or has to employ tactics that people will whine and complain about such as camping over patrolling a set generator area use special in game "currency" purchased items to give them a clear advantage. The game does rank resets on the 13th of every month. What this means is that all the rank 1 suvivors drop a couple ranks so they can completely destory the killers at the lower ranks again which just creates massive frustration for the low rank killers because they are getting smoked by players with 300 hours and decked out perks.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: If I could I'd give this game a mixed rating. It's mostly quite enjoyable but at times you'll get a game which kills your mood instantly.The game's ratings are mixed for a reason. The core gameplay is fun and I personally like the characters and sounds a lot.The community though is very toxic. There's a lot of tension between the killer and survivor side. Killers complain about survivors who use overpowered perks (and some of them really are) and survivors complain how easy it is to play the killer (which is true in some aspects) etc. Personally I don't care about this stuff.However what I do care about is how people are playing. Killers facecamping and tunneling and survivors pallet looping. I simply don't understand why people keep doing it. I avoid doing these things because it just isn't fun for either side.The sad thing is that the devs constantly make changes that do not make the situation any better. For example recently they made it so that survivors can't recover from being exhausted while running (before you just recovered much slower while running which was fine imo). By nerfing the survivors' exhaustion perks they encourage the killers to tunnel and punish the survivors for surviving a chase long enough. There's plenty of changes like this for both sides which encourage toxic gameplay.So all in all I recommend this only if you are prepared to be dissapointed periodically because of patches and the community itself.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: I would definately recommend this game. At first it is quite shoking (and it sometimes is shoking even after I played it for longer time). The best and at the same time worst moments are when the killer kills you by himself (not by hanging you). I would recommend to play the game together with friends (in survivor mode) since that's easier to handle. You can coordinate what you do and therefor play better. If you play alone it can happen that other survivors leave you alone and you're soon dead (but that doesn't happen all the time).One bad thing for me I could NEVER play the killer. Whenever I tried that I was in the lobby for ever and never had a survivor joining me (and no my profile wasn't private at that time). I would really love to get at least some bots in such cases so you can at least try to play the killer.

review: Oh what to say. This game is amazing. Its shocking how fun and addictive a game like this would be. You would think repairing generators would get old. Nope. Its intense at all times. From powering the generators to running out of the gates and escaping last second from being killed. The bloodweb is a great feature. Sure it may seem a bit grindy but when your having so much fun its like a bonus. The lore in this game is amazing. The Dead by Daylight Wiki has all the lore that I love. I dont play the killer much simply because im terrible at it but i see how it can be really fun and exciting.EDIT This was a long time ago. The developers are VERY BAD. They have practically ruined the game. They cant make a good ranking system and they cant balance survivors vs killer. Its ridiculous. Flashlights were OP for a whole year where the dev then played against it at an event and finally realized how bad it was. RIDICULOUS.

review: This game is a tricky one. On one hand it can be fun and I could actually take it competetively sometimes. But there is a serious balancing issue that made me and many of my friends stop playing it. There is a clear meta that is really hard to avoid. Hard camping hooks is the most infuriating things this game has to offer. I used to love this game. But I can't bring myself to play it anymore. Maybe I'm just bad but that is enough to make me not enjoy this game as much as I could've. The DLCs are just too much money for a character or t shirt. I bought a few of the DLCs before. But I never realized how expensive they are until I got a job and made my own money. Maybe it's because I'm not making a lot but I just know I can't afford them. Looking back on this game I can say that it really isn't worth the money you would have to spend to experience the full game. It is nice they add free killers and survivors. But there are only 3 that I know of out of 10. You also have 4 DLCs with just clothes I can let those slide however because they don't help you in game. But DLC characters feel more fun to play as well as more effective in my opinion. The final problem for me is even if it was perfectly balanced and all DLC was perfect and either free or at least cheaper. The game would still be boring. The color pallet is bland and dull. Sure it's supposed to be gritty and dark because it's somewhat of a horror game. But after a while it gets boring to look at. The characters have stopped being original and are just movie characters. They did make the rabbit chick with axes which is cool. But in the last 4 DLCs only one is an original character (Which is Curtain Call. If it is in a movie I haven't seen nor heard about it.) The rest being Leatherface Freddy Krueger and Saw Pig. I don't see anything cool about the movie tie in characters other than "Hey I know that movie! I want to give you my life savings because I recognize the character!" Which isn't really appealing to me. I just can't recommend this game anymore.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Product received for free. I really enjoy playing this game and every bit of content it holds and has. It is a shame that console players do not get updates as fast however I do understand it is not as easy transfering over and the fact they even do is great. I would definitely recommend this game if you like multiplayer games in which are not exactly fast or slow. It is interesting the concept of one killer versus 4 survivors and the overall characters make it even better. I personally prefer the Huntress and will definitely continue playing. My tip to any new players would be to test waters for both killer and survivor to test what you might prefer. I learned very quickly but continue to grow as both. It is a bit tough if you play survivor alone but you can eventually get used to it as you earn perks and level up each character. I feel this game has a great community and a good dev team who often answer many questions the players give.

title: Dead by Daylight

review: So Dead by Daylight. There are many things to be said about this game but we're going to start with the negatives. Let me start by saying that this game is at its worst when you play with randoms. If you don't have at least one friend to play this with and aren't good at making friends then this may not be the game for you. Playing with randoms can be infuriating. Randoms in this game in my experience are almost always in it for themselves. This game is VERY much about teamwork which doesn't help when your teammates are leading the killer to you to save themselves unhooking you for the points but not caring enough to check if the killer is near (or sometimes they flat out do it on purpose) not even worried about helping anyone on hooks leaving once the gate is open and not sticking around to help others etc.. I could go on and on about randoms and how it's so hard to get matched with good players. Speaking of matching with players most of the games i've joined by myself have this issue where they take forever to find a fourth player. I'm pretty sure it has to do with the lack of dedicated servers and the fact that every killer i've ever played against has a ping of at least 3 digits (usually higher than 150). Don't get me started on the loading times *rolls eyes*. Another negative and boy is this a negative is the ever lurking presence of cheaters. It's all too often that you'll have a killer that is completely immune to pallets or they'll 'glitch' through them or they'll be faster than possible or they'll know exactly where you're at at all times (given there are a number of perks that deal with that but on the end match screen you can usually see that these people aren't running any of them). This game has a bunch of glitches and issues so be aware of that before purchasing.Okay that's enough of the negative let s move on to the positive. In an age of mass oversaturation of games in popular genres it is unbelievable to me that there are not enough asymmetrical games that actually pull it off like DBD. Dead by Daylight does it very well. It is one of the most simple concepts and yet it is so entertaining and keeps you coming back. It amazes me how a one trick pony of a game like this can fool you into thinking how diverse of an experience it is. That feeling of satisfaction and relief you get when your entire team makes it out there's nothing like it. It's not the most balanced game but it's actually functional and for the most part fair in it's mechanics. I mentioned earlier that this game is at its worst when you go solo well when you've got your team assembled this game is at its absolute best. Communication (besides for giving you obvious advantages) helps to make this game even more suspenseful and entertaining than it already is. Countless times you'll hear friends screaming and their pants because they're in a chase and it's an amazing experience. You're going to get the best out of this game with a full team of four but really all that you need for an optimal experience is a partner. With all of the above I'm going to leave you by saying that despite the numerous issues I recommend this game especially if you get the squad together. The fun I've had here outweighs the anger and frustration I've felt. All in all I think it's an entertaining and unique experience that everyone should give a chance. I will say though that you should definitely watch some gameplay and determine if it's for you because this game will not be for everyone. Anyways I hope you found this helpful!
title: Dead by Daylight

review: I would recommend this game if you have friends. The game is only fun if you have friends otherwise don't bother getting the game. I enjoy this game but this game has so many flaws. The Devs don't even really care about this game and is just trying to make money off of us. The balancing is so bad killers complain about how hard it is to kill survivors but mostly everytime I join a game and the game starts the killer ends up finding me first and probably hooking me plus killers are able to lunge and have a long range which makes no sense because killers are faster than survivors so why are they able to lunge or have a ridiculous range. The killers are so more overpowered then the survivors like it ain't even fun. Then just trying to join a lobby takes forever. Even when it is just me I have to restart my game like 4 times before I could even get into a match because I am always in an infinite loading screen so I have to restart my game like all the time. Also there are so many bugs and glitches and the Devs barely try to fix it. Once I tried unhooking my teammate but then I got glitched and got stuck or there was this one glitch where killers were able to get the Hill Billy's chainsaw when they weren't even playing the Hill Billy. It took the Devs forever to fix this glitch and it was annoying whenever I played a killer that had a chainsaw that wasn't the Billy. This game has many flaws but I love playing it with friends. It is up to you if you decide you want to get this game and play it.

When you're in the Lobby of a new match and all 5 Players are there. If one player leaves the Lobby it takes forever to get a new 5th player. I think the Lobbies with 4 Player should be filled first then those with 3 Players 2 Players and so on. This way nobody has to wait too long.2. I would appreciate some kind of Cheat Protection. Sometimes it really feels like the killer has some kind of Wallhack. Althoug it could just be my opinion any kind of protection would be good )But this is just nitpicking. The game is a milestone in gameplaying in my opinion. It's a kind of game i've waited for since ages! To me the best game since Left4Dead 2.

review: Dead by Daylight is a 1v4 survival arena type game. 4 players play as survivors where their mission is to activate enough generators to power the exit gate so that they can escape the arena.1 player plays as the killer whose mission is to kill as many survivors as possible.The game is a battle of wits filled with fear adrenaline and a tiny bit of luck. In a one on one situation the killer usually has the advantage which means the survivors have to work together if they want to escape.I've played almost since the beginning and so far no killer or survivor has been unfairly over powered. However it will take some time to properly understand how to avoid each killer as they are all equipped with a different set of skills.The game plays well a few bugs but almost none that breaks the game and/or hinders intended gameplay.A great buy definitely worth the price.
title: Dead by Daylight

title: Dead by Daylight

review: I think I soiled myself! No really I did (This is a game that caters to both the inner sociopath and the inner socialite. The premise is simple. 4 nervous survivors attempt to outwit and evade 1 of 6 (i think) twisted psychotic killers and escape the level. This is done by the simple act of powering up 5 generators to give power to the level gates. Simple enough and actually a tad repetitive after a while. However each game still manages to inject just enough suspense excitement and fear to keep you coming back. Teamwork pays off but you can be the selfish type and just try to ensure your own survival. Perks and items collected from crates or from levelling up will make your survival a little easier.....maybe.As a killer you play a sometimes frustrating game of cat and mouse attempting to find chase and capture survivors so you can hang them from meat hooks.....yes that's right finally we can do what we've always wanted to ) The killers are all different with their own skills perks playstyle etc and it's difficult to select a favourite as they all play so differently.The trapper sets his traps and attempts to lure or chase his prey onto them. The hillbilly charges across the map maniacally swinging his chainsaw. The wraith is a stealthy stalker etc etc.Maps are all dark and misty very atmospheric in some cases. The graphics in general are nothing to write home about. The textures of the characters in general are pretty poor and the killers seem to be lacking something. However you won't notice it you'll be far too busy screaming "OH FECK OH FECK" as you dash frantically across the map leaping walls and throwing pallets down behind you in an attempt to lose the 7 foot tall hatchet wielding psychopath who seems intent on having you around for dinner.In conclusion a very good game. Suspenseful tactical and rewarding for those that learn to play. My only gripe so far is the community or parts of it at least but its no worse than many others. There have also been a few serverside issues that can cause problems joining a game but that's a minor issue as it doesnt happen often.
title: Dead by Daylight

Dead by Daylight is not beginner friendly but it's also not difficult to master the mechanics once you have some game knowledge. That said the average skill level is extremely low and most players just rely on the few overpowered items to succeed.The developers have no idea what they're doing but there are still some decent people playing the game. I wouldn't advise joining the game this late into its lifespan which surely can't go on much longer but I also can't convince myself to quit.I got my money's worth that's for sure despite all the pain along the way.

review: Product received for free. You know I love the concept. It was enjoyable for maybe the first hour? Anyways you will love the game. It is pretty spooky if you are trying to hide and get away from the killers.For the most part everything is balanced. I enjoyed playing the survivors and tryign to work together to escape. That was fun.I played The Nurse as the killer. Fun and can be difficult to play but the actions of the killers are slow(which they should be).Here is what did it for me... I played about 5 games in and oon the 5th game here comes The Hag. This killer single handedly ruined it for me. The traps she can place next to the sacrifice hooks is unacceptable if you ask me. Should not be allowed. It allows her to be in 2 places at one time which if you ask me ruins the premise of '4v1'. With the trap it allows the hag to teleport to you if someone ran over it. which basically makes rescuing survivors from the hooks next to impossible.I am glad they allowed a free weekend so that way i can give it a shot before buying it.i will not be buying this game.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: So here's the thing.Dead by Daylight has the potential to be an extremely fun game and is truly unique. It happens to also be an imbalanced PoS.For those of you unaware it is an asymmetrical survival horror game where four survivors team together against one killer.The survivors objective is to repair five generators randomly spawned around the map and then power exit gates to escape and survive.The killers objective is to sacrifice the four survivors before they escape.And there are a variety of different killers and survivors to choose from survivors and killers each coming with their own unique perks that unlock special abilities and killers come with their own unique powers that change their playstyle in various ways.Oh and there's a leveling system. Playing matches earns you a currency called Blood Points which can be used to level your character and unlock items and perks to use in future matches. And there's an overall level system that progresses the more you play rewarding you with a currency called Iridescent Shards. More on that later.There are currently 12 killers and 13 survivors to choose from.Something that some people might find alluring to the game is that there are licensed DLC killers alongside original killers and survivors created for the game. Examples of licensed killers would be Michael Myers from Halloween Leatherface from Texas Chainsaw Massacre The Pig from Saw and Freddy Krueger from A Nightmare on Elm Street. Alongside these DLC killers are the survivors Laurie Strode Detective Tapp and Quentin Smith from their respective franchizes.This game is NOT pay to win. In fact the strongest killers are all free and come with the base game. And most of the better perks for survivors are on free characters too. And all perks for all killers and survivors have a chance of showing up in the shrine which is part of the in game store and changes weekly. You can buy the perks using the Iridescent Shards mentioned above.The simple fact of the matter is that the DLC killers and survivors should be bought because they look interesting and fun to you. Do not be tricked into thinking that they are required in order for the game to be enjoyable. Aside from buying killers the only other purchasable thing is an in game currency called Auric Cells which can be used to buy cosmetics for nonlicensed survivors and killers.Finally the last thing I can say is that your mileage may vary. From my experience the game can be a 10 or a 0 when it comes to fun depending on the match and the interaction between the killer and survivors. The community varies from being ok to extremely toxic. There's enough variety to keep things interesting and it's extremely replayable. And its progression system gives you a reason to keep playing. However the game is imbalanced at times due mostly in part to particularly strong perks for both killers and survivors as well as noticable skill gaps between players that can sometimes occur due to poor matchmaking.The best advice I can offer is pick up the game if it seems interesting to you just don't take it too seriously and play for fun. Side note Fun party game to play with friends.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: My friend showed me this game and we played it every time I came over. So my birthday passed and I bought a Steam card and bought this game. I got on and it wouldn't load. Only one time I actually got on a server with it loading and it wouldn't let me move. The game only works on certain devices. Her game let her play but my computer doesn't have anything else downloaded on it but hers does so she has a better chance of getting a virus and my computer doesn't have a virus. My internet is so fast but not on this game. So today I tried to play and it had to update for an hour. I waited about an hour and a half and it let me on but I clicked to be a survivor and it said I couldn't play. It said "EAC has detected that game files have been modified (error code 4). To resolve this please verify the integrity of the game cache (found under the Local Files section of the game's properties). Additional info Unknown file version (DeadByDaylight Content Paks pakchunk38 windowsnoeditor.pak)/. How am I supposed to do that. That makes absolute no sense to me. When it says that it makes me quit the game. If someone can help me please do. Or I just wasted 20 dollars on this game.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: First of all I never really write reviews but I pre ordered this game and I like it a lot so here I go.Do I recommend this game? Yes. Is there flaws? Many. This game is good fun IF you have friends to play with I wouldn't dare play this game solo unless killing is your thing then go ahead. A few REALLY frustrating and somewhat game breaking issues are pallets. When you drop a pallet sometimes it throws you on the wrong side which is a guaranteed hit for the killer sometimes they just don't drop. Vaulting through windows is almost always a guarantee hit for killers too since it seems their arms are made of rubber and can stretch a thousand miles the devs cater towards the killers constantly when they shouldn't be. They complain devs give. A perkless killer can kill ALL survivors where as a perkless survivor will probably die first it isn't very balanced. Enough ranting though is this game worth it? I'd say so get ready for a toxic community sometimes but it is good fun filled with laughter and butt clenching chases WHEN you have friends.

review: Great game! Even better than expected! I watched this game being played and thought i should try it out. It exceeds my expectations! I thought it might be broken based on other reviews and it does have its flaws but its still amazing! There are many killers to choose from and they are SUPER fun to play. Being a survivor gets your heart pumping and you feel helpless just like the creators hoped! Each killer and survivor has their own perks and strengths such as one survivor can heal herself without a health pack (Claudette) and another who is quick and quiet (Meg)! One killer can go invisible (The Wraith) and another can break into a crazed chainsaw sprint (The Hillbilly)! The only problems with this game are the numerous trolls and bullies (they just mess with you so it's not that bad) The Nightmare (Freddy Kreuger) is way too OP and that you have to pay about $5 on average per DLC ( There are about 13 DLCs 10 of which cost money) so all the DLCs combined is over double the base game! ( $50 for all DLCs $20 for Game). In summary the game is great and does have its flaws but it is WAY WORTH IT!!! 9.25/10!!!
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Update Despite the emblem system not being perfect for both killers and survivors the game is in a much better place and (mostly) enjoyable...However the emblems do not punish killers who camp enough. Games where you are the 1/4 (25%) to be caught first get hooked and then camped and tunneled to death is un interactive and not fun.Most games you don't get this but unfortunately their are too many where this does happen.Games still have unfair match making too where a new player may be put alongside prestige players against a average leveled killer. The math balances out but it makes the game un fun for the new player and un fun for the killer to try and get the more experienced players.With a new game by the devs coming out soon it won't surprise me if this one gets less developments and matchmaking issues (and camping) are still not fixed due to this new game taking development time.Only get this on a sale (50% or more) don't pay full price for this. Previous review (6th September 2016)I enjoy this game greatly I like most of the character mechanics and perks...What I don't like is trying a different character (who is at level 1) and being put with other survivors mostly at level 10 20 against a killer at level 40...I don't know whether the issue is with a lack of player base or lack of a background system to queue people around the same level but the game was changed recently so that rather than leaving a lobby if you felt other players were too high level instead it doesnt show you their level now.I've played as killer a few times at level 5 and been against level 30 players or level 35 prestige 2 players...The game isn't designed for people who can only play an hour or two a day and it is a shame.Maybe if there was a non competitive mode? (turns off perks) the game could be viable for new players but with the current systems it is unplayable. (additionally the lobbying issues and various other visual/connectivity bugs help to take away from the immersion and experience)
title: Dead by Daylight

review: I really like this game. It can get a bit repetitive however it is very unique and after a short break i find myself coming back to it. Initially it is difficult but as you play more it gets much easier. The role of the killer is well balanced against the survivors. A bit more explaination of how the bloodweb works would be nice however its not so hard to figure out that its extremely necessary. For me personally this game is a breath of fresh air in a world where so many games have become stale. I would like to see them add some more features however this game is very fun and one of the most unique games ive played. i highly recommend it if you like any kind of thrill or excitement it will get your heart pumping one way or another.

review: This review is for version 1.05 of the game with me having played about 50 60 hours. I really love the feel of this game. It brings to mind the classic slasher flicks from the 80s like Friday the 13th Halloween and Nightmare on Elm Street. I'm always tense and on the edge of my seat when I play as a survivor praying the killer keeps away from me long enough for me to restart this piece of junk busted generator. Conversely playing the killer is a huge rush. I love watching the survivors scatter like cockroches when I come out of the dark night. I can't help cackling madly as I chase them down and hook 'em. Gotta catch 'em all!That being said there are some issues with it. Camping someone that's been put on a hook is an understandable but annoying strategy that many killers tend to use. I'd like to see the killer get reduced points for corpse camping or the victem get more points for occupying the killer's time or some combination thereof.Also the game lobby seems to be seriously wonky. Sometimes you'll get dropped from a lobby or get stuck on 'searching for a match' for what seems like forever. It can sometimes take over 5 minutes between finishing one match and getting into the next. I still recommend Dead By Daylight because once you get into the game it really is a heck of a lot of fun. Hopefully we will see improvements with the connection and balance issues in future updates.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: I played this game twice before during weekends and both time was like "meh". Now I decided to actually purchase it and I have been morew than happy with what I got.Now with updates the game has become smooth and is very well balanced the only problems for me being hookcamping (It's very annoying as it can ruin a single player's experience entirely while the killer kinda sacrifices the match itself) and the Saw map "The Game". The map is in my opinion poorly balanced for survivors in terms of escape routes and it also is one of the more complicated maps having multiple floors. This makes finding objectives hard.Aside from those two things I dont have any problems with the game. It has very little rng lots of room to improve yourself as a player and multiple maps killers and perk combinations make each match a new experience. Also custom lobbies have everything unlocked for each of your characters so you can go wild with your friends.As Im writing this review the game is currently 50% on the Steam store. Go buy it. It's way worth 10 bucks whether you play with a few buddies or solo. Happy hunting/running to you all!

review: This game's great the idea of an asymmetrical horror where 4 survivors are forced to work together in order to escape against a deadly survivor is great the execution of this idea in Dead by Daylight not great (at the moment).Currently this game is in a weird state where in low ranks and for new players the game is really fun the initial couple of hours playing the game always will be being immersed in the game and hiding gives you a rush but once that wears off the game becomes more tedious.If you want to have the best builds for either survivor or killer in most cases you'll need to buy at least one of the DLC characters. Also if you're a completionist and want to max out all killers and survivors in this game prepare to invest over 1000 hours depending on when you buy the game as once every few months a new killer/survivor is released.But the main issue currently is balance. Unless you're playing nurse pallets are currently the bane of killers. By pallet looping even sitting at pallets and wasting them will give other survivors enough time to complete all 5 generators and escape. Furthermore the map design at the moment is terrible with some maps heavily favoring survivors and others favoring killers. The game is currently the survivors game to lose unless you are exceptionally good at playing killer which takes a long time to achieve unless you are a natural. The devs do seem interested in fixing the major balance issues however but this obviously takes time.So to conclude is the game fun? Yeah. Is the game entertaining? Yeah. Is the game fun to play for the first 20 or so hours? Yeah. Is the game fun to play in the beginning? Yeah. Is the game fun to play after that? Not at the moment and thats why I can't recommend the game.Also I almost exclusively play killer so some of my opinions on the game are skewed by that.EDIT 11th July 2018Since I originally wrote this review the developers seem to have given the game new life with solid consistent updates that improve the game as a whole. New killers have also been added since this review was written specifically the Pig (I think) and the Clown. Both DLC's are strong as a whole and in the Pigs case introduces a new solid mechanic which changes the game drastically.Overall the game has made a great turnaround over the past couple of months and appears to be continuing along this path. With more balance updates around the corner I am excited for the future Dead by Daylight holds.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Lol they deleted my previous review..... instead of spending time to delete honest reviews in order to get more people to give you $ for this buggy game why not use the time to address the bugs imbalanced map and the terrible matchmaking system? Too lazy to write down the long list of bugs a simple google search will net you a list of bugs experience by us the players. Certain maps consist of loops that just makes the players feel like they are playing a Merry go round simulator. The devs solution to this is that they added a mechanic (bloodlust) that makes the killer run faster after a period of chasing instead of reviewing the design of the map. Apparently this mechanic resets upon breaking a pallet so basically it is merry go round simulator until the killer is moving too fast that is the timing whereby the survivor will drop the pallet and turn the game back to a f*&amp k Feast of merry go round again. Genius matchmaking whereby the players are Q into red ping (&gt 300ms) rooms 70% of the time and they have to constanly re Q and roll the RNG dice in order to finally get into a room with stable latency. In order to make it more frustrating they added a 5 sec delay where users that left the room are unable to find another room. The time adds up considering the % of time where the users find a room of unstable latency.Although we can see the devs putting in some form of effort (Creating more skins?!?!?! nani????) to address the issues faced by players i strongly do not recommend the purchase of this game is you are spending &gt $10 as there are better games out there for this price.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Theres a lot of balancing that needs to be fixed. Some killers are WAY too OP and others are way too nerfed and hard to play.And same as survivors Some get perks that make it near impossible to kill them and some cant do anything. Youve got toxic survivors and toxic killers.Killers will camp hooks or camp dying survivors.Survivors will quit half way through load and screw the rest of the team over.Theres some things that need to changeLosing pips when the killer DCsLosing your high tier items when killers DCThe sabo perk should be a little stronger Hooks should grow back after a certain amount have been sabod. (IMO Im sure everyone feels some way about this).The match making needs to be fixed When your joining a match you should be matched with people in your region and with a decent ping.80% of the time people are leaving because they get stuck in servers with killers who have horrible connections. Lag is a big issue for survivors a killer can screw your game up with lag on his side. I feel like the devs need to focus on what the community is complaining about and fix it. Honestly I dont think the devs play enough of the game to understand any of the issues players are faced with when joining random matches. Not too mention they all have egos and what they say rules who cares what the community thinks right?Idk over all I enjoy the game. I recommend it to those who can handle the butt hurt and toxicity of the community or people who just want to screw around with some friends. The game can be fun dont get me wrong. But holy can it just push your buttons sometimes.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: This has to be the most broken and unbalanced game i have EVER player. Here are my reasons why..200 hours in and i lost all my progress. All my perks and everything i had grinded for. Had to contact devs to fix it for me and somehow that took a month and they didnt even fix it. They just gave me bloodpoints (the in game currency) and even then it took me hours to spend them all and get some of my stuff back.The lack of dedicated servers makes this game unplayable at times.. It relies on the same system as old COD games. Where the killer is the host and if his internet sucks d*** your game will most likely be ruined by horrible lag.The Balance is off as well.. It has a sort of ranked matchmaking wich would be fine if people did not disconnect every single time a good killer or a good team of survivors are owning.. Don't buy this game don't support sloppy game design and devs who don't care about their product..
title: Dead by Daylight

You can play as either the Killer or a Survivo and repair gens to escape. Now the game haver other mechs. inside that make the exp. more enjoyable or more painful. I changed my review to recommend because I have put 700+ hours in this game if anyone puts more then 10+ hours in a game then it is worth it.Just dont let this game get to you never mind try not to let it if you want to see how stressful this game can be just click on the community hub and see how seperated it is its like the US when trump got elected.

review: I love this game with all my heart but if you truly love something you need to face the truth. There are very glaring problems with not only the communty the mechanics as well. I would have to say the devs are pretty out of touch. Sure the community director is a previous player turned developer but making games is a lot different than playing them. I felt my opinion wouldn't be a valid if i hadn't played the game for at least a little under 500 hours. I feel like people will listen to me now. Ok. I consistently get to high rank survivor (Yes i am a survivor main but that will change soon) and i find that it takes forever to find matches let alone matches worth playing as in Disconnects Facecamping etc. I don't think its the mechanics that are mainly causing common problems. Most bugs these days are ones that people who have played the game since inception ever see but that doesn't lower their priority. The devs could easily fix a majority of the problems their games faces but they are scared to do anything drastic which sucks. Its understandable that they don't want to go to fast but its just frustating to say the least. There are so many things I would like to say but I can't really name them all. They are problems that irk me very heavily whenever they pop up but i learn to deal with them. Someones does an unfair strategy? Learn how to deal with it in the ways you can sometimes you just need to learn that you aren't Ochido or any other high ranking survivor or killer main. At the very least I'm hoping that the next anniversary update changes a few things that frustrates everyone in the community. well hope you have a fun time an look forward to seeing you in the fog if you choose to play this game Peace.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Let me just start of with i absoloutly love this game the survivors the perks i bought this game just over a year ago and this game has made so much progress with killers survivors and the devs are still improving and improving.don't get me wrong there are lots of cons with this like the community for example i don't want to get into much detail about this but im going to say i've had my fair share of fun in this and i wouldn't trade this game for any other but the community is umbelivably toxic and the amount of times i have been harrased and hated on is unreal. Now. the game is about 4 survivors and 1 killer each killer is unique and has their own ability and cosmetics from outfits to weapons to perks the first few killers available are Trapper wraith nurse and huntress others are paid dlc and each killer has a difficulty level based on their ability and perks Now survivors each survivors have their own unique perks that can be unlocked and be unlocked and used in other survivors.At the start of every game there are 4 survivors and 1 killer of any of the available killers now the internet connection is ran of the hosts internet connection so basically if the host has terrible internet you will aswell and if you leave you will get deranked due to the games ranking system from 20 being worst to 1 being the best and to get higher up in the rankings you need to get a certain amount of points in a match and then you make your way up also each season the ranks reset now when you start a game you need to complete 5 gens depending on the amount of survivors 4 survivors being 5 gens 3 being 4 2 being 3 and 1 being 2 now the survivors have to complete these gens while avoiding the killer who is attempting to hook the survivors on a hook and sacrifice them to the creature whos responsible for the survivors being there the entity now once you get hooked you get a chance to attemp escape where you have a small chance to escape now after awhile you will reach the second phase of the sacrifice and if you got unhook and rehooked you will reach that phase automaticly and once thats complete you die simple as that and the only other way of killing someone as killer is using a mori that you can unlock in the bloodweb there are multiple types of mori's now if you get hooked as a survivor then unhooked the killer will have the option to murder the survivor from one of them to all of them depending on the mori now once the gens are complete you have to open the exit gate orrr escape in the hatch that can either be opened by a key or automaticly opens when theres only 1 survivor remaining in the game.anyway i guess this is where i end the review hope to see you guys in the fog! bye bye!
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Most toxic community ever. Not even kidding.You can try playing any kind of build in this game and you'll have the opposing side whine and complain the loudest about "OMG. YOU RAN (insert perk) LIKE A NOOB. GET GOOD." You have people in the community who will run the most scummiest items/perks so they can guarentee survival. (I can understand it on scummy survivors or killers but even the polite players get screwed over because of this behavior.) If you want to see examples of this toxicity then just look at the Steam Community Forums for this game. There is at least two or three complaints about something wrong about this game.If you ever stop by a good majority of the Twitch streamers that play Dead by Daylight especially the big name streamers a good chunk of people in the chatrooms are toxic. Sometimes the streamer actually encourages and promotes some of this toxic behavior. Criticizing another player is fine but just being downright disrespectful and toxic towards other players is uncalled for. Many of the good hearted players have abandoned this game because of how toxic disrespectful and scummy this community has become. I don't even want to stream this game and promote it in the current state it's in.Also if you dare trigger a killer as survivor then don't expect to be leaving the game alive in 90% of the games. As killer if you dare run something scummy on a specific group of survivors then don't expect to be catching them alive when they run into your lobby again. It's this toxic back and forth tug of war of scummy gameplay that has lead to the individual players not respecting each other. To the remaining group of people who actually still play this game respect the game for killers and survivors alike and don't resort to scummy gameplay I give kudos to you. Most dumbfounded developer and community manager team ever.There were numerous scummy playstyles that can easily get a killer or survivor pips and it took the developers almost a whole year just to patch some of them out. Some that are still in the game and still exploitable to this day especially with how awful in this current day and age. (OhTofu did perkless wraith played like any typical scummy killer and achieved Rank 1 in two days on his stream. The ranking system is a joke.) Alongside the ranking system doesn't reward you at all unless you want to consider the rewards of getting to Rank 1 of playing with streamers extremely toxic players or players that were carried by their friends to Rank 1. (Rank hardly ever matters in this game past Rank 15.) The developers are not communicative to their playerbase at all. Some of the developers stream on Twitch and they get bombarded by questions of fixing their game but they tend to ignore it and time out people who harass them. (Nothing wrong with that it just shows how many problems there are in this game.) Yet some of the developers (not all) don't seem to bother actually addressing issues in the game and push it to the side for another week until it actually blows up in their face and then they actually have to address it. In fact some of these developers and community managers have devolved into the same toxic behavior the community promotes on their own streams. I can respect them as individuals outside of their job profession but not inside of it. Their in game reporting system? A complete joke. You actually have to go to their website to actually report someone or contact one of the moderators on Steam. Yet let's just cut the bull here and say many of these cases the moderators will tell you need more sufficient evidence (video evidence) or some other reason to satisify the ban criteria. Unless you're friends with a moderator or provide enough "credible" evidence don't expect someone to get banned. Overall I suggest avoiding this game. Even though they might have licensed killers and survivors the community is not worth playing against. You thought Call of Duty was completely toxic with 12 year olds on the console? This game can easily beat Call of Duty in the dust and leave no trail behind.I do play the game from time to time with friends and was perhaps worth the $30 or so I spent on this game but it's not worth the hassle (looking into the game in the perspective of a new player) of how the game is currently sitting in. There might not be much competition in the field of horror multiplayer games but I rather not waste my time with a game that will give me more stress and grief than actual fun.
title: Dead by Daylight

They rarely acknowlege the bugs and when they do it's nothing beyond "we're fixing it soon." Never an apology never any rewards to make up for it and NEVER a single comment after the bug is fixed. The devlopers have good initial ideas as the game and DLCs are always good initially but you can tell their drive ends after release of the content. They had to be strong armed by the community for months to change the ranking system and make TINY tweaks to the gameplay.
