review: It's one of those multiplayer horror games where one person plays the bad guy trying to catch/imprison the other players who are survivors. But this is a really good example of the genre.You have an upgrade/level system and items plus a few clothing articles to customize your character. Every survivor class has unique skills some passive some upgradeable and some have to be activated in addition there are numerous villain classes.There's even more if you also purchase the DLCs which are all quite good. Going by comments the biggest criticism of the game is that its community is toxic or takes advantage of unbalanced mechanics. I'm a newbie and a pretty predictable player (which in this game is a disadvantage) but I haven't encountered any negativity (in the GMT and GMT+1 timezone at least). Several times the Killer would let me and another sole survivor win out of pity several times all four survivors would form a conga line and mess with the Killer xD During every round I've played so far other survivors even other newbs are good at signalling and working with you. Roles are assigned and accepted without chat one player focuses on juking and baiting the killer another player is the designated rescuer/healer and the other two focus on getting the generators up and running for example.In fact for me this is a big draw to the game getting along with others and working out an escape plan even without direct communication. A word of caution though don't jump into the game expecting to play as a clever Killer the first time around. The Killer is the hardest mode to learn and master and your first couple of times you will most probably lose spectacularly. That's okay though! You can learn from this experience from guides and from how better Killers behave when you play Survivor. On a side note there are a few fundamental differences between this game and its unofficial rival Friday the 13th. Survivors have different abilities escape routes are different level design is completely different... It's hard to say which is better. It's like comparing Terraria with Starbound or Team Fortress 2 with Overwatch.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: You might look at this game and think "oh neat a game about surviving a killer!" but it's not that. After learning the game it turns into a game about trolling a killer. Unless you're against incredibly inept survivors you're going to have an awful time as killer because are designed from the ground up to frustrate you. You'll get looped around the same loop for insane periods of time often leading the survivor escaping any way then having them accuse you of tunneling them. You'll get body blocked vt multiple survivors forcing you to drop a survivor before you can hook them. You'll play against a friend team of 4 that will gen rush the hell out of you. You'll get survivors that try to farm you by healing hiding in lockers sitting in the basement etc. You'll get groups in which all 4 people are running an OP perk setup making it near impossible to beat them. You'll get survivors that will teabag you then immediately disconnect if you hook them. You'll get survivors that escape because of s crutch perk they shouldn't have or an escape hatch they haven't earned. Then to top it all off you'll be chastised at the end of the match. If you win then you're a camper a hacker a tunneler a farmer an etc. If you lose then you're a noob a bad killer trash etc. The developers of this game blindly pander to incredibly toxic people that honestly believe it should be easy for them to win in an asymmetrical game and any time the developers try to make it easier on killers the same people throw a fit. If you're planning to buy this game because you want to play as the killer please don't.
title: Dead by Daylight

title: Dead by Daylight

review: Dead by Daylight a game worth buying. Fun Mechanics interesting lore and some really really tense gameplay (both sides of play).The gameplay is focused on 4v1 asymmetrical multiplayer. 4 people are survivors people attempting to repair generators that will power gates that will allow them to escape from the other player the killer who is trying to find and capture the survivors so they can be sacrificed to the entity the game's god. The gameplay on both sides are extremely interesting and fun with survivors having their heart pounding at their chest as they hear heartbeats getting more and MORE intense before suddenly a desperate chase ensues. The killer once on the trail is just chomping at the bit...just a bit...just a bit close....closer....near...ly......GOT YA! Each Successful strike of your weapon being a sense of the hunt.Both sides however don't come to this party of dark torment without some toys. The survivors have items for aiding in a number of aspects ranging from healing a wounded ally to being able to track where objectives are. These items are all on borrowed time as to die with them is to lose them but don't fret you can always reverse that with being able to find an item on the map from a chest and if you escape with it you keep it!The Killers however are a little more set in their styles as instead of getting random items they have their own unique 'power'.The Trapper (my personal favourite) as the name implies traps. Bear Traps. This killer specialises in placing traps in choke points behind windows that survivors can jump through or even in front of a hooked sacrifice for a little bit of insurance that ether the hooked or saviour is caught (sometimes both if they don't leave quickly!). Very fun to play as hearing you traps snap shut on a survivor is just a joy that curls your mouth to a grin like the killers mask.The Wraith (the communities pet punching bag) little more obscure power heh as the wraith can turn invisible (think predator camo it isn't perfect). This killer gets the most flak however that is just because he is considered the easiest to get used to due to a simple play style. While invisible you move faster but cannot attack or do any sort of 'attack' action (breaking barricades picking up survivors and the like) and it always takes a few seconds to cloak and de cloak. This power has a huge benefit as survivors cannot hear a heartbeat if you are cloaked. So pay attention and get ready for a jump scare when fixing a generator.The Hillbilly (he hates auto wreckers) The chainsaw wielding maniac. A simple killer but with high skill cap but high reward. His chainsaw takes a few seconds to get going but once it does he will come running for you like an american muscle car and hits like one too. Doesn't turn easily but the speed he travels and the fact a hit is instant downed status is terrifying better sharpen your juke skills for this one because a good hillbilly will see you downed quickly and you won't even see it coming. Quite terrifying actually.So lets be honest about the game it is good extremely good. I recommend it whole heartly without doubt but I will point out the game is still buggy in some things. However the Devs have been working extremely hard to polish their game and have been removing bugs and adding features people wanted for so long and are even going to add a fourth killer. However if you can't stand small bugs (like say a small camera unhitch here and there every say 4 5th game for killers) then don't until a later date.Other than small issues that most games (even triple As) have this game is great fun. Just great. Find some friends get a lobby and scream over voice chat as the hunter chases you down first every game.......grumble grumble........(Last sentence is a personal experience of mine with rotten luck and some really determined killers)

review: Insanely fun. There are some glitches that while not *game breaking* have been match ruining. . .mainly clipping through the floor as Killer and becoming immobile while I watch the dumbest survivor I've ever seen bumble his way through the map. The rank system is a bit dumb but a lot of games have problems finding the right balance for their ranking system. Hell Blizzard still has trouble. It *is* frustrating to lose a rank just because you offed the four survivors quickly. The game does a good job of getting you in the role of each side though. As survivor my heart rate really gets pumping and as killer the thrill really is in the chase!Bunny hopping is super annoying but I usually take that as a sign to move on. . .plus I've had some people that up and BAM ON MY SHOULDER YOU GO.

review: I have a lot to say about this game some good but in all honesty this game is terrible from gameplay all the way to the idiotic devs who don't know when to stop when the game becomes unbalanced and bias towards the killer winning most of the time. With this last update they've decreased the wiggle time to get free so that to actually get free the killer needs to be all the way on one side of the mapand get to the other end so that the survivors are actually able to escape. The games are way too one sided with the killer picking up the win most of the time as either the wraith or hillbilly. The trapper imo is the closest thing to balance in the game and yes im also including the survivors and their bloodwebs which are completely underwhelming considering all of but two things are one time use and most of the time utterly pointless. Another reason the game is unbalanced is that they made the survivors pushovers almost making it impossible for them to win. With the decrease in wiggle speed no longer being able to recover yourself and making it your teams burden to come pick your stupid up baiting them towards to killer or them saying it and leaving you left for dead. This is also not mentioning that when your teammates do ditch you and you try to attempt to escape off the hook the attempt fails 98.888888% percent of the time. What im really trying to say is that devs need to stop focusing on the t killers realize the game is unbalanced and fix their ing game or they're going to have mroe reviews like this coming in.UPDATE Even after this last patch they refuse to listen to the community reviews and neglect to change unbalanced features of the game. STOP MAKING THE ING KILLERS OP YOU DUM SONS OF BETHCES. FORGOT ABOUT THEM AND FOCUS ON THE SURVIVORS YOU MORONS. &lt 3
title: Dead by Daylight

review: There's not that many bugs. Might find one once a week.The survive with friends mode has been added as promised although that itself is going to make people angry too.I don't really care about matchmaking. Unless your teammates are in the single digit ranks they're pretty killable like the rest of us. If you have a good killer he'll just have some more common sense than the average dunce.The developers are constantly in a state of balancing the game trying to please both sides of the game (Killers vs Survivors) which will never be at ease due to both sides wanting the game in their favor. Any issues that cause major imbalance usually get fixed quickly.The whole "finding game" issue is a very minor inconvenience. Oh gee I have to press the button four times instead of once. Not a issue that will drag out the process more than five seconds.Infinite jukes have been fixed. As reward for fixing it the developers were greeted with hate. (fixing the issue tipped the balance back in the killer's favor)If you really care about a rank then you may have issue with the ranking system as it does not promote winning quickly but rather playing like the people in horror films which is an issue when your killer/survivor is a tryhard. (Think dramatic chase scenes and the survivor to narrowly escape only for the killer to pop back in).The insta killer offerings are lame but I've maybe been killed by them about 2 3 times in the 81 hours of gameplay that I've played with each match being about ten minutes.People complain about hook camping which is one of the few things that actually is common. Despite there being obvious disadvantages to doing this people continue to do it. I don't really know how I would fix it so I can't blame the development team for not fixing it either. They're sort of iffy on the issue since I've seen them both say that it is a valid strategy but they seem to frown upon it from judging how they talk about it.About one in every ten games I will come across lag. It's worth noting that if you really despise it then you will need to take that into consideration when you decide on buying the game. Due to the game being built upon a peer to peer system you will have to hope that the killer is not someone who doesnt realize how bad their internet is. A way to test whether someone has bad internet is by typing in pre game chat and seeing the delay. It isn't a fool proof method if the lag isn't so bad that it will delay chat but is bad enough to show up in game but it helps an unfixable issue.The way of progressing through the game is through an RNG system with each level having exactly one perk (random) and other random items which their rarity depends on your level. I have no issue with it but due to RNG being random someone is getting the short end of the stick and isn't happy about it. That's all the major complaints I can think of.If you like the game and really like the gameplay then these issues will not stop you from playing the game.
title: Dead by Daylight

title: Dead by Daylight

review: I have a complicated relationship with this game but i'm to the point where i can comfortably say i really enjoy it.I started out being too afraid to do much of anything useful. This was back in October 2017 when I bought the game on sale to play with friends who had already been playing. We played some kill your friends together to get the hang of the controls and objectives.After that we jumped into Survive With Friends where we were afraid but we were afraid together. I'll never forget the time we were all sitting in the open exit gate area and Freddy Krueger popped some sort of perk that blocked the exits for a period of time and we all panicked and ran around laughing and freaking out.But then we started playing less because it was frustrating waiting any where from five to fifteen minutes to get into another game if one of us died early and had to sit around and wait for the others.Shortly after The Pig DLC was released a friend and I decided to play some ol DBD cause nothing else sounded fun to play. First game of the night was with The Pig. We knew it was her because we saw the puzzle boxes. I started working on a generator and after twenty seconds i see her about fifteen feet away stalking me and it scares THE SHIRT out of me. I mean I threw my mouse away and half closed my laptop screaming WHAT THE FORK in a VERY high pitched tone. To my credit I hadn't been playing seriously and all other killers (besides the shape but he was tall) had a terror radius that I relied on along with my friends callouts to avoid any surprises. Well that night with the Pig i only played two more games still shaken up. I even had a nightmare that i was being stalked in my own home by Hillbilly and Doctor.That next morning I decided I had to face my fears. No one was online so I logged in and jumped into queue alone. And you know what? I had so much fun. And I still do! I almost exclusively solo queue and now I play more Killer too! Today I bought the Halloween DLC and i had a BLAST playing The Shape no wonder everyone reccommends it! Remember that it is a multiplayer game so expect a certain amount of toxicity but I've found that as long as you throw the ol GG in at the end people seems to hold onto their EZs.This game gets a lot of hate for being such a creative immersive and addictive experience. It's not just one way to play it's many. The bugs have been annoying at times but I think DBD is at a great place right now. I don't play any games like DBD and I wouldn't have thought this was going to be something I'd like but it's one of my favorites to play after a long day in the office and I'm glad I gave it a chance! )
title: Dead by Daylight

review: I was really excited about this game for a long time and had high hopes for it. But then the problems started coming in and rather than working to fix them and take into consideration what the community has been saying seriously the developers would much rather make easy money marketing off of popular horror/slasher movie characters and add more stuff that work on existing problems. The problems early on were the lag among other glitches in terms of movment and actions that made things difficult as a survivor. However the most pervasive problem that has not improved in the slightest is the camping from players as the Killer. Non stop time and again there have been Killers who manipulate the game and take away the enjoyment from playing. They have the advantage and are choosing not to play fair and the people who update this game and see this problem consistently have chosen to side with the camping Killers and it appears as though they have gone out of their way to aid them in their slaughter. Maybe instead of adding Killers like Freddy who put everyone to sleep with no means to wake themselves up consider trying to tackle the really issues with the playablity of the game without adding on more issues. Try making it so that if the Killer is within a certian radious of a Survivor that is on the hook for longer than 15 seconds they are immediatley teleported to a different location on the map that is 75 meters away from anybody so as to not put other Survivors at a disadvantage and prevent the manipulation of the game via camping. Because when a Killer camps they do not earn their rank they steal it. If this continues people will see the game as worthless in terms of playing as a Survivor and play as the Killer. But once eveyone plays and camps as the Killer who will they play against? No one. There is nothing wrong with adding new content and creating new fun and unique experiences for players but it should not be the only thing the people updating the game are willing to do. This game needs alot more work and time needs to be spent fixing these issues not brainstorming new ways to pump money out of players via a broken game by adding one shiny new thing.Also on your stream don't say for people to play another game. Beacuse when you show that level of insulting indifference to concerned community members that is just what they'll do play a different game. So be careful what you wish for because it's starting to become true.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: it feels like it's almost been a year since i panned a bad review on dead by daylight based on some toxicity from the playerbase and i'm here to say after giving it another fair chance after a slew of updates it finally seems really well balanced and the player base in general seems alot more friendly. i recently picked this game backed up and i'm actually having quite a bit of fun both as survivor and killer. it seems the devs and playerbase are genuinely interested in making the game the best it can be for its premise. in it's current state this game is genuinely fun and fair just try not to get too salty and remember it's meant to be asymmetrical but above all remember that no matter which side you are on (killer/survivor) each side is rewarded for being as crafty and devious as they can be if you remember everyone is here to have fun dead by daylight is probably the best cat and mouse experience you can purchase

review: I am going to recommend this game but please be warned that if you dedicate a significant amount of time to this game you will get frustrated.What I like This is a great game to play with your friends (Survivors up to 4 including yourself) There are some jumpscare moments. Forces you to use your brain and outsmart your opponent. Licensed Killers! Plenty of survivors to choose from.What I don't like Match making is horrendous. (I'll explain below) The game can be unbalanced allowing for a severe advantage over your opponent (killer or survivor) The is fun untill you pass rank 12 (for me) it just feels like a grind after that with rare matches actually being fun.Matchmaking A lot of killers will dodge lobbies if they see Survive with Friends (SWF) They will dodge the lobby for a lot of reasons. Who knows. Survivors will Disconnect mid game if they feel like they are being treated unfair and that screws your entire team. Sometimes you will be matched with higher ranked people and that makes the match a bit more challenging. Sometimes this game feels like lobby simulator after rank 10.I thought the Overwatch community was toxic but this is by far the most toxic community I have ever been a part of. Post game chat is cringy as hell.Honestly it is a fun game and I will continue to play it because it is a unique game in that they really don't have any REAL competition. F13th isn't the same game so it's easy to ignore the player base and continue to pump out money making DLC and ignore the real issues.You should play the game but don't expect a whole lot out of it.

review: This is a great game that incorporates a unique 4 vs 1 playstyle. You get very different perspectives and thrills whether you play as the survivor or killer. The game provides a ton of replayability as you try to unlock perks. The game can be very grindy as you attempt to unlock all of the perks you want but the addition of the shrine helps reduce the amount of hours needed.This game does have some flaws. Game lobby wait times used to be unbearable but have been improved greatly. The matchmaking system has seen better days as I often get matched with others nowhere near my rank. There are lots of goofy bugs that work their way into the gameplay but overall I still have a blast playing.Ignore the toxic community that constantly complains about this or that being over powered. The devs have specificly tailored the killers to have the advantage by taking away a lot of the advantages survivors used to exploit (jungle gyms infinites). This doesn't bother me as much as the killers should strike fear into the heart of the survivors. Although it can be very frustrating when you get dominated by a skilled killer who is 10 ranks above you.The devs have put out some great DLC that keeps the game fresh and are constantly tweaking the gameplay based on user feedback.I would definately recommend this game. I would ignore many of the negative reviews you see on here. As you can see many of them have 100 200 or even 1000 hours poured into this game. Yeah its not perfect but its certainly good enough to spend a couple hundered fun hours with.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: I love this game. I also hate it.The gameplay is a lot of fun right up until you run into survivors who know the loop spots on the maps. These are spots where they can jump through a window and then another window or a wall and then another wall infinitely. There is no way to stop them and there is no way to catch them unless they make a mistake which is pretty hard to do.The Devs promised they would fix it back when the game was first released but they didn't. Came back during the free weekend years later to find that people are still doing the same thing. Pointless. Don't waste your time it's an exerise in complete frustration.

review: I would recommend this to some people but would warn that this game is more of an early access game.Edit 10/25/2016 Many of the bugs I originally complained about have been corrected and the game is starting to show direction for how the game play is suppose to be. Survivors are still very similar though and the game now has an impossible grind if you want all of the perks/abilities in the game. Also stealthy players are still not rewarded by in game points at all and in fact aggressive teams get much more out of each match.One positive I did not mention before is that this dev team is on par with the one for Warframe and what I mean by that is that they are very active with community and are always sharing what they are working on at least every 2 weeks.Original review This game is in Beta even if it is not official and I mean a real beta. What the game promises and what it can do now is fun and will only get better but there are MANY bugs that aren't addressed fast enough. The game still feels like it is trying to figure out how its own system for points perk progression and game play work. While I am enjoying the game I am also at least once every time I play getting frustrated by any number of issues that the game has right now.The above statement sums up my thoughts on the game. Their are many bugs like the many issues with matchmaking hit boxes wonky game mechanics and skills/perks not working. Also the game seems confused on what the focus is either its getting the most points so that you rank up or its the interplay with the killer and trying to survive/kill.What the game really lacks a good reward system for being a stealthy player and one that focuses on the objectives. you have four different things that you can get points in and they are capped at a certain amount. What is worse is that 2 of these are very hard to get points in so with the cap on each type of points you usually only do well if you survive.If you never interact with the killer and only get generators or heal teammates you will not rank up at the end of the game and may even go down a rank. What is even worse is that if you die helping out the team by being a distraction or getting people off hooks it almost seems like the game punishes that kind of behavior netting you much less points than the people you saved. The reward system is not robust enough to support different play styles and makes it so during some games you try to get into trouble just to get points and get enough out of the match.My final complaint is that each survivor feels the same. Each "unique" perk that a survivor can learn can be taught to the others if you play enough and other than these perks only the cloths/gender is different. If each survivor had other unique stats it would help change up the game a lot.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: When this game works the way it is supposed too it really is good fun. Some survivor's I've played against have been very great people others not to much. The game is based around a killer trying to hook survivors and sacrifice them to the entity. The killer is OP. And when something is OP you nerf it right? Well that's the problem with this game. Survivors have too much of a fighting chance and great perks to accompany their use of items. That seems to be the general feel of the killer community but because there are 4 survivors to every 1 killer killer nerfs are imminent when survivors feel the game is unfair. The game is based around unfairness . I like the game enough to leave it a positive review but this game could be so much better.

review: Game is clearly not balanced correctly without any knowledge of how to play I can wipe teams as the killer and rank up easily never having to worry about losing items or what comp / perks the enemy team has. As a survivor not only is the game stacked against you massively (in balance terms and in mechanics terms) but you will be punished for doing well too. One match I managed to survive and activate 2 3 generators myself got an item out of the map and helped an ally off a hook only to be deranked. There's no leniency if a teammate leaves either you are down a person with a massive disadvantage and dying or leaving will result in you being deranked and losing your items. Having the killer host seems like a reasonable idea until you play against a killer from another continent and it's clear they have no handicap from hosting in another region while your entire team of survivors rubberbands into trees and away from escape ledges. This game clearly needs a lobby type game selection or at the very least some way to specify what rank / level you'd like to play with. I see far to many people lobby hopping but I entirely understand why if they want to rank up at all they have to make sure they don't play with new players or really anyone with low ranking these people tend to never help teammates and hide during critical times when the killer is in a known location far away and should be repairing generators or planning to rescue their teammates. Also none of those new people should have to play against a killer with a full very rare perk set especially if they have few to no perks to use themselves and little to no knowledge of the killer's perks. This is a game it will never be easy to balance I'd even argue it shouldn't be balanced as a healthy sense of fear is really what the survivor's gameplay revolves around. That being said the game should be fun for both sides. Playing survivor feels fun but is a bit frustrating if you hope to keep items or rank up. Playing killer is fun but feels far too easy and a bit stale I had to do very little hunting and searching and spent a lot of time hauling people to hooks. I'll absolutely agree that the killer should have an advantage but specific strategies seem to have some advantages that are a bit too much against certain players having a bear trap under a hooked teammates with the trapper camping nearby means you will have to coordinate with a random person to have one person distract the killer while the other rescues which might be literally impossible depending on the cooperation of the random people you are playing with in a match since there's no way to tell a teammate this in the game but if you were on a VOIP chat system with a friend you could easily manage to communicate that entire plan before trapper could even find a bear trap. Seems like the discrepencies between players very familiar with the game's mechanics and the maps and people that are not along with similar discrepencies between players with VOIP systems and players entering queue alone with no communications have caused some disagreements in the game's community on how this game should be balanced. Many experienced players love the newer changes eschewing exploits that saturated high ranked gameplay and applauding the higher skill bar of playing a survivor but for others it's left some rough edges.The developer has stated that they're going to be tweaking the game's balance but only after the dust has settled from their more recent patches with bug fixes and exploit removals. I'll likely update this review when they do but for now I'm a bit on the fence about this game. I can't recommend it to anyone looking for a really fair and balanced game or anything to play competitively but I might play a bit if it if they can find a way to make the game revolve around something other than "hook camping". There seems to be no advantage to helping teammates at the moment as the risk (getting chainsawed or walking on a trap) is far greater than just going and fixing a different generator.Update I wrote the above review when this game had beed fully released for only about a week I haven't played it since but I doubt my review reflects the current state of the game. This game was a lot of fun until I took it too seriously. If you want to have the scared out of you check it out!
title: Dead by Daylight

review: So ive had some time to dig deep into this game. This game has had me so hyped since the day i seen the first footage of it. Gotta picture my excitment here at the start of the month i finally bought a gaming pc that could play this. I download it play it and the next day they announce MYERS!! my fav movie of all time and the icon is coming to the game i was so pumped!! So I will say first things first the learning curve sucks for this game! They dont hold your hand you have to pretty much figure out most of the game. At first i had no idea what offerings were etc. over time the better i get im really starting to enjoy this game. I was a little disapointed with the myers halloween update. For $7 I would of liked maybe a few more versions of myers mask and maybe larie strode from the zombie movies as well would of been cool. I understand people hate campers next to the hook after the killer has hooked you but as somone who plays as the killer its annoying how easy they could get off that hook. I really think the developers should fix that!! Make it harder for people to take other people off the hook. Maybe throw a skill check in there while taking them off the hook and if u miss they die! Feel like that would solve the huge "camper" issue. Overall i love the game awesome job!! Hope to see some more horror icons pop up in future updates. Also with the myers DLC the hospital from the orginal halloween 2 would be cool..keep up the good work guys awesome game F the haters!!!

review: Bought this game during the Steam Halloween sale as a game to Spoop my roommate and I during the Holiday season. At around game 20 30 (you lose track because of how many times you'll die and jump out of matchmaking) we made it rather far. One of the few times this happens to us with only one generator left to turn on the Wraith goes balistic on us. He weeds out the teammates around me as I attempt to close in and unhook them. Inexperience leads to failure and then I listen to my roommate yell behind me as he's hooked and saved and then hooked immediately after. I'm the only sacrifice left I see the sign that I can escape through the hatch but not having covered enough ground to know where it is I just sprint around searching until the Wraith catches up with me. As I jam the A &amp D keys with both hands I'm able to get away from the killer two separate times until on the third time he picks me up starts to carry me in circles once more reaping mad XP because of this and then he suddenly drops me...I see the prompt for the hatch and I freeze up. The Killer is just staring down at me for what felt like a whole minute and then I press the space bar and escape. Our jaws are on the floor at the mercy we had just witnessed. It having been a minute since everyone else died and I was playing struggle and cuddle with the Killer it was just him and I in the chat box afterwards. He says "lol I felt like you're actually pretty good." To which all I can say is "Thank you." He quickly replies "GG man" and I stumbled with shaking fingers to type "you got your XP I got mine... GG man." TL DR This is my first review I have no hours in the game but if you stick it out for the rewarding moments you may actually play with a human being and not a psychopath who stares at you after he's hooked you. 7/10 broken moments terrible button mashing unrewarding item system unique perks the most rewarding wins I've ever experienced in a game makes for great stories.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Game started off as a lot of fun.Update by update the development crew seems to listen only to the top 5% of players who have 5000+ hours when it comes to updates.Lets be real not all of us are top 5%...So the endless killer/survivor battle of this ones better than the other purely relies on the top 5%.Needless to say after the last update Previously i was rank 6 I can't even get below rank 20. This is me getting 15k bloodpoints plus. Pallets were shrunk to near non existant. Can't even escape through windows anymore. And any response you ask for all you get is "get good". Well sadly enough not all of us are top tier 1000 hours into this game. Start listening to the real majority of players and stop listening to the killers who rank up super fast into the top 5%.I rarely write reviews but after a couple hundred hours into this game i regret buying it. The community is straight up toxic if a killer doesn't kill all 4 survivors a "gg" is few and far between.And if you do survive and make it out you don't even get to rank up a pip. Even if you hauled ! # getting generators running.Balance for this game is WELL overdue and the community refuses to admit it. I personally have held off purchasing the addons as i see them as a waste of money at this point.If you want to be shafted by admins every step of the way then this is the game for you! If you want a community of killers that will automatically assume you have a group of 4 overly qualified players on survive with friends. This is for you!In reality as not every killer realizes sometimes when you queue as 3 friends you get a brand new survivor that isn't a pro. They bring your entire team down to their level (which is perfectly fine). However the community of killers automatically assume every player should be a pro.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: After almost half a year off from this game there are good things to say about it and if you are playing with your friends it could actually be kind of fun.ButKillers don't have the power in this game. It seems like a killer has a way harder time to pip than the survivors do even tho stealth survivors are a little ed aswell because they don't get that many points as they needed to rank up in the new Emblem system that they implemented.Biggest t about this game ? THE COMMUNITY. Out of 20 matches you play a day (doesn't even matter if you are survivor or killer). you have at least 16 people insulting you in the end screen for something you did or even didn't do and they are just mad they lost. XD So many people who think they can insult people just because they are hidden behind a screen and that wouldn't open their mouth if you stood infront of them. I'd ban all of them in a banwave just because the internet would be a better place. Now i don't say don't state your opinion but if you are trying to insult me and use a different language than english or russian at least try to think about that i can speak more than those eventually The game is full of those people. I know you have those everywhere but this is a pathetically huge amount in one game.And with this huge disbalance between killer and surivor and the community + the fact everytime that there is a patch that fixes stuff something different breaks i can and will not recommend it. If you have friends to play it with you could have a good time. The concept isn't bad. Execution and the most amount of people here are.

review: This is my second time writing a review for this game and now at its current state... its okay. If you want to play this game then play survivor because at the moment thats the side the game is leaning toward. The price of $20 USD is an okay price but wait for a sale if you can. They have improved the lobbies and I can say that I can smoothly go from one game to another without bugs. One of my issues with the game is that some of the loading times are unreasonable and by the time they are done you either have 1 person with you or your a one man army. The devs have said they are aware about this bug but personally if I worked there I would say that this should take priority. Besides all of this the devs have "done a pretty good job so far" and should continue working on bugs and fixing them. At the current state 6/10. That rating is not final since there is way more things to be fixed and worked on but until then this is what im rating it.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: edit Just yesterday the game director responded to a player's letter regarding the issue of Killer being extremely frustrating to play (due to SWF Survivors basically controlling the game). His response was "I don't agree with you. But if it bothers you that much how about you just play Survivor instead?". Aka "I don't give a and you're wrong."Decide for yourself whether you want to support that kind of attitude.Overall an ambitious game trying to blend horror and asymetrical PvP.Despite not being 'scary' per se once you played a couple hours the core combination of the near invulnerable killer searching the map for you as you try not to fail suddenly appearing skillchecks whilst hearing his heartbeat come closer... Still gives me the one or other adrenaline rush. Which is clearly a good point.However more fan of being a killer myself you run around setting up traps or ambushes chasing survivors down and both gameplay scoring and fun intentions lead to you preferring to play with your enemies instead of murdering them flat off. It's a feature that Evolve sorely lacked and that's well done here.However there are a few major downsides to the game Occasionally the game simply freezes. This reoccured at semi predictable patterns and frequently ruined otherwise fun rounds.The game's network bases on P2P centerd around the Killer. Whilst that means Survivors can't abuse ping spikes to teleport about it does mean if the Killer has a crappy connection Survivors are screwed by THE KILLER teleportin around and frequently getting stuck on corners.Gamebalance is made and broken by the items and offerings (one use items) players bring into the match. Some perks make the Killer beyond unstoppable (i.e. a perk that lets Shape one shot assured kill any player he comes close enough too) some items can have the survivors win the game near instantly (the famous 4xSparePart troll that lets the Survivors instantly finish 4 of the 5 generators required). Whilst this does prevent the game from being stale at any point there's just no fun for both sides if one side brings a broken combination of items.Survivors WILL troll a killer if given the chance. It completely breaks the immersion of a horror game if Survivors employ seemingly nonsensical tactics and teabag you from the other side of a fence knowing that due to their perks or map layout they can easily escape you if you try to go around/over it. Whilst we could still argue that this is part of the gameplay it evidently stops if you run into those that will simply afk in a corner of the map for a hour forcing you to play Hide'n'Seek. And personally I do not enjoy having to literally chase the Survivors out the exit gate either. Because you can rely on the last survivor on the map going to wait at the exit minutes if necessary to keep teabagging until you force him to actually end the game.There can be an argument made that this game is starting to lean on the P2W side. Killers are not created equal. Some are very evidently more powerful then others. Of course given the game is alot about not minmaxing your worst but instead toying around with your prey (from the killer's perspective) you can definitely pick one of the weaker killer's and have fun with it. But the mere fact that some of the new DLC killers are notably on a higher powerlevel then others and cannot be unlocked (except for being able to find rare offerings that let you play as no perk no item DLC killer for a single round aka test run) other than with money strikes me as a potential issue.Overall I think this is evidently one of the 'better' 1vsMany action games out there. As for the horror part it's about as good as a non unique story driven horror game can be nowadays. It's just the list of minor issues above that really make me go 'hmmm' on whether to give a positive or negative recommendation. And given there will always be enough people upvoting everything I'll go with downvote here.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: This is a really fun game especially either as a Killer or a Survivor. It is really rewarding when you do your objective right.THE COMPLAIN I HAVE IS THE MATCHMAKING. Aside from it sometimes bugging out and returning me to the lobby or showing infinite loading screen. The BALANCE with other players specifically the killer I don't know how many times I had to face a high rank killer those red ranks Rank 1 mostly and the worst part is my party were like me low ranks the highest probably Rank 18. The only solution I can think of is to grind this out and level up your character till you get your perks but playing against high ranked killers make the grind even harder when you've got a bunch of low ranks versus a high rank killer. Not that it's always in the favour of Killers though there've been times were its Low Rank Killer vs High Rank Survivors. The matchmaking sucks for both ends especially for the beginners as they are forced to keep losing until they grind out their chosen character's level as if this game wasn't grindy enough. This is game is really fun gameplay wise but matchmaking ruins it I won't recommend this game till it gets fixed. UPDATE I tried playing again and it seems they fixed the loading screen problem the UI is more sleek now too. As for the matchmaking I think the only way to fix this is to A) Grind your chosen character and with his/her bloodpoint use it to upgrade your other characters or B) Spam killer and do the same. Then when you get bored use the other characters to mix it up rinse and repeat then suddenly the matchmaking isn't so bad. With this I think I'll recommend it now.
title: Dead by Daylight

title: Dead by Daylight

review: This game is an excellent asymetric 4v1 horror game with a problematic community. You can play as any of 8 killers (at this time) each distinict in appearance speed and mechanics. There are also 8 playable survivor characters that are less varied but like the killers have some unique perks to unlock that act as a signature playstyle and each survivor is unique in apperance. Controls and mechanics are simple and easy to learn the survivors need to open the doors and escape the killer needs to kill them all. Despite this as this game is all online PvP there is a steep learning curve for new players that is ultimatly quite rewarding once you put the time in to learn. All matches are ranked so your pefromance will dictate your ranking in every match and your mechanics which dictate performance are different for survivors and killers (at this time). Now the bad. The community is flat out terrible. Ultimatly there are two communities depending on whether you prefer surivor or killer and they hate each other with a passion. I would stay away from the discussion boards unless you are looking at announcements much like you would stay away from YouTube comments. The anger and attitude is even on the reviews for this as each side has play strategies that the other side feels is cheating or is unfair. If you see references to "camping" or "looping" that is what I am refering to. The lobbies can be long depending on the player make up at that moment some people will disconnect from games to try and screw the other side or avoid losing items. There are occasional bugs but the developers are constantly working on this game.Ultimatly this is a fun game. Give it some time to learn to play ignore the rude folks and give it a go. You won't regret it.

review: GameplayGameplay is very well thought out. This game produces some very interesting situations and even though sometimes there are minor balancing problems this is well thought out.TechnicalThis game still has a lot of bugs even so long after release.Some of these are minor and do not much harm besides making the game feel like it is of bad quality. For example laggy menus temporary freezes in the game menus inconsistently disabled shortcuts for exiting menus and abysmal loading times and bad performance in general. These things make the game feel very cheap.Other bugs are more annoying like inconsitent state of "ready" signs in lobbys sometimes the lobby system is completely broken without some kind of explanation why it did not work other games usually dsplay some kind of message indicationg the source of the problem.Almost game breaking bugs include the fact that the game interface especially activation of buttons is very laggy and causes me and others i have talked about to completely mess up our actions sometimes not being able to escape beecaus the interface just switches over from "disable trap" to "unhook" wchich completely screws you or the escape tunnel not being able to activate even when it is open and standing directly on top of it. The quick tme events on the generators are equally frustrating if there are lag spikes in the network these minigames are imposible to solve and they are laggy in general I feel at least 1/10 second of lag after pushing the key and seeing the needle indicator stop.SummaryWhile this is a really nice game concept and the setting and mechanics are mostyl well thought out and engaging and the graphics are very god in my eyes this game is sadly a very low quality product from a technical point of view. Also i have watched progress for a while from reports on youtube and later by playing myself and I am very disappointed that many of the obvious issues never got fixed in the past half year. (Others got solved though but in my eyes it is still a mess)If you can overlook the technical shortcommings this is a nice game but I do not whish to endorse badly programmed software and do not recommend this game untill this gets out of beta quality.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Now i'm gonna be honest this game is hard and some days even for good players you can have a really frustrating session. They are trying to make the game more friendly to new players but in my opinion you shouldnt buy the game unless you're a patient person or you've watched quiet a few videos of reasonably skilled players ( i recomend HybridPanda or Ohmwrecker's play style as a good example to new players). This way you won't buy the game become enraged and never touch it again a big mistake new players make. For those get into the game dead byb daylight provides excitement that can leave more serious players sweaty after a close game with either killer or survivor. There is a vast variety or playstyles killers and perks that allow for varied games to prevent a feeling of repetition. Though some playstyles are toxic (such as being targetted all match by the killer or have him stay near the hook you're hooked on and for survivors using strong items and perks to their advantage and worst of all teabagging a killer) most games you will play will be fun and fair. The game isnt perfect ( no game is) but i've played it for 500+ hours and still aren't bored... all it takes is persistance to get a decent skill level at the game before you can access the games full potential. So learn the game before you get it and i hope to see you in the fog some time soon.

title: Dead by Daylight

review: Dead by Daylight was and still is in my opinion one of the best multiplayer horror games. Even today almost after two years I still enjoy the game a lot. The game does have it bugs so there is that to keep in mind but I think that with the new updates coming the game is definitively progressing forward.Pro's The Perk system Its a lot of fun to play with friends online or KYF(kill your friends) The amount of content maps customization killers and items make the game last a lot longer without getting boring even if you only have the one objective.Con's Playing killer against organised survivors is frustrating. You cannot kill them without camping and/or tunneling unless you are very good at the game. Rank reset is problematic because when this happens all the high ranking survivors and killers get in games with new players which isn't very fun for the new players. I'm a survivor main but I have to admit that it is easy to let the killer chase you and keep him on you the entire match whilst the other survivors focus down the generators.All in all Dead by daylight is a great game to play with your friends and even solo. If you look past the bugs and sometimes toxic community this can really be a great game for you. Buy the game with a couple of friends and give it a shot your going to enjoy it.

review: Survivor Review (When I was a survivor main) The most difficult question I can be asked about this game Do you reccomend this game?It's a fine line a very fine line.Dead by Daylight oh what a ride. I've experienced it all From Facecamped after being immediately chainsawed (At the start of a game) to pulling the last survivor not five feet away from escaping to his death.This game is an 5 player Survival horror game. You survive and you kill. There are many different kinds of players in this game Tryhard point fanatics incompotent allies The almighty professional you name it. The game is a current war between those who mainly play killer and mainly play survivor. They argue over what is fair and what is not. The community is mostly a toxic cesspool over how much the game needs to be fixed. Believe me it definitely needs some fixes but not all of what people whine about.A typical game of mine (As survivor) is as follows.Immediately after spawning I go straight to the closest generator.While fixing the generator I need to watch out for the killer see if he's a sneaky one.While doing this I need to do mind bogglingly difficult (I play the game constantly on around 15 25 FPS) skill checks at random.Rinse and repeat.Some variations of this are The killer hangs a friend and you go to rescue them.The killer chases you until you can juke them or escape.The killer catches you and hangs you.As a killer You just generally hunt down and hang survivors.One thing you NEED to know before you buy is that camping soft hardcore or even insidious is basically cancer in this game.After the killer catches a survivor almost all killers stay within the general vicinity of the hook the survivor is on making it near impossible to save them. Some killers literally stare at their victims until they die. Most times the killer patrols the nearby area. Things tend to turn out that when the victim is actually saved the killer just comes straight back immediately targets the victim because they are already injured and an easy target and immediately puts them back on the hook which kills them faster.Is this game fun? Sure. I enjoy killing people as much as the next guy. The moments that make the game worthwhile are the times when you're an inch away from the messenger of death and he didn't even know you were sitting in the grass right in front of him when you dodge his blade at the last second or get saved by a friend taking the hit for you when he literally hits the locker you are hiding in then walks away.Is it repetitive? Yes very much so. It's made in such a way that it becomes a familiar rythm a routine that one enjoys.Is the game hard? For you? you'll probably be fine the game has a ranking system that matches you against similar skilled players. Me? Well I have a computer under the minimun system requirements. I get about 20 fps and I basically have to predict skill checks to get them. The game is very harsh for me. Despite all that I have been rank 1 (the best) multiple times and I have an extensive collection of look perks and my pride and joy prestige items. You can definitely do the same.Is it worth buying? If you have friends who will play with you definitely. If you plan on playing solo know that the game is basically much much more difficult in most aspects.What is my main goal in the game? It depends on you do you tend to prioritize progess perks and items? You'll mostly be there for the Experience (bloodpoints). Are you a violent sociopath? You're gonna wanna get as many mori's as possible stab people for fun etc. Do I reccomend this game? Begrudingly I wouldn't give up those 400 hours of brutal salt filled low fps days even if I could get them back. They were too much fun.*EDIT* It was my comptuer that caused the FPS issues and 100% not the fault of the game. So don't worry about that. I've since earned a higher quality system and it runs fine. Killer Review Coming back to re evaluate this review 800 hours later from this point on.Don't play this game. Particularly if you wish to play as the killer.It fails to deliver what asymetrical games promise many weaker units against a stronger single unit. Instead it is many stronger units against a weaker single unit. Killers are not killers. They are the true victims. Victims of poor game balance overbalance of the multiple and a sour point when it comes to the developers publically announcing any plans for QoL improvement. The game director told you himself Play survivor or go play a different game.I wrote this section after playing mostly killer for those 800 hours after playing mostly survivor for the first 400 hours. You tell me how differently I reviewed the game in between playing both sides Mathieu Cote (Game Director)'s opinion If you don't have fun in this game don't play it go play sid 5.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Had a match where this Claudette sprinted towards a locker and hid in it so I hid in the locker next to her. Next thing I knew she gets out and starts giving away my location to the killer by repeatedly opening and closing my locker.. so I got out and she jumps back inside the locker next to mine. I started spamming open and close on her locker and kept pointing to it in case the killer was around to take care of this cheeky little troll. She just stayed inside there for a solid 20 seconds. Guess she was laughing her butt off cuz I was too. Lucky for us the killer wasn't around. That just made my day. This game never fails to amuse me Then I had another match where the instant I loaded in all the other survivors disconnected at the same time so it was just me and the killer. Either the killer was braindead or he just wanted to toy with me because after he caught me he would spam kick a generator and wait for me to escape his grasp. Then he would be right up on my and down me again. There wasn't an option of finding the escape hatch. The game wanted me to do five generators all by myself. I laughed my butt off and left the match. Well that was a first.. there's a mix of surprises in this game which keeps its entertainment value. This game is a memorable one.

review: Atmospheric asymmetric gameplay which has hidden layers of strategy. Has the classic slasher feel down to a tee.Updated 14/03/17 The devs are trying to concentrate on too many things at once (balancing console versions new killers/survivors bug fixing cosmetics etc) and so updates are not only few and far between but also riddled with bugs. With the community also tearing itself apart I can't recommend at this time.Updated 07/08/17 After getting through a rough patch the game is back in a better place. More frequent updates with more community involvement through challenges with rewards if the community completes them. Also 'cube' updates provide a clear focus on what areas of the game they are improving (e.g. the 'Victory' cube focused on win conditions). There are still plenty of bugs to be ironed out but they don't detract from the experience as much as they used to.

review: Great game! Just the whole vibe of being up close and personal with the killer at times gives you the thrill most games can't. And its even better when you're able to juke out the killer during a chase. Some people claim that Friday the 13th is way better than dead by daylight. The only thing I believe is better about Friday the 13th is how many items you can get. Other then that dead by daylight is way better because you can actually get away from the killer. Most of the time in Friday the 13th the killer will stay on your tail until someone else distracts him or if he just gives up running after you. And that happens rarely. Dead by daylight can feel repetitive at times but overall i feel dead by daylight is better. Definitely recommend both games they are both good. Especially when you have friends to play the games with.

review: Can be fun usually isn't.If you'll hear me out let me explain why it almost always isn't 1. Community toxicity Essentially the community of this game as with most MP games is extremely volatile and toxic. Some examples of this are Racist homophobic trash talk almost always ensues after a match even if everything went normal and fine When you reach higher ranks in the game you get more frequently matched with people who will camp you on the hook until you die ensuring most likely 2 kills and thus ranking up. Rank 1 people are 40 50% campers ruining the feeling of accomplishment and genuine increase in difficulty by ranking up. Any exploit/bug/nerf/buff that is added in a patch will be all you encounter. The current exploit of the month is flashlight saves buffed to basically guarantee the killer drops a player not even a second after the pick up animation finishes and you can't look away until you are 99% blinded and finish the locked animation.2. Bugs Bugs Bugs I have no excuse/explanation why there are still day one style bugs in a game that has been out this long. I don't genuinely play this for the horror element but all it take is one bug and poof you will laugh and chuckle and any tension is gone. Also there have always been game breaking bugs that rarely get addressed. Absolutely astonishing that anyone could have a product not in Early Access and be in this state I would be ashamed as a dev. My current favorite bug just for reference which has been around since the inception of the game is pallet slamming killers is a show. There is like this gamble that the killer might still hit you while being stunned teleport through the pallet to your side or something else but there are genuinely too many pallet related bugs to list.There are literally memes about how buggy this game is. ("Pretty good job so far")3. Repetitve Lack of Variety There is a lack of replayability that you will probably find around the 20 30 hour mark pretty quick. There is one mode that's right one. It's fun for a while but once you grind up to a decent rank you will encounter the above stated toxic people and lose interest fast. But don't worry you can come back again in like 6 months when you forget about the cruminess and are massively deranked and play it like new again until said ranking is achieved remember how frustrating and unfun the game gets and swear the game away again. Trust me I have done this in excess of 3 times. I'm a glutton for punishment or something just save yourself the frustration.4 The Unspoken/Unenforced Rules So there are a few code of conduct rules that are only enforced by the good part of the community so everyone can have fun in the game. They are as follows hook a survivor and leave them don't camp but come on back if they get unhooked if you'd like heal the injured players whenever possible don't heal them if the killer is approaching as you can lock the heal y in place without their consent make sure to unhook survivors while the killer is away or not in line of sight to give both of you a chance to escape without chase do not body block other survivors or work with the killer to kill othersKnowing all these rules and playing by them ensures that pretty much everyone has fun and that the game is fair. When you start out after the initial learning curve of these rules about 80 90% of games following these rules. Around when you reach rank 12 or higher about 30 40% of games follow these rules.5. Most Importantly The fun goes away it really does. I love what this game tried for and hope that one day the game will actually fix itself somehow but the devs don't care (look at the patches they add it seems they test them less and less and rely solely on the most whiney community members for input) and I have very little hope remaining that it will actually be the case.The only suggestion I would have to aide the game is to implement mechanic's that actually enforce the game's unofficial rules not just point incentives that people stop caring about pretty fast in high ranking matches. That or fix ranking somehow but I have little hopes for that.TL DR I got camped 5 out of 6 matches today on the hook then got trash talked in the lobby for being bad somehow. Fix the bugs fix the game mechanics will that happen I sincerely doubt it. Go watch someone play it on youtube it's the only way to enjoy the game consistently. Recommend HybridPanda on YT he's very good at the game and somehow doesn't rage 99% of the time.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: This game is by far my favorite game on steam. The idea of a 1 v 4 hide and seek killer v survivor is a really fun concept. This game is fun to play as both survivors and the killer. Personally I think it's more fun to play as the killer. If you're new to the game I think the killer has more power and wins more. But the more skilled survivors I play against the harder it is the play as the killer. This game is definitely worth the $20.Pros game is fairly balanced (I never find myself winning ever game).The community is helpful in my experience. In a lot of reviews people talk about a "toxic community" but I've only seen a handful of trolls.There is a lot of strategy. This game isn't just about running away from the killer. From auras to perks to teamwork and more there's a lot of strategy that can be put into both the survivor and killer. This game is definitely as fun as you make it. Cons people rage quit mid match (and sometimes before the match begins) too much. You have to buy a dlc for every killer/survivor combo (only one killer and survivor comes with each dlc). And then The DLC's are $7 each. Too pricy they need to combine DLC's or make them cheaper.Every so often you find a killer that camps hardcore. A solid number of bugs the exist and slow response from devs.The last thing I have to say about this game Don't take the game too seriously. Part of the fun of the game is role playing as the killer/survivor. Have fun getting jumps scared and working together to win.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: DEAL BREAKER Dead By Daylight's server browser sucks. If you are playing with friends it gets harder to get into a server as the number of players in your lobby goes up which is backwards. I was trying to find a game with 3 other friends and we ended up finishing a short 30 minute film and we were still searching. If the creators really care about the game they should focus on fixing different aspects of the infrastructure of the game rather than creating DLC and ignoring the pre existing problems.Other then that the game is great! The gameplay in Dead by Daylight allows for different games everytime and guarentees various thrilling moments as you go aganst different killer's and play the map with the generators in different locations every time. The gameplay is rarely ever boring and if you play as killer you never have to worry about getting into a lobby because you create it and each killer has vastly different gameplay styles whereas the survivors just have 3 unique perks.GET THIS GAME7/10 Great game Dire need of bug fixes and system improvements.

review: Last review June 24th 2017Well a year has passed since DBD came out it dragged me back in since they were researching how many survivor wins vs killer wins so I went back playing to contribute meanwhile I found out they fixed a lot of things (except the random terrain merging bug) and added a lot of things and to my biggest surprise most killers stopped with the camping! So I decided to buy all the missing DLCs to see what they have done... I really like the new killers and maps. Each one adds more diversity to the game. I also learned that the real key for liking this game is not to get salty. Even if I lose I can rate a game 5 stars because I had fun if I had fun. I'm aware now in terms of horror gaming it just doesn't get much better the thrill is all here. It's the voyage that matter most more than the outcome we all die at the end anyway D second review November 19th 2016After mor than three months I will now change my review and the rating because I simply don't feel the love for this game anymore as I did back then... finding a match as a killer has become very hard community is full of trolls devs feels annoyed and annoying I'm not watching the twitch anymore it's a waste of time. Devs have promised us free dlcs and free stuff but now they they've seen how many people play their game they want to sell us every form of garbage packaged as paid DLC. Ok the prices are low but what you get is even lower in terms of value. I'm aware being responsible for such game requires a lot of work and listening to a toxic community that always cries no matter what the devs do. It's a nightmare for them and on the other hand it's a nightmare for us playing against trolls. This game has such opposing poles like Evolve that is bound to create hate when they clash i.e. in almost every match. also gets repetitive as hell and is destined to fail if it goes on like this. Another thing devs are giving uber prestige awards to those who prestiged but they are not aware that the vast majority of those who prestiged did so only because exploting infinites as survivor and camping as a killer. Not that I care much about the rewards I just think it's not fair and I absolutely hate campers and exploiters of infinites and especially teabaggers. In the end I had my fun I invested quite some hours in the game also idling and waiting for matches in the lobby. I liked the game too much at the beginning but I'm tired of it now the magic is gone the love is gone. Idk if I will ever be excited again to start up this game because it does not feel exciting anymore but more like frustrating instead. One last thing I may change my review in the future to positive again if I will feel compelled to do so. One never knows what the future holds. First review September 1st 2016I love this game and it's getting better and better with each update. Looks like the devs are listening to their player community in making it a unique fun and very scary experience that everone who likes horror games must experience. I found my heart racing like crazy! Such rush of adrenaline as you try to get out alive! ...or that feeling of satisfaction every sacrificed victim brings to the killer... I played many horror games in general but this is definitely the best multiplayer horror game I know of. There are still some basic issues that should get fixed tho but don't let that scare you away this game is highly recommended!

review: As much as i've enjoyed the game I cannot recommend it with the dreamcrushing "lose all progress" bug. I bought into the game thinking "oh this sort of thing would NEVER happen to me" only to have the game wipe my progress 2 times within a 2 week span. The customer service is... automated for the most part. They only confirm your emails once sent and have no problem ignoring any other context that the email has. Ive been waiting for my first set of bloodpoints for nearly a month now with no update except for "Hello We are currently looking into your issue and we will get back to you as soon as possible. Thank you for your patience! BEhaviour"Which is another easily copy pasted email that is sent to everyone with this issue. This update was sent to me 2 days after my submission and has left me 20 days in the dark with no further updates.An alternative to this horrifying bug is to constantly manually back up your cloud data after every session in order to avoid a complete wipe. But unless you do it after every round of playing theres always a risk you might lose SOMETHING. Personally though I dont think for a paid title (that were paying for with hard earned cash) I should be obligated to do ANY sort of manual work when they have servers of their own. This is especially true knowing how many other multiplayer alternatives there are out there who dont have such a frustrating bug.All in all Fun game (especially with friends) ruined by a frustrating bug that ruins an experience so focused on progressing individual characters and killers. Not to mention you lose your competitive rank if you're into that sort of thing.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: I can't reccomend the game right now only because of the infinitives. If you do not know infinitives are these parts of the map that are at every single generator they consist of barriers and windows. If you do not know the windows and barriers are easy to cross if you are a survivor but takes forever if you are killer. So all they have to do is knock down the barrier and keep running over the barriers and windows and you can't die. You just got to wait for the killer to be stunned then run away. Since I really enjoyed playing killer originally this makes me heartbroken. Now I am forced to give this a bad rating just because I can no longer play killer. Behaviour Interactive please fix these problems.Update They have had tryed to fix these problems to the point that if you get good enough you can but the survivors can still counter (ON SOME MAPS! Can't stress that enough also the Halloween DLC killer is broken with the stalker perk (Seriously it just shows the killer the survivors location).But knowing all this it is still a good game just fix the problems please Behaviour Interactive try your best.

review: I really really want to like this game. I do like it just not as much as I had hoped. This game is based upon a genius premise a horror game with/ against other players however the execution of this brilliant idea is not best expressed by Dead by Daylight. Allow me to make a lis t of Pros and Cons.Pros Interesting Idea Good Story and Level Design Iconic Killer Micheal Meyers Base price is reasonableCons Glitches and Bugs EVERYWHERE Graphics are good for a PS2 Bad Animations Lack of creativity for survivor character design Pricey DLC that should have been free (Blood Sack and 80s Suitcase) Gameplay gets repetitiveI still enjoy this game but these devs need to fix some serious isssues. I will continue to have high hopes for this games future but right now jus keep it stored on your wishlist.

review: Alright children get your popcorn its gonna be a long ride so first off i've been playing dead by daylight since like june 2017 i just got back into dead by daylight heres the part of the killers normal killers trapper the trapper is one of the best free killers its probally the killer everyone has played if they have played killer before. The wraith The wraith aka BING BONG is very bad he eats pallets 24/7 if he wants to get someone while uncloacking just body block the guy then you'll be out and hit em. the hillbilly the hillbilly requires lots of skill mainly used to get around the map fast and scare survivors in rank 1 the hillbilly is your worst enemy he is kinda like leatherface.the nurse Alright the nurse requires lots of skill but is very rewarding dont expect to just play the nurse first time and get a kill or two the nurse requires memory useing add on can mess up that memory a true nurse killer wont use add ons mainly because it damages there memory and could make them lose maybe (.the huntress requires some skill not as much as nurse still is rewarding unlike the nurse the huntress is a little faster and can throw projectiles this makes up for her being slow she has a lullaby that can be heard from a distance if you hear the heartebeat RUN that means she right up on you.The cannibal The cannibal is great for camping but only scrubs do that playing leatherface requires making decisions if a survivor is close to window or pallet mallet if you have time use the chainsaw chilli boy doesent require much skill if your a pleb you use insidious with a reved chainsaw outFinally but not least THE PIG opinion time i think the pig is a great stealth character and is basiclly hex ruin as a killer putting traps on survivor slow down the game a lot im not gonna tell you how she works but just use the traps every once in a while dont use them all at the startPros_____For killers pallets getting removed a little )For killers terror radius is a little broken (For survivors Borrowed time saves life )For survivors gens get fast with gen rushing squad's ) (Cons_____This game can be a little buggy (killers can lag swith (the player base will slowly die VERY SLOWLY (For killers most survivors are great and expect to get your butt kicked when you see 4 jakes with boxesTHE END

review: When i first bought this game i played only 9 hours and then i said "That's too horror for me" an i uninstalled it. After 2 weeks i tried to play a match and matchmaking couldn't find me any match. But when the new update has come out (A lullaby for the dark) the game found me matches and i played a lot SWF. Then i played for 100+ Hours and i like it soooo much. Only three problems about this game 1) Matchmaking is bad so when i play a match my teammates have rank 20 and i have rank 12. 2) The game files are in yor computer so when reinstalling Dead By Daylight or Windows all your progress is lost. 3) Laggy matches. Killers host the match so when you see a laggy killer and you press Alt+F4 an lose 3 pips well that's not funny at all In conclusion that uniqe concept of horror game is godd but it laks some fetures. I recommend this game . I give 10/10. Thx for reading and i recomend it ! Update After some months the game is still my favourite but the community is dying every day even with those new features. RIP Dead By Daylight 2016 2018.... You'll be remebered

review: For what it is a horror game that simulates both the hunter and the hunted this game is very good and very fun but...It SUCKS being a new player. Veteran players already have a HUGE advantage over new players in mastering the mechanics and maps of the game but as a new player you're going up against people who ALSO have full perk setups when you're starting out with none (in beginner matches). If this company wants to net gain rather than net lose players they would be well advised to try and bring a little more equity to the new/early player experience. Perhaps implement perk limitations by match Rank (1 perk max for Rank 16 20 2 perks for Rank 11 15 3 perks for Rank 6 10 4 perks for Ranks 1 5) to help make low rank matches more competitive rather than the bloodpoint farm they often seem to be for veteran players.I'm recommending this game but with a WARNING to new players. Just go in expecting to get crushed (and sometimes trolled) for your first many games and you'll have more and more moments that are remarkably fun in a way that is unique to this game.*EDIT*Since my review there have been some updates to the way matchmaking and ranking occurs that help remedy my earlier complaint about early matches being unrelentingly imbalanced for the new player. The situation has changed for the better. The developer has also been very timely with the release of new costumes maps killers and survivors which is admirable.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Product received for free. Deep down there is a very fun game at the core of Dead by Daylight. Unfortunately it utilizes a perk system which means until you've played the game for hours other players including your opponents are going to have mechanical advantages over you in game such as seeing you through walls getting buffs to their movement speed and increasing the time required to complete quicktime events required to win the game. You are expected to spend hours completing games and gaining xp (Which will not carry over between individual characters) just to end up on a level playing field with experienced players. There is no way to play online with random players without running into this problem. Unless you have 4 other friends who also own this game and are willing to play in private matches I cannot reccomend this game to anyone
