review: Dwight was geeky and scrawny through high school. He always wanted to be one of the cool kids but somehow never had the charisma. He tried out for the football team but was cut the basketball team didn't even take a look and his grades were distinctly below average. One weekend on a team building exercise from his dead end job Dwight's boss led them deep into the woods before breaking out his family recipe moonshine. Dwight remembered taking the first sip before waking up late the next morning all alone. During the night the others had abandoned him. Once again the laughing stock of the community Dwight tried to hike his way out of the woods. That was the last anyone ever heard of Dwight Fairfield.Dwight isn't the typical guy you think of when someone says "Survivor". He lacks that certain pizazz and without his glasses he's more or less blind. But as the sun sets and the woods comes alive Dwight clasps to his rat race life making sure that he'll live to see another day even though something unimaginable is after him. Dwight won't stop. He'll survive no matter what. As others spent hours being seen in high school. He spent hours becoming invisible and avoiding danger. And it doesn't matter if it's dangers in the hallway or dangers in the woods. Survival is key. As other employees panic when terror infects them Dwight makes use of his disturbing teen experience. The tables have now turned and now others need to follow to Dwight's firm directions if they are to survive as he knows how to disappear.Dwight's PerksThese are perks which start off only appearing in Dwight's Bloodweb IconHelp bloodweb.png. After achieving level 30 teachable versions of these perks can be found Bond level 30Prove Thyself level 35Leader level 40If obtained other survivors are able to find Dwight's perks in their Bloodwebs from that point on.Dwight is skilled at finding others and working as a group. His perks help him and others by keeping them together and alive. Thus this means that Dwight's perks are centered around others.Icon Name DescriptionBond.gifBond Unlocks potential in one's Aura reading ability. Allies' Auras IconHelp auras.png are revealed to you when they are within 12/24/36 metres."We have to work as a team I need you to survive so that I can survive!" Dwight FairfieldUnique to Dwight Fairfield until Level 30 at which point its Teachable version can then be learned and taught to the other Survivors.ProveThyself.gifProve Thyself Receive an incremental speed bonus to repair healing and sabotage actions when other Survivors are within an 8 metre range.1 nearby Survivor grants 1/2/3 % increased speed.2 nearby Survivor grants 2/4/6 % increased speed.3 nearby Survivor grants 3/6/9 % increased speed."I'll show you what I can do!" Dwight FairfieldUnique to Dwight Fairfield until Level 35 at which point its Teachable version can then be learned and taught to the other Survivors.Leader.gifLeader You're able to organize a team to cooperate more efficiently. Increases the other Survivors' Repair Healing and Sabotage speed by 3/6/9 % when they are within an 8 metre range from you."Listen to me if you don't wanna end up on a hook." Dwight FairfieldUnique to Dwight Fairfield until Level 40 at which point its Teachable version can then be learned and taught to the other Survivors.AchievementsMain article AchievementsThere is currently 1 achievement which is related to Dwight.Icon Name DescriptionAch adeptDwight.jpg Adept Dwight Unlock Dwight's 3 perks and teachable perks.CustomizationPlayers can customize their character by choosing one outfit style from each category. Blood stained attire is obtained after Dwight reaches level 50 and prestiges.Some items of clothing can only be worn if the appropriate DLC is owned.Dwight's attire includes Head Torso LegsDweard Dwight Cubed Brown SlacksPrestigePrestige I Bloody Friday Shirt (Torso)Prestige II Bloody Slacks (Legs)Prestige III Bloody Dwight (Head)DLCMain article Downloadable ContentDwight is currently part of 8 DLC packages Available DLCThe 80's SuitcaseLeft BehindHeadcaseCharity CaseUnavailable DLCDweard + Sharp Mustache JakeYouTubers/Streamers Exclusive (Admiral Bahroo &amp Twitch Exclusive)Red Shirt Pack (REQUIRES Left 4 Dead or Left 4 Dead 2)BloodlettingTriviaDwight is one of the four original Survivors who were first introduced to Dead by Daylight IconHelp DBDlogo.png.The other three Survivors are Jake Park Meg Thomas and Claudette Morel.Dwight is one of three Survivors to wear glasses.The others being Claudette Morel and Ace Visconti.There are various internet memes that circulate amongst the community concerning Dwight as he is stereotyped as the "noob" or "default" character. Another stereotype is that Dwight players are traditionally located inside lockers and not assisting his fellow survivors which is (as his perks suggest) his primary role.Dwight's first job was a pizza delivery guy.The creators of Dead by Daylight are selling merchandise that includes "Dwight Fairfield's First Job Shirt"A meme called "The Cult of Dwight" which consists of Dwight Players following around the Killer staring at him/her.

review: Dead by Daylight is a neat ol' "horror" game where 4 survivors go against 1 killer all of which are players. The survivors are tasked with repairing generators and opening the exit doors then leaving and the killer has to stop that from happening and slaughter everybody. "You put horror in quotes! You don't think it's scary?" After 100 hours the game is less scary and more spooky. It can still be unnerving but if you hide in a locker the entire game your team will lose so acting scared gets you killed. Once you start acting brave you slowly realize "Hey this isn't so bad!" and decide that your team needs you working otherwise it's game over. There are scary moments like when you realize "How long has Micheal been stalking me for?" or "Where's the Wraith?"But regardless you are tasked with dealing with your fear for the greater good. All the killers are unique but there is a tier list and such based on their skill caps which makes the game sound pay2win but all the high tier killers are actually without DLC's. + the pay2win part is in a game that is already $20 so hey what can ya do? There are perks that you can unlock for each killer and survivor so you can make your own builds and such however you want to play. If you just throw perks together chances are you'll get boned but that doesn't mean there are few working builds you can make TONS of them based on your playstyle. Regardless sometimes you get sadistic teammates and altruistic killers but the majority of the time it's you in a horror movie having a grand ol' time. 9.5/10 Leatherface needs to be removed.

review: Honestly this game isn't really skill based or "asymetrical" at all. An asymetrical player v. player game consists of a single entity that is overpowered and a group that is extremely underpowered but has the single unit bested in numbers. This game does that all wrong. The survivor team is overly powerful in the fact that they have perks that can make it 100% impossible to kill someone in the end game "Borrowed Time" being the biggest example. And for killers like FREDDY FRICKEN KRUEGAR (a killer who is literally known for making his own rules) this game just simply doesn't do justice. Ususally I find survivors to just run circles around the killer and stick around at the exits just in sake of taunting the killer because of his/her weakness. All in all I feel as though this game is a disgrace to big horror characters like Michael Myers Leatherface Freddy Kruegar and now Jigsaw. I honestly find it to be quite a disgrace to the horror genre as a whole a genre that means very much to me. This game seems to be much more about the pallets than anything else. I do believe that this is a good concept for a horror game and even that it was great in its earlier stages but as it is now it seems a lazy excuse for bringing great characters to a situation that makes them look like idiots. I hope that this game can one day be great because as I see it now I wish i could return this game with all of its extra DLC because I feel that the $60+ price tag for this game and all of its extras is just not anywhere near worth it.

review: I love this game The game and The Last Breath update/Free DLC is fun! People are complaining about bad matchmaking today (release of The Last Breath DLC) when yeah it is terrible at times. But well worth the wait. Slow matchmaking on a Play for Free weekend + DLC release day is expected just because it will have more traffic than usual. But regardless I think this game is fantastic! I play both Killer and Survivor and love both equally people who are also complaining are mad because they aren't balanced. But they aren't supposed to be it's an ASYMMETRICAL game. Anyway I think it's great and would recommend it to everyone that likes Survival and Horror games.Edit on Jan. 9th 2018 I now have 1720+ hours in the game I have put about 800 hours into Killer the rest into Survivor. I occasionally enjoy this game but it feels completely different from when I left my first review. There are still some bugs that exist since the beginning (Pallets that spawn incorrectly and missing textures only one two or three people loading into a match instead of the required four and so on.) Most importantly the Devs need to rework their maps currently they are way too RNG based and a few game mechanics need to be fixed (Decisive Strike Survivor Perk Instantly Throwable Huntress Hatches (Due to Add Ons Flower Babushka &amp Manna Grass Braid along with the Perk Tinkerer) Bloodlust needs to either be slower or Bloodlust Tier 3 needs to be removed. I do recommend this game for a group of friends who would play it for fun and not competitively otherwise the community is terrible.Edit on July 31st 2018 (Changed to Not Recommended) Great community 10/10 would NOT recommend. Survivors or Killers complain about every single thing you do you can't make anyone happy if you're buying this game for KYF I recommend it. Other than that the community turned it into complete garbage. Do note that there are still some amazing people out there in the game but you get more bad than good. Also yes I still play the game but I won't recommend it for new buyers.
title: Dead by Daylight

title: Dead by Daylight

review: 9/10I throughly enjoy this game. I feel that the game is balance it rewards smart plays punishes bad ones. I hear a lot of negative thoughts on the game and what I have to say in regard to those? 'You're not doing it Right'. "The Killers are too Weak" Correction you're not playing them right. Playing the killers requires thought before action play mind games with the survivors. I see a lot of killers attempting to just straight up chase and kill like the climax of a horror movie you need to build up to the climax where the survior is desperate to leave. Make them panic make them make choices faster you need to control both sides of emotions and thoughts "Survivors are too Weak" Survivors also have to play mind games this does not mean find one spot and jump over it constantly you will die this way to a smart killer. The flashlight 'does' work but you need to know how to aim at the face not wiggle it around like you're shooing the killer. The medkit is helpful because that means you won't get hit once and fall next time the tool box may not seem like it speeds up repairs but it does.Overall the complaining of this game gets me pretty down the developers are pretty good they can add a few features and tweak a few mechanics but I throughly believe this game to be good.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: I nominated this game for "The Villan Most in Need of a Hug" award. At first this might sound weird. But look a the backstories of some of the killers most notably the Hillbilly. Anyway this game is fun. It's hard to get tha hang of but then once you get it you can get twelve thousand bloodpoints per game easy. I mostly play survivor because I play with my friends but I'm much better as a killer. Both sides are balanced as the survivors if they know what they are doing can easily hide and not get found or if they are found get away. The killers are balanced. Trapper can place traps in random places or stagegically to catch the survivors off guard but the traps can be sabatoged and avoided. The Hillbilly can knock people down instantly and traverse the map quickly but if you avoid his chainsaw he becomes stunned and that can make the difference between life and death. The Wraith's stealth abilites can be seen through by using premonition and spine chill and if you don't have those his breathing is quite loud. The Nurse's teleport is easily avoided and can stun her letting you get very far away. And finally Michael. The one eveyone has been compaining about. Sure he's annoying. His first stage he might as well not have a heartbeat and pemonition and spine chill don't work. But he's slow and can't lunge very far in that stage. His second stage increases that heartbeat range and his speed but it's still not as fast as the other killers. Now the third stage is a bit of a weird one to try and give reasons for it being balanced. It's instant knockdown super fast and normal heartbeat. But it dosen't last forever. And if you can escape and hide from him you can waste it. Then he has to waste more time stalking people to fill that bar up again. The survivors on the other hand aren't balanced. I mean that in the way of one survivor being better than another. Claudette's self heal is definately better than Dwight's prove thyself. But I do recommend it. Get it. Play it. We could always use more survivors in our ranks.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Product received for free. Dead by Daylight is a 1 v 4 horror survival game that really needs more things to be added. For example singleplayer. Bots would be great. Also some minor improvements and changes could be made. The Nurse has a stupid amount of bugs like teleporting THROUGH THE MAP and getting stuck in places that not accessable. Michael Myers should be changed a little bit too. His ability to mask his heartbeat is incredibly useful but also very unfair. Most of the concepts and killers are based off of real things. Most likely. The trapper is a big hulking dude that has a large machete like weapon who has extreme loyalty to a family memeber and also wears a mask. The hillbilly has a hammer and chainsaw a covered deformed face and hangs people on hooks. If that's not Leatherface from Texas chainsaw Massacre I don't know what is. However it is nice to see some creative twists on the originals. I'll always like the originals better but these look alikes are also very good too. In conclusion this game could use a lot more polish and added stuff but it is SUPER FUN to play with a group of friends. You can find videos of people playing it together just having the time of their lives This game could be much better. I'm just gonna wait for Friday the Thirteenth.Update. They made it a lot better.
title: Dead by Daylight

They clearly lack development knowledge and I feel they hired them off freelancer or craigslist. They don't care about the community or listen to feedback. It's all about the $. In one of their streams they said they haven't had to put ANY overtime into this game! Even when there was game breaking exploits delayed patches (waited over 3 4 months for it to come out when it was promised) and players unable to play due to freezes! They still didn't put the effort or time into fixing their game. Don't buy it!

Killers are camping in your face or so close nobody can come near you when your hooked. Other Survivors take longer to rescue you or don t even come to help you (this could be because of killers face camping ). I am not saying this goes for everyone there are still a lot of good people playing this game who don t. It just now I bought the game it seems I am getting placed into bad matches. I am recommend the game just because I had a lot of fun playing it however there are some issues with this game but then again every game has it s issues.

review: Really tried to like this game. If you haven't put in 200 hrs you're going to get outmatched constantly. Experienced players have so many perks (which many are shamelessly OP) that it's impossible to have a fun experience as a new killer or survivor. I played survivor for about 55 hours and match making kept putting me in games with killers that have hundreds of hours and all maxed out perks. Then I tried to play killer and was again matched with survivors that have hundreds of hours. If you haven't play for hundreds of hours it's too late to enjoy this game. Unless you enjoy waiting 10 mins for a game and losing very quickly. I'm finally giving up on this game. Maybe they'll fix their matchmaking. Expect to run into cheaters as well.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: This is a hard one to swallow but i'm still recommending it. I love the game and the gameplay is good especially with a group of friends or if your alone its still as enjoyable (so long as your the killer and not some pub group).It's just the developers haven't been making the best decisions for the game. I can understand the paid dlc for the new killer and the charcters so that they can make more content and new maps but the cash shop they've put in is a step too far in my opinion it feels like Smite's unlocking system (which would be fine) if they didn't already have paid dlc for the game. Still though other than that this game is still worth picking up in my opinion even with its poor development team it has given me and my friends a good laugh a few scares and thats what games are for really at the end of the day enjoying yourself so I'd still recommend it.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Product received for free. CURRENT REVIEW. 1/31/2018The game is fun but as you get higher up in ranks the balance issues become quite glaring.You can do well with the Killer but your success more hinges on survivors making bad plays rather than you making good ones. Don't get me wrong you can definately tell a difference between a good and bad killer but the survivors dictate the match.If they play overly altruistic you can capitalize on the time they waste but if they use their time wisely the gens will be done in a very short ammount of time. Survivors can ultimately bully the killer at higher skill levels tea bagging and taunting all along the way. A competant team of survivors can easily get 3 survivors out alive if not all 4 against a killer equally competant.Killers have some tricks they can perform but most of the cards are in the survivors hands.It is fun it is also very frustrating at times the toxic community ( mainly on the survivor side ) make it even more so.It's kinda weird when a game makes you feel bad for the killer.OLD REVIEWI deleted my last review but it's still acurate.Basically if you are good at survivor you're permitted to be a total butthead and unless you're facing a perfect killer player AND they are playing nurse they can't do anything about it.Have fun with the survivor bias and the buttheads who play them.I've played in a lot of toxic communties (WOW LoL Dota 2. . .) but this is by far the worst and it all comes from the killer having NO recourse agaisnt cheap and lame survivor tactics and survivors having a way out for just about anything the killer does. As a killer you can't even facecamp ( which is pretty much the lamest thing a killer can do ) and get a kill 100% because of borrowed time aka get out of jail free card#213375689127 for survivors.It's a fun concept but the incompetance in the management ruins it.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Wow what a game! I might have little time on the game but here's my experience with the game.Overall rating 8.5/10Pros Intense atmoshphere An AMAZING price for the amount of content it offers Its a good game to play with freinds OR by yourself Prety bug free. (there are some but few and non game breaking) really good net code (it blows some triple A titles out of the water) Decently sized comunity so it doesnt take to long to find a match Comunity is not to toxix (you will get the occasional try hard who is a stuck up Not an extreme learning curve but enought to actually feel like you're improving The graphics are amazing The game is well optimized (i got an alienware aurora r6 pc for the hollidays and its held this game up well!. My specs are at the bottom of the review)Now for the cons. There is no tutorial so you kinda wing it and hope you're actualy helping the team or playing killer right It's a bit pay to win with Freddy Krueger and Michael Myers If someone disconects there isnt much of a penalty so far ive only seen people get instant losses when the dc so no real punishment The level system could use a rework since it forces you to choose a main between being a killer or survivor then proceeds to force you to choose a main beetween each character of said choice Leather face is literally a reskin of the hillbilly but considerd a different killerThats prety much it. Now going onto my system (witch can run the game on ultra 1080p and still go 60fps+)Intel core i5 7400k 3.00 Ghz (overclocked to 3.30 GHZ)16GB RAMNvidia GTX 1060 6GB VRAMWindows 10 64bitAll runing at a resolution of 1920x1080

review: I've played this game for a couple months now. When I started it was fun but the more I've gotten into it the more monotonous it is and the community is purely toxic. You have a bunch a people who only want to play survivor and a bunch of people playing killer and both sides are screaming at each other about how unfair the other side has it in terms of tweaks to the game. The biggest flaw I'm finding right now is that you have killers camping survivors that they hooked moreso since they implemented the emblem system. It makes the game excrutiatingly boring. Assuming you don't want to screw over your team if you're hooked you're just sitting there staring at the killer. If someone else is hooked and camped you're just performing endless skill checks on gens with no one chasing you. If I could get my money back I would.

review: This game DOES have its issues and its far from perfect! My biggest issue with this game is its matchmaking. review: Amazing game but not without a few hitches. It's very immersive fun and interesting once you get the hang of it. Matchmaking at present can pose a steeper learning curve for new players (recommend playing with a friend) due to high ranks vs low etc. But that presents another problem in that the lobbying of the game is cumbersome and it can take a long time to get you into the game. The Devs have acknowledged this and considering Survive With Friends is fairly new as well as the game itself it's understandable that tweaks are being fixed.I appreciate the continued updates from the Devs &amp their livestreams where questions from fans are answered (can attest to this mine was!) and they provided a lot of information on upcoming releases (chapters bug fixes etc.) as well as answering questions and taking into account player problems and feedback. Mattieu has said he reads the steam forums a lot (lore especially) and that sort of interaction with Devs/ open communication is appreciated.tl dr Very good game a few problems but it's a new release &amp Devs have acknowledged and said they are working on fixes. Game can be hard at first but once you progress a little learn a lot and get some practice in it's amazingly fun. 10/10.
title: Dead by Daylight

title: Dead by Daylight

review: ADDITIONAL IMPORTANT UPDATE 11/25/16 NOW 400+ HRS IN....Yeah still crack addiction....IMPORTANT UPDATE 9/19/16 &amp HUNDREDS OF HOURS LATER...Dead By Daylight equals crack addiction and I ve spent far longer playing it than I thought I would largely due to its continued popularity as it s multiplayer only so unless the devs can add in the ability to play solo w/ bots (which would defeat the whole purpose of a game like this but would still be nice for when there are no longer peeps playing) there is no other way to play it.Granted getting my Dwight Fairfield to P3LV50 was so maddeningly frustrating at times when considering the fact that I didn t procure the sprint self heal or sabotage perks even one time (for reals I don t recall them having ever been made available to me while leveling ) that I felt like throwing my controller through a window then throwing the remains of that window through another window. But that aside who would have thought that starting up generators and tipping over pallets as a survivor for hundreds of hours could be so fun. Generators are typically how you ll survive a match and you need to power up 5 of them to activate the exit doors of which there are 2. There s also the exit hatch that can be seen once enough generators are powered up and you can either use a skeleton key in advance to escape though those are an ultra rare item or you can survive long enough to be the last survivor and it will open for you if you know where to find it. Being a killer can be fun too but in my opinion the nurse is totally unbalanced and against her the pallets are virtually useless.One of the best things to have come from this game for me besides fond memories and the lingering creeping dread and tension of trying to survive is the fact that I ve spent far longer leveling up characters in this game than in any other I ve played to date which now makes me feel that leveling up a character in a different game will no longer be anywhere near as frustrating or as time consuming as it sometimes seems to be.Behav10r simply put you have made the best 4v1 survival horror game to date please make more in the future (oh and be sure to make at least one of the male characters have an immaculate Dwight like stache) ORIGINAL REVIEW FROM LATE JUNE/EARLY JULY Do you like cornfields? Do you like powering on machines? Junkyards? Estates? Chainsaws? Hooks? Sacrifices? Perks items burnt offerings hillbilly killers crows and quite possibly pooping in your pants? Well my friends if you can say 'YES' to any of those things then you'll love this game. It looks good plays great and killing or being killed has never been more fun.

review: Great game. Here is the quick and simple Can be intense as a survivor inducing some horror elements (good). Lots of potential (good). Glitches but few and apparently being worked on (good). Ranking system (good). In game items (good). No matchmaking (bad). No penalties for leaving early which hurt opposing player/s (bad). Lobby uncontrolled leaving good players leaving and restarting matches to match up with better players (bad). No friend option for public matches (bad). No in game chat or voice within distance chat (biggest pet peeve).Most of the things I have listed are bad but I feel they will be fixed. The developers seem to listen and respond to players so hopefully things progress since this game is alread fun but can be really really good. So given that the good in this game will outweigh the bad.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Hello my current name is Xyltice and I would like to adress an issue that has plagued some peoples computers ever since the new Valentine's day/Chinese new year update came out.Some things to note is that I currently have 286.1 hrs on the game I will give this review a thumbs up (even though I am adressing issues) and that the issue I am talking about no longer effects me (It used to and I don't know why).So let's now dive into this review.Dead by Daylight is an indie multiplayer horror game based around a person playing as a killer hunting down the 4 survivors who are also being played by other real people. The killer has to hunt down the survivors beat them down and put them on hooks. Whilst the survivors have to power up 5 gens out of 7 open an exit gate and escape.In it's days prior to the new update Dead by daylight has it may have been buggy or laggy at times but it was a god damn fun game to play with a balanced addicting levelling system. You could expand your playstyles by levelling up your chosen character or pick a new one to play. This goes both with survivors and killers.The graphics are neat especially after the new update and there is quite a lot of content for $20 if Dead by Daylight was still in the state it was before the update I would've suggested this game to everyone. But now I would only suggest it to people who have really good computers. And heres why.Frames. Dead by Daylight for me runs at around the 30fps which is considered a requirement for most games have 25 frames and you will start feeling like you are lagging and cannot control the actions of what you would normally accomplish at 30 frames. So when the devs decided to update their game with new graphics mechanics and content. People's computers couldnt take it. And are now playing at 10 20 frames.This is a huge problem as yes it may affect a little portion of the fanbase but that means that they can't play anymore. I thought I had this problem as well as one time I was playing nurse (one of the killers) and couldnt hit most of my strikes. For now I don't have this issue yet other people still do. This isn't something that can't be fixed easily either. But I'm just here to give a review.I do not reccomend most people Dead by Daylight in it's current state. I would've prior to the update but unfortuneatly that is not the case. Only buy this game if you know you can run it. Otherwise you might regret paying $20. I don't know if this issue still exists but I will still give you notice. I hope this Warning/Review/Adress helped you and I hope you have a nice day. Xyltice
title: Dead by Daylight

review: TLDR Game gets repetitive very fast and it's not competitive by any means. Developers can't fix core problems instead introduce OP perks to make things more balanced and that leads to unfun experience in my opinion. It is also very close to P2W experience because some "meta perks" are tied to DLC character's. Also there are no dedicated servers the killer player is always server host so expect some laggy games with people that have poor connection or do some intentional lagging/cheating. So this game is one of those games that is great on paper but have poor execution. Don't get me wrong this game is really fun for few hours and could be for even more if you have casual mindset and just want to play something to pass the time. The thing that get me hooked to this game the most was character progression and leveling. I often found myself in situation where I just played another match because I wanted to see if perk I want will show on next level up but this can take you only so far. I bought the game because I watched one of the streamers I enjoy to watch playing this game and population was quite high. Huge mistake got hyped and I regret it highly. It's like the first time I got baited into game like that but lesson learned.I played survivor mostly and the game boils down to constant repairing generators runnig from the killer for a while getting hooked and repeating the whole process. Forget about stealthy plays this is not what the devs are aiming for in this game. Killers have plenty of "wallhack perks" and can spot you easily or they are aware you are near them. Here is the latest dev stream where they talk about it https //www.twitch.tv/videos/283820197?t 55m48sThey so called ranking system is pure abomination. If you want to rank up you have to forget about your main objective of the game escape. No no. You have to be chased or help people that were hooked and/or heal them. If you do your job and fix generators as fast as possible and escape you will not get enough match points in "emblem categories" to rank up.This balance problem is tied to another problem called "toxic survivors" friends join lobby as a team to play versus the killer. They use flashlights to blind killer so he drops person he was carrying to the hook. They also body block him and distract whole game and run in loops to waste his time etc. while someone is doing generators. To make it worse survivors have some nasty perks too and by nasty I mean unfun for the killer for instance they can suddenly escape from the killer grasp on demand (and that can lead to killer camping the hooked survivor and ignoring everyone or focusing one survivor just to get the kill imaging you are the person that gets treatment like that zero fun guaranteed).The perks topic is a big beast that have many more problems but it shows the balance approach of the developers. They will throw more and more perks to balance the game instead of trying to fix the core problems. And here is one thing I wasn't aware off this whole perk system is very close to P2W experience. Each character in game have 3 unique perks you can level that character so the perks get unlocked for other characters ( 20h). But some character's can be obtained only by buying DLC. Some can be bought for in game currency but it takes very very long to get enough to buy one! In my 50h game time I gained 7k of that currency it takes 9k to buy one character. If there are multiple perks that are currently meta or must have prepare your wallet and some time cause even if you buy character you want you still have to level him up. And you if go for specific build you better start prying to the RNG gods right now cause the perks you are aiming for may not show on that character in the next few hours because they are random. There is also this thing called Shrine of Secrets that once per week have 4 random unlockable perks to buy just for 2k in game currency what a deal!So the last aspect I really don't like about this game is that there are almost no graphics options to set in game. You can chose between low mediun high ultra only. This game is on Unreal Engine so you can change some settings in config file but man this speak miles about those developers. Game is out for 2 years now. There is not even borderless window mode.On closer here is a video I just found from someone that was playing this game a lot it shows how this game is on higher ranks and how developers approach this game https //www.youtube.com/watch?v 4kwvMKjXp94 I wish I would find it before I decided to buy this game.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: I really liked DBD! It had a very promising concept upon being released and held up to its name. I used to think that the killers were rather powerful since I had been playing with a smaller group of people but upon playing the game online with rankings and others in a full team I do think that the killers stand less of a chance against larger groups of players. This especially goes for those working together in a chat.I think what really helps would be a customization center that the killer could establish or one where survivors establish and killers can peruse for matches based on those settings. Things like Perk limitations rankings items maybe. I hadn't noticed this so called "toxic fan base" yet but I don't disagree that it exists. It is a game that is highly based on having friends to play with and outside chat so I would definitely suggest this game more for players with online friends willing to join in on the fun. Maybe even a group of five so you can have a killer with you versus a stranger if you're willing.TLDR good game but could be a bit more balanced maybe with new configurations depending on preferences. Need chat and need some friends to play!

review: Consumers beware Killers that camp the hooked survivors (either facecamp or camp running around in circles) and killer perks that allow active aura reading abilities (BBQ &amp Chili Territorial imperative Deerstalker Bitter murmur A nurse's calling) or passive tracking (Whispers) are kind of toxic and unfun to play against as a survivor denying any sort of survival / stealth aspect that the vg could have. Since killer mains won't show any empathy towards you in the forums if you're looking forward to play as a solo survivor I wouldn't suggest to buy the game in its current state. Playing with a lobby of friends is highly encouraged and enjoyable though you will either way stumble upon one of those killers aforementioned.

review: Recommended
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Game is decent but there are numerous problems both on the ends of survivors and killers.Problems for Survivors The basement can be OP as hell depending on the map and the killerThere are some incredibly useless perks that either need to be removed or changed (almost every single non learnable perk) which can lead to some really stale builds especially in higher ranked play. Not that it's necessary that you run meta perks or any perks at all but 95% of people doThe map design for The Game is absolutely atrocious and is nigh unwinnable when up against the Nurse or the Doctor but it's still really strong for every killer except BillyThere is pretty much no counter play against the Nurse (no I don't care that she "is the most difficult killer to learn" that's no excuse for making her literally uncounterable and when you get above rank 10 pretty much every Nurse knows what they're doing)The grind is absolutely insane. Look at my hours played. I only have 1 prestige 2 character 1 level 50 character and 3 characters somewhere between levels 35 40. And the rest which make up more than half are at level 0Problems for Killers When multiple survivors run DS and/or Borrowed Time it's probably the most tilting thing on this Earth. Especially in higher ranked play and even more so in SWF when everyone is way more coordinated and knows what they're doingThe grind is really bad just not as bad for survivors since killers on average get more bloodpoints. Again it's still really bad. All of my killers are rank 0 since I only play them to complete dailies. So in case you read my above tidbit about what rank my survivors are and you thought "oh maybe this person has leveled up their killers as well surely the grind can't be thaaaat bad." Yes it is in fact that badSome killers are just... way superior to other killers. Since the Wraith got his changes in PTB he's actually viable now but Freddy is still considered extremely weak by most of the community. Leatherface and Trapper (but also the Clown and the Pig to some extent) mostly rely on the survivors making mistakes in general. Also the meta CLEARLY favors high mobility killers such as Billy and the Nurse and the Huntress who has a ranged attackOther than all of that the game is pretty good. It's fun has good atmosphere all that jazz. It's just over time you start noticing all the little flaws and that paired with the toxic community... I'll just say that the salt is abundant.If I could change one thing about the game I wish survivor builds were more diverse (can't really speak for killers since I don't really play them and their playstyle naturally differs from one another since they all have unique modes of movement or attack). If I had complete control of this game I would make it so that each survivor had one unique perk to them (probably whatever their most viable teachable is but never exhaustion perks because any changes to exhaustion would be a direct buff or nerf to that survivor) and then they could pick the rest of their 3 perks (this is assuming that the useless perks are now viable). Then it's probably less likely that everyone is running the same DS/exhaust perk/Borrowed Time/Self Care that you always see because each survivor would encourage a different type of play.

title: Dead by Daylight

review: Product received for free. I really like Dead by Daylight's concept. It's a fun unique multiplayer horror experience. However the game works against itself in a lot of ways which makes the experience unenjoyable. So here's some things that stuck out to me while playing Balancing IssuesI can tell that there was a lot put into trying to make it so each side has an equal chance of winning but at the moment I feel like the level 1 survivors/killers are way too underpowered and cant do anything while the higher level ones are over powered. I could understand this if there was a matchmaking system that paired people of similar levels together but there isn't. It's totally random from all that I played. Survivors all leveled up with items could be against a beginner level 1 killer that has no experience yet so that could use some work. Also killers can just camp the meat hooks they hang you on until you die instead of looking for others and giving people a chance to save you. It's funny for a bit while youre the killer but a real unfair experience for survivors. I should mention that I think the logic behind it is that while the killer is camping the meat hook he's giving the other survivors time to restart the generators (which is their main goal) but that takes ages while the time it takes to die on a meathook is probably a minute or less. Traps take too long to get out of and can stop you from helping people off of meat hooks with no way that I could find to disarm them. I'd like to think you could disarm them and maybe my game is just glitching but I couldn't find a way. Maybe that's because every time I saw a trap it was placed below a survivor hanging on a meat hook so my only option was to try to unhook them and step on the trap in the process... It'd be nice if I could take the time to disarm it and then attempt to save them. It'd take me more time and leave the player vulnerable but give them more of a chance.Quick time events are an interesting mechanic. A lot of the time they work fine and are very similar to Resident Evil 6's. However sometimes they don't give you enough time to react at all which can be a pain because they occur so frequently and make you lose progress on the activity you're performing I think it should be one set amount of time that all the quicktime events take not varying. Or at least not so fast that you just can't press the button in time. One last gameplay element that I did not like but I understand is how congested the killer's first person viewpoint is. The survivors play the game in a third person perspective so that they can see around corners while the killer is in a limited first person. But I felt that this first person was almost too limited as if they had zero peripheral vision. Probably locked at 60 or 75 FOV which just feels far too narrow for me to enjoy. It's probably just to make it so survivors can have a chance of not being seen but I wish it felt better to play.Matchmaking Perhaps my biggest problem with the game is that the "Survive with your friends" matchmaking system just flat out doesn't work right. You have to keep readying up and unreadying to restart the search and hope that another party with enough available slots searced at the exact same time as you otherwise you'll find nothing. This is very frustrating as in order to play with my friends I had to babysit the ready button instead of being able to sit back and let the game find a match by itself. We only got one game in an hour or two.Controller SupportIn game the controller support is fantastic and works like a charm. However the main menus pause menus end game screens etc cannot be navigated with a controller. This is a little annoying because I can't sit back on my bed and enjoy the game fully I have to keep getting up walking over to my computer and using the mouse before and after a game. It's not a huge deal but it's definitely a pain and full menu navigation with controllers would be a very welcome addition.OverallDead by Daylight is a creepy multiplayer horror experience that'll keep you quick on your feet and playing match after match if you're looking to play by yourself and you can look past the problems I mentioned above. Personally I wouldn't buy it until they patch in some balancing and fix the matchmaking issues.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Product received for free. So my piece as a free weekend player. The queue times are horrible maybe it's because of my level or maybe because I only played killer I got matched against really high level people who clearly knew every inch of every map and every single place. I've heard of those infamous loops in the game certain places in the game where the killer can't catch a survivor no matter how hard they try and I found that this made the games so very boring. Some minor problems like not having fullscreen windowed changing sensitivity etc. The biggest minus was after the game though the community is absolutely disgusting. I got alked about being freeweekend player doing bad even told to uninstall the game and kill myself by higher level players. Apparently it's too hard to find people in my own ranks or other free weekend players.Overall the idea of the game is nice but the points I've made turn it in to a big minus. I was so excited to be able to play this game and all I feel is disappointment. For the longest time I wanted to buy this game and now that I've actually played it I'm really happy I didn't waste my money.
title: Dead by Daylight

Lemme give you a hint for fun gameplay go into this game as a "survivor" fully expecting to get sacrificed. But make the MFer *work* for his/her sacrifice. If you're the killer try not to face camp. review: I wish I played less so i could get a refund. This game was fun for a short while after purchasing while still trying to figure out how to play for first 10 rounds or so. I dont even want to play this anymore. There is no reason to fear the killer at all. It is just survivors pallet jumping (or window jumping) in a circle taunting the killer round after round. Of the few time that you actually hook someone you get abused in the chat whiule they insta unhook thier teammate and run away. It is just one sided game afer one sided game after another. Additional OP perks for survivors continue to be added to the game and remove all hope of ever reinstalling. Really regret not getting a refund at this point. It was a cool premise and sounded like a fun game. Instead it is survivors trolling until the game is over.No reason to buy if you want any semblance of a balanced or fun game (unless you only want to play suvivor which was way to easy imho). If you want to play video game troll simulator this is it.

review: Fun game but it definitely needs some fixing it's been broken for ages now. Massive lag spikes in game for everyone Some games just time out and you'll go back to menu Joining games can be a pain because you'll randomly exit queue Sometimes you won't be able to join a queue at all happened to me last patch completely impossible to join a party Rubberbanding in game is ridiculous (So much you can fall through the map and glitch outside of the Gates for an instant win)It sucks as this game probably has a lot of potential to be a very fun game from just a very popular flavor of the month twitch game to something big but I don't know if it ever will with how long it's taking to fix their game.You can still have fun with this game it's not your pants scary but you still get that "Oh quot feeling when you're running away after ing up a skill check or running to the gate when the killer is chasing you but I'd honestly keep your money until a later date when the game is more optomized / fixed.

review: Now i love this game its one of my all time favorite games on earth theres nothing better then hunting down someone after hearing a bone crunch in a trap smashing my bell and scaring the jesus out of people or sniping annoying survivors with an axe. But this game does have its serious issues and i can tell you everyone feels this way the matchmaking in this game is horrible i was a level one huntress trying her out and a i got a premade of prestige 3 survivors with toolboxes they repaired all 5 gens in less then a minute leaving me to do nothing i couldnt kill them cause sprint burst and borrowed time easily let them escape its frustrating trying to level up with this matchmaking it should be off the survivor or killers LEVEL not the ranking im really good at this game so i usually can get from 2 4 people every game but sometimes its frustrating when i have to hunt them down with only 2 level one perks while they hae 4 level 3 perks that on my perks other than that survivors usually have an extremely unfair advantage of crzy broken items or stupid op perks that dont let me even get them on a hook (obsession im looking at you) while killers normally have a hard time trying to even catch someone because of looping sprint burst or god forbid the flashlight that blinds you in .001 swcs for 5 secs...other than that this game is great and i wont ever stop playing just wish the devs would look at the survivors and nerf some stuff and buff a few killer perks. Wraith main for life.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: TL DR this game should be more about hiding than running as instead of being scared of the killer finding them survivors are mildly inconvenienced when found.This was once upon a time one of my favourite games Back when there were three killers four survivors and the game was about hide and seek (minus the Wraith which was reviled for being able to sneak up on you. Oh the days.) Now the game is less about that aspect and more a third person combat game. If you see the killer you distract him stun him waste his time and even rescue your friends right from under his nose. You don't hide any more especially with the advent of the new killers. Like really? A killer with literally zero terror radius?In my opinion the game should be less about the rescue and more about the chase. Killer perks should be focused upon catching survivors rather than finding them while survivor perks should be focused upon hiding rather than running. When it turns into yet another merry go round the map's obstacles followed by body blocks from your friends once you're rescued to even have a chance at getting away the game loses its charm. All in all continually making killers harder and harder to avoid rather than trying to hide in a variety of ways forces the hide and seek concept to become a racing game ruining the entire horror aspect.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: The game isn't too bad. Sorta steep learning curve and some of the mechanics don't make a ton of sense to me. Not that I haven't had fun with it I just got bored and frustrated with it sorta quick. My main problem with the game that really prompted my negative review is the fact that there are updates every couple weeks and they take FOREVER. No other game takes this long. I'm in the middle of an update that is 18.7 MB. No big deal right? It says it's going to take 20 minutes because every time it Preallocates room actually downloads the update and then take 15 gerd dam minutes to "Update"!!!! for a few MBs!!!! It's maxing out my Disk usage right now at over 40MB/s. There is no reason for this. I can't justify it. I keep trying to give this game a chance but somehow updates have to consume my computer's utilities for 20 minutes for minor fixes. Imagine when they make big updates....
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Love the game I play a few matches every day. So many different builds and techniques you can use. The only thing I did not like (the whole reason I am writing this review) is that when you are in the dying state (crawling) you are unable to use a key to unlock a trapdoor (to escape and win). The trapdoor should be pretty easy to open realistically I would think. At least let the trapdoor become unlocked (maybe the door still closed but another player can lift it up if it is deemed too heavy to lift in a downed state) Because 1.) It is impressive to find and crawl to a trapdoor AND have a key equipped and 2.) kinda saying that a paraplegics can't open a damn door.

review: Great game but the community kills it. No moderation in any form in the game or surrounding networks. Toxic no matter what side you're on. If you're killer survivors will BM you and talk furiously post match best one I've been called in what I thought was a close game was "chinese jew". If you're survivor killer will...no it's just survivors who are salty.As well massive disparity in game experience between solo queue matches and SWF or Survive With Friends (team party play) which are pooled into the same matchmaking queue. In SWF matches the skill and loadout required by the killer is so much higher to pick apart a group of survivors coordinating themselves on voice basically good luck unless you're using top killer builds. Most of the time will turn into 4 rude kids bullying a poor helpless killer blinding him while rubbing themselves all over him and breaking all his basically makes no sense.tl dr Game is fantastic at it's core but needs work with balancing and community.

review: I originally wrote a very bitter review about this game because after 100 hours of playing all my progress was reset. After about a week I started playing again essentially giving up on them to restore my stuff. After another 50 hours or so I had much exceeded what I had originally (what can i say when I was knew I was trash didnt even understand how to get points) and though bitter still kept playing. Around 50 more hours (200hrs) or so I had 90% of all I could want and they awarded me 8million bloodpoints to compensate me for my lost stuff originally (probably twice what I had spent from what I can guess) so I just kinda level'd up killers (really more of a survivor person) and a survivor even though I had one with all the skills I wanted.Here I am at 270hrs now and idk its a pretty fun game. Annoying sometimes but generally its good. My one friend pretty much stopped playing but I like it still even though its a little repetitive. buy it you might lose your stuff but you'll prolly get it back eventually and its pretty fun along the way

review: Honestly the game in its current state is pretty good and about a year ago i would have given this game a negative review. So let me give some pros and cons of the game in its current state.ProsA wide range of killers and survivors this gives a ton of personalization in builds.Great early game experiance your first games will have you terrified skill checks will be hard because of shaky thumbsA great multiplayer or single player game as a 4vs1 game you have somthing to do while your friends are gone.The game recieves updates and content regularly content is typically paid DLC it is relativly cheap (&lt 10$)There are systems in place to allow you to play survivor and get all paid perks same for killer but less extensive.Does a good job of recreating modern and classic horror monsters.ConsNo innate voice coms. This is a huge problem because of how much of an edge players get for being in voice together. The game should have it by default plain and simple.Balance is 100% in favor of the survivors but that doesn't mean the killer doesn't have the ability to win. Often times everybody wins.The game forces you to play ranked and for some people that is relativly stressful especially because of how the daily system works forcing you to play people you dont have leveled up.Peer to Peer host servers you can see your ping but it can be a problem finding a good match especially if you're from somewhere like australia.The game does have a habbit of just being buggy with connections and loading which can be very frustrating as this game revolves around using 1 time consumables that just get eaten when the game doesnt load.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Game is so good that I bought it for me and 2 of my friends.You find yourself playing it for hours and hours.You can play as a survivor or as the killer.It's a 4v1 game where there are 4 survivors and 1 killer that's objective is to try to sacrifice all of the survivors.The survivors objective is escape. To do this you have to fix 5 generators and open one of the 2 gates (or both) OR if you are the last one and there are atleast 2 generators done you can find a hatch where you can escape.Some cons though Game save file wipe can happen randomly and it takes BHVR about 1 2 months to compensate you.Though you can prevent this by backuping your save regulary/using MLGA that shouldn't be the users responsibility. Don't know if this happens to others but sometimes when I launch the game it freezes my whole PC on the loading screen.

review: This game has the dumbest matchmaking system in the univers. It's season based and will match a novice with a long time player. only buy it if you know EXACTLY what you are doing and getting to if you already know every single perk item and build in the game. The matchmaking will match you with a killer who has played the game for 1500 hours just because they haven't played killers a lot since the last reset. That is just ing ridiculous. I have about 10 hours of gameplay at this point and it was just back breaking.Moreover because its killer hosted if the host has a connection 4 players will experience lag and people WILL lag spike you because they can and because the player reporting system does not seem to work at all.If you have 4 friends and can get your custom lobby it'll be a more leveled playing field it'll be nice but if you're going to be going on this journey on your own the volume of you'll encounter is not worth the trouble there's tens of thousands of games on steam go play something else.The game is not fun anymore after my past experiences these experiences were soo incredibly poor that it makes it not fun to play. 3 consecutive matches with either crazy lag or 1000+ hour players shouldn't be a "common" user experience. At this point this is not a game that is worth "learning to play".If you have it you're probably good at it but if you don't just don't bother at this point.
title: Dead by Daylight

title: Dead by Daylight

review: I had to rewrite this after experiencing both sides of the world. Dead by Daylight was fun and is FUN with friends. Without friends it's a bit of a contagious disease of saltiness. Because no side is truly balanced there is a lot of people who take advantage of what the DEVS allow in their game and PC people have more punishments than console. Lol. I own it on both a console and the PC. Body blocking is allowed by either side and so is camping tunneling slugging and a whole bunch of other messes that can just make the game play for a survivor (usually) or a killer most unpleasant. Survivors can pallet loop killers to no end and it's not fun but it's a style to survive as long as you can. So you have to deal with it basically because they don't have any other means they made flashlights only for people who can time it just right and who know how to do it with math equations going through their brain. Nothing is like unqiue anymore between killers or survivors all perks can be shared. Only people who havve unique abilities is killers whether it be blinking instadowns chainsawing etc. Except Freddy Poor Freddies only can tunnel in order to get things done because well...freddy is hated by DbD xD. I genereally feel bad for both sides now of the coin due to the game being...well it was so fun in the beginning. Now it's just cancer I can only stand like 2 3 games because most people that host as a killer have terrible ping for someone like me who lives on the East Coast in the middle of no where. So I can only reccomend this game if you want to play with 3 or more friends. Or if you just want to be the ultimate killer and stab everyone. I can't promote the solo play. Maybe I should play CIV 5 though. kek.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: I absolutely love this game... i'm not great at it mind you.. rather mediocre in fact. However the game play is absolutely great. The reason I can't recommend the game is because of the community. The community for this game is so toxic it's atrocious. Survivors endless loop and body block they taunt the killer relentlessly but if you as the killer does anything tunnelling camping and the like you're a worthless PoS who can't play the game and they hurl insults completely ignoring all the crappy behaviour they did during the game.The same goes the other way if you're a survivor the killer will do everything they want and try to call you out on the things you do.I have chosen to no longer engage in the community before or after the game it's truly a shame.

review: Fun for a laugh but the matchmaking ranking and frequent disconnects limit the replay and competitiveness factors.Matchmaking Appears to be mostly random. For example as a rank 18 level 12 killer with a tier 1 perk I was placed against rank 1 players with four tier 3 rare perks. Makes it feel super punishing as a new player.Ranking Anyone that accomplishes the bare minimum could attain and hold max rank with the major limitations being access to perks and addons and less emphasis on skill. These need to be unlocked by points and unfortunately it seems to be points efficient even if you don t accomplish the primary objective of the match (aka you can still get a lot of points if you lose ). Sometimes matches turn into points farming sessions instead of a survival thriller.Disconnects It felt like people were disconnecting from almost every game so I started recording them. On average over twenty games a player disconnects once per game. I don t know if it s an issue with the game connectivity/bug or if it s just bad manners but the game is clearly balanced around 4v1 and having players(s) DC makes the game less fun for everyone that s left.The ambience artwork and music are all great except for the occasional janky animation. The Huntress is wicked fun to play and sneaking around as a survivor is intense. A lot of work has gone into making the game feel eerie moody and creepy but it s too easy to have sessions reduced to mechanical points/rank farming or for everyone to give up because the first survivor hooked rage quits.I ll come back to the game for sure if they implement harsher disconnect penalties an actual ranking system ladder that lets me compare my skill to the rest of the player base (instead of just time played) and maybe some basic balance stuff that seems standard in other PvP games (like diminishing returns on abilities/mechanics like flashlight blinds and slug mode for both the survivors and killers).
title: Dead by Daylight

review: From my standpoint of this game. Now we all know there are no perfect games and there are games that seem to have some problems. Well Dead By Daylight is a game that has some problems with it's community and it's developer views. It seems as if when someone goes into the forums stating they have found something either OP or a bug that the developers must drop whatever they are doing at that current second to fix it. Well the developers do listen to the community a lot and I give them credit for trying to make everyone happy but the changes sometimes implemented are incredibly biased to one side sometimes. Now onto the game yes the game has a really great concept and gameplay is fun. However I don't agree with all of these new exclusives coming out into that game that are only available for people that went to a PAX or a twitchcon that's a down point from my point of view because not everyone has the ability to fly to a twitchcon or PAX just to get some exclusive codes for their favorite game. Overall the game is okay in its current state.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: I would like to say this game is awesome I would like to say this game will give you plenty of good times but I simply can't. The concept of the game is amazing but the developers sadly have no idea what they are doing. During the past year I've had high hopes for every patch only to be sorely dissapointed every single time it gets released. The developers behave like they graduated from their programming education 6 months ago and the insurmountable amount of bugs in the game show it clearly time and time again. Moreover the bugs are often literally game breaking and these bugs often take very long to get fixed.The balancing of the game is also terrible and balance changes are often made by introducing a new mechanic that in their theory should "cancel out" the other terribly balanced factors. As an example I will mention bloodlust. The pallets in this game are mechanically terribly designed making a chase that takes forever possible. But instead of taking care of how the pallets work and where they are placed they introduce another mechanic bloodlust Making a killer get movement speed over time which takes care of the issue of unending chases but doesn't deal with the actual problem of pallets.These kinds of "fixes" happen time and time again and only shows that the creators have no clear understanding of the basic functionality and essence of their own game. If you want another example I can mention hook camping and borrowed time another "fix" that works in this way temporarily solving the symptoms of the problem but doing nothing to the cause of it.In its current state you simply cannot play the game anymore if you run the game on a Windows 8 system and has been like this for a month. I doubt they will ever be able to fix this issue due to their incompetence and the fix the developers have given is "Update your OS to Windows 10". Amazing fix right? Go pay 200 something dollars and you can play our game!Another bug that happend about 10 months ago made it possible to have almost constant wallhacks on every killer (and also be practically invisible on some killers that shouldnt be) and it took 3 weeks for a completely gamebreaking bug like this to get fixed.Needless to say I'm dissapointed that a game concept like this has ended up in the hands of what seems like children with no actual knowledge of designing games.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Dead by Daylight &gt 4v1 where four survivors are being hunted down by one serial murderer.Honestly speaking when I saw this game on YouTube it looked darn pretty interesting and I said to my friends "Hey let's get this game it looks extremely fun!" So yeah we bought it and encountered much Pros 1. Fun as hell2. Get to torture your friends3. your pants4. Loads of unique perks and items to be used in the game5. Characters and even maps have quite interesting lores6. Game and DLCs are pretty much at reasonable price7. Soundtracks? Quite well produced.Cons 1. BUGS. LOADS. OF. BUGS.2. Lvling up bloodwebs.. &gt Grinding.3. Searching for match can take God knows how long.4. Some plays can be irritating like killers can be quite annoying by camping their victims &gt almost impossible to save5. Pubs disconnecting in and out.6. Games are all hosted by the killer and that is equivalent to not knowing whether the killer's internet is good or not.7. Bloodweb items are purchased by bloodpoints which are earned ingames. Guess what? Farming is bloody possible. (killer and survivors agree to farm points together)Only thing I can recommend here is that this game can be played for fun with friends. In terms of levelling or stuff I doubt the devs put some thoughts of what happens when the game is released. You might not fully enjoy the game though because the way this game works does not really suit everyone. Overall still pretty fun.

review: Player Bases Kids Everyone Casual players Gamers Hardcore Gamers Graphics Minecraft Really bad Bad OK Good 8 pixel Good Beautiful Masterpiece Price/quality Full price Wait for sale Average Refund it if you can Don't do it Free Requirements 90' PC Minimum Medium Fast High end NASA computer Difficulty You just need 2 arms Easy Easy to learn / Hard to master Hard Dark Souls Game time/length Really short ( 0 2 hours) Short ( 2 10 hours) Few hours ( 8 20 hours) Long ( 30+ hours) Endless (Depends on the player) Story A Mystery It doesn't have Still better than Twilight Okay Quite Good Fantastic Bugs 24/7 Bugs Bugs sometimes crashing the game sometimes Some bugs there and there Funny Bugs Few Bugs Few Funny Bugs Nothing10/10.I always loved Dead by Daylight but now I can play it D. Dead by Daylight is a 1vs4 game where one takes the role of the Killer and the others of the survivor. The Suvivors goal is to escape while not being caught by the Killer the killers goal is to stop them. Its really fun and unique each time you play since perks of the suvivors and the killer are each time different which will make you adept each time. Never gets boring. review: The concept and gameplay are good but the game actively discourages new players. This is a perfect example of a progression system done wrong. Starting out (as a killer or survivor) you have no tools to play the game really. In order to get what you need to have any chance of success (or to have any fun whatsoever) you have to play match after match where the outcome is predetermined (you lose). I'm sure the game gets fun after the immense grind but it just isn't worth it. It's supremely frustrating.

review: UPDATED 8/20/2016I can no longer recommend this game bugs and matchmaking aside the community is incredibly toxic.An overwhelming majority of the players you will encounter will not even attempt to play the game legitimately and will instead abuse every game mechanic they can in order to win. The rank system only perpetuates this toxicity and as you progress through it you will encounter more and more players who make it their goal to create a stalemate scenario that basically holds you hostage until they decide they have farmed enough points.I don't know how much longer I will be playing this game. I do love it and those rare games where people aren't being scum and very fun win or lose.Beyond that I would not buy this game right now I was lucky and got it on sale when it first released I am probably going to end up returning the second copy I bought for my wife.Update 10/19 with the upcoming DLC I thought I would update my review. Unfortunately the game has not improved this is more the fault of the community than the devs but they are not without blame. Infinites and stalemates still exist attempts to fix them have been half hearted at best playing as killer is like being in 4 abusive relationships at once and playing as survivor consists of extended wait times because noone wants to play killer.Will you get $20 worth of fun out of this game? Probably but the cost of chemo will far outweigh the value of this game.Community is still terrible at this point the fact that certain issues haven't been fixed is just an insult to the players. The developers seem lost they clearly hate the Nurse but they can't remove her from the game so they make her unfun to play and design maps that make her worthless.Update 8/16/2017Game is still and community is still aweful. Don't buy it the developers don't give a .
title: Dead by Daylight

review: 30 hours in and heres what I took away from this game. It's not done bugs are game breaking and nonstop. I just spend the past 2 hours to get into 3 games with a friend with multiple platform crashes inbetween. Once you're in a game more bugs will also break the game. Midheal with a skill check at the 10 'oclock position and you'll fail as soon as the meter starts and be unable to heal again. Significant studdering and latency issues between host and players. Honestly I regret this purchase and hope in the future the devs will fix all these gamebreaking issues. In its current condition it's unplayable with friends and solo play is "meh" at best.Update 2/28/2018I'm glad I kept going with this game as it has come an incredibly long way since I first wrote this review. The game stability issues are non existant aside from it being Peer to Peer which of course causes issue if the killer gets upset and leaves. The game is still not friendly to newcomers and is incredibly grindy to unlock abilities but deeply rewarding if you enjoy survival horror.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: I'll try to write a review for those trying to decide on if they should purchase this game or not.Firstly the cost. buying the game when it goes onsale is more of a deal for yourself the game is only 29.99. compared to some of the newer titles that's 50% on an average new title.I think cost might be important for some when they are concerned with the cost of the game to gauge value with per buck.Now let's talk about balance. There will be mixed thoughts on this so I'll only provide my own based on my own experience. I've played both Killer and Survivor. When going against a group of very skilled Survivors with equal skill of a killer I would have to say the Survivors have the upper hand.Take into account that this review was written in mind of patch 1.4.2. 1.5 would have supposedly even the playing field a bit with the new rage mechanic. Which allows the killers to gain speed while chasing down a survivor. There have been other changes to help out the killer as well.Now let's talk about the broken parts of the game. The major broken part is the networking infrastructure. There are no dedicated servers or a server farm hosted by Behavior. How it works is the Killer acts as a host and steam provides the service of match making. At the time of writing this review Behavior is working on their own back end to facilitate better handling with match making. Matchmaking for queuing up with survive with friends now is broken. It takes along time for SWF (Survive with friends) that is queuing up games with your friends and issues can be described in more detailed by the developers. But Single/solo queuing is no issue.the Matchmaking needs optimizing because the ranking system has not been fully tweaked against correctly portraying a person's skill in the game. Again the developers are working on these aspects in the game.After all of this I think it's quite clear if you are expecting immediate results from the team on improving the game you might become quite disappointed. But if you're patient enough I believe the game only gets better here on out.Last and foremost let's talk about the community. I believe owning the game will quickly reveal to you your triggers and patience level. I found that alot of players complain about certain aspects of the game and how players play to exploit the pure advantages either the killer or survivor has. People are easily triggered when they are the first found by the killer in the match or if they have been the first to be eliminated. People are upset easily with the camping with killers near hooks. Hooks are where the killers sacrifice players to eliminate them. Camping the hooks make it difficult for other survivors to rescue their friends. There's easily and most commonly will be some toxicity. People just get too angry at this game's certain aspects.The developers just hired a community manager therefore the devs will be more listening to the community and be able to communicate back.I hope this review gives you some insight on what you are getting yourself into when purchasing the game.Even with all of the flaws even ones that will be corrected in due time (just requires some patience) I believe the game is worth the 29.99.Sept 18th 2017.I'm updating my review because I left the game about when Friday the 13th was released. Didn't have a need to go back to play Dead by Daylight.They recently released 1.7 patch to change the game mechanics further to even the playing field. I thought I would give it a try and killer feels more powerful now. There are still times when I still feel being out runned by survivors. There are a ton of good survivors out there keep that mind when playing killer. You'll eventually end up against them and it's really difficult to take them out. I recently also purchased the DLC Spark of Madness because they buffed the killer Doctor too.I've recently started playing Dead by Daylight and have to say having great fun once again. What I enjoy most about this product is that the developers are always making tweaks and adding new content. If I can recall correctly just remember when purchasing this game don't expect competitive level of balancing and tweaking to the game this is what the Devs said. They primarily want to make a fun game and not focus too much on e sports quality direction.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Honestly I love this game I think it hs a lot of promise and I enjoy all the different varieties of ways that you can play and how no one game it the same as the next and after putting in so many hours its still as fun to play as when i first bought it. However the game has added a killer which is the most played by far for very good reason. The huntress. She is the most used killer due to the fact she is the only killer inn the game(aside from the clown) with ranged attacks. It requires no real skill to be good with her as a simle point and click is all it takes to incapacitate a survivor without any chase required. The fact is the game may pride itself on its well spaced maps but many parts of the maps are linear and for a killer who can throw projectiles in a straight line it makes capturing survivors far too easy. I think the premise of a killer like her is interesting but it just doesn't work she is far too easy to play and far too easy to win with. Until she is severely nerfed or removed i have to say don't play this game cuz 90% of your games will be against her and you will lose far more than you win even if you are a pro survivor.
