review: Gameplay is average. Probably significantly better with friends but I have none of those. Decent performance on my hardware (See profile) but do be expected as the graphics aren't the best. Cons There is no matchmaking. Your rank is irrelevant and is not taken into consideration properly. It's pretty much just if you are 10 or below you are matched with 10 or below. Considering this game has 20K+ players most of the time THIS ISN'T GOOD ENOUGH.Second thing. PEER TO PEER. STOP IT. Half of the matches have 200+ ping so you just lag around and eventually die because of it. Either this is the matchmaking to blame matching me with foreign players or most of the players hosting have internet. Please add a filter so i can filter out lobbies with 100+ ping. Third. Developers can't seem to make up their mind who has the advantage. So with every update they might give survivors or killers a significant buff or an insane perk or they might do the opposite and nerf one side into the ground. Fourth. The devs just spent their time making cosmetics to sell so they can not only bathe in money like they currently areBut now they'll have enough money to wallpaper their house with it too. ("BuT yOu DoN't HaVe To BuY iT" you say Clearly missed my point)tl dr The game really isn't that good. I'm not going to give it a negative rating because the problems lie mainly with the developers and the cancerous community not the game (Worse than League or CSGO this takes the cake for me) But unless it's on sale or you have 3 friends (I don't) then don't bother.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Okay first off Take every review with a grain of salt. A lot of people are angry because of reworks and the Developers are getting hate because people can't solve their own problems. People don't want nerfs that hurt them or buffs that help the enemy and get angry and frustrated that the developers are actually TRYING (Not always succeeding) to help balance the game and make it a fun experience for all.That being said the game is quite fun. Gameplay is a system of cat and mouse chasing where you must repair the generators and escape without being caught and killed. This vanilla experience is altered as you will gain perks and items to use against the survivors or killer which alter gameplay. Overall the game is quite interesting based on the unique take of the multiplayer horror genre. Make a game where you aren't getting scares from things jumping out but the everlasting dread that creeps into your heart when you are finishing a gen and slowly hear a heartbeat.... Walking towards you.... It knows where you are... and it will get you... or they will walk past you kick the gen and keep going as your friends across the map just blew up a generator three times in a row like idiots. The game is not traditional horror as you aren't scared by the killer you aren't scared by getting caught. The scare comes from progression towards the exit and somebody alerting the killer and leading the killer to you.Killers have a harder time then you would think however. In a one versus one match Killer just needs to find the survivor and hook them once. However with four survivors all of them being able to do generators means that the killer has to be cunning and use their ability to mess with the survivors keep them off generators and keep them away from the exits. These are more often the masochistic players as they are basically gluttons for punishment from the community. The DLCs are great and hold amazing perks behind them. With some you get amazing perks such as BBQ and Chili from Leatherface which increases Bloodpoint payout the currency of the game then you have some like Myers whom are higher levels of play killers that have abilities that are amazing. The only exception is the Nightmare on Elm Street DLC and the Cosmetic DLCs. When Freddy was introduced he was viewed as OP so he got nerfed to Hell but is currently facing a possible rework. Then the Cosmetics don't do anything. If you do want to spend money on this game for cosmetics go with Charity Case it is for charity so good cause am I right?Now you are going to hear the community is toxic. Yeah that is basically it as a lot of players will be total jerks and will leave you behind or will have bad manners and teabag. However that is only around 20 40% of players and honestly everyone else is pretty open and cool. 20 15 is the learning period for new players now and is where you will make most of your friends or meet the cool and friendly survivors even if some of them are quite angry (I apologize in advance if you see me in game I usually get angry because I just get tunneled so hard around half the time and the other half people teabag)This game is a great game overall and is just limited by the Development team and how the player base is overall shattered and confused. If you are looking to buy this game wait until there is a sale pick it up for around ten dollars and see about getting your friends to join you. If you really love the game and enjoy it buy DLC packs and help teach the next generation of players. If you hate it just refund it and write a review detailing what was bad and what was good that will help give out a pro/con for the game. I praised it but I didn't give it much flak. This is because I think that the game gets too much crap from people who are angry at the developers or people who play the game and don't like specific things. My recommendation Watch some videos of gameplay for both Killer and Survivor. If you like what you see try it out. If you don't like it refund it then write a review with pros and cons. If you do write a review to help people understand all of the issues or be willing to teach people how to play the game.

review: I enjoy this game. I really do. But it has some issues so here's what I think Pros +Great gameplay on both sides. The game feels balanced and it takes an extreme amount of attention to detail to play either side.+Leveling system that works well+"Randomly" generated maps+Loads of content Cons Lots of issues 3 of 6 matches I played failed to load me in and several times the game would "break" when trying to enter Quick Play Adding PAID DLC for a game that is super buggy and not even in full release? Seems kinda greedy if you ask me Very repetitive People online are awful they are either way better than you or way worse (ex. I played a game where I was playing with 2 level 20 survivors and the killer sat staring at a wall picking up and putting down traps) Games feel short Spend more time loading than playing Confusing lobby screenOverall I can't recommend this game to the serious gamer who wants to make the most out of their money. With the game still in development it is of course expected to have bugs this would not be an issue if the devs weren't releasing DLC that requires payment. The concept is original and exciting but it gets very repetitive very quickly. I hear playing with friends has some issues and it isn't really fun by yourself. UPDATE AS OF 3/23/2018Okay so I played this game with friends and alone. Overall they seem to be pretty on top of bug fixes and the games is surprisingly fun. I would recommend but I don't care to rewrite a whole pros/cons list.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: I used to recommend this game now I do not.this game used to be very fun as a killer and as a survivor. Now the Devs have nerfed the killers and their perks to the ground and buffing the survivors and their perks to the extreme. There is no fun in playing as a killer now and playing as a survivor with their overpowered perks make it escaping with flying colours. As a survivor all you need to do is earn points by doing most actions in the game objectives helping teammates getting chased and earning points is pretty easy. Ranking up as survivor is a walk in a park and have a variety of escape perks that waste the killer's time easy.As a killer it is not rewarding to play anymore. The ranking system is changed instead of blood points it is how many times you hooked and kill people. So if survivors just keep on pallet looping like they all do on these survivor sided maps you do earn blood points but do not proceed to ranking up at all until you hook them. Killer perks have been nerfed to the ground as well and it makes it even harder to kill. Brutal Strength that was always used because it was so good against pallet looping has been nerfed and will never be where it was. Killers have animations that create time gaps for survivors to get away which was fine before but now that they got stuff like sprint burst dead hard decisive strike it creates way bigger time gaps and loses the survivor easy. Especially in Survive with Friends. When survivors are in groups have and communication it makes the game 3 times as hard to play. You have to make no mistakes at all in order to rank up or break even on pipping.I do not recommend this game at all in it's current state. It is way too unbalanced for an asymmetrical horror game. It is suppose to be killer be super strong and survivor should be scared but now it is killer the one getting bullied and survivors are the ones controlling the game and the horror game has turned into a competitive ranking game.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: I definitely got my $20 worth in playing this game. Though I am not a hardcore active player I do enjoy playing occasionally.I like the thrill of the chase to where your heart is thumping trying to get away from the killer. I enjoy the stealth play to keep from being found and the bravery/stragedy needed to save your teammates. I don't always escape sometimes I may run into some unfair situations but that just keeps me moving forward to another match and do better. You can't always win.My dislikes are mostly how others' may play the game (toxicity) but that's just how it goes in games like these. It's not always going to be fair fun and your way. I am out here to have fun and some just don't see it that way. To each their own. Yes there are some bugs glitches etc. But these Devs and their staff try their best to approach problems and find a solution. It might not be what other players agree with or like but they do what they can. They have been generous enough to give free items cosmetics maps survivors killers etc. in the game to keep us motivated.With a little over 500 hours in the game I will say that Dead by Daylight is my favorite go to game of all. I am glad this game was made and I look forward of the things to come in the future. I totally recommend it for anyone who loves the thrill of the chase hiding seeking and sacrificing. See you in the Fog!
title: Dead by Daylight

review: This is one of those games that you play/watch for the first time and think "This is a great concept! This is so fun!"And it is a fun game surely but not without a lot of annoying bugs and toxic players.As survivor you will notice quickly that the game is heavily in the killer's control because a lot of players don't work together. This is because there are 2 emotes to signal to your teamates and that is it. /As survivor you will run into more annoying gameplay mechanics such as "Hook Campers" (This includes the lowest ranks and the highest ranks.) These campers are the biggest downer sometimes. The killer will hook and survivor and just decide that your death is more important than anything else. This deprives you the killer and all other players from getting a good amount of points. People on the game's forums tend to pick a camp this includes the "killer" or "Survivor" camps. This utterly blows my mind because there is no reason for this. I think we can all agree pallet looping is just as bad as face camping. There are other methods to fighting this cheap tactics. Such as just letting the guy camp and do generators. This works sometimes but people just tend to be altruistic. I like saving my allies. Most killers will discourage this. There are also a million bugs that will drive you up a wall.Now that my rant on the bad is done here is why I reccomend the game. Firstly this is a truely unique game. I love how simple the concept is. It's easy to play hard to master. Makes for a fun late night game. You'll grow numb to the scares very quickly. The perks are actually well thought through and make it fun play around and change up your playstyle. Killer's being in first person make it fun by playing on his tunnel vision. However the killer might hear you and then he just needs to follow your tracks. Survivors have a lot to worry about but there is nothing more satisfying than finding skilled teamates who think alike and work together to get everyone out alive. I said some bad stuff in this review but I do love this game. I have about 200 hours on it and I've only owned the game for a few months. Very Addicting!
title: Dead by Daylight

title: Dead by Daylight

review: I have never seen a game that FORCES you to work as a team... until i played this. The way everyone works as a team (most of the time as far as i have seen) is amazing! To escape and live you have to work as a team by instinct and knowledge of the game there is no text chat in game or voice chat only impulse and again knowledge. Survivor is fun to play as because you have to constantly be on edge of the killer and focusing on the objective/teammates.Killer is the most fun in my opinion because you get really have to get the FEEL of the killer to properly win.Knowing the map what youre playing against your objective etc all amazing features of the game.The bloodweb(or skilltree type thing) is completely random this prevents people constantly getting the best perks and pushes them to adjust to the new perks and opening up new playstyles.TLDR 10/10 VERY VERY FUN i do reccommend buying this game

review: This game has so much potential to be an incredible game. Having played this alone and with friends on this and a previous account I probably have 50 hours. Not a great amount to say I'm a know it all but I understand the basics of a good game. Dead by Daylight is a game where its a 4v1 Killer vs Survivors. Now. Onto the actual review.The game has Is Pros and Cons.Pros Unique game Fun to play with friends Easy but enjoyable to play Choice of characters and Perks to play the game how you want (Stealth Speed Saviour)Cons Killers are op and normally end up targeting a player (Part of the game but ****ing fustrating) Player base on killer side is normally of a "as long I kill someone I'm happy" this leads to camping.. and it sucks! To many killers with overlapping features (Invisibility and one hit weapons...) The amount of hooks in each map is too many. There has been one time in 50 hours of gameplay I have wiggled off the shoulder. Even with offerings to lower the amount of spawned hooks it is still way too many.The list for both can go on but overall the game has something for everyone. I do wish that the Killers were less over powered when it comes to abilitys because playing this game and being the first to die multiple games in a row it is the most fustrating thing!Either way It is definetly a game to get if you enjoy tense moments and a good laugh with your mates or to blow off some steam and kill a few people. Happy Hunting

review: I've had Dead by Daylight since it's launch day and it gave me a few bad first impressions but over the past few months I've really come to liking this game. It had a somewhat rough launch and playing public matches with friends in the first few weeks just plain didn't work. But through a few updates and patches it's come around and became a really decent survival horror game. PROS +Exciting/Thrilling overall+Nice graphics and audio if you look closely at some textures it has a somewhat cartoonish style but still creepy.+Fun and interesting gameplay mechanics+Terrifying killers+Good maps each with there own unique style that link up with the lore of the killers+Nice backstory and lore to the killers and overall game+Character customization for both killers and survivors+Challenging level system with many perks and items to use in game+Very fun with friends (especially now that public matchmaking works)+Bad*ss killer theme song CONS Killers host not servers meaning you can be matched with ANYONE around the globe (terrible lag sometimes) Somewhat frequent loading bugs (freezes while loading) EDIT Fixed for the most part now somewhat rare to encounter frozen loading screens or being sent to the lobby for no reason. Skill checks which are basically QTE's (quick time events) Some moments when the killer hits/grabs you from ridiculous spots which make you go "wait what the f*ck?" Can get a little boring after a few matches but depends on how you feel reallyDespite there being quite a few glitches and bugs the game itself is really entertaining and nerve wracking when you're a survivor which is good if you're into thrills. I would recommend this for people looking for a thrill or something fun to play with their friends.

review: Ill say a few things about this game. That alot of people have already said.Pros Solid (Yet slightly repetitive) gameplay tense moments when you have no clue when the killers gonna pop out Interesting semi depth to killer gameplay Mind Gaming your prey to get them on hooks smart trap placement sneaking around as wraith chainsawing strange angles as hillbilly etc.Cons Repetitive gameplay Pretty bad community (There's still a few really nice killers/polite survivors out there atleast I dont ever see them Majority of people i run into are rude/gloat) Questionable perk balance (Decisive strike NOED STB4L+Unrelenting etc.)It's worth picking up if you have a few friends to play with or like playing psychopathic killers TL DR Don't have the highest hopes but it's worth a go.

review: Let me start out by saying that I do enjoy this game extensivly and I do find it to be a fun online team based horror game where you and three others take on a random killer and repair generators and not get sacrificed or where you take on the role of the killer and hunt down to sacrifice four survivors to please the Entity. Whilst this game is very fun to play especially if you play with your friends the community on the other hand is very divided. On one side you have the decent players who can take losing well and be good sports. On the other hand you have people who disconnect from matches and harass other players.However this applies to most games and shouldn't really be a factor in deciding if you should try the game for yourself. It can be a ton of fun at times and is stressful in a way that doesn't feel overbearing for the majority of any match. Sure you're gonna encounter toxic players every now and then but most of them aren't like this and the devs are actively trying to mitigate this toxicity by introducing changes to promote a more pro active system.Some killers have recently recieved buffs that have greatly inproved their viabilltiy as killers in general and most of these changes are ones I welcome openly even though I don't main killers that often feeling like the killer is an actual threat is far better than running from a killer who isn't good at their own job.The game still has a long way to go before I would consider it to be even close to 'perfect' but trust me when I say that this game is slowly becoming the experience most players want it to be and I am glad the devs are listening and are doing what they can to fix it as time goes on. It may not be perfect but I think the devs deserve a pat on the back for doing a pretty good job... so far.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: A good game for those who are fans of the horror genre. For those of you who want to experience the thrill and exhilaration of being the hunted or the hunter DBD has a satisfying gameplay loop that will satify both equally well. Its core elements can arguably be divided into two different games and learning both sides (survivor/killer) is a fun and engaging experience in of itself.

review: Dead by Daylight is an incredible game. The graphics are higher end for todays market and the gameplay is supurbly balanced. I come back to this game again and again because of the unique horror experience only Dead by Daylight has been able to offer. I feel truelly horrified playing as a survivor. The progression system and the cooperation between survivors are the highlights of my gameplay. Acquiring and upgrading abilities helps give some edge agaisnt the killer. Playing the killer on the other hand is an incredible power trip and has plenty of its own upsides including its own rewarding progression system. For horror fans or for those who long for progression and achievement in their terrible life.

review: Clunky but fun. the character models have giant collision boxes. often two survivors can't fit between a tree at the same time as they are running away even though visibly you could fit 3+ survivors in the area.It's more than what i'd expect for a 20 dollar game as far as gameplay goes but there are still some bugs to iron out. The ranking system is pretty meaningless when 1 person disconnects and another dies instantly as the game starts for some unknown reason.Overall I feel it is pretty well balanced between bad guy and 4 good guys. It won't seem that way when you first start but it quickly becomes a mental game of tag when you're chasing someone or being chased. Predicting people's movements will win you a round as you take someone to juke city.Check to make sure group queue has been implemented if that is important to you. For now you can only solo queue as survivor.Edit 9/29/2016 The bugs that really broke the game are all gone. There are still a few issues with things like getting promts to come up for disarm vs unhook. But overall the game has improved drastically. The survive with friends mode is functional finally after the last update. Queue times are longer but at least the matches are closer in skill between survivors and killer.Edit 10/29/2016 Matchmaking and DLC The Halloween DLC broke matchmaking completely. Everyone wants to play Michael Myers so the queues for killer are very long. 20+ minutes at peak times. Since the queues for killer are so long the matchmaker is just slapping together anyone to fill the survivor lobbies. Every game I see brand new players being matched up against killers with hundreds of hours more experience. The score screen is toxic with veterans raging at new players. I can't recommend this game to anyone in it's current state. The Halloween patch made this game mostly unplayable for me... during Halloween sadly...Bugs and Exploits They are exceptionally slow to patch out bugs and exploits. The Hillbilly had a bug with one of his addons that allowed him to keep someone permanently in dying state. Games took only a few minutes until he had everyone dying on the ground with no way to revive... I ran into several people abusing this and ruining games. It took the devs more than a month to fix it.The Trapper can place traps directly under a hooked survivor. They are almost impossible to disarm and after the most recent update you can no longer unhook the person on the hook until you are lucky enough to get the "Disarm" prompt to come up instead of the "Unhook" prompt. You are forced to walk back and forth in circles around the person on the hook until the correct prompt displays... This seems more like a UI issue to me but it's been a problem since beta... which tells me they have no plans to change it.Potential for Pay to Win The base game is $20 which seemed more than reasonable at the time. The first DLC was also free. It seems that every "chapter" after that first one will be $7 though. They plan to release several chapters a year. We're currently at $30 altogether. The DLC are optional but if you want to play any of the new killers or survivors and their associated perks you will need to buy it. The Halloween Chapter introduced new killer and survivor perks that are much stronger than most of the ones that came with the base game. Some people might call that pay to win...The Nurse Chapter was also quite necessary at release though it was free. She was broken overpowered for a few weeks. If you are reading this and disagree that the nurse was overpowered just keep in mind that the Developers said she was OP on their Twitch stream...Edit 11/3/2016 Added TLDR. This will be my last update. I don't see myself playing this for much longerTLDR The core cat and mouse gameplay is fun. I originally recommended this game because of that. I still play it after 400+ hours but that is only because I still have friends in the game. After dozens of patches and a few DLCs I am changing my vote to not recommended.The slow response to bugs and exploits was understandable early on. Some of them are/were quite gamebreaking though and easy to abuse.The game's matchmaker will break every time there is a new killer released. Brand new players will be matched against killers that have a thousand hours or more. It WILL BE UNPLAYABLE for a couple weeks every time this happens unless you have a 4 stack of survive with friends.I'm seeing a pattern of pay to win with the killers. Both the Shape and Nurse are/were way more effective than the original 3.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: The game is fun however balancing is a big issue. Most games seem to be survivor sided as the killer can only get good to a point based on their ability going up against 4 survivors.Quick points Pros Characters (Survivors) All survivors bring helpful perks to the table allowing for diverse amounts of strategies.Characters (Killers) All killers play different from each other due to their powers.Maps All maps give survivors a number of ways to hide from the killer and traverse the map.Character Progression The bloodweb system is quite cool as you don't know what perks and upgrades you will get when you go for your next level up.Cons Pallets These are extremely helpful for survivors to escape the killer as the killers are generally faster than them and will eventually catch them. However the amount of pallets there are on the map are absurd at times and between them and windows survivors can perform the strategy of pallet looping meaning the killer can go through a whole match without getting a single hit.Survivors The survivors while they do bring perks these perks can be learned by all other survivors meaning that by the end of the game if you max out all your survivors there is no variation between them apart from looks. Killers at least have unique powers.Ranking system The ranking system does not seem to work in the slightest...it is supposed to mean that a rank 15 killer goes up against survivors around their rank. I just had a match where I went up against a rank 16 rank 7 and two rank 1 survivors...doesn't seem fair.Killers apparently aren't allowed to do their jobs? A complaint i've seen go around is that people are annoyed when killers camp dying survivors. From the survivors perspective yes this sucks as you basically have no way of getting healed from other survivors. From a killers perspective this is a double edged sword. While yes it may secure a kill you are not going around trying to stop other survivors from completing their objectives. There are more reasons survivors get angry but I won't get into them.The game itself is a lot of fun for both survivors and killers as long as you are willing to take the time to practice and understand the roles and playstyles. Don't just go into this game expecting to win (if you do then good on you) but go in to hae fun if you aren't having fun look at what you did and what you could do better for the next time.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: This is an exciting game filled with not only fun frustration and stress but also elevated heart rates defeat and a grim sense of satisfaction. This game is not as scary a horror game as it portrays itself much of the tension and excitement is there but fear and/or fright is usually replaced by annoyance tiredness or positive pleasant feelings such as a sense of safety while in certain terrain. I heartily give this game a thumbs up for the enjoyment it can give but I give warning to those who expect a sense of power and/or fairness on a consistent basis. This game is not for everyone but it is exciting for many. The community is extremely turbulent and conflicting die to the current state of the game. The developers are often in dissonance with the community. I can sincerely say that at one point or another I've had fun in Dead by Daylight.P.S. It's completely not what they advertise.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Frustrating game with a large skill cap in terms of learning the maps RNG spawns builds. Really big sink hole for time to get the required perks as each character needs to be roughly leveled to 40 to unlock the character specific perks. You have multiple in game currencies which all can be used for buying in store items skins to even perks to save you farming them. Events provide freebies so not everything cosmetic wise is locked under lock and key DLC characters might as well be a must have if you truly want to be able to play with a competitive edge as usually the new perks keep a decent enough impact on the game making the DLC worth getting.The biggest crutch which is ruining this game is the fact that the servers which are used currently still are peer to peer which means that one of the players in the lobby are hosting (the killer) which means that the ranked match making means nothing for a good part of it whether its genuine lag or not people with the lag have the full advantage and if you leave due to them cheating by using a lag switch or w/e else you're the one who is penalised for it at the end this is the furthest i've ever gotten in the rank system was rank 11. 3/5 pips and its practically unplayable for the most part as most of the "Killers" have obsern lag and the only thing their doing is killing my connection to the lobby. And before anyone says its me. Its not this problem doesn't occur anything else I play on.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Its kinda weird if you combine genres like horror and online together all that comes to mind would be the classic Killing floor series or the Left 4 dead series. But this game is here to say that a genre like that is deffenetly possible. Dead by Daylight is one of my favourite horror games out there for sure. The game doesnt have the best looking engine for sure really looks bland and not pushed to its full potential but everything else in the game can push this fact to the side. Yes its really scary yes its kinda hard to master at the start and yes its absolutely fun ! There is a big variety of killers with their own ability and play style and on the other hand there is a big selection of survivors that have their own special 'perks'. The in game goal is to activate 4 generators (+3) that open the door where you escape from simple right ? not really the killer is constantly breathing behind your necks and haunting you using his abilities and traps.... (i have to mention that like every game if you dont play tactically then its preety unbalanced).... but if the survivors play smart and 'out smart' the killer with their perks and different items located on the map then its a win ! ( its good to mention that for begginers even if you kill one survivor its a good win for you because you get rewarded preety nice). The character design and the map design in this game is preety nice but as i said ... not the best engine out there. Another thing about this game that i really like is that every single character and killer has its own backround story.... there are even allot of horror movie characters for example Freddy Kruger Micheal Myers Leatherface and The pig from the Saw series. I can deffenetly recommend you to try this game a bit ! its even worth for the current price or even the discount price.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: This game is immensely fun. That feeling of your heart thumping in your chest as you hide defenselessly as a serial killer stalks you is thrilling and hard to replicate in other games. I've always been a fan of multiplayer games like Left 4 Dead where players work as a team to complete objectives or compete head to head with other players. The mechanics at this point are fairly simple which makes the game balanced and skill based. I hope they don't add too much content in the future that makes the game unbalanced. Very fun to play with friends.

review: Product received for free. This is my 2nd review of Dead by Daylight.Originally my review was very negative on all of the bugs in this game were basically plaguing it. However in the past couple of months the Devs have killed it in fixing bugs in this game. It seems like they actually care about how the game is to the public so they stepped it up and are ironing out as many bugs as they can and that makes me happy. Don't get me wrong the game is still buggy but it is miles better than it was before Summer began. I play both survivor and killer about 60/40 for survivor to killer. They both feel so much better and they gave a ton back to the community for the anniversery event of the game. All in all I definitely recommend the game now and I would 100% suggest giving it a try. A new free killer is coming out soon as of writing this and more is sure to come so you don't wanna miss the fun...bwahaha.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Hallowed Blight event broke the killer queues even more. Dev doesn't listen to the actual community instead they listen to the minority who cries about things being OP when they don't want to learn mechanics. Forums are cancer. Mods are biased. You can get warned for calling someone stupid but have full on flamewar and just have your post closed without even a slap on the wrist. As a survivor unless you SWF you will have a hard time. Unless you SWF or get a baby killer you will almost always have a toxic game as 2 and 3man SWFs will sandbag and BM you if you play solo. Camping Looping Slugging and Tunneling are dev approved "strats" yet are extremely toxic and the dev knows it. Extremely long Queue times as killer despite rank. Be prepared to wait 10 60minutes depending on your location just to get trashed by a 4man SWF on comms. One of the Top 5 most toxic gaming communitiesThis is a great game with a bad community and a deaf developer. I'm still wishing and waiting for QoL improvements but they keep falling drastically short.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: From what I can tell so far this game rocks! If you have 4 other friends who are playing with you. If you don't you're pretty much doomed to wait in the lobby until 4 other people want to play and a killer hosts a game. I've been dropped from a few games as well. I think there should be some kind of offline version for people who are new to the game since every matchup I've been in so far is with and against seasoned players with seious perks. That all said I do like this game and the ability to go between keyboard and controller when playing. If/When they fix the bugs and add an offline version I'll totally reccomend this game to others.Right now? I'm trying to find 4 people to play with so I can actually enjoy the game.UPDATE Now with the ragion lock I'm doomed to only play as survivor. There are almost no players in my region that play as survivor and lots of people playing killer. Makes those events that call for you to play both near impossible to complete without outright paying and that sucks for people like me who live paycheck to paycheck. I'm willing to spend for the dlc when I have it but to have to buy outfits others can outright play to get just sucks. I shouldn't have to wait 1 2 hours to get a full lobby when others can get them in a few minutes just to play for 5 minutes and do the wait all over again.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: It is a fun game when you actually get to play it. I love everything about this game EXCEPT all the bugs. Seriously I'm not one to complain but I have purchased the Deluxe pack and all dlc content with the exception of the killers outfit pack. My only complaint is the game is sometimes impossible to join...by sometimes I mean 85% of the time I try to play the game I get the 'Infinite Loading' loop and I have to force close the game and reopen to find that if I want to try and join a game I have to go through Survive With Friends and join Solo. Even that method does not always work. I have followed suggestions on reloading my game cache and I have adjusted my steam connection settings to no avail. The reason why I still recommend this game is because I believe the devs will eventually fix this issue and the game will be fun to play again. My best advice I could give is hold off on buying it and keep checking the updates and discussions and once they finally address this issue go balls deep.*UPDATE 12/31/16*I cannot recommend this game until the devs fix these f***ing server issues. Seriously guys get it together.*UPDATE 2/21/17*The server issues have been resolved for the majority. It has at least become a fun game to play again.*UPDATE 10/5/2018*Just buy the game and play it....

review: I was between the choices of whether or not I should recommend this game but unfortunately I decided not to recommend it I will tell you why with my mere 35hrs of experience.Firstly this game has too many DLCs as of 2018 I remember last year there wasn't that many DLCs but that's not the point I have had this game for 1 year or so and everytime the developers release a DLC there will be a new survivor and a killer and most of the time you have to learn and adapt to the new killer's or survivor's abilities also there's an increasing number of the cosmetic DLCs as well I started feel that DBD is gonna become the next Payday 2.Secondly during my time playing I had a lot of laugher and satisfaction as well as anger and frustration but the latter outweights the former it's primarily owing to the slightly unbalanced ability of the killer a very obvious example is the Huntress' hatchet throwing ability which is a ranged attack method that has almost unlimited flying distance unless got stopped by trees or walls none of the killers has that kind of ability except for the Huntress .Thirdly I don't really like the lobby mechanism that DBD uses because I always got assigned to servers that have over 200 ping to me I hope the developers can add a server browser so that players can choose servers that have the least ping to them simply saying give us more freedom to choose our server of choice.So in conclusion I won't recommend DBD unless the problems mentioned above are stopped or solved this is my review of DBD after 1 year of gameplay.

review: A game which despite being a "horror" game is very fun and enjoyable.(It can be D)Although it IS a good game and the developers are trying hard to push bugfixes and all the're are obviously down sides.So some pro and contra PRO A good team based game even better with a friend or 3 Developers actually care about their game (even if you don't feel so) It gives a huge boost of self esteem after some jukes and pallet loopes (what? pallet loopes?) Playing for the first time is not hard but even so there IS a "training" for players who aren't familiar with the gameCONS Lack of game modes this will hit you only if you play the game more than a 1.000 hours or so or you're rank 1 for a great time. Maining killer can be depressive after lvl 10 There is NO official server (this is a bad thing because the servers are hosted from the "killer" Pc allowing them many options to "cheat" like lag switch and so on ) Espect to find toxic and egoist players Grinding feels exhausting without boosters Lastly the bugs and hitboxes.... You remember when i said the "killer" s Pc hosts the game right? Yea so the're is this thing called latency... You will be really gating that thing and if not for that the survivor hitboxes are (hugely) off.Overall I recommend this game although it has its bumps and all.But if you can play this gem with a party it WILL be a good time (DC DC DC DC DC DC O..O)
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Update At least it's not Deathgarden. This is way better. I have come around and DbD is good again. It's fantastic with friends and has more than 10 people playing. Thanks for coming to my TedxTalk You know how games typically get better from release from each update? Well Dead by Daylight (DbD) likes to defy convention. With each passing update with their lengthy download times new bugs are inserted! Have you ever wanted a generator to sound like wood snapping when it's kicked? You got it here in DbD! You want intense music to play for you when your killer is chasing someone 5km away? Come to DbD. You want developers that respond more to positive comments than the negative criticism? BUY. THIS. NOW. While sitting in a lobby do you want the constant POP POP POP of fireworks in your ears. Well you don't get that because the Chinese New Year event has passed. You also missed out on a cosmetic that makes one of the killers look like she has a receding chin. Do you want to be a part of a community so toxic that it makes CS GO look civil. WELL. You've come to the right place.I used to be deeply involved with this game. It didn't start too long ago and I told myself not to get hooked that I would only get hurt in the end. BUT DbD was good to me and I saw the red flags more as quirks at first. "I'm sure it will change for the better." I told myself. Alas they kept heading on a busride to Rock Bottom. Did I mention the bus was on flames? Well it is. I decided to hop off the bus before it reaches that destination (if it does). It's not my responsibility for DbD's redemption. On its way down I'm sure it saw Friday the 13th (the game) coming back up. DbD could learn from Friday the 13th if it wants to be the game it was once before. It could learn from its mistakes. Unfortunately I'm beginning to lose hope as DbD tries to don something shiny and new instead of working on what it has so far. Maybe one day DbD will work towards being better. Maybe its code will be untangled and be able to flow with a new creativity. However I cannot support it while it still on that bus to Rock Bottom. At this point I wouldn't suggest this game to a friend. Would you set your friend up with that guy who you KNOW is addicted to drugs but swears he's sober and getting better? Yeah I wouldn't either. When DbD can prove that it's striving to improve I'd be willing to give it another chance. Until then I think if it's best if we play different games (Like Civ V). &lt /3
title: Dead by Daylight

review: This game is amazing. For a game like this the devs really had to walk a fine line between balancing and rewarding teamwork and not punishing players who choose to not help their teammates. You are left not knowing if the strangers you got teamed with will help you survive or leave you to die. It's half of what the game's about and gives it a good amount of depth in an otherwise basic game. UPDATE Matchmaking issues seem to be mosty resolved now (11/23/17). DLC doesn't create a wall. You can play with anyone. It doesn't matter if you have the DLC or they have the DLC. It really only has an impact on the characters YOU can choose from.Overall Dead by Daylight it worth the money. I would defiently reccomend checking the system requirements and ensuring that your PC can handle the graphics. This is an issue that I ran into when the game first launched.
title: Dead by Daylight

title: Dead by Daylight

review: Dead by Daylight is a game I've put a LOT of time into since its release and always end up coming back to despite its rough edges. The asymmetrical multiplayer/horror genre of game is pretty niche and while there have been a few other attempts at it none have really taken off like this game has. I was pretty excited when it first released and despite it's horrendously buggy and unbalanced debut it was a blast. I mean at that point nobody really knew what they were doing anyway.The gist of the game is 4 survivor players try to repair generators scattered around the map to open the exit gate while a killer player hunts them down in an attempt to ritually sacrifice them. There are a wide variety of killers with different playstyles to choose from and while the differences between survivors are largely cosmetic there are a wide variety of perks and abilities you can unlock to change up your playstyle a bit as well as good map variety.However while the game has come a long way it can still seem a bit unpolished at times. It can still be a bit buggy especially with graphical glitches but it's rarely anything that ruins the game. The balance is also hit or miss but honestly it's probably better now than at any point in the past. It's not really a competitive game at heart anyway despite the ranking system. But on the flip side that means that play at higher ranks between veteran players is where a lot of the balance issues become glaringly obvious. But that's a whole other discussion in and of itself.To be honest the biggest turnoff would probably be the community but that could be said for a lot of online games. But due to the nature of the game with it's opposing roles both "killer" and "survivor" mains constantly antagonize each other. I play and enjoy both sides personally so my advice would just be to ignore whatever negativity your opponents try to berate you with and play the game how you want. It also helps that you can choose to just hide the post game chat completely and all the salt that comes with it. This game can be a bit hard for new players to get into especially once they start playing against players with a bit more experience as there's a lot of meta tactics that you might not be aware of that can make the game seem quite frustrating if you don't know how to utilize/play against them. But once again I suppose that could be said for most online games.All in all there can be a bit of a learning curve and while the game can certainly feel frustrating at times it's still a unique game experience with tons of replay value especially if you like horror aesthetics of it.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: There are no words to describe this game. Well maybe a few Toxic Hillarious Chaotic and A blast to play with or without friends. High praises and I cannot believe how much the recent dlc's have been improving compared to some of the older ones.11/7 Highly Reccomend
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Rated it poorly on my first review. Main complaints were issues with match making. Since then they have made an effort to address the problems. Game is definitely much more enjoyable when you're in a premade party. Without in game voice chat the killer can easily dominate a team. If you're in a group on a discord server the scales balance out. Much care went into the map designs which are dense with detail. The leveling system involves too much grind for the pay off (a new skill or a good item). Mechanically the game is sound. My only complaint being that a killer is not effectively penalized for camping hooks. New characters/killers can be purchased through an in game micro transaction system. You can get the full experience even without them but if you're going to buy one I recommend avoiding the hag and the nightmare. In their current state they are not much fun to play. The game is well worth its current price.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Get ready for one helluva roller coaster ride At first this game doesn't really seem like so much fun. Well at least it wasn't for me. But it DOES grow on you. It plays havoc with one's emotions and while you could be having the time of you life one moment frustration alone could turn you into a monstrous raging lunatic in the next! All in all great fun especially when you play with friends and feel obliged to rush into the most foolhardy rescue attempts known to man (and the Entity)!!!Beware severe distress and annoyance may occur due to the silliest things ever! Like if you purposely lead the killer to your ally...Edit Never gets old...Edit 2 DO NOT BUY THIS GAME!!! Whatever good there is about the game itself is completely lost on account of the technical support the devs provide it's ABSOLUTE !! Check the discussion threads you'll see many many like myself who have lost hundreds even thousands of hours of character progress and no response from support not even weeks (and in many cases months) after they've been reported.Update A month and still no sign of support...Update Only fair that I share support did eventually refund me my bloodpoints to spend.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Highly addictive and spine chilling Dead by Daylight is super addictive and fun to play.It will constantly keep you at the edge from start till the end of the game.In this game there are 4 surviors and 1 killer.The survivors's job is to repair 5 generators and the killer's job is to stop them from repairing the generators and put them on the hooks(eventually kill them).This sounds easy but it's not easy as it seems.The killer got tools to find survivors and stop them similarly survivors also got tools to evade the killer.It's basically the the skill of survivor vs the skill of killer with a bit of luck in it.. Survivors can either cooperate with the others or be solo.Your chance of survival will vary depending on whether you work together as a team or if you go at it alone.Overall the game is fun to play and you will never get bored once you get the hang of it.Every game is different since you get different players in every game with different play styles.The only thing that remains same will be the sense of forboarding and dread.Also this game is super fun to play with friends.. The only negative thing that I found about this game is the lengthy matchmaking system time and peer to peer hosting with lack of dedicated servers which leads to latency problems if killer's connection is not good. .Also new players prepare to get frustrated a lot till you get enough experience.You simply can't expect to out smart a player who had put a lot of time in learning his game.As I said earlier it boils down to the skill of killer vs skill of survior..Also player complaining about camping killers can be duped all it takes certain perks which you will learn eventualy and skilled two survivor one to distract and one to save.Just give some time watch youtube videos and learn from it..This game can't be masterd in 24hrs you have to play at least 100hrs to get the hang of it.So the player whoare not patient shouldn't buy this game.This game is not for you.This is my personal experience it can be learned in less time also it depeds on players.. And finally don't be a sore loser learn to respect the skill of other.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Hello There Reader of Reviews. I wasn't to enthusiastic about this game at first it seemed so simple on the surface. You play as either the Killer or The "Survivors" and the goal is to either Kill everyone or to survive. Pretty simple on the surface. First off Survivors is in quotes because I like playing the Killer and there shouldn't be any survivors... and usually aren't (Hail Freddy "The Nightmare" Krueger). That's not all there is to it though.You can spend points to get perks to make things easier for you or harder for your opponent. Addons for your medkit or Tollbox to make healing and repairing the generators easier or faster. There are skill checks to see if you mess up fixing the generators causing more damage or healing and messing that up. If you are injured you leave bloodtrails and grunt and grown giving away your psoition... On the killer side... You can hook people chase them down stab them beat them and just generally make the players life miserable all around. Don't want to kill your victims right away... leave them crawling on the ground bleeding out and move on. Maybe someone will heal them or maybe not either way your having fun! It seems simple on the surface kill or escape but for the survivors it's all about teamwork you aren't getting out if you can't or won't work together.. for the killer.. its more tactical they all have powers and abilities and if played right.. no one is getting out alive.I'm loving this game simple on the surface... and yet nuanced... give it a shot play both sides and have some fun killing.You can play against others or with them in randoms. If you have the urge you cann Kill Your Friends (no points) One annoying piece though you have to steam invite your friends to play with you after every single round.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Why this should win better with friends This game is very fun it has many suspenseful moments many suprise scares and with friends that just doubles the amount of greatness. you can be a survior with friends or you can kill your friends! the game in a nutshell is this four surviors enter a map and have to complete generators to escape! Watch out though another player the killer tries to kill the surviors trying to escape. Each survior and killer have their own perks abilites to give them an advantage. There are also offerings that spawn more chests in or increase the likely hood of a map. I totally recommend this game because it has hours and hours of fun.

review: Ok this is going to be tough to write a review for this game as this game is... honestly? It's a storm. Now I don't mean like it's horrible or anything like that but the community itself at least a good chunk of it is WHY I say this constant fights against the others side name calling toxicity things like that. I'm just gonna stick to the game itself and try to be as unbiased as possible.Have there been any bugs since I've played this? Looking at my hours it would be tough to say that the game is perfect and has no bugs however the only bugs I've experienced were WAAAAY in the early days of this game and the devs? Pretty nice people trying to fix bug mistakes the second they learn about it just that they give the update to it a while later somewhat causing different bugs but hey progammers know that pain. Can't make anything perfect.So how about gameplay? Well it's a 4 v 1... well no more like it's suppose to be a 1 v 1 v 1 v 1 v 1 in some instances but more times than not 4 v 1 either play as a killer or 1 of 4 survivors trying to kill the survivors or escape from the killer. Perks that help with escaping with killing for being un noticed and general things that help in the game. So the areas you play it in are randomized but there's always like a... "base" kit so to say to help keep your bearings somewhat and a general idea of where some things are. Many different killers to choose from that fit how you play. Survivors are more or less "skins" however at least get all of the characters to level 40 that way you can get that characters "Perks" to help in the game itself. There's... not much to say in story as it's just a multiplayer player vs player interaction though there is some character backstory to HOW they got into this situation for the survivors and killers themselves and some for certain items. Can you get your moneys worth? Ok for the base game it comes with 5... 6 survivors at base And 5 killers with different playstyles and able to unlock ther killers or survivors just from playing the game a bunch and all for just $20 american dollars which is pretty cheap. Most of the dlc is just 1 killer and 1 survivor for like.. 7 dollars which isn't much if you don't WANT to sink a lot of hours just to unlock one or the other though im not saying TO buy the dlc if you buy it just if you enjoy the game but want to play as a different killer or want to play as a new survivor that option is available to you.TL DR $20 Dollars were well spent DLC is there incase you want it still a toxic community

review: Product received for free. I've devoted a sizable portion of my life playing this. It has without a doubt had it's ups and downs. Game balance is a very tenuous thing and it's constantly shifting one way or the other. At the start of every event and when new dlc are released connectivity issues arise in abundance. The issues normally persist for a day or two before being fixed. This happens every single time without fail.On nearly every major update something significant breaks as well. For example what should have been a minor audio tweak turned into a survivor bug that instigated the chase music at random intervals even when the killer wasn't even remotely close to you. It took the devs over a week to fix that.This game has it's issues and flaws I will never deny that. That being said this is by far one of my favorite games of all time. There is something special about this game I don't know if it's the haunting acoustic intro music or the incredibly intense adrenaline scares caused by Michael Myers appearing out of nowhere or any number of other awesome things. This game is fairly easy to pick up for beginners on the survivor side. It's pretty much pressing the M1 button and trying to stay away from the killer (tip if you are being chased aim your camera behind you intermittently to check and see what the killer is doing.). I feel like the killer side is a lot more difficult to grasp for beginners. Each killer has a different power/ability that is wildly different from each other. It will take a lot of time and experience to fully grasp and understand each ability. I will say that the community can be fairly toxic. I honestly recommend hiding the after game chat if you don't want to see some pretty hateful stuff. Solo queue survivor can be a pretty stressful experience I personally recommend finding a group of friends to play survivor with it will likely make things more enjoyable.Re reading this I realize it sounds kind of negative about the game but in my eyes this is just healthy constructive criticism. I'd like to reiterate that I could not possibly recommend this game more. Slight disclaimer this game was gifted to me by a friend over a year ago (nearly two years). I typically only play survivor with a group of two or three friends and those games have been some of my best experiences in recent memory.EDIT Just some grammar fixes.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Well now that i passed the 500 hours line guess it's time to do a proper review for this game DLet's start with saying that Dead by Daylight unlike the game name itself and the tags is not an horror game. If you are searching for a scary game that's not what you are searching for except for some nice jumpscares when killer is Micheal Myers/has Tinkerer and pop up from behind a wall.It takes more the shape of a competitive/cooperative (at least on the survivors side) game and will make you sweat on your keyboard both as a survivor while trying to escape the killer and as a killer when chasing down survivors.Game mechanics are well balanced even if the killer sometimes has more control on the result of the game than the survivors.In the overall the experience is very enjoyable and I would recommend it.Something else?Oh right... THIS GAME NEEDS DAMND DEDICATED SERVERS. I'm tired of having to switch several lobbies before finding a killer with a decent ping becouse yes it can be incredible but real every game (even "ranked" ones) is hosted on the killer's pc.

review: I've been playing this game basically since it came out. I've seen it all. The good and the bad times.1) If you hate bugs game breaking glitches laggy teammates and opponents you might wanne pass on. I'd say 8/10 matches go quite well maybe a broken animation or a bit of lag but playable. The rest well from hilarious glichtes that dont break the game to lag and bugs that might just throw you out of the match I've seen it done it suffered from it.2) Ignore post game chat. It's most likely just a killer complaining about survivors being OP or a survivor complaining about the killer camping or a survivor sandbagging. 3) Rank means nothing. You can be rank 1 and still be bad at the game or a rank 20 after the rank reset and own every match. 4) The community is ok.5) By default almost every newkiller dlc release will have everyone complaining about the killer being OP just because no one knows how to play against them.6) There are two types of survivors A the newbie not knowing how to play the game properly wanting to win the match by crouching along the edges of the map and hiding in lockers. B The 1000 hrs + player who know dont care about surviving but about completing objectives saving teammates and mostly playing with the killer until they get caught or escape.7) If you see a streamer show off a bug that breaks the game be prepared you wont have normal match until its fixed the Devs like their holidays and week ends ++ They put out new killers quite regularly. Not always a good thing.++ New maps are free. Yeah!++ Active community++ Cometics but you can get some from playing the game Bugs dont expect them to be fixed anytime soon Bad game mechanics (camping infinites) Killer favoured devs Cosmetics It aint really scarry...You gotta like the gamemode. Otherwise its not more than a few ours of fun until it gets boring.

review: Pretty much the best "Play a slasher movie killer" game out right now. The game constantly updates with balance changes and new characters which can be good and bad. Every 3 months or so a new DLC comes out for $7 with a new killer survivor and map. While you can pay for it you can also earn shards in game to get it without paying which I appreciate. If I could mention one thing that could presuade you not to pick this up it is this. This is a very toxic community or at least it can be. I recommend having your steam profile to friends only and ignoring the after lobby chat that way you can mostly ignore the toxicity. (When i first got the game it was in the process of getting review bombed because of an actually needed balance change.) This game takes awhile to get used to and even longer to get all of the perks you want. Despite this it is a lot of fun as both survivor and killer and it is a lot of fun to survive with friends (even if it can lead to some irritating killer matches if everyone's on discord). You can even play solely with friends with all the perks available which is always fun to verbally taunt each other while chasing each other. Basic outline if you have at least one friend who can show you the ropes and if you can get used to both roles this game will keep you entertained for a long while.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: A very Fun horror experience for both the Killer and Survivor. For Killer it's the fun and Thrill of the Hunt that makes them fun. For the Survivor it's the Resilience and the will to survive that makes playing them fun. The game is still a little buggy with it's vaults and pallets (and hit detection) but otherwise it really is a fun experience.

review: Product received for free. Good game but not the best. I was excited to check this game out. It seemed like a big change from your standard FPS/MP game. The first hour was spent figuring out why I couldnt get the game to work after install. It had something with my firewall blocking it because I wasn't running it as an admin. After screwing around for a while I was finally able to log in and pick a character. Sweet! Went to check out the tutorial and the game crashed. Ran out of time to play for a bit. Later that night I managed to log in and decided to screw the tutorial. I would have to figure it out. I decided to play as a survivor thinking that the worst thing that could happen if I sucked would be that I died right away. Luckily the controls weren't that hard to understand and it worked perfectly with my XBOX 1 control. This game made me jump consistently while I played. There is nothing like the Oh S*** feeling you get when you hear that creepy music getting louder and louder. I was almost sold on this game. Except it started to get a bit repetetive after a while. There were a few different maps and being hunted by different bad guys was pretty awesome. Then I tried to play the bad guy. I logged in and waited... and waited. It dawned on me the community isn't big enough to consistently provide you with matches if you are the villan. People would come in then they would pop out. Eventually I gave up and went to be a survivor. Bottom line is that if you got it on sale then lucky you. Would I pay the $20 price point and then more to unlock characters and villans? No not going to. Its half a game and they want to nickel and dime you in order to expand it.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Dead By Daylight is a good game all around because it's thrilling and really gets the heart racing at times. Over time you'll get better and learn more about the game and it's mechanics. It's gotten to the point where I can tell who the killer is in the first minute of the game without actually seeing them just because I know their mechanics so well. So just for your information DBD quickly changes from a horror game to a competitive ranked game.PROS Genuinely scary gets less scary over time but still scary if you're not paying attentionFun game the developers do a good job with updating it.The developers are really when it comes to people ragequitting so you won't have to deal with much of that(if you report it).CONS 90% of the community. If you play DBD you need to have tough skin and you can't let a bunch of toxic s get to you. Basically don't give a to toxic s.Sometimes the community complains about new killers and gets them nerfed even though they don't need to be all they need to do is get better. (That's why Freddy sucks now.....)Finally most of the new characters come from DLC and cost money which is rather annoying. I understand making the licensed killers cost money but not the ones they've added like Doctor and Hag.So my advice to you is to get DBD if you like both horror and competitive ranked games have tough skin and make good choices about DLC. For example the main thing in DLC is killers. Research a killer and make sure you really want it before getting it.That's all. Enjoy DBD!

But i decided to try this anyways and i have Zero regrets. well... besides for all the time i have spent that could have been spent learning a life skill...Very fun game. review: I've played this game somewhat consistently with some breaks since its release back in 2016. Sure the game isn't perfectly balanced and probably won't ever be but it's really fun nonetheless.Most people complaining about certain mechanics being "OP" probably didn't even play when actual unfair mechanics existed such as infinites no hook respawns (basically you can't hook anyone) 20 second cooldown sprint burst crazy pallet spawns and so much more. The game is in a much better state now than it was before.Another common complaint is that the game is "unplayable it's so buggy". The fact of the matter is the game is really not buggy outside of a few major bugs which I have personally only come across a few times. Sometimes they accidentally introduce a new bug but they usually fix it within a couple days. The real issue is the lack of servers. If the killer (killers host the match) has a high ping things that registered as happening on his end may not match yours. This is an actual problem but the devs have added a way of checking the killer's ping beforehand so you know in advance to search for a new game if the latency is bad.That might seem like a lot but with those two things aside the game is actually really good for what you pay ($10 on sale is almost nothing). Because playing as survivor and killer is so different each side is like a game of its own. This may be somewhat biased but in terms of gameplay matches almost always play different from the last and to an extent you determine you how you want to play. Every killer plays very different from each other and different perks can really change how you play. If you are new to the game there are perks that can assist you. If you are more experienced there are perks that can be pretty helpful in the right hands.Even though I have played this game for quite some time I still learn new things here and there and still have room to improve. The game might be a little hard to pick up if you're a new player but it's gonna be a while before you truly get bored of the game. DBD is not for everyone though. There isn't really another game to compare it to as there's not really many 1v4s. But if the game looks interesting at all to you I'd give it a try because I never thought that I'd still be playing this game when I bought it back in 2016.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: great teamplay once you figure out how to play. On low ranks killer is a lot easier to play. An experienced survivor team though is a tough matchup for experienced killers. Balanced matchmaking once you get out of rank 20 15 (starting ranks).Have to add that the monthly rank reset is a poor design choice though because it pretty much moves all players within 5 ranks (10 15) instead of 15 (1 15) which leads to relatively unbalanced games for a week or two.

review: A fun game where you can be either a killer attempting to sacrifice four people to some supernatural being or a survivor trying to fix generators and just stay alive and escape. In my opinion this game lets people with various playstyles choose their favourite role. As survivor you have to sneak around and play with team as you recieve additional points for healing or helping players which have been caught and hooked by the killer. It is good for people with good mechanical skills since if you are not good at it the skill check minigame while fixing generator might be annoying untill you have trained a bit. As killer you are a solo player. You have to think ahead and use your resources to raise your chances of killing all the survivors. Camping hooks and just mindlessly following whoever shows around will not help you succeed. It would take too long to explain everything but you should note that this game is more than meets the eye. The community can be pretty toxic on both survivor and killer side but that is disease which affects any online game nowadays.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Edit I no longer recommend this game and I shall tell you why but first let me tell you a story on how I found this game (Also ignore what I said at the top it's my original review it no longer applies. Also TL DR it's a rant if you get offended or triggered please end your existence)So how did I find this game? Well it goes back to roughly mid April of 2016 where one night me and my friend (Who shall not be named) where looking through our queues to see whether we could find a good game to look forward to or play anyway I stumbled upon this game "Dead by Daylight" the name intrigued us both and we both watched the trailer. I didn't take much interest into it as Assymetirical (I believe that's how you spell it) horror games don't interest me anyway my friend is really intrigued by this he then does some research on it and it turns out it was coming out in June which was close to when we where looking for games anyway a month later give or take he pre orders the Deluxe Edition (Which has no value anymore considering all you get is art and a soundtrack). Not knowing that if you did this you where then able to and two other people enter the Beta (Which I will get onto later) he then sends me and another friend a key (This other friend is not going to be named again). Shortly after the Beta begins we are excited to play it and what do you know? It's a decent game! Besides the horrible optimization and frequent bugs and crashes it was good. This then prompted me and my other friend who played with us to pre order the game and so we did when then waited about 1 2 weeks for the release once released we downloaded the game and began playing it it was fun lots of hype! Shortly after I write the review at the top. A few weeks pass and me and my friend (The friend who bought the Deluxe Edition) and we would play it whenever we wanted to we then heard news of a new killer and we where excited we played as and agasint the new killer it was fun for a while. And then... It stopped. What stopped you may ask? Well the fun aspect I didn't find it fun anymore. And NOW we get into the review (I know right finnaly?!). Now I have to keep this short as Steam don't allow in depth reviews so here goes.Toxic CommunityToo little variety of killersToo many survivors (In my opinion)Horrible optimization (LITERALLY getting 80.C on my GPU in game on medium settings at 30fps for a game that is in Unreal this in my opinion is unacceptable)I don't know about update frequency due to me uninstalling the game months ago so please tell me how that is in the comments. But from when I used to play this game good updates weren't frequent and pointless ones where.Also this isn't Team Fortress 2 what's the point in paying for cosmetics? (Irony)As a whole I don't recommend this game there isn't much in it for me to enjoy and even if I did come back to playing it I wouldn't enjoy even most of my friends who bought don't play it anymore.Well what do I know? You may enjoy it but I don't just get it on sale. If you want to see my original review go this link LINK REMOVED https //mega.nz/#!a0oiyBCL!59 tsaaYmLfiJ WeAHsL_JmEbLLW5PTHV IqICbSyqISo yeah as a whole this review was apparently 1500 words but Steam doesn't like that.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: I love this game it gets a bad rep from salty people but people forget that competitive games will have it's share of exploiters trolls and cry babys. I play both survivor and killer it's great fun alone or with friends.The gist of the mechanics A. 4 Survivors and 1 killer.B. Survivors objective is to power the 5 generators then head for the exit doors to escape scattered about the map while the killer tries to eliminate each of them one by one.C. Survivors perform quick time skill "events" while repairing generators killer's objective is to "hook" players on hook structures around the map in order to "kill" them.The best $20 I've spent in quite awhile.

review: A very fun game with somewhat overly simplified mechanics that lead to problematic gameplay and toxicity. Toxicity in the community is primarily generated (no pun intended) by pitting two factions of players against eachother while each side utilizes the mechanics aformentioned to accomplish their respective objectives. However one way or the other the game tends to be lopsided favouring either Killers or Survivors depending on the most recent rebalancing.Stalemates are a commonplace element a prime example being the "Hatch" where standoffs hold the game indefinitely on the last survivor and the killer staring eachother down at point blank. If the Killer hits first the survivor can Escape due to a small window of oppritunity if the Survivor jumps first the Killer can Grab them within a slightly larger window. Similar situations are frequently found in simple Killer strategies such as "facecamping" and the like or the lack of consistency in element functionality. Where struggle meeters stick and animations lead you into comprisming situations despite not making much sense visually (ignoring pallets strange misses etc).While a point of contention there is little to do beyond radical redesign to alleviate these sort of interpersonal challenges beyond continued refinement of the games infestructure and a close monitoring of the hosts Ping prior to the match (some abuse of "lag switching" does occur and a laggy host will completely break the game).Over all Dead by Daylight is very enjoyable sometimes more in simply filling out the Bloodweb than actual gameplay and the most important thing to do is remember not to respond to Toxcity with Toxicity as tempting as it is. Unfortunately the community thrives on that cycle and in a strange way hates itself more with every Trial completed.So have fun be well and try to laugh at the absurdity of it. UNLESS YOU'RE PLAYING A CANNIBAL IN WHICH CASE YOU CAN GO F
title: Dead by Daylight

review: This game is a very skill based game in which both sides require diffrent skills. This is a very fun game that in my opinion never gets old. One problem that stood out to me alot was how killer chases could last for a very long time in the higher ranks (around 15 1). Both sides have their toxicity as face camping is prevelant in the killers and t bagging is common in the surivivors. Both sides have their issues but I'm going to stay neutral because as having many hours on both sides I will have to say that both situations are annoying. I do understand that survivors looping is the only decent way to not die but for killers it is very annoying and time consuming. And on the other hand face camping or just proxy camping (patrolling general area) is annoying on the survivor side I do understand that people don't buy games to be told what to do. Everytime I play killer there is always something "wrong" with my gameplay that causes me to be **** on in the end game chat over maybe staying 20 metres within the hook area. Survivors act as if everything that happens is the killers fought. Lets be honest would you want to be looped flashlighted body blocked and t bagged as killer? No of coarse not. Some face camping is WELL deserved. In ending this game is kind of set up for the survivors to win. *Feel free to share your opinions with me*

review: I'm playing this game since its release and I never regret buying it. Most of the time I'm playing solo. As a survivor it's pretty easy to find other players and the lobbies fill up fast. As a killer I have to wait a few seconds up to 20 minutes for other players sometimes (but that is rare). So far I've bought every DLC wheather it's worth you have to dicide on your own. You'll get a new killer survivor and a map every time. I'm enyoing the game and I want to support the devs so I've bought all of them. Pros quick funny rounds (normally 10 to 20 minutes) constant support and balancing of the game events (dopple xp Halloween Christmas)Cons sometimes toxic players especially if you winning a game as a killer or if you don't help these players (even if it's impossible in certain situations) sometimes you have to wait a long time before survivors join inIf you enjoy asymmetric multiplayer games I definitely recommend this game.
