review: After over 200 hours of playing the game I would have to recommend not buyting this game as its best spent somewhere else. This game is full of bugs glitches and a really unbalanced game as a whole. I really wanted to like this game but I just can't.1. Good luck finding a lobby you can spend 10 20 minutes trying to find a game becauase of Failed Lobby errors and the ones you do find there is probably a 70% chance the killer is going to back out.2. Matchmaking is horrible in this game. If you are a new player rank 20/level 1 be prepared to get slaugtered by a rank 1 killer with full perks on a consistant basis. so much so that you will wish you never bought the game so save your salty tears. 3. Team play is virtually non existent The game is supposed to support team play but it never really happens... get hooked? chances are you are not getting saved.. working on a generator? chances are your the only one becuase.. one teammate is playing dwight and hiding in the basement locker. one is doing nothing but runing around trolling everyone trying to work in generators and the other one is just crouching in a corner waiting for everyone to die so they can take the hatch.4. Game play is really unbalanced in favor of the killer. its understandable that the killer is supposed to be scary overpowering and survivors should use stealth to avoid the killer but once the killer sees you just consider yourself caught 70 80% of the time as they have nerfed most of the things available survivors can use to get away.5. Glitches galore. Not only do you have to worry about out running the killer but you also have to worry about getting stuck in the gound being uable to get healed when downed unable to pick up survivors unable to hit survivors in some instances on staircases.I feel I could go on and on about the issues but at this point I just said why bother as there are too many to mention and this game is not worth the time. These are just some of the glaring issues this game suffers from and I havent even mentioned the hacks.This game is a beta at best that was presented to us as a finished game... its not! IT's a RIPPPEdit this game has definately gotten better with time but it still has its issues with cheaters glitches and exploits. also all the now its like you are almost required to buy all the dlc to even start having fun.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: I've previously played this game on PS4 for 100 hours. I like the concept and the gameplay progression loop but you need some patience with this game. Disregard any review telling you that killers are overpowered they have absolutely zero idea what they are talking about and are new to the game. There are certain add ons that can make killers more effective and even then a well coordinated team of survivors will destroy Killers (except Nurse which should have never existed). And I'm not even factoring in the possibility that the survivor team could be all friends communicating over Discord which makes the odds of the Killer winning next to none (except again if you're a good Nurse). Survivors have many many tricks they can pull off on you due to the very limited nature of how you are able to interact with the environment and game as the killer. Break a pallet? Locked animation makes it easy to be blinded. Pick up someone that you want to hook? You're gonna drop them right away if some confident survivor blinds you with the right timing. There's manipulating the frame rate of the game to achieve movement that shouldn't be possible... it just goes on and on. The thing I hate most of all is this culture of survivor entitlement throughout the game. As a survivor the most toxicity you get is the killer maybe ragequitting which is only amusing. That's it. As a Killer you get hate for being good. You get hate for being bad. The party and their friends will mock you for being terrible even though the results screen clearly shows you only have 1 or 2 perks so far for that killer with common add ons and a low rank to boot. The only reason they got matched up with you is because they probably lost enough on purpose to smurf on newer players during a free week. When survivors use techniques that quite a few admit are stupidly broken such as looping Decisive Strike Self Care Balanced Landing Adrenaline Sprint Burst Dead Hard and Urban Evasion it's fine deal with it. If Killers use (god forbid) BBQ &amp Chili Hex Ruin Rancor Enduring Hex No One Escapes Death Thanatophobia A Nurse's Calling and Monitor &amp Abuse they're a horrible piece of that is "cheap" a "camper" and/or using a "crutch". There are simply two different communities playing this game and constantly clash in the most toxic fashion I have ever seen. Me? I'm just trying to have fun with this game and I'd really like to play Killer more than survivor but the amount of times survivors have acted like they were hot after a game ended because they were using unfair advantageous communication is ridiculous. Most of my good games as Killer were against clearly poor players but my games that weren't good were blowouts by Survivors that shouldn't be at my rank. Honestly playing Survivor is like a pleasant stroll on a mildly downward paved sidewalk with the occasional misalignment but playing Killer is a jog up a steep hill and that never changes.It's fun but there should be not only an option to turn text comms off (first game I've ever wanted that because it seems like people actually play this game for the purpose of wanting to shed their toxicity because they've had a life recently) but Behavior Digital Inc. needs to crack down on survivors being OP. When you pass a skill threshold that isn't particularly high the Killer really needs a miracle to win.Unless you're Nurse. Delete Nurse.Edit Never mind this game is designed so that if you main survivor you become a genuinely awful person.

review: Although it has its moments Dead by Daylight is a solid game and is even better with a squad of friends. I have put 40ish hours in already and see no reason to stop now. One frustrating thing that affects gameplay is the server lag. It can cause the killer to catch up quick or hit you through/over a barrier since the animation of you hurdling can hitch. Other than that I have not experienced much frustration online.One big change they could make is the lobby/invite system especially when you have a team of four survivors. There really isn't a need to continuously invite each of my friends after a match. If they added a "stay as group" feature to match making that would be amazing. Honestly no other complaints really. It is rare that I spend the full price on a game these days and have it be fully worth the price. This game is it. If you are new I suggest playing as the killer online first. This way you can see what the killer sees and then when you play as a survivor you know where/how to avoid detection. I would recommend this game to anyone looking for an adrenaline experience online. 10/10 for me!

review: Product received for free. I can't recommend this game. I honestly can't. Don't get me wrong it's an amazing concept for the game and it *can* be genuinely fun. But I honestly think the devs of the game want you to not have fun. Playing killer is one of the things that attracts people to the game because everyone wants to be a murderer. But the killer is just bullied. The killer is always at a disadvantage because the survivors can run in loops that are impossible to break if you don't have certain perks. Generators get done way too fast and make the killer's game a stress fest. Killers are forced to run the strongest perks (That require dlc and tons of grind if you don't get lucky with the shrine of secrets) to even make the game fair and even then it's RNG if you have a good time or not.Lastly the community of this game is insanely toxic. You'll get people that will disconnect the second you down them you'll get the people that flame you for doing a certain tactic as killer (Which sometimes feels required to be successful) and then you'll get the survivors that will run circles around you taunting you instead of ending the game (Because the survivors can actually hold the game hostage and force you to dc by just simply not escaping). TBH I think what the devs should do is remove the killer's aura perks buff the survivors stealth game and remove the loops completely. That way it becomes the game it's trying to be the "Hide and hope he doesn't find you because if he does you're dead" game.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: I wanted this game on release but after careful thought and watching youtube streams i realized this game is NOT ready release game. It's an early release/beta disguised as a ready release game so i didn't get it.fast forward to august 20th. free weekend. hellyeah.so i downloaded it and spend the past 15 hours playing it straight and have come to the conclusion that this is actually worth the price tag which even when it's not on sale is like $20.the premise of the game is simple. you have a team of 4 people who are trying to escape a map before getting killed or sacrificed by a demon killer / monster thing.the game gives you options on how to try and beat a map. i've seen people forego saving others to start the generators needed to activate the exit doors and then whole teams try to save people who get caught by the monsters.the monsters themselves are pretty well thought out and with the recent update one of them can shift through walls which means you have to get good at juking and not being so readable. with the original few monsters you could throw things in the way to slow them down. The main issue with the game is that the server is based on the person who is playing the monster instead of actual servers. other issues include buggy maps and some necessary balancing tweaks. I have won matches against level 20 and up players when i was level 1 because you have to be unpredicatble as both a human and a monster. another issue is the lobby and waiting area is you might wait anywhere to seconds to upwards of 10 minutes to get into a game and those games range from 5 minutes to 40 minutes.The developers are constantly working on and updating the game and for $20 give or take that beats out some AAA games. if you have the bill to spend i'd get it. the game can only get better and once you get the hang of your role and how it fits in with your gameplay the game itself becomes quite enjoyable.7/10 because of tech issues meh graphics balance issues that will most likely be addressed with upcoming patches (at which point i'd move it up to an 8/10)
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Ohh boi This game is just broken. When you start with level 1 killer/survivor you always get at least one guy that run all the "Meta" perks and he will make your life a nightmare. Let's talk about killers shall we? First thing first. Don't play Freddy. I know Freddy is the Killer that you bought this game for... But he's unplayeble... And Nurse god have mercy on your soul sometimes you'll play against bad Nurse and you can actually have fun. Then you'll meet the God Nurse and you will suffer. That's mostly gameplay for you. As a surviver don't try to hide just run some perk that allows you move faster than killer and you'll be fine.Pro Fun with friends Almost all iconic slasher villians Easy to learn hard to master Great horror music (If you play with Michael Mayer that is)Cons Some killer are unplayeble Not ballanced for newcomers

review: Update I've changed my mind over the last year. I'm just tired of it. I don't feel like there are any "good" players left. The community has become so toxic it makes me sad. The majority of the survivors I play with/against are pallet hopping squat ghosting griefing pos. I don't blame killer mains for being brutal "face campers". I would throw these idiots on the hooks myself to help the killer at this point.I blame half of it on the devs for not fixing some of the core gameplay issues. They got close to greatness but I've lost faith that they are actually going to change anything of value this far from release.The other half goes to the trolls who are so focused on point hoarding they try to justfy their behavior by telling others they just need to git gud aka exploit every whatever they can to ruin the experience for everyone else.This game has lost it's original spirit. Now it's about the same as every other online experience full of 12 year olds who know your mom.I got my moneys worth at least.Original After 300+ hours of play I still catch myself holding a breath as the killer passes mere inches from my hiding spot or leaning into the screen to look around corners looking for survivors. This game has great elements Well designed music/effects that raise your heartrate and inspire paranoia/fear A wide variety of playable characters to match your style Many maps and variations of each to keep the element of the unknownAs usual the main issue with this game is *some* players. Do yourself a favor and skip the aftermatch chat 99.9% of the time. Whoever died/loses whines about it being unfair/how dare others not save them/they only died because X didn't or did Y and it's not fair. Whoever wins acts like they are pro level and you must be an idiot for not winning. There's the Youtube troll vid crew being well you know.AKA The usual multi online experience.Yes. This game has bugs and balance issues but the devs do regularly put out patches/updates in addition to new survivors/killers/maps/perks stirring the pot frequently. No. It's not perfect. No there is not reward/reason for ranking up yet........*hint hint*If you play sans the meta soup it is an enjoyable nail biting experience with a solid group of invested players that will keep you coming back for more.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: At first time i bought this game it felt like a game where you just run around do some objectives and avoid getting killed and i found it boring and dint touch it for nearly a year although it is exactly like that in the paper this game offers a lot more.Pros The Perk system is awesome there is so many perks that will litterly change your entire role and ability in the game. Ranking up your survivor/killer is actually pretty simple and easy it doesnt take intense grinding to get someone level 30 etc. i have 34 hours in this game and i have one survivor at 30 (Meg &lt 3) And 5 killers being level 10 while spirit being level 20. Leveling up in this game is definetly not hard at all. The offerings / items gives advantages to your survivor and killer. Overall gameplay is amazing although it sounds repetative and boring the game is very intense considering there is no in game chat and every survivor / killer plays different and that makes every match incredibly unique.Cons The community is a bit toxic you have salty survivors while also having farm friendly killers that will ruin your experience. I did put in game voice chat not being a thing in pros section but i do also have to put it on cons considering this game would be more fun if we had any type of communication in the game just like in Friday 13th but devs wanted the players to experience the game with you not knowing your teammates so it would make it more intense whitch i do agree it does make the game intense but they need to add more animations off you trying to tell what you want to say. Right now as far as i know there is only 2 animation for survivor pointing and waving to yourself. There isnt any spesific animation for saying heal me stop dont go there etc. so it needs those kind of animations. (Well heal me signal for survivors is T bagging yup its T Bagging) Some of the perks are ridiculously overpowered and it makes you nearly impossible to be killed or not to be killed. Its nearly impossible to find a loby with a stable ping and if you level up its nearly impossible to find a lobby. Some of the mechanics does not work as they intended i seen people getting hit while throwing down the pallet i seen people getting hit by killer altough there was some range between them.Overall 7 10 as long as there are lobbys with stable ping and mechanics working as they intended this game is awesome. Ofc there is nothing to do for toxic players but is there a game with stable/friendly community nowadays?
title: Dead by Daylight

review: It's been almost 2 years sense I reviewed this game I'm trying to be fair with this updated review but I still can't recommend the game for various reasons. For starters you will be dealing with a toxic community of both survivors and killers. You'll only really enjoy this game if you are playing with friends however this game can also ruin friendships I've nearly lost a couple of friends from this game. In fact someone unfriended me from the game due to them getting killed in a KILL YOUR FRIENDS MATCH! Now lets talk about survivors and killers just in general originally there was only 4 survivors and 3 killers. During this time the game was more balanced and sure it had bugs but they could be managed over time. This was what set the game on the right path. Now the game has over 14 survivors and over 13 killers. So whats the issue here? The game has a lot of bugs and this also leaves the game unbalanced. Survivors can and will always have the upper hand in matches because they have better perks that leave the killer at a disadvantage which also leaves some killers having to farm one survivor just so they can get a kill. Whats even worse is that there will be a new killer and survivor added in december. Developers I'll say it once and I'll say it again fix your game take care of the bugs that your game is running into. Well thats my review for Dead by daylight and I hope this review helps you decide on whether or not to get the game.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: good. my main issues is with the maps and some survior perks but overall good. being killer feels amazing. very immersive but still get looped into oblivion. i love this game but losing is the worst after all the work u put into it. the killers u get at the start are some of the best so starting out u got good killers which i love. the starting surviors are also very good. long qoue times also suck even though i know this game is popular. overall i love this game but u really have to deal with some issues and cant be a love hate relationship in this game. i got 200 hours and i got three killers prestige one. im heavily invested in this game but i admit starting a lobby or joining a lobby pains me every time due to high chance of being out played and tea bagged. also sometimes ure team dies in 30 seconds of starting. teamates suck. going solo is better. i play people who dont rely on others. game gets upated a lot which im thankful for. all the updates never address the real issues and really needs to be fixed soon if im gonna put any serious time in this game. over all game definifitly worth the money and even dlc. the game isnt worth investing huge time into at the moment of writitng this. unless all killers gets a boost u if u say killer stronger survivors way stronger than killers then it may not be worth it. also this is the only game i played where u dont want to unlock all the perks as it makes leveling up less desirable cuz u get crap perks. killers have a couple good perks and most are meh. getting any good perk is a hassale and wish it was easier to make a certain build. definitaly based on rng. lots of rng in this game. can lose a match to pure luck. anyways this is a high skill game like team fortess 2. if ure interested in learning curves and countering the meta u might like this one. perks are a big deal in this game but u can win perkless too all depends on player level. i just pray every match i get paried up with idiots cuz i hate long chases.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: As much as I am willing to downvote this game I also want to upvote it but the current state of the game and its community at the time of this review pushes me towards not recommending the game in its current state the community is a mixed bag of those that cry out for nerfing the Killers and Survivors. Because they both have their fair share of being Overpowered With how the game is currently being handled as of this review it seems that Reporting does absolutely nothing in their current state allowing those that Troll and play "unfairly" to see just about if no consequences.There are the types of players that Play Fairly and if you meet these types of player Yes you will have fun with this game but you are guarenteed to also meet players that will Camp hooks and other area's and Speak in a rude manner after the game is done one example I can give is one match I have played we were Ill capable to win due to the killer camping two generators the same general area and then proceeded to mock the survivors for losing.By all means I would recommend this game but due to pretty much my own personal experience with the community thus far I am personally forced at hand to click the down arrow.Edit After a while the game has been getting somewhat better albeit not the best but still good the game does still lack in some areas in terms of balance but over all the devs are working at least somewhat to fix these issues.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: This is so much fun it should be illegal. I have only played killers a handful of times and I see the attraction to playing them but I really prefer to play the survivors.Even after a couple of months of playing this game I still feel the adrenaline flow when I'm working on a generator and the killer is starting to get close. Or when I'm crouched behind a tree and they are so close you can reach out and touch them yet they still haven't found you.The excitment is contagious when you play with friends and use third party software for communication. Hearing somebody scream when the killer surprises them will either freak you out or make you smile. In any event if you're looking for a game that will get your heart pumping look no further!

review: Ok i know i might get hate for saying this but i do think this game is worth picking up for its theme alone and that is one of its issue i guess its an assymetrical game where theres one killer who is supposed to be strong and in control of the game and a survivor that is supposed to have numbers and should find a way around the killers streangths yet I come to its downfall for me if your trying to play killer and expect to feel like one i have a bad news for you you wont feel like one at all it doesnt feel the game is in your hands its actually in the survivors hands cause gen rushing is a thing still specially to low level killers that doesnt have hex ruin(which btw just get destroyed 2 3 mins into the game because totem placements are obvious) plus some maps are so big that if the survivors spawn seperately and work on different gens across the map as a killer your screwed plus community is toxic thats one more thing i have read a couple of reviews and most of them are from survivors who complain killers are too powerful they have the nurse they have spirit they have huntress but we forgot those characters have steeeep learning curves aswell and their powers have great weakness nurse gets exhausted spirit cant see survivors while invi huntress has that stupidly huge hum radius. im just saying even if they have played them like 1000 of hours theres still lots of ways to work around their abilities.I wanna stop right there with the community but i can say i can recommend this game because its not hopeless it is an amazing game with an amazing concept maybe someday we can hone this game into perfection where everyone will have fun it is possible to have fun if your even a bit curious about the game id say yeah give it a go just remember the game is there to give you enjoyment and no made up honor rule should prevent you from enjoying it if they are gonna keep you hostage in a game by all means camp that hook. no one should stop you from havving fun except if you cheat then you deserve to be hooked irl.

review: TLDR if you're a gamer that's 1). easily triggered by toxicity 2). hates doing the same thing over &amp over again and 3). can't stand occasional glitches/bugs/lag of any sort then avoid this game as you probably won't like it in the long run.Honestly this is a game you'll either grow to love &amp tolerate or slowly &amp painfully hate.Can the game and the community be toxic at times? Yes just like any multiplayer/PvP game can be.Can the game get annoying frustrating repetitive and/or boring at times? Yes however the implementation of new killers/survivors/maps/events which are periodically released within the game can help to break up the monotony of things (as well as playing the game with friends).Can the game get glitchy buggy and/or laggy? Yes on many occasions. And while the devs assumingly do their best to correct any glitches or bugs found in the game there will still probably be bugs and glitches to be found as in almost any game. (And without dedicated servers the lag issues will probably continue to remain)Now despite all of this Dead by Daylight is not an inherently bad game. Sure it could use improvements but it also has the potential of being an enjoyable asymmetrical multiplayer (4vs1) horror game if you're patient and give it a chance especially if you have friends to play it with.7.5/10
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Ok... this game isn't the best however despite that the game is still fun whether you're with friends or some random people. The community is pretty garbo and can get frustrated easily at the slightest things. I would recommend you at least give it a try once it's free weekend or on sale could always refund it once you've tried a few rounds and find it's not your game. Starting out is hard because there's no direct tutorial (could always go find one on youtube I guess) but once you get use to it and play more it can get pretty fun. There will be moments where you want to uninstall or tell one of your forehead teamates to go shove the doctor's weapon up their bum but hey can't ask for everything now can you? Everyone you play against is going to be different (unless you go up against the same people/with the same survivors) whether their an absolute boosted player or someone who's actually quite knowledgeable about the game. But when you start I recommend trying it with a friend because I can promise you it'll be more fun that way. I personally started this game on my own but once I convinced one of my friends to try it with me we had an absolute blast trolling eachother or making amazing game winning plays that you can be proud of. One thing though I guarentee you're going to get REALLY playing this game at some point but hey that's when you take a break. You can't always have the perfect game and have everything work in your favor nothing works like that. In the end I really do recommend you give this game a try whether you have a friend or not I won't say it'll be worth your time because everyone will expect different things from this game and not everyone will be satisfied but hey you won't know until you try right?
title: Dead by Daylight

title: Dead by Daylight

review: Game is addicting asf and fun. It has a great grind and has 100's if not 1000's of hours of gameplay.I don't recommend it because it is frustrating plagued by t.Infinite loading screens.Crashes.Tons of bugs.Lobbies are ed.Events are usually more trouble for the player base than fun making lobbies take up to 20mins.Rank means literally nothing.As a survivor you will have to requeue lobbies up to 6 times in a row just to get a ping on a killer that isn't 175 800.Killers are laggy asf like they are on McDonalds wifi.Survivors get almost no blood points while killers get a ton and then the devs say the lobbies are due to everyone playing killers...... So buff survivor BP right? Nope.There are a handful of killers that are cancer to play against so most survivors DC. They aren't OP but extremely unfun and the devs know which and have left em unchanged forever.Game runs like on most mid range pc's only able to get 45 55fps on ultra in 1080p. Same PC would get 100+ in BF1 or PUBG but not DBD.4 man SWF groups break the game if they communicate well on discord and relay the killers location the entire match SWF's should be limited to 2 man groups. They also treat solo's like and will hook rush throwing the match like idiots. SWF is cancer for both survivors and killers imo.Overall a amazing game but completely ed at the same time.
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Currently my favorite game out right now I've been playing since launch when the Trapper the Hillbilly and the Wraith were the only killers in the game and from there the game has made so much progress and there have been so many positive changes that make the game fun to play on both sides be it killer or survivor minus the pallet looping if you're a killer chasing down a survivor but I see why it's a useful tactic. With a wide variety of killers to choose from to play they are all very enjoyable to play once you learn how to use them. Once you get the hang of it and learn how to use lunges properly killer is definitely addictive to play. This game rarely ever bores me as a killer main most matches are enjoyable and if you play as survivor it doesn't really get stale either as there are a wide variety of killers that you could be up against and it could be a really skilled killer which calls for an intense match. 100/10 keep up the amazing job BHVR!

title: Dead by Daylight

review: Good game that will never live to its potential due to the developers running it.Very unbalanced on each side (Killer and Suvivors).High learning curve not much is done to teach new players.DLCs are usually overpowered then nerfed weeks later to encourage release sales.Very poor character customization all variants (Even DLCs) are mere recolors of pre existing models there since release.Developers never address important issues or questions during streams are avoidant to ongoing problems that are most likely there due to lack of knowledge on their part.Infinites and camping have always been a problem yet never discouraged. Issues still not addressed.Public matchmaking has been horrible from the very beginning. Sometimes taking 5 10 minutes with friends up to 30 minutes as a full group of 4 survivors. This still remains unaddressed.The Killer of each round hosts the game over their network. This causes lag issues and enables cheaters to manipulate the gameplay. Lagswitching also seems to be a popular trend. Nonetheless you are always at the mercy of the host's connection. The developers still won't host the game on their own servers or address the concern of many.When in the lobby the Killer can see everyone it is made very easily for them to click you see your hours achievements what items you are bringing into the round. I didn't have a problem with this at first because survivors had their own way of seeing who they were going to face but they removed the options for survivors and made it more accessible to Killers. This encourages the Killer to adjust his items perks offerings to their liking according to what they see. I play both sides and I think it is unfair. It encourages a bad attitude from the start. Criticize these details all you want but this is the NUMBER ONE REASON that when you finally find a lobby you get dodged by the Killer and waste even more time looking for another lobby. All because the developers won't just make each side equal/fair and unknown to another.After each game your party is disbanded. Again another issue they do not fix.It's a fun game but very broken. I do recommend it yet I'd only buy it on a sale. Oh and the community is more toxic than anything I've played.

title: Dead by Daylight

review: The microtransactions and level up system are a tad excessive but the devs offer a creative and playable product in the gaming age of recyling mediocrity.EDIT To clarify this is a casual / party game. Competitive play is laughable as consumables (from a needless level up system) are required. Unless you don't mind losing a couple games for no reason other than people being higher level than you (having access to better perks and consumables) investing a couple hundred hours to max everything and then begining to climb. With the constant addition of killers the game will need to be upkept as certain maps become more appealing or unfun for certain killers.EDIT2 I no longer reccomend this game. After you hit Rank 15 the game consistently matches you with players who have maxed out builds and if you don't have a maxed out build to compete you will need to derank in order to play with other players of the same build quality.

title: Dead by Daylight

review: Although I knew about this game in 2016 I didn't play which I regret to this day. Nowadays this game is pretty balanced and despite what many people say it's not bugged. Not even close. Ofc sometimes you're going to encounter some bug it is still a very good game with a minimal ammount of bugs. A lot of killers to choose from as well as survivors and the developers are all the time putting all of their resources into this game. Every year you're getting 4 new killers and 4 survivors and 4 new maps. Add to that some events and you have a game that you can play for countless hours. Fortunately there are a lot of players playing this game so it looks like for the next few years you won't have a problem finding lobby which is really good. Recently the developers also added in game store in which you can buy with in game currency (with an exception for a few exclusive outfits) outfits for your survivors and killers.I really encourage you to play this game even after all those hours it is as much fun for me as it was in the beginning.

review: Really fun game to play with friends. Usually I am not fan of repetitive games but I love the fact that depending on the combinations of killer survivors and map the game can turn out to be totally different and unexpected. The game is also really cheap to get off sales regularly so it is definitedly worth the fun for the sale price.Negatives are probably that it can take time to unlock the characters without using real money or buying the DLCs as you only start with few killers and survivors when you buy the base game.

review: Hex Devour
title: Dead by Daylight

review: Alright so... A friend recommended this game to me and I was very hesitant because I'm not a horror fan by any means. I've seen Youtubers play it a bit and never really understood the mechanics until I finally played it for myself. Over 300 hours now invested into it and I can now say it's quickly become a fast favorite of mine. I've really grown to love the game despite its' many flaws. I primarily play Killer but survivor can be fun as well. Even for non horror fans DBD is well worth the time. The developers are constantly evolving the game with patches bugfixes new content seasonal events new cosmetics new playable survivors and killers... There's clearly been alot of work done to get the game up to par and though sometimes the toxic community can certainly put a damper on fun your could and should be having it's not enough to push me away. If anything it just makes me want to slaughter the next group of victims that show up on my screen. I highly recommend it to anyone looking for something different that can be played solo or with friends.
title: Dead by Daylight
